Title: Support Analyst
Description: The primary role of the Support Analyst is to coordinate activities related to the various Advisory Councils, Industry Working Groups, Committees and the Fundserv Funnel, by interacting with manufacturers, distributors, service providers as well as internal stakeholders.It is essential that ideas raised by members are vetted and run through the Fundserv Funnel framework (governance process) that has been established in order to justify the industry’s investment into a solution.The role involves a significant amount of administration related to idea management, business document maintenance, communication and meeting facilitation. The Support Analyst will also perform backup functions for other roles within the Industry Engagement team, as required.In this role, you will be responsible for:A. Advisory Councils, Industry Working Groups, and Committees· Schedule meeting dates and coordinate details related to member attendance· Compile and distribute meeting materials· Moderate external group meetings by introducing agenda items, managing attendee participation etc.· Record meeting minutes and distribute to council, working group and committee members· Develop and facilitate surveys and other gathering of information from members· Create discussion and proposal documents as required· Maintain documentation as per council meetings, focus groups or any other initiative related to the Funnel.· Build and strengthen relationships with members and service providers· Align advisory council activities to department metrics· Assist with preparing presentations and coordinating with communications and translation team.· Co-ordinate with Communication department to ensure the latest working group documentation is published on the Fundserv websiteB. Fundserv Funnel Administration· Develop monthly publication of the Funnel, ensuring the status of initiatives is current, and supporting documents are maintained.· Collaborate with Technical Communications to ensure internal and external stakeholders are informed of publications.· Proactively communicate and collaborate with external and internal stakeholders to analyze data being received from industry members in relation to the Funnel.· Consolidate feedback received from industry and/or summarize for internal stakeholder review· Assist in the development of business cases related to industry initiatives· Successfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously· Implement business process improvements to support efficient team workflowWhy YOU are the person we’re looking for· Post-Secondary Education in business/financial management, or related field would be an asset· Strong business writing skills· Research and data analytics, with the ability to summarize findings including the use of charts and graphs· Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal· High attention to detail with an ability to work independently, under time constraints· Strategic thinker with the ability to see “big picture” solutions· Strong sense of initiative, continuously striving to acquire and develop related business knowledge· Business Analysis education/training an asset· Industry and Fundserv application knowledge is a strong asset· Bilingualism is a strong assetJob Types: Full-time, PermanentAdditional pay:Bonus payBenefits:Dental careDisability insuranceEmployee assistance programExtended health careLife insurancePaid time offRRSP matchVision careWork from homeSchedule:Monday to FridayExperience:mutual fund industry: 1 year (preferred)

Title: Data Analyst
Description: Data Analyst(Full-Time)Reporting to the Director, Corporate Services, CCD’s Performance Analyst provides key reports, analysis and insights that support data driven decision making, performance monitoring, quality improvement and reporting to internal and external stakeholders.Responsibilities include but are not limited to:Build, update and maintain timely and accurate reports and dashboardsAnalyze data and provide insight to decision makersDefine new data collection and analysis processes to support evolving business needsProvide quick and efficient data reporting as neededSupport Privacy program by conducting audits of access to Personal Health Information (PHI) and participating in privacy investigations and discussionsCompile data for submissions to funding organizationsMonitor trends and proactively identify areas for further research and analysisMaintain and update client database to support service delivery, reporting metrics and business initiativesSupport internal stakeholders to ensure complete and accurate data inputs, including developing documentation, training, and performing audits as necessarySupport internal stakeholders to run reports within client information database, including troubleshootingQualifications required: Post-secondary education in a related discipline (e.g., Business, Analytics, Information Management, Health Informatics) and/or equivalent experience2-3 years of experience working in data or analytics role, including data collection, analysis and interpretation of performance data (e.g., clinical, service, financial)Demonstrated logical thinking, problem solving, and critical thinking skills requiredComputer skills with ability to use software such as Microsoft Office (Excel, Access, Word) and Power BI; sound SQL and database knowledge and experience working on queries and reportsKnowledge and/or experience in the health care sector such as OHFS (Ontario Healthcare Financial and Statistical System) reporting an assetPrivacy training (PHIPA) an assetDemonstrated effective verbal and written communications skillsAbility to work independently with high levels of initiativeStrong interpersonal and time management skillsProject management knowledge an assetSatisfactory Police Vulnerable Sector CheckSensitivity to adults with needs related to aging, physical and/or mental healthAdhere to COVID-19 safety practices including two doses of COVID-19 VaccineMust work in a safe manner and promote the health and safety of all staff, volunteers, clients and the community as outlined within CCD policiesCompensation: Starting at $51,302 annually, three (3) weeks’ vacation per year of work (pro-rated to hours worked); 11 paid (including stat) holidays; health, insurance, and pension benefits when eligible.* Pay will be commensurate based on education and experiencePlease apply in writing referencing posting #2022-80 outlining qualifications and experience by 4:00pm, on April 15th, 2022 to Human Resources, Community Care Durham emailJob Types: Full-time, PermanentSalary: From $51,302.00 per yearSchedule:8 hour shiftApplication deadline: 2022-04-15

Title: Data Analyst - Level 3
Description:
Career Opportunity

Libro is growing – and Libro is hiring.
Our expansion plans include a series of new hires across southwestern Ontario. Take a look!
Job Opportunities With Libro Credit Union

Who We Are

Imagine working for an organization where every employee and customer is an Owner.

No matter whether a customer Owner or employee Owner, everything we do at Libro is about helping people prosper. We recruit and develop experts like you; Epic Humans who are ready to offer the best possible advice, coaching and service, when and how our Owners need it.

Libro is a progressive employer who invests heavily in the development and career ambitions of our staff. Our hiring philosophy is focused finding candidates who carry a positive attitude, a desire to learn, and a passion for helping our Owners grow financial confidence. We commit to teaching and supporting you as you learn the skills you need.

This position is eligible for flexible work arrangements including a combination of remote and in-office work , and/or flex time, with office locations in London, Essex and Caledonia.

What Opportunity Awaits?

Libro is on the quest for a passionately accountable Data Analyst - Level 3 to lead research and analytic activities to solve a wide range of business problem. They will retrieve and gather vast amounts of data, organize it and use it to reach meaningful conclusions. They will exercise their knowledge of statistical techniques, analytics skills and database analysis tools and techniques to develop strategic insights to drive business goals. Data Analyst are more excited about what they can learn with data, than they are about what is already known.- Could this be you?

What you will do - The Epic Human we are looking for will;

Create datasets for reporting in high-level analytics, including but not limited to data cubes for modeling trends, business reviews and/or analytics.

Contribute to enhancing the validity, reliability and accuracy of data and information utilized in support of business initiatives.

Be comfortable with data analysis, mining, modelling, cleansing, migration and mapping.

Be comfort manipulating and analyzing complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality data from varying sources

Be a recognized expert with one or more reporting/ visualization tool-Tableau, Power BI, power pivot/map

Understand OLAP database technology and data modeling. Techniques with MDX, DAX would be an asset

Bring strong passion for empirical research and for answering hard questions with data.

Have the ability to communicate complex quantitative analysis in a clear, precise, and actionable manner.

Have strong technical documentation skills.

What we are looking for? Could this be you ?

Minimum 5-7 years’ experience in systems analysis and programming with extensive business knowledge.

Have a graduate or post graduate university degree in Computer Science, mathematics or statistics.

Have advanced skills with MS SQL Server Management Studio including stored procedures, views, functions, and ad hoc database queries for reporting purposes

Have experience developing with and supporting Integration Services (SSIS), Analysis Services (SSAS), ETL processes, SQL Agent jobs and related tools.

Be experienced with Visual Studio.NET and VB.NET

Strong expertise in analysis techniques and coding (R, Python, etc) would be an asset.

What is in it for you? How we bring Joyful in our work :
Competitive salaries and employee pension plans

Comprehensive benefit package including health, dental, and vision

Generous vacation time

Employee wellness programs

Staff accounts and staff rates on products and services

Staff appreciation programs and awards

Career development opportunities including tuition assistance

Many great perks and rewards; fitness club discounts, technology offers, travel and entertainment deals, just for being part of our great team!

Are you ready to Be Libro ?
If you're passionate about helping your community, interested in being part of a remarkable team, and want to help grow prosperity in Southwestern Ontario - we want to hear from you!

With a purpose beyond profit, Libro Credit Union is proud to be a Certified B Corporation, joining leaders of a global movement of people using business as a force for good. Serving families, farms, and enterprises in southwestern Ontario, Libro offers an inclusive, forward thinking approach to banking – all centered on growing prosperity. Libro pursues its purpose through four key pillars – employment, financial resilience, local food accessibility, and housing. Libro is also a proud Associate Member of the Responsible Investment Association of Canada.

Libro is committed to fostering a safe, healthy and inclusive work environment that inspires respect. Following the advice of Canadian health authorities to mitigate the risk of potential spread of COVID-19 and support social distancing, all recruiting activities including interviews will be conducted virtually.

Libro will provide accommodations to employees with disabilities, upon request.

#SJ

Title: Data Analyst (Summer Student 2022)
Description:
About GWL Realty Advisors:

GWLRA is a leader in both the commercial and multi-residential real estate industries. Driven by our values of Integrity, Ambition, Creativity, and Empathy, our vision is to be a sustainable company known for exceptional real estate management, trusted advice, and outstanding service by consistently fulfilling our mission to deliver strong, long-term results for our clients.
Working in a collaborative team-based environment, the Data Analyst will support the Property Management team during the completion of a portfolio wide process improvement imitative.

This is a great opportunity for an aspiring data analyst that wants to develop their skills in managing and manipulating large amounts of data. They will fine tune their pivot table skills and learn about power query. This role will also provide an opportunity to develop an understanding of the commercial real estate industry with some exposure to accounting and concepts around energy management.


RESPONSIBILITIES:
Assist in the development of a utility consumption tracking Excel spreadsheets for approximately 17 buildings
Work closely with the Property Administrators at each site to collect and input historical data
Find creative solutions for automating additional features for this tool
Assist the Business Analyst as needed
Work with the Project Manager on co-ordination of program roll-out
Review, manage and analyze large amounts of data


QUALIFICATIONS:
Currently enrolled as a Business Administration, Finance or Management Information Systems student
Eager for exposure to commercial real estate
Excellent MS Excel skills and high proficiency in Pivot Tables
Ability to work independently in a collaborative team environment
Excellent communication skills and initiative that lead to effective solutions
Detail oriented and able to effectively manage multiple priorities within tight deadlines

What we Offer:
3 Weeks of Vacation per year
3 Paid Personal Days per year
Up to $2,000 annual Education Allowance
Up to $5,000 annual Mental Health Coverage, plus other comprehensive benefits and savings programs
Up to $400 to use towards wellness annually to help support your financial, physical, and mental wellness


Our Business:
Learn more about our commercial and residential businesses, our values, and careers at GWLRA.

Our Commitment to Diversity:
GWL Realty Advisors is an equal opportunity employer. It prohibits discrimination based on age, color, disability, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, and any other legally protected class in accordance with applicable federal, provincial and local laws. We are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace. If you are contacted for an interview and require accommodation during the interviewing process, please let us know.

    If you’re looking for an empowering and progressive place to build your career, then you’ve landed in the right place here at BCAA and Evo Car Share.
  


 Summary:


    The Jr. Analyst is responsible for the execution of regular and ad-hoc business reporting and administrative tasks for the Evo car sharing product, including interpreting business problems, retrieving, and analyzing data, and communicating results to internal stakeholders.
  

 Contractor Role: The nature of this role is a temporary contract position without a set end time.

 STRATEGY

Title: Junior Business Analyst
Description:
Subsidiary: Miller Paving Limited
What Does a Junior Business Analyst Do?
Miller is looking to add a Junior Business Analyst to our Aggregate Manufacturing & Sales Business Unit. This individual will work with our sales and operations teams in building reports & tools that can be used to help run the aggregate business more effectively. The reports & tools will track Key Performance Indicators, product profitability, production efficiency and other areas for potential improvement.
The Analyst will assist in analyzing the data and preparing summary notes and dashboards/graphs/charts that will be shared with the sales & operations teams. The Analyst must be a self-starter and able to work in a project-based environment. The Analyst must be able to build productive working relationships with key individuals across multiple business divisions.
As a Junior Business Analyst, You Will:
Assist the Manager, Material Marketing and Business Development in the key functions of business analytics across Sales & Operations
Collecting, organizing, analyzing and reporting critical subject matter business information related to existing key performance metrics and critical success factors
Assist with building budget & reforecast templates
Assist with reporting on key performance metrics
Work cross-functionally across the organization to fully understand business objectives
Apply analytics in support of evaluating the performance of various operations and support sharing of best practices
Work with key stakeholders within all business
What You'll Bring
Bachelor's degree in Commerce, Business Administration, or Mathematics
Previous experience in PowerBI is considered an asset
Advanced Excel Knowledge (managing large dataset, Macros VBA, pivot tables) is considered an asset
Strong communication and relationship building skills
Strong quantitative, analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent interpersonal, written and oral communication skills
Team player; excellent collaboration skills; ability to engage with our team remotely and in person
Valid Drivers License and access to a car
Construction or Manufacturing experience
Miller is proud to provide this unique career opportunity, we offer continuous learning, opportunity for growth, and a competitive compensation package. At our core; we are our people. We succeed because we respect our people and invest in their development, safety and well-being. Miller is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that diversity and inclusion are key attributes to building greatness. Miller’s core values of Integrity and Community welcomes everyone, at work and in the community, and our value of Accountability, means that we own our actions, our decisions and our results. As a Miller employee, this will ultimately be your commitment to our inclusive culture.
We will contact candidates selected for an interview. Accommodation for applications with disabilities will be made during the recruitment process when requested.

Title: Business Analyst – Healthcare
Description:
BUSINESS ANALYST – HEALTHCARE - JOB DESCRIPTION
You: passionate about working on projects that have meaningful impact, enjoy working in a supportive, collaborative team setting and contributing in many ways, and are excited about the prospect of helping an early-stage agency grow while having an opportunity to contribute to and share in its success.
We want to meet you!
We are looking for experienced Business Analyst with clinical health systems (healthcare) experience and/or background to join our team.
We are a group of experienced and talented, dedicated, passionate professionals that deliver exceptional health system transformation, change management, and management support services. We take a more unique and collaborative approach to service delivery by focusing on the intersections of people, innovation, and forward-thinking change. We help healthcare organizations solve their most pressing problems, deliver exceptional value, and create better outcomes for all.
Position Level: Consultant / Associate / Analyst
Start Date: Immediately
Location: Remote
The role: 
This role requires a range of business analyst skills and competencies for various client and project work.
As the ideal candidate, you demonstrate a record of strong business analysis skills and experience, exceptional presentation and communication skills, and strength as a team player. You share a passion for and can demonstrate through your experience, problem solving skills and delivering exceptional professional services.
In this role your responsibilities will include working directly with healthcare clients, gathering, analyzing, and documenting information and requirements, synthesizing information into documentation, creating reports and communication material, developing clinical and/or operational strategies, conducting health systems research, and interfacing with external clinical and non-clinical subject matter experts.
Responsibilities: 

Provide business analysis and clinical health systems subject matter expertise, with the ability to provide in-depth knowledge of clinical workflows, products, business process logic, and data definitions
Create detailed requirements and manage translation of requirements into technical and non-technical specifications, including the creation of documentation, test plan development, and testing support
Lead, manage, and coordinate business requirements gathering sessions, facilitate systems design sessions, create business process documents outlining current and future state models and use case documentation
Facilitate system design sessions (JAD) and create/author business requirement documents (BRD), functional requirement documents (FRD), business architecture documents, use cases, user requirement specification (URS) documents, process documentation, and workflow documentation
Develop business processes and workflow diagrams using BPMN and DMN to outline current and future solution state models, including data flow diagrams and activity diagrams
Conduct Business Analysis Assessments (BAA) and develop Business Continuity Plans (BCP)
Conduct gap analyses identifying areas of need and opportunities to eliminate redundant processes
Partner closely with project teams and business users to support various projects and workflows
Support analytics teams and user groups in defining data tracking, collection, and extract/reporting requirements
Analyze data and reports and uncover insights that provide business and client value
Proactively engage and maintain strong stakeholder and client relationships, acting as a change agent, influencing team and project implementation methodologies, including identification of project risks and mitigation items
Coordinate BA team requirements specification reviews and walkthroughs to ensure clarity and completeness
Assist in the development and documentation of test case scenarios to validate logic for test rules and cases and work collaboratively with teams to provide internal training material
Support the development of annual operating plans, capital budgets and forecasts, and build business cases for new business initiatives (cost/benefit analysis)

Qualifications / Skills: 

10 years’ experience performing business analysis / analyst functions 
5 years’ experience performing range of business analysis services in clinical health / healthcare / health systems settings
Strong understanding of and experience in business analyst scope of practice / work / activities including strong familiarity with BABOK framework and principles
Familiarity working with / analyzing data using Excel (including pivots, lookups, etc)
Demonstrated / proven experience developing, maintaining, and completing requirement and operational documents, reports, specifications, plans, and analysis
Excellent stakeholder management skills, with proven experience working within cross-functional teams
Strong attention to report and presentation detail is critical; must have significant experience synthesizing material and information into cogent, well-constructed presentations and material

What We Offer: 

Values:  we are a people-focused agency determined to innovate through collaboration and trust
A great team environment with an incredibly strong, passionate, and collaborative, team-focused group
Annual team-based + individual performance bonuses and comprehensive benefits package
An opportunity to join an early-stage agency and share in being a part of building something great together

If this opportunity sounds like a good fit for you, contact us and let us know more about yourself and why you think you would make a good fit.
Note: only candidates who are currently residents of Canada and who meet the aforementioned experience requirements will be considered.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Experience:

Business Analyst: 10 years (required)
Healthcare / Clinical Health Systems: 5 years (required)

Title: Data Analyst
Description: Who We Are: We are the largest Credit Union in Atlantic Canada with $1.2 billion in assets and serving approximately 35,000 members in 10 branch locations across PEI.We are committed to the following core values in operating our organization:- We go above and beyond for our people - members, staff, and board.- We are accountable and have integrity.- We work together as a team.- We seek to continuously improve.- We act in the best interests of our communities.Who You Are: You love automating reports, developing dashboards, and analyzing data to derive actionable insights.What You’ll Do: - Reporting to the CFO, you will help empower the credit union to make data-driven decision making and uncover opportunities to grow our membership.- Writing queries, developing Python scripts, maintaining quality data, and consulting with team members across PEI.- Studying current data sources to develop accurate reporting- Developing and presenting dashboards that highlight results and trends- Conducting deep-dive analysis into business questions across all areas of the credit union.- Scope and prioritizing incoming data requests within your workflow.- Coordinating with other data team members on team projects and preserve our data warehouse as the source of truth- Collaborating across the credit union, acting as an advisor for stakeholders.What You Have: Required Education and Experience- You have 2+ years of experience in a data analyst role or equivalent education.- You are comfortable manipulating datasets with SQL (familiar with self-joins, window functions, parameters), and have intermediate Python knowledge (user-defined functions, creating API requests, writing efficient loops).Skills and Abilities- You have strong quantitative and analytical competency combined with data gathering skills.- You are a quick study on business concepts, metrics, and KPIs.- You have a sense of ownership and the ability to multitask and prioritize multiple assignments.- You are well organized and have effective time management skills.What We Offer: - Outstanding culture and opportunity to join an engaged and community-focused team.- Market competitive compensation plus annual bonus.- Generous benefit package including flexible health and dental Plan, sick time, and 6% contribution with employer match in a Defined Contribution Pension Plan and Group Retirement Saving Plan with up to 3% employer contribution.- Vacation starting at 3 weeks per year plus 4 personal days.- Tuition reimbursement, training, and career progression opportunities.- Additional employee perks including but not limited to, annual fitness and clothing allowance, and reduced rates on employee loans/mortgages and no service fee banking.- Salary range for this position: $52,938.63 – $62,280.75.Interested?Do you think you would be a good fit for the role? Tell us why by submitting your resume and cover letter. Applications will close April 18, 2022.Please note that all offers of employment are conditional upon the acceptance of an Individual Fidelity Bond Application which includes a criminal check and a credit check.We wish to thank applicants in advance; only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.Diversity and Inclusion: Provincial Credit Union invites applications from all qualified individuals. Provincial Credit Union is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace, and welcome applicants from diverse backgrounds. Accommodations are available for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment process.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $52,938.63-$62,280.75 per year

Description: Job Title – In-line Inspection Data AnalystNovitech Inc. is currently looking for an entry-level or experienced In-line Inspection Data Analyst to expand our team.About Novitech Inc.: Novitech Inc. is an industry leading in-line inspection service and technology development company.Novitech’s innovation driven culture is supported by individuals with decades of experience, as well as strong customer partnerships. Title: Junior Database Analyst
Description:
Reporting to the Senior Analyst, Business Intelligence the successful candidate will be responsible for monitoring, maintenance and operational support of our entire portfolio of databases. Maintain reliability, stability and data integrity of the databases. Provide support in the administration, backup, integrity and security of various SQL databases.
Key Duties and Responsibilities:

Monitor performance of database systems resources and query throughput
Optimize SQL Code as necessary
Monitor and maintain database storage resources
SQL Server Installation, Upgrades, Migrations and Configuration
Install database software service packs and cumulative updates as necessary
Maintain database documentation as required
Maintain and administer database security access
Perform database Ad-hoc backups and restores
Trouble shoot and resolve database connectivity issues
Proactively monitor and respond to MSSQL database Alerts.


Qualifications:

2 years experience as a database administrator in SQL Server environment
2 year experience in Transact SQL, DTS, SSIS package development
1 years of SQL Server database development / programming
Experience of administering SQL Server 2000, 2005 and 20008 databases
Experience with Monitoring & Diagnostic tools
Experience working with Windows server, including Active Directory and disk configurations
Bachelor's Degree (BS/BA) or equivelant combination of education and experience.


Required Education, Knowledge and Experience:

1-2 years of experience as a data administrator in SQL server environment
University degree – Bachelor or Masters in Commerce, Engineering, Sciences, or related
Strong analytical and critical thinking with proven ability to solve problems
Deep understanding of advanced analytics platforms, SQL, reporting tools, etc. and an ability to quickly learn new technologies to execute on business objectives
Strong business acumen with a strategic mindset and long-term perspective
Demonstrated ability to partner, collaborate, and execute cross-functionally
Ability to work autonomously and comfortable with decision making and accountability.

If you are interested in this role and possess the above qualities, please apply with your resume and cover letter with highlights of your achievements. In addition to working with great people in a supportive work culture every day, we offer competitive compensation, excellent benefits, career advancement opportunities, and significant on-the-job training.

Title: ICQA Data Analyst
Description:
2+ years of experience in a business analyst/data analyst/statistical analyst role and conducting analysis and data mining using Excel.
1+ years experience extracting and processing data using SQL.
1+ years project management experience

Job summary
At Amazon, we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. If you'd like to help us build the place to find and buy anything online, this is your chance to make history. This role requires an individual with excellent analytical abilities, outstanding business acumen and exceptional written and oral communication skills. They will be a self-starter comfortable with ambiguity, with strong attention to detail, be vocally self-critical, and with an ability to work in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment.  Partner with the program team to create key performance indicators and new methodologies for measurement. Understand drivers, impacts on key influences on business dynamics and productivity. Understanding of data warehousing and data modeling.

Excellent communication (verbal, written, and data presentation) and interpersonal skills to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams.

Title: Junior Global Business Analyst
Description:
About ZOOK Canada Inc.
ZOOK is committed to finding pressure relief solutions for our customers that maximize our customers’ productivity and performance while keeping their people safe. ZOOK is a global market leader with over 90 years of manufacturing expertise in high-quality metal & graphite rupture disks and other pressure relief products. ZOOK has global locations in the USA, United Kingdom, Canada, and Malaysia, with state-of-the-art manufacturing facilities in Canada and the USA. We are dedicated to investing heavily in the latest technology and production to stay competitive in the marketplace and can offer comprehensive solutions to the selection and sizing of products best suited for each customer application.

Job Type: Full Time

Schedule: Monday to Friday 8:00am - 5:00pm

Job Summary
The Junior Business Analyst position supports the IT Applications department with the Microsoft Dynamics NAV ERP application and ZOOK reporting. Responsible for collecting, interpreting, and analyzing data using statistical techniques relating to various functions including, marketing, sales, operations, manufacturing, and IT so decision-makers can make more informed decisions. The incumbent will be primarily supporting, reviewing, analyzing and evaluating business systems and user needs across all ZOOK locations. Document requirements, define scope and objectives and formulate systems to parallel overall business strategies.

Key Responsibilities & Duties
Conduct data mining and executes queries to process data from multiple sources
Analyze data and prepare reports/dashboards that show key trends and metrics
Develop action plans to improve reporting, including suggesting & implementing any fields or improvements that could be made in systems for capturing the data needed for reporting
Fulfill ad hoc reporting requests, as needed, in support of business initiatives and department needs.
Support future system development with existing Microsoft Dynamics NAV ERP solution.

Qualifications
Familiarity and expertise with Microsoft business data products, including Power BI, Power Query, SQL, VBA, Microsoft Dynamics NAV, Microsoft Business Central preferred.
Bachelor’s degree or College certificate in business analytics, economics, mathematics, engineering, or related field 3+ years prior experience
Intermediate MS-SQL skills using queries and stored procedures.
Analytical mindset with an ability to gather, organize, and analyze large amounts of information so that specific business questions are answered
Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to interact across all departments of the company
Self-starter with a capability to learn, prioritize and organize effectively with moderate supervision from a team
Capacity to multi-task in a fast-paced environment
Experience with manufacturing a plus.

Benefits:
Extended Health & Dental
Paid time off
Disability insurance

About ZOOK Canada Inc:

ZOOK is committed to finding pressure relief solutions for our customers that maximize our customers’ productivity and performance while keeping their people safe. ZOOK is a global market leader with over 90 years of manufacturing expertise of high quality metal & graphite rupture disks and other pressure relief products. ZOOK has global locations in the USA, United Kingdom, Canada and Malaysia, with state-of-the-art manufacturing facilities in Canada and the USA.We are dedicated to investing heavily in the latest technology and production to stay competitive in the marketplace, and are able to offer comprehensive solutions to the selection and sizing of products best suited for each customer application.

Title: Analyst, Data
Description:
Want to make a difference in your career? Consider this opportunity.
The Data Analyst is responsible for providing support on data collection, disclosure and data transfer activities to Ontario Health internal and external stakeholders. Working in collaboration with the business, the Data analyst will be primary point of contact with external data providers, ensuring the receipt of data in a secure manner as per agreed to schedule. The Data Analyst will work with internal and external clients to help troubleshoot issues and challenges with the data as well as support process documentation and redesign to ensure the team is efficient and effective. This position requires a good understanding of the healthcare environment and Data Assets.
Here is what you will be doing:
Supports the end-to-end data operations of OH-CCO data collection and disclosure for key datasets including but not limited to DAD, NACRS, OMHRS, and OHIP.
Provides advice, guidance and makes recommendations to OH teams regarding new data asset collections and disclosures to optimize project outcomes. Facilitates initial set-up and provides ongoing operational support.
Develops, improves and uses existing processes to ensure timely delivery of all data collections, distribution and transfers.
Support operationalization of new processes and recommends system and process adjustments
Identifies gaps with data access provisioning and seeks appropriate resources to help implement solutions.
Manages the access to Data Holdings as per Ontario Health privacy policies.
Develops education and training tools about appropriate access and use of PHI
Support operationalization of new processes and recommend system and process adjustments.
Manages various client requests/inquiries channels for collections, transfers, distribution.
Execute appropriate data analysis to support strategic business needs and decision making in coordination with the Manager, develops the tools, templates and processes required to execute the research and analysis activities
Here is what you will need to be successful:
Education and Experience
Bachelor Degree in Public Administration, Health Administration, Business Management or equivalent education/experience
Preferred 2+ years of data related experience or experience in similar capacity
Knowledge of the relevant data quality processes, frameworks and methodologies
Knowledge of data governance principles, data management, data models, processes and application
Knowledge of data manipulation and data management to deliver on objectives or execute activities
Experience collecting and documenting requirements for a wide range of initiatives and the ability to apply this experience to a wide range of situations
Strong organizational skills and time management skills
Familiarity with information issues in the healthcare environment
Knowledge and Skills
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills to effectively engage and solicit support from a wide range of external and internal stakeholders in the delivery of the program activities
Requires an ability to influence decisions through well-articulated recommendations to key decision makers
Demonstrated superior written communication skills including the ability to prepare executive correspondence.
An understanding of Ontario's health care environment, experience with cancer is an asset
Strong collaboration skills and the ability to work within a cross functional team
Detailed, customer service, and process oriented
Ability to perform routine tasks on on-going basis
Employment Type: Permanent Full time
Location: Ontario (currently virtual; subject to change)
All applicants must be a resident of Ontario to be considered for roles at Ontario Health.
Internal Application Deadline Date: Apr 13 2022
Note: As part of the initial recruitment screening process, applicants must confirm that they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19. If applicants are not fully vaccinated, they will be asked to identify any accommodation needs pursuant to a protected ground under the Code. If no such accommodation is identified, the applicant will not be eligible to proceed through the recruitment process.

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
If you are committed to public service, enjoy collaborating with others, share our values and have a desire to learn and grow, join The City of Calgary . City employees deliver the services, run the programs and operate the facilities which make a difference in our community. We support work-life balance, promote physical and psychological safety, and offer competitive wages, pensions, and benefits . Together we make Calgary a great place to make a living, a great place to make a life.

The City is committed to fostering a respectful, inclusive and equitable workplace which is representative of the community we serve. We welcome those who have demonstrated a commitment to upholding the values of equity, diversity, inclusion, anti-racism and reconciliation. Applications are encouraged from members of groups that are historically disadvantaged and underrepresented. Accommodations are available during the hiring process, upon request.

As a Technical Business Analyst (BA) you will provide data driven expertise to optimize the process and workflow systems in key service areas in Planning and Development (PD). To achieve this, the BA performs cross-functional analysis of business objectives, policies, current process, business information, and systems capability to ensure relentless improvements of operations. The BA provides excellent customer service and support for all sections within the business unit, and other experts within the organization in order to facilitate informed decision-making about investments in process, information, and technology. Primary duties include:
Elicit, define and document end-user requirements and business specifications in the form of agile stories and features with the required acceptance criteria. Investigate nonfunctional requirement by analyzing system architecture, reporting needs, and data quality.
Anticipate, investigate, identify business operations improvement opportunities and make solution recommendations with statistical information to product owners and/or management teams.
Collaborate with agile delivery team and business users to ensure that designed solution meet business needs, validating the solution into production and monitoring results post release.
Develop and maintain PD process and data artifacts in an agile environment.
Actively monitor new policy or regulation impacting PD services.
Building a trusting relationship with stakeholders.

Qualifications
A completed 2 year diploma in Business Administration, Computer Information Systems, Planning, or a related diploma plus at least 5 years of related experience in quality assurance, business process improvement, business re-engineering; OR
A degree in Computer Science Software Engineering, Business Administration, Planning or a related degree plus at least 3 years related experience in quality assurance, business process improvement, business re-engineering.
Demonstrated ability in providing business analysis services across multiple projects.
Active listening and communication skills with a focus on understanding multiple stakeholder’s requirement with the ability to negotiate to common goals and outcomes.
Big picture analytical thinker with the ability to demonstrate how improvement will impact upstream or downstream processes.
Pre-employment Requirements
Successful applicants must provide proof of qualifications.
Union: CUPE Local 38
Business Unit: Calgary Approvals

Position Type: Temporary (up to 18 months)
Location: 800 Macleod Trail SE

Compensation: Pay Grade 11 $40.05 - 53.55 per hour
Days of Work: This position works a 5 day
work week with 1 day off in a 3 week cycle.

Hours of work: Standard 35 hour work week

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Profile:
Position Title: Supply Chain Data Analyst
Department: Corporate Supply Chain
Reports To: Senior Supply Chain Data Analyst
Job Summary:
Proactive member of Corporate Supply Chain team, contributing to all aspects of the data analyst role, focused on cost reduction initiatives.
Responsibilities:
Working with IT and Supply Chain teams from all divisions: collect, organize, and format all global purchasing data into standard, regular information reportsProducing periodic key performance indicators scorecards in accordance with Global Procurement needsCommunicating with ATS Divisions to disseminate reports and collected informationContinuously improving data structures and gathering processes, including implementation of common category codes, and part numbering standards where appropriateWorking with Category Leads to create and maintain sourcing information files to support efficient category analysis. Support Supply Chain performance improvement by providing targeted analysis (for example, regional price comparisons, part and supplier consolidation metrics, standards compliance data)Working with ATS segments and ATS Corporate Office to identify specific improvement opportunities and capture outcomesAnalyzing supply industry sectors to evaluate supply market and industry trendsEnsuring that all business activities are performed with the highest ethical standards and in compliance with the ATS Code of Business ConductAdhering to all health and safety rules and procedures
Qualifications:
Education:
Post-secondary degree in business, computer science, Supply Chain Management, Accounting or equivalent.

We know we can find solutions to their most important technical and business challenges they encounter. We aren’t consultants. We help them make their products the most competitive in the world and that’s how we’ve grown to over 11,000 problem solvers from 50 centers around the world. We aspire to be a 100-year company, which doesn’t mean staid and boring, but rather, we evolve and adapt to create the frontier of the engineering services industry.Our CultureWe just crossed the 23-year mark, and despite remarkable growth, we have maintained a culture of empowerment at all levels—what we call intrapreneurial. You will be part of the decision making to drive continuous improvements so we can stay happy and healthy as a business in a challenging industry. Not everyone is a great fit. Title: Risk Analyst
Description:
Metrolinx is connecting communities across the Greater Golden Horseshoe. Metrolinx operates GO Transit and UP Express, as well as the PRESTO fare payment system. We are also building new and improved rapid transit, including GO Expansion, Light Rail Transit routes, and major expansions to Toronto’s subway system, to get people where they need to go, better, faster and easier. Metrolinx is an agency of the Government of Ontario. 
We embody our values in everything that we do. We Serve with Passion, Think Forward, and Play as a Team. If you can relate, we want to hear from you! 
Our CPG Risk Management Team is seeking a Risk Analyst to facilitate regular risk reviews at the project level and contribute to detailed project risk reports as required within the reporting cycle as well as taking an active role in the continuous improvement of the risk management function. 
The Risk Analyst will also support the Delivery Team and the Senior Risk Analyst in ensuring that the Risk Management Plan and other ancillary risk-related procedures are followed as per the risk management requirements for the assigned scope of work. 
What will I be doing? 

Reporting to the Project/Program Risk Manager and responsible for the delivery of risk management across the assigned project(s) within a program. 
Coordinates project risk identification via workshops with a broad range of internal and external stakeholders (predominantly with project delivery teams, other project controls, engineers and project managers) 
Responsible for input of identified risks into the Active Risk Manager (ARM) database for assigned project(s) and provides assurance of project level risk data. 
Run quantitative risk analysis models (cost and schedule) to support options analysis, commercial decision-making, contractual risk-transfer strategies and inform the setting of appropriate project-level contingency (cost and schedule). 
Coordinating the production of metrics for project risk management and performing regular data analysis with associated tracking & reporting. Consults with Senior Risk Analyst as required for quality assurance and review Engages with the continuous improvement process for risk management, drawing on previous experience, industry best practice and in partnership with enterprise risk management as applicable

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description: About Armour Group Inc. Armour Group Inc., established in 1996 and headquartered in London, Ontario, markets and administers multiple lines of products in the automobile, recreational, heating and cooling and lending marketplaces. We focus on building relationships not only with our clients but also with the customers our clients serve.The Armour Group Inc. is looking for a full-time Business Data Analyst to join their team in the London, ON office. Remuneration commensurate with experience.Position OverviewWith the Armour Group’s commitment to create and manage innovative products and processes, the Business Data Analyst will be responsible for managing and developing all our data analyses, data collecting systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality. The successful candidate will be highly skilled in all aspects of data analytics to turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions.Here’s what you will deliver· Interpret data, analyze results and provide ongoing reports on product and program performances· Identify trends and opportunities for growth through analysis of complex data sets· Work closely with the senior management to understand and maintain focus on analytical needs, including identifying critical metrics and KPIs· Proactively analyze data to answer key questions from stakeholders or out of self-initiated curiosity with an eye for what drives business performance, investigating and communicating areas for improvement in efficiency and productivity· Create and maintain rich interactive visualizations through data interpretation and analysis, integrating various reporting components from multiple data sources· Develop and maintain databases by acquiring data from primary and secondary sources, and build scripts that will make our data evaluation process more flexible and scalable across data sets· Analyze local, national, and global trends that impact both the organization and the industry· Remove corrupted data and identify errors and related problems· Work with management on adhoc projects to prioritize business and information needsHere’s what you bring to the table· 2 - 3 years’ experience in mining data as a data analyst· Bachelor’s degree in Business, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or Statistics an asset· Proven analytic skills, including mining, evaluation, analysis, and visualization· Proficient in Microsoft Office products, databases and working knowledge in SQL· Experience working in data visualization software like Power BI or Tableau· Highly organized, detail oriented, and able to thrive in a fast paced, changing environment· Demonstrate effective verbal, listening, and written communication skills· Attention to detail and ability to maintain a high level of accuracy· Excellent time management skills, ability to multitask and work well under pressureWhat’s in it for you· Excellent management support and guidance· Access to health, dental and vision insurance· Employee Assistance Plan (EAP) for you and your family’s wellnessJob Types: Full-time, PermanentSalary: From $55,000.00 per yearBenefits:Dental careExtended health careVision careSchedule:8 hour shiftCOVID-19 considerations:Our office does not have customer traffic. Provincial health measures are followed as required.Application deadline: 2022-04-22

Job Summary

The Business Analyst will be facilitating workshops and interviewing business area leads to document and validate requirements, current and future state architecture, and asset management processes to complete key deliverables of the IT Corporate Asset Management project.

Skills and Qualifications
Post-secondary education in Business Administration, IT, Commerce or related discipline and a minimum of 3 years business analysis experience or an equivalent combination of education and experienceCBAP, PBA, CCBA or other business analysis certification is requiredDemonstrated experience in Asset Management and/or Finance would be an assetExperience in an Information Technology environment, with a proven record of accomplishment in requirements facilitation, business requirements documentation, business process modelling, technical/functional specifications, and testing plans is requiredExperience and strong understanding of data management, databases, application integrations, financial reporting, analysis, trends and forecasting would be an assetProven data collection and analysis skills together with an ability to use process modelling and analytics tools (e.g., Visio, Excel, Crystal Reports, SAP Business Objects, Microsoft Power BI, and Tableau) is requiredStrong verbal and written communication, leadership skills are required, as are excellent organizational and problem-solving abilitiesExceptional business analysis with an emphasis on customer service and ability to work with a diverse group of stakeholders and senior level management is requiredDemonstrated presentation and facilitation skills with the ability to deliver training to operational staff related to business operational initiatives, processes and applications would be an assetExperience with Questica Team Budget, Enterprise Asset Management systems, and Work Management systems would be an assetExperience with SQL Data Query Language, relational databases or cloud database environments would be an asset

Title: Business Intelligence and Reporting Analyst III
Description:
TD Description
Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.
Department Overview
What does TD Data & Analytics stand for? For starters, we believe in visionary leadership and insights. We believe in using every resource at our disposal to better serve our clients, and this includes our vast data.
The Business Intelligence group delves into our data, past and present, to develop crucial metrics and reporting functionality that better informs and optimizes key businesses decisions across the organization.
This is the team building the tools, reports, dashboards, cubes and scorecards that deliver and process vital data to business partners across the enterprise.
Joining us in Business Intelligence & Reporting is an opportunity to advance and deepen your career and to help TD serve its customers in a way we never have before.
Job Description
Looking for a role where career opportunity and growth keeps pace with your own initiative and growing knowledge in business intelligence?
In this role, you will work with a focused, specialized team to provide specialized guidance, reports and insights to business leaders and other enterprise partners. As data's role in providing world-class products and services to our customers grows, we'll look to your specialized knowledge in the development, adoption and ongoing evolution of the best reporting and business intelligence capabilities. As an experienced Analyst, you can own your space, dig in and play a key role in ground-breaking projects that are helping to shape data & analytics and take TD into the future of banking.
As an Analyst III, Business Intelligence & Reporting Analyst, you will:
Produce specialized reporting packages, dashboards and scorecards for businesses, with focus on the following functions: to understand objectives and deliver insights and commentary that can inform and shape product design and development, customer engagement, account management and business decision-making,
Own the implementation of initiatives in support of overall business/function strategy
Conduct analysis to provide enhanced BI to inform management leadership team
Create complex and comprehensive BI reporting packages and dashboards utilizing data infrastructure, localized datamarts and external data sources
Validate the quality and integrity of the data included in the Reporting Packages and Dashboards
Develop important and insightful commentary/insights on new and existing reporting packages.
Work with business partners to understand business objectives and develop valuable reporting and ad-hoc data extracts
Understand business drivers, definitions and metrics in order to interpret findings, take action and provide relevant direction
Lead the development and implementation of portfolio reporting (e.g. acquisition, attrition, portfolio growth, profitability, etc.)
Provide (and may develop) complex reporting, analysis, and assessments at the functional or enterprise level
Demonstrate your professional experience to provide specialized guidance/assistance to function supported
Employ good understanding of reporting and BI tools, platforms, and techniques as well as strong knowledge of various data sources (and ability to connect to multiple data sources and systems relevant to the business unit supported)
Connect and query data or obtain the data and prepare summaries and reports
Focus on short to medium-term (weekly-monthly), non-routine specialized/ complex issues and/or raised issues and other matters
Independently perform tasks end to end
Job Requirements
What can you bring to TD? Share your most relevant experience, credentials and knowledge for this role, as well as these essential requirements and attributes:
Undergraduate degree or technical certificate
Three (3) or more years relevant experience
Inclusiveness
At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Decision Support Analyst - Decision Support
Description:
Posting Period

Open: April 5, 2022
Deadline: April 11, 2022
Non-Union

Department Name

Decision Support
The Decision Support Analyst will work with the Portfolio Leaders and Clinical and Financial Teams to provide support, act as a resource and provide education around clinical, CIHI, statistical, MIS guidelines information and MOHLTC/CCO reporting.
Leveraging knowledge of hospital data/information systems, the Decision Support Analyst will also extract, translate, relate, and analyze data to deliver information products to a diverse customer base (i.e., from the data warehouse to formal ‘easy-to-understand’ reports). Individuals in this position will provide preliminary analysis that may include providing a written summary with recommendations. The Decision Support Analyst must be able to test hypothesis, build “what-if”/predication models using available information and Microsoft Office software tools.
Rate of Pay: $37.35 per hour - $46.69 per hour
Hours of Work: 37.5 hours per week

Qualifications
Successful Completion of an Undergraduate degree in Health Informatics, Statistics, Business, Computer Sciences or Mathematics is required
Minimum 2.5 years of recent related experience is required
Demonstrated advanced ability to synthesize innovative approaches to data analysis, interpretation and communication
Demonstrated advanced knowledge of and commitment to define information and analysis needs of hospital leaders, physicians, Ministry officials and researchers
Demonstrated proficiency in presentation skills
Demonstrated expert level knowledge of relational databases and SQL
Demonstrated knowledge of Ministry of Health hospital reporting requirements and standards (e.g., MIS, OHRS, OCDM, T/B,)
Demonstrated advanced knowledge of data reporting and Business Intelligence tools (eg. SRRS)
Demonstrated excellence in using Microsoft Office Suite
Demonstrated knowledge of Health Sector data holdings CIHI databases, MOHLTC, Statistic Canada, ICES, etc.
Demonstrated advanced level of communication skills both verbal and written
Demonstrated advanced ability to solve problems and make decisions
Demonstrated practice and commitment to the principles of patient and family centered care
Demonstrated practice and commitment to patient and staff safety at LHSC
Demonstrated practice and commitment to LHSC’s Mission, Vision and Values
Demonstrated ability to attend work on a regular basis
Immunization Requirements:
Provide Immunization or proof of immunity reflective of Ontario Hospital Association (OHA) Guidelines. These include measles, mumps, rubella and varicella, tuberculosis skin test, and a completed COVID vaccine series (two vaccines). Additional immunizations may be recommended. Detailed information regarding health review requirements and immunization can be found at https://www.lhsc.on.ca/careers/health-review-requirements
London Health Sciences Centre fosters a culture of patient and staff safety whereby all employees are guided by LHSC's Mission, Vision, Values and Code of Conduct.
LHSC is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace and welcomes applications from women, visible minorities, Indigenous people, persons with disabilities, and LGBTQ2+ persons. We are committed to providing persons with disabilities equal opportunities and standards of goods and services and are also fully compliant with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (2005), as applicable.
Your interest in this opportunity is appreciated. Only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted. Successful candidates, as a condition of job offer, would be required to provide a satisfactory Police Information Check (original document) completed in the last 3 months.

Title: PROGRAM DATA ANALYST
Company: Ministry of Labour, Training and Skills Development
Description:
Are you looking for an exciting opportunity to take your data skills to the next level? If so, consider this opportunity with the Finance, Analysis and Systems Support Branch at the Ministry of Labour, Training and Skills Development where you will develop business intelligence solutions and perform data analysis for Employment Ontario programs and services.

About us:

The Ministry of Labour, Training and Skills Development's Employment and Training Division contributes to a prosperous and stable economy by delivering integrated employment and training programs and services.

The Division's Finance, Analysis and Systems Support Branch (FASSB) leads financial planning, corporate reporting and risk management exercises; provides a comprehensive suite of dynamic reporting and analytic products; and works with Ministry and I&IT Cluster partners to manage the development, enhancement and maintenance of the division's business information systems and digital business models. The branch offers an innovative and inclusive culture, exposure to an integrated perspective on policy and program delivery and on-going opportunities for managers and staff to develop new skills and competencies.

At FASSB, we recognize that flexibility is vital. We take our work seriously and want to enjoy doing it! We embrace and celebrate differences. We have great respect for our strengths, perspectives, opinions and lifestyles. We have high expectations of each other, but even higher expectations of ourselves. We love the clash of ideas that lead to better solutions. Challenging the status quo is encouraged. Collaborating will allow us to push forward. If this sounds like a good fit for you, come and join us!

Why work for the Ontario Public Service?

The Ontario Public Service (OPS) is committed to being an employer of first choice, creating a positive and inclusive work environment.


We offer:

Competitive compensation and benefitsFlexible work arrangements
Collegial and professional work cultureCareer growth and development opportunities across multiple business areasOn-the-job training to support your success in the role
What can I expect to do in this role?Build business intelligence tools and enterprise data products for a broad range of data users and stakeholdersProvide business and technical support throughout the development, testing, implementation and maintenance of business intelligence and data analytics products including data integration solutions and data quality assessmentsMonitor program activities and report on program performanceProvide leading-edge support and advice in the development of key performance indicators with partner ministries and organizations
How do I qualify?
Data Skills and Technical KnowledgeYou have hands-on database, business intelligence and reporting product development skills using relational database systems (e.g. Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle)You have strong SQL scripting skills, including stored procedures, queries, performance optimization
You have reporting experience using applications such as SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) and Power BI Report Server (PBRS)You are able to analyze large datasets containing millions of data points and optimize access to relational and non-relational data sourcesYou have knowledge of digital system change management, team development tools, agile development methods and tools, and automated deployment
Analytical and Problem Solving SkillsYou have analytical, research and problem solving skills to assess and analyze and report on large amounts of complex data and investigate and assess data quality and integrityYou have knowledge of research theory and methodology, data analysis including data interpretation and modelling using financial analysis, and other forms of qualitative and quantitative analysis
Project Management and Program Development KnowledgeYou have project management and leadership skills and experience to coordinate multi-disciplinary, cross-ministry project teamsYou have knowledge of policy development processes to provide input into the development of new program and service design and delivery enhancementsYou can interpret and apply legislation, regulations, directives and guidelines (e.g. AODA, FIPPA) that govern the collection and dissemination of program and client data
Communication and Collaboration SkillsYou demonstrate oral and written communication and presentation skills to respond to information requests, prepare reports, and briefing materials, to present complex data/information to inform non-technical staff and senior managementYou have consultation and relationship management skills to discuss data findings and make recommendations to senior management/stakeholders

Title: Data Visualization Analyst
Senior Business Analyst - Special Project (April 2022 - April 2024)
Description: The incumbent serves as the Senior Business Analyst to the College providing advice and direction on business solutions that will advance the College’s organizational goals. The Senior Business Analyst is part of the Enterprise Project Management Office responsible for the design and implementation of new and modified business processes and organizational structures which deliver increasingly efficient business outcomes, while maintaining and improving service delivery.The incumbent will work with managers at all levels from across the organization to gather, analyze and document business requirements. Dealing with complex cross functional problems the incumbent will be highly skilled at articulating requirements in a clear concise way so that business intelligence tools can be used to meet the needs of senior managers at Mohawk College.This position requires a thorough understanding of business analysis methodology and best practices in order to guide the development and design of effective business solutions and support continuous improvement in technology and processes. These solutions require providing guidance and recommendations on sensitive matters which may influence work processes, resourcing and systems decisions.RESPONSIBILITIES: The duties of this position will include, but are not limited to the following:Business AnalysisLead the investigation, evaluation and documentation of existing business practices within the College, using structured analysis techniques. This position will act as an advocate and advisor for the business units and will step up and resolve conflict to provide the best solution for the business area.The incumbent will have the ability to see the bigger picture before heading into the details trying to understand where particular needs and requirements fit in with the organizational goals. They will also be aware of, or try to determine interdependencies that relate to other areas of the College.Analyze and model the current state of a service, function or business process to create a complete picture of existing process flow. Then overlay the new technical requirements to create a future state model.Leads cross-functional teams for continuous improvement efforts. Identifies opportunities for process improvement and makes recommendations that will enhance reporting, metric, score-carding and dashboard needs within the organization.Articulates and documents business processes within the context of each application's process, data and technical architecture.Identifies risk factors and addressing and reporting on these in a timely manner.Strategy and PlanningIn collaboration with senior management, liaise with stakeholders in all business areas to identify and define reporting and analytic needs in conjunction with the business unit’s goals and deliverables as well as Mohawks strategic direction.Analyze business processes gaining a thorough understanding of what needs to be achieved to deliver those business needs then translating that information into application, data, and systems requirements.Work closely with the Business Solutions Team to ensure business requirements are met and determine alternative solutions where limitations are encountered.Interview stakeholders and work with business area teams to understand business requirements, challenges and opportunities; and with a clear understanding of these factors use business analysis tools and methods to identify opportunities (business process improvement and/or technology) that either align with or help to enable that strategy.Develop best practices and tools for project execution and management.Implementation & OperationalizationResponsible for the creation of an accurate business requirements document and obtaining stakeholder and senior management’s approval; Performs analysis and facilitates stakeholder consensus to create documented, agreed upon functional and non-functional business requirements and specifications.Analyses proposed Project Change Requests for impacts on documented Business Requirements; Defines the User Acceptance Testing (UAT) strategy; Leads the UAT associated with the project.Documents, assesses, researches, analyses, and manages issues and defects found during UAT ensuring they are addressed appropriately by the project team.Develops or supports the development of training material and may deliver training to impacted stakeholders as appropriate.Other Duties as AssignedQUALIFICATIONS: The successful applicant must have:A three-year degree in such disciplines as Math, Computer Science, Statistics, Business Commerce, or a related field; or equivalent combination of education and experience.Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) or Project Management Professional (PMP) is preferred.Minimum of 5 years’ experience functioning as a senior business analyst or similar role, translating business needs into technical requirements and solutions in a private or public sector organization.Experience must include the implementation and delivery of projects, having participated in all aspects of the project life cycle.Experience in service improvement, solution requirements definition, business process engineering, test plan development, and test execution.Experience with formal test management methodologies and supporting tools.Experience developing effective and efficient solutions to diverse and complex business problems.Experience interacting with senior management to document, analyze, and recommend solutions and business changes and building strong relationships with stakeholders.Extensive experience working with and configuring ERP systems, including Banner.Demonstrated commitment and understanding of human rights, equity, diversity and inclusion with the ability to communicate and work effectively inter-culturally with diverse groups of students, employees and the community.Mohawk College is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes. Should you require accommodation through any stage of the recruitment process, please contact the HR Department at (905) 575-2047.Although many of our employees are currently working remotely, this position is governed by the applicable legislation of the Province of Ontario. Successful candidates will be required to conduct work within Ontario, must be available to work on campus as required, and will be required to follow the vaccination policy. Title: HR Data Management Analyst
Description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.
Job Title
HR Data Management Analyst
Job Description
What is the opportunity?
As a HR Data Management Analyst, you will identify and collect data sources, analyze and extract key data and information, evaluate and monitor data quality to meet the organization's information system needs and requirements.
What will you do?
Identifies and collects data sources using specific tools or techniques; inputs them into the organization's information system.
Provides data flow diagrams and documents the processes used in a company databases.
Assists and participates in data validation and cleaning to ensure the quality and integrity of data.
Analyzes and extracts key data and information to meet the organization's information system needs and requirements.
Run exception reports in Workday to identify data discrepancies such as job profiles with invalid compensation codes and update codes accordingly
Review compensation exception items in Workday, analyze the data and work with the appropriate teams to make data corrections
Work with various teams, including domain leads and HRCT to understand data discrepancies and bring to resolution
Manage day to day data operational requests by monitoring incoming data requests in the Data Management group inbox
Create /update incentive codes related to Advanced Compensation in SAP tables
Enter org units in SAP legacy system when Finance creates a new cost center in source system (FiBRS)
Execute and review exception reports and correct data discrepancies in source system for job profiles, org changes and cost center changes
Enter exceptions in SAP legacy system for Short Term Incentive deferral payment
Maintain tables in SAP legacy system for Business Purpose and Organization requirements to ensure accuracy between Workday and SAP
Update job country specific attributes in SAP ad hoc based on requests received in Data Management generic mailbox
Support team communication for changes related to data discrepancies and audit checks
Work in collaboration with Digital Solutions strategy team to prioritize work and exchange information including participation in weekly team meetings, planning activities and ad hoc requests to support team deliverables
What do you need to succeed?
Must-have:
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Experience in data entry and data analysis
Nice-to-haves:
Experience with Workday and/or cloud based technology
Knowledge of HR practices, policies and systems
Familiarity and experience in using the SAP HR system
What's in it for you?
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
Opportunities to take on progressively greater scopes of work
Job Summary
Identifies and collects data sources, analyzes and extracts key data and information, evaluates and monitors data quality to meet the organization's information system needs and requirements. Applies complete knowledge, skills, and practices to perform assignments.
