Title: Business Systems Analyst II, Stem Cells Solutions - Remote
Description:
Job category: Information technology Job posting ID: 2901

 Employment status: Regular full-time
 Classification: PTS/MGT/IT B
 Salary/Rate of pay: $84,000 -$99,750
 Application deadline: 2022-04-20

 Please note: Candidates located in Ontario near any major city with a Canadian Blood Services site are encouraged to apply.

 Somewhere in Canada there’s a life you can save.

 Be part of a dynamic, collaborative and caring organization committed to saving and improving the lives of Canadians. Thousands of Canadians depend on us every day for reliable access to blood, plasma, stem cells and organs and tissues.

 Join Canada’s Lifeline and make a meaningful difference every day.

 About the role

 Canadian Blood Services is looking for a Regular Full-Time Business Systems Analyst II, Stem Cells Solutions to join our dynamic External Customer Experience team in Ontario. The work of a Business Systems Analyst II, Stem Cells Solutions is integral to Canadian Blood Services’ role as Canada’s Lifeline. In this role, you will assist senior Business Systems Analysts of the team to act as the interface between the clients or project team and the National Systems Solutions group as well as other IT Teams for large/complex business systems. For small to medium sized business systems, you will act as the interface. You will participate in/complete the planning, development/acquisition, implementation, and maintenance of small to medium sized business systems. You will identify/complete small to medium tasks as part of the project or release. These tasks include, but are not limited to, requirements (use case) gathering/analysis, project plan and work schedule creation/ management, project and release coordination/management, test case creation/execution, problem management coordination/trending for existing business systems, resource capacity planning and overall liaison between the business and National Systems Solutions. The interface role also involves coordinating between other IT departments to complete the infrastructure and other enabling services for new and existing business systems.

 Key responsibilities include:

 Build strong client relationships, develop IT strategic and tactical plans for the client’s business.
 Develop expertise in client strategic directions, business processes, data, and systems.
 In partnership with more senior members of the team or independently depending upon the size and complexity of the system, establishes and maintains a professional and cooperative working relationship with assigned client groups, other team members, client Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) and other Information Technology (IT) Teams.
 Proactively proposes business solutions to client groups to leverage technology in improving the business processes and results. For more complex systems, participates in the proposal development and progression.
 Becomes the primary point of contact for day-to-day support and business systems planning for the client group. As part of a larger team, participates in providing day-to-day support and system planning for large systems.
 Assess client requirements, determine possible solutions and plans system development.
 Identify new program initiatives or changes requiring business system development or enhancements independently or in conjunction with senior business systems analysts depending upon the size/ complexity of the business system
 Aids/leads project team ensuring all tasks and timelines are understood and progressing on schedule.
 Assists with/establishes project schedules and ensures work activities are completed on schedule and within budget.
 Ensures work products are complete, fully tested, documented, and meet client requirements for small to medium sized projects/ systems or participates in these activities for large complex projects I systems.
 Assists client with testing and with development of user documentation and training.
 Provides timely reporting of progress and issues to management. Participates in/ leads the development and research of various process, quality and project standards, process efficiency, team practices and industry developments.
 Assists with/ advises other members of the team and within IT on process, quality, and project standards.
 Takes direction from other members of the team and from within IT for team operation and process efficiency or leads discussion/ investigation to ensure best practices.
 Understand and comply with Canadian Blood Services information technology regulatory standards.
 Performs other related duties as required.


 Qualifications:

 Post-secondary level education in a relevant discipline from a recognized academic institution, preferably in Business, Computer Sciences or Computer/Software Engineering.
 Five to seven years of experience as a project manager, systems analyst, process specialist, software developer or business systems analyst.
 Experience in the client business processes to be supported (e.g., Stem Cells ) with an aptitude for system design.


 Required skills:

 Ability to conduct business professionally and develop strong working relationships with clients.
 Proven ability to learn in a fast-paced, dynamic, and challenging environment.
 Exemplar problem analysis, planning and organizational skills.
 Exemplar documentation skills (e.g., use case, business requirements, functional specifications, project plans, training, and user guides).
 Exemplar project management skills for managing and implementing projects of a larger scale (scope, complexity, and budget).
 Ability to articulate requirements to IT subject matter experts.
 Strong leadership, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.
 Ability to effectively deal with conflict.
 Exemplar communications skills in English.


 Benefits:

 Competitive base salary range
 4 weeks of paid vacation
 Annual Performance Award up to 8%
 Flexible remote working schedule
 Comprehensive group health, dental and vision benefits
 Choice of defined contribution or defined benefits pension plan
 Employee discounts, wellness programs, and much more

 Diversity and inclusion play a vital role in ensuring health equity for patients across Canada. We are committed to reflecting Canada’s population in our organization and fostering an environment where all employees can be their authentic selves, with equal opportunities to succeed and contribute.

 To protect the health and safety of its employees, all Canadian Blood Services’ employees are required to be fully vaccinated (COVID-19 vaccine doses as approved by Health Canada), subject to any medical or other human rights grounds.

 If this role resonates with you, we encourage you to apply! This could be your first step towards a meaningful and inspiring career. Come to work each day knowing that you save lives.

 We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those considered for an interview or those invited to participate in an assessment (such as testing) will be contacted. Applicants who require accommodation should discuss their needs with us.

Title: Data Analyst, Valuation & Advisory Services
Description:
Our Story: 
  
 About You:


    You are a high achiever looking to thrive in a fast-paced environment. You take pride in your own work but are comfortable collaborating with a team of highly motivated individuals. You can communicate clearly and concisely with teammates and clients, and you enjoy strong company culture and camaraderie. You can navigate multiple corporate functions, including global lines of service and corporate centers of excellence. You possess strong interpersonal skills and are willing to take on diverse tasks to achieve the team’s common goal. You value personal and professional growth and are ready to take the next step in advancing your career.
  


 If this sounds like you, well, then you will love the culture at Avison Young!
  


 About Us:


    Avison Young is a global commercial real estate brokerage and advisory firm, offering transaction, management, financial and consulting services. We’ve designed our corporate structure to best serve our clients by enhancing collaboration across our organization.
  


 Real estate can have an enormous positive impact on people’s lives – and we’re in the business of making spaces and places work better for people. Our purpose is to create real economic, social and environmental value as a global real estate advisor, powered by people.
  


 We care about each other and we have each other’s backs. This makes AY a great place to be a client, and a great place to work. We support the whole person and their complete wellness – economic, mental and physical – because what’s best for our business comes from our people bringing their whole selves to work.
  

 Overview: 
   As a Data Analyst in Western Canada, you will work closely with internal and external stakeholders in the multiple market across all business lines. Leveraging your passion for data, technology and real estate, you will capture, review and enhance transactional real estate data. Responsibilities: 
   This role which will require data entry & broader data importing, data analysis/management, and strong researching skills and will include the following regular tasks:


 reviewing core real estate data and importing it to the technology platform including properties, images, documents, leases, sales and ensuring accuracy & consistency.
 engage with local resources to capture and enhance transactional real estate data
 researching local cities, businesses, economic, demographic and real estate market activity and consolidating it into concise reports.
 meeting/speaking with both internal and external stakeholders around market activities
 adding/updating data on internal technology platforms utilizing publications, public filings, public records and third-party data providers
 searching and pulling data from public records around ownership, sales, debt, permits, zoning and tax assessments.
 adding/maintaining data from internal systems and processes by reaching out to industry insiders to track down missing data points.
 Qualifications: 
   To be successful in this role, an individual must be able to perform each essential task at an above average level. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required.


 Post-secondary education and/or pursuing post-secondary education is considered an asset
 1+ year experience in commercial real estate or real estate course work preferred
 Passionate about data, technology and real estate
 Dedicated to data as an art and science
 Sound knowledge of provincial geography and economic landscape
 Ability to learn new technology applications quickly & advanced knowledge of Microsoft excel preferred
 Possess characteristic traits of independent thinking, self-starting initiative while working well in a team-oriented environment
 Must be able to handle flexibility in task management while having a keen eye for detail
 Ability to communicate clearly and concisely is essential
 Ability to multi-task, utilize effective time management skills, and be able to recognize and respond to time sensitive issues and tasks


 A positive attitude is essential as we strive to maintain and protect our culture by hiring only those that enhance our current compliment of long-term employees and bring value to our team.
Our Equal Opportunity Commitment: 
  
    Avison Young practices as an equal opportunity employer in all services locations around the world. We are committed to building and maintaining a workforce diverse in experience, skills and knowledge with uniformity in service excellence, commitment and integrity.
  


 The firm maintains a strict policy to ensure employment opportunities are equal and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, creed, age, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, disability, marital and civil partnership/union status, protected veteran or military service status, or any other elements protected by law.
  


 For those requiring assistance with disabilities, information relating to the need for accommodation and accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially.
  

    Avison Young is committed to employing the best talent with the most fair and equitable recruitment practices. Apply with us TODAY!

Job Description:

POSITION SUMMARY: Under the general direction of the Supervisor, assists in developing and providing effective Business Applications solutions, strategic planning and project management, and applying suitable solutions to meet Departmental and Corporate requirements. Key responsibilities include project management, research, process analysis/reengineering, and planning.
MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:
Provides project management services for Business Applications initiatives as directed, including resource requirements, scheduling, planning, and status reporting.
Analyzes and assesses processes; recommends and assists in the deployment of departmental and Corporate process re-engineering activities; establishes business case support including budgetary and resource impact with respect to process improvement recommendations.
Researches potential Business Applications solutions to meet client and/or CIT needs; reports on findings and makes recommendations where required.
Maintains effective and cooperative liaison with clients, vendors, suppliers, service providers, and staff in other organizations; maintains a high standard of public relations at all times.
Assists in the development, implementation, and attainment of Section objectives, work plans, and schedules; assists in the same processes for Departmental and Divisional activities.
Participates in Corporate cross-functional teams improving Corporate IS / IT processes.
Ensures accurate Section records are maintained in accordance with Corporate policies.
Participates in the preparation of annual capital and operating budget for the Section and Division budgets.
Participates in Corporate-wide initiatives and cross-functional teams as required.
Performs such other related duties as may be assigned.
QUALIFICATIONS:
Education/Experience
Degree in computer science, business administration majoring in information systems, or related field, together with a minimum of three years’ related experience with application development technologies, enterprise system software; or
Diploma relating to computer systems/business application development, together with a minimum of five years’ related experience with application development technologies, enterprise system software.
A minimum of one year related project management experience.
Skills/Abilities:
Demonstrated attitude to excel at supporting client excellence
Strong understanding of organizational goals and objectives and project management principles
Superior ability to communicate effectively and concisely, both orally and in writing, with the ability to present ideas in a business friendly and user friendly language
Superior ability to establish and maintain effective working relations with other departments, subordinates, co-workers, and the general public
Ability to improve Divisional effectiveness and efficiency
Knowledge of network hardware, protocols and standards including IP networks, and firewalls
Understanding of applicable data security practices and law
Highly self-motivated and directed
Excellent problem-solving, organizing, and prioritizing
Assets:
Experience with Web, GIS, ERP, and application development technologies
Knowledge of the functions of City departments, outside boards and local community groups
Project management certification
Business analyst certification
CONDITIONS OF EMPLOYMENT:
Must undergo a successful Criminal Record and Judicial Matters Check (CRJMC)
Must sign and abide by Employee Confidentiality Statement
May be required to attend meetings outside regular working hours
May be required to travel to various work locations and provide own transportation
May be required to be on call

Title: Business Analyst - Data Governance
Description:
Desjardins Group is the largest cooperative financial group in Canada, and one of the largest employers in the country. It offers a full range of financial products and services and is home to a wealth of expertise in property and casualty insurance, life and health insurance, wealth management, services for businesses of all sizes, securities brokerage, asset management, venture capital, and secure, leading-edge virtual access methods.
Job Level
NV-10
As a business analyst, data governance, you will help define and develop strategic planning and monitoring activities, and track business plans and performance. You will help establish targets and identify service delivery improvement opportunities, and support the design and delivery of business strategies and solutions in line with the business architecture of the various projects or as part of the transformation and development of Desjardins Group.

Your role will be to analyze the organization’s business environment and needs in connection with innovative, wide-scale projects and initiatives. You will target, design and recommend business solutions. You will analyze their impacts on the organization, and ensure they’re integrated, from needs assessment to rollout. The nature of the initiatives and projects will require in-depth and extensive expertise in your field.

You will make recommendations on the development and delivery of files and projects with a high degree of operational and conceptual complexity. These will require analysis and a comprehensive, detailed understanding of the business and the organization, as well as an ability to manage uncertainty and ambiguity. Coordination will be critical, and you will be required to interact with a large number of stakeholders who are experts in a variety of fields. Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to balance the interests of multiple parties will therefore be essential.

You will act as a specialist and play a leadership role for organizational bodies and work teams.
General Information on the Position
Plus précisément, vous faites partie d’une équipe d’une dizaine de personnes avec des profils complémentaires qui visent à développer une surveillance globale et intégrée des risques de donnée auxquels est exposé le Mouvement Desjardins. Cette équipe de 2e ligne de défense assure une surveillance efficace des risques de données et contribue au rehaussement des pratiques opérationnelles en collaboration avec les équipes des différentes composantes du Mouvement Desjardins.
Responsabilités principales
Développer et mettre en place des algorithmes, des règles d’affaires et des tests statistiques afin de détecter les anomalies de données dans les environnements Desjardins
Coordonner, suivre, mesurer et communiquer la performance des contrôles de qualité déployés dans le cadre de la surveillance des encadrements de qualité de données dans les différentes entités du Mouvement
Développer, opérationnaliser et faire évoluer les standards, processus, outils ainsi que les meilleures pratiques en lien avec les contrôles de qualité de données
Surveiller l'efficacité des contrôles de données mis en place par les différents secteurs et faire les recommandations appropriées dans une perspective d'amélioration continue
Opérationnaliser un processus de signalement des anomalies de données afin de commander les corrections aux dossiers par les premières lignes
Accompagner des projets en lien avec l'évolution de la gouvernance des données.
Conditions particulières
Lieu de travail: Présentement en télétravail régulier découlant du contexte de la pandémie. Le mode de travail s’appliquant au poste est le mode hybride #LI-Hybrid
Nombre d’emploi disponible : 1
Profil recherché
Baccalauréat dans une discipline appropriée
Un minimum de six ans d’expérience pertinente
Veuillez noter que d’autres combinaisons de formation et d’expérience pertinentes pourraient être considérées
Pour les postes vacants disponibles au Québec, veuillez noter que la connaissance du français est nécessaire
Connaissances spécifiques
Maîtrise de la suite Office
Connaissance de la programmation SQL
Connaissance de SAS, R, Matlab (un atout)
Connaissance du langage de programmation Python (un atout)
Connaissance du cloud Microsoft Azure (un atout)
Connaissance des procédures SAS (un atout)
Desjardins Cross-sector skills
Action oriented, Customer Focus, Differences, Nimble learning
Key competencies for the job
Ambiguity, Communicates effectively, Interpersonal Savvy, Strategic mindset
Work Location
Complexe Desjardins Montréal
Trade Union
Non Syndiqué

2022-04-20

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Overview:

It’s an exciting time to be at OSL Retail Services, working for a people focused company that’s at the top of its game. The momentum we’ve generated in recent years with our commitments to client customers, innovation, business results, and an entrepreneurial spirit has created energy, enthusiasm, and engagement among our employees that is pushing us to new heights. And we’re on the lookout for talented people who share our vision and values and want to join us in this journey. At OSL, our culture is our foundation. Passionate employees, great customer service and long-term relationships are all built upon that foundation. We value people, passion, honesty, respect, and integrity.
Summary:
Reporting to the Business Intelligence Manager, the Business Intelligence Analyst is a skilled analytical professional who has significant hands-on experience with analysis and reporting as they relate to the merchandise productivity in a large organization. As an Analyst, you will be responsible to create and develop metrics, see opportunities in the business and help shape the vision for reporting and analysis at OSL.
 Responsibilities:
Work with the Business Intelligence Manager to determine the vision for reporting and builds a plan to execute on those goals
Work within a team to prioritize work and achieve team goals on time
Support the team with producing reports as required, scheduled or ad hoc
Assist in identifying opportunities in the business and works to produce impactful analysis
Examine reports and produce accurate data
Assist with the compilation and distribution of key financial and management reports
Liaise with internal and external clients on reporting needs to find effective solutions
Assist with new project opportunities to identify reporting and data system requirements
Candidate Qualifications:
Proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages, databases (SQL), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks)
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc.)
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Adept at queries, report writing, data visualization and presenting findings
BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics an asset
What we offer:
Competitive base salary plus bonuses and other perks
Vacation plus additional flex days
Comprehensive benefits
Training and development opportunities to grow your career with one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies
A supportive workplace culture and work environment
Disclaimer: The preceding job description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this job. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.
OSL is committed to an inclusive workplace that does not discriminate against race, nationality, religion, age, marital status, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender, or gender identity. We believe in diversity and encourage any qualified individual to apply. We are an EEOC Employer.

Title: Reporting and Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Radiant offers a complete range of industry-leading transportation and warehousing solutions to businesses around the globe by leveraging our extensive network of carrier partners across all modes. Radiant provides customized logistics solutions that create value and increase profitability for our customers.
Radiant Canada is a learning environment in which passion, dedication and a commitment to getting the job done are valued. That’s what being on our team is all about. It’s where you can gain valuable skills and experience, which also helps Radiant grow. If this sounds like the kind of company you are looking for, we would love to hear from you!
We are currently looking for a Reporting and Business Intelligence Analyst to join Radiant and be part of our dynamic team.
HYBRID WORK MODEL - Date to be determined. Currently work remote due to COVID-19. Hybrid work model is working in the office at 1280 Courtneypark Drive E, Mississauga every Monday and Wednesday.
What You’ll Do: 

Respond to reporting requests. Design and develop reports and dashboards using reporting development tools i.e. Excel, SSRS and Power BI.
Analyze data and identify opportunities to maximize profit, minimize costs, recommend value-added business solutions and determine potential areas for improvement and growth.
Communicate with internal teams and customers to collect business logic and requirements.
Summarize and communicate business logic to IT for data structure development and data extract.
Perform data collection, cleansing, transformation and testing for day-to-day analysis, and reporting and dashboard development.
Develop internal and external operational and financial KPI’s.
Design, execute, communicate and troubleshoot problems for external customer reports.
Develop and maintain reporting standard operating procedure documents.
Assist in preparing customer presentations. Participate in the customer presentation as required.
Develop transportation invoice statement templates as required.
Other duties and assignments as required.

What You Bring to the Role: 

University Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or Mathematics.
Minimum 2 years’ experience in performing analysis with large sets of data.
Experience in performing analysis with large sets of data is an asset.
Proficient in Microsoft Office i.e. Outlook, Word, PowerPoint.
Intermediate skills in SQL (e.g., writing statements).
Advanced skills in Excel and knowledge of Relational Database design.
Experience with Microsoft Power BI is an asset.
SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) is an asset.
SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS, MDX query) is an asset.
Visual Basic and other programming language are an asset.
Experience with Access is an asset, e.g., create Tables, Queries, Forms and Relationships
Knowledge of Transportation Management software or Warehouse Management software is an asset.
Ability to understand the flow of information between departments.
Ability to clearly identify the internal and external customers’ current and future needs and present solutions to them.
Dedicated commitment to providing superior, timely internal and external customer service.
Effective interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate clearly and effectively in verbal and written form.
Effective problem-solving and decision-making skills in a team environment.
Highly organized with the ability to multi-task.
Team cooperation and respect is required.
Work well under pressure in a time sensitive environment.
Analytical and detail-oriented.

Perks You’ll Get: 

Health, Dental, Vision, Life and Disability insurance
RRSP Contribution Matching
Learning & Development Opportunities
Employee Discounts
Access to an Employee Assistance Program for services including counseling, financial and legal consultation
Wellness Program
Safety Shoe Allowance

Dental care

Employee assistance program

Monday to Friday

Ability to commute/relocate:

Mississauga, ON L5T 1N6: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)

Application question(s):

performing analyses with large data sets: 2 years (required)

SQL - writing statements: 1 year (required)

Title: Senior Risk Analyst
Description: Job Title:  Senior Risk AnalystDepartment:  Risk ManagementReports to: Senior Manager Operational Risk ManagementJob SummaryThe Senior Analyst, Risk Management, is responsible for the following:Supporting the Senior Managers of Operational Risk Management in managing the various aspects of Operational Risk Management Department’s responsibilities with specific focus on Risk & Control Self-Assessment, Control Testing and Assurance, Key Risk Indicator and Operational Risk Event Data Collection and Analysis, Action Plan Monitoring and Management and Board of Directors Reporting.As and when required support the Chief Risk Officer and Senior Managers of Credit Risk Management and Enterprise Risk Management in managing the various aspects of Risk Management.The incumbent will foster good working relationship with business unit heads to ensure that operational risk is being managed as per the requirements of the Banks Policy and Guidelines. The incumbent is also required to stay up to date with the regulatory requirements, forthcoming regulations and industry best practices.Responsibilities and DutiesThe Senior Analyst Risk Management is responsible for, including but not limited to, the following: Conduct control testing of operational controls related to credit processes and other critical functions of the Bank and revise/update control assessments using inputs from internal/external reports, internal audit reports, regulatory reports etc.Review, challenge and update of the Risk & Control Self-Assessments and corrective action plans, monitoring and analysis of key risk indicators and operational risk events.Provide second line of defense challenge on new products, initiatives and process change risk assessments and outsourcing risk assessments.Review and update of policies, procedures and guidelines. Coordinate collection of operational risk data from business departments and branches for Parent Bank, Senior Management and Board of Directors reporting.Prepare monthly, quarterly and annual operational risk reports in a timely fashion ensuring accuracy of data and sound analysis.Develop, maintain and automate, to the extent possible, the Operational Risk Events, Key Risk Indicators databases and Risk & Controls Libraries.Assist the CRO and Senior Managers of Credit Risk Management and Enterprise Risk Management in special RMD projects and Ad-hoc assignments.Qualifications And SkillsBachelor’s or Master’s degree in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics or equivalent work experience and background.Prior experience (minimum of three years, preferred 5 years or more in a financial institution) in operational risk management, controls assurance, data analysis or reporting.Good understanding of risk management and governance.Experience in one or more of the programming languages/tools i.e. SAS, SQL, R. Python and VBA are nice to have.Good project management and time management skills.Sound report writingEffective communication skills.Overall knowledge of Bank’s processes and controls is preferredJob Types: Full-time, PermanentBenefits:Dental careExtended health careVision careSchedule:Monday to FridayAbility to commute/relocate:Toronto, ON M2N 6K1: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)Education:Bachelor's Degree (preferred)Experience:Risk & Credit Analysis Occupations: 1 year (preferred)Risk management: 1 year (preferred)Language:Korean (preferred)Application deadline: 2022-04-13

Title: Analyst IV
Description:
TD Description
Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.
Department Overview
Provides a broad range of analytical and/or process support, research, and execution on projects and special initiatives. Reviews and provides reporting and operational analytics as input for senior team members and leadership. Contributes to overall deliverables and strategies of the team on a variety of metrics. May also work with directly or indirectly with clients. This program is designed to attract, develop, and retain top talent within TD. After successful completion of this program, occupants should be prepared to move into a permanent role.

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES:

CUSTOMER: • Complete rotation objectives set together with each host at the beginning of each rotation
Contribute to, support, and prioritize comprehensive, efficient, and accurate processes to meet and exceed business/client needs and requirementsConduct meaningful qualitative and quantitative research and data analysis, and obtain/share internal and external data and best practicesImprove processes within area including but not limited to those related to reporting, planning, and forecasting; contribute to overall effectiveness of the organizationAssist in conducting value-added business analysis, insights, and recommendations to support business unit/client endeavors, including ad-hoc reviews, reporting, and takeaways with attribution analysis and executive summaries within own area or as assignedLiaise with other areas of the business and overall enterprise to facilitate completion of projectsFor Financial Advisor Program:Provide personalized financial services advice relating to everyday banking, investment solutions, credit needs, and credit managementBuild effective, profitable, long-lasting relationships with a variety of unique personal banking and business banking clientsLiaise with other business units (e.g., Wealth, Business Banking, etc.) to facilitate successful referrals of clients For Technology Solutions Programs:Create code and maintain software, applications, etc. according to business requirements, UX designs, and architectural guidelines, ensuring a high-quality solution

SHAREHOLDER:

Contribute to various operational activities and processes as assignedConsistently exercise discretion in managing correspondence, information and all matters of confidentiality; escalate issues where appropriateBe knowledgeable of practices and procedures within own area of responsibility and keep abreast of emerging trends for own functional areaProtect the interests of the organization identify and manage risks, and escalate non-standard, high risk activities as necessaryMonitor service, productivity and assess efficiency levels within own function and implement continuous process / performance improvements where opportunities existsAcquire and apply expertise in the disciplineIdentify, recommend and effectively execute standard practices applicable to the disciplineAdhere to internal policies/procedures and applicable regulatory guidelinesKeep abreast of emerging issues, trends, and evolving regulatory requirements and assess potential impactsMaintain a culture of risk management and control, supported by effective processes in alignment with risk appetite For Financial Advisor Program:Engage customers in conversation to understand and meet their current and future financial needs by proactively providing them with advice/counsel and appropriate products and servicesPromote products, sales, services and banking capabilitiesContribute to the achievement of business objectives by initiating and closing sales opportunities and referralsIdentify and refer customers to other partners as appropriateAct as a key resource for all customer financial needsEnsure necessary due diligence to support the accuracy of all customer transactions

BREADTH & DEPTH:

Title: Business Systems Analyst - GTM Business Systems
Description:
Fastly helps people stay better connected with the things they love. Fastly's edge cloud platform enables customers to create great digital experiences quickly, securely, and reliably by processing, serving, and securing our customers' applications as close to their end-users as possible — at the edge of the Internet. The platform is designed to take advantage of the modern internet, to be programmable, and to support agile software development. Fastly's customers include many of the world's most prominent companies, including Vimeo, Pinterest, The New York Times, and GitHub.
 We're building a more trustworthy Internet. Come join us.

 Business Systems Analyst - GTM Business Systems
 Come be an important part of our growth by founding the role of Business Systems Analyst for the Go-to-Market Business Systems part of the organization. Key responsibilities include demonstrating business applications product expertise as well as specifying and documenting technical requirements for solving the organization's process & system challenges. The work you implement will have a direct impact on our team's productivity and our organization's overall growth. You will be expected to work with our business stakeholders at all levels, using your functional/business expertise and technical proficiencies to understand the challenges they face and provide context to team leadership for work prioritization and organization. You'll work alongside the Product Manager - Business Systems on ticket intake processes, eliciting and documenting systems requirements. If you want a work environment where your ideas are welcome and contributions are recognized, this is the place for you!
 What You'll Do

Use systems thinking to workshop process problems with business partners, identify solutions, and document requirements.
Follow systems analysis frameworks, patterns and practices.
Coordinate with system admins and developers to resolve technical issues.
A leader in multi-functional team projects that address strategic business issues, you'll provide guidance to the business on implementation strategies & best practices.
Create and document user stories in JIRA including acceptance criteria for application developers and admins of all levels.
Create proof of concepts and design mock-ups.
Assist in managing ticket intake process, assuring tickets are ready for stakeholder prioritization and team grooming ceremonies.
Develop test plans in collaboration with the business & demo all new feature development for accuracy of vision.
Improve the overall quality and completeness of documentation.
Influence at all levels without straight line authority.
Contribute to strategic roadmap planning activities and team process improvement to increase results.
Provide Salesforce, Zendesk, NetSuite and/or Gainsight product expertise, combining business knowledge and technical skill.
Help us grow the GTM Systems team by contributing to the development of our vision and execution of our strategies.

Nice to Have

Experience with Salesforce CPQ.
Experience working on projects that rely on integrations between Salesforce and NetSuite to facilitate the order-to-cash process.
Certified Salesforce Administrator, Certified platform app builder, CPQ certification.
Working knowledge of NetSuite, Zendesk, and Gainsight.

What We're Looking For

Solid business process engineering skills.
Business Analyst work experience, preferably in an Agile environment.
Solid understanding and ability to solution business application integrations with other systems.
Ability to create and interpret system / business requirements and prepare specification and design documents for developers.
A deep understanding of the Lead to Cash processes at scale.
Success working independently with distributed stakeholders and development teams.
The ability to discuss high-level best practices for Salesforce, Zendesk, NetSuite and/or Gainsight.
Must excel in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
Partner with cross-functional leaders that address strategic business issues and create plans to apply appropriate technology solutions.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with a pleasant, supportive, and customer-focused personality and the ability to work across all levels in an organization.
Outstanding attention to detail and problem solving skills.
Ability to follow through on sometimes ambiguous issues until resolved.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

In accordance with applicable law, Fastly's minimum base pay for this role if hired in Colorado is $94,000 per year. Additionally, this role is eligible to participate in Fastly's equity plan. Final offer amount will be at the company's sole discretion and determined by multiple factors, including years and depth of experience and expertise, location and other business considerations. Note that this role is available to candidates outside of Colorado and different minimum compensation may apply.
 Fastly is proud to deliver a strong total rewards program to our employees. This role is eligible to participate in the following benefits:

Health benefits (medical, dental, and vision)
Medical: Cigna or Kaiser available 
Retirement benefits and employer match
Life Insurance (Basic and Voluntary Life)
Short & Long Term Disability with a buy-up LTD option
Voluntary Accident & Critical Illness benefits
Flex Spending Accounts & Mass Transit benefits
Open Vacation Policy
Sick Time
Generous leave benefits (medical, maternity, paternity, and personal)
Paid wellness days
Employee Assistance Program
Learning & reimbursement program stipend
Mobile and internet allowance
Wellness stipend
Pet insurance

Fastly reserves the right to amend or modify for any reasons in accordance with applicable law.

 Why Fastly?

We have a huge impact. Fastly is a small company with a big reach. Not only do our customers have a tremendous user base, but we also support a growing number of open source projects and initiatives. Outside of code, employees are encouraged to share causes close to their heart with others so we can help lend a supportive hand. 
We love distributed teams. Fastly's home-base is in San Francisco, but we have multiple offices and employees sprinkled around the globe. In fact, 50% of our employees work outside of SF! An international remote culture is in our DNA. 
We care about you. Fastly works hard to create a positive environment for our employees, and we think your life outside of work is important too. We support our teams with great benefits like up to 20 weeks of paid parental leave, options for free medical/dental/vision plans, and an open vacation program that enables our folks to take the time they need to recharge (some benefits may vary by location). 
We value diversity. Growing and maintaining our inclusive and diverse team matters to us. We are committed to being a company where our employees feel comfortable bringing their authentic selves to work and have the ability to be successful - every day. 
We are passionate. Fastly is chock full of passionate people and we're not 'one size fits all'. Fastly employs authors, pilots, skiers, parents (of humans and animals), makeup geeks, coffee connoisseurs, and more. We love employees for who they are and what they are passionate about. 

We're always looking for humble, sharp, and creative folks to join the Fastly team. If you think you might be a fit, please apply!


 Fastly is committed to ensuring equal employment opportunity and to providing employees with a safe and welcoming work environment free of discrimination and harassment.
 Employment decisions at Fastly are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, family or parental status, disability*, age, veteran status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Fastly encourages applicants from all backgrounds.

Applicants with disabilities may be entitled to reasonable accommodation under the terms of the Americans with Disabilities Act and certain state or local laws. A reasonable accommodation is a change in the way things are normally done which will ensure an equal employment opportunity without imposing undue hardship on Fastly. Please inform us if you need assistance completing any forms or to otherwise participate in the application process.

 Fastly collects and processes personal data submitted by job applicants in accordance with our Privacy Policy. Please see our privacy notice for job applicants.

Title: Business Analyst - Data Governance
Description:
Desjardins Group is the largest cooperative financial group in Canada, and one of the largest employers in the country. It offers a full range of financial products and services and is home to a wealth of expertise in property and casualty insurance, life and health insurance, wealth management, services for businesses of all sizes, securities brokerage, asset management, venture capital, and secure, leading-edge virtual access methods.
Job Level
NV-10
As a business analyst, data governance, you will help define and develop strategic planning and monitoring activities, and track business plans and performance. You will help establish targets and identify service delivery improvement opportunities, and support the design and delivery of business strategies and solutions in line with the business architecture of the various projects or as part of the transformation and development of Desjardins Group.

Your role will be to analyze the organization’s business environment and needs in connection with innovative, wide-scale projects and initiatives. You will target, design and recommend business solutions. You will analyze their impacts on the organization, and ensure they’re integrated, from needs assessment to rollout. The nature of the initiatives and projects will require in-depth and extensive expertise in your field.

You will make recommendations on the development and delivery of files and projects with a high degree of operational and conceptual complexity. These will require analysis and a comprehensive, detailed understanding of the business and the organization, as well as an ability to manage uncertainty and ambiguity. Coordination will be critical, and you will be required to interact with a large number of stakeholders who are experts in a variety of fields. Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to balance the interests of multiple parties will therefore be essential.

You will act as a specialist and play a leadership role for organizational bodies and work teams.
General Information on the Position
Plus précisément, vous faites partie d’une équipe d’une dizaine de personnes avec des profils complémentaires qui visent à développer une surveillance globale et intégrée des risques de donnée auxquels est exposé le Mouvement Desjardins. Cette équipe de 2e ligne de défense assure une surveillance efficace des risques de données et contribue au rehaussement des pratiques opérationnelles en collaboration avec les équipes des différentes composantes du Mouvement Desjardins.
Responsabilités principales
Développer et mettre en place des algorithmes, des règles d’affaires et des tests statistiques afin de détecter les anomalies de données dans les environnements Desjardins
Coordonner, suivre, mesurer et communiquer la performance des contrôles de qualité déployés dans le cadre de la surveillance des encadrements de qualité de données dans les différentes entités du Mouvement
Développer, opérationnaliser et faire évoluer les standards, processus, outils ainsi que les meilleures pratiques en lien avec les contrôles de qualité de données
Surveiller l'efficacité des contrôles de données mis en place par les différents secteurs et faire les recommandations appropriées dans une perspective d'amélioration continue
Opérationnaliser un processus de signalement des anomalies de données afin de commander les corrections aux dossiers par les premières lignes
Accompagner des projets en lien avec l'évolution de la gouvernance des données.
Conditions particulières
Lieu de travail: Présentement en télétravail régulier découlant du contexte de la pandémie. Le mode de travail s’appliquant au poste est le mode hybride #LI-Hybrid
Nombre d’emploi disponible : 1
Profil recherché
Baccalauréat dans une discipline appropriée
Un minimum de six ans d’expérience pertinente
Veuillez noter que d’autres combinaisons de formation et d’expérience pertinentes pourraient être considérées
Pour les postes vacants disponibles au Québec, veuillez noter que la connaissance du français est nécessaire
Connaissances spécifiques
Maîtrise de la suite Office
Connaissance de la programmation SQL
Connaissance de SAS, R, Matlab (un atout)
Connaissance du langage de programmation Python (un atout)
Connaissance du cloud Microsoft Azure (un atout)
Connaissance des procédures SAS (un atout)
Desjardins Cross-sector skills
Action oriented, Customer Focus, Differences, Nimble learning
Key competencies for the job
Ambiguity, Communicates effectively, Interpersonal Savvy, Strategic mindset

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Overview:

It’s an exciting time to be at OSL Retail Services, working for a people focused company that’s at the top of its game. The momentum we’ve generated in recent years with our commitments to client customers, innovation, business results, and an entrepreneurial spirit has created energy, enthusiasm, and engagement among our employees that is pushing us to new heights. And we’re on the lookout for talented people who share our vision and values and want to join us in this journey. At OSL, our culture is our foundation. Passionate employees, great customer service and long-term relationships are all built upon that foundation. We value people, passion, honesty, respect, and integrity.
Summary:
Reporting to the Business Intelligence Manager, the Business Intelligence Analyst is a skilled analytical professional who has significant hands-on experience with analysis and reporting as they relate to the merchandise productivity in a large organization. As an Analyst, you will be responsible to create and develop metrics, see opportunities in the business and help shape the vision for reporting and analysis at OSL.
 Responsibilities:
Work with the Business Intelligence Manager to determine the vision for reporting and builds a plan to execute on those goals
Work within a team to prioritize work and achieve team goals on time
Support the team with producing reports as required, scheduled or ad hoc
Assist in identifying opportunities in the business and works to produce impactful analysis
Examine reports and produce accurate data
Assist with the compilation and distribution of key financial and management reports
Liaise with internal and external clients on reporting needs to find effective solutions
Assist with new project opportunities to identify reporting and data system requirements
Candidate Qualifications:
Proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages, databases (SQL), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks)
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc.)
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Adept at queries, report writing, data visualization and presenting findings
BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics an asset
What we offer:
Competitive base salary plus bonuses and other perks
Vacation plus additional flex days
Comprehensive benefits
Training and development opportunities to grow your career with one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies
A supportive workplace culture and work environment
Disclaimer: The preceding job description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this job. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.
OSL is committed to an inclusive workplace that does not discriminate against race, nationality, religion, age, marital status, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender, or gender identity. We believe in diversity and encourage any qualified individual to apply. We are an EEOC Employer.

Title: Senior Risk Analyst
Description:
Job Title:  Senior Risk Analyst
Department:  Risk Management
Reports to: Senior Manager Operational Risk Management
Job Summary
The Senior Analyst, Risk Management, is responsible for the following:

Supporting the Senior Managers of Operational Risk Management in managing the various aspects of Operational Risk Management Department’s responsibilities with specific focus on Risk & Control Self-Assessment, Control Testing and Assurance, Key Risk Indicator and Operational Risk Event Data Collection and Analysis, Action Plan Monitoring and Management and Board of Directors Reporting.
As and when required support the Chief Risk Officer and Senior Managers of Credit Risk Management and Enterprise Risk Management in managing the various aspects of Risk Management.
The incumbent will foster good working relationship with business unit heads to ensure that operational risk is being managed as per the requirements of the Banks Policy and Guidelines. The incumbent is also required to stay up to date with the regulatory requirements, forthcoming regulations and industry best practices.

Responsibilities and Duties
The Senior Analyst Risk Management is responsible for, including but not limited to, the following: 

Conduct control testing of operational controls related to credit processes and other critical functions of the Bank and revise/update control assessments using inputs from internal/external reports, internal audit reports, regulatory reports etc.
Review, challenge and update of the Risk & Control Self-Assessments and corrective action plans, monitoring and analysis of key risk indicators and operational risk events.
Provide second line of defense challenge on new products, initiatives and process change risk assessments and outsourcing risk assessments.
Review and update of policies, procedures and guidelines. Coordinate collection of operational risk data from business departments and branches for Parent Bank, Senior Management and Board of Directors reporting.
Prepare monthly, quarterly and annual operational risk reports in a timely fashion ensuring accuracy of data and sound analysis.
Develop, maintain and automate, to the extent possible, the Operational Risk Events, Key Risk Indicators databases and Risk & Controls Libraries.
Assist the CRO and Senior Managers of Credit Risk Management and Enterprise Risk Management in special RMD projects and Ad-hoc assignments.

Qualifications And Skills

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics or equivalent work experience and background.
Prior experience (minimum of three years, preferred 5 years or more in a financial institution) in operational risk management, controls assurance, data analysis or reporting.
Good understanding of risk management and governance.
Experience in one or more of the programming languages/tools i.e. SAS, SQL, R. Python and VBA are nice to have.
Good project management and time management skills.
Sound report writing
Effective communication skills.
Overall knowledge of Bank’s processes and controls is preferred

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Benefits:

Dental care
Extended health care
Vision care

Monday to Friday

Toronto, ON M2N 6K1: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Title: Analyst IV
Description:
TD Description
Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.

Title: Business Systems Analyst - GTM Business Systems
Description:
Fastly helps people stay better connected with the things they love. Fastly's edge cloud platform enables customers to create great digital experiences quickly, securely, and reliably by processing, serving, and securing our customers' applications as close to their end-users as possible — at the edge of the Internet. The platform is designed to take advantage of the modern internet, to be programmable, and to support agile software development. Fastly's customers include many of the world's most prominent companies, including Vimeo, Pinterest, The New York Times, and GitHub.

We're building a more trustworthy Internet. Come join us.
Business Systems Analyst - GTM Business Systems

Come be an important part of our growth by founding the role of Business Systems Analyst for the Go-to-Market Business Systems part of the organization. Key responsibilities include demonstrating business applications product expertise as well as specifying and documenting technical requirements for solving the organization's process & system challenges. The work you implement will have a direct impact on our team's productivity and our organization's overall growth. You will be expected to work with our business stakeholders at all levels, using your functional/business expertise and technical proficiencies to understand the challenges they face and provide context to team leadership for work prioritization and organization. You'll work alongside the Product Manager - Business Systems on ticket intake processes, eliciting and documenting systems requirements. If you want a work environment where your ideas are welcome and contributions are recognized, this is the place for you!

What You'll Do

Use systems thinking to workshop process problems with business partners, identify solutions, and document requirements.
Follow systems analysis frameworks, patterns and practices.
Coordinate with system admins and developers to resolve technical issues.
A leader in multi-functional team projects that address strategic business issues, you'll provide guidance to the business on implementation strategies & best practices.
Create and document user stories in JIRA including acceptance criteria for application developers and admins of all levels.
Create proof of concepts and design mock-ups.
Assist in managing ticket intake process, assuring tickets are ready for stakeholder prioritization and team grooming ceremonies.
Develop test plans in collaboration with the business & demo all new feature development for accuracy of vision.
Improve the overall quality and completeness of documentation.
Influence at all levels without straight line authority.
Contribute to strategic roadmap planning activities and team process improvement to increase results.
Provide Salesforce, Zendesk, NetSuite and/or Gainsight product expertise, combining business knowledge and technical skill.
Help us grow the GTM Systems team by contributing to the development of our vision and execution of our strategies.

Nice to Have

Experience with Salesforce CPQ.
Experience working on projects that rely on integrations between Salesforce and NetSuite to facilitate the order-to-cash process.
Certified Salesforce Administrator, Certified platform app builder, CPQ certification.
Working knowledge of NetSuite, Zendesk, and Gainsight.

What We're Looking For

Solid business process engineering skills.
Business Analyst work experience, preferably in an Agile environment.
Solid understanding and ability to solution business application integrations with other systems.
Ability to create and interpret system / business requirements and prepare specification and design documents for developers.
A deep understanding of the Lead to Cash processes at scale.
Success working independently with distributed stakeholders and development teams.
The ability to discuss high-level best practices for Salesforce, Zendesk, NetSuite and/or Gainsight.
Must excel in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
Partner with cross-functional leaders that address strategic business issues and create plans to apply appropriate technology solutions.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with a pleasant, supportive, and customer-focused personality and the ability to work across all levels in an organization.
Outstanding attention to detail and problem solving skills.
Ability to follow through on sometimes ambiguous issues until resolved.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

In accordance with applicable law, Fastly's minimum base pay for this role if hired in Colorado is $94,000 per year. Additionally, this role is eligible to participate in Fastly's equity plan. Final offer amount will be at the company's sole discretion and determined by multiple factors, including years and depth of experience and expertise, location and other business considerations. Note that this role is available to candidates outside of Colorado and different minimum compensation may apply.

Fastly is proud to deliver a strong total rewards program to our employees. This role is eligible to participate in the following benefits:

Health benefits (medical, dental, and vision)
Medical: Cigna or Kaiser available
Retirement benefits and employer match
Life Insurance (Basic and Voluntary Life)
Short & Long Term Disability with a buy-up LTD option
Voluntary Accident & Critical Illness benefits
Flex Spending Accounts & Mass Transit benefits
Open Vacation Policy
Sick Time
Generous leave benefits (medical, maternity, paternity, and personal)
Paid wellness days
Employee Assistance Program
Learning & reimbursement program stipend
Mobile and internet allowance
Wellness stipend
Pet insurance

Fastly reserves the right to amend or modify for any reasons in accordance with applicable law.
Why Fastly?

We have a huge impact. Fastly is a small company with a big reach. Not only do our customers have a tremendous user base, but we also support a growing number of open source projects and initiatives. Outside of code, employees are encouraged to share causes close to their heart with others so we can help lend a supportive hand.

We love distributed teams. Fastly's home-base is in San Francisco, but we have multiple offices and employees sprinkled around the globe. In fact, 50% of our employees work outside of SF! An international remote culture is in our DNA.

We care about you. Fastly works hard to create a positive environment for our employees, and we think your life outside of work is important too. We support our teams with great benefits like up to 20 weeks of paid parental leave, options for free medical/dental/vision plans, and an open vacation program that enables our folks to take the time they need to recharge (some benefits may vary by location).

We value diversity. Growing and maintaining our inclusive and diverse team matters to us. We are committed to being a company where our employees feel comfortable bringing their authentic selves to work and have the ability to be successful - every day.

We are passionate. Fastly is chock full of passionate people and we're not 'one size fits all'. Fastly employs authors, pilots, skiers, parents (of humans and animals), makeup geeks, coffee connoisseurs, and more. We love employees for who they are and what they are passionate about.

We're always looking for humble, sharp, and creative folks to join the Fastly team. If you think you might be a fit, please apply!


Fastly is committed to ensuring equal employment opportunity and to providing employees with a safe and welcoming work environment free of discrimination and harassment.

Employment decisions at Fastly are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, family or parental status, disability*, age, veteran status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Fastly encourages applicants from all backgrounds.
Applicants with disabilities may be entitled to reasonable accommodation under the terms of the Americans with Disabilities Act and certain state or local laws. A reasonable accommodation is a change in the way things are normally done which will ensure an equal employment opportunity without imposing undue hardship on Fastly. Please inform us if you need assistance completing any forms or to otherwise participate in the application process.

Title: Senior Analyst
Description:
Your Opportunity:
 The Alberta Coding Access Targets for Endoscopy (ACATs-E) is a new initiative with the important goal of developing and implementing a provincial program for endoscopy to effectively manage patient waitlists to ensure patients are scheduled to receive the right care, and at the right time and place. Essential to this work is a provincial endoscopy data management strategy to support the business in adhering to best practice protocols for wait list management. The high quality analytics delivered will provide valuable insights into patient access to endoscopy services and will drive improvement initiatives. This senior professional position is part of the AHS Data and Analytics department and will be jointly supervised by the Provincial Director of Path to Care and the ACATs-E Project Managers within the Digestive Health Strategic Clinical Network. This position is suited for someone who can navigate and thrive in working technically as a data scientist and also translate that data into meaningful information. Using your advanced technical skills, superior creative design skills and expertise with analytical tools, you will have the confidence to self manage projects from start to finish and provide next level analytical products to the organization. You are a technician, an artist, and a leader in endoscopy data in Alberta. You are a highly capable Senior Analyst who can build a provincial endoscopy data repository to meets the organization needs and short-timelines. You will have a solid foundation in SQL, ETL Tools, data automation and business intelligence. Although this position is posted as temporary for 1-year, the plan is to secure permanent funding as this function is integral to the long-term vision of both the endoscopy program in Alberta and the overall AHS Optimization of Analytics Strategy.
 Description: 
The Senior Analyst is a provincial position with a high degree of responsibility and independence in supporting the clinical, operational, and program data and reporting needs for the endoscopy service. The main functions of the role are: establishing a provincial endoscopy data repository in the AHS enterprise data warehouse, acquiring raw data from the clinical information systems used by endoscopy, establishing ETLs to the repository, building report level data sets, and building multi-level analytical products. The initial focus is to build a provincial Tableau Dashboard to meet the needs of the ACATs-E program. Next, will be to build provincial Tableau Dashboards to meet the AHS referral, wait list, and wait time management reporting requirements and to support endoscopy in meeting their patient access improvement goals. This position will also fulfill any ad-hoc data and reporting requests that can come from across the organization, Alberta Health, CIHI, or for research purposes. As a new clinical information system is currently being implemented across AHS, it would be ideal for the successful candidate to have Epic Proficiency. This position will develop into the subject matter expert for data, measurement, monitoring, and reporting of patient access to endoscopy services at AHS. The role will enhance the data literacy of the organization and support it in becoming data-driven. This will require the successful candidate to have the capacity to understand the business of endoscopy and the proficiency to create analytics that display the patient access picture for endoscopy that readily convey actionable insights for the business. The successful candidate will have a forward-thinking mindset and will continuously look to innovate how AHS delivers and uses analytics to deliver healthcare better.


Classification: Senior Analyst
 Union: Exempt
 Department: SCN Digestive Health
 Primary Location: Seventh Street Plaza
 Negotiable Location: Provincial
 Temporary Employee Class: Temp F/T Benefits
 FTE: 1.00
 Posting End Date: 18-APR-2022
 Date Available: 09-MAY-2022
 Temporary End Date: 31-MAY-2023
 Hours per Shift: 7.75
 Length of Shift in weeks: 2
 Shifts per cycle: 10
 Shift Pattern: Days
 Days Off: Saturday/Sunday
 Minimum Salary: $34.52
 Maximum Salary: $59.20
 Vehicle Requirement: Not Applicable

 Required Qualifications: 
Master’s Degree from an accredited institution in a data science or quantitatively focus field. Minimum of 6 years Oracle SQL or other comparable database query and report writing. Minimum of 6 years experience analyzing data, using business intelligence and data visualization products, and performing ETL tasks. Minimum of 2 to 3 years working with healthcare data.
 Additional Required Qualifications: 
Proficiency with communicating in English, with excellent written and verbal communication skills. Advanced skills in interacting with team members and stakeholders by presenting results in a visually appealing and in business-friendly language. Advanced Microsoft Suite (including Visio, PowerPoint, Excel) skills and the ability to quickly become proficient with new software and products. Demonstrated ability to collaborate with and lead others effectively. Demonstrated ability to manage multiple concurrent projects and a record of meeting deadlines. Must abide by the highest standards of confidentiality and have a sound understanding of the principles. within Alberta’s Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act, as well as the Health Information Act.
 Preferred Qualifications: 
3 to 5 years experience in healthcare expertise, specifically related to endoscopy and patient scheduling data. Minimum of 3 years in Tableau Desktop, Tableau Server (non-admin, for publishing) and the ETL tools Informatica or Alteryx. Epic Proficiency.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You'll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you'll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.
Job Description:
Business Data Analyst (SAP GL, GR, BW)
Role Summary:
The Corporate Applications Services (CAS) /Finance Shared Services team is looking for a Business Data Analyst (SAP) role with adequate analytical skills and business systems to become a member of the Finance Shared Services team and be part of the SAP COE(Centre of Excellence), support organization going forward.
In this position, you will serve as the primary resource for SAP General Ledger, Group Reporting & Business Warehouse applications (including Master Data, Chart of Values & Reporting Hierarchies) pertaining to operation support and project
initiatives reporting to the Manager Business System Analysis.
What will you do?
Support Director/Manager Business Systems Analysis in day-to-day operations regarding reference data/master data maintenance and management
Working with the client to ensure day-to-day support and maintenance activities, which include problem solving
Performing finance related activities in multiple system landscapes, such as revaluation/translation and consolidation
Identification/tracking/resolution as well as new requests including the new projects and enhancements
Participate in business requirement gathering and analysis and contribute on the reference data requirements identification and configuration
Documentation and maintenance of operational guides and documentation
Documentation of user documents and training the users on applications supported by FSS
Working and coordinating effectively with our offshore partners to ensure quality and timely deliverables
Work with technical team, business systems analyst to resolve any issues/defects from the Finance users
What will you need to succeed?
Business, accounting and/or finance degree
Minimum of 2 years of experience in the financial services industry with extensive knowledge of financial analyses and reporting
Strong computer skills in Microsoft Office applications with proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint.
Strong written and oral communication skills and the ability to effectively communicate at most levels of the organization
Strong data analytics skills
Solid understanding of accounting systems and processes
Working experience of SAP general ledger and reporting applications (1-2 years), similar ERP systems will be considered, and SAP training will be provided
Strong client focus
Unique Requirements
Occasional work outside of normal business hours as part of a global team
Occasional weekend work in support of project delivery and implementations
What’s in it for you?
Great Place to Work® Certified in Canada and the US.
Named 2021 “Best Places to Work” by Glassdoor
Canada Award for Excellence for Mental Health at Work - 2021
Flexible hybrid work model including in-country work-from-home if you prefer.
Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security
Work and professional development that is united by our Purpose: to help Clients and Employees achieve lifetime financial security and live healthier lives
A friendly, collaborative, and inclusive culture
Be part of our continuous improvement journey in developing the next greatest digital enterprise experience.
