Title: Human Resources Corporate Analyst
Description:
Job Level: RÉ-05 $68,641 to $91,072

Closing Date: 22/04/22


Human Resources Corporate Analyst

The Human Resources Branch is looking for a Human Resources Corporate Analyst for a permanent position. The position is classified as an RÉ-05 ($68,641 to $91,072 per annum).


ABOUT US

The National Capital Commission (NCC) is the federal Crown Corporation dedicated to ensuring that Canada’s Capital is a dynamic and inspiring source of pride for all Canadians and a legacy for generations to come. Building on more than a century of experience, the NCC provides unique value in the Capital Region by fulfilling three specific roles: long-term planner of federal lands, principal steward of nationally significant public places, and creative partner committed to excellence in development and conservation.

Year after year, the NCC has been recognized as one of National Capital Region’s top employers as well as recognized as one of Canada’s Greenest Employers. NCC employees can deploy to departments and separate agencies in accordance with the Public Service Employment Act.


DETAILED JOB DESCRIPTION

Reporting to the Manager, HR Corporate Programs and Policies, the incumbent provides research and advisory services and is responsible for gathering data, analysis and writing and, preparing supporting documentation. The incumbent provides management with information on best practices, strategies, policies and programs from a range of public and private sources in a broad range of areas such as, but not limited to:

Staffing, Corporate Human Resources, Classification, Labour Relations, HR planning, Employee engagement, Performance and Talent management, Organizational development, Training and development, Employee onboarding, HR programs, Official languages, Employment Equity, Diversity and Inclusion, GBA+, Multiculturalism, Employee recognition, HR reporting, Occupational Health and Safety (includes workplace harassment and violence prevention & workplace wellbeing, Employee Assistance Programs), Disability and return to work management, Duty to Accommodate, Informal conflict management or Change management, equitable compensation, awards and recognition, onboarding.

Special challenges of this position include being an agent of change, influencing HR management by keeping abreast of trends and best practices in human resources, developing and implementing high impact solutions/programs that will attract, retain and develop talent as well as enhance the NCC’s overall employee experience while understanding the operational and HR needs of the National Capital Commission.

ESSENTIAL QUALIFICATIONS:

EDUCATION: University degree with specialization in the field of Human Resources or in a related discipline or an acceptable combination of education, training and experience related to the position.

EXPERIENCE:

Progressive experience providing advice to clients and/or senior managers in at least two people management (HR) disciplines.
Experience conducting research and analysis.
Experience creating related briefing material (such as reports, briefing notes, presentations, recommendations etc.).
Experience applying diversity and inclusion principles (including but not limited to GBA+, employment equity).

KNOWLEDGE

Knowledge of federal public sector people management legislation and policies.
Knowledge of policy life cycle management development.

ABILITIES

To apply analytical skills on complex questions/cases and in recommending solutions, options or strategies.
To provide advice on the interpretation or application of people management legislation and policies in the federal public sector.
To draft and edit written material.
To plan, prioritize and coordinate multiple projects to meet client expectations, priorities and deadlines.

COMPETENCIES:

Demonstrating Integrity and Respect Civility and Well-Being,
Thinking Things Through - Innovating Through Analysis and Ideas;
Working Effectively with Others – Relationships and Trust Building; and
Showing Initiative and Being Action-Oriented – Getting Things Done

CONDITIONS OF EMPLOYMENT

Possess or eligible to obtain Reliability security clearance;
Linguistic profile: Bilingual BBB/BBB;
Position is in the National Capital Region. The candidate must reside within a commutable distance from the workplace (40 Elgin Street, Ottawa, Ontario); et
All employees of the core public administration, including the NCC as a crown corporation are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and attest to their vaccination status unless accommodated based on a certified medical contraindication, religion, or another prohibited ground for discrimination as defined under the Canadian Human Rights Act. The requirement for employees to be fully vaccinated applies whether they are teleworking, working remotely or working on-site. This is a condition of employment and it applies to indeterminate (permanent), determinate (term), casual, and student hiring. Should you reach the point in the selection process where it is necessary to verify terms and conditions of employment then the hiring manager or a human resources representative will contact you in order to complete an attestation.

ASSETS

Experience developing policy documents, such as, but not limited to, policies, guidelines, and/or guidance.
Two or more years of experience providing people management program support and/or advisory services in the Core public administration.
Experience in more than two people management disciplines.

The National Capital Commission is committed to establishing and maintaining a representative workforce. Preference may be given to qualified candidates who self-declare as members of a visible minority group, Indigenous peoples, persons with disabilities or women (in non-traditional occupations).

Preference may be given to Persons employed in the public service.


The NCC is committed to building a skilled, diverse workforce reflective of Canadian society. As a result, it promotes employment equity and encourages candidates to indicate voluntarily in their application if they are a woman, an Indigenous person, a person with a disability or a member of a visible minority group.

The NCC is also committed to developing inclusive, barrier-free selection processes and work environments. If contacted regarding this competition, please advise the Human Resources representative of the accommodation measures which must be taken to enable you to be assessed in a fair and equitable manner. If you require additional information on the position or if you are experiencing technical difficulties, please contact us at hr.recruitment@ncc-ccn.ca.

Hearing impaired and speech impaired persons can contact us through a Teletype Device (TTY) at (613) 239-5090 or 1-866-661-3530 (toll free).

Title: Technical Business Analyst
Description:
At Myplanet, our Service Methods team is looking to evolve our ways of working across our delivery teams, enablement teams, and client teams to ensure our services and methodologies reinforce our messaging as a premium provider in the headless e-commerce space.
 As a Technical Business Analyst on our Service Methods team, you'll work as a key team member in eliciting, analyzing, and documenting Myplanet's product and processes. You'll work cross-functionally and collaboratively to create the artefacts that will be used across all teams.
 With strong attention to detail, and the ability to think critically, you will build an understanding of both product and processes at a level that will enable you to become an internal expert and thus communicate to and train others.
 If you're excited to broaden your exposure to product and delivery management and are ready to support our product and processes, we want to hear from you.
 Responsibilities

Meet with stakeholders (decision makers, systems owners, and/or end users) to elicit, analyze and document functional and non-functional capabilities of the product and delivery processes.
Responsible for creating and maintaining business solution and processes documentation, including but not limited to formal documentation, use cases, and process flow diagrams.
Collaborate across disciplines (designers, product managers, and developers) to ensure a common understanding of the product and delivery processes.
Collaborate with internal learning and development team members to create relevant training materials for our product and processes

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Commerce, or other related fields.
At least 2 years of experience in a business analyst role/capacity.
Familiarity with software development life cycles complemented with a solid understanding of agile/scrum methodologies.
Ability to distill complex concepts into easy to understand content (presentations, documentation, artefact development) for a diverse range of audiences.
Proficiency in project management tools such as Jira
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal
Excellent planning and organizational skills with the proven ability to handle multiple initiatives and deliver results within tight timelines
Strong sense of curiosity, keen to desire to learn about new things
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, always changing environment
Experience in retail/e-commerce strongly preferred

Performance and Growth Expectations
 Our environment is not your average, hierarchical software studio: we emphasize accountability for outcomes, but autonomy in activities. Your work will be measured using our 360-degree system (a combination of peer and supervisor feedback) and will also be measured on the basis of client and user satisfaction. Your growth path is in your hands— you will have ongoing meetings with your mentor/manager to help determine your path, but your progress will be based on what you hope to achieve and how you choose to access the resources available to you.
 About Myplanet
 Myplanet is a software studio and certified BCorp. Based in Toronto with global studio presence, we're working with the world's most influential organizations to catalyze change across business silos.
 Drawing from a range of talents and perspectives, our team brings together data, systems thinking, and curiosity to build next generation experiences. We're tackling mission-critical digital challenges for businesses by taking the millions of moments of interaction they have with customers every day and surfacing key opportunities to engage and connect within those moments.
 We're building deep capabilities in data-driven design, AI implementation, and personalization, while forming strong partnerships with leaders in machine learning, hardware development, and IoT platforms. We're shaping the way organizations use technology to deliver context-aware, multi-interface experiences that equip them to meet their business goals.
 While headquartered in Toronto, Canada, we're a remote-first company of over 100 employees.
 Committed to an Inclusive Workplace
 We are committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible environment as we build a workforce that reflects the diversity of the community in which we live, including those with disabilities. We are dedicated to providing accommodations in all parts of the hiring process in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and the Ontario Human Rights Code. If you require any accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.
 Committed to Social and Environmental Stewardship
 Myplanet is committed to promoting and working towards a more socially and environmentally sustainable future. All employees are expected to make decisions and take actions in relation to their role and work that follow through on this commitment.

Title: Senior Data & Reporting Analyst
Description:
Info-Tech is one of the world’s fastest-growing IT research and advisory companies, proudly serving over 30,000 IT professionals. We are looking for a strong Senior Data and Reporting Analyst to join our Sales Operations team.
 Why join us?
 We are a growth focused, entrepreneurially spirited company that has consistently achieved YoY growth in our 23 years of operation and are especially proud of our double-digit growth in the midst of a global pandemic.
 When you join Info-Tech you get access to unlimited opportunities for professional growth and development in your field of expertise or areas you are interested in. We promote learning to help you be a better professional and we will also pay for some of those certifications.
 You will work in a highly collaborative team that functions efficiently even in a remote work setting. You will have flexibility to work from home, at the office (located in London / Toronto Ontario and quite fun), or in a hybrid mode.
 We offer great competitive salaries, benefits plan, and RRSP matching plans.
 Responsibilities:

 Subject matter expertise on data projects
 Identify, define, implement, and ensure adherence to technical strategy, policies, and standards
 Participate in evaluation and selection of software systems (Tableau, Power BI, etc)
 Work with vendors to assess products, understand features, and assist in maximizing ROI
 Establishing Audit Guidelines According to Organizational Standards.
 Expert understand how to get the accurate data when given requirements (proper fields, exception and business rules) and be able to mentor juniors on their understanding
 Define best practices for ETL tools and integration points to blend multiple data sets together
 Gather Data requirements from customers and develop solutions to meet those requirements
 Development of Dashboards and reporting for all departments
 Define Procedures for Resolving Issues Found During Audits
 Lead the evaluation and selection of software systems (Tableau, Power BI, etc)
 Work with vendors to assess products, understand features, and assist in maximizing ROI
 Define Required Audit Reports for Communicating Status of Systems and Issues Found
 Understand industry trends, emerging technologies, and how they apply to the organization
 Work with the Statistical and data governance groups as needed.


 Education

 Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent in Engineering, Computer Science, IT, Mathematics


 Knowledge and Experience:

 A minimum of 8+ years overall IT industry experience
 Experience presenting ideas, products, concept papers to varied audiences
 Leadership capabilities and proven ability to manage difficult stakeholders
 Experience with configuration management and automation tools
 Experience with Software development full lifecycle methodologies, patterns, frameworks, libraries, and tools
 Knowledge of one or more programming and scripting languages
 Experience with relational, graph and/or unstructured data technologies such as SQL Server, Azure SQL
 Experience in data movement and transformation technologies
 Working knowledge of visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau
 Salesforce experience is a bonus

 Info-Tech Research Group of companies is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion and does not discriminate on the basis of any legally protected status or characteristic including Minority/Female/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Disability/Veteran and are pleased to consider all qualified applicants. To that end, upon request, ITRG will ensure, to the extent possible, that accommodation be made available to applicants throughout the recruitment and hiring process.

Title: Junior Business Systems Analyst
Description:
Company Profile:

Maximus Canada is an industry leader in the provisioning of products and services to support the delivery of government services in North America and internationally. With operations across Canada and around the globe, Maximus provides innovative, practical and meaningful solutions to help government programs and services function more effectively and efficiently.
We are constantly assessing new technology, processes and methods of delivering services to the citizens of Canada. With our expertise in program information management, claims processing, contact centre services, document processing and information technology, we are positioned for significant growth.
Maximus Canada offers competitive market-based salaries, comprehensive employer-paid benefits and a defined-benefit pension plan or a Group RSP with employer-matching contributions, for eligible employees. Our people also get some great perks too, such as employee appreciation events throughout the year, along with a supportive results-oriented work environment.
Maximus Canada welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
Job Description:

Role Summary
The role of the Business System Analyst (BSA) is to support the Access Management team by assisting in managing access to various systems. The BSA will also conduct audits and investigate access to those various systems. Additionally, the BSA will help define business requirements for new processes and perform other functions in support of the department as assigned. The BSA must be hands-on in working with end users and is available for some weekend work.
Key Responsibilities
Ensures that system access is maintained in accordance with company policy
Supports all access management control activities across all infrastructure systems
Ensures access to systems is provisioned with the concept of least privilege
Evaluates existing access to ensure access levels remain commensurate with job responsibilities
Responsible for evaluating access management systems to show continued improvements of provision processes and operations
Improvement of processes through analysis, reviews and reporting as well as through automation, competence building, knowledge sharing and other organizational changes
Business analysis including working with business users and/or subject matter experts to produce requirements such as, gap analysis, cost benefit analysis, business process design, business rules and other analysis work products
Creates effective use cases and defines all the key actors, and systems in order to achieve the desired goals
Visually creates UML models using industry standards to visually capture the design of various systems
To be able to create effective test plans, test cases, and test scenarios using both manual and automated testing methodologies.
Education and Experience
1 – 3 years’ experience working as a Business Analyst
Diploma or a degree in Computing or Health Informatics, or an equivalent combination of education and experience
Preference will be given to candidates with Business Analyst or ITIL 4.0 certification or coursework
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Will be a problem solver who can also, plan, analyze, and resolve business challenges
Comfortable with peer and supervisory feedback
Ability to possess a desire to learn and adopt new processes for continual improvement and to keep abreast of new technologies
Proficient knowledge of MS Office, Outlook and ability to operate standard office equipment
Knowledge of on-line computer-based programs, services and system
Strong internal and external communication skills
Competency working within privacy and security of personal information
Keen attention to detail
Requirements Elicitation
Business Process Modeling
Use Cases UML Modeling
Testing & Quality Assurance
Preferred Skills:
Health Insurance or Pharmacy Industry
Business systems analysis and documentation, business process reengineering, and business case development and status reporting
Experience with the application landscape that supports the British Columbia Ministry of Health
Mainframe
Core Competencies
Results and Delivery
Defines appropriate goals
Works toward achieving goals
Articulates vision and steps for achievement
Technical
Maintains current understanding of technical processes and equipment
Uses technology to increase performance and productivity
Customer Focus
Understands the balance between our capabilities, the customer’s expectations, and the parameters in which we operate
Uses open, honest communication to develop relationships built on trust and mutual respect
Seeks to incorporate the experience of our diverse customers
Builds relationships through personal credibility, as opposed to formal authority
Disciplined Approach
Takes the time to properly plan
Data-driven and detail-focused
Seeks out opportunities for continuous improvement
Ethics
Honest
Accountable
Maintains confidentiality
Additional Information:

We will be accepting applications until 11:59pm (PST) on April 22, 2022.
This position may require you to attend Maximus Canada’s facilities, client sites, and / or other in-person events. Accordingly, any successful applicant may be required to provide provincially recognized proof of having a complete series of COVID-19 vaccines as a pre-condition to accepting an offer of employment with Maximus. Should an applicant fail to provide sufficient proof of vaccination as required, their offer of employment will be rescinded.
Please note that while all applications are appreciated, only those candidates selected for interview will be contacted.

Title: Sr Data & BI Analyst, CAN
Description:
At Edward Jones, we help clients achieve their serious, long-term financial goals by understanding their needs and implementing tailored solutions. To ensure a personal client experience, we have located our 15,000+ branch offices where our more than 7 million clients live and work.

In a typical branch office, a financial advisor meets with clients and receives branch office support, so they can focus on building deep relationships with clients. Headquarters associates in St. Louis, Tempe and Mississauga provide support and expertise to help U.S. and Canada branch teams deliver an ideal client experience. We continue to grow to meet the needs of long-term individual investors.
Within Edward Jones Canada, we are establishing a Data Analytics capability to service the analytical priorities of all functional areas within Canada. The primary purpose is to increase data acumen across Home Office and our branch teams, and incorporate analytics into our decision-making and prioritization. In this role, you will be responsible for developing and evolving best in class analytics in partnership with functional areas to determine business needs and recommended solutions.


Do you like thinking outside the box? Are you a big picture thinker? This is the kind of thinking Edward Jones Canada - Data Analytics needs to grow impact and enhance both client and branch experience.

Flexible Work Arrangements available - Onsite, Hybrid and Home based

Business Intelligence (BI):
Build specialized reporting packages, dashboards, and scorecards to inform senior leaders and functional areas.
Validate the quality and integrity of data included in all reporting; ability to test and maintain BI products developed while following governance procedures.
Storytelling & Communication:
Generate and incorporate insights into a cohesive story that clearly addresses business questions and influences decision making.
Effectively lead the creation and communication of tailored messages to influence senior leaders regarding analytic ideas, approach, key takeaways and actionable insights.
Ability to communicate technical information to non-technical audiences.
Business Understanding:
Maintain a strong understanding of division results and business drivers; understanding to analytic approach to influence key strategies and business performance.
Drive measurement, improvement and optimization strategies by connecting business activity to outcomes that will help achieve stated goals.
Business Consulting & Data Coaching:
Develop and manage business relationships with project team members and senior leaders across the organization.
Consult with business owners to understand the business problem; independently identify the appropriate analytic approach to solve the problem.
Provide mentorship and feedback to others on analytic approach and leverage systems thinking to connect work to other strategic initiatives.
Serve as a functional and technical data subject matter expert; educate senior and executive leaders across the firm on analytical concepts and best practices.
Analysis:
Understand and apply statistical concept; proactively identify opportunities with impact where analytics can inform the business.
Provide actionable insights to support business decisions and strategy by performing root cause, exploratory, sensitivity and scenario analysis, hypothesis testing, economic modeling and data visualization to identify trends for business needs
Actively participate in industry and trade data and analytic communities in order to bring fresh ideas to the organization.
Data:
Define business and data requirements for analytic efforts while building cross-functional relationships
Build and maintain an understanding of data flows, sources, and data transformations across multiple domains; extract, merge, cleanse and transform data from multiple sources as needed for analysis.
Apply critical thinking to pressure test and validate logic and outputs against known sources and understanding of business.
Proactively identify data quality issues and collaborate with other subject matter experts to identify solutions.
Operational Efficiency:
Document, monitor, and improve processes and controls related to areas of responsibility.
Proactively identify opportunities for efficiency with moderate to broad impact and visibility, propose solutions to relevant parties and drive implementation of solutions.
Bachelor's Degree required in relevant discipline, preferably in Business, Economics, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering or Analytics or relevant work experience.
5+ years of relevant work experience in Analytics, Business Intelligence, Data Analysis, Statistics
Canadian Securities Course (CSC) an asset
Strong analytical, critical and systems thinking required.
Apply innovation and creativity to improve work efficiency; effective in managing multiple priorities with strong organization and time management skills.
Experience with programming languages such as SQL & Python required. R would be an asset.
Proficiency interacting with various database and file storage systems (Oracle, Hadoop, NoSQL).
Understanding of statistical concepts and analytic techniques/types (descriptive, diagnostic, predictive, prescriptive).
Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, Access); advanced knowledge of VBAs, Macros
Experience with Data Visualization tools such as Tableau, PowerBi, or QlikView.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will help the organization to turn data into meaningful insights. The successful candidate with work in all Driving Force lines of business (Rentals, Sales, Leasing) as well as the management and operations teams to deliver high quality and accurate reports and dashboards. We are looking for a candidate who enjoys creating new ways of visualizing data, and gains satisfaction from empowering users to make better business and operational decisions.

Health & Safety

Read, understand, and comply with TDF Group safety policies, safe work practices and procedures and rules as well as any OHS legislation as it applies to your work
Actively participate in the company’s safety program
Take reasonable precautions to protect themselves and others around them at the workplace
All other safety responsibilities and duties as determined by the company’s safety program and OHS legislation

Data and Analytics

Create and maintain a large repository of reports/dashboards
Coordinate with internal and/or external stakeholders to capture requirements and provide input on optimal data insights
Use analytical techniques to inspect and sort data into a useful format and create reports and visualizations that help solve business problems
Work with business and finance teams to build our metrics to measure the impact of changes or to better surface information to decision-makers
Maintains current knowledge of industry and business trends through communication with professional organizations, suppliers, customers, competitors, and other informed individuals
Adopt, implement, and effectively evolve report automation standards
Performs other related duties as assigned

Qualifications
You take pride in your work and are passionate about having an impact. You face challenges head-on, are an excellent communicator and collaborator, and act with integrity. You’re good at analyzing data, but you are creative, and able to find the expected and the unexpected in data.


At least two years’ experience implementing data solutions using tools such as: MS SQL Server, AWS Quicksight, Tableau, Power BI (we use AWS Quicksight)
Logical analytical problem solver – able to spot trends and indicate the key drivers behind it. Support/develop comparative analysis and tests. Deliver actionable insights
Very strong comfortability in accessing large data sources, performing mining, extractions, and manipulations to uncover relevant data findings and big-picture stories
Basic understanding of relational and dimensional data models and Extract-Transform-Load (ETL) concepts, designs, and practices
Great communications skills and ability to ask good questions to fully determine the needs of the business
Highly organized, detail oriented, and able to thrive in a fast paced, changing environment
Knowledge on car rental/sales/leasing business is an asset
Experience programming in Python or R is an asset
AWS certification or experience working with AWS is an asset

We thank all candidates for their interest, however, only individuals selected for an interview will be contacted.
Please click on the APPLY NOW button to proceed with application.

Title: Senior Business Analyst (BA)
Description:
Senior Business Analyst
Become a primary liaison between our clients, our product engineering team, and the operations team in a high-growth technology firm based in Saint John, N.B. Lead the company's requirement definition & process documentation processes.

Focus Areas
Defining & Documenting Requirements: Equip the product engineering team with the specifications required to build exactly what the customer is looking for.
Be proficient at extracting, understanding, and articulating clients' requirements in a way that's easy for the product engineering team to act upon;
Work with the product engineering team to define what is required from the clients. Provide these requirements to the clients in a digestible format, then validate the response(s);
Work with clients to discover potential improvements to our products (new features, bug mitigation, etc.).
Defining & Documenting Processes: Lead the initiative toward having all internal and client-facing processes properly defined, documented, and organized.
Lead the creation of documentation for current and future state internal processes;
Identify potential gaps in our existing processes and provide solutions where applicable;
Identify potential gaps in our existing documentation and provide solutions where applicable;
Define configuration specifications and business analysis requirements;
Define and manage test cases for new products and changes to existing products;
Prepare integration plans for product deployments.


Qualifications
5+ years of experience in related positions.
Willingness & ability to work with clients, including traveling to their offices as needed. Travel expenses would be covered by Four Eyes.
Degree or diploma in Business, Computer Science, Engineering or a related field of study.
Highly technical & analytical, experienced with implementing complex software solutions.
Quantitative skills; ability to use hard data and metrics to back up assumptions and develop thoughtful & actionable business cases.
Demonstrated ability to perform with significant responsibility in a dynamic environment where decisions are made rapidly.
Experience working with Data-driven Applications in a Cloud environment.
Experience working with clients and developers to define, scope and prioritize product requirements.
Ability to lead junior analysts and support them with their deliverables
Four Eyes Financial is a Regulatory Technology (RegTech) company based in Saint John, NB. We are at the forefront of change in how Wealth firms think about their data and their compliance functions. Our proprietary Intelligent Compliance Platform, with multiple compliance solutions, streamlines interactions between Advisors, Clients, and Head Office.
We have a diverse team of bright and high-performing people and we are in growth mode. You'd fit in well if you thrive in a fast-paced environment, have a thirst for learning, enjoy improving systems and processes, and focus on excellence in everything you do.
Some of our great benefits include:
Health & Dental Benefits
RRSP matching program
Competitive salary
Generous vacation days
Hybrid work options
And more!
Are you ready to accelerate your career? If you have a pioneering spirit, a passion for results, seek meaningful work and want to make an impact on a changing industry, come join us!

Title: Statistical Analyst
Description:
Job Summary

To ensure compliance to Regulatory (Statistical) reporting requirements, responsibility for driving change management related to Statistical Reporting including analyze and interpret a wide variety of collected information according to established statistical methods, to ensure management have access to regular information.

Job Qualifications

Required:
• Bachelors Degree and 3 or more years of experience in the Statistical Analysis area

OR
High School Diploma or Equivalent and 5 or more years of experience in the Statistical Analysis area

Preferred:
• Insurance industry knowledge
3 or more years of experience in Personal Auto Statistical Reporting
Advanced Microsoft Office skills
Experience gathering and interpreting complex data sets
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Job Accountabilities - Key Accountabilities
• Collaborate closely with IT and Finance team develop Statistical Reporting process for Personal Auto.
Create coding requirements for new products and programs.
Comply with regulation, reporting schedules and changes in reporting requirements.
Develop processes that streamline the flow of work and increase quality.
Provide regular information to management regarding filings and reports.
Monitor effectiveness and makes changes as necessary.
Research data anomalies and develop recommendations to solve data problems.
Possess and apply a comprehensive knowledge of particular field of specialization to the completion complex assignments.

Business Accountabilities
• Undertake investigations and inspections of data, under guidance and in accordance with established procedure to quantify risks associated with an assigned area of the business or product category.
Collate data and assist actuarial colleagues to conduct statistical analysis using standard statistical techniques, actuarial methods and formats and make recommendations in order to support the preparation of reports.
Undertake the analysis of data using standard office systems in support of actuarial analyses and studies assessing risk and evaluating performance for an assigned area of the business.
Participate in the evaluation and review of new/proposed processes and systems to support the implementation of upgraded systems.
Act as the subject matter expert in business change and provide technical guidance and recommendations relating to Statistical reporting data and data architecture in order to support decision-making capabilities.
Competencies
Collaborate Together
Develop & Grow
Puts Customers First
Fuel Innovation
Technical Competency 1
Technical Competency 2
Motivational fit
Provide Clear Direction
Make it Happen
A future with Zurich
Now is the time to move forward and make a difference. At Zurich, we want you to share your unique perspectives, experiences and ideas so we can grow and drive sustainable change together. As part of a leading global organization, Zurich North America has over 148 years of experience managing risk and supporting resilience. We are a leading provider of commercial property-casualty insurance solutions and a wide range of risk management products and services for businesses and individuals. Today, we serve more than 25 industries, from agriculture to technology and insure 90% of the Fortune 500®. Our growth strategy is not limited to our business. As an employer, Zurich strives to provide ongoing career development opportunities and foster an environment where voices are diverse, behaviors are inclusive, actions drive equity, and our people feel a sense of belonging. Be a part of the next evolution of the insurance industry. Join us in building a brighter future for our people, our customers and the communities we serve.
As a global company, Zurich recognizes the diversity of our workforce as an asset. We recruit talented people from a variety of backgrounds with unique perspectives that are truly welcome here. Taken together, diversity and inclusion bring us closer to our common goal: exceeding our customers’ expectations. Zurich is committed to providing a diverse, inclusive and barrier-free environment resulting in an accessible organization for employees, customers, and other parties who interact with, or on behalf of, Zurich. We strive to achieve a workplace free of discrimination of all forms, including discrimination on the basis of physical or mental disability, or medical condition. If you are interested in a job opportunity, please advise if you require an accommodation, so we can work with you to provide a more accessible process.
Zurich does not accept unsolicited resumes from search firms or employment agencies. Any unsolicited resume will become the property of Zurich Canadian Holdings Limited. If you are a preferred vendor, please use our Recruiting Agency Portal for resume submission.

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
Business Analyst
Take a central role
The Bank of Canada has a vision to be “a leading central bank—dynamic, engaged and trusted—committed to a better Canada.” No other employer in the country offers you the unique opportunity to work at the very center of Canada’s economy, in a diverse and inclusive organization with significant impact on the economic and financial well-being of all Canadians. You will be challenged, energized and motivated to excel in an environment where we are reinventing central banking, renewing ways of doing business and reinforcing a culture of innovation.
Find out more about the next steps in our Recruitment process.
What you will do
Under the leadership of the Director, Organizational Effectiveness (OE), you are part of a team of internal consultants/analysts devoted to the performance-based culture of the Corporate Services (CS) Department. The group works in a context of moderate to high complexity because of the multiple disciplines of its client groups: Information, Data and Analytics Services (IDAS), Corporate Security Services (CSS), and Facilities Services (FS), the multiple areas of specialization, and a wide range of internal and external stakeholders.
You are responsible for the development of new or improved departmental processes and/or procedures to ensure operational objectives and standards in service delivery are met. You also support the Analyst, Business Environment Support, with communications, corporate work environment initiatives/projects; liaise with and assist business line functional leads; conduct basic research and provide analytic and project management support.
Specifically, you will:
develop and maintain sound management tools to enable the department and its business lines to better manage and deliver on core operations and change agendas
identify cross-business-line opportunities and work with partners to leverage these opportunities
investigate trends and irregularities, analyze business issues to identify causes, and recommend changes to departmental and Strategy and Business Management processes or systems to enhance service delivery or minimize operational risk
deliver analytics, logistics and operational support to the Organizational Effectiveness business line
analyze, develop, recommend and implement changes to departmental processes and/or procedures (e.g., improving departmental onboarding and offboarding process, various tracking templates)
What you need to succeed
As an analyst, you communicate effectively with a wide variety of audiences by adapting your language to the audience, by clarifying complex information, and by conveying sensitive information in an appropriate manner. You can synthesize information and analyze key issues or challenges. You have experience in defining an issue, seeking relevant information, identifying and assessing alternative solutions and providing useful recommendations. You recognize core issues, rather than symptom issues, and develop and maintain a network of effective relationships with clients.
You take initiative and are creative. You have a flexible approach to dealing with unstructured or ill-defined problems and the ability to develop positive working relationships by supporting team decisions, addressing conflicts, and promoting co-operation and partnerships. You have proven ability to work both collaboratively and independently.
Nice-to-have
Knowledge of LEAN and PROSCI change management methodology
Experience with data visualization and deck preparation
Advanced Excel skills
Knowledge of Power BI
Your education and experience
The position requires bachelor’s degree in business administration, communications or other related field and two years of related and relevant work experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered.
What you need to know
Language requirement: English and French essential (bilingual) with a minimum starting level of functional (level 4) in second official language. Training may be provided to help reach the required level of fully functional (level 5) in second official language.
Priority will be given to Canadian citizens and permanent residents
Security level required: Be eligible to obtain Reliability
Please save a copy of the job poster. Once the closing date has passed, it will no longer be available.
In response to the COVID-19 pandemic and further to public health guidelines, preventative measures are being taken to ensure health and safety during the recruitment process. All interviews are conducted virtually.
The official title for this position is “Consultant, Strategy & Business Mngt”
Hybrid Work Model
The Bank is moving towards a hybrid working model which allows employees to telework up to 50 percent of the time, balanced over a two-week period. Relocation assistance may be offered by the Bank for terms greater than 2 years.
Vaccination Policy
In response to the COVID-19 pandemic that was declared by the World Health Organization, the mandates issued by the federal government, and the direction provided by public health authorities, the Bank of Canada requires all new employees to be fully vaccinated prior to their start date.
Selected candidates will be asked to provide proof of vaccination status at the reference stage. Candidates who are unable to be vaccinated against COVID-19 and require an accommodation for a legitimate medical, religious or other human rights-based grounds will follow a seperate process.
Covid-19 Authorized Vaccines in Canada
We wish to thank all applicants for their interest and effort in applying for this position. Only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.
What you can expect from us
This is a great opportunity to join a leading organization and be part of a high-performing team. We offer a competitive compensation and benefits package designed to meet your needs at every stage of your life and career. For more information on key benefits please visit A great deal to consider.
Salaries are based on qualifications and experience and typically range from $72,695 to $85,520 (job grade 15)
Depending on performance, you may be eligible for performance pay for successfully meeting (5 to 7% of your base salary) or for exceeding expectations (10% of your base salary). Exceptional performers who far exceed expectations may be eligible for higher performance pay.
Flexible and comprehensive benefits so you can choose the level of health and dental coverage that meets your needs
Extra vacation days (up to five each year) that you can purchase to add to your vacation entitlement
Option to join the indexed, defined-benefit pension plan after 24 consecutive months of service #LI-POST

Title: Data Technical Analyst
Description:
Position Description:
CGI has an immediate need for Sr Data Technical Analyst / Developer to join our life sciences practice area. This is an exciting full-time opportunity to work in a fast-paced team environment supporting one of the largest leaders in the pharmaceutical industry. We take an innovative approach to supporting our client, working side-by-side in an agile environment using emerging technologies.
As an Sr Data Technical Analyst / Developer, you will act as a key participant in data analysis, data development, execution, defect tracking, and reporting. The candidate must have demonstrated experience in data qualtiy development and familiarity with test management, an understanding of best practices, SDLC Scrum and Agile methodologies, as well as strong problem-solving abilities and leadership skills.

Responsibilities Include:
Collaborate with CGI cross-functional teams to analyse, design, and detail the technical aspects and feasibility of proposed solutionsInteracting with the IT and Business Teams by actively participating in requirement/design reviews, providing input on completeness of functional & technical requirements, design elements and schedulesStrong understanding or hands-on experience with data quality, data profiling, data structures, data classification and metadata
Experience in multiple areas of implementations including Data Profiling,data migration, validation, reject processing and pre-landing processingHands-On experience in Informatica, Cognos, and Tibco versions with development skills in ETLHands-On experience working with SQL Oracle databasesCollaborates with the Solution Architect to devise and implement technical solutionsFormulates and defines scope and objectives pertaining to the technical solutionAnalyzes and revises solution or data quality logic based on current environment or technology challenges.
Coordinates with the on-shore/near-shore/off-shore developers for both enhancements and fixing defectsWorks with the Business Analyst to translate business requirements to actionable technical requirementsCoordinates with the Project Manager to schedule releases, set timing expectations, and communicate statusCreates or modifies code to resolve problems considering computer equipment (on-premise or cloud) capacity and limitations, operating time, and form of desired resultsPrepares technical deliverables and/or provides input to other deliverables related to the IT serviceMonitoring the completion of tasks within time and cost constraints and ensuring that technical and functional objectives are metWorks with the Test Lead to ensure technology and data are relevant for testing in test environments.

Title: Intermediate Business Analyst
Description:
The Business Analyst is responsible for contributing to all aspects of solution engineering including problem definition, requirements elicitation, research, solution identification and selection, and implementation.
The BA will work with the Business, Architecture, and Development teams to translate business requirements into detailed processes and solutions. The BA will provide guidance and recommendations in a collaborative effort with internal departments to address key information gaps and ensure delivery of a solution that best meets the customer’s needs.
A primary objective for the BA is to help structure CLEARVIEW to not only meet and exceed the needs of our customers today, but also to be an innovative product that will continue to evolve to meet the needs of existing and future customers tomorrow. The BA will be responsible for driving key enhancements for CLEARVIEW and its future innovation.
What will your day look like?
Duties and tasks include, but are not limited to:
Customer Engagement
Forging strong customer relationships to build trust and encourage collaboration
Conducting workshops and interviews to discover information related to process and/or requirements
Conducting requirements review and prioritization sessions to validate that the captured requirements are clear and correct, and are prioritized
Documenting and disseminating the purpose of customer requirements and processes
Documenting, presenting, reviewing captured As-Is and To-Be processes and associated information
Market Research and Analysis
Conducting gap analysis with targeted competitors and their key modules for various markets
Identifying opportunities to expand into other quick service industries (not just QSR)
Investigating demand for other languages, functionality to position CLEARVIEW in new markets
Providing assessments and recommendations of Product Innovation for discussion and decision
Product Innovation
Exploring new and creative ways to lead customers into the future; proactively meeting the needs that will arise in their business (whether they know it or not)
Helping develop the roadmap for CLEARVIEW, with focus on 3-5 years in the future
Assess the value of current CLEARVIEW functionality and provide feedback on adding/removing/enhancing functions and features
Providing an attractive product that will attract and retain customers
Working closely with internal teams to determine overall product direction and innovation map
Discussing how to best leverage new technologies (build/buy/integrate) with the Product Engineering team
Collaborating with technical teams
Communicating customer needs and strategies to the Architecture team
Helping to identify solutions within CLEARVIEW that meet the customer’s needs while also fitting into the overall product strategy
Consulting with Development teams, advising and answering questions as they build and refine a solution
Collaboration with business teams
Collaborating and sharing best practices
Articulating ideas and viewpoints to senior management, peers and others
Attending interdepartmental meetings as needed to provide insight on process improvement and opportunities for increased efficiency
Qualifications
You should be:
100% product and process focused, passionate about designing a quality product that meets both business and technical needs
An enthusiastic self-starter who learns quickly and proactively approaches tasks and assignments with a focus on problem-solving and data analysis
An excellent communicator (written and oral), who can effectively present complex information in a clear and understandable fashion
Persuasive, able to establish rapport, quickly build trust and gain buy-in internally and externally
And have:
A solid understanding of the software delivery lifecycle (SLDC)
Experience with requirements elicitation through workshop facilitation and interviews
Understanding of Agile methodologies such as Scrum and KanBan
Ability to effectively prepare and maintain the following documents / tools:
Functional and Non-Functional Requirement Definition
Use Cases
User Stories
Business Processes, including an understanding of BPMN
Process Flow Analysis
Product Architecture and Design Best Practices
Entity Relationship Diagrams/Data Models
Detailed Functional Designs
Business Cases
Request for Proposals/Information
Executive Summaries
The ability to successfully manage multiple tasks and competing priorities at any given point
Experience working on projects of various sizes and scopes, as well as handling day-to-day operational requests from the business
Outstanding interpersonal skills, with emphasis on customer focus, teamwork, and relationship-building
A proven track record of understanding and negotiating the needs and expectations of multiple stakeholders (internal/external) to achieve desired results
Other requirements:
Some flexibility of working hours as required based on business and departmental needs
Occasional travel may be required
Minimal physical demands, with most time spent sitting/standing in an office environment; manual dexterity required for computer usage
Significant visual and mental concentration

Title: GIS and EQuIS Analyst
Description:
VERSATILITY. EXPERTISE.
With these two words, Vertex makes the promise that we will always be versatile in developing solutions to our clients’ unique needs and that we will always demonstrate expertise in our designated fields.
Since 1962, Vertex has been a leading North American provider of environmental services. With over 50 years of expertise, Vertex helps clients achieve their development goals through our versatile suite of services. From the initial site selection, consultation and regulatory approval, through the construction, operation and maintenance phases, to conclusion and environmental cleanup, Vertex offers a diverse range of services throughout the life cycle of our clients’ projects.
*OVERVIEW*
Vertex is currently accepting applications for full time permanent GIS and EQuIS Analyst in Victoria, British Columbia. The successful candidate must be a critical thinker with strong GIS and spatial database skills and a keen eye for detail. Experience in EQuIS is an integral component of this role.
*CANDIDATE QUALIFICATIONS*

Diploma or higher in Geography, Environmental Science, Natural Resource Management, or another applicable field
Minimum three (3) years industry experience preferred
Strong experience in GIS software (ESRI products)
Working Knowledge of EQuIS database software, including:
Transcribe and prepare data for entry
Review data for deficiencies
Proficient knowledge of Microsoft Excel and VBA programming
Implement VBA scripts for analytical table generation and formatting
Working knowledge of and ability to interpret environmental regulations, guidelines, and standards
Strong command of the English language including, but not limited, to excellent writing, grammar, and spelling
Demonstrated self-motivation, communication and decision-making skills
Ability to work independently and in a team
Previous experience in the consulting, oil and gas, or environment industries is an asset
RESPONSIBILITIES*
Manage spatial databases and integration of GIS and EQuIS software
Keep up to date on industry guidelines
Create high-quality content that conveys technical concepts
Compile, manage and analyze data that is collected by field personnel using EQuIS and other database programs

LOCATION
This position will be based out of Victoria, British Columbia.
ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

Compensation is commensurate with education and experience
The position is intended to be an office position

With a track record of success, Vertex provides a fast-paced environment where people thrive. We recognize that each member brings a valuable skill-set to the Vertex team and we make health, safety and community well-being a priority by supporting numerous endeavors at each of our locations across North America.At Vertex, we value teamwork through collaboration and provide support across the entire organization. If you think you have what it takes to play for the Vertex team, please apply.
*We would like to thank all applicants for their interest in this position, however only those selected for interviews will be contacted*
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Title: Data Analyst Instructor
Description:
North America Vocational Education Group(NAVEG) is a professional training and education consultant group headquartered in Vancouver, BC, Canada. The group has four core subsidiaries including “WEDO EDUCATION”, “WEDO PLANNING”, “THE WILLWORK”, and “AzureHR”.Our service includes K-12 grade after-school tutoring, university admissions planning, career, vocational training of international technical talents, and international employment planning.
Job Description:

Plan, organize, and prepare classes, including developing detailed lesson plans for Database, PowerBI, VBA, Access, Cloud, Python, etc.
Delivering instruction that meets module and program objectives as set out in the curriculum
Develop learning/ instructional materials and curricula that support the learning objectives and planned activities.
Prepare, administer, and grade assignments and exams in a timely manner to inform students about their progress.
Prepare feedback on students' projects and code with students on project bases.
Prepare and submit to the Education Coordinator all relevant data concerning students on a regular basis.
Assist in the provision of daily supervision of students as required or assigned.
Supporting the administrative functions of the college to enhance the student experience
Demonstrate flexibility in meeting the college’s and students’ changing requirements as conditions may require overtime.
Participate in the assessment, implementation, and evaluation of the college’s quality improvement procedures as required.
Monitoring and reviewing students during practicum and/or clinical placements, as the program requires
Perform other duties as assigned by the Management Team.

Qualifications:

Degree or diploma from a recognized University or College in a relevant discipline.
3 years of practical, real-world experience as Data Analysts, Data Scientists, or similar in Top 100 Tech companies in North America.
A credential in adult education or in progress from an accredited post-secondary institution is an asset.
Current membership/license with relevant regulatory body preferred.
Satisfy specific position qualifications as prescribed in program design and program approval for the instruction of the courses.

Skills and Abilities:

Has expertise in Google Sheets and/or Excel, and SQL, and has expertise in using Python for data wrangling, exploratory data analysis, predictive modeling, statistics, supervised machine learning, and data visualization.
Has practical knowledge of working with big data, performing customer segmentation, and using cloud services
Advanced oral and written communication skills, including presentation and group facilitation both in English and Mandarin.
Ability to motivate and inspire students.
Ability to work cooperatively with other instructors and staff.
Time-management and punctuality.

Job Type: Part-time
Education:

Bachelor's Degree (required)

Experience:

Data Analysts, Data Scientists: 3 years (required)

Language:

Mandarin (required)

Title: BI Developer
Description:
Our telecom client, Bell Canada, is looking for a creative and energetic candidate to join the Business Intelligence Team in areas of data analysis and reporting. The ideal candidate would have a minimum of 4 years experience in BI development.
Key Responsibilities and Job Duties: 

Extract data and manipulate data to be used in presentable reports and analytical tools
Ensure accuracy & integrity of data & applications through analysis, coding, writing clear documentation & problem resolution
Architect data models that are used in business reporting, analytics, business performance, automation, artificial intelligence and machine learning
Analyze & translate functional specifications & change requests into technical specifications.
Shape stories using data and analytics
Develop, test & implement program logic
Translate business needs into end user applications

Key Competencies and Experience: 

ETL Tools and Processes (Such as SAS, SSIS, Informatica, etc.)
Understanding of multi-tier data warehouse lifecycle
Must be proficient in MS PowerPoint and have advanced skills in MS Excel
Experience using SQL
Experience creating performance dashboards and scorecard using business intelligence dashboard (i.e. Cognos, MicroStrategy, Tableau or MS Excel)
Must be proficient in Python
Telecom experience is a strong asset
Comfortable in working in a virtual environment (i.e. conference calls)
Exceptional writing and communication skills
Highly analytical and curious
Demonstrated problem solving skills
Ability to influence internal and external teams
Confident and demonstrate strong leadership
Ability to adapt to a fast paced environment with high tolerance to change management
Results oriented
Self motivated, autonomous
Bilingualism is an asset (English and French)
