The successful candidate will have excellent interpersonal, communication and organizational skills, excellent consensus building, guiding/education and diplomacy skills.
Preferred Qualifications:
Advanced degree, diploma or training in health leadership, clinical informatics or health information management preferred. Management and or instructor experience is an asset. Experience defining, implementing and supporting workload measurement and strong analytical and problem solving skills also an asset. Commitment to meet deadlines and produce high quality deliverables and the ability to provide leadership and work as a team desired.

Title: Senior Reporting Analyst - Business Enablement - Edmonton or Calgary
Description:
Let’s impact lives for the better!
Alberta Blue Cross® is Alberta based, not-for-profit and dedicated to delivering exceptional customer experience and community leadership. We’re committed to providing the best health coverage to over 1.8 million members and take an active role in promoting the wellness of all Albertans. We believe in what we do—and place trust in our employees to deliver our vision.
Working at Alberta Blue Cross® means having a career where you’ll be recognized for your contributions. We value diversity, encourage our employees to maintain a healthy work-life balance and provide opportunities for training and career growth.
OVERVIEW:
Alberta Blue Cross® has an immediate opening for a Senior Reporting Analyst to join our team. Reporting to the Manager, Business Enablement, the successful candidate will deliver insights to business leaders and customers using marketing, sales, and product information. You will also play a key role in developing automation and creating report visuals. The ideal candidate has a great attitude, proven track record for delivering excellent reporting results, and can quickly build expertise and relationships in a constantly shifting business environment. This position is considered hybrid role where you are able to split your time working from home and in office.
WHAT YOU WILL DO:
Use your exceptional interpersonal skills, your ever-growing business knowledge, and your technical agility to deliver insights to our clients and advisors.
Work closely with our business leaders, customers, sales team, and product partners to find information needed, manage tasks and timelines to deliver results.
Automate manual tasks using your technical agility.
Design, develop, validate and deliver scheduled and ad hoc reports for our group clients and advisors.
Make recommendations and improvements to the design and delivery of reports, analytics practices, and data management.
Create excellent working relationships with our stakeholders.
WHAT YOU WILL HAVE:
An undergraduate degree/Diploma or certification in Business, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or equivalent field is preferred.

You will have 3-5 years experience in analyzing data, data mining and producing reports using visualization tools.
Proficiency in Oracle SQL, Tableau and MicroStrategy or any other visualization tools.
Use your exceptional interpersonal skills, your ever-growing business knowledge, and your technical agility to deliver insights to our clients and advisors.
Work closely with our business leaders, customers, sales team, and product partners to find information needed, manage tasks and timelines to deliver results.
Automate manual tasks using your technical agility.
Design, develop, validate and deliver scheduled and ad hoc reports for our group clients and advisors.
Make recommendations and improvements to the design and delivery of reports, analytics practices, and data management.
Create excellent working relationships with our stakeholders.
Alberta Blue Cross® is an inclusive employer committed to a workplace that reflects the diversity of the communities we serve. We empower and are advocates for our employees by welcoming, respecting and valuing their unique perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences.

We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the opportunity to work in an innovative, high-energy team-focused environment. This position will remain open until a suitable candidate is selected. If you have the qualifications we are looking for, apply online at careers.ab.bluecross.ca
COVID-19 Vaccination Notice: Alberta Blue Cross has a COVID-19 Vaccination Policy that applies to all of its employees. As a condition of employment, successful job applicants will be asked to confirm their COVID-19 vaccination status and may be required to provide proof of a valid negative COVID-19 test or a valid exemption pursuant to applicable human rights law if not fully vaccinated.

Title: Operations Support Analyst (Administration) Full-Time
Description:
Caring for Life. Make a difference. Be the difference.
Calea is Canada’s leader in the provision of products and services that safely and reliably support community-based infusion therapy, advanced wound care, and the need for general medical supplies.
We are a community partner and licensed Pharmacy, providing expert solutions and support resources to healthcare professionals, hospitals, patients and their caregivers, and home care programs across the country. Calea supports patient care provided by several of Ontario’s largest Local Health Integration Networks’ (LHINs) Home and Community Care services. Our customers also include Regional Health Authorities.
Our people, experience, systems, and facilities make us a trusted partner in delivering innovative, cost-effective, patient-focused care that preserves independence and enhances quality of life. With over 280 employees and pharmacy locations in four provinces, Calea is committed to continually advancing the delivery of safe, high-quality community care.
If you are looking to work for a growing, global corporation that is focused on making meaningful improvements in the safety, affordability, and availability of the care medical professionals provide to their patients, then you should consider Calea & Fresenius Kabi Canada. We are an employer that works to build great leaders, teams and businesses. We know our employees are key to everything we accomplish, so we give them the freedom and resources to reach their potential and the opportunity to work with managers who care about their professional development.
We are currently seeking a full-time Operations Support Analyst to join our team in Mississauga.
POSITION SUMMARY
Responsible for assistance and support in coordinating administrative duties and other projects within the Calea Operations department for the Mississauga and Hamilton facilities. The position supports the Operations department in achieving its objectives and in providing superior customer service by working closely with the Operations management team.
Assist in maintaining Time and Attendance for the Operations department.
Assist with payroll submissions
Coordinate Staff Schedules and post
Maintain communication board, as required
Provides support in the coordination of departmental events
Provides support in maintenance of non-inventory supplies
Coordinates projects as assigned by the Manager
Assists in the preparation of documents, communications, and training schedules.
Maintain up-to-date training designated for this position
Perform data analysis
Special projects as assigned
Other duties as assigned
QUALIFICATIONS
Post secondary diploma in a related field/administration preferred
2-3 years experience in related administrative support role
Intermediate computer skills in MS Office (Word & Excel)
Knowledge/experience with SAP an asset
Excellent customer service skills and the ability to collaborate with all levels internally and externally
Self-motivated and able to work with minimal supervision
Strong attention to detail with the ability to multi-task and handle fluctuating workloads
Excellent organizational and problem-solving skills
Excellent continuous improvement skills
Proven ability to adhere to standards & procedures and maintain confidentiality
Calea is responsible for ensuring we can provide critical and lifesaving medical products and services to vulnerable members of our communities. We are committed to fostering a caring culture, a safe environment, and a healthy workplace for all employees. Everyone must follow safe work practices and comply with our health and safety policies, vaccination policy and Covid-19 protocols.
The company is committed to meeting the accessibility needs of people with disabilities. Calea is dedicated to breaking down barriers to accessibility, preventing new barriers from arising and to meet the accessibility requirements prescribed by the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). If you require accommodation at any time please contact us.

Title: Inventory Analyst
Description:
Inventory Analyst
Primary Functions
Analyse customer demand and inventory balances & communicate them to planning scheduler
Analyse daily inventory transactions and fix all transactions errors.
Maintains and performs cycle counts and plant inventories as required.
Perform daily inventory counts of WIP, stampings, and gp12 areas, and provide count to master scheduler.
Actively participates in the APQP process on new & existing products for the materials department (CN implementation / GPMS)
Ensure timely delivery of month end reports
Ensure customer demand is met through monitoring schedule attainment and releasing all vendors/subcontractors for required material
Maintain integrity of key business activities inside IATF
Continuous improvement
Key Responsibilities
Establish inventory locations and maintain inventory levels to cover production schedules at all times
Monitor inventory at supplier and yield analysis and initiate charge backs of yield variances > 2.00%
Reconcile month-end inventory balances to physical counts at subcontractors and in plant, make adjustments and analyze root causes for variances
Performing document control and inventory analysis functions of physical inventory
Assisting production department with lot tracking reporting
Analyze customer demand and inventory balances & communicate them to planning scheduler to help make proper production schedule,
Analyze all vendor / sub contractor inventory variances, root causes, and correct.
Analyze inventory balances and material availability for production and compare to the production schedule
Coordinate engineering changes with production planning, customer service and engineering department to ensure timely part supply and prevent obsolescence
Responsible for implementation of corrective action if results in area of delivery performance, create and transmit once a week releases to vendor through ERP system (MRP)
Ensure that vendor releases are monitored and releases are driven by Pullmatic’s production schedule and shipments of incoming material and parts/components are on time
Assist in planning and ordering supplier releases - ensuring delivery and specification
Analysing data to look for trends and shifts in customer releases and plan to ensure appropriate supply of product from entire supply chain.
Track and manage supplier performance on an ongoing basis.
Investigate all transaction errors; perform root cause analysis, and corrective actions.
Report all supplier receiving discrepancies to supplier and purchasing department.
Key Qualifications/Requirements
Minimum completion of post secondary education in material management
Minimum of 3 years experience in ERP/purchasing in an automotive or related manufacturing environment
APICs certification or working toward certification in CPIM an asset
Computer literate: ERP systems (cmi knowledge preferred), Microsoft Office & MS outlook
Excellent English language communication skills (both verbal & written)
Excellent documentation & organizational skills
Strong leadership and organizational skills within a team environment
Working knowledge of IATF16949 & ISO14001 systems
WHMIS
Additional Information
Accommodations for disabilities in relation to the job selection process are available upon request.
Awareness. Unity. Empowerment.
At Magna, we believe that a diverse workforce is critical to our success. That’s why we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We hire on the basis of experience and qualifications, and in consideration of job requirements, regardless of, in particular, color, ancestry, religion, gender, origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or gender identity. Magna takes the privacy of your personal information seriously. We discourage you from sending applications via email to comply with GDPR requirements and your local Data Privacy Law.

Title: Business Systems Analyst
Description:
NAIT is proud to be named one of Alberta’s Top Employers for 10 consecutive years. We are also a proud partner of the Canadian Centre for Diversity and Inclusion and Pride at Work Canada. Learn more about NAIT’s commitment to equity, diversity and inclusion at nait.ca/edi. NAIT has adopted our first Equity, Diversity and Inclusion Strategy to serve and empower NAIT communities. We are committed to fostering an environment where all people feel safe, valued and included. Our commitment is rooted in our promises and values – the starting point of our journey to create meaningful change.
Reporting to the Manager, Business Analytics and Systems Support, the Business Systems Analyst is a business solution professional responsible for supporting all functions under Facilities Management and Development (FMD) by converting simple and complex business requirements into processes, procedures, information and technology solutions. The position is responsible for assessing and evaluating IT-related business requirements from all sections in FMD and translating those requirements into system solutions, processes, and methodology to ensure efficient delivery of essential services at NAIT. The Business Systems Analyst combines in-depth analysis, requirements gathering and evaluation, assessment skills, project management skills, and strong communication skills, with an understanding of FMD’ operations to be able to design, implement, and deploy integrated leading-edge business and information technology solutions. The position supports FMD with information, reports, implementation of new systems, upgrading of existing systems, and other services as required. Moreover, one of FMD’s goals is becoming a data-driven business unit where employees can apply their knowledge, draw insights, make the best possible decisions, and to provide executive with effective presentation of data to support strategic decision-making. This role will support the adaptation, optimization, and evolution of FMD business processes. This role will help in ensuring that FMD has timely access to high-quality information and analysis required for strategic planning, performance tracking, reporting, and support data-driven decisions to improve performance.

Key Responsibilities:
Gather, assess and evaluate business requirements from FMD business units and translating those requirements into business and system solutions. Solutions may take the form of recommendations for the implementation of a new system, process change, design specifications for reports or system changes, requests for system enhancement, expanded use of existing functionality, or custom data queries, reports, and analysis.
Utilize a variety of tools to execute and/or design simple and complex queries and reports to produce essential data from various FMD systems and tools such as Power BI, SharePoint, AiM systems (AiM Operations & Maintenance, AiM Capital Planning and Project Management, AiM Space Management, AiM ReADY Request, and AiM Go), Bonfire, ServiceNow, PeopleSoft, and other FMD systems as required.
Act as project lead for FMD in IT-related projects by coordinating, defining requirements, identifying project milestones, phases, monitoring, and other elements of a project. Support projects from conception to implementation and address gaps and issues that may impact timelines and quality.
Work closely with FMD units to report problems, design new systems, recommend enhancement of existing systems, business intelligence, and complete data integrations.
Develop and execute test plans and test scenarios to test new systems, modifications, enhancements, customizations, product upgrades, and new functionality.
Develop and deliver end-user training on FMD business processes. Develop and maintain end-user process documentation, standard operating procedures, processes and other procedures related to the operation and use of FMD systems.
Coordinate and evaluate IT-related project requests from various FMD units.
Maintain FMD website and provide expertise for FMD systems.
Skills & Abilities:
Ability to effectively collaborate with various stakeholders to assess and develop business requirements and solutions.
Ability to analyze and troubleshoot complex problems and make sound decisions.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Project management skills
Extensive knowledge and experience with various systems and tools such as Power BI, AiM (AiM Operations & Maintenance, AiM Capital Planning and Project Management, AiM Space Management, AiM ReADY Request, and AiM Go) SharePoint, Bonfire, ServiceNow, PeopleSoft, and BACnet Protocols.
Extensive knowledge in the areas of descriptive, diagnostic, predictive, and prescriptive analytics.
Ability to collect, analyze and interpret data and statistics using quantitative and qualitative methods.
Strong interpersonal and influencing skills
Strong oral and written communications skills
Qualifications:
Degree or Diploma in Computer Science, Information Technology or related discipline. Equivalencies may be considered.
Academic Certification in Business Analysis program is strongly preferred.
At least five years of direct related experience as a Business Systems Analyst
Experience in the Facilities Management industry is a strong asset.
Extensive knowledge of business analytics, business intelligence and data analytics solutions are preferred.
Extensive experience in various AssetWorks AiM systems is an asset.
Knowledge of acts, legislation, issues, practices and management of privacy and security of data for reporting and analytics is an asset.
Remuneration: $2,635.92 - $3,492.03 bi-weekly, plus a comprehensive benefits package
Thank you for your application however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

NOTE: With our return to campus Distributed Work Model, this position has the option to work from home for a maximum of 3 days per week, dependent upon business requirements.

It is recommended that applicants who have obtained educational credentials from outside of Canada and have not had them previously assessed, obtain an evaluation of their credentials from World Education Services or the International Qualifications Assessment Service (IQAS) - http://work.alberta.ca/immigration/international-qualifications-assessment-service.html

PLEASE NOTE: Alberta’s post-secondary institutions are working together and taking a coordinated approach to ensure safety on our campuses for students, staff, contractors and visitors this fall, and beyond. The safety of our large, diverse communities has been our top consideration when making both short-term and long-term plans throughout the pandemic. NAIT has joined other post-secondary institutions in the province to introduce a vaccine mandate and require proof of vaccination. We are introducing the following enhancements to our campus safety measures:
NAIT continues to encourage everyone coming to our campuses to be fully vaccinated and to get their booster shots as soon as they are eligible. Vaccination against COVID-19 remains the best way to prevent severe illness and death, and third doses can boost immunity to improve protection and limit spread.

Title: Business Analyst (Staff Analyst)
Description:
At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity and inclusion are shared values. We’re committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that’s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.
Boeing Canada Operations Ltd. (BCA) is seeking a Business (Staff) Analysts reporting to the Business Operations Manager, working out of the Winnipeg, Manitoba office.
This role is an integral part of the Boeing team, helping to execute a variety business needs and a partner for executive support. The position requires experience collaborating with both internal and intercompany stakeholders to ensure team deliverables are met.
The Business (Staff) Analyst is the general focal for all items relating to reporting; including collecting, organizing, analyzing and integrating data according to established processes within the management system.
Above all, we are seeking someone who will value and champion our culture of learning, trust, and relentless collaborative energy.
Position Responsibilities:
Provides data and Key Performance Indicator (KPI) reporting for management review and tracking performance to plan. Communicates status or performance to internal and intercompany stakeholders. Summarizes data and action plans. Develops leadership briefings.
Establishes and maintains the Operating Rhythm and Management System of the leader including meeting architecture and content, agenda development, and provides visibility of upcoming meetings and deliverables.
Leads meetings, tracks actions, and manages action completion.
Assists with the identification of risks and opportunities, development of mitigation plans, and tracks plan implementation.
Reviews and evaluates organizational issues and identifies options including implementation recommendations
Provides strategic design, logistics and facilitation of large meetings or events as needed.
Annually, assists leader with developing plans for executing long-range strategies, organizational goals, objectives and initiatives.
Leads the development of standard tools and processes
Employer is not willing to sponsor applicants for employment visa status.
This position is expected to be 100% onsite. The selected candidate will be required to work onsite at one of the listed location options.
Basic Qualifications (Required Skills/Experience):
5+ years of experience in a Staff Analyst role or equivalent
Bachelor’s degree in business, supply chain, or related field.
Must be proficient in Microsoft Office Tools including Word, Outlook, Excel, Access, MS Project
Exemplary professional writing skills and experience creating executive level briefings
Experience in Information Management organization, management, storing and distributing information efficiently using a variety of systems
Experience with data analytics and metric development
Must be legally able to work in Canada
Preferred Qualifications (Education/Experience):
Experience using Tableau
Experience in developing standard tools and processes
Experience in leading cross-functional and/or project teams
Typical Education and Experience:
Education/experience typically acquired through advanced education (e.g. Bachelor) and typically 6 or more years' related work experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience (e.g. Master+4 years' related work experience, 10 years' related work experience, etc.).
Relocation:
This position does not offer relocation. Candidates must live in the immediate area or relocate at their own expense.
This requisition is for a, locally hired position in Canada. The employer is Boeing Canada. Candidates must be legally authorized to work in Canada. Benefits and pay are determined by Canada and are not on Boeing US-based payroll. This is not an expatriate assignment.
Equal Opportunity Employer:
Boeing is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, genetic factors, military/veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

Title: Business Analyst I, OPL
Description:
From coast-to-coast, our inspiring colleagues are at the heart of what we do best: helping people, businesses and society prosper in good times and be resilient in bad times. With our team, you’ll bring this purpose to life every day by living our Values, being open to change, and pursuing your goals.
At Intact, we’ll give you countless opportunities to learn and grow, alongside a diverse and passionate community of experts – the best the industry has to offer. You’ll be empowered to be your best self, do your best work, and make a meaningful impact. Here, you can: shape the future of insurance, win as a team, and grow with us.


About the role


We are currently looking for a Business Analyst for our Operations and Planning department, which would play an important role in our growth.
Are you energized at the idea of working in an environment where you are able to evaluate and analyze information?
Are you eager to get your foot in the door with a national industry-leading organization?
Do you want to work in an environment that believes in growth and development and offers various career opportunities?
Are you interested in being at the center of all the key strategies of the organization and moving those projects forward?
Do you want to be a part of one of the most exciting teams in the organization?
If you answered yes, to any of the above questions, we might be exactly what you are looking for!
WORKPLACE: Montreal (2020 Robert-Bourassa Blvd), Quebec (5700, des Galeries) or St-Hyacinthe (2450, Girouard Ouest Street)
What you’ll do here:
The Operations and Planning department is seeking individuals with exceptional analytical and organizational skills for a variety of Business Analyst positions, ranging from Junior - Intermediate - and Senior Business Analysts. These activities include but are not limited to eliciting and documenting business requirements and supporting the project team.
Plan and coordinate project activities related to organizational requirements or changes.
Act as a intermediary between I.T., users and managers from different hierarchical levels.
Obtain requirements from business communities using techniques such as interview and work sessions.
Analyze complex needs, information obtained from various sources, detail the high-level information and provide users with recommendations to their problems.
Document requirements obtained from business community using defined templates.
Ensure the link between the business units, the technology teams and the support team.
Act as PO if required
Organise and facilitate working session with experts from different fields.
Responsible for improving productivity and reducing risks and high costs through effective analysis.
Identify the need for change to assess and communicate their impact.
Support the Quality Assurance team during Test Planning and Execution


Qualifications


What you bring to the table:
Bachelor Degree or a combination of education & relevant experience will be considered.
Minimum one year relevant business analysis and requirements elicitation/documentation experience
Experience in a variety of Requirements gathering methodologies,
Experience with an Agile approach, Product Owner role is an asset
Experience in complex business environments where multiple systems interact
Superior organizational skills in order to manage projects and balance multiple demands and deadlines.
Proven analytical skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills are essential.
Insurance industry experience is an asset.
Bilingualism (French/English) is required
Travelling might be required – 15%
Here are a few reasons why others have joined our team:
An award-winning, inspiring workplace that supports its people and recognizes great work
Stimulating, challenging projects and development opportunities to help you grow your skills and career
Flexible Work Arrangements
Right now, we support 100% remote work, if your role permits. We anticipate that in early 2022, we’ll be moving to a hybrid approach which gives us the best of both worlds – a mix of home and in-office workdays.


Closing Statement


We are an Equal Opportunity Employer
At Intact, our value of Respect is founded on seeing diversity as a strength, being inclusive and fostering collaboration. We value diversity and strive to create an inclusive, accessible workplace where all individuals feel valued, respected and heard.
If we can provide a specific adjustment to make the recruitment process more accessible for you, please advise the Talent Acquisition partner who reaches out about the job opportunity and they will work with you to meet your needs.
Background Checks
As an employer and publicly traded financial services company, the best interests of our customers, employees and shareholders are important to us. We want Intact to be a great place to work! This means that internal and external candidates will be asked to consent to background checks so we can learn more about you. Please note that for positions with access to financial data or funds, your credit must be in good standing.
Internal Candidates
For internal candidates, you can apply for a posted position if you have been in your current position for at least 12 months and are performing at a satisfactory level. Please note we may have identified other internal candidates through our Employee Development Program, and that the selection process may also be opened to external applicants.
Eligibility to Work in Canada
It’s important that you are legally eligible to work in Canada at the time an offer of employment is made. You may be requested to provide proof of eligibility at that time.

Title: Senior Health Information Analyst
Description:
POSITION: SENIOR HEALTH INFORMATION ANALYST

DEPARTMENT: DECISION SUPPORT

STATUS: FULL TIME

PAY RATE: $40.372 - $50.465


POSITION DESCRIPTION:

Reporting to the Manager of Finance & Decision Support, the Senior Health Information Analyst contributes to healthcare delivery by interacting with medical staff, physicians, health care providers and management. This position responds to customized ad hoc and regular requests for data from both external and internal stakeholders. These include requests for data from the Discharge Abstract Database (DAD), the National Ambulatory Care Reporting System (NACRS), the Electronic Patient Record (Cerner), CIHI, iPort Access, Risk Management System, and Integrated Decision Support Business Intelligence Tool (IDS).

The Senior Health Information Analyst is the lead member of the Decision Support team and has a broad range of responsibilities. Activities include taking a leadership role in responding to data requests, including consulting with stakeholders, analyzing data, implementing and enhancing quality assurance activities and generating analytic outputs including preparing and/or delivering presentations to various audiences. This position is also responsible for the coordination and timely mandatory submissions of various MoHLTC and Ontario Health (OH) projects including but not limited to Wait Time, Emergency NACRS Initiative (P4R), Surgical Efficiency Targets Program and Case Costing.


HOURS:

The successful candidate will work Monday – Friday (37.5 hours weekly) with a willingness to adjust their schedule to meet the needs of the organization.


SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED:

Completion of a recognized university degree or college diploma in healthcare or business administration
3 - 5 years recent, related job experience with healthcare data and processes
Certified Health Information Management (preferred)
UMNO Membership is an asset
Being a critical thinker, self-starter, self-managed, solution minded positive role model for the team are absolute must have characteristics
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and Word
Advanced proficiency in data collection and management and advanced proficiency in report writing (including Crystal, 3M, Power BI, DA2 and Tableau Reporting tools)
Detailed content knowledge and proficiency with a variety of provincial and national healthcare data sets (DAD, NACRS, CCRS, NRS, OMHRS, etc.)
Excellent facilitation skills and proficient in preparing and delivering presentations to large and small audiences.
Interprets clinical data and educates managers on clinical data reporting practices, the application of Case Mix Group methodologies (e.g., CMG, CACS, SCIPP, RPG, RUG) and its impact on healthcare funding models (e.g., QBP,HIG)
Demonstrated ability to synthesize data / evidence into value-added communication.
Self-motivated and action-oriented; an adept team player who can work independently and collaboratively.
Customer focused and responsive to the specific and unique needs of each working situation.
Flexible, adaptable & able to prioritize & manage change; works effectively in a fast-paced & evolving work environment.
Demonstrated excellence in identifying data needs to support decision-making and in determining appropriate sources of data.
Demonstrated excellence in written and verbal communication skills
Demonstrated excellence in interpersonal skills and collaboration with all levels of staff including clinical managers, physicians, directors, VPs and administrative leadership.
Demonstrated ability to establish and build effective working relationships
Development of key performance indicators, QIP scorecards, dashboards
Familiar with lean methodologies, Green Belt (preferred).

Title: SEO Analyst
Description:
Angi® is the home for everything home. From repairs and renovations to products and financing, Angi is transforming every touch point in home services. With over 25 years of experience and a network of nearly 250,000 pros, we have helped more than 150 million people with their home needs. Our products and technology help our customers love where they live while helping small businesses grow and thrive. We believe the home is the most important place on earth and we are at the beginning of our ambitious journey to redefine how people care for their homes - join us!
 About the Role
 Angi is seeking an experienced, results-driven SEO Analyst who will be responsible for overseeing and developing projects that increase the organic visibility of the Angi website. This person will be responsible for interpreting market, web and business metrics to identify high-impact optimization opportunities, and working cross-functionally with product, engineering and content to implement them. This role will also have a heavy focus on conducting A/B experimentation, Technical SEO, as well as helping maintain and build our analytics capabilities.
 What You'll Do:

Monitor and report on KPIs, share with the SEO team and Senior Management, and quickly respond to divergences
Help design SEO experiments and test new strategies and opportunities for growth
Analyze SEO test results and execute next steps at a fast pace
Analyze keyword, traffic, user and business trends to gain insight and take action
Lead, manage, and prioritize projects that involve cross-functional stakeholders
Grow the business through technical SEO, data analysis, and various optimizations
Understand each department's SEO needs and evangelize SEO internally

Qualities we're searching for:

Passionate & curious problem solver: someone who is genuinely curious about how and why people search, extremely knowledgeable about SEO best practices and trends, and relishes in the analytical and technical depths of the industry.
Extremely detail-oriented: but can also see the forest from the trees, balancing the intricacies of SEO with the larger company objectives.
Quantitative and pragmatic: you have a data-driven approach to making decisions.
Analytical, tactical & strategic: experience building a strategic and tactical plan based on analyzing large amounts of data.
High ownership: autonomous and takes pride in your work, has a sense of urgency, and perseveres through difficulty to deliver high-quality results.
High initiative: An ambitious go-getter who takes initiative without being asked and over-delivers on your promises.
Excellent communicator: ability to clearly communicate and evangelize SEO across all levels, particularly through data.
Results-driven: Focused on achieving results, setting ambitious goals, and able to prioritize appropriately by understanding the balance of value.
Innovative: constantly focused on improving, growing, and coming up with new ways to grow and propel the business.
Teamwork & positive attitude: works collaboratively with a positive and can-do approach to opportunities and challenges to get the right things done quickly.

Ideal Qualifications:

BA/BS degree or equivalent experience (preferred in quantitative field such as economics, mathematics, statistics, or computer science/engineering)
Demonstrable track record of success at driving significant results & business growth
3+ years of SEO/Web Analytics experience with enterprise level websites (i.e. hundreds of thousands or millions of pages)
Advanced Excel skills required
Experience with Omniture/Adobe Analytics strongly desired
Experience with SQL, JavaScript, CSS or other coding languages strongly desired
Superior analytical, problem-structuring, and problem-solving skills; experience synthesizing data into information, and presenting concise analyses

Compensation & Benefits:

The salary band for this position ranges from $60,000-$100,000, commensurate with experience and performance. Compensation may vary based on factors such as cost of living.
This position will be eligible for a competitive year end performance bonus & equity package.
Full medical, dental, vision package to fit your needs
Flexible vacation policy; work hard and take time when you need it
Pet discount plans & retirement plan with company match (401K)
The rare opportunity to work with sharp, motivated teammates solving some of the most unique challenges and changing the world

Title: Business Data Analyst, Autodesk Customer Success Practice
Description:
Job Requisition ID #
22WD58843
Position Overview
Autodesk is a world leader in 3D design, engineering and entertainment software and services. Our software is used by creators, designers, architects, engineers, video game developers and film makers around the world. Learn more about why Autodesk is continually ranked a top place to work by Fortune, Forbes, Glassdoor and others: Top 7 Reasons You Should Work at Autodesk . And check out what Autodesk employees are saying.
As a business analyst in the Autodesk Customer Success Practice team, you’ll be the principal owner of how we use data & analytics to inform strategic decisions and measure current execution status. You will help us measure the impact of the programs and tools we build to help our customers plan their success. You’ll have an opportunity to learn about some of the most impressive technologies that Autodesk is working on.
We are looking for a proactive, well-spoken, collaborative teammate to apply their love of data analytics and data visualization to quantify and provide insights into the adoption and use of our value management and success planning tools and content. If you like collaborating with cross-functional teams, owning projects start-to-finish, and using cutting edge analytics tools to do it - you will love this job.
Responsibilities
Work with various stakeholders to define the right metrics needed to measure the success of the tools, content, and programs we build
Identify the data points required to obtain those metrics, and work with our technical teams to instrument the tools we build in a way that provides the required data
Work with external teams to obtain additional data from our other business systems (e.g., Salesforce) that can enrich our metrics
Help define the best way to export and aggregate all the necessary data
Build and maintain self-serve dashboards to help team members and management easily understand how our programs are performing
Analyze the data, identify trends and areas of interest or risk, use the data to “tell a story”
Design, develop and generate periodic or ad-hoc reports and presentations in response to requests from upper management
Perform periodic audits of data consistency and accuracy
Look for opportunities to constantly improve our data and reporting processes, propose new ideas
Ensure the compliance of our data collection, storage and dashboarding processes with Autodesk security and privacy policies, GDPR, etc
Be the team’s “go-to person” for any questions or training related to metrics, dashboarding, best practices around collecting and interpreting data
Minimum Qualifications
2+ years of experience performing data analysis and visualizations
Ability to determine the right metrics and to make sense of complex data to tell a compelling story
Strong attention to detail and work ethic. Care deeply about data quality and integrity
Curiosity, thinking outside the box and always looking for opportunities to improve processes
Independent, fast learner, proactive, problem solver
Strong communication skills and written English. Comfortable presenting to senior leadership
Experience working with unstructured data (webpages and/or text) a plus
Experience with Microsoft PowerBI, Salesforce, AirTable, SQL, Snowflake a plus
Availability to occasionally travel as needed
We’d like to thank all applicants for their interest. Only selected applicants will be contacted for an interview.
Visit us at: www.autodesk.com
At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law.
Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Please search for open jobs and apply internally (not on this external site). If you have any questions or require support, contact Autodesk Careers .

Title: Sr Security Business Analyst
Description:
Company Description
At ServiceNow, our technology makes the world work for everyone, and our people make it possible. We move fast because the world can’t wait, and we innovate in ways no one else can for our customers and communities. By joining ServiceNow, you are part of an ambitious team of change makers who have a restless curiosity and a drive for ingenuity. We know that your best work happens when you live your best life and share your unique talents, so we do everything we can to make that possible. We dream big together, supporting each other to make our individual and collective dreams come true. The future is ours, and it starts with you.
With more than 7,400+ customers, we serve approximately 80% of the Fortune 500, and we're on the 2021 list of FORTUNE World's Most Admired Companies®.
Learn more on Life at Now blog and hear from our employees about their experiences working at ServiceNow.
Job Description
We are hiring a Business Analyst to join our Threat Defence and Response Team to support our maturity and growth. Working with the Head of Security Operations Enablement, your main tasks will include capturing, managing and driving maturity efforts, performing detailed requirements analysis, documenting processes, and updating stakeholders on the progress of our initiatives.
To succeed in this role, you should have a natural analytical way of thinking and be able to understand and communicate technical concepts to all audiences. You’ll have experience and/or a strong interest in Cyber Security, have an appreciation for security compliance requirements and be passionate about continuous improvement, particularly around business process. Experience in application workflow creation and management would also be hugely advantageous.
Business Analyst Responsibilities:
Evaluating both new and existing processes, identifying new requirements, recommending areas for improvement, and developing and implementing solutions.
Leading ongoing reviews of these processes to ensure their continued maturity.
Driving best-in-practice standards across all areas.
Leveraging the power of our platform wherever possible.
Identifying process automation opportunities and driving them forward.
Supporting the team in relation to compliance and audit requirements.
Conducting meetings and presentations to share ideas and findings.
Ensuring solutions meet business needs and requirements.
Gathering critical information from meetings with various stakeholders and capturing action items, driving them to resolution.
Documenting and effectively communicating progress to cross-functional team members and management.
Creating, managing and communicating appropriate success metrics.
Supporting user acceptance testing to ensure smooth transition.

Qualifications
To be successful in this role:
A bachelor’s degree in business, related field, or an MBA and/ or a minimum of 5 years of experience in business analysis or aligned role.
Experience working with Security Incident Response, Threat Detection and/ or other Cybersecurity teams is highly desirable.
The ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them to determine acceptable solutions.
End-to-end process management experience.
A track record of following through on commitments.
Excellent planning, organizational, and time management skills.
Excellent documentation skills.
Experience creating detailed reports and giving presentations.
Competency in Microsoft applications including Word, Excel, and Outlook.
US Citizenship required
JV20
Additional Information
ServiceNow is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status or any other category protected by law.
All new employees hired in the United States are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, subject to such exceptions as required by law. If hired, you will be required to submit proof of full vaccination or have an approved accommodation, by your start date. Visit our Candidate FAQ page to learn more.
If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact us at talent.acquisition@servicenow.com for assistance.
For positions requiring access to technical data subject to export control regulations, including Export Administration Regulations (EAR), ServiceNow may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Government for certain individuals. All employment is contingent upon ServiceNow obtaining any export license or other approval that may be required by the U.S. Government.
Please Note: Fraudulent job postings/job scams are increasingly common. Click here to learn what to watch out for and how to protect yourself. All genuine ServiceNow job postings can be found through the ServiceNow Careers site.
Work personas
Work personas are categories that are assigned to employees depending on the nature of their work. Employees will fall into one of three categories: Remote, Flexible or Required in Office.
Required in Office
A required in office work persona is defined as an employee who is contracted to work from or aligned to a ServiceNow-affiliated office. This persona is required to work from their assigned workplace location 100% of the work week based on the business needs of their role.
Flexible
A flexible work persona is defined as an employee who is contracted to work from or aligned to a ServiceNow-affiliated office and will work from their assigned workplace location roughly 3 days/week or less (generally around 40-60% of the work week). Flexible employees may choose to work the remaining working time from their workplace location or home. Flexible employees are required to work within their state, province, region, or country of employment.
Remote
A remote work persona is defined as an employee who performs their responsibilities exclusively outside of a ServiceNow workplace and is not contracted or aligned to a ServiceNow-affiliated office, including those whose place of work (pursuant to their terms and conditions of employment) is their home. Remote employees are required to work within their state, province, region, or country of employment.

Title: IT Business Analyst Graduate
Description:
IT BUSINESS ANALYST GRADUATE (JOB NUMBER: GRAD-050422-001-JLB)
At BNP Paribas Canada, it is our employees which make the difference... Our 75 nationalities are part of our diversity!
Do you like challenges, a structured framework, the prospect of optimizing and innovating? You are known for your originality and want a certain freedom to think while sharing your knowledge and ideas?

... Come help us contribute to the growth of our Canadian platform!

You will benefit amongst other things from:
Access to social volunteer and recreational programs, via our many Employee Resource Groups (ERGs)
Opportunities for career development through active internal mobility and our innovative training program: Canada Academy
A brand new workspace, flexible, comfortable and easily adaptable to your needs: remote work opportunities, standing desks, innovation lab., open meeting rooms and spaces

As a Graduate, you will also benefit from a Development Program that aims to help your further your career by discovering your potential through customized trainings, coaching & networking sessions.

BNP Paribas Canada's Fresh Finance Dedicated Solutions department is growing, and is looking to hire a Fresh Data Analyst.

ABOUT THE DEPARTMENT
FRESH Connect Data Operations team’s mandate, within the Department, is to ensure the availability of data to the Finance North Americas production teams for the preparation, review, control and issuance of IHC reports into the CUSO/IHC reporting infrastructure.
The team acts in close proximity with Finance Departments, IT Operations, Fresh NAR and IT Application Support teams to monitor production processes on a daily basis and support users especially on closing periods for the reporting applications such as Triton, Moody’s or Axiom.
The team provides services and means to fulfill short-term requirements, to prototype, test and deliver innovative solutions.

The NAR Data Ops team is based in Canada (Montreal). The candidate will be located in Montreal (2001 Robert Bourassa)

SUMMARY OF THE ROLE
The graduate candidate will participate in the day-to-day activities and support the team on various initiatives, including process improvements focusing on the functional design, writing of functional specifications and deployment of Systems and Process changes initiatives at both a Legal Entity and Intermediate Holding Company (IHC) level. S/he will work as a team member of projects.

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES
Support and monitoring of the day-to-day activities surrounding the production of CUSO/IHC reporting.
Manage issues and escalate effectively.
Analyze, and document Finance user requirements and business processes in order to improve the operational framework.
Develop functional specification requirements for IT development and to ensure user requirements are met.
Perform System Integration Testing to ensure development is in line with functional specification.
Participate in project planning and cost estimates.
Ensure on-time quality delivery of projects and activities assigned.
Report on and monitor project status on regular basis (weekly) as to inform all stakeholders of ongoing program updates.
Liaise with cross-functional teams (business groups, IT and PMO organizations) in New York, New Jersey, California, Montreal, Mumbai, London and Paris
KEY SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS

TRAINING AND OCCUPATIONAL EXPERIENCE
Bachelor’s degree in the fields of Business, Finance or Accounting obtained within the last 12 months. Master’s degree would be a plus.
Accounting and basic general ledger general structure knowledge required
Experience must include business analysis, data sourcing, functional specification, and application testing.
Strong Microsoft software Office skills (Excel, Word, Access, PowerPoint, Visio, Project).
Knowledge of project management, SharePoint, Database Management – Standard SQL
Regulatory Reporting knowledge preferred
Fluent in both French and English

SKILLS AND BEHAVIOURS
Excellent written and oral communication skills, with the ability to explain complex issues clearly and concisely to audiences of varying technical or accounting levels.
Ability to work effectively in geographically dispersed cross-functional teams.
Ability to understand complex financial products and system architectures, including accounting business processes

About BNP Paribas
With more than 200,000 employees in 72 countries, the Group serves nearly 32 million individual customers and 850,000 professionals, entrepreneurs, SMEs and large companies. BNP Paribas is a leading bank in the euro zone and a leading international banking player.
Did you know? In 2019, BNP Paribas named World’s Best Bank for Corporate Responsibility 2019

About BNP Paribas in Canada
With more than 1200 employees, BNP Paribas Canada continues to attract experts from diverse fields as well as ambitious young talent from around the world. We are proud to offer our employees a rewarding and international workplace where they can build their professional careers by honing their skills, meeting challenges and enriching their knowledge of the financial industry.
A recruitment policy that promotes equality and diversity:
BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer. BNP Paribas recruits, employs, trains, compensates and promotes regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, disability, age, and other protected status (Employment Equity Act).
Part of BNP Paribas dedication to diversity, multiculturalism and inclusion is clearly reflected on how we believe and live diversity and inclusion all together. As such, one of BNP Paribas’ initiatives is hosting Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) which are focused on equality of gender, sexual orientation and learning from other cultures.
We can assist with access to job offers for people with disabilities who may be unable to use our career site - please contact us by email canada_recrutement@ca.bnpparibas.com or by phone on 514-285-6000

Title: Distribution Manager (Logistics, Data Analyst)
Description:
The Distribution Manager is responsible for the major activities of the department, from the ordering of the vehicles to the final delivery of these vehicles to the dealership. All with the intention to reach and exceed our company wholesale objectives. You’ll working with a team of employees, to perform tasks which includes ordering vehicles from the factory, managing the relations with our logistic partner, Glovis, while overseeing the company car program. .
This position has an exceptional degree of importance all aspects of the organization operation, all actions and decisions must be consistent with general corporate policies and procedures, corporate objectives, provincial and federal law, and sound business practices.
** Responsibilities
Responsible for the monitoring and reporting of the sales, inventory, logistical and cost control functions of the Distribution Department.

Management of Kia’s monthly and yearly wholesale objectives by ensuring the proper mix of models and trims are ordered from the factory
Monitoring their production status, their arrival in the county and timely delivery to the dealer
Preparation of the monthly production order and submission to KHQ. Monitoring of our production to ensure KCA inventory needs are met.
Liase with KHQ, Glovis, our customs broker, port, MPCA, etc. regarding incoming shipments.
Analysis of Logistic related items, days of supply, supply chain flow, port, rail, compound and transport efficiencies
Monitor aged inventory status Preparing aged inventory reports by model and trim line
Maintain and report daily, weekly and monthly sales/inventory reports by:
Responsible for preparation of the monthly production order and submission to KMC by
Assist the Sales department with analysis and reporting of Sales related items as required
Analyze Inventory/sales status and make recommendations regarding Sales programs
Provide a weekly wholesale estimate to senior management, which details the carlines to be wholesaled for the month, and ensure that is aligned with corporate objectives.

Assist in the preparation of the annual department budget, which needs to detail the expenses of the department vehicles and expense that occur in management of such vehicles.
** Skills / Knowledge / Experience / Education Required

Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Excellent computer skills – SAP, Logistics OS, Advanced MS Office,
Ability to work in a stressful, fast paced environment and maintain a customer service attitude
Knowledge of importation and customs is an asset
Attention to detail is a must
Ability to work in a team environment
Self-motivated, easily adaptable to changing priorities
Minimum 6 years’ experience, preferably in the automotive logistics industry
University Degree

Please apply directly on KIA Canada website (link below): 
https://www.kia.ca/en/about-kia/careers/job-postings/Distribution-Manager
Job Type: Full-time
Schedule:

8 hour shift
Day shift

Application deadline: 2022-04-26

Title: Senior Business Analyst
Description:
Job Type: Permanent
Reference code: 102121
Primary Location: Toronto, Ontario, Canada
All Available Locations: Toronto
Our Purpose
At Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization.
By living our Purpose, we will make an impact that matters.
Partner with clients to solve their most complex problems
Be empowered to lead and have impact with clients, our communities and in the office.
Be expected to share your ideas and to make them a reality.
Our Database Marketing and Insights team provides marketers with world-class prospect and customer data integration services that dramatically improve their prospecting and / or customer care strategies.
What will your typical day look like?
In an entrepreneurial environment, the successful candidate will be involved in the development, production support and enhancements of a complex multi-layer software application and processes within the Database Marketing and Insights team.
The role of the Sr. Data Analyst is pivotal to the success of our data production support and product development model. The role involves a mixture of well-defined production execution steps and development/coordination of data management tasks. The incumbent will be the interface between the business management leads, quality control specialists and analytical analysts within our team, and the larger project teams.
Responsibilities
Design, develop and document automated and standardized processes for clients and internal applications
Execute ongoing daily production jobs and client requests, on time and with high quality
Respond to client-related inquiries and issues within a defined time frame
Create ad-hoc reports and/or data extracts for custom client requests
Perform various production validation procedures to ensure business requirements are met and generate reports that will be verified by a Quality Control Analyst.
Work with the Quality Control Team to establish objectives and implement processes to support quality control standards through the Stage Gate methodology
Monitor, maintain and execute periodic updates to Client data repositories
Implement production fixes or upgrades as required to support the existing process
Propose new enhancements to the existing production process through new or modified usage of existing programs
Remove corrupted data and fixing coding errors and related problems as required
Perform analysis to assess quality and meaning of data; identify, analyze, and interpret patterns and trends in complex data sets
Filter data by reviewing reports and performance indicators to identify and correct code problems
Using statistical tools that could be helpful for the diagnosis and prediction
Scrutinize data to recognize and identify patterns when required

About the team
DM&I has in-house data specialists who serve data management needs for organizations across all industries including financial institutions, retail, life sciences and healthcare, B2B, education, government and automotive.
Enough about us, let’s talk about you

Skills and Experience
Bachelor’s degree in Applied Science/Applied Mathematics/Computer Science/Business Information Systems, or relevant degrees with a strong focus on math or data
Minimum of 3-5 years’ experience as a Data Analyst, or any combination of experience and education that would provide the required knowledge and abilities for successful performance
Solid understanding of database technologies including Microsoft SQL Server
Previous experience and knowledge of programming languages like SQL, BASE SAS, SAS Enterprise Guide
Experience with statistics and statistical packages like Excel, SPSS, SAS to be used for data set analysis
Technical proficiency regarding database design development, data models, techniques for data mining, and segmentation
Demonstrated initiative, excellent problem-solving skills and strong attention to details
Adept at queries, writing reports, and making presentations
Demonstrated ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage competing project priorities
Collaborative and strong team-working skills
Strong capability to understand relevant business parameters along with an ability to select appropriate processes or procedures from multiple options
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Proficiency in Windows and Office (Word, Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint)
Knowledge of data visualization software like Tableau, Qlik, Power BI
Our shared values
While our Purpose guides us and helps explain why we exist, our shared values describe the behaviour we expect from each other at the firm.
They provide common ground to unite us across cultures and geographies. They help us to earn the trust and respect of our stakeholders. We all commit to living by these shared values, to stay true to the principles they represent, and to honour the legacy from which they came. They are what sets us apart and makes us Deloitte.
Every day, we live our Purpose through the following five shared values:
Lead the way: Deloitte is not only leading the profession, but reinventing it for the future. We’re also committed to creating opportunity and leading the way to a more sustainable world.

Serve with integrity: Deloitte has earned the trust of employees, clients, regulators, and the public for 175 years. Upholding that trust is our single most important responsibility.

Take care of each other: We look out for one another and prioritize respect, fairness, development, and well-being.

Foster inclusion: We are at our best when we foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. We know this attracts top talent, enables innovation, and helps us deliver well-rounded client solutions.

Collaborate for measurable impact: We approach our work with a collaborative mind¬set, teaming across businesses, geographies, and skill sets to deliver tangible, measurable, attributable impact.
The next step is yours
Sound like The One Firm. For You? Apply Now
At Deloitte, we are all about doing business inclusively – that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities. Deloitte encourages applications from all qualified candidates who represent the full diversity of communities across Canada. This includes, but is not limited to, people with disabilities, candidates from Indigenous communities, and candidates from the Black community in support of living our values, creating a culture of Diversity Equity and Inclusion and our commitment to our AccessAbility Action Plan, Reconciliation Action Plan and the BlackNorth Initiative.
We encourage you to connect with us at accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca if you require an accommodation for the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms or other accommodations). We’d love to hear from you!
By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.
Deloitte Canada has 30 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge our offices reside on traditional, treaty and unceded territories as part of Turtle Island and is still home to many First Nations, Métis, and Inuit peoples. We are all Treaty people.

Title: Analyst, Global Inventory Management
Description:
At BRP, we create new ways to move people, where experience is measured in emotion rather than distance. All over the world, our products, successes and aspirations reflect the exceptional expertise of our people. Want to be part of the adventure? 
 
 We are looking for a Global Inventory Management Analyst reporting to the Global Inventory and Deployment Manager to help us meet our business needs through sound inventory management. In this role, you will have a major impact in supporting the growth of the organization by optimizing our procurement, inventory and deployment policies for BRP's parts and accessories distribution centers. 
 
 ADVANCE YOUR CAREER 
 
 By working at BRP, you will develop within an environment at the cutting edge of technology and will be able to apply your analytical mind to complex, large-scale projects. You will be part of an experienced team and will have access to numerous training opportunities to keep your skills up to date. 
 

YOU WILL HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO:
 Perform data analysis to support operational and strategic decisions. 
 
 Define and improve processes/tools to support inventory management and deployment policies with a view to continuous improvement. 
 
 Collaborate with various positions to ensure proper management of inventory levels. 
 
 Define and produce key performance indicators and use them to implement concrete action plans. 
 
 Help transform the department, including by contributing to the implementation of the SAP Integrated Business Planning (IBP) system. 
 
 TO THRIVE IN THIS ROLE, YOU WILL NEED TO HAVE THE FOLLOWING SKILLS AND QUALITIES: 
 
 2 years’ experience in a data analysis, business intelligence or inventory management role 
 
 Background in supply chain, engineering or related field. 
 
 Advanced knowledge of Excel and intermediate knowledge of Power BI (or other data visualization tool) 
 
 Proficient written and oral communication (in French and English) 
 
 Positive attitude and strong analytical mind. 
 
 Is this you? We look forward to receiving your application! 
 

WE CAN OFFER YOU:
 A very competitive salary 
 
 An annual bonus 
 
 A generous allowance of paid leave 
 
 An annual contribution to a pension plan 
 
 A group insurance plan fully covered by BRP 
 
 Significant discounts on our products 
 
 A personalized career progression plan 
 
 Access to an online training platform 
 
 Team building activities 
 
 Access to a gym 
 
 WELCOME TO BRP 
 
 We’re a world leader in recreational vehicles and boats, creating innovative ways to move on snow, water, asphalt, dirt and even in the air. Headquartered in the Canadian town of Valcourt, Quebec, our company is rooted in a spirit of ingenuity and intense customer focus. Today, we operate manufacturing facilities in Canada, the United States, Mexico, Finland, Australia and Austria, with a workforce of over 20,000 spirited people, all driven by the deeply held belief that at work, as with life itself, it’s not about the destination; It’s about the journey. Yours. 
 
 #LI-GB2

Title: Strategic Planning Analyst II - Fleet and Facility Services
Description:
Strategic Planning Analyst II - Fleet and Facility Services
Job Number : 43258
Reporting to the Manager of Analytics, the Strategic Planning Analyst (SPAII) will be the client conduit to build, execute, and operationalize strategic initiatives within Fleet & Facility Services. Using a combination of branch and corporate analytics, this position will work closely with senior leadership and internal resources to drive continuous improvement and operational excellence. Project planning and execution will include regular site visits to the operational areas to develop a strong understanding of the pressure points and priorities that will influence recommendations.
With a focus on the City of Edmonton’s Cultural Commitments to Safe, Helpful, Accountable, Integrated and Excellent, you will:
Conduct analysis of performance measurement and trend data to develop project plans
Prepare recommendations to senior management regarding project implementation, budget, timelines, and performance metrics
Oversee and report on deliverables associated with assigned projects and initiatives
Define, monitor, and provide budget progress reports
Coordinate stakeholder engagement and understand the political sensitivities that drive urgency and decision making within the organization
Lead and assist in operational audits including work order data and data integrity
Act as Project Manager on specific projects
Integrate all branch and operational data and dashboards
Lead monthly meetings with the service delivery and analytics teams to coordinate and consolidate reporting
Work with Finance to link operational results to financial results by using financial forecasting and budget development
Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques, and provide ongoing reports
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics, and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources including Assetworks M5 and SAP Plant Maintenance
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Filter and “clean” data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and work with the appropriate group to correct any problems
Work with management to prioritize business and information needs
Locate and define process improvement opportunities by interpreting data and analyzing results using statistical techniques
Other duties as assigned
Qualifications :
An Undergraduate Degree (or higher, or equivalent) in Business Administration, Public Administration or a related discipline
Project Management Professional (PMP) designation preferred
A minimum of five (5) years of progressively responsible experience in strategic and operational business planning, working with corporate performance measures and budgets, and/or business and case development
Leadership and project management experience in a public sector or operational environment is preferred
Knowledge of the development and management of project performance measurement strategies and tools
Advanced level knowledge of primary and secondary research methodology, including design and implementation, data collection, trend/results analysis and presentation
Experience in strategic and business planning, change management techniques, process improvement, process management, and engagement activities
Knowledge of strategic and business planning principles, policy development and benchmarking with the ability to integrate them into operational practice
Demonstrated proficiency in the use of analytics and data intelligence to support decision making processes by effectively gathering, synthesizing and analyzing data.
Ability to understand the business limitations and find best-fit alternatives that will isolate risks while maintaining forward momentum
Excellent communication skills, including the ability to express complex ideas and concepts effectively and persuasively, both verbally and in writing
Excellent interpersonal and conflict resolution skills with the ability to lead and collaborate within integrated, interdisciplinary teams on business strategy development; build and maintain strong relationships, positive engagement and create buy-in
Strong facilitation skills with the ability to tailor information to different audiences
Proficiency working in Google Workspace (Sheets, Docs, Calendar, Gmail, etc) and the ability to learn and adapt to evolving technology
A valid Alberta Class 5 driver's license (or provincial equivalent) is a requirement of this position
Must be comfortable driving to various work locations across the city, as needed
Applicants will be required to arrange their own transportation and where appropriate will be reimbursed in accordance with the City of Edmonton policy. This may require the applicant to obtain business auto insurance
Demonstrated ability to achieve results in the context of a respectful, inclusive and service-minded style
Embrace the Cultural Commitments of Safe, Helpful, Accountable, Integrated and Excellent, and foster an environment that encourages others to do the same
Applicants may be tested
The City of Edmonton is committed to inclusive, respectful and equitable workplaces that represent the communities we serve. We continuously improve our systems, policies and practices to remove barriers and ensure our employees, in all their diversity, can succeed. We value applicants with a diverse range of skills, experiences and competencies, and encourage you to apply. To learn more, see the Art of Inclusion: Our Diversity and Inclusion Framework here: https://bit.ly/3hd2d95.
The City of Edmonton strives to provide reasonable access and accommodations throughout the application and selection process. If you would like to request an accommodation at any stage of the process, please contact Employment@edmonton.ca
COVID-19 Notice: The City of Edmonton has implemented a COVID 19-Vaccination Policy. Employees must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and provide proof of vaccination. Employees who cannot be fully vaccinated on the basis of a protected legal ground (e.g. medical, religious) may request an exemption. Please note that this policy applies to all employees, including new hires, and volunteers. If your application is successful, you will be asked to provide proof of vaccination or request an exemption.
For more information, please refer to our COVID-19 Vaccination Policy (bit.ly/3lKwb6j) and COVID-19 Vaccination Procedure (bit.ly/39BICMt).
Up to 2 permanent full-time positions
Hours of Work: 40 hours per week, Monday – Friday
The weekly hours of work for this position are currently under review and may change at a future time. Any changes will be made in accordance with the City of Edmonton/Civic Service Union 52 collective agreement and the incumbent will be notified in advance.
