Title: Analyst Corporate Strategy and Development
Description:
The Position
 Title : Analyst, Corporate Strategy and Development
 Location: Toronto, Ontario
 The Analyst, Corporate Strategy and Development will be focused on accelerating VCNA's market intelligence reporting's rigor and impact through the execution of high value analyses and advices. This will involve working with a wide range of data sources, executing analysis leveraging standardized models, and occasionally developing custom analytical approaches and dashboards. The Analyst, Corporate Strategy and Development will focus on pricing and strategic marketing responsibilities in cement or other product lines. The Analyst Corporate Strategy and Development may also support due diligence cases and strategic analysis
 What will you do

 Execute analysis on market intelligence and strategy related projects
 Work with various data platforms to acquire relevant data for specific analytics modules
 Execute analysis/dashboard using a range of data tools (BW/SAP, Access Excel, Power BI, PowerPoint), generating slide output to clearly communicate insights on PowerPoint
 Collaborate with Strategy team on queries related to nuances of analytics conducted or underlying chosen data sources
 Support awareness and adoption efforts
 Participate to develop and lead content training sessions with Marketing Director and our sales team to drive awareness and adoption of market intelligence and CRM adoption

 Who you are

 Undergraduate Degree (Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Marketing or equivalent) 
3+ years of relevant experience in corporate strategy, business development, management consulting or equivalent 
Experience conducting analysis using a range of data sources and generating visual output to clearly communicate insights
 High degree of proficiency conducting data analysis using Excel, Access, PowerBI, and mapping software's or other related tools
 Knowledge of CRMs (e.g. 4C4 or Salesforce)
 Ability to access and extract data in SAP/BW, develop and update BW queries 
Interest in developing advanced analytics skills, learning new digital / data tools, etc.
 Attentive to detail and very organized, systematically questions and crosschecks data to align with our financials
 Strong proficiency in English
 Strong asset; knowledge of additional languages (e.g. French Spanish or Portuguese)

 About Us
 Are you interested in working for a company with a long heritage of excellence and commitment? Since its founding in 1912 in St. Marys, Ontario by John Lind and Alfred Rogers, St Marys Cement has been a major producer of cementitious materials in the Great Lakes Region. With six plants strategically located to serve Canadian and US customers and a production capacity over five million metric tonnes, St Marys Cement participated in such landmark projects as the CN Tower, Roy Thompson Hall, Maple Leaf Gardens and the Darlington Nuclear Station, as well as countless other engineering, civic and residential projects that significantly contributed to the growth and prosperity of the region.
 Today, in the dynamic international business environment, Votorantim Cimentos, one of the largest companies in the building materials industry in the world. We are present in 11 countries: Argentina, Bolivia, Brazil and Uruguay (South America); Canada and the United States (North America); Luxembourg and Spain (Europe); Turkey (Europe / Asia); Morrocos and Tunisia (Africa). Peru, Spain, Tunisia, Turkey, United States, and Uruguay. 
Votorantim Cimentos is part of Votorantim S.A., a 100% Brazilian company, which is present in 19 countries and celebrated 100 years of activity in 2018.The eight companies that make up the Group are: Votorantim Cimentos, NEXA, CBA (Companhia Brasileira de Alumínio), Acerbrag, Paz del Rio, Votorantim Energia, Citrosuco and Banco Votorantim. They are part of a business that includes more than 485 operating and administrative units and employs over 36,000 people

Title: Senior Analyst-CPG Manufacturer
Description:
Job Description
As part of this team, you will work together with our Consumer Packaged Goods clients to cultivate value-added partnership relationships. The goal is to become the primary and leading source of business insights for NielsenIQ’s clients.

As a Senior Analyst, you will add value through a strong understanding of client needs and providing them with the products, services and analytical insights that will help achieve their business goals. The successful candidate will have experience and/or knowledge in working with data , performing analysis integrating a wide variety of data sources and presenting to clients. You will work within a team environment where you will develop solid relationships with your own team and within the client organization.

The Ideal Candidate Will Have
Post-secondary degree in Marketing/Business and/or related field
4+ years of marketing, retail or category management experience
Strong analytical skills preferably in the CPG or Retail industry
Demonstrated ability to provide insight into the data and address client business issues
Excellent communication skills
Excellent presentation skills
Strong client relationship building/management skills
Knowledge of NielsenIQ products and services an asset
The aptitude to look for ways to challenge the status quo
Ability to multi-task and capable of independent decision making with a bold, nimble and collaborative approach to problem solving
Technically fluid with strong data manipulation , Excel skills and the ability to leverage technology as an enabler
Familiarity with using Power BI and/or Tableau
Accountable, results driven and open to new ideas and ongoing learning
Proactively create innovative insights that challenge the status quo
Strong sales mindset with the ability to influence and build strong client relationships

Additional Information
About NielsenIQ
NielsenIQ is a global measurement and data analytics company that provides the most complete and trusted view available of consumers and markets worldwide. We provide consumer packaged goods manufacturers/fast-moving consumer goods and retailers with accurate, actionable information and insights and a complete picture of the complex and changing marketplace that companies need to innovate and grow. Our approach marries proprietary NielsenIQ data with other data sources to help clients around the world understand what’s happening now, what’s happening next, and how to best act on this knowledge. We like to be in the middle of the action. That’s why you can find us at work in over 90 countries, covering more than 90% of the world’s population. For more information, visit www.niq.com.
NielsenIQ is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class.

Title: Senior Analyst, Health Indicators and Client Support
Description:
Category Data Analysis

City Ottawa, Toronto, Ontario, Canada


Job Description Senior Analyst, Health Indicators and Client Support


Who we are
We are an organization comprised of industry thought leaders who are passionate about health data and want to make a difference in the health care field. We are an independent, not-for-profit organization and together with our partners we provide essential information on Canada's health systems, enabling decisions that lead to healthier Canadians. As a valued member of the CIHI team, you and your work will have a pivotal role in the evolution of Canada's health care systems.
CIHI is recognized as an exceptional place to work that embraces diversity, respect, integrity, collaboration and innovation.
At CIHI, we recognize what matters to our employees. Some of the benefits of working at CIHI include
HOOPP Pension Plan (Defined Pension)
Retirement Planning Program
Generous vacation days for permanent and long-term contracts
Work-life balance
Career Planning Program
Learning and Professional Development Program
Flexible benefits program from your first day on the job for permanent and long-term contracts


Why is this role important?
The Health Indicators and Client Support area is responsible for the calculation and dissemination of various indicators of health system performance for hospitals and jurisdictions across the country. The Senior Analyst is a key member of the team and is contributing to the compilation, verification, analysis and dissemination of a set of indicators intended to provide health providers, health decision-makers, researchers and the public with reliable and comparable data on various dimensions of health care performance to promote quality improvement. The Senior Analyst also responds to client requests, works with other internal stakeholders to define data requirements and may also liaise with other external parties as required.


What you'll do
1. Writes and executes computer analyses required for the computation, analysis, and/or verification of the indicators. This may include taking responsibility over a defined suite of indicators.

2. Conducts the methodological reviews of the existing set of indicators, including the relevant data analyses and literature reviews.

3. Assists with dissemination of health indicator data, including, but not limited to, data verification and preparation of the data for reporting.

4. Participates in the design, development, and dissemination of policy-relevant information products targeted at specific stakeholder groups.


5. Prepares related documentation as required, including technical documentation, literature reviews and interpretive text.

6. Conducts ad hoc analyses to support special studies, liaising with key stakeholders to fully define data and/or analytical requirements.

7. Assists with other projects, special studies, ad hoc reports, articles for publication or presentations, as required. Participates on CIHI project teams as required.

8. Develops and maintains knowledge of CIHI's data holdings, related data held by other organizations, and tools used by CIHI to access these data holdings.

9. Maintains current knowledge about analytical techniques, health services and population health research, and stakeholder information needs.

10. Assumes responsibility for other related duties as assigned.


What you'll bring to the table
Undergraduate degree in health sciences, health policy, health economics, social sciences, statistics or similar field. Graduate degree is an asset.

Three to five years’ experience working in a health care research or health policy, including the analysis, design and dissemination of research studies and related information products. Preference will be given to candidates with experience in one or more of the following:
o experience with administrative health data (e.g. DAD and NACRS)
o manipulating and analyzing large, complex databases


Advanced knowledge and experience in using SAS for data manipulation and statistical analysis. SAS Certified Advanced Programmer for SAS 9 is preferred.

Working knowledge of Python is an asset

Experience in client support and preparation of statistical and descriptive reports.

Sound conceptual knowledge of determinants of health, the measurement of health status, and the Canadian health system.

Strong analytical, interpersonal and communication skills.

Experience within a hospital decision support or quality improvement environment is an asset.

Experience with electronic health system performance measurement tools or business intelligence tools is an asset.


Closing Statement
To find out more about this role and other exciting opportunities visit our website at www.cihi.ca and check out our 'Careers' section.
We thank all those who apply, however, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
Vaccination remains the most effective tool to reduce the risk of COVID-19. CIHI is committed to ensuring the health and safety of our employees in the workplace, and therefore CIHI requires proof of vaccination for all of our employees unless a valid accommodation under legislation exists.


Employment Equity
At CIHI we are committed to fostering an inclusive, barrier-free and accessible environment. Part of this commitment includes arranging accommodations to ensure an equitable opportunity to participate in the recruitment and selection process. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.




Analyste principal, Indicateurs de santé et Soutien à la clientèle


Notre organisation
Notre organisation regroupe des leaders d'opinion de l'industrie qui sont passionnés par les données et veulent faire bouger les choses dans le domaine de la santé. À titre d'organisme autonome et sans but lucratif, nous collaborons avec nos partenaires pour fournir de l'information essentielle sur les systèmes de santé au pays, favorisant la prise de décisions éclairées qui visent à améliorer la santé des Canadiens. À titre d'employé de l'ICIS, vous jouerez un rôle déterminant dans l'évolution du système de santé canadien.
Nous offrons un milieu de travail exceptionnel qui favorise la diversité, le respect, l'intégrité, la collaboration et l'innovation.
L'ICIS, sachant ce qui importe à ses employés, leur offre une gamme d'avantages, dont les suivants :
une structure salariale concurrentielle
un régime d'avantages sociaux flexible dès le premier jour de travail
l'adhésion au régime de retraite HOOPP
un programme de planification de la retraite
un équilibre travail-vie personnelle
un programme de planification de carrière
des programmes d'apprentissage et de perfectionnement professionnel


Pourquoi ce rôle est-il important ?
La Division des indicateurs de santé et du soutien à la clientèle est responsable du calcul et de la diffusion des résultats de divers indicateurs de la performance du système de santé à l’échelle des hôpitaux et des provinces et territoires canadiens. L’analyste principal est un membre important de l’équipe. Il contribue à l’élaboration, à la vérification, à l’analyse et à la diffusion d’une série d’indicateurs qui visent à fournir aux dispensateurs de soins, aux décideurs de la santé, aux chercheurs et au grand public des données fiables et comparables sur diverses dimensions de la performance du système de santé dans le but de promouvoir l’amélioration de la qualité. Par ailleurs, l’analyste principal répond aux demandes des clients, collabore avec d’autres intervenants à l’interne afin de définir les exigences en matière de données, et collabore avec d’autres intervenants externes, au besoin.


Quelles seront vos responsabilités ?
1. Programmer et exécuter des analyses informatiques en vue de l’informatisation, de l’analyse et de la vérification des indicateurs, ce qui peut comprendre la prise en charge d’un ensemble défini d’indicateurs.

2. Mener un examen méthodique des indicateurs existants, ce qui comprend les analyses de données et les analyses documentaires nécessaires.

3. Participer à la diffusion des données sur les indicateurs de santé, y compris la vérification des données et la préparation des données pour les rapports.

4. Participer à la conception, à l’élaboration et à la diffusion de produits d’information axés sur les politiques à l’intention de groupes d’intervenants ciblés.

5. Préparer au besoin des documents pertinents, notamment des documents techniques, des analyses documentaires et des textes interprétatifs.

6. Réaliser des analyses ponctuelles pour appuyer les études spéciales, et créer des liens avec les principaux intervenants dans le but de définir clairement les exigences en matière de données ou d’analyse.

7. Participer à d’autres projets, études spéciales, rapports ponctuels ou articles destinés à la publication ou à des présentations, au besoin. Collaborer avec les équipes de projets de l’ICIS, au besoin.

8. Cultiver sa connaissance des banques de données de l’ICIS, des données connexes détenues par d’autres organismes et des outils utilisés par l’ICIS pour accéder à ces banques de données.

9. Rester au fait des techniques analytiques, de la recherche sur les services de santé et la santé de la population, et des besoins en information des intervenants.

10. Assumer d’autres fonctions connexes, au besoin.


Que mettriez-vous à profit ?

Baccalauréat en sciences de la santé, en politiques de la santé, en économie de la santé, en sciences sociales, en statistique ou dans un domaine connexe; diplôme d’études supérieures, un atout.
De 3 à 5 ans d’expérience de l’analyse, de l’élaboration et de la diffusion d’études de recherche et de produits d’information connexes dans le domaine des politiques ou de la recherche sur les soins de santé. La préférence sera accordée aux candidats ayant de l’expérience dans au moins l’un des domaines suivants :
o données administratives sur la santé (p. ex. BDCP et SNISA NACRS);

Title: Senior Analyst-CPG Manufacturer
Description:
Job Description
As part of this team, you will work together with our Consumer Packaged Goods clients to cultivate value-added partnership relationships. The goal is to become the primary and leading source of business insights for NielsenIQ’s clients.

As a Senior Analyst, you will add value through a strong understanding of client needs and providing them with the products, services and analytical insights that will help achieve their business goals. The successful candidate will have experience and/or knowledge in working with data , performing analysis integrating a wide variety of data sources and presenting to clients. You will work within a team environment where you will develop solid relationships with your own team and within the client organization.

The Ideal Candidate Will Have
Post-secondary degree in Marketing/Business and/or related field
4+ years of marketing, retail or category management experience
Strong analytical skills preferably in the CPG or Retail industry
Demonstrated ability to provide insight into the data and address client business issues
Excellent communication skills
Excellent presentation skills
Strong client relationship building/management skills
Knowledge of NielsenIQ products and services an asset
The aptitude to look for ways to challenge the status quo
Ability to multi-task and capable of independent decision making with a bold, nimble and collaborative approach to problem solving

Accountable, results driven and open to new ideas and ongoing learning
Proactively create innovative insights that challenge the status quo
Strong sales mindset with the ability to influence and build strong client relationships

Additional Information
About NielsenIQ
NielsenIQ is a global measurement and data analytics company that provides the most complete and trusted view available of consumers and markets worldwide. We provide consumer packaged goods manufacturers/fast-moving consumer goods and retailers with accurate, actionable information and insights and a complete picture of the complex and changing marketplace that companies need to innovate and grow. Our approach marries proprietary NielsenIQ data with other data sources to help clients around the world understand what’s happening now, what’s happening next, and how to best act on this knowledge. We like to be in the middle of the action. That’s why you can find us at work in over 90 countries, covering more than 90% of the world’s population. For more information, visit www.niq.com.
NielsenIQ is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. Title: Senior Analyst, Health Indicators and Client Support
Description:
Category Data Analysis

City Ottawa, Toronto, Ontario, Canada


Job Description Senior Analyst, Health Indicators and Client Support


Who we are
We are an organization comprised of industry thought leaders who are passionate about health data and want to make a difference in the health care field. We are an independent, not-for-profit organization and together with our partners we provide essential information on Canada's health systems, enabling decisions that lead to healthier Canadians. As a valued member of the CIHI team, you and your work will have a pivotal role in the evolution of Canada's health care systems.
CIHI is recognized as an exceptional place to work that embraces diversity, respect, integrity, collaboration and innovation.
At CIHI, we recognize what matters to our employees. Some of the benefits of working at CIHI include
HOOPP Pension Plan (Defined Pension)
Retirement Planning Program
Generous vacation days for permanent and long-term contracts
Work-life balance
Career Planning Program
Learning and Professional Development Program
Flexible benefits program from your first day on the job for permanent and long-term contracts


Why is this role important?
The Health Indicators and Client Support area is responsible for the calculation and dissemination of various indicators of health system performance for hospitals and jurisdictions across the country. The Senior Analyst is a key member of the team and is contributing to the compilation, verification, analysis and dissemination of a set of indicators intended to provide health providers, health decision-makers, researchers and the public with reliable and comparable data on various dimensions of health care performance to promote quality improvement. The Senior Analyst also responds to client requests, works with other internal stakeholders to define data requirements and may also liaise with other external parties as required.


What you'll do
1. Writes and executes computer analyses required for the computation, analysis, and/or verification of the indicators. This may include taking responsibility over a defined suite of indicators.

2. Conducts the methodological reviews of the existing set of indicators, including the relevant data analyses and literature reviews.

3. Assists with dissemination of health indicator data, including, but not limited to, data verification and preparation of the data for reporting.

4. Participates in the design, development, and dissemination of policy-relevant information products targeted at specific stakeholder groups.


5. Prepares related documentation as required, including technical documentation, literature reviews and interpretive text.

6. Conducts ad hoc analyses to support special studies, liaising with key stakeholders to fully define data and/or analytical requirements.

7. Assists with other projects, special studies, ad hoc reports, articles for publication or presentations, as required. Participates on CIHI project teams as required.

8. Develops and maintains knowledge of CIHI's data holdings, related data held by other organizations, and tools used by CIHI to access these data holdings.

9. Maintains current knowledge about analytical techniques, health services and population health research, and stakeholder information needs.

10. Assumes responsibility for other related duties as assigned.


What you'll bring to the table
Undergraduate degree in health sciences, health policy, health economics, social sciences, statistics or similar field. Graduate degree is an asset.

Three to five years’ experience working in a health care research or health policy, including the analysis, design and dissemination of research studies and related information products. Preference will be given to candidates with experience in one or more of the following:
o experience with administrative health data (e.g. DAD and NACRS)
o manipulating and analyzing large, complex databases


Advanced knowledge and experience in using SAS for data manipulation and statistical analysis. SAS Certified Advanced Programmer for SAS 9 is preferred.

Working knowledge of Python is an asset

Experience in client support and preparation of statistical and descriptive reports.

Sound conceptual knowledge of determinants of health, the measurement of health status, and the Canadian health system.

Strong analytical, interpersonal and communication skills.

Experience within a hospital decision support or quality improvement environment is an asset.

Experience with electronic health system performance measurement tools or business intelligence tools is an asset.


Closing Statement
To find out more about this role and other exciting opportunities visit our website at www.cihi.ca and check out our 'Careers' section.
We thank all those who apply, however, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
Vaccination remains the most effective tool to reduce the risk of COVID-19. CIHI is committed to ensuring the health and safety of our employees in the workplace, and therefore CIHI requires proof of vaccination for all of our employees unless a valid accommodation under legislation exists.


Employment Equity
At CIHI we are committed to fostering an inclusive, barrier-free and accessible environment. Part of this commitment includes arranging accommodations to ensure an equitable opportunity to participate in the recruitment and selection process. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.




Analyste principal, Indicateurs de santé et Soutien à la clientèle


Notre organisation
Notre organisation regroupe des leaders d'opinion de l'industrie qui sont passionnés par les données et veulent faire bouger les choses dans le domaine de la santé. À titre d'organisme autonome et sans but lucratif, nous collaborons avec nos partenaires pour fournir de l'information essentielle sur les systèmes de santé au pays, favorisant la prise de décisions éclairées qui visent à améliorer la santé des Canadiens. À titre d'employé de l'ICIS, vous jouerez un rôle déterminant dans l'évolution du système de santé canadien.
Nous offrons un milieu de travail exceptionnel qui favorise la diversité, le respect, l'intégrité, la collaboration et l'innovation.
L'ICIS, sachant ce qui importe à ses employés, leur offre une gamme d'avantages, dont les suivants :
une structure salariale concurrentielle
un régime d'avantages sociaux flexible dès le premier jour de travail
l'adhésion au régime de retraite HOOPP
un programme de planification de la retraite
un équilibre travail-vie personnelle
un programme de planification de carrière
des programmes d'apprentissage et de perfectionnement professionnel


Pourquoi ce rôle est-il important ?
La Division des indicateurs de santé et du soutien à la clientèle est responsable du calcul et de la diffusion des résultats de divers indicateurs de la performance du système de santé à l’échelle des hôpitaux et des provinces et territoires canadiens. L’analyste principal est un membre important de l’équipe. Il contribue à l’élaboration, à la vérification, à l’analyse et à la diffusion d’une série d’indicateurs qui visent à fournir aux dispensateurs de soins, aux décideurs de la santé, aux chercheurs et au grand public des données fiables et comparables sur diverses dimensions de la performance du système de santé dans le but de promouvoir l’amélioration de la qualité. Par ailleurs, l’analyste principal répond aux demandes des clients, collabore avec d’autres intervenants à l’interne afin de définir les exigences en matière de données, et collabore avec d’autres intervenants externes, au besoin.


Quelles seront vos responsabilités ?
1. Programmer et exécuter des analyses informatiques en vue de l’informatisation, de l’analyse et de la vérification des indicateurs, ce qui peut comprendre la prise en charge d’un ensemble défini d’indicateurs.

2. Mener un examen méthodique des indicateurs existants, ce qui comprend les analyses de données et les analyses documentaires nécessaires.

3. Participer à la diffusion des données sur les indicateurs de santé, y compris la vérification des données et la préparation des données pour les rapports.

4. Participer à la conception, à l’élaboration et à la diffusion de produits d’information axés sur les politiques à l’intention de groupes d’intervenants ciblés.

5. Préparer au besoin des documents pertinents, notamment des documents techniques, des analyses documentaires et des textes interprétatifs.

6. Réaliser des analyses ponctuelles pour appuyer les études spéciales, et créer des liens avec les principaux intervenants dans le but de définir clairement les exigences en matière de données ou d’analyse.

7. Participer à d’autres projets, études spéciales, rapports ponctuels ou articles destinés à la publication ou à des présentations, au besoin. Collaborer avec les équipes de projets de l’ICIS, au besoin.

8. Cultiver sa connaissance des banques de données de l’ICIS, des données connexes détenues par d’autres organismes et des outils utilisés par l’ICIS pour accéder à ces banques de données.

9. Rester au fait des techniques analytiques, de la recherche sur les services de santé et la santé de la population, et des besoins en information des intervenants.

10. Assumer d’autres fonctions connexes, au besoin.


Que mettriez-vous à profit ?

Baccalauréat en sciences de la santé, en politiques de la santé, en économie de la santé, en sciences sociales, en statistique ou dans un domaine connexe; diplôme d’études supérieures, un atout.
De 3 à 5 ans d’expérience de l’analyse, de l’élaboration et de la diffusion d’études de recherche et de produits d’information connexes dans le domaine des politiques ou de la recherche sur les soins de santé. La préférence sera accordée aux candidats ayant de l’expérience dans au moins l’un des domaines suivants :
o données administratives sur la santé (p. ex. BDCP et SNISA NACRS);
o manipulation et analyse de bases de données d’envergures et complexes.

Connaissance approfondie et expérience de l’utilisation de SAS pour la manipulation de données et l’analyse statistique. Certification « SAS Certified Advanced Programmer for SAS 9 », un atout.

Connaissance pratique de Python, un atout.

Expérience du soutien à la clientèle et de la préparation de rapports statistiques et descriptifs.

Bonne connaissance conceptuelle des déterminants de la santé, des mesures de l’état de santé et du système de santé du Canada.

Excellentes aptitudes pour l’analyse, les relations interpersonnelles et la communication.

Expérience dans un environnement d’aide à la décision ou d’amélioration de la qualité en milieu hospitalier, un atout.

Expérience des outils électroniques de mesure de la performance du système de santé ou des outils d’exploitation des données, un atout.

Maîtrise de l’anglais essentielle, maîtrise du français, un atout.


Declaration

Nous remercions tous les participants, mais nous ne communiquerons qu'avec les candidats retenus.

Title: BI Data Scientist

About Fusemachines
Fusemachines is a leading AI strategy, talent, and education services provider. Founded by Sameer Maskey Ph.D., Adjunct Associate Professor at Columbia University, Fusemachines has a core mission of democratizing AI. With a presence in 4 countries (Nepal, the United States, Canada, and the Dominican Republic and more than 250 full-time employees) Fusemachines seeks to bring its global expertise in AI to transform companies around the world.
About the role:
We are looking for a BI Data Scientist who has experience in online gambling and can write codes and is interested in taking over tasks from the Data Science Team. Amongst others, you build a self-service analytics solution and support various stakeholders' needs by providing insights in various formats (reports, dashboards, and analysis). Being a field expert, the BI Data Scientist needs to understand business challenges and the data maturity of the clients to build the most adapted solution including using Machine learning.
This is a part-time consulting role and it could over time become a full-time consulting position.
Role scope:
You deliver business intelligence solutions and provide thought leadership and technical consultation to the various stakeholders that the team supports
You occasionally design and develop the ETL processes for the proposed data model and utilize them efficiently

statistics, machine learning, deep learning, decision trees, clustering, network analysis, graph theory, regression analysis, topological data analysis

University Degree. in a scientific discipline such as mathematics, data science, IT or physics. Ideally, you also hold a master’s degree.
Proficiency. Minimum 2 years of experience in Business Intelligence or data analytics. Preferably 3+ years of work experience.
Programming Skills. You are an experienced user of Python and gained experience in Machine Learning.
Tools. Proficient with dashboarding tools such as QlikSense, Domo, Tableau, or other enterprise tools.
Technical background. Solid technical background with a complete understanding of database design and modelling using Redshift, MySQL, SQL Server, or other relational databases.
Analytical Thinker. Passion for analytics and strong analytical abilities.
Teamwork. Experience in working closely with a data team or an analytics team.
Who we’re looking for:
Agile Mindset. This is about learning and adapting, continuously improving what we do to deliver a valuable product to our customers. You collaborate and communicate leading to team success
Team player. We love learning from each other, great ideas are shaped and inspired by other ideas in order to achieve the simplest, smartest, and safest solution
Innovative. We create space for ideas and love to use the newest technologies. To be cutting edge, we need to stay on top and deliver an amazing digital experience

Title: Business Analyst, Catalog Authorization, Brand Protection
Description:
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Analytics, Statistics or related field
3+ years analyzing and interpreting data and experience with Redshift, PostgreSQL, Oracle, NoSQL etc.
Experience in writing complex SQL queries
Experience with data modeling, data warehousing, and building ETL pipelines
Experience with data visualization using Tableau, Quicksight, or similar tools

Job summary
At Amazon, we aim to be Earth’s most customer-centric company. To get there, we work passionately to drive a bar-raising experience initiatives for Selling Partners that sell on Amazon, who play a key role in product selection and customer experience. We are looking for a Business Intelligence Engineer to transform data into measurable business impact. In this role, you will use analytics to enhance our services, and provide automated reporting so that we can track how our programs enhance Customer experience and protect Brands from abuse. You are results-oriented and can think big about big data with demonstrated success in using analytics to drive product success.

The ideal candidate should be a self-starter, enjoy solving complex problems and building technical solutions in partnership with engineering and science teams. Being able to make data driven decisions and deliver results fast is a must.

Key job responsibilities
The BIE will be responsible for the following:

Apply deep analytic and business intelligence skills to extract meaningful insights and learning from large and complicated data sets
Design, develop and maintain scaled, automated, user-friendly systems, reports, dashboards, etc. that will support the needs of the business.
Be hands-on with ETL to build data pipelines to support automated reporting.
Serve as liaison between the business and technical teams to achieve the goal of providing actionable insights into current business performance, and ad hoc investigations to support future improvements or innovations. This will require data extraction and manipulation, problem solving, and communication of insights and recommendations.
Build various data visualizations to tell the story of business trends, patterns, and outliers through rich visualizations.
Recognize and adopt best practices in reporting and analysis: data integrity, test design, analysis, validation, and documentation
The individual should possess a track record of successful relationship management, strong business and analytical acumen, and experience working with product and engineering teams. The ideal candidate should be a self-starter, enjoy solving complex problems and building technical solutions in partnership with engineering and science teams.



About the team
The Catalog Authorization team within the Automated Brand Protection organization seeks to protect Brands across the world. In addition to building the next generation of abuse prevention systems, you will work with a wide variety of teams across various organizations to institute fundamental change in how we develop product and program solutions to protect our catalog on behalf of customers and brand owners worldwide.

Masters degree or higher in statistics, Computer Science or an equivalent quantitative field
5+ years of industry experience working as a BIE or related specialty
Experience using Cloud Storage and Computing technologies such as AWS Redshift, S3, Hadoop, etc.
Experience in scripting languages such as Python, etc.
Understanding of data warehousing and data modeling
Experience communicating results and business impact of analytical deep dives to senior leadership

Title: Crude Oil Marketing Analyst
Description:
Who we are:
Validere is a leading data and analytics SaaS provider for accelerating the energy transition. We’re on a mission to digitally transform the world’s largest supply chain to be commercially and environmentally efficient. Our Product Data Cloud enables energy companies to aggregate all product data sources into a single source of truth rapidly and seamlessly. Over 40 leading energy companies have partnered with Validere to identify new, hidden sources of value across the business. Our unique datasets and experts across data science, physical science, and oil and gas provide our clients a company-wide value engine that boosts commercial margins, reduces operational costs and risks, and ensures meaningful environmental progress.
Founded at Harvard University, Validere has since raised $70M+ from leading technology and energy investors, including Mercuria Energy America, BlackRock, Wing VC, Greylock Partners, and Y Combinator. With offices in Houston, Calgary, and Toronto, our 100+ employees focus every day on delivering the highest value, removing friction, and scaling results for every one of our customers.
In 2022, Validere and Phoenix Energy Marketing joined forces to empower the industry to easily execute on data analytics insights. Learn more.
Who you are:
To support our rapid growth, we are looking for a Crude Oil Marketing Analyst with focus on executing, improving, and expanding the existing suite of client services of our newly acquired subsidiary, Phoenix Energy Commercial Services. You’re just as excited as we are about building the most high-tech and innovative marketing platform and tools in Canada.

Reporting to our Professional Services Manager (Commercial), you will work closely with our Services team to deliver value to clients, spearhead onboarding of new clients, helping to identify and leverage value from Validere products and technologies, as well as reporting on account health and performance.
Let’s give you a purpose:
Own the crude oil marketing, transportation and blending activities for clients to deliver commercial value
Provide front, mid & back office Crude Oil marketing support, such as submitting Form “A” volume forecasts, monitoring & balancing positions, price reporting, netback analysis, assist with revenue accruals, contract negotiation and administration.
Coordinate shared goal-setting with our clients and execute on plans to achieve key commercial milestones and report out on account health/status to the Services Manager
Support seamless onboarding experiences for new clients
Work closely with our product team to (a) improve existing processes and streamline key marketing tasks leveraging technology, (b) evolve our marketing toolkit with new and exciting offerings for clients by leveraging your industry expertise and feedback from clients & prospects
Provide support to senior team members and share your industry knowledge and experiences to help drive product development
Assist sales efforts and pitches to prospects with your technical expertise as required
What you’ll bring along:
University degree or College degree in a related field, such as Accounting, Commerce, or Business Management/Administration, or equivalent experience
3-5 years of progressive responsibility and experience working with oil producers and/or oil marketing companies.
A deep knowledge and a robust skill set around the following:The upstream crude oil industry in Western Canada.The monthly crude oil marketing and sales cycle.Lease purchase contractsCrude oil feeder pipeline systems, storage operators & rail terminals.Crude oil truck transportation service providers.
Professional designation is considered an asset
What sets you apart:
You’re a great communicator and a meaningful relationship builder with clients and other stakeholders alike
You are keen to work in a dynamic tech-environment; you’re excited to build new tools to revolutionize the marketing space
Solving problems in a creative way excites you
You like identifying opportunities to improve existing processes and services
You’re a team player, and aim to be an integral part of shaping our Commercial Hub Sales & Product strategy by leveraging your deep industry expertise
You’re a problem solver at heart; your success is your client’s success
Our shared values:
Deliver (the highest) value
Remove friction
Everyday, more scalable
Be well, fair & transparent
Validere is an equal employment opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage applications from everyone regardless of race, colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, or disability status. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the interview process and beyond. We are committed to providing an inclusive, open, and diverse work environment.

Title: Technical Business Analyst
Description:
Role: Technical Business Analyst
Please address your cover letter to the hiring team at Habanero, and make sure to share: (1) why you think Habanero would be a great place to work, and (2) an interesting problem you have solved in your professional career.

You're passionate about creating amazing workplace experiences! Your peers and clients describe you as knowledgeable, tech-savvy, collaborative and curious. You have experience building trusted relationships with clients and see yourself as a technical consultant keen to continue building specialty in SharePoint, Viva and Microsoft 365. So, we’d like to meet you!

A technical business analyst (or digital workplace consultant) at Habanero works with enterprise-sized clients to determine how their business can use Microsoft 365 and our GO Intranet most effectively. It’s okay if you don’t have perfect experience in all of the role description or technology listed below; if you can learn quickly and work well with others to solve challenges just in time, we’d like to hear from you!

Habanero is looking to add this exciting full-time intermediate role to our already awesome team anywhere across Canada! This means you can work remotely anywhere in Canada or from one of our downtown offices in Vancouver, Calgary or Toronto, we're flexible! As an organization, we are passionate about creating exceptional experiences for our clients and their employees, and we believe that the best solutions begin and end with people. This is where you come in.
To get a picture of what this role looks like, imagine yourself…
Part of an inclusive and diverse team of Habs, passionate about helping people and organizations thrive
Working with enterprise-sized clients to determine how their business can use Microsoft 365 most effectively
Leading customer discovery and planning sessions to uncover employee experience challenges and insights to designing effective solutions
Analyzing data from people analytics, surveys and ethnographic research to design exceptional digital employee experiences
Learning on behalf of our clients in order to consult with knowledge and confidence on how workplace technologies, processes, systems and culture can be designed to help people and the organizations they work in thrive
Working with clients and our awesome team of developers, designers, quality assurance specialists, and project managers to create award-winning solutions on our GO Intranet
Supporting and evolving the solutions you help create

Chances are, you’re right for this role if you…
Bring experience working in a client-facing role, helping create intranets and implementing digital workplace programs of work
Are a good listener and clear communicator
Are keen to seek clarity from ambiguity and embrace complexity
Bring expertise in working with Microsoft SharePoint and/or Microsoft 365
Have experience facilitating in-person interviews and workshops
Are passionate about researching and analyzing client needs
Have experience organizing content and designing information architectures
Have portal management and governance knowledge
Are technically curious and up to date on current digital workplace trends – especially SharePoint, Viva and Microsoft 365 updates
Thrive in high-performing and non-hierarchical workplaces

If you plan on working remotely or from home regularly, you have...
An appropriate remote work setup, such as a quiet space and a trusted and reliable internet connection
Access to internet speeds of at least 15 Mbps down and 5 Mbps up (having the ability to connect via Ethernet for troubleshooting is required)

Bonus points if you have...
Experience with information architecture, experience design, and/or measurement and analytics
Experience with Power Platform, Power BI, ServiceNow and/or enterprise content management systems

The Hab hiring process
As mentioned above, please address your cover letter to the hiring team at Habanero, and make sure to share: (1) why you think Habanero would be a great place to work, and (2) an interesting problem you have solved in your professional career.

If we reach out, please expect a thorough interview process including some meet and greets with Habs, a 2-hour core competency interview and reference checks with past employers or other contacts. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all steps of our hiring process. While we’d love to meet everyone who applies, only those who are short-listed will be contacted. All applicants will receive a notification when the role is closed or filled. Thanks for taking the time to apply!

A little bit about Habanero
Habanero is a Canadian consulting company with offices in Calgary, Toronto, Vancouver and Winnipeg. We are passionate about helping people and organizations thrive. We believe that every organization can be exceptional, and we help to humanize the world of work through the creation of modern workplaces and the cultural, communication, collaboration and content experiences that power them. Our solutions are globally recognized, and we have consecutively ranked as one of Canada's top ten best places to work for the last 11 years. Habanero is proud to be ranked #9 on the Great Place to Work® Canada List of Best Workplaces™ for 2021.

The best kind of work
Habanero is an organization where people who are creative, hard-working, friendly, honest and open come together to do great work. We have a shared passion for solving complex issues that will benefit other people and organizations. We only hire people we can count on, so you can be certain that you are joining a team of happy and competent team members. We service our clients and projects across Canadian time zones and consultants are resourced on cross-regional teams.

Supporting each other in personal growth
We are a lattice organization, meaning that there is no traditional hierarchy. There is no typical boss, and you don’t report to a manager. Instead, we have a more holistic approach to mentorship – we offer employee journey coaches who are there to help you with all things career and life. We believe it’s up to you to make the most out of your career, and we are here to support and encourage you every step of the way.

A diverse culture of clever humans
At Habanero, we celebrate diversity and inclusivity. We are committed to creating and supporting equal employment opportunities regardless of age, race, ancestry, ethnic origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, family status or disability. We have included a personalized submission field in our application form to provide an additional opportunity for you to tell your story outside of the traditional resume and cover letter.

Compensation
Our compensation package includes a technology allowance, a wellness allowance, flexible work hours, the option to work from home, health and dental coverage, a health spending account and RRSP matching. We also enjoy smaller perks like free snacks and drinks and group lunches where you can reconnect with your team after a long week. There are training and development opportunities for those who wish to continue evolving their skills. All employees start at three weeks of vacation.

Bringing life to work
Everyone at Habanero probably has their own story around this, but it's probably safe to say that it starts with people feeling like they can bring their whole selves to work. The cornerstone idea is that we want to support people having great lives, not just great work lives (we can't say our relationship begins at 9:00 and ends at 5:00). Other things we've heard make the difference for Habs:
People starting their careers get to jump in and gain experience right away
Employee journey support system (career coach)
The culture of trust, transparency, inclusivity, collaboration, autonomy... to name a few
The awesome people that work here (of course)
Flexible work schedule
Training and development opportunities when we can support them
We recently asked Habs to share what they feel makes us one of the Best Places to Work in Canada and the loudest response was 'our people' (with 'our teams' and 'balance' not far behind). So, if this sounds like something you want to be a part of, and you have the skills and experience to contribute, then we want to meet you!

Title: Business Analyst, Omni-Channel (E-Commerce)
Description:
Your Opportunity at ARC’TERYX:
As the Business Analyst, Omni-Channel, you will act as the conduit between Information Systems (IS) and multiple business teams. You assist with our configuration and integration projects by eliciting and analyzing requirements, liaising between business and technical resources, and documenting business processes or systems and their integration. You must be able to quickly absorb new and different types of information, modify and adapt existing knowledge, and work in a changing and evolving environment, to ensure successful project delivery using an agile scrum methodology. You are a critical thinker who enjoys diving into the details and seeking to understand the “how” and “why”.
Meet Your Future Team:
The Omni-Channel e-commerce team partners closely with various parts of the business to deliver the Arc’teryx digital customer roadmap from product merchandising to the completion of an online order. In this role, you will work with talented teams to deliver new systems and enhancements that will strengthen the e-commerce user and brand experience. We dig in and get to the root of the right problems and seek to be the most knowledgeable people within Arc’teryx to help the business be successful.
Is this job open to relocation? No
Will there be Visa support? No
Can this job be hired remote? Yes


If you were the Business Analyst, Omni-Channel now, here are some of the core activities you would be doing:
Leading the discovery of new e-commerce projects and gather requirements using effective business analysis techniques
Translating business requirements into detailed and actionable specifications
Creating understandable visual representations to communicate complex concepts and models for various target audiences
Documenting detailed user stories, process flows, system flows, and acceptance criteria that will be used for business process review, systems architecture, and quality assurance
Identifying and documenting business process, changes, and improvements
Facilitating and managing stakeholder engagement
Maintaining process and system documentation as business and systems evolve
Here are some of the things you could be working on in the future:
Developing, updating, and embedding your extensive expertise on business areas & technologies in scope within the Business Analysts chapter and the agile squads
Preparing and coordinating system changes for release, organizing and leading product demo sessions, coordinating user training, arranging special hardware requirements with IS Infrastructure Manager
Consulting the e-commerce business teams in vendor selection and future technologies
Assisting the IS leadership team with other tasks and projects as required
Are you our next Business Analyst, Omni-Channel?
You have a Bachelor’s degree or post-secondary education in business, information systems or a relevant field, completion of a recognized Business Analysis program, and/or equivalent business experience
You have 3+ years of experience as a Business Analyst, working on agile projects related to e-commerce, retail & omni-channel
You have experience with working in an Agile methodology
You have excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate with all levels of stakeholders to be able to explain, articulate, and document concepts, business processes, systems and business requirements efficiently
You have strong organization and prioritization skills while managing multiple, competing priorities
You have excellent time management skills with the ability to plan ahead and meet deadlines
You are familiar with web-development
You possess a high level of analytical and critical thinking
You are a strong troubleshooting skills
You have a solid understanding of data models (ERDs)
You have experience using JIRA
You are proactive in identifying the root cause of issues and developing solutions
You remain highly flexible and adaptable when faced with ambiguity
You are able to balance autonomy and collaboration
You inspire breakthrough thinking and continuous improvement
You seek the best (but sometimes not the easiest) solutions, with an unwavering commitment to do what is right
You have experience with different technologies and application integrations using service layers
You have experience with working in the (Outdoor) Apparel or Retail industry
Your passion for your work is paralleled by your passion for getting outside and living it
Equal Opportunity
Arc’teryx is committed to actively creating and fostering a culture of inclusivity where voices are heard, people are seen, and values are respected. We care about the uniqueness of our applicants, employees, and guests, and we do so in a safe space fueled by curiosity and acceptance.
Creating an inclusive workplace is connected to our core value Do Right while also having the added benefit of helping make our business better. We believe inclusion helps us to create a healthier, happier workplace, drive creativity and innovation, and reflect the communities where we operate.
All applicants, employees, and guests can expect equality of opportunity and fair treatment in alignment with our values.
Design your Purpose. Live our Values.
DISRUPTIVE EVOLUTION. Design your future through challenge, experimentation, and inspiration.
COMMIT. Set and deliver on bold objectives as we collectively raise the bar.
LIVE IT. Deepen your connection to nature and live your most purposeful life.
LEAVE IT BETTER. Create a better world, together.

Title: Senior Performance Analyst
Description:
1 Full Time Permanent Position 
INTERNAL/EXTERNAL POSTING  
DATE: April 11th, 2022  LOCATION: Toronto, ON 
COMPENSATION: $65,986 – $88,016 (Prorated) 


 LOFT Community Services is a unique and dynamic charitable organization that supports 
people living with complicated issues such as mental and physical health challenges,  substance abuse, poverty and homelessness. Serving over 9,500 people and providing 
1,733 units of supportive housing last year, LOFT is one of Ontario’s largest mental health  service providers of its kind.  
LOFT is recognized as a Nonprofit Employer of Choice™ Award (NEOC) recipient.  
 To help fulfill its mission, LOFT is hiring a Senior Performance Analyst  

JOB SUMMARY: 
The Senior Performance Analyst will work with the other members of the Administration  and System Management team to meet the business and reporting needs of LOFT staff, 
program directors, and senior management. The individual will lead the development and  maintenance of all reporting, analytics and quality improvement initiatives.  

Note: All LOFT employees are required to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated as a condition of 

hire in accordance with LOFT’s Vaccination Policy. A satisfactory vulnerable sector check 
(VSC) is also required.* 

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: 
Reporting and Analysis 
Deliver and maintain weekly, monthly, quarterly reporting products to various  stakeholders. 
Support decision-making, through the development and ongoing maintenance of 
strategic and operational reports, key performance indicators, dashboards, and  executive summaries. 




Work with program directors to identify performance gaps and establish and follow- up on action plans. 
Design blueprint and provide recommendations for new reports to turn data into  actionable insights for key stakeholders. 
Manage, prioritize and deliver ad-hoc reporting requests using internal and external  datasets. 
Support the organization in operationalizing the strategic plan, including identifying 
and defining KPIs, and building the appropriate scorecards for ongoing performance  management. 
 Business Requirements 
Bridge the gap between the technical and program functions by translating 
requirements both ways 
Support reporting and technology projects by leading the requirements gathering  process; create and manage appropriate documentation e.g. functional 
specifications, use cases, user stories, workflow diagrams  Develop and lead the QA and UAT process as related to data warehouse and 
business intelligence report development. 
Conduct feasibility analysis; work with stakeholders to identify alternative solutions  to meet end-user needs. 
 Quality Improvement 
Support the Manager in building a culture of quality and continuous improvement. 
With the focus on continuous improvement, conduct ongoing  quantitative/qualitative analysis with program directors and senior staff (e.g. key 
metrics); proactively assess results and identify and explain unanticipated  variations from targets/budgets and provide improvement recommendations. 
Use quantitative and qualitative methods to define the problem, measure the 
current state, identify root cause, and implement and sustain solutions.  Support quality improvement projects by leading exercises e.g. process mapping 
(value stream mapping, fishbone, SIPOC), root cause analysis, etc.  Support the knowledge base by creating and delivering articles, user training 
sessions and other documentation. 
 Project Management 
Work closely with project leads and sponsors to define project business and  technical requirements, scope and objectives. 
Use PMBOK guide and principles to plan, execute and deliver IT, reporting and 
quality improvement projects within the Administration and System Management  team. 
Support and maintain projects and work plans to ensure completion of deliverables  on time, and escalate project risks as appropriate. 
Support department with development of presentation material where required 
Perform other duties as necessary.  
  QUALIFICATIONS: 




Undergraduate degree in a related field (analytics, statistics, epidemiology, health  informatics, or equivalent) required. 
A minimum of 5 years relevant work experience.  Understanding of Ontario healthcare system, organization, policies, and data 
structures.  Experience in data analysis, reporting, and the ability to translate information into a 
convincing written argument or business case. 
Experience in translating business requirements into technical and reporting  requirements. 
Understanding of data modelling concepts as they relate to data warehousing and  business intelligence. 
Ability to manipulate and work with large data sets. 
Experience in leading QA and UAT process.  Experience with Microsoft Office tools including Excel, Word and PowerPoint required. 
Skilled in creating products (e.g. Reports, presentations) for multiple audiences.  Experience with MS SQL and/or Microstrategy is an asset  Demonstrated experience with process mapping tools and techniques. 
Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks in parallel; strong  problem-solving skills and demonstrated ability to think critically and strategically. 
Detail-oriented and process-driven with a demonstrated ability to consistently and  effectively produce high quality work. 
Excellent oral and written communication skills; ability to explain complex concepts in  a manner that is simple and easy to understand. 
Proven team player with strong interpersonal skills including ability to resolve conflicts, 
diplomacy, achieve consensus and able to work comfortably with staff and external  stakeholders, including clinicians. 
Innovative thinker with the ability to develop creative solutions to complex problems.  Demonstrated ability to work in matrix structure, but with minimal supervision as a 
self-starter. 
Familiar with Quality Improvement/Lean principles and methodologies.  Lean/Quality Improvement certification is an asset. 
PMP certification is an asset, MS Project experience is an asset.  Experience in healthcare is an asset.  Experience in writing business case / proposals is an asset. 
Understanding of cultural competency and anti-oppression framework.  Reflective of a multi-barriered group, as serviced by the program, a strong asset. 

TO APPLY: Send resume with cover letter to Human Resources, Email: hr@loftcs.org 
LOFT Community Services is committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible 
environment and dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the  community in which we live and serve. LOFT is committed to making employment 
opportunities accessible in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities  Act, 2005. Requested accommodation will be provided in all parts of the application and 
hiring process by contacting hr@loftcs.org or (416) 979-1994.  




We welcome and encourage people from equity-deserving communities and intersecting 
identities to apply for this position. 
PLEASE INCLUDE: “FT SR.PA” IN THE SUBJECT LINE OF ANY EMAILS. 
CLOSING DATE: April 29, 2022

Only those selected for interviews will be contacted and we thank all other applicants for their interest.McDougall Energy is committed to an inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection process and workplace. If you require any accommodations, please notify us and we will work with you to meet your needs.Job Type: Full-time

Description: We have the below requirement with one of our clients and its a 1 year contract with a probability of extension:Skills: SSIS/ADF, SQL Server, SSAS, Power Designer, Azure, ETLExperience with data architecture designs and technologies for BI solutions, using the Microsoft BI suite, for both on-premise and cloud solutions10+ years of experience for the following:  * ETL development experience using SSIS / ADF in a data warehousing environment or large data migration; Working experience in debugging mappings, transformations and source qualifier files and Unit testing the newly developed ETL componentsCube development experience using SSAS  * Experience using PowerDesigner to review data models, as well as make changes and generate DDL's Nice to have  * Public Sector experience Experience and Skill Set Requirements Technical Experience - 50%Experience with data architecture designs and technologies for BI solutions, using the Microsoft BI suite, for both on-premise and cloud solutions10+ years of experience for the following: o ETL development experience using SSIS / ADF in a data warehousing environment or large data migration; Working experience in debugging mappings, transformations and source qualifier files and Unit testing the newly developed ETL components o Cube development experience using SSASExperience working with Oracle and MSSQL databases  * Extensive experience with source control and environment management  * Experience with creating documentations such as data dictionary and data source to target mapping; provide feedback/direction to team on how existing documentations can be improved  * Experience using PowerDesigner to review data models, as well as make changes and generate.Job Types: Full-time, Fixed term contractContract length: 12 monthsSalary: $50.00 per hourSchedule:8 hour shiftAbility to commute/relocate:Toronto, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Title: Senior Cyber Defense Fusion Analyst
Description:
Canada's Challenger Bank™



 Equitable Group Inc. trades on the Toronto Stock Exchange (TSX: EQB and EQB.PR.C) and serves a growing number of Canadians through Equitable Bank, Canada's Challenger Bank™. Equitable Bank has grown to become the country's eighth largest independent Schedule I bank with a clear mandate to drive real change in Canadian banking to enrich people's lives. Founded over 50 years ago, Equitable Bank provides diversified personal and commercial banking and through its EQ Bank platform has been named #1 Bank in Canada on the Forbes World's Best Banks 2021 list. EQ Bank provides state-of-the-art digital banking services, like the Savings Plus Account that reimagines banking by offering an everyday high interest rate, plus the flexibility of a chequing account, as well as a wide range of smart banking solutions for Canadians, like fast international money transfers, US dollar accounts and a suite of registered products.
   


 Level 7 out of 12



 Purpose of the Job


 


     The Senior Cyber Defense Fusion Analyst is responsible for operating and optimizing tools and processes to ensure fast and flawless detection, investigation, and response to attacks targeting the digital bank, both from the perspective of cyber security and fraud. Their primary responsibilities will be focused on the intersection of cyber security and fraud, including threat intelligence, event correlation, threat monitoring, analytics, investigation, incident response, and after-action reviews.
   





 Main Activities

 Perform the day-to-day operational responsibilities related to fraud and cyber security threat detection and response including threat intelligence, centralized log management (CLM), security event correlation (SIEM), threat monitoring, data analytics, investigations, and incident response. Examines security log information to determine trends and identify security incidents or areas for improvement related to fraud and cyber security Review customer account activity and related trends for potential cases of account takeovers and/or fraud Work closely with internal Fraud teams on proactive detection, response, and strategies Build reports on fusion monitoring for executives and upper management Maintain documentation of operational procedures and similar references, including incident response plan and incident response playbooks. Provide input to the strategic plan and roadmap for all threat detection and response functions. Provide technical expertise and technology investment recommendations for new technologies and systems related to fraud and cyber security Track incidents, account takeovers, stolen assets, and attempt to find innovative ways to prevent future losses Contribute to the planning and execution of projects to build and/or improve fraud and cyber security threat detection and response capabilities Stay current on the fraud and cyber security threat landscape, including the latest attacker tactics, techniques and procedures, and the controls that may serve as effective countermeasures Practice continual improvement for fraud and cyber security threat detection and response practices, and participate in activities to identify improvements, including internal measurement practices, practice reviews and internal/external audits. On call, off-hours and/or shift work will be required







 Knowledge/Skill Requirements

 Bachelor Degree in Computer Science or related field. A minimum four (4) years working in an information technology role, or two (2) years working in an information security role. CISSP or similar certification is preferred. Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with minimal guidance and supervision. Experience in at least one of the following disciplines related to fraud and/or cyber security: threat intelligence, centralized log management (CLM), security event correlation (SIEM), threat monitoring, threat hunting, data analytics, investigations, and incident response. Knowledge of basic digital fraud trends, scams, criminal justice, and online crimes (nice to have). Ability to adapt to constantly changing technical, regulatory, and compliance environments. The incumbent is expected to interact with all employees including executives and thus good verbal and written skills are important. Experience working in a banking or financial services environment is an asset. Experience working with risk management and fraud detection tools. Excellent organized, structured, logical thinking and detail oriented analytic skills are required. Ability to think out of the box for solutions to technical problems.







     #LI-Hybrid
   


 What we offer [For full-time permanent roles]




     Competitive discretionary bonus
   

     ✨ Market leading RRSP match program
   

     Medical, dental, vision, life, and disability benefits
   

     Employee Share Purchase Plan
   

     Maternity/Parental top-up while you care for your little one
   

     Generous vacation policy, personal days and even a moving day
   

     Virtual events to connect with your fellow colleagues
   

     Education reimbursement program
   

     A fulfilling opportunity to join one of the top FinTechs and help create a new kind of banking experience
   


 Equitable Bank is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from all qualified candidates. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. All candidates considered for hire must successfully pass a criminal background check and credit check to qualify for hire. While we appreciate your interest in applying, an Equitable recruiter will only contact leading candidates whose skills and qualifications closely match the requirements of the position.

Title: Senior Operations Analyst
Description:
Come Work with Us!  At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.  Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.





































































































 Job Title




































 Senior Operations Analyst
  





































 Job Description





































 What is the opportunity?
 The Senior Operations Analyst will be responsible for the maintenance and day-to-day operations support of applications within Payments & Trade Technology with specific emphasis on the Payment Service Hub Services including most corporate payment types. You will ensure prompt resolution to any production problems. You will partner across T&O and assigned business lines to ensure requirements for changes are understood. You will work with the technical support team to jointly develop solutions to production problems.

 What will you do?

 Responsible for day-to-day operations support to Business Units (BU) and their supporting areas, the Help Centres and Project teams
 Responsible to work with the business unit(s) with priority setting for maintenance releases
 Apply analytical and business skills to proactively identify, track, manage and resolve application and operational issues. You will work closely with the technical staff, managing production issues while also working with partners ensuring updates are provided within a timely manner.
 Responsible for the review of requirements documents for accuracy and completeness and identify application deficiencies and provide / recommend solutions to the support team and BU
 Proactively seek opportunities for process improvements
 Participate as a SME in project / development work including participating in project walkthroughs to assist with the transition of projects from development to support.
 Conduct accurate and timely investigation of issues to ensure that the Service Level Agreement is not compromised
 Responsible for tracking all work requests , Problem Tracking Records, System Change Requests, Investigations, Work Items and maintaining accurate details and priority ratings


 What do you need to succeed?
 Must-have

 3-5 years of experience as an Operations Analyst or similar
 Professional experience working with multiple projects with multiple interfaces and/or 3rd parties in a technical environment
 Service oriented nature as this is a service and support position
 Business knowledge of RBC processes and or the Trade/Payments processing business. (ACH, WIRE, SWIFT)
 Analytical thinking in troubleshooting and analyzing data within applications
 Excellent written and verbal communication skills and works well within a team atmosphere


 Nice-to-have

 Payments experience

 What’s in it for you?
 We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

 A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
 Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
 Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
 Opportunities to do challenging work
 Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities
 Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies


 RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

 RBC exige, à titre de condition d'emploi, que tous les candidats retenus aux États-Unis ou au Canada soient entièrement vaccinés contre la COVID-19 avant leur date d'entrée en fonction. Il est possible qu'ils aient à présenter une preuve vaccinale. Des mesures raisonnables d'adaptation sont offertes lorsque la loi l'exige

 At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work.
