Title: Senior Operations Analyst
Description:
Come Work with Us!  At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.  Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.





































































































 Job Title




































 Senior Operations Analyst
  





































 Job Description





































 What is the opportunity?
 The Senior Operations Analyst will be responsible for the maintenance and day-to-day operations support of applications within Payments & Trade Technology with specific emphasis on the Payment Service Hub Services including most corporate payment types. You will ensure prompt resolution to any production problems. You will partner across T&O and assigned business lines to ensure requirements for changes are understood. You will work with the technical support team to jointly develop solutions to production problems.

 What will you do?

 Responsible for day-to-day operations support to Business Units (BU) and their supporting areas, the Help Centres and Project teams
 Responsible to work with the business unit(s) with priority setting for maintenance releases
 Apply analytical and business skills to proactively identify, track, manage and resolve application and operational issues. You will work closely with the technical staff, managing production issues while also working with partners ensuring updates are provided within a timely manner.
 Responsible for the review of requirements documents for accuracy and completeness and identify application deficiencies and provide / recommend solutions to the support team and BU
 Proactively seek opportunities for process improvements
 Participate as a SME in project / development work including participating in project walkthroughs to assist with the transition of projects from development to support.
 Conduct accurate and timely investigation of issues to ensure that the Service Level Agreement is not compromised
 Responsible for tracking all work requests , Problem Tracking Records, System Change Requests, Investigations, Work Items and maintaining accurate details and priority ratings


 What do you need to succeed?
 Must-have

 3-5 years of experience as an Operations Analyst or similar
 Professional experience working with multiple projects with multiple interfaces and/or 3rd parties in a technical environment
 Service oriented nature as this is a service and support position
 Business knowledge of RBC processes and or the Trade/Payments processing business. (ACH, WIRE, SWIFT)
 Analytical thinking in troubleshooting and analyzing data within applications
 Excellent written and verbal communication skills and works well within a team atmosphere


 Nice-to-have

 Payments experience

 What’s in it for you?
 We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

 A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
 Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
 Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
 Opportunities to do challenging work
 Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities
 Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies


 RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

 RBC exige, à titre de condition d'emploi, que tous les candidats retenus aux États-Unis ou au Canada soient entièrement vaccinés contre la COVID-19 avant leur date d'entrée en fonction. Il est possible qu'ils aient à présenter une preuve vaccinale. Des mesures raisonnables d'adaptation sont offertes lorsque la loi l'exige

Title: Senior Business Analyst
Description:
Job Description

As a Senior Business Analyst (Sr. BA), within Technology & Operations - Canada IT, you will work side-by-side with business organizations and key customers in Canada. The successful candidate will help to identify new product opportunities and understand new features and capabilities planned for existing products and services. You will provide a critical communication channel between the Canada Corporate Marketing and Innovation Team and multiple Digital Business Team Lines of Business. You will need to be familiar with the various Digital Products, Services and Digital Experiences to ensure that Canada is accurately represented in Product Roadmaps, OKRs, PI Planning and WSJF scoring.

Major duties / responsibilities:

Development of business process models, business requirements/user stories (functional and non-functional) and product backlogs.

Increased knowledge of company issues and data challenges of the business.

Serves as the requirement's liaison between the business community and the Digital Business Teams.

Interpret business requirements to articulate the business needs to be addressed.

Strong analysis skills are required to help breakdown problems/challenges into logical steps.

Effective at collaborating with cross-functional & global operations customers to gain consensus and drive support for new insights, products, and process.

Coordinate the efforts of internal and external customers and technical teams during the development and implementation of applications and processes.

Proactively identify user requirements, and application issues & solutions, which optimize the ability to achieve business objectives.

Prepare UAT test cases and actively participates in the testing phase of projects.

Additional Job Description

Requirements:

Post Secondary Education required, Computer Science Degree preferred

10+ years in an applicable business environment.

Proven understanding of Business Process fundamentals; including requirements elicitation, customer collaboration & communications, and problem-solving skills

Experience in IT project management including IT strategy and roadmap development.

Expertise in applying requirements tools

Experience with Dealer/Customer Business Processes

Experience with Agile development methodologies

Able to write and managed Business Requirements Documents, Epics, Features and User Stories

Understand Business Process Modeling

Knowledge in functional areas and business process domains.

Demonstrates critical skills such as collaboration, strong written and verbal communication skills, and analytical capability

Independently facilitate meetings.

Prioritize, manage multiple contending priorities, in a fast-paced environment

Successful candidates will be required to attest to, and be prepared to provide proof of, their vaccination status and that any job offer will be conditional on the candidate being fully vaccinated.

This role offers a Hybrid Work Appropriately strategy:


This position does not require an employee to be onsite full-time to perform most effectively. The employee's role enables them to work at a GM facility or off-site as frequently as needed or desired.

About GM

Our vision is a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion and we embrace the responsibility to lead the change that will make our world better, safer and more equitable for all.

Why Join Us

We aspire to be the most inclusive company in the world. We believe we all must make a choice every day - individually and collectively - to drive meaningful change through our words, our deeds and our culture. Our Work Appropriately philosophy supports our foundation of inclusion and provides employees the flexibility to work where they can have the greatest impact on achieving our goals, dependent on role needs. Every day, we want every employee, no matter their background, ethnicity, preferences, or location, to feel they belong to one General Motors team.

Diversity Information

General Motors is committed to being a workplace that is not only free of discrimination, but one that genuinely fosters inclusion and belonging. We strongly believe that workforce diversity creates an environment in which our employees can thrive and develop better products for our customers. We understand and embrace the variety through which people gain experiences whether through professional, personal, educational, or volunteeropportunities.

We encourage interested candidates to review the key responsibilities and qualifications and apply for any positions that match your skills and capabilities.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement

Accommodation is available for applicants with disabilities. Should you be contacted by General Motors of Canada, please advise if you require accommodation. General Motors of Canada values diversity and is an equal opportunity employer.

Title: Digital Marketing Analyst
Description:
Canada Drives is changing car buying in Canada! We are at the forefront of the biggest disruption to car shopping in our lifetime. For the first time ever, Canadians have the power to buy their next vehicle completely online. Our organization provides customers with a 100% online purchasing experience, from start to finish, including delivery right to their door!
Our Mission - be the easiest place to buy and sell your car in Canada.
Spring Financial (a subsidiary of Canada Drives), founded in 2014, has spent the last 7 years simplifying the lending process for millions of Canadians facing every type of financial circumstance.

Reporting to the Director, Analytics & Insights, the Digital Marketing Analyst is responsible for working with stakeholders to turn business problems into data analysis questions, and then unearthing deep insights through analysis of data. This includes selecting the appropriate methodology through which to conduct data analysis generating accurate and actionable insights through data education and visualization.


NOTE – This is a full-time permanent position, eligible for remote/work-from-home position and is open to all applicants from across Canada who are legally entitled to work in Canada. Occasional travel to downtown Vancouver will be required.


You’re a Fit if You:

Are talented & motivated to be the best at what you do.
Have an entrepreneurial attitude with an ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
Are proactive in identifying and delivering business insights.
Have strong problem-solving skills and can identify and troubleshoot problems in an efficient and effective manner.
Have attention to detail & are highly organized.


What You’ll Be Doing:

Analytics Manager and other stakeholders’ initiatives with your analytics expertise.
Track, monitor and collect web traffic data and provide detailed analysis, insights and recommendations.
Create and manage UTM tracking across multiple ad platforms.
Use tracking and reporting tools such as Google Analytics and Salesforce to analyze advertising effectiveness.
Create and update reports and dashboards on an ongoing basis to identify best ad combinations.
Keep up to date with best practices and standards in Analytics and Data Management.


What you should have:

A minimum of 2 years of experience in a data analytics role, with experience in manipulating data and producing succinct reporting for external teams.
Proficiency in spreadsheet applications with a firm understanding of SQL.
Have experience with A/B testing, site optimizations and tools similar to Adobe Target / Google Optimize.
Be fluent in English and have great interpersonal skills.
Have experience analyzing digital campaigns with six to seven figures monthly ad budgets.
Be resulted-oriented, creative and charismatic with the desire to share a laugh or two with your teammates.
Experience with Segment and Modern Product Analytics tools (Full Story, Amplitude) is an asset.


What We Will Give You:

Coaching, Mentoring & Career Development
Competitive Compensation
Comprehensive Benefits

Title: Sales Data Analyst
Description:
Are you looking to join one of Canada's Greatest Places to Work and be a part of making it even better?

 
Mister Safety Shoes is growing our New Customer Success Department and looking for an exceptional Sales Analyst to join our team.

 This is a Hybrid Work arrangement position, working our of our Toronto & Mississauga locations.


 At Mister Safety Shoes we are always seeking great people to continually grow our company and strengthen our culture. We believe that great people drive our business. We are looking for open-minded, responsive, caring individuals like yourself who are excited about working in a fast-paced, goal driven environment.

 What people say about you:


 As a Sales Analyst, you are a partner to the business. You are passionate about building relationships and helping others succeed. You are meticulous and detail oriented. You are a self-starter with strong time management & organizational skills who like to work in a fast-paced environment with minimal supervision.

 What's in it for me?
 An opportunity to join a newly created department with a focus on helping clients keep their Canadian employees safe by collecting, analyzing data to provide insights and recommendations that support sales, business accounts, forecasts, and business trends.
 


A day in the life:

By using Sales data analytics from Salesforce and Magstar- ERP system, provide actionable information and insights to the sales and customer success team.
Gain in-depth understanding of client needs, to ensure appropriate service levels with limited support and guidance. 
demonstrate a comfort level in seeking out & maintaining relationships with multiple contacts within an organization and delivering superior levels of customer service.



What you bring:


 Post-Secondary Education in a related field 
Knowledge of BI/Analytics platforms. Certifications are an asset-
Previous analysis and CRM experience (We use Salesforce)
Advanced proficiency in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook
Comfort in effectively meeting deadlines, managing conflicting priorities, and understanding business needs.
Delivering information to a wide variety of users
Integrity, professionalism and excellent communication and interpersonal skills that are required to handle both internal and external communications with tact and diplomacy
A sense of humor and an ability to work within a dedicated team of good-hearted people. 



What we offer:


 Mister Safety Shoes is celebrating our 50th year anniversary as a Canadian Company. 
We offer a competitive compensation package, perks and benefits. 



Is this the career step you've been seeking?


 Tell us why you are right for this role by submitting your resume and let's chat about it! 



Mister Safety Shoes has been certified as a Great Place to Work® and is proud to be a Best Workplaces™ in Canada in Retail and Hospitality & Best Workplaces™ in Ontario

 We are an equal opportunity employer and positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates. If required, please include accommodation requirements with your submission.

Title: Senior Credit Analyst
Description:
PayBright, an Affirm company, provides affordable and transparent installment payment plans to Canadians at checkout. As one of Canada's fastest-growing fintech companies, we partner with thousands of domestic and international retailers like Hudson's Bay, Samsung, Sephora, Wayfair, and eBay to offer flexible payment plans to consumers – both in-store and online. In January 2021, PayBright was acquired by Affirm, one of the leading payment solutions providers in North America and a pioneer in our industry. In addition to being aligned on nurturing a diverse and supportive work culture, both PayBright and Affirm believe in the continual innovation of financial products that meet the needs of the modern consumer in the US, Canada, and beyond.We are a remote-first, diverse, and growing team of over 200 people, with a physical office located in downtown Toronto.Visit us at paybright.com to learn more!
The Credit team works cross-functionally with Data Science, Product, Engineering and Capital Markets to responsibly manage the risk profile of the business. We're looking for an intelligent, driven individual who wants to learn, grow, and solve hard problems.The team's mandate is to enable sustainable growth while closely managing the profitability and resilience of our portfolio. As Affirm continues on an exciting growth trajectory; thinking through credit policies for new initiatives and products, developing effective risk management strategies and capabilities, shaping ongoing testing and experimentation, and being ready for navigating through any exogenous changes will be important problems to tackle.This role requires extensive use of data analytics to derive insights and develop credit strategies. It also requires a lot of cross-functional partnership. Working with the Data Science and Engineering team to develop new underwriting models and risk management capabilities, with the Product teams to develop new products and features, with the Merchant Pricing team to value different merchants, with the Finance team to help facilitate discussions with debt and equity investors are some parts of the role.Come join us in our mission to change consumer finance through better data and technology, lower costs, and increased transparency while providing the best customer experience.What you'll do

Partner with Data Science and Engineering on building risk analytics capabilities
Develop robust life-time valuation infrastructure and capabilities
Use advanced data analytics and critical thinking to derive insights and optimize credit strategies
Own risk initiatives within new product formation and new market exploration
Monitor portfolio as well as macroeconomic trends impacting loan performance. Drive adjustments to our underwriting and marketing strategies to mitigate risk

What we look for

Passion and drive to change banking, payments and online marketing for the better
3-5 years work experience as a data analyst (consumer credit risk management strongly preferred)
Curiosity to learn about data, models and algorithms
Extensive experience with SQL and Python
Ability to collaborate and influence across different teams in the organization
Ability to communicate findings and recommendations clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences
A passion for finding insights in data and driving change based on those insights
Intelligence + Humility. Hubris is the fastest way to blow up a business!

Location - Remote Canada
#LI-Remote
PayBright is proud to be a remote-first company! The majority of our roles can be located anywhere within the province of Ontario. Employees in remote roles have the option of working remotely in Ontario or from PayBright's Toronto office, and may occasionally travel to an Affirm office or elsewhere for required meetings or team-building events. Our office in Toronto will remain operational and accessible for anyone to use on a voluntary basis, subject to local COVID-19 guidelines.Why should you apply?

We provide an outstanding work environment in a high-growth industry
We focus on creating a positive and cohesive team-based environment, and aim to have fun doing our jobs!
We have fun with regular team events and social activities (currently being held virtually due to COVID-19)
We offer attractive compensation and benefits, including equity participation
We have a prime location in downtown Toronto near amenities and public transportation

Equal Employment OpportunityOur diverse and inclusive team is part of what makes PayBright a fulfilling place to work. PayBright is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from persons of all backgrounds.We are proud to be partnered with the Canadian Centre for Diversity and Inclusion.If you require any accommodations during the hiring process, please do not hesitate to let us know. We will work with you to meet your needs.
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Database Administrator and Solutions Analyst
Description:
Location: Toronto or flexible (core hours Eastern Standard Time)
Taking care of our environment has never been more important than it is today. The Nature Conservancy of Canada (NCC) is looking for a Database Administrator and Solutions Analyst to join a team committed to protecting our most important natural areas and the plants and animals they sustain.
NCC is the nation’s leading not-for-profit, private land conservation organization, working to protect our most important natural areas and the species they sustain. Since 1962 NCC and its supporters have protected 14 million hectares (more than 35 million acres) of ecologically significant land across Canada. NCC takes a collaborative, science-based approach to achieve conservation success for the sake of nature and Canadians. With a national office in Toronto and seven regional offices across the country, NCC delivers results you can walk on.
Position Summary
The Database Administrator will be responsible for the management and maintenance of NCC databases.
The role will be responsible for the standardization, configuration, integration, and performance optimization of critical NCC database systems.
The incumbent will ensure the availability and consistent performance of the relevant business applications.
This role will primarily be professional/technical.
Position Requirements
University or College degree in computer science or a related field.
One to two years of experience in database administration, information technology, database architecture, or a related field preferred.
Strong command of MS SQL and SQL server tools.
Extensive experience with database technologies (MS SQL preferred).
Advanced knowledge of database security, and performance monitoring standards.
Knowledge of PowerShell scripting.
Familiarity with SSRS.
Hands on experience in issues management, including problem-solving and coordination of issue resolution in a timely fashion.
Good project management skills in accordance with current accepted principles and practices.
Interpersonal skills to establish and maintain relations with others (NCC staff, peers within other organizations, consultants, contractors, agencies / organizations) and to resolve project-related complaints / disputes / issues.
Time Management / organization skills to identify priorities, re-arrange work if required to meet identified deadlines.
Communication skills (listening, writing, verbal) to provide clear direction to those involved in / working on the project; to ensure solid understanding of work requirements, work guidelines and to encourage and sustain consensus building to make decisions.
Experience with Microsoft Azure a plus.
How to Apply
NCC is an equal opportunity employer. If you are interested in joining our team, please submit your cover letter, resume and salary expectations through our Career Centre by April 29, 2022 by 11:59 pm EST.
NCC welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
We value and incorporate diverse traditions, heritage, knowledge and experiences in our mission and in our workplaces. We celebrate the full participation of people from all walks of life as we work towards common goals. We strive for a conservation movement in which equity, diversity and inclusion are the norm. This is our continuous commitment: to promote healthy people, healthy communities and a healthy planet for everyone.

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
Company Description
Talan Canada is growing and looking to strengthen its team with a Business Analyst for the Montreal office, who will be interested in working with clients from multiple industries.

Job Description

Automate manual tuning process through the usage of Python, Unix shell, AutoSys, and/or other programming tools.
Architect, design and implement enhancements for our global compliance monitoring systems, predominately using Python.
Produce reports and alerting that is clear, timely, and actionable.
Be hands-on in writing clean and maintainable code and building large distributed systems.
Collaborate with multiple teams to understand the business problems, changing priorities and devise technical solutions.
Analyze output of screening systems to create systemic rules that can suppress recurring false matches (a.k.a. False Hit Mitigation)
User set up and quarterly certification for Sanctions Compliance applications and related partners.
Assist with reporting for management and other stakeholders
Review and revisit procedures and controls to make them effective and efficient
Generate and publish reports to Compliance and global stakeholders
Some weekend work for business testing and other initiatives will be expected
Works with business partners within across regions and functions to align technology solutions with business strategies
Demonstrates an informed knowledge of a several business areas and across assets to resolve problems on an ongoing basis
Responsible for the collection, analysis, and documentation of a client's business requirements
Establishes relationship with business partners to provide technical solutions to meet user needs.
Understands client's priorities of projects and requests. Assesses client needs utilizing a structured requirements process (gathering, analyzing, documenting, and managing changes) to prioritize immediate business needs and recommends options, risks, and cost vs. benefits
Develops, writes, and communicates business requirements for the implementation of business solutions. Procures technical assistance to help in problem resolution.
Works closely with developers to clarify requirements, and ensure development is done according to requirement
Helps to maintain priorities of tasks for the team, and organizes sprints
Develops test cases and validates test results during the testing phase with QA
Organizes demonstrations to ensure delivery is according to the user's requirements
Investigates, resolves, and escalates production problems.
Conducts feasibility studies and drafts proposals for evaluation by appropriate users and managers. Develops and assists in the presentation of business cases.
Works closely with several teams across technology and operations to complete project needs
Supports and participates in the formal reporting of project status to clients

Qualifications
Experience needed:
5 years or more with IT business analysis and project management experience
4 years or more with Firco Continuity (Transaction) and Firco Trust (Entity) screening
4 years or more with Python, JavaScript, Unix (shell scripts), SQL, XML and/or VBA Knowledge
3 years or more in Agile, XP, and/or other similar project management practices
Technical Skills:
Exposure to an Object-Oriented based development environment such as Python, JavaScript, and/or Java
SQL Knowledge
Advanced Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Visio)
Software development lifecycle knowledge
Knowledge of Agile development methodologies
MS Office Suite, Project Management tool
Ability to read and interpret logs
Competencies:
A demonstrable interest in technology
Strong interpersonal skills
Ability to quickly learn new technical skills
Knowledge of financial transaction types such as SWIFT MT and MX, FED Wires, CHIPS, SEPA, ACH, etc. is a plus
Familiarity with sanction screening, False Hit Mitigation techniques, and similar operational activities is preferred
Excellent verbal, written, and presentation skills.
Strong abilities in analytical thinking, problem-solving, research, and time management
Ability to manage multiple simultaneous tasks in a high-pressure deadline-driven environment
Ability to liaise with the business and technology teams utilizing collaboration and relationship management skills
Project management skills
Rigorous and structured, dynamic, detail oriented, fast learning capacity and able to work in a high-pressure environment
Must be able to interact with a variety of clients and support staff, traders, middle office, development, infrastructure, etc.
Must be a self-starter who is comfortable working in a very dynamic environment, with rapidly changing priorities.
Analytical skills
Educational Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent
Additional Information
You must live in Montreal or be willing to relocate rapidly from anywhere in Canada and possess a valid work permit.
Talan is a consulting firm specializing in digital innovation and transformation. For over 20 years, Talan has been advising, supporting, and implementing transformation projects for businesses and public authorities, in France and abroad. With operations on five continents and nearly 5,000 consultants, the group anticipates a revenue of 600 million euros in 2022 and expects a turnover of 1 billion euros by 2024. The group places innovation at the heart of its development strategy and is involved in areas of technological change affecting major corporations, such as Big Data, the Internet of Things, Cryptocurrencies, and Artificial Intelligence.
Joining Talan also means:
Joining a Canadian group with more than 500 consultants, working in an agile and pragmatic way with large companies (Finance, Insurance, Telecommunications, Services, Distribution, Public sector) by combining consulting services / technological expertise / innovation / ability to deliver and deploy projects
Joining dynamic teams, where the role of the employee is at the center of attention, with the desire to create spaces allowing everyone to flourish
Participating in different communities to contribute to development and to innovate, all with a strong team and entrepreneurship spirit
Talan is a great playground, it's up to you!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At House of Friendship we believe in what we are doing. We get out of bed each day to make a difference in our community; to walk with and to serve. We are not happy with the status quo. We get energy from ongoing learning and growth. We lead with passion and believe without a doubt that everyone deserves to belong and thrive. We live and breathe our values of Compassion, Inclusion, Justice, Dignity and Hope. And we have fun!
Sounds pretty great doesn’t it? It is!
We are seeking an upbeat, organized and self-initiated individual to fulfill a significant administrative role within our Addiction Services and Housing areas. You will be the administrator of the electronic health record and oversee the data entry expectations/targets, process and analyze data and prepare reports for both internal and external purposes. This position also participates/develops staff training, conducts audits and oversees the dashboard and quarterly reporting requirements.
** This is a full-time, contract position from April 2022 to September 2022.
 Scheduled Monday to Friday. Flexibility to work remote and in office. **
Your key responsibilities include:
Data collection, analysis, reporting
Target setting, dashboard, balanced score card
Graphs, visuals of data/statistics
Training/building capacity for data entry and data integrity
Liaise as needed with TELUS Health (EHR)Work with partners to collect required data through MOU’s and data sharing agreementsWork directly with the management team in Addictions and Housing
Your skills and experience include:University degree or college diploma in related field
A minimum of 3 years work experience in data management
Superior organizational skills with strong attention to detail
Knowledge and experience in Health care reporting including Catalyst, DATIS, OHRS, TELUS PS suitesExperience with and strong skills in, internet based data systems including report generation and data analysis
Strong skills in Excel, Microsoft Office Suite
Internally motivated with the ability to work comfortably and effectively independently
Knowledge of issues relating to and impacting individuals and a strength based philosophy is necessaryCommitment to understand and uphold the mission and values of House of Friendship is expectedExemplary emotional intelligence, resilience, communication, conflict management and problem solving skills requiredAbility to work professionally as a team member with staff, participants and community membersUnderstanding of diverse populations including people from various cultural backgrounds, income levels, and sensitivity to their needsExperience with and commitment to using an anti-racism, anti-oppressive and trauma informed approach to consultation, program design, evaluations of processes and service deliveryMust be dependable, professional, flexible, a team player, and have a positive attitudeRespectful, supportive and engaging approach to persons with physical and/or cognitive disabilities, addictions, mental illness and other life challengesExcellent project, timeline and deadline management skills including skills in logistics, planning and detailed record keeping
Rate of Pay:
At House of Friendship all compensation ranges are categorized under a series of “grades” and we base our payment structure on internal equity. When determining rate of pay, a candidate’s past related experience will be taken into consideration along with where others with similar experience are currently on the pay grid.
Note: Most new team members will start somewhere between the start rate and the mid point of the range.
Grade: 4
Min: $21.10
Mid: $24.44
Max: $27.77
Working Conditions:
37.5 hours per week, generally daytime, weekday hours
Work may be performed in a home office for some of the weekly hoursEncountering participants at program sites who may be under the influence alcohol and other drugs and/or experiencing symptoms of mental illness can be expected
COVID-19 Vaccination Policy:
To maintain the safety of staff and participants, House of Friendship has implemented a COVID-19 Vaccination Policy. All Staff hired after October 19, 2021 are required to provide proof of being Fully Vaccinated against COVID-19 as a pre-condition of their employment or placement offer. If an individual is unable to be vaccinated against COVID-19, they will be required to submit written proof verifying a medical reason or by submitting a request under the Ontario Human Rights Code and agree to regular Rapid Antigen Testing at least two times per week. When documentation has been received and approved, House of Friendship will provide accommodation up to the point of undue hardship in compliance with the OHRC and may follow up to receive further information and/or documentation as required. Failure to meet these requirements will result in the immediate revocation of an offer of employment.
If you are as passionate as we are about serving the community, let’s talk.
To apply, please submit your resume and cover letter by April 12, 2022.

Title: Natural Gas/NGLs Marketing Analyst
Description:
Who we are:
Validere is a leading data and analytics SaaS provider for accelerating the energy transition. We’re on a mission to digitally transform the world’s largest supply chain to be commercially and environmentally efficient. Our Product Data Cloud enables energy companies to aggregate all product data sources into a single source of truth rapidly and seamlessly. Over 40 leading energy companies have partnered with Validere to identify new, hidden sources of value across the business. Our unique datasets and experts across data science, physical science, and oil and gas provide our clients a company-wide value engine that boosts commercial margins, reduces operational costs and risks, and ensures meaningful environmental progress.
Founded at Harvard University, Validere has since raised $70M+ from leading technology and energy investors, including Mercuria Energy America, BlackRock, Wing VC, Greylock Partners, and Y Combinator. With offices in Houston, Calgary, and Toronto, our 100+ employees focus every day on delivering the highest value, removing friction, and scaling results for every one of our customers.
In 2022, Validere and Phoenix Energy Marketing joined forces to empower the industry to easily execute on data analytics insights. Learn more.
Who you are:
To support our rapid growth, we are looking for a Natural Gas/NGLMarketing Analyst with focus on executing, improving, and expanding the existing suite of client services of our newly acquired subsidiary, Phoenix Energy Commercial Services. You’re just as excited as we are about building the most high-tech and innovative marketing platform and tools in Canada.

Reporting to our Professional Services Manager (Commercial), you will work closely with our Services team to deliver value to clients, spearheading onboarding of new clients, helping to identify and leverage value from Validere products and technologies, as well as reporting on account health and performance.
Let’s give you a purpose:
Own the Natural Gas/NGL marketing, transportation and trading activities for clients to deliver commercial value and be a reliable resource in abnormal situations
Provide front, mid & back office Natural Gas and NGL marketing support, including but not limited to: optimize firm & interruptible gas transportation , placing nominations, monitoring & balancing positions, weekend/holiday gas control rotation, price reporting, netback analysis,, assist with revenue accruals, monitor credit positions, contract negotiation and administration, invoicing and reconciliation
Coordinate shared goal-setting with our clients and execute on plans to achieve key commercial milestones and report out on account health/status to the Services Manager
Support seamless onboarding experiences for new clients
Work closely with our product team to (a) improve existing processes and streamline key marketing tasks leveraging technology, (b) evolve our marketing toolkit with new and exciting offerings for clients by leveraging your industry expertise and feedback from clients & prospects
Provide mentorship guidance to team members leveraging your industry knowledge and experience
Assist sales efforts and pitches to prospects with your technical expertise as required
What you’ll bring along:
3-5 years working with natural gas/NGL producers and/or natural gas/NGL marketing companies in a scheduling or trading role
University degree or College degree in a related field, such as Accounting, Commerce, or Business Management/Administration, or equivalent experience
Knowledge of the upstream natural gas/NGLs industry in Western Canada
Knowledge and familiarity with the natural gas/NGLs marketing and sales cycle
Understanding of plantgate gas sales processes
Familiarity and ability to use GasEDI contract templates
Knowledge of Western Canada gas pipeline systems & storage operators, including TC (NGTL), Enbridge (WEI), Alliance (APL) and TransGas (TGL)
Proficiency & experience using ICE/NGX gas trading platform
Understanding of NGL recoveries at gas plants, liquids trucked, pipeline, fractionation, netback calculations and back-office support or ability/eagerness to learn
Professional designation is considered an asset
What sets you apart:
You’re a great communicator and a meaningful relationship builder with clients and other stakeholders alike
You are keen to work in a dynamic tech-environment; you’re excited to build new tools to revolutionize the marketing space
Solving problems in a creative way excites you
You like identifying opportunities to improve existing processes and services
You’re a team player, and aim to be an integral part of shaping our Commercial Hub Sales & Product strategy by leveraging your deep industry expertise
You’re a problem solver at heart; your success is your client’s success
Our shared values:
Deliver (the highest) value
Remove friction
Everyday, more scalable
Be well, fair & transparent
Validere is an equal employment opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage applications from everyone regardless of race, colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, or disability status. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the interview process and beyond. We are committed to providing an inclusive, open, and diverse work environment.

Title: iGAMING ANALYST
Description: Niagara Casinos is committed to developing a new online market for internet gaming that combines iGaming with the bricks and mortar properties. The iGaming Analyst will play a key role in compiling and analyzing data, implementing strategic processes and procedures, executing business analytics and project management support for the launch of a new line of business for Niagara Casinos. If you would like to be on a team of Great People delivering great service, we may have just the opportunity for you!The job involves: Assisting with strategic planning and initiatives to drive ROI through qualitative and quantitative analysisDesigning, drafting and producing reports and analysis based on specific business requirements for stakeholders using data from the platform’s analytic environments, web analytics tools, research and financial databases for iGamingWorking with the iGaming team to provide analytical support for product development and operation, including player journey and engagement, retention and marketingPerforming financial reporting, planning, and analysis including budgets, forecasts and predictive modeling. Proposing and developing initiatives that positively impact monetization metrics specifically around game economy and progressionCollaborating with vendors and partners to test and verify that solutions meet business requirements, monitoring the progress of multiple concurrent projects and making agile adjustments to ensure successful completionFlexibility to support a 24/7 operationThe ideal candidate has: University degree or college diploma in Business, Computer Science, Mathematics and Statistics, Finance, Economics or equivalent advanced degree3 years experience in reporting and analyticsDemonstrated leadership, organizational and coordination skills, excellent communication skillsExtensive knowledge of contemporary software and computer systems including Microsoft Access, SQL and other relational database systemsExperience with data visualization and reporting design tools such as TableauNiagara Casinos is committed to creating an accessible and inclusive environment by providing equal opportunity to candidates of all abilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.Job Types: Full-time, Fixed term contractContract length: 12 monthsBenefits:Employee assistance programOn-site gymOn-site parkingSchedule:8 hour shiftDay shiftMonday to FridayCOVID-19 considerations:All Health & Safety protocols are being followedApplication deadline: 2022-04-30

Title: Technical Product Support Analyst
Description:
CaseWare is a remote first company with opportunities in Canada, the United States and a few other countries across the globe. Since the global pandemic we have adapted an Agile Work Strategy, which aims to give people the option to work from home or work from a CaseWare office. Feel free to ask us questions about our approach at any point in the interview process.
The Product Support Analyst provides high-quality customer support over the phone to our financial accounting, practice management applications, and templates end users. You will take ownership of customer issues throughout its life cycle, until a timely resolution is provided. Duties also include minor testing of software, providing feedback and performing other related projects as they arise.

Your Mission:
To provide 1st class Accounting Software Support service to each and every customer. Deliver effective, efficient, and complete resolutions consistently with professionalism and care as well as radiate team values and champion continuous learning initiatives.
What you will be doing:
To understand Accounting software applications and troubleshoot issues/problems reported by the end-users
Effectively work in an inbound call queue and manage a high volume of calls and emails
Provide guidance in the use of the software application (i.e. installation, various functionalities and /or features)
Analyze client firm workflow and processes to apply CaseWare products along with accounting
knowledge in order to troubleshoot issues/problems reported by end-users
Maintain and update records of procedures and processes
Maintains client confidence and protects operations by keeping information confidential
Effectively and efficiently track issues using the internal ticket system
Perform minor testing of software, providing feedback and performing other related projects as they arise
Maintains historical records by documenting hardware and software changes and revisions


What you will bring:
You have understanding of or exposure to accounting, assurance & tax principles
Achievement & resolution oriented with a strong commitment to providing an exceptional customer service experience
You are able to analyze data, utilize problem-solving/troubleshooting skills, and provide the best possible solutions
Strong Independent learner
You are committed to continuous improvement and can demonstrate your ability as an independent learner within Fintech
You are able to maintain a high level of performance under the pressure of time restraints and a fast-paced, changing environment
You have excellent English communication skills (both verbal and written), French is an asset
Accurate and efficient keyboarding and data entry skills
About CaseWare
With a head office in Toronto, CaseWare is one of Canada's original Fintech companies, having led the industry for over 30 years, with more than 500,000 users across 130 countries and available in 16 different languages.
While you might not have heard of us (yet) over 36,000 accounting and audit professionals list CaseWare as a skill on their LinkedIn profiles!
CaseWare's cutting-edge software products are meticulously designed for accounting firms, corporations and governments. Our teams are continually collaborating, innovating and building upon our existing suite of products. With a customer focused mindset we are building technology that is shaping what the future of audits, financial reporting and financial data analytics will look like.
With a recent strategic investment from Hg Capital in 2020, CaseWare is now in its next major growth phase as we double down on the people and products that have made CaseWare so successful to date.
One of CaseWare's core values is that we believe Our People Make Us Great and with that in mind, we're dedicated to building teams as diverse as our customers in an equitable and inclusive way. We welcome and encourage candidates of all backgrounds to apply. Should you require accommodations or have any questions at any point during the application or interview process, please e-mail our People Operations team at careers@caseware.com.
Any candidates successful in obtaining an offer for a position will need to successfully complete a background check through Certn.co which typically includes an Identity Verification and Criminal Record Check. Executives and Senior Managers will undergo a Soft Credit Check as well.

Title: Senior Analyst, Forecasting & Analytics in Workforce planning
Description:
From coast-to-coast, our inspiring colleagues are at the heart of what we do best: helping people, businesses and society prosper in good times and be resilient in bad times. With our team, you’ll bring this purpose to life every day by living our Values, being open to change, and pursuing your goals.
At Intact, we’ll give you countless opportunities to learn and grow, alongside a diverse and passionate community of experts – the best the industry has to offer. You’ll be empowered to be your best self, do your best work, and make a meaningful impact. Here, you can: shape the future of insurance, win as a team, and grow with us.


About the role


We’re looking for a Senior Analyst, Forecasting & Analytics in Workforce planning to join our growing team!
Workplace: Montreal (2020 Robert-Bourassa), Anjou (7101 Jean-Talon Est), Saint-Hyacinthe (2450 Girouard Ouest) or Quebec (5700 Boul. des Galeries)
What you’ll do here:
Collect, build forecasting model and analyze data from different sources in order to provide recommendations for workforce planning.
Adapt and use predictive models and tools.
Provide structured analyses and performance reports relevant for each business sectors and adapt them to the stakeholders they serve.
Support the business sectors throughout the budget process.
Participate in tools and process improvement initiatives.
You will need to establish strong relationships with various partners, both within and outside of the Workforce Management team.
You have the knack to identify opportunities to streamline the way we do things - status quo is not your cup of tea.
Operational excellence is within your reach – you are curious and have a strong analytical background that allows you to explore to identify the best practices to be more efficient.


Qualifications


What you bring to the table:
Bachelor's degree in Administration, Finance, Mathematics, Statistics or a combination of education & relevant experience will be considered
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
Thorough and ability to search and collect information
Expertise with Excel
Proficient with PowerPoint and Word
Strong organization and prioritization skills
Here are a few reasons why others have joined our team:
An award-winning, inspiring workplace that supports its people and recognizes great work
Stimulating, challenging projects and development opportunities to help you grow your skills and career
A comprehensive financial rewards program that recognizes your success
An extensive, flexible benefits package
An industry leading Employee Share Purchase Plan where we match 50% of net shares purchased
A $350 annual wellness account that promotes an active lifestyle
Flexible Work Arrangements
We’re proud to support a flexible hybrid approach which gives everyone the best of both worlds. While there are no minimum or maximum time requirements, each team’s need for in-person connections will be different and there will be times you’ll join your colleagues at the office.


Closing Statement


We are an Equal Opportunity Employer

Title: POL EC 27R - Senior Policy Analyst
Description:
Senior Policy Analyst
Policy Analyst - Economics R27
An eligibility list may be established to fill future temporary and permanent vacancies.

On November 1, 2021 the BC Public Service announced the COVID-19 Vaccination Policy that defines the conditions and expectations for BC Public Service employees regarding vaccination against COVID-19. Among other possible measures, proof of vaccination will be required. It is a term of acceptance of employment that you agree to comply with all vaccination requirements that apply to the public service. More information can be found here.

A great opportunity to take the next step in your career

The Small Business and Economic Development Division advances a strong, sustainable economy that supports broad-based prosperity through informed economic policies and initiatives that support small business sector development, decision making through data analysis and ensuring an economic lens, efficient and effective regulatory frameworks, and strong relationships with economic development leaders.

The Branch of Regional and Inclusive Economic Recovery leads outreach and communication activities and provides tools, resources, programs, and other supports to facilitate economic recovery and development, job creation, regional, race and gender inclusion, and community- and data-driven research and sustainable investment in B.C. The branch showcases and raises awareness of new and existing resources, profiles community-led examples of success to build an environment of shared learning, develops and shares best practices to aid local decision making, and encourages two-way communication and feedback to support current and future projects or programs.

The Senior Policy Analyst is responsible for the design, development, implementation, delivery and evaluation of strategies, programs, projects, toolkits, and innovative resources to promote and support economic development in the province. Reporting to Director of Regional Economic Initiatives, the Senior Policy Analyst is responsible for leading a range of high-profile, multi-dimensional initiatives in support of regional economic development. The Senior Policy Analyst researches needs and priorities of various client groups and develops tools to address those needs through workshops, surveys, online supports, and programs to build economic development capacity across communities and regions.

The Senior Policy Analyst also works on inter-ministry and cross-divisional projects, prepares, and coordinates divisional briefing materials, and develops plans and strategies to facilitate regional economic development.

The BC Public Service is committed to creating a diverse workplace to represent the population we serve and to better meet the needs of our citizens. Consider joining our team and being part of an innovative, inclusive and rewarding workplace.

For information about the Indigenous Applicant Advisory Service please visit: Indigenous Applicant Advisory Service - Province of British Columbia (gov.bc.ca).

For complete details about this opportunity, including accountabilities, please refer to the attached job profile. For specific position related enquiries, please contact Sandra.Addison@gov.bc.ca. DO NOT SEND YOUR APPLICATION TO THIS EMAIL ADDRESS. For more information about how to complete your job application, add/edit your resume and for more useful tips when applying for jobs, please refer to the Your Job Application page on the MyHR website. If you are still experiencing technical difficulty applying for a competition, please send an e-mail to BCPSA.Hiring.Centre@gov.bc.ca, before the stated closing time, and we will respond as soon as possible to assist you.

NOTE: Applications will be accepted until 11:00 pm Pacific Standard Time on the closing date of the competition.

Job Requirements:
In order to be considered for this position, your application must clearly demonstrate how you meet the education and experience as outlined below:
Degree in Public Administration, Business Administration, Economics, Social Sciences, or a related discipline and 3 years of recent, related experience
An equivalent combination of education, training, and/or experience may be considered
Recent, related experience includes:
Experience developing processes for stakeholder consultations and surveys for defining program policies, legislation and regulation, identifying stakeholder preferences, and reconciling conflicts.
Experience in planning and coordinating complex projects that facilitate economic development activities.
Experience in concisely and persuasively writing a range of documents, including briefing notes, letters, reports, and presentations.
Experience providing advice and recommendations to senior management, ministry executive, and government officials.
Applicants selected to move forward in the hiring process may be assessed on the Knowledge, Skills, Abilities and Competencies as outlined in the attached Job Profile located in the Additional Information section at the bottom of the posting.

A Criminal Record Check (CRC) will be required.

APPLICATION REQUIREMENTS:
Cover letter: NO - Please do not submit a cover letter as it will not be reviewed.

Resume: YES - A resume is required as part of your application; however, it may not be used for initial shortlisting purposes.

Questionnaire (COMPREHENSIVE): YES - As part of the application process, you will be prompted to complete a comprehensive online questionnaire to demonstrate how you meet the job requirements. Please allot approximately 60 minutes to complete the questionnaire.

Title: Capital & Maintenance Program Analyst
Description:
WORK ILLUSTRATION:
The Capital and Maintenance Program Analyst is responsible for the effective business operations associated with Toronto Hydro-Electric Systems Limited (THESL) Capital and Maintenance programs and operating expenses. Responsibilities include: data gathering, data analysis, identifying gaps and trends as well as producing reports related to the THESL Capital and Maintenance Work Programs. The incumbent will develop processes, procedures and tools to ensure governance and compliance in the delivery of the THESL Capital and Maintenance Execution Work Program. The Analyst will also develop databases and automated reports to assist leaders and external stakeholders in the efficient and effective management of the capital work programs.

The incumbent is expected to behave ethically and follow the established code of business conduct, policies and internal control procedures, laws and regulations governing Toronto Hydro.

Toronto Hydro has implemented a mandatory vaccination requirement for all its employees. Proof of full vaccination will be required upon receiving a conditional offer of employment. Toronto Hydro will provide reasonable accommodation to individuals who cannot be vaccinated due to disability or any other ground protected by the Ontario Human Rights Code.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Analysis of gaps and trends for various projects/ programs.
Prepares reports pertaining to project/program status and outcomes.
Manage performance of contractors
Identifies gaps and trends and performs analyses to determine root causes and develops recommended solutions.
Gathers data, performs data analysis and creates reports ensuring accuracy of data.
Leads and participates in process improvement initiatives as well as process mapping activities in support of departmental continuous improvement programs.
Liaises with internal and external stakeholders to assist in the successful coordination and delivery of project/ execution.
Creates and maintains reporting applications, forms and customized databases.
Performs periodic analysis and monitoring of operations data for the purposes of quality assurance.
Participates in corporate wide initiatives to support overall business strategy.
Supports the development of rate applications to the regulator including, preparation of narratives, assisting with responses to interrogatories and supporting witness preparation needs related to THESL Capital/Maintenance Execution Work Programs.

COMPETENCIES:
Bachelor degree in Engineering (Electrical Engineering preferred).
Five (5) plus years’ of experience in data analysis, gap analysis and reporting results.
Five (5) plus years' of experience in business process redesign, analysis for business projects, identification areas for improvement and development of new initiatives.
Two (2) or more years of experience in construction project environment.
Class G license required.
Familiarity with SAP enterprise modules is an asset.
Project/program management experience preferred.
Certified Business Analyst Professional (CBAP) designation is an asset.
Project Management Professional (PMP) designation is an asset.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Excellent analytical and business solution development skills, including the proven ability to function effectively in a dynamic environment.
Fully proficient in the use of Microsoft Office applications including advanced working knowledge in MS Excel, MS Project, MS Access and MS Word.
Able to proactively flag At-Risk areas of business based on analysis of data and KPIs.
Ability to develop statistical tracking methodologies to track performance and measurement against set standards of quality.
Ability to develop dependable feedback systems and tracking.
Experience with process mapping and procedure writing.
Knowledge of Microsoft programming languages (such as VBA or SQL) to support data analytics is an asset.
Business and strategic thinking acumen.

Job Segment: Programmer, Engineer, ERP, Electrical, Program Manager, Technology, Engineering, Management

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
Help us boldly shape retail in Canada 
Canadian Tire Corporation, Limited (“CTC”) is one of Canada’s most admired and trusted companies. With world-class Owned Brands and exciting market-leading merchandising strategies, we are continually innovating with purpose: to be there for Canadians from coast-to-coast. We are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join Canadian Tire and its group of companies. 
The Business Analyst will be primarily focused on the daily operations and continuous improvement of rental equipment management across the country. This includes support for upgrades/enhancements to the software and physical environments, procedures and processes for entering/reviewing data, set up of queries/reports from the data base, apply statistical reviews to the business, minimize process steps and standardize/update SOPs. 
This dynamic environment requires and individual with highly developed interpersonal and organizational skills with a passion for continuous improvement on process and service. 
To help define where and how we work, CTC has introduced Hybrid Workplace Personas. While each role fits into a different persona category, this may evolve as employees progress in their career or business needs change. The Business Analyst position is categorized as a Roamer, which means that the incumbent can successfully complete their role objectives virtually and are not required to be present on a CTC campus unless they choose to do so. 
What you’ll do 

Manage, monitor and improve processes around the management of rental equipment 
Rental trailer tracking, administration and invoice processing (includes trailers, containers, chassis, reefers) 
Develop and manage relationships with external rental partners, cross functional teams and internal stakeholders 
Execute rental trailer analysis and requests based on forecast data and collaboration with leadership team and other stakeholder groups. 
Rental Repair Invoice validation and administration 
Identify and implement process improvement initiatives to create efficiencies in service and/or cost 
Monitors and maintains synchronization of data within both Yard Smart and Fleet Lease Database 
Develop and implements new business processes for the efficient, cost effective management of our assets 
Provide regular updates to manager, team lead and internal stakeholders 
Other duties as required 

Who you are 
We are looking for individuals who are: 

Creative and courageous, with the ability to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold, strategic moves in this rapidly evolving retail environment 
Action oriented, and comfortable taking calculated risks to better serve our customers and business 
Outcome focused, critical thinkers with the ability to analyze and visualize, to ensure continuous improvement across our entire business 
Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward 
Inclusive leaders who build and develop teams that effectively anticipate and respond to disruption, while consistently delivering strong performance 

If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then this is definitely the place to be. 
What you bring 

Post-secondary education in Mathematics/Engineering/Computer Science/ Business is an asset 
Minimum 5 years’ experience in Transportation Operations 
Experience in process re-engineering 
Experience in project management and working knowledge of database tools/ management 
Demonstrated problem solving, statistical and analytical skills 
Strong time management skills, able to work with minimal supervision 
Proven interpersonal/communication skills, able to deal with various levels of management 
Strong presentation and written skills 
Experience with Microsoft Office applications 
Knowledge of shunt and dispatch operations would be considered an asset 
Knowledge of Trailer Tracking System would be considered an asset 
Knowledge of other internal CTC internal systems such as DCCS, MTM, AOM and Infopac, would be considered an asset 

About Canadian Tire Corporation 
As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies . To learn more follow us on LinkedIn . 
CTC is committed to the fight against COVID-19 and being there for Canadians. In support of this, we have adopted a COVID-19 Vaccination Policy to protect the health and well-being of our employees. Employees will be required either to be fully vaccinated or undergo regular COVID-19 testing in order to access the workplace until further notice. 


   Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees - their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience. Canadian Tire Supply Chain 
  

   Ontario-Brampton 
  

   Permanent 
  

   Full-time

Title: Analyst Operations
Description:
Primary Locations: Montreal, Quebec
Employee Status: Regular
Schedule: Full-time
Are you known for your analytical skills, drive and curiosity?
Do you take an interest in trading, securities and financial markets?
Can you handle stress and manage priorities?
Can you lead and influence your colleagues and partners?
As an Analyst, Segregation & Buy-ins, you’ll work in an environment where excellence is encouraged and where you’ll build strong relationships with internal and external partners. You’ll have the opportunity to learn and develop within a team that values collaboration, innovation, performance, and partners’ satisfaction.
The Segregation & Buy-ins team is responsible for security segregation, i.e. making sure that fully paid securities are kept separate from other securities. The segregation team analyzes segregation deficiencies daily and resolves them within the timeframe prescribed by regulation. It also manages all buy-ins for our Canadian and U.S. brokers. Buy-ins are carried out to regularize segregation deficiencies but also to streamline the continuous net settlement (CNS/NSCC) and broker to broker (COD/TFT) process. The team is also responsible for applying the SEC’s rule on short selling (Rule 204).
Your main challenges:
Helping to resolve segregation deficiencies and buy-ins within regulatory or market deadlines
Maintaining close relationships with our main partners
Becoming familiar with the applicable regulations (IIROC, SEC, FINRA)
Demonstrating a marked interest in data analysis and data savviness
More specifically, you will:
Analyze segregation deficiencies and ensure regularization according to regulatory deadlines
Transmit or retransmit redemption notices in a timely manner and process redemptions when deadlines are not met
Identify transformation opportunities and discuss them with the Senior Analysts
Build close relationships with our main partners
Education and experience:
College diploma in a 3-year specialized program or academic equivalent in a related field and 4 years’ relevant experience OR bachelor’s degree in a related field
Keen interest in regulations, securities and financial markets
Knowledge of the applicable standards, an asset
Knowledge of ISM(OSS), MAX/Arrow, AS400 as well as CDS and DTC platforms, an asset
Ability to analyze and summarize information, sense of initiative, take charge and independent
Strong interpersonal and communication skills
Bilingualism, both spoken and written (English and French), essential
At National Bank, we stand out by investing in our employees throughout their careers, as demonstrated when we were awarded silver in the “Most Innovative use of HR Technology” category at the 2020 Canadian HR Awards for our use of Axonify, a personalized learning solution that can be used every day.
The Bank has innovated by updating its performance appraisal system to better meet our clients' changing needs. That’s why the expected behaviours of partnership, agility and empowerment count as much as achieving business objectives.

Title: New Flyer - Data Analyst
Description:
New Flyer is North America's heavy-duty transit bus leader with various locations in North America. Offering the most advanced product line under the Xcelsior® and Xcelsior CHARGE™ brands. It also offers infrastructure development through New Flyer Infrastructure Solutions™, a service dedicated to providing safe, sustainable, and reliable charging and mobility solutions. Further information is available at www.newflyer.com.
POSITION SUMMARY
This position is responsible for providing detailed strategic analysis of complex data from multiple data sources supporting data-driven business decisions and communicating the value of this information effectively. This position is also responsible for supporting a culture of continuous improvement through process enhancements, data reporting and analysis and system development and enhancement.
WHAT YOU WILL DO:
Perform data mining, reporting and analysis providing insight in product reliability and supporting continuous improvement efforts
Mine and interpret data into meaningful information that can be read by both people and machines
Interpret data sets, paying particular attention to trends and patterns that could be valuable
Prepare reports for Customer Care leadership that effectively communicate trends, patterns, and predictions using relevant data
Collaborate with programmers, engineers, and organizational leaders to identify opportunities for process improvements, recommend system modifications, and develop policies for data governance
Working with IT, assist in the design, maintaining of data systems and databases, including supporting resolution of issues and other data-related problems
Create appropriate documentation that allows stakeholders to understand the steps of the data analysis process and duplicate or replicate the analysis if necessary
Provide query/reporting and analysis support to Divisional activities, leveraging reporting tools and automating reporting where advantageous
WHAT YOU NEED TO BE SUCCESSFUL:
Post-secondary education in Business or Technology or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Strong knowledge of database languages such as SQL, Excel including Power Query, visualization tools such as PowerBI
Exceptional data analysis and problem-solving skills
Experience working in complex integrated On-premises ERP and cloud solutions including Oracle EBS, Service Cloud and Field Service Cloud considered an asset
Ability to think strategically and breakdown data supporting solid data driven analytics business decisions
Ability to work with minimum supervision
Motivated self-starter with capabilities to work within a fast-paced team-oriented environment
Excellent communication skills both written and verbal
WHY JOIN OUR TEAM:
Competitive wages and a comprehensive benefits package.
A continuous learning environment.
Ability to advance your career with a growing company.
NFI Group has been named a Manitoba Top Employer for 2020 and this is the tenth since the competition was established in 2007.
Employee social committee organizes numerous events throughout the year, including summer barbecues, holiday festivities, sporting events and tournaments, and much more.
Ongoing employee development through a variety of in-house training initiatives along with tuition subsidies for courses at outside institutions.
OUR WHY:
We exist to move people. Our mission is to design and deliver exceptional transportation solutions that are safe, accessible, efficient and reliable.
NFI Group is a leading independent global bus manufacturer providing a comprehensive suite of mass transportation solutions. News and information are available at www.nfigroup.com, www.newflyer.com, www.mcicoach.com, www.arbocsv.com, www.alexander-dennis.com, www.carfaircomposites.com and www.nfi.parts.

Title: Business Intelligence Developer (3 Year TFT)
Description:
Job Status Temporary Full-Time

About Us
If you are civic minded and interested in making an impact on people and businesses on the beautiful North Shore, consider working for the District of North Vancouver.
Home to vast parkland and attractions including Grouse Mountain, Lynn Canyon and Capilano Suspension Bridge, the District is inspired by nature, and enriched by people. The District offers exciting professional development opportunities and a competitive total compensation package. We are a flexible, family-friendly employer with a compressed work week program (9-day fortnight) and an inclusive work-place culture. This is an exciting time to join the District, as we embark on a range of initiatives to transform digital service delivery, customer experience, and our approach to climate action.

Position Overview
The District of North Vancouver is searching for a talented Business Intelligence (BI) developer to join our growing team of data enthusiasts. In this role, you will draw on organizational and external data sources to develop various analytic reports and dashboards for Senior Management and other interested parties. You will work with business users, gather requirements, and update existing BI reports as well as develop new BI reports as required. The BI developer will also aid in establishing organization wide data and reporting standards, define common terminology, and help to align existing and future reporting requests. Finally, they will interact with team members whenever data schemas require redesign in order to ensure the accommodation of new reporting requirements.
Who we are
We are a growing, multi-disciplinary team of technology professionals focused on providing our customers and colleagues the right solutions to help them succeed. We love what we do and take pride in delivering what our customers need, and we have been recognized for the innovative and high-quality work that we have delivered.
What we’re looking for
We’re looking for a talented individual to join our team for at least three years. You will be the lead BI Developer in a predominantly Microsoft shop and will work closely with both our Business customers throughout the organization and skilled technical architects, technology infrastructure specialists, and usability and user experience professionals. You will help apply the latest technology and aid the District in making informed decisions on how best to transform government services. Your responsibilities may include:

Collecting business reporting requirements and translating them into technical specifications.
Developing database queries and conducting analyses.
Creating visualizations and reports for requested projects.
Analysing existing reports and optimizing them for standardization across the organization.
Proposing schema and data flow optimization to enhance reporting performance.
Developing and updating technical documentation.
Collaborating with IT/Digital team members to set up and maintain BI tools, infrastructure, and integration with the organization’s data sources.
Maintaining and supporting Power BI.

What you’ll need to succeed
4+ years of related experience plus relevant training and education.
Proficiency in the use of Power BI. Those without experience with Power BI but with proven experience and aptitude with other BI tools such as Tableau and Qlik Sense may be considered.
Experience with data modelling and data schemas.
Experience with database operations and optimization for MS SQL Server.
In-depth understanding of database management systems, online analytical processing (OLAP) and ETL (Extract, transform, load) framework.
Experience with SQL queries, SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) and/or SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS).
Proven abilities to take initiative and be innovative.
Analytical mind with an aptitude for problem-solving.
A strong attention to detail and a passion for standardization.
A BSc/BA in Computer Science, Engineering or a relevant field.
We are looking for someone who has a degree or diploma in computer technology plus considerable related data, business analysis, and project leadership experience.

If you have what we’re looking for, and have a passion to serve people and the community, and a demonstrated commitment to supporting a healthy and safe workplace, we would like to hear from you. Please apply on-line with your resume and cover letter at https://careers.dnv.org. This position will remain open until filled.

To support the health and safety of our employees and the public we serve, the District of North Vancouver has recently introduced a Mandatory COVID-19 Vaccination Policy. Compliance with this Policy is a required condition of employment.
We thank you for your interest in employment with the District of North Vancouver and advise that only those shortlisted for an interview will be contacted.

Compensation The pay range for this unionized position is between $46.64 and $55.15 per hour based on a 35 hour work week.
