Title: Manager, Evaluation and Business Intelligence
Company: CASA Child, Adolescent and Family Mental Health
Description:
Manager, Evaluation and Business Intelligence
Job Details:  1.0 FTE, permanent, out of scope
Posting ID:  22-015
Closing Date:  April 11, 2022
Location:  CASA Downtown
Open Positions:  1
About CASA
CASA is a major non-profit community-based provider of mental health services for children, adolescents and their families within greater Edmonton and from Central and Northern Alberta. Since 1988, CASA has provided assessment and treatment services for up to 4,000 children and adolescents from ages three to 18 each year through a continuum ranging from consultation in community outreach settings to intensive treatment programs.
We are currently looking for data driven leader to manage our Business Intelligence and Evaluation Department. In this role you will liaise with multiple different parts of the organization with your team to effectively evaluate CASA’s clinical programs and help further CASA’s core values.
Job Purpose
Reporting to the director, people and culture, the manager, business intelligence and evaluation, is responsible for leading the organization’s business intelligence and evaluation team and strategy. The manager, business intelligence and evaluation will work collaboratively within the leadership team to support evaluation of clinical programs, the use of business intelligence analytics, and organizational performance metrics aligned with CASA’s core values of community, patient-centred and family-inclusive care, collaboration, equity, diversity and inclusivity, and outcomes-based accountability.
Duties and Responsibilities

Develops and implements organizational and program-specific clinical evaluation frameworks in collaboration with the clinical leadership team.
Oversees and contributes to the design, collection and analysis of qualitative and quantitative clinical program data.
Consults with leaders throughout the organization to understand and define evaluation of program deliverables and outcomes.
Champions the importance of data collection and data quality throughout all levels of the organization.
Ensures use of appropriate methodology and approach for data analyses and evaluation.
Reviews and provides feedback to data and evaluation analysts on internal and external reports for quality assurance.
Ensures external evaluation reporting requirements are met. .
Collaborates with the manager, research to identify potential research projects of organizational interest and provides accessibility to data.
Develops and implements a business intelligence program to support data-driven decision-making and organizational strategy.
Contributes to the development and monitoring of key performance indicators (KPIs) at the program and organizational level.
Prepares a variety of communication and knowledge translation materials including reports, infographics, dashboards and presentations.
Provides recommendations on innovative software and data platforms and ensures effective implementation when needed.
Collaborates with all business operations teams to facilitate efficient information flow and provide access to high quality data.
Provides leadership, coaching, mentorship to data and evaluation analysts and research assistants, including regular performance reviews.

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in public health, health sciences, information science, medicine, computer science or other related degree. A graduate degree would be an asset.
Experience developing and implementing healthcare evaluation frameworks.
Experience in application of a diversity (qualitative and quantitative) of evaluation, research and data analysis methodologies and techniques.
Knowledge and/or experience in business intelligence is a strong asset.
Advanced skills in Microsoft Office Suite.
Proficiency in one or more coding languages and/or data analysis software programs like SQL, R, Stata, SAS, Python.
Experience in a leadership role with budgeting responsibilities is a strong asset.
Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Tableau and/or Power BI is an asset.
Experience in a healthcare environment, particularly mental health, is a strong asset.
Demonstrated leader and mentor in a highly collaborative team environment.
Excellent project management skills, with strong ability to prioritize competing work demands.
Excellent problem-solving and critical thinking skills.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Disclaimer
We appreciate your interest in CASA Child, Adolescent and Family Mental Health. However, only those applicants selected for interviews will be contacted. CASA is an Equal Opportunity Employer that is committed to providing employment opportunities to all individuals. CASA is not currently accepting unsolicited resumes from search firms. Only those candidates permissible to work in Canada are applicable to this position.

Title: Inventory Control Analyst
Description:
GENERAL ACCOUNTABILITIES
The Inventory Control Analyst is responsible for overseeing inventory-related issues which include running inventory reports, discovering and analyzing discrepancies in the inventory data, and improving the inventory control systems. The Inventory Control Analyst is also responsible for ensuring data integrity, accurate reporting, and maintenance of all parameters for warehouse layouts. This role will also partner with the Accounts Payable team to ensure the accurate tracking of all inventory transactions.
SPECIFIC ACCOUNTABILITIES

Monitor and control inventory integrity and control warehouse layouts
Update data, run reports and identify discrepancies while maintaining inventory control records, and regular management reports
Analyze actual sales compared to forecast and identify cause/effect relationship of variances
Perform daily cycle counts, reconcile, and monitor inventory accuracy while resolving any errors or discrepancies in a timely manner
Make recommendations for corrective actions based on on-going analysis
Observe all safety rules in performance of duties

QUALIFICATIONS / EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS

University degree or college diploma, preferably in a related field
Strong analytical skills, attention to detail and understanding of data management
Understanding of technical aspects of warehouse operations including storage solutions
Thorough knowledge and understanding of bulk and finish goods processes
Strong problem solver, able to create solutions to challenges in an expedient manner
Able to communicate effectively with various organizational levels including warehouse floor employees and customers
Advanced skills in MS Excel
Ability to travel and work at other locations as required
Previous work experience in a related field would be a strong asset
Knowledge of ERP systems an asset
Able to work Monday to Friday, afternoon availability required

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Additional pay:

Overtime pay

Disability insurance
Employee assistance program

Life insurance
On-site parking
Paid time off
RRSP match
Vision care

8 hour shift
Day shift
Monday to Friday

Do you have availability for some afternoon availability as well?

Inventory control: 3 years (required)

Title: Principal Consultant, Data Integration and BI
Description:
Responsibilities

Design, build, and test custom data warehouse and BI solutions for Myers-Holum clients using the Oracle NetSuite Analytics Warehouse (NSAW) platform
Translate business requirements into technical specifications
Develop custom data integration solutions to ingest data from multiple sources (cloud and on-premise) using various data integration / data pipelining tools, Oracle Analytics Cloud (OAC), and Oracle Autonomous Data Warehouse (ADW)
Implement NSAW Best Practices

Qualifications and Skills

10+ years of relevant professional experience
6+ years experience with data management using Oracle or other relational database
6+ years experience with data warehouse and data integration projects, using ETL / data integration / data pipelining tools
Proficiency with at least one cloud or on-premise data integration / data pipelining tool, such as Fivetran, Stitch, Talend, Glue, Nexla, Informatica, Oracle Data Integrator
Proficiency in at least one version of SQL: Oracle (preferred), SQLServer,MySQL, PostgreSQL, Snowflake
Experience with at least one of the following BI tools: Oracle OBIEE, OAC, Looker, PowerBI, Qlikview, Tableau
Experience with using REST APIs and/or GraphQL APIs to get data from cloud data sources is preferred
Knowledge of ERP data and business processes
Business analysis skills
Strong written and verbal communication skills

About Myers-Holum

Myers-Holum Inc. (MHI) is a technology and management consulting firm founded in 1981 and based in New York, New York with several professional services practices, specialized skills and expertise
Today, MHI has regional presence in core markets across North America delivering of NetSuite and other cloud services.
Our firm is comprised of a remote workforce of 275+ consultants and developers working across the US and Canada
Our cutting edge technology partners include Oracle + NetSuite, Google Cloud Platform, Dell Boomi and Stripe, all working with us to provide the best customer experience throughout each implementation
Specialties include Enterprise Data Management, Data Warehousing, Business Intelligence/Analytics, Master Data Management, Performance Management, Google BigQuery, NetSuite ERP and Ecommerce implementations and Managed Services
Having consulted for more than 800 companies ranging from the Fortune 500 to the lower Mid-Market, our workforce represents a diverse and ambitious group of consulting and development professionals with comprehensive industry, systems, and data management expertise.
The clients we service represent a wide array of industries including: Manufacturing, WD, Retail, Ecommerce, Software & Technology, NFP, Financial Services, Pharma & Healthcare, Hospitality, and Insurance
Having been a NetSuite Alliance Partner and Commerce Agency Partner since 2017, MHI has been recognized as NetSuite Partner of the Year in 2019, 2020 and Dell Boomi Growth Partner of the Year in 2020
Website: myersholum.com

Benefits

MHI offers competitive base salary, incentive pay and comprehensive benefits including medical, dental, 401k
Company access to training and full coverage for certification/exam fees in a variety of products and professional skill sets
Career growth and upward mobility to meet your long term goals
Remote working opportunity when not traveling for client requirements with full access to the team through technology

Title: Business System Analyst
Description:
Business System Analyst

Capco – The Future. Now.

Capco is a distinctly and positively different place to work. Much more than consultants, we are active participants in the global financial services industry. Our passionate business and technology professionals enjoy a unique environment where they are actively encouraged to apply intellect, innovation, experience and teamwork. We are dedicated to fully supporting our world class clients as they respond to challenges and opportunities in: Banking, Capital Markets, Finance Risk & Compliance, Insurance, and Wealth and Investment Management. Experience Capco for yourself at capco.com

Let’s Talk About You

You want to Own Your Career. You’re serious about rising as far and as fast as your work and achievements can take you. And you’re ready to write the next chapter of your career story: a challenging and rewarding role as a Capco Business Analyst.

Let’s Get Down To Business

We are looking for Business System Analyst to join our Business Consulting team. This is a chance to join one of the fastest growing and exciting consultancies, with an opportunity to grow with the company as it expands.

Responsibilities

Establish collaborative relationships with external and internal stakeholders.
Working closely with clients to define and optimize their roadmap
Gather accurate requirements and create user stories
Strategically and creatively think about how the consumer experience should work; translating a vision to processes and requirements
Shaping and executing complex digital transformations

Show Us What You’ve Got

It will be very useful if you have some or all of the following skills and experience:

5+ years Business Analysis experience
Elaborate and elicit detailed technical user stories based on feature and epics prioritized via business roadmaps and desired outcomes
Key skillsets required:
Agile delivery experience
Ability to structure and derive technical details from business priorities, technical architecture and elicit sufficient details to provide clarity to clear scope and desired outcomes
Collaborative and ability to manage complex priorities
Cloud & multi tiered apps
Work with vendor and project teams to analyze and document data, process, integration details and specification for the teams' to follow
Support teams' to answer questions and triage issues
Liaison with both vendor and teams to align and coordinate details to produce a final set of specification, technical stories, intakes and any artifacts required to support the targeted scope (JIRA, Confluence a must)

Technical expertise and comfort working with APIs and JSON.


Professional experience is important. But it’s paramount you share our belief in disruptive innovation that puts clients ahead in a tough market. From Day One, your key skill will be to perceive new and better ways of doing things to give your clients an unfair advantage.

Now Take the Next Step

If you’re looking forward to progressing your career with us, then we’re looking forward to receiving your application.

Capco is well known for its thought leadership and client-centric model that distinguishes it from other consulting firms. Capco’s strong technology and digital knowledge base, it’s global experience of the Financial Service enables us to deliver projects from strategy through to delivery. We are committed to providing new areas of expertise from which our clients will greatly benefit. We have:

Access to industry-focused talent globally
Ability to leverage best-of-breed, innovative products and solutions for complex architecture and large-scale transformation
Extended global geographic market reach
Ability to capitalize on our client footprint and deep domain expertise within financial services

For more information about Capco, visit www.Capco.com.

Capco is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.

Title: Keepstock Routing Analyst
Description:
JOB DESCRIPTION
Primary Function:

The Routing Analyst is responsible for managing the implementation of all routing processes, workforce management scheduling, and will work cross-functionally to provide routing strategies and solutions for On-Site Services North America Organization. Activities include route dispatch, MobileCast application training for users, short / long term capacity forecasting, and creating future-state scenarios The Routing Analyst collaborates with local leadership including Managers Onsite Services and Supervisors Onsite Services to provide consistent comprehensive route management; and OSR/OSS team members to ensure the adoption of MobileCast app use.

Principal Duties & Responsibilities:

Provides strategic analysis and recommendations to Field Managers and Supervisors to provide optimized route scenarios for KeepStock as well as other services and solutions for the US / Canada regions.
Support at least one and a half region or two regions, in average about 150 employees per region.
Masters knowledge of Dispatch, Maintenance and Territory Planner modules within Roadnet Transportation Suite and MobileCast field App to train new field team members and troubleshoot functionality issues.
Onboarding plan for Onsite Representatives related to routing and forecasting.
Influences and recommends optimized routing options to territory leaders.
Leverages additional learnings and functionality of Roadnet software and recommend Continuous Improvement opportunities to peers and leadership.
Proactively communicates with territory leadership to make problems visible and decrease variation to help enhance the customer experience.
Analyzes data to address anomalies and exceptions of existing routes.
Create regional plan for routes base on actual hours and review monthly with Onsite Managers.
Leverages business, organization and customer changes and incorporates in routing scenarios.
Supports company projects and initiatives as required by the business.

Qualifications:

5 years of customer service experience, preferably in the KeepStock environment or a like operations support role (forecasting, data analysis and field support)
Strong analytical and technology skills and possesses understanding of routing logic.
Work force management, route management or similar experience preferred.
Demonstrates responsiveness and urgency; able to react quickly to customer needs and meet tight deadlines.
Ability to multi-task with agility and perform in a fast paced, high-volume environment.
Must possess strong communication and interpersonal skills across multiple levels within the organization, including the ability to influence without authority, negotiate, and escalate unresolved problems or questions.
Master in Roadnet software, MS Office applications, including Excel, SharePoint and other analytical tools.
Ability to evaluate and interpret data to make solid recommendations and business solutions.
Must be proactive, able to effectively prioritize tasks and work with little or no supervision and possess an innate ability to follow through on results.
Accomplished in and fosters the use of Continuous Improvement (CI) methods and tools
Project management experience is preferred.
Ability to build strategic partnerships across the network.

Description: Position Title: Cloud & Data Center Systems Support AnalystLocation:  Flexible (Victoria, Vancouver, Regina, Calgary)Compensation:  Negotiable (depending on experience)Reports to: Service Desk ManagerSkills OverviewThe role is diverse in its exposure to technology and vendors but is focused on data center support. Title: Business Credit Analyst
Description: **Posting Deadline: Please submit your application by 11:59 PM PST, April 11, 2022**Position Type: PermanentTogether, Let’s Do Great Things!We’re the largest financial institution based on Vancouver Island and the Gulf Islands, and we’ve got an opportunity for you. We are looking for a Business Credit Analyst to join our Commercial Services team, so if you’re passionate about commercial lending and have experience with financial analysis, we’d like to hear from you.What’s the role?As a Business Credit Analyst, you provide analytical and credit analyst support to the Commercial Services team. You will monitor commercial loans in an assigned portfolio and ensure adherence to established policies, procedures, checks and balances. You are responsible for analyzing financial and other data and writing detailed credit reports recommending renewal of existing commercial credit facilities as well as recommendations of new commercial loan applications. Your primary areas of responsibility include; preparing and conducting annual reviews, credit applications and status reports in an accurate and timely manner on business accounts to the assigned team.Your duties also include:Maintaining relationships with a network of key contacts and centres of influence;Identifying new sales opportunities from existing and new commercial members during the commercial credit renewal and application processes and recommends referrals in the area(s) of interest; retail, commercial, wealth management and insurance;All aspects of credit and financial analysis;Recommending accounts for collection and assists in credit collection activities;Follows-up on delinquencies and overdrafts;Prepares and completes any supporting documentation.What are we looking for?University Degree with a preference to business, management, accounting, or finance, or an equivalent combination of education, training, and experience;1-3 years’ experience as a business analyst or small business lending experience and/or an equivalent combination of education and experience;Previous commercial lending, accounting experiences, and sales would be an asset.Ideally, you are a flexible, collaborative team player with:Knowledge of business lending policies and procedures, collection processes inclusive of legal requirements.Knowledge of statutory guidelines and regulations governing business lending.Knowledge of all Coastal Community products and services.Knowledge of the banking system and the Microsoft network of programs.What we offer you: Competitive salaryA comprehensive benefits package including MSP, dental, and extended healthcareEmployer paid RRSP benefitOngoing support for education and career developmentWho are we?Since first forming in 1946, Coastal Community has grown to become the largest financial services provider based on Vancouver Island. We’re proud of the legacy we’ve built and the things that make us who we are:We’re 100% member-owned, with all decisions made locally—right here on Vancouver Island.We’re a growing organization with over $4 billion in assets under management. Coastal Community helps improve the financial health of over 100,000 members and clients through our 24 branches, 16 insurance offices, 4 business centres, plus our wide range of online and digital services.We believe in making meaningful contributions to the communities we call home. Each year, we give over half a million to community organizations and programs.If you join us you’ll work hard, but have a lot of fun along the way. We offer a generous compensation package and a great work/life balance because we want you to spend your career here. Many people do!Job Type: Full-time

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst - Edmonton
Business Analyst (Identity and SailPoint asset) (Remote Ottawa Hub)
Description:
Requisition ID: 141870  Cost Centre: [[costCenter]]  Employee Referral Program – Potential Reward: $1,000.00  We are committed to investing in our employees and helping you continue your career at Scotiabank.

 The Team

 Scotiabank’s Information Security & Control (IS&C)’s Global Identity and Access Management group is responsible for development, management, and governance of Logical Access control to the Bank’s information systems. The Business Analysis & Reporting and Analytics team is a team within the Identity and Access Management group that focuses on supporting internal GIAM applications, teams and business partners from a BA perspective.

 The Role:

 The Business Analyst contributes to the overall success of Global Identity and Access Management (GIAM) by ensuring specific analytics and reporting goals, plans, and overall initiatives are executed / delivered in support of the team’s business strategies and objectives. Ensures all activities conducted follow governing regulations, internal policies and procedures.

 Where could you work? Both at home and in the office.
 We’re focused on being an employer of choice for the communities we serve and offering a hybrid work environment for top Tech talent in Canada’s capital city.
 We’re creating a local ScotiaTech Hub in Ottawa. You’ll have the opportunity both to work remotely, and head to the Ottawa office for in-person moments that foster team cohesiveness and collaboration.

 Is this role right for you?


 You can prepare Business Requirement documents, analyze data and access processes and procedures to deliver recommendations.
 You are passionate in new technologies and enjoy the challenges of working with Identity Access teams in implementing security controls to protect them.
 Working on different types of projects (from large complex to simple) is a part of your DNA.
 You love to collaborate with various business lines, IT support functions and IS&C Control functions.
 You are a strong supporter of a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems and knowledge
 Build and maintain reporting dashboards to facilitate regular monitoring


 Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role?


 2+ years full cycle Business Analyst experience including performing business requirement documents, process workflows, use cases, user story, data analytics with metrics and preparing communications.
 You possess advanced communication (verbal/written/presentation) skills as you actively speak to multiple stakeholders
 2+ years hands-on experience with the Microsoft suite of applications (i.e.: Visio, PowerPoint, excel), PowerBI, PowerShell an asset, scripting, pivot tables, MS Access
 2+ years hands experience with SailPoint Identity IQ (IIQ) and Security IQ (SIQ)
 2+ years experience in Information Security, Identity and Access Management and Identity Access Governance
 Some knowledge on any version of Cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP) – (Nice to have)
 Post-secondary education in Computer Science or in a related field – (Nice to have)
 Spanish speaking is a nice-to-have


 What's in it for you?


 We have an inclusive and collaborative working environment that encourages creativity and curiosity and celebrates success.
 We provide you with the tools and technology needed to create meaningful customer experiences.
 You’ll get to work with and learn from diverse industry leaders, who have hailed from top technology companies around the world.
 Our work from home social channel offers weekly virtual yoga, social events, learning opportunities, and lots more.
 We offer a competitive total rewards package, including a performance bonus, company matching programs (on pension & profit sharing), and generous vacation.


 #ottawahub

 Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Ottawa  Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.  At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Analyst, Credit Risk
Description:
Help us boldly shape retail in Canada
Canadian Tire Corporation, Limited (“CTC”) is one of Canada’s most admired and trusted companies. With world-class Owned Brands and exciting market-leading merchandising strategies, we are continually innovating with purpose: to be there for Canadians from coast-to-coast. We are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join Canadian Tire and its group of companies.
To help define where and how we work, CTC has introduced Hybrid Workplace Personas. While each role fits into a different persona category, this may evolve as employees progress in their career or business needs change. The Analyst, Credit Risk position is categorized as a Connector, which means that the incumbent will be working with a variety of colleagues and partners to achieve business outcomes that require a mixed use of virtual and CTC campus presence.
What you’ll do
Develop and implement account management and collection strategies by using data mining and analytical techniques
Monitor strategy effectiveness and identify opportunities to improve performance
Analyze and respond to existing and emerging delinquency trends
Develop and maintain software and systems relating to Credit Risk infrastructure
Formulate plans to address customer needs, in the form of authorization decisions, reinstatement strategies, card reissuance, collections tactics and other related account maintenance analytics
Manage multiple work assignments in a constantly changing business environment
Establish and maintain effective working relationships with operational teams within CTFS
What you bring
University degree in an analytic discipline (Mathematics, Statistics, Business, or a quantitative discipline)
Demonstrated analytical, mathematical and problem-solving skills
Programming experience, preferably with data extraction and manipulation software (SAS, SQL)
Good knowledge of MS Office, particularly in Excel and PowerPoint
Attention to detail and personal accountability to ensure accuracy of produced results
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Capable of clearly communicating analytical results to business stakeholders
Capability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines
Ability to prioritize and independently execute assigned work
Team player and results oriented
Nice to have
Knowledge of Risk Management and Credit Cards
Experience in statistical modeling, data analysis or data mining
About Canadian Tire Corporation
As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies . To learn more follow us on LinkedIn .
#LI-GM1
 Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees - their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience. Credit Risk & Custmr Analytics

Title: Business Analyst, Technology
Description:
About eOne
Entertainment One Ltd. (eOne) is a talent-driven independent studio that specializes in the development, acquisition, production, financing, distribution and sales of entertainment content. As part of global play and entertainment company Hasbro (NASDAQ: HAS), eOne's expertise spans across film and television production and sales; production, distribution and brand management of kids and family properties; digital content; and immersive and live entertainment. Through its extensive reach and scale, and a deep commitment to high-quality entertainment, eOne unlocks the power and value of creativity.
eOne brings to market both original and existing content, sourcing IP from Hasbro’s portfolio of 1500+ brands, and through a diversified network of creative partners and eOne companies including: international feature film distribution company Sierra/Affinity; unscripted television production companies Renegade 83, Daisybeck and Blackfin; live entertainment leaders Round Room Live; and award-winning emerging content and technology studio Secret Location.
As a Business Analyst, you will join Entertainment One’s Information Technology team to ensure process mapping, requirement gathering, data analysis, relationship management, and project and/or operational support.
Key Responsibilities:
Create and document Business Requirements, gap analysis and support documents for projects related to Entertainment One’s Strategic Initiatives.
Analyze and synthesize stakeholder requirements into actionable items.
Facilitate stakeholder engagement through interviews, workshops, meetings, and/or training.
Submit technology estimation (cost benefit analysis) documentation and provide to clients in order to facilitate feasibility assessments on project initiatives.
Act as a liaison between business and technology groups.
Provide initiative documentation as deemed necessary.
Ensure business and system requirements are documented in the form of detailed functional and non-functional requirements and business designs, which meet industry best practices and are consumable by clients, development and testing.
Provide operational support following the change management process.
Research existing policies, procedures, methodologies and systems that support the current state and identify changes needed to support revised processes. Work with business and process engineering to identify and build process improvements into design.
Utilize creative thinking to modify or select the most suitable procedure/approach that results in providing eOne with optimum solutions to business and technology challenges
Lead requirement gathering and other sessions with Stakeholders, to capture the requirements and specifications.
Using negotiating and facilitation skills, resolve issues across competing segments and channels to arrive at solutions that meet the needs of all stakeholders. Actively manage client expectations on the BA work package and the initiative overall where providing support.
Work with the technology team to ensure understanding of the business requirements, use cases and business designs, and obtain sign off on the various elements to ensure solution delivery is appropriate and meets the needs of the business.
Support the work packages for the Development, Testing, Communication, Learning, and Implementation teams by conducting walkthroughs, providing clarification and facilitating issue resolution.
Conduct user training.
Business Planning and Tracking - Meet business requests within budget, on time, and within acceptable quality levels. Manage assigned work packages against timelines and within scope and budget; make recommendations on corrective actions if work package deliverables are in jeopardy. Create change requests as required. Document and raise issues for resolution encountered during the requirements definition process.
Work for consensus and contribute to achievement of team/group goals.
Provide support in RFP process and vendor management.
Continuous Improvement - Work to provide continuous improvement of and ensure high level of quality in all deliverables, processes and procedures.
Communication - Create organized and professional presentation material for clients and partner stakeholders, presenting recommendations in a logical, articulate and influencial manner. Facilitate and lead discussions as required, preparing documentation to record discussion and follow-up actions.
Key Competencies:
Passionate innovators, creators, collaborators, and leaders who will be delivering solutions that meet our internal clients' changing needs.
At least 5 years of Business Analysis experience.
Well-developed analytical skills with strong attention to detail.
Experience in business requirements documentation.
Experience in Use Case creation.
Strong multi-tasking and organizational skills.
Well-developed writing skills sufficient to create and precisely articulate requirements, ideas, and opinions.
A University degree in business and/or information technology (or equivalent work experience) is an asset.
Certified business analyst professional or equivalent work experience (preferred).
Demonstrated success in delivering initiatives across multiple business units in a matrix environment.
Extensive experience with all aspects of Requirements Management: Business Process Modeling, Use Case modeling, use case specifications, functional and non-functional requirements and interface design.
Demonstrated ability to build relationships, work collaboratively, and resolve problems with people at all levels in the organization, across lines of business and with third party vendors.
Excellent interpersonal, communication, negotiation and mediation skills.
Self-driven and someone who takes ownership.
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office including Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
MS Visio experience.
MS SharePoint experience (preferred).
Previous Finance system implementation experience (preferred)
What you’ll be a part of:
Break time: free snacks, winter holiday office closures, reduced hours in summer
Party time: office bar carts, after work drinks, holiday and summer parties, and sometimes just because
Be inspired: regular film screenings, concerts, and opportunity to get involved in industry events
The office: modern facilities, in house screening rooms, more snacks, and swag
Build a better world: transcend entertainment to our corporate social responsibility activities. Plan a social event.
Promote healthy lifestyles. Go green. Give back.
Grow: develop your career and shape your future
We thank everyone for their interest but only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
Entertainment One is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to providing accommodations for persons with disabilities and supporting diversity and inclusion within our work environment. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodation needed to ensure you have access to a fair and equitable process. #LI-Hybrid

Title: Pricing Analyst
Description:
Join our Business Analytics Team as a Pricing Analyst!
 When was the last time you bragged about where you work? At CARFAX, we do it every day. Why? Because we’re proud to work for a company with a strong mission and trusted brand. We’re proud to work with people who care about what they do and work hard every day to deliver their best. And just announced, the return of the 4-day work week from May 30th to Labour Day! We’ve created the type of company culture where the term, “work- hard play- hard” isn’t just a catchy saying, it’s part of the #CARFAXdifference!  Our Pricing Analyst will join our rapidly growing Pricing group and report to the Head of B2B Pricing. Playing a key part in guiding pricing strategy and operations, this person will work closely with Product teams to support both product strategy and go-to-market initiatives.
 As a Pricing Analyst you will:

 Perform complex data analysis that will help to guide pricing strategy and operations 
Proactively analyze product usage, billing and customer data to identify drivers of customer acquisition and churn
 Collaborate with the Head of B2B Pricing to develop and enhance value based pricing models that align with pricing strategy
 Work with technology teams to streamline reporting and operational pricing processes to reduce time to market
 Ensure timeliness and accuracy of input data used in pricing models
 Build statistical models to help with value-based customer segmentation, churn prediction and anomaly detection
 Work with product teams to share value insights and support product development roadmap

 To be considered you will need:

 Bachelor’s degree is required, preferred degree in Mathematics, Business Analytics, Economics, or similar areas of focus
 Minimum 3 years of experience in a business analytics role, at least one year focused on Pricing, ideally B2B
 Advanced Excel skills (Pivot Tables, vlookups, conditional sums etc.)
 Advanced proficiency querying databases using SQL 
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
 Highly organized with attention to detail
 A commitment to learning and continuous improvement

 What’s nice to have:

 Master’s degree with a quantitative focus
 Experience querying data using Hive and/or Spark
 Knowledge of a visualization tool such as MicroStrategy, Cognos, Tableau
 Program language skills using R or Python

Title: Senior Studio Business Analyst
Description:
Company Description
SSENSE (pronounced [es-uhns]) is a global technology platform operating at the intersection of culture, community, and commerce. Headquartered in Montreal, it features a mix of established and emerging luxury brands across womenswear, menswear, kidswear, and Everything Else.
SSENSE has garnered critical acclaim as both an e-commerce engine and a producer of cultural content, generating an average of 100 million monthly page views. Approximately 80% of its audience is between the ages of 18 to 40. It is privately held and has achieved high double digit annual growth and profitability since its inception.

Job Description
Reporting to the Associate Manager of Planning, the Senior Studio Business Analyst is responsible for analyzing requirements to support all projects and strategic initiatives across Studio operations. This role will directly partner with various business units to help develop long-term strategies in key initiatives that drive growth and profitability improvements. The Senior Analyst is responsible for formulating clear recommendations on how to improve internal processes, and enhance our production by mapping out processes and analyzing data from various sources. The ideal candidate will work cross-functionally, embrace coaching and have a collaborative style, with the ability to influence and motivate to drive performance results.
Reporting & Forecasting (40%)
Actively participate in assessing current and future data needs that can scale with the the business
Establish key performance indicators, and streamline and improve internal and external reporting dashboards to provide visibility to the business on operational performance, as well as ensuring methods for reporting are maintained
Proactively make recommendations to the Associate Manager of Planning to help drive initiatives for financial planning and business intelligence systems
Translate all Studio strategic and growth initiatives into operational metrics and dashboards to monitor project performance results
Carry out ad-hoc reporting and data analysis requests, articulate metrics and establish analytical models for various forecasting needs
Strategy & Growth Support (40%)
Lead analyses and develop the business cases for studio initiatives relating to new ways of working, including new or improved technology solution and corporate initiatives that are supported by studio operations
Suggest thoughtful methodologies to analyze business requirements within a project
Build models to back up financial decisions and reduce business risk
Proactively anticipate, identify and remove roadblocks, and work cross-functionally to ensure everything stays on track
Liaise and collaborate with various SMES and business stakeholders of the Studio, including Finance, Technology, Product, and Real Estate, to socialize strategy, to gather project requirements, and to understand user needs
Document needs and business requirements from internal and external stakeholders for assigned projects
Business Processes & Integration (20%)
Streamline and optimize internal processes and interaction flow with various stakeholders of the Studio, including Finance, Technology, Product, and Real Estate, to contribute to data alignment and to ensure integration of growth initiatives
Performing ongoing reviews of business processes, anticipating requirements, uncovering areas for improvement, and developing and implementing solutions.
Maintain and improve the Studio Planning Team knowledge base through standard, concise and relevant documentation

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Engineering, Information Technology, or related field
3-5 years of experience in business analysis, data analysis or project management
Prior experience in data processing, manipulating large datasets, querying databases, data analysis, and reporting
Experience with data management and visualization software such as Tableau or similar data discovery and visualization tools, an asset
Knowledge of process mapping software (Lucidchart, Visio)
Advanced knowledge of the Microsoft Office Suite, in particular Excel and PowerPoint
Excellent English written and verbal communication skills, French an asset
Skills
Capacity to synthesize and simplify complex information
Detail oriented with a results-driven mindset
Highly analytical with the ability to present exec-level recommendations and influence through sound quantitative and qualitative analysis
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced performance-driven environment, juggling multiple projects/multi-task and work effectively under pressure
Strong interest in retail and e-commerce and a passion for shaping the future of e-commerce an asset
Knowledge of fashion, styling and photography, an asset
Solution-oriented mindset and can-do attitude to overcome challenges
Team player with a natural ability to build relationships and collaborate

Title: Customer Experience Business Analyst
Description:
Company Description
SSENSE (pronounced [es-uhns]) is a global technology platform operating at the intersection of culture, community, and commerce. Headquartered in Montreal, it features a mix of established and emerging luxury brands across womenswear, menswear, kidswear, and Everything Else™.
SSENSE has garnered critical acclaim as both an e-commerce engine and a producer of cultural content, generating an average of 100 million monthly page views. Approximately 80% of its audience is between the ages of 18 to 40. It is privately held and has achieved high double digit annual growth and profitability since its inception.

Job Description
Reporting to the Manager of Fraud Prevention & Customer Insights, the Business Analyst supports the Customer Experience(CX) team, working in collaboration with other Business Analysts working for the four pillars of CX: Care, Personal Styling, Fraud Prevention, and Retail. The business analyst will be responsible for formulating clear recommendations on how to improve internal processes and enhance our customers’ experience by analyzing data from various sources, creating dashboards and mapping out operational processes. The ideal candidate is a strong team player who is passionate about business analysis, curious about customer experience and always seeks to learn more.
Responsibilities
Reporting & Dashboarding (25%)
Support the Manager of each pillar, and their Team Leaders, by providing day-to-day results and ad-hoc reports on sales, customers and operations
Identify new reporting and dashboarding needs
Liaise with the Data Operations team to build dashboards and reports
Develop, format and clearly communicate findings and insights from the data
Analysis & Forecasting (35%)
Support Senior Business Analysts and Managers in producing volume forecasts and resource planning
Estimate man-hours required for various tasks, mandates, and operational needs
Analyze data to identify operational opportunities and risks
Perform financial analysis for projects and business cases
Gather and analyze information from various sources to inform business decisions
Business Processes & Product Development (40%)
Collaborate with Product Managers, Data Analysts and Data Engineers to develop new tools for Customer Experience, fixing bugs or adding features based on team needs
Document, streamline and optimize internal business processes, aligning with the Customer Experience, Distribution Center, and Logistics teams
Communicate process and tool updates to CX team during cross-functional meetings
Participate in business case drafting, providing insights, data visualization and building presentation slides when needed

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Management, Business Technology Management, or a related field
A minimum of 2 years relevant experience
Practical experience with Excel/Google Suite
Good understanding of business dynamics
Experience solving analytical problems using quantitative approaches
Skills
Analytical and detail oriented
Creative thinker with good problem solving abilities
Strong time management and organization skills
Good communication and presentation skills
Strong interpersonal skills

Title: Sr. Data Analyst
Description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.
Job Title
Sr. Data Analyst
Job Description
What is the opportunity?
Acting as a Data Analyst within the Core Credit Systems, Retail Banking & Payments Technology group you will have the opportunity to perform end-to-end requirements analysis and complete documentation for development projects of various complexity impacting the portfolio of a variety of systems used to service the loan and mortgage credit product. You will have the opportunity to manage multiple priorities and time constraints while delivering high-quality requirements. You will also have the opportunity to partner with various IT and business stakeholders.
What will you do?
Plan and execute detailed system requirements phases and identify, track, and resolve business systems issues
Assess, research, analyze, and document stakeholder needs, using the recommended or selecting the appropriate information gathering and data modelling technique to elicit requirements
Contribute to successful completion of project objectives with high quality, within budget, and on time
Review test plans, scenarios, cases as needed
Support Development, Quality Assurance and User Acceptance Testing activities
Build and maintain a repository of reusable system documentation
Identifying risks, dependencies, assumptions and constraints
Effectively communicate and build rapport with team members, stakeholders, and business unit partners through all project phases
What do you need to succeed?
Must-have
7+ years of experience as Data Analyst
Self-motivated, independent, possess excellent analytical, communication and presentation skills
Proven experience in various project delivery methodologies such as Iterative Waterfall and/or Agile
Proven experience in requirements analysis and documentation such as Use Cases and Scenarios, User Stories, Process Modeling, User Interface Design, Data Requirements, Acceptance and Evaluation Criteria Definition
Hands-on data analysis experience using medium to complex level SQL on but not limited to Relational databases
Nice-to-have
Understanding of API
Understanding of streaming platform (e.g. Kafka)
Knowledge of banking and credit product concepts
Working knowledge of Confluence
Experience in financial credit domain
Understanding of Data governance. Ideally should have worked on Data governance tools such as Collibra
What’s in it for you?
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
Opportunities to do challenging work
Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities
Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies
RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

Title: Sr. Business Systems Analyst - Service Layer
Description:
TD Description
Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.
Department Overview
Building a World-Class, Diverse and Inclusive Technology Team at TD
We can't afford to be boring. Neither can you. The scale and scope of what TD does may surprise you. The rapid pace of change makes it a business imperative for us to be smart and open-minded in the way we think about technology. TD's technology and business teams become more intertwined as new opportunities present themselves. This new era in banking does not equal boring. Not at TD, anyway.
TD Business Systems Analysis covers a mandate that includes (but isn't limited to) proposing technical systems to accomplish business requirements enterprise-wide. These experts build relationships with business partners and other groups of diverse subject matter experts and stakeholders (both internal and external) to:
Plan + Elicit + Analyze + Document + Communicate +Manage system requirements;
Assess client needs and recommend the right technology; and
Offer operational and process-related analysis and support.
There's room to grow in all of it.
Job Description
About This Role
We are looking for someone to plan, manage, and lead the delivery of detailed system requirements and technical and functional specifications that align to standards and frameworks. You will provide technical leadership and work in close partnership with ambitious business and technology partners, project teams and stakeholders to plan, elicit, analyze, document, communicate and manage detailed functional specifications.
Meaningful work is fueled by meaningful performance and career development conversations with your manager. Here's some of what you may be asked to perform:
Work with technology partners (e.g. Solution Designers and Architects) to research and analyze current state system capabilities and define technology solutions options and recommendations.
Define, document and translate business requirements into detailed functional specifications, taking into account non-functional requirements.
Assist testing teams in translating requirements and use cases into test conditions and expected results for product, performance, user acceptance, and operational acceptance testing.
Contribute to project management activities such as: scoping and estimating project efforts, identifying risks and recommending mitigation measures, communicating activity status, as well as escalating and communicating possible issues.
Participate in quality management reviews, including designs, prototypes and other requirements work products.
Work closely with stakeholders to determine solutions, assess impact to existing work processes and systems, and pinpoint how to manage integration.
Provide operational and process-related analysis and support.
Respect existing processes and standards including requirements management and project management disciplines, technology delivery and business technology architecture, escalating issues as needed.
Gain knowledge in own area, stay abreast of technology trends and developments, develop expertise in TD services, applications, infrastructure, analytical tools and techniques, business domains and their products and services.
Work with vendors to support business case development (consistent with technology requirements and guidelines) including benefits identification, RFI/RFP and service level agreements.
Coach new or less experienced colleagues and serve as a reference point throughout requirements management life cycle.
Job Requirements
What can you bring to TD? Share your credentials, but your relevant experience and knowledge can be just as likely to get our attention. It helps if you have:
Undergraduate Degree or Technical Certificate.
5-7 years relevant experience.
Commitment to applying advanced to expert knowledge of business technology delivery practices and standards and related expertise, including design, development, testing and project management.
Advanced to expert knowledge of system analysis process and techniques, as well as system components, functionality, interfaces, data flows and business rules.
Ability to work independently as the senior or lead system analyst and coach or guide team.
Experience and comfort level acting as a subject matter expert and consultant.
Additional Information
Join in on what others in TD Technology Solutions are doing:
Inspire a positive work environment and help champion quality, innovation, teamwork and service to the business.
Learn voraciously, stretch your thinking,
Inclusiveness
At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Sr. Business Systems Analyst
Description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.
Job Title
Sr. Business Systems Analyst
Job Description
What is the opportunity?
The Advisor Technology team within Retail Banking & Payments Technology is seeking an experienced Business Systems Analyst to help deliver product enhancements within the Advisor Technology application portfolio. The role is responsible for all aspects of business requirements within application delivery including planning, systems analysis, documenting concise requirements / user stories, management and support for changes to applications within the portfolio. The role is a part of an Agile lab that works closely with the Product Owner and stakeholders to deliver business objectives.
What will you do?
Facilitate collaborative sessions with large and diverse business stakeholder groups to drive requirements discovery, analysis, and review. Apply advanced elicitation techniques to work with different types of stakeholder groups
Contribute to requirements prioritization and leverage techniques to drive out priorities and meet quarterly and annual business objectives.
Work collaboratively within an Agile Lab directly with our business partners and stakeholders from multiple IT teams (i.e. source systems).
Perform business analysis including understanding of business objectives, planning, eliciting, scoping, analyzing, documenting, prioritization, managing changes, maintaining traceability, managing backlogs, stakeholder analysis and effort estimation
Produce requirements documents using techniques such as Problem Opportunity Analysis, Scope Modelling, Business Process Mapping, Business Context Diagraming, and Story Mapping to create High-level and Detailed Requirements, Use Cases & Scenarios, Business Rules & Data Catalogue, User Stories, Story Decomposition, Story Mapping and Requirements traceability
Build and maintain a repository of reusable requirements documentation to support future initiatives, following the enterprise standards
Contribute to data model and system architecture decisions
Communicate effectively, written and verbal, to various audiences (technical and non-technical)
What do you need to succeed?
Must-have
Minimum 3 - 5 years of experience in a Business Systems Analyst role with proven experience with Agile methodology delivering large-scale complex projects/programs
Experienced in facilitating group discussion with various stakeholders to elicit requirements. Ability to collaborate with colleagues of various roles (Business, Technical, Architecture, Operations)
Experienced in Documenting Requirements using techniques such as Problem Opportunity Analysis, Scope Modelling, Business Context Diagraming, Use Cases & Scenarios, Business Rules & Data Catalogue, and Traceability Matrix, Data mapping, documenting as-is and to-be process flows, and gap analysis
Excellent communication, active-listening, stakeholder analysis, relationship-building, self-management, proactive, team-player, critical thinking and problem-solving skills
Proficient in common Agile practices such as user story creation and planning, effort estimation, prioritization, managing change, maintaining traceability, managing backlog
Proficient in the use of tools such as Confluence, Jira, Visio
Nice-to-have
Knowledge of Advisor Technology systems such as Sales Platform, Service Platform.
Knowledge of ELK stack
Relevant college, university, and/or post-graduate degree in Business Analysis
What’s in it for you?
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
Opportunities to do challenging work
Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities
Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies
RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

Title: Business Analyst in Global Clinical Supply Chain Planning
Description:
Role: Business Analyst in Global Clinical Supply Chain Planning

Department: PTSD

Type: FTE

The Clinical Demand & Supply Planning organization’s mission is to cost-effectively ensure the right product is in the right place at the right time every time, such that no patient will go without treatment and no clinical trial will be delayed.

The Clinical Supply Chain Business Analyst is an expert in related reporting and analytics solutions. This role is essential to increase the maturity in Roche clinical supply chain planning, allowing planners to access critical information more easily, with less individual effort, and at higher consistency, leading to better decisions and outcomes.

For this, the role will build and own an integrated roadmap for reporting and analytics capabilities within the Clinical SC Planning domain. He/she will own the planning, design and implementation of improvements, and for this will collaborate strongly with business functions (super users, SMEs), Business Capability Owners & IRT specialists in the Systems & Process Optimization (S&PO) chapter, Informatics, Aspire and the wider PT Analytics and Reporting groups. He/She will foster an environment of continuous improvement and knowledge sharing, to socialize new capabilities and build a stronger base for reporting and analytics.

Over time, the Supply Chain Business analyst will be expected to mature the analytics capabilities in the organization from reporting into advanced analytics in order to support higher value and more complex decisions such as supply chain optimization.

Key Responsibilities

Develop and own a roadmap for Reporting and Analytics capabilities in PTDS-PLAN with the aim to:

Prioritize reports will that be needed in the future to support the new processes introduced with the upcoming organization transformations and ASPIRE (Roche’s global ERP program)

Identify the future platforms to run those reports, including leveraging existing infrastructure and functionality

Clarify roles and responsibilities for report generation

Develop and present business cases for further investments in reporting & analytics

Provision of standard as well as ad hoc reports and system extracts to the planning teams as required.

Develop new reporting capabilities as outlined on the roadmap, e.g. in the area of Lead time, order size and rounding value optimization, Segmentation and supply chain operating model analysis.

Develop and maintain strong understanding of the Roche global OMP solution, supply chain planning business processes and data structures, stay closely connected to the planning community.

Build and maintain a Community of Practise (CoP, or “Pod”) in PTDS-PLAN to share best-practices, news, improvement ideas, and knowledge about Reporting capabilities.

Contribute or lead projects impacting Supply Chain planning such as Network changes and analysis, Optimization requests, SAP Projects, update of inventory policies.

Challenges status quo and targets break-through innovations. Benchmarks internally and externally and brings best practices to Roche.

Competencies & Experience

Strong motivation to enhance Roche’s supply chain planning capabilities through leveraging data as an asset.

Strong knowledge of clinical supply chain planning and reporting processes & IT systems

Knowledge of IRT functionalities for clinical trials (understanding of clinical trial protocol translation into supply chain parameters managed by IRT systems)

Strong analytical, logic and problem solving skills

Proven continuous improvement mindset

Experience in systems and data modelling, and programming scripting language (Python, R, OPAL, Javascript or anything similar)

Able to effectively communicate technical concepts to the planning community, capable of translating business requirements into technical concepts

Passion for collaboration and customer service mentality

Superior problem solving skills with an ability to anticipate issues and recommend solutions

Can-do (differently) attitude and get it done

Excellent oral and written communication and presentation skills (English mandatory)

Experience in project management, in a cross-functional and cross-cultural environment and willingness to work in a global organization

Experience & Education

Strong Experience in managing/using enterprise reporting applications (e.g BW, Tableau, etc)

Know-how of ERP systems, preferably OMP, SAP APO and SAP ERP

Experience in Supply chain planning is a plus

Degree in engineering, mathematics, informatics

APICS and/or SCOR certification, or associated relevant experience are a plus

Who we are

At Roche, more than 100,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we’ve become one of the world’s leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity.

Roche Pharma Canada has its office in Mississauga, Ontario and employs over 850 employees. The Mississauga facility is bright, vibrant, fosters collaboration and teamwork, and is reflective of Roche's truly innovative culture.

As of January 4, 2022, Roche requires all new employees who work in Canada to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 on the date they take office. This requirement is a condition of employment at Roche that applies regardless of whether the position is on a Roche campus or remotely. If you have a valid reason for not being fully immunized, which is limited to certain specific medical reasons or other valid reasons protected by applicable human rights laws, you may request an exemption and / or adaptation measures regarding this vaccination requirement.

Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Title: Community Prog. Analyst - PT
Description:
HAMILTON POLICE SERVICE
 TOGETHER | STRONGER | SAFER



The Hamilton Police Service (HPS) provides policing to over 540,000 residents in the City of Hamilton. In 2018, HPS answered over 199,430 emergency calls for assistance from our community. We have over 1,240 employees in Sworn and Civilian roles. Our mission is to be a trusted partner in delivering public safety.






JOB POSTING







 
HAMILTON POLICE SERVICE (HPS)
 CIVILIAN JOB OPPORTUNITY
 COMMUNITY PROGRAM ANALYST
 Temporary Assignment
 Job Title: Community Program Analyst (Temporary Assignment)
 Reports to: Manager of Analytics
 Primary Job Location: Central Police Station, 155 King William St, Hamilton, ON
 Hours of Work: Monday to Friday 8:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.
 Salary Range: Schedule 8E - $71,896 - $84,591 per annum (As of January 1, 2021)
 Posting Date: April 20, 2022
 JOB SUMMARY
 Under the direction of the Manager of Analytics, the Community Program Analyst will be responsible for analytics to support the role and data needs of Hamilton Police in contributing to Hamilton’s housing and homelessness strategies. 
The Community Program Analyst will work with various police and non-police data, as well as conduct research in order to provide recommendations to support strategic and operational needs. The Community Program Analyst will collaborate with other agency analysts to support knowledge translation and anonymized data sharing to address community policing matters intersecting with social and health needs. The Community Program Analyst will be responsible for ensuring compliance with privacy legislation and data safeguards that protect the privacy and integrity of individuals and communities represented in both police and community datasets. This is a 1-year pilot project.
 GENERAL DUTIES

Establishes key performance indicators, routine reports and dashboards to measure effectiveness of the Social Navigator program and HPS’ strategic priorities.
Conducts ad-hoc analysis for various internal and external members.
Creates analytical products using various tools, data, and information to summarize and synthesize key insights and recommendations to various stakeholders.
Collaborates with internal and external peers to enable knowledge translation between partner agencies and internal members.
Assesses key internal and external data sources, conducts gap analysis and devises processes to address data gaps required for managing community-based policing issues.
Maintains analytical databases and information as it pertains to community-based policing issues and in accordance to privacy legislation.
Evaluate existing processes and systems, research alternatives and recommend modifications or new processes in order to achieve organizational and community goals.
Researches and reviews new analytical techniques and crime trends through professional reading, completion of training courses, and by attending seminars, workshops and conferences.
Perform other duties, as assigned, which are related to the major responsibilities of the job.

 REQUIREMENTS
 EDUCATION: Minimum three (3) year University Degree 
EXPERIENCE: Must possess four (4) months of work experience in analysis and reporting
 CERTIFICATES/LICENSES/APPRENTICESHIPS: 

Valid Class G Driver’s License, or the equivalent, with no more than six (6) accumulated demerit points, permitting you to drive an automobile in Ontario with full driving privileges would be an asset.

 REQUIRED TECHNICAL SKILLS/EXPERIENCE:

Ability to learn and work with a wide variety of reporting and analytical software (e.g. Power BI, Tableau, Advanced Excel, Power Pivot, SPSS, SAS etc.) is required.
Experience with mapping and spatial analysis using GIS software (e.g. MapInfo, Arc GIS etc.) or equivalent is an asset.
Working knowledge of relational database models and Structured Query Language (SQL) is an asset. 
Must possess excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to communicate and present complex information in an easily understood manner.
Experience and demonstrated ability with project coordination and consultation with multidisciplinary teams to meet deliverables in a timely fashion.
Experience providing analytical support to various levels of an organization, as well as experience in supporting large complex data analysis to support process improvement and strategic initiatives.
Ability to maintain a high degree of discretion and confidentiality. 

APPLICATION DEADLINE & INSTRUCTIONS
 Applications (i.e. cover letter and resume – all one document) are to be submitted via the City of Hamilton Careers website before 11:59 PM on April 20, 2022.
 If you are interested in this position, please submit your application (i.e. cover letter and resume) to the City of Hamilton Careers website (https://www.hamilton.ca/jobs-city/current-opportunities). Recruitment process could include testing, assessments, interviews and/or presentations. A full background and reference check will be required for hire.
 We are unable to respond to all applicants. The Hamilton Police Service is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes. If contacted for an employment opportunity, please advise Human Resources if you require accommodation for testing, interview, or employment purposes.
 If hired, the incumbent shall comply with all Health and Safety Policies and Practices for their position and the workplace. By applying, you agree that the statements made by you are true, complete, and correct to the best of your knowledge. Further, you understand that any falsification of statements, misrepresentations, and/or deliberate omission or concealment of information may be considered just cause for dismissal.

Title: Business Insights Analyst – Marketing
Description:
Who We Are, What We Do, Where We Are Going
Magnet Forensics is a global leader in the development of digital investigative software that acquires, analyzes and shares evidence from computers, smartphones, tablets and other IoT related devices. We are continually innovating so that our customers can deploy advanced and effective tools to protect their communities, countries and companies.

Headquartered out of Waterloo, ON but with over 400 employees spread out globally, Magnet is continuing to expand and grow. Where we are today, is not where we want to be tomorrow.
Your Role
The Business Insights Analyst role will provide support to continually improve the productivity of sales and marketing teams to achieve the corporate revenue and contribution objectives. This individual will use their strong set of analytical skills to develop and deliver data-based insights to help teams make wide-ranging business decisions. The ability to identify inefficiencies will drive continuous improvements and innovation in our processes and operations through data-based insights.
What You Will AccomplishPerform research, collect and analyze large, complex data sets to identify trends, key indicators, patterns, insights, issues or shortcomings that will address strategic and operational business questionsLead data quality and transformational initiatives as required to continuously improve Magnet’s operationsPresent data-driven stories about key findings and how they are impacting Magnet’s operationsTranslate data from multiple sources to facilitate data-driven decision-making to drive business improvementsImplement and manage reports and dashboards required to track key business KPIs for stakeholdersLead initiatives to enable self-service data analysis and reporting throughout MagnetManage the business intelligence platform and supporting data modelsProvide ad hoc reports to broader company departments as neededInvestigate and propose industry best practices and technology to support business intelligence initiatives
What We Are Looking For
We’re looking for someone who checks off most, but not all, of the boxes listed in “skills and experiences”. It’s more important to us to find candidates who can display indicators of success through skills they have developed and experiences they have been a part of, than to find folks who have ‘been there, done that”. We want to be part of your development journey, and we’ll learn as much from you as you learn from us.

There are a couple must haves, but we will keep that list short:
3+ years of work experience in a Business Insights Analyst or related roleExperience with financial and revenue related processes
Knowledge of Salesforce.com and other sales, service and marketing platformsProficiency with Microsoft Power BI or other business analytics tools
The Most Important Thing
We’re looking for candidates that can provide examples of how they have demonstrated Magnet InteGRITy in their previous experiences:
Greater Good – We think beyond our own interests and strive to improve communities around the world. This demonstrates our passion for making a difference in the world.
Respect – We hold ourselves accountable through transparent sharing of information and we have faith in each other’s abilities
Innovation – We lead the industry in excellence and reliability while keeping the user experience simple and relevant. We are not afraid to push the boundaries to stay ahead of our competitors.
Teamwork – We collaborate internally and externally, while caring about each other and listening to our customers.
Magnet Forensics Inc. is an affirmative action, equal opportunity employer. It is Magnet Forensics policy to recruit and select applicants for employment solely on the basis of their qualifications, with emphasis on selecting the best-qualified person for the job. Magnet Forensics does not discriminate against applicants based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, or disability or any other status or condition protected by applicable law.

Magnet Forensics encourages applications from all qualified candidates. Magnet Forensics has a great record of accommodating persons with disabilities. Contact our AODA contact at aoda@magnetforensics.com or 519-342-0195, if you need accommodation at any stage of the application process or want more information on our accommodation policies.
