Title: Supply Chain Management Analyst
Description:
Job Description:
Crescent Point Energy is a leading North American oil producer focused on the development of high-return resource plays. Based in Calgary, Alberta, we aim to enhance shareholder returns by cost-effectively growing our significant asset base in the Viewfield Bakken, Shaunavon, Flat Lake, and Shale Duvernay plays.
Job Title: Supply Chain Management Analyst
Location: Calgary, Alberta
Reports to: Manager, Supply Chain Management
Employment Type: Permanent, Full-Time
The following will provide you with basic guidelines as to the duties required of this position.
Purpose:
The Supply Chain Management Analyst is responsible for key commercial matters and contractual activities that support Crescent Point’s Canadian operations. This position will require strong analytical and data visualization skills to drive the development and execution of strategic sourcing strategies in close collaboration with internal business stakeholders.
Main Responsibilities & Activities:
Take ownership over cradle to grave strategic souring initiatives to execute on Rfx initiatives, including detailed cost evaluations to present to business partners.
Experience with collecting an analyzing customer, competitor, market indices and economic data to present in a complete market intelligence report would be highly sought after
Implement strategies that directly affect company financial results and growth plans
Identify metrics, tools, and processes to optimize sourcing activities and efficiencies and work collaboratively with team members to prioritize and drive implementation
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail.
Collaborate with team members to collect, analyze, and evaluate information from multiple sources including
Build reporting and analytic support tools to aid Senior Supply Chain Management Analysts in identifying opportunities for further cost efficient.
Create and maintain rich interactive visualizations through data interpretation and analysis integrating various reporting components from multiple data source.
Maintain and provide a current understanding of industry best practices and technology trends to team members and business partners
Ensure compliance with purchasing policies and procedures, ethical practices and adherence to relevant laws and regulations
Liaise with internal category teams, business partners and gain a comprehensive understanding of business requirements
Work cross functionally with contracts team ensure collaboration and success of all teams across the supply management team
Oversee the tracking and reporting of initiatives and vendor information in a central repository for reporting purposes
Considered “go to” excel and PowerBi expert for other team members
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:
Post-secondary education in Business, Economics, or Engineering is required, with a preference for Finance knowledge
Proven working experience as a Data Analyst or Business Analyst is preferred
Working towards or have SCMP or CFA is considered an asset
Minimum 3 -5 years’ experience in Business Analytics, Data Analysis, or Supply Chain is required.
Thorough knowledge of advanced functions of Microsoft Office applications (Word, PowerPoint, Power BI, etc.) required.
Expert user in Microsoft Excel with working experience in formulas, databases, macros, etc.
Strong knowledge in Microsoft Power BI, ability to developed dashboards and databases.
Experience in various supply management and supply industries roles in support of oilfield operations would be considered an asset
Knowledge of strategic sourcing including RFx, and negotiation processes would be considered an asset.
Excellent relationship building, interpersonal and communication (verbal and written) skills required
Confident, assertive individual who is resourceful and ambitious
Self- starter, must be well organized, able to multi-task, and prioritize various initiatives
Strong and proven business and financial acumen
Why Crescent Point:
A highly engaged workforce who is supported, engaged, and connected.
Competitive total rewards package.
Flexible savings and benefits options to meet your specific needs.
Employee wellness initiatives, that support the physical, financial, and psychological well-being of our workforce.
A pilot flexible hybrid work model which allows for flexibility to work remotely up to two days a week as schedules allow.
Diversity & Inclusion:
Crescent Point is committed to building an inclusive organization that harnesses diverse thinking to innovate and grow. We are transforming our talent programming using an inclusive design lens where diverse points of view and talent are supported.
Crescent Point Energy is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to an inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes, and work environment. If you require accommodations at any stage in the hiring process, please let your Talent Management team know. This includes conducting interviews in person or virtually via Microsoft Teams. We encourage all qualified candidates to apply.

Title: Fraud Analyst (15-Month Contract)
Description:
Canada's Challenger Bank™
Equitable Group Inc. trades on the Toronto Stock Exchange (TSX: EQB and EQB.PR.C) and serves a growing number of Canadians through Equitable Bank, Canada's Challenger Bank™. Equitable Bank has grown to become the country's eighth largest independent Schedule I bank with a clear mandate to drive real change in Canadian banking to enrich people's lives. Founded over 50 years ago, Equitable Bank provides diversified personal and commercial banking and through its EQ Bank platform has been named #1 Bank in Canada on the Forbes World's Best Banks 2021 list. EQ Bank provides state-of-the-art digital banking services, like the Savings Plus Account that reimagines banking by offering an everyday high interest rate, plus the flexibility of a chequing account, as well as a wide range of smart banking solutions for Canadians, like fast international money transfers, US dollar accounts and a suite of registered products.
Level 4 out of 12
Position Summary

The Fraud Analyst is responsible for assisting the Senior Manager, Fraud Risk Management in performing fraud detection duties and ensuring that all accounts suspected of containing fraud are accurately recorded. The Fraud Analyst will also be responsible for ensuring that the Sherlock SharePoint enterprise fraud database is kept current and any new fraud trends or brokers, industry professionals, employers, etc., requiring action are identified. Finally, the Fraud Analyst will assist the Senior Manager in the development of new fraud detection and mitigation tools, presentations, analytical reporting and other projects as they are identified. Although the main activities of the Fraud Analyst will focus on Single Family Residential (SFR) mortgages, the position may expand to other Business Units as the role and function matures.


Main Activities
Assist in the daily management of the Sherlock database by reviewing loans, applying sound judgement through robust reviews and escalating cases to management that require special attention
Responsible for completing a targeted selection of accounts for fraud focused reviews
Analyst responsibility to complete the daily investigation of Intralinks alerts utilizing internal databases
Managing the inbox, handling standard requests and escalating to management where required?
Use open source investigative techniques to research and report on all applications selected for fraud focused reviews, considering adherence to fraud processes and noting trends or issues warranting escalation (including for watch or deny list)
Ensure all new suspected misrepresentation accounts have been appropriately updated in the WL/DL and in citadel; as necessary, create new cases and perform complex fraud investigations when required
Proactively identifies industry parties (brokers, lawyers, etc.) For the watch list or deny list as a result of investigations and escalations
Assists in the handling of the fraud mailbox, addressing all emails in a professional, timely and responsible manner, escalating as appropriate
Ensure all statement and BCPIF requests are completed appropriately and accurately recorded
Review and analyze mortgage applications, corporate documentation, credit reports, income/employment documentation and funding documentation at a level that enables adequate analysis and escalation of irregularities.
Analyze and validate all reported observations and provide detailed and accurate documentation to substantiate findings.
Provide support to the front line business, including any new initiatives that may directly affect the review process or business unit objectives.
Provide excellent customer service to other departments through professional written and verbal communication.
Maintain knowledge of banking operations, products/services, systems and associated risks and controls.
Communicate with the Senior Manager, Fraud Risk on status reports and duty prioritization


Knowledge/Skill Requirements
A bachelor’s degree or higher in a financial or quantitative discipline. ACFE, ACFI or IAFCI accreditation an asset.
An advanced understanding of mortgage/credit origination processes and controls with at least three years’ experience in a Canadian financial institution including at least one year of financial fraud investigation or fraud loss mitigation experience in a Canadian financial institution
Demonstrated mortgage fraud subject matter expertise
Experience with Equifax Citadel
A working knowledge of open source investigative techniques; knowledge of Cyberquery and/or SQL an asset
Advanced written and verbal communication skills
A strong knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite including strong knowledge of Excel (pivot tables, formulas, functions)
Meticulous organizational skills and attention to detail
Able to work without supervision and to make decisions under pressure
Excellent time management, analytical and problem solving skills


The following skill sets will be considered an asset
A preference will be given to candidates with mortgage lending experience
Financial fraud management experience covering multiple product lines
A sound knowledge of fraud in the mortgage/real estate industry and financial fraud in general
A strong background in data analysis and presentation of findings at a senior level
Previous experience with Equifax’s Citadel, including administration and rules development
Previous experience with advanced fraud detection technologies including AI and machine learning
Fraud, criminology or AML-related degree(s) or certification(s)
A sound knowledge of OSFI guidelines, particularly as they relate to mortgage lending and operational risk
Training experience and public speaking skills
Project management experience


#LI-Hybrid
What we offer [For full-time permanent roles]

 Competitive discretionary bonus
✨ Market leading RRSP match program
 Medical, dental, vision, life, and disability benefits
 Employee Share Purchase Plan
 Maternity/Parental top-up while you care for your little one
 Generous vacation policy, personal days and even a moving day
 Virtual events to connect with your fellow colleagues
 Education reimbursement program
 A fulfilling opportunity to join one of the top FinTechs and help create a new kind of banking experience
Equitable Bank is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from all qualified candidates. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. All candidates considered for hire must successfully pass a criminal background check and credit check to qualify for hire. While we appreciate your interest in applying, an Equitable recruiter will only contact leading candidates whose skills and qualifications closely match the requirements of the position.

Title: Pricing Analyst- 8-month contract
Description:
Eaton Electrical is currently seeking a Pricing Analyst (8-month contract) to join our Marketing team! This position is based at our Burlington, ON, facility.
Position Overview:
The candidate will be responsible for supporting the pricing function, aligned with Eaton’s growth strategy and Business- to- Business (B2B) customer journey. This includes, supporting the roll out of pricing tools, best practices and insights that help balance profitability and competitiveness.
The candidate should understand the importance of the B2B buyer journey and draw on the perspectives and needs of the customer, creating informative content that drives conversation, leads and sales. The role will require the candidate to collaborate with both sales and marketing teams.
In this function you will:
Partner with product managers to roll out the respective profit plan workbooks; responsibilities would include enhancing and maintaining the workbooks
Roll out advanced pricing methods, tools, systems, best practices, and technology to the commercial teams
Assist in execution of General Price Increase (GPI) including setting targets, coordinating market communications with division sales teams, and measurement of yield
Assist in implementation of pricing software and tools, profit waterfall projects, mix improvement, low margin opportunities
Analyze web and other sources of campaign data to provide insights for improvement
Support marketing events (webinars, distributor events, tradeshows)
Qualifications
Basic Qualifications:
University degree or college diploma in Marketing, Business or Communications from an accredited institution
Legally authorized to work in Canada on a permanent basis without company sponsorship
This position does not offer relocation
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience working with Microsoft Office specifically demonstrated advanced Microsoft Excel and PowerBI skills
Knowledge of the following software applications; QlikView, Business Intelligence, statistical and modeling software
Excellent written, oral communication and presentation skills
Demonstrated leadership experience within campus and/or the community
Position Criteria:
Ability to engage with stakeholders at all levels of the organization
Ability to multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment
Effective time management and project management skills
Highly motivated, self-starting, enthusiastic, results oriented team player
We are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities for all job applicants and employees. Employment decisions are based upon job-related reasons regardless of an applicant's race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, marital status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by law.
Eaton has in place accessibility policies for accommodating employees with disabilities. If you are selected for an interview and require accommodations, please let the recruiter or hiring manager know so that we can work to make reasonable adjustments that best suit your needs. Accessibility information may be found at: https://www.eaton.com/ca/en-gb/company/policies-and-statements/accessibility.html
We make what matters work.
At Eaton, we believe that power, whether it’s electrical, hydraulic, or mechanical power - is a fundamental part of people’s lives. Technology, transportation, energy, and infrastructure—these are things the world relies on every day. That’s why we are dedicated to helping our customers across the world find new ways to manage power more efficiently, safely, and sustainably. And we’re committed to improving people’s lives, the communities where we live and work, and the planet our future generations will depend on. Because that’s what really matters–and we’re here to make sure it works.
While our vision is to improve the quality of life and the environment through the use of power management technologies and services, our culture and what we value can be represented in six essential leadership attributes expected of all Eaton employees.
We’re ethical - we play by the rules and act with integrity.
We’re passionate - we care deeply about what we do. We set high expectations and we perform.
We’re accountable - we seek responsibility and take ownership. We do what we say.
We’re efficient - we value speed and simplicity.
We’re transparent - we say what we think. We make it okay to disagree.
We learn – we are curious, adaptable, and willing to teach what we know.
About Eaton:
As a power management company with 2020 sales of $17.9 billion, Eaton provides energy-efficient solutions that help our customers effectively manage electrical, hydraulic, and mechanical power more efficiently, safety and sustainably. We have approximately 92,000 employees across the world and sell products to customers in more than 175 countries.
What you will get from us
Eaton’s mission is to improve the quality of life and the environment through the use of power management technologies and services. We provide sustainable solutions that help our customers effectively manage electrical, hydraulic and mechanical power – more safely, more efficiently and more reliably. Making what matters work at Eaton takes the passion of every employee around the world. We create an environment where creativity, invention and discovery become reality, each day. It’s where bold, bright professionals like you can reach your full potential—and where you can help us reach ours. Eaton’s 2020 revenues were $17.9 billion, and we sell products to customers in more than 175 countries. We have approximately 85,000 employees.
We make work exciting, engaging and meaningful for our employees through our dedication to tackling some of the toughest power management challenges on the planet and by never losing sight of what matters. Our culture is built on a strong commitment to practicing our core values and supporting our employees with the tools they need to succeed. We pledge to always foster a diverse and inclusive environment, including inclusion resource groups that bring together employees who share a common purpose, interest or background. In the past year, our company has received top employment recognition by the Human Rights Campaign and almost fifty percent of our Board of Directors represented diverse groups. When we embrace the different ideas, perspectives and backgrounds that make each of us unique, we — as individuals and as a company — are stronger.
We have demonstrated our passion for sustainability with the recent announcement of cutting carbon emissions from the company’s operations by at least 50 percent by 2030. We are ethical, passionate, accountable, efficient, transparent and committed to learning. We are confident we can deliver on our promise to improve the quality of life and the environment because of the attributes that our employees embody.
We are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities for all job applicants and employees. Employment decisions are based upon job-related reasons regardless of an applicant's race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, marital status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by law.

Title: Senior Business Data Analyst - 335837
Description:
Senior Business Data Analyst- PROCOM KW is looking for an experienced Business Data Analyst for a permanent, full time role with one of our clients in the transportation sector
Senior Business Data Analyst Job Details 
As a Business Data Analyst on the customer success team, you’ll be responsible for analyzing transportation operations data, performing service design, running simulations, assessing key performance indicators, supporting new service launches, driving operational improvements, and providing technical systems support. You will develop a deep understanding of urban mobility challenges faced by transit operators. You will become an expert on our client’s technology platform and data-driven design and operation of transportation services.
Senior Business Data Analyst Responsibilities 

Plan and execute special initiatives as per the project timeline.
Setup up, test, and tune system parameters, run simulations, oversee the soft launch, monitor KPIs on launch week and make system changes as needed.
Build performance analysis reports spanning rider user-experience, driver user-experience, marketing, operating efficiency, and unit economics.
Compare the performance against goals, evaluate trends, and identify areas for improvement. Review the performance reports with stakeholders and the client operations team to generate insights and actions.
Provide ongoing technical systems and analytics support to operations managers.
Advise them on using the system’s dashboards and interpreting the data. Perform system configuration changes based on feedback from operations staff, drivers, and passengers.
Analyze urban area (density, road network, etc.), travel patterns, user-profiles, demand data, client requirements, and design on-demand transit services that are superior to existing transportation options. 
Configure the technology platform reflective of your envisioned service model.
Collaboratively develop weekly/monthly actions to drive continuous improvements, and to achieve the service’s objectives
Identify ways to further automate and systematize our internal processes
Expand your knowledge of the transportation industry, share your ideas to product manager as well as understand clients’ pain points and identify gaps/opportunities in the product

Senior Business Data Analyst Must Have Skills

Undergraduate degree in Management Engineering / Applied Mathematics / Statistics / Finance, or related discipline.
4+ years of industry experience as an analyst or technical project manager or related role.
Proficient in Excel and Microsoft Office tools. Experience working with business intelligence or visualization tools such as Tableau / SAS / Cognos. Knowledge of relational databases with the ability to read and write SQL is an asset.
Strong written/oral communication and presentation skills. Experience preparing reports for management.
Experience in data modeling/analysis or engineering role(s)

Senior Business Data Analyst Nice To Have Skills

Experience in Project Management 


Senior Business Data Analyst Start Date

As Soon As Possible


Senior Business Data Analyst Assignment Length
Permanent, Full Time Role

Title: Senior Inventory Analyst
Description:
JOB DESCRIPTION
POSITION OBJECTIVE:
The Inventory team at Acklands Grainger manages over 500K Stock Keeping Units and $170 million across multiple distribution centres, branches, and on-sites across Canada. Our primary responsibility is to have the right product in the right place for customers, strategically balancing capital and OPEX investment of inventory dollars, labour and holding space.
The Senior Inventory Analyst will be responsible for providing functional expertise and guidance regarding daily execution and continuous improvement of inventory planning processes and policies.
KEY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
The Senior Inventory Analyst will be accountable for functional expertise over select planning areas within the network for specific business policies and procedures, as assigned, within (but not limited to) the following areas:
Demand Capture
Demand Management
Forecasting
EOQ / Safety Stock
DRP / Deployment
Stocking Policy
Market Intelligence
Based on the specific assigned area of ownership, the Senior Inventory Analyst will:
Partner with leadership in developing supply chain strategies to meet customer service and meet inventory performance targets for the network.
Facilitate discussions with regional or national business representatives to adapt the planning system to effectively accommodate business unit needs.
Identify and recommend enhancements to supply chain systems.
Work with cross functional and cross border Supply Chain partners to gain alignment on business policies and system functionality to execute those policies.
Forecast and manage the flow of product to the Distribution Centers and/or Branches and/or on-sites.
Build and maintain relationships with Acklands Grainger and Grainger US Supply Chain partners to develop building-specific strategies, identify constraints, and recommend and execute solutions to meet performance metric goals and support long-term supply chain objectives. Perform system maintenance and maintain master data within planning areas and processes as needed.
Review and analyze planning data to prepare reports for management review.
Perform ad-hoc analyses as needed.Provide thought leadership and business guidance to department analysts to make the team better as an informal leader.

REQUIRED EXPERIENCE AND QUALIFICATIONS:
Completion of post-secondary degree, preferably in Business or equivalent business experience with a minimum of 3 to 5 years’ experience in Supply Chain
Strong analytic fundamentals, proficiency in analyzing large data sets to solve problems and experience working with cross-functional partners
Understanding of key financial, customer service and supply chain metrics
Ability to influence without authority
Use of data and analytics to tell a story to relevant business leaders
Proficiency in Microsoft Office; requires knowledge of downloading and uploading information via mainframe and PC systems
Project Management and continuous improvement experience a plus
Proficiency in Business Objects and/or Teradata and/or SQL and/or PowerBI a plus
Working knowledge of SAP Supply Chain Suite, particularly Advance Planning & Optimization or Service Parts Planning a plus

Understanding of key financial, customer service and supply chain metrics

Title: Business Systems Analyst
Description:
As a Business Systems Analyst at Lean Industries, you will provide technical guidance to support internal and client stakeholders with the implementation and ongoing maintenance and support of Lean Industries’ products. Reporting to Manager, Business Analysis & VP of Project Management, your day-to-day responsibilities will include identifying issues, creating solutions and improving efficiency while collaborating with peers cross functionally.
Here's more of what you'll do:
Actively collaborate with software configuration, development and QA peers throughout the project
Communicate proactively with all internal and external personnel to identify problems, create solutions, and implement efficiency improvements
Understand all the artifacts and tools needed for the success of the project implementation; own certain implementation/ configuration tasks
Reading and writing technical requirements
You are someone who has:
5+ years of related business systems analyst experience
Technical background and experience implementing and supporting enterprise software applications in complex business environments
Prior exposure to SQL Server from a database query perspective is a must. Similar experience with Oracle database technologies is desirable
Experience supporting and trouble-shooting J2EE/Java-based web applications
Experience supporting and trouble-shooting Tomcat, JBOSS and Websphere based environments
Demonstrated knowledge of Microsoft Office products, particularly Visio, Word, Excel, PowerPoint
Prior experience in a client servicing or service desk role is a must. Demonstrated experience with issue troubleshooting and issue resolution cycle
Demonstrated success discovering, collecting and documenting business requirements and specifications
Minimum of a 4-year college or University degree in technical subjects such as computer science, engineering or business administration. Equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered
Prior experience with, and a preference for, work in a small, growth-oriented company
Ability to travel globally (including possession of a valid passport); manage travel itineraries and travel expenses until reimbursed
We definitely want to talk to you if you have the following:
Experience in retail banking, card issuing, merchant acquiring, and/or similar industry experience such as in the electronic payments processing space
Prior experience with business process management software, workflow automation software, and robotics technology
Bilingual (English/Portuguese or English/Spanish)
We know you have your choice of roles for your next opportunity. Here's why we think you should choose Lean Industries:
Lean Industries is growing rapidly! We offer autonomy and the opportunity for self-motivated individuals to lead software product development efforts
A highly-configurable workflow-based solution, Lean’s software is used by large international financial institutions and merchant acquiring companies.
Lean Industries develops and delivers comprehensive enterprise software solutions designed to lower the costs and improve the quality of managing consumer and fraud disputes, exceptions and adjustments for electronic payment transactions
Lean software applications are currently used on three continents and we are expecting to add a fourth continent next year.
Check out our website https://leanindustries.com
Joining Lean means you’ll enjoy a competitive and generous salary structure, excellent health benefits options and paid time off.
Tuition assistance, life insurance, 401K and remote work capabilities are excellent offers, as well.
You will challenge yourself and take pride in your efforts, in a rewarding, safe and comfortable environment.
About Lean Industries
Lean Industries is focused exclusively on delivering solutions for disputed consumer-originated financial transactions, in both the card and non-card payments space, and both fraud and non-fraud disputes. We are experts in this industry and bring an unparalleled passion to all that we do. Our core values of Dedication, Integrity, Excellence, Confidence, and The Lean Family embody who we are, what we do, and what we strive to become. Our software products, based on a highly configurable business process management system coupled with extensive enterprise, third-party processor and payment network data and image interfaces, result in a highly efficient and automated back office operational structure, with commensurate cost savings and productivity improvements
Lean Industries provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Lean Industries complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities.

Title: Senior Performance Analyst
Description:
Location:
Vancouver, British Columbia, CA Calgary, AB, CA Quebec City, Quebec, CA Montreal, Quebec, CA Toronto, ON, CA

Jobs by Category: Operations
Job Function: Planning and Analysis
Status: Full Time

Description
Join our Team and what we’ll accomplish together

As part of the Customer Success team in TELUS Business Solutions, you represent the TELUS brand, values, and promise. The Customer Success team is a highly engaged and high-performance team that has embarked on a journey to delight customers at every moment of truth, focusing on optimizing relationships to drive profitable growth for TELUS Business Solutions (TBS).

We are relationship-focused and outcome-driven. We are passionate about our mission to connect with customers in a way that will unlock new growth and retention opportunities in Commercial and Public Sector (1000+ employees) accounts.

Our Customer Success journey will require careful planning and strong interlock with all stakeholders across TBS. As a member of the Customer Success Transformation Office, you will be an integral part of driving the transformation while ensuring we stay well connected to the pulse of the business and our customers.

As part of our transformation, we are developing our Success Planning and Controls.
You will act as the primary interface between Customer Success, Sales, and Marketing to identify, design, plan, and execute continuously aligned targets/territories plans for the Customer Success Executives, linked to their incentive plan.

In addition, you will act as the consultant and liaison between project teams, the organization, and our external vendors, developing process and system documentation to produce a tangible Customer Success Planning and Controls function.

What you'll do
Build and inspire a culture of "everyday innovation" within your team
Strategy: You will collaborate with Customer Success leadership and TBS stakeholders to understand the strategic direction around the Customer Success targets/territory plans and compensation
Analysis and Execution: design, plan and execute the Customer Success targets/territory plan, including building the appropriate reports and dashboards. In addition, create the proper business logic between the targets/territories and the Customer Success compensation plan
Scorecards: establish the proper leading and lagging performance indicators to proactively drive and report on business performance
Performance Analysis: Support the Customer Success Executives and leaders achieve targets based on proactive data analysis, reporting, and governance
Project Management: Lead cross-collaborative projects by identifying opportunities, developing recommendations, and seeing through implementation, including standardized process documentation where appropriate
Process Improvement: You will champion process improvements for internal and external processes in collaboration with stakeholders
Stakeholder Management: You will foster trust and build strong relationships to lead through influence across TBS and TELUS teams aligning on critical decisions and necessary approval across all levels of our organization (Manager, Directors, VPs)
Presentations & Storytelling: With your excellent communication skills, you'll be able to articulate the strategic priorities and progress MoM building executive-level content and presentations for your portfolio
Qualifications
What you bring

You are an experienced analyst yet strategic thinker who can connect the dots from ambiguous strategy to delivery
You love to solve problems with your critical thinking and constantly challenge the status quo to find better ways of working to do more faster
You should have a high degree of comfort and confidence working directly with the Director, VP to SVP level
You have strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build strong working relationships
Ability to manage changing priorities/tight deadlines effectively in a very fast-paced environment; ability to navigate ambiguity, overcome confusion, and simplify complex situations
Excellent storytelling and presentation abilities with demonstrated ability to take the message upwards and across the team to senior leaders within and across the organization
With your exceptional communication skills, you tactfully collaborate with teams across business areas and can influence decisions with more senior-level audiences
Great attention to detail and strong organizational skills
You have experience with establishing a performance management framework that identifies trends for impact and opportunity while aligning metrics / KPIs to strategies driving desirable outcomes
Effective use of Google Suites, Microsoft PowerPoint, Excel, and other collaboration tools in everyday use at TELUS

Great to haves

Customer Relationship Management or customer-facing experience is an asset
Knowledge of TELUS Sales/Marketing target/territory planning process and systems an asset
Workshop facilitation skills and experience
Experience with visualization tools such as Tableau and/or Structured Query Language (SQL) is an asset

Title: Senior Analyst, Business Intelligence
Description:
Req Id: 359875
At Bell, we do more than build world-class networks, develop innovative services and create original multiplatform media content – we advance how Canadians connect with each other and the world.
If you’re ready to bring game-changing ideas to life and join a community that values, professional growth and employee wellness, we want you on the Bell team.
Bell’s forward-thinking Customer Operations team is creating the ultimate service experience for our residential, wireless and small business consumers. We lead strategic development and execution of day-to-day operations, develop tools and processes to drive service enhancements, manage customer loyalty and retention, and leverage big data and artificial intelligence to create intellectual property.
Senior Business Systems Solution Analyst
Are you a creative technical business solution analyst with a knack for problem-solving and getting things done?
Are you passionate about quality and take ownership of deliverables?
If you answered an Enthusiastic “YES” to these questions, this position is for you!
The Customer Experience Business Intelligence team uses emerging technologies, working cross-functionally to design and build innovative solutions. We’re looking for creative problem-solvers who are curious, collaborative, and passionate about delivering the best results. You must be comfortable working in an unstructured environment and have the leadership skills to focus efforts in times of ambiguity and provide appropriate recommendations to deliver results on time.
At the core of the position is delivery of solution and assessment documentation required for the project to meets its intended benefits. The candidate should have experience in helping identify project impacts to BI Systems by interviewing clients to collect information, working with BI architects/developers/SMEs to understand system impacts and interfacing with BI PMO on Project Management best practices. The candidate should exhibit excellent interpersonal, communication and leadership skills, to lead and drive the delivery of project deliverables throughout the BI Project delivery life cycle.
Accountability and Critical Requirements:
Strong analytical skills with ability to collect, transform, create and present very large number of events and facts into concise, formal and coherent set of requirements and/or business rules
review and sign off on key development and design deliverables, including interface specifications, integration requirements, data schemas, and design documentation
Review the test plans and scenarios for SFT (System Functional Testing), SIT (System Integration Testing) and E2E (End to End) including supporting the execution and signoff of test results to confirm the Business/system requirements have been met
Solid problem solving skills and the ability to make sound decisions and recommendations
Ability to memorize large number various facts and tales provided by multiple people with ability to summarize and document them quickly and provide meaningful ‘on the spot’ recommendations
Ability to understand business needs and to document them into Business Requirements and System Requirements
Ability to understand how different areas of the application integrates with other downstream system(s) and to assess the ripple impacts
Business Intelligence knowledge of principals, trends and customer experience
Creativity in finding ‘out of the box’ approaches and optimal lower cost solutions
Excellent documentation and in-docs presentation skills; ability to produce clear and easy to understand documentation, detailed process flows, illustrated calculations components, data models chart etc.
Strong communication skills and ability to work with people with various skills (technical and non technical), adapting communication to different audiences including executives
Detail oriented and the ability to work with minimal supervision
Ability to work and collaborate on cross functional teams
Ability to manage multiple projects and priorities
Preferred Competencies and Education:
Undergraduate degree in a discipline such as: Business Analytics, Commerce, Applied Math, Computer Science or Applied Management/Science
5+ years experience working in a similar capacity within a IT or BI team
Familiar with concepts and differences of various programing languages and technical concepts; Experience in tools, technology & framework
Previous Telco experience or related industry
Understanding of the IT systems development lifecycle
Working knowledge of understanding system interface specification and xml document
Working knowledge of data modeling and entity relationships
Bilingualism is an asset (English and French); adequate knowledge of French is required for positions in Quebec.
Additional Information:
Position Type: Management
Job Status: Regular - Full Time
Job Location: Canada : Ontario : Toronto || Canada : Ontario : Ottawa || Canada : Quebec : Montreal
Flexible work profile: Mobile
Application Deadline: 04/26/2022
Please apply directly online to be considered for this role. Applications through email will not be accepted.
At Bell, we don’t just accept difference - we celebrate it. We’re committed to fostering an inclusive, equitable, and accessible workplace where every team member feels valued, respected, and supported, and has the opportunity to reach their full potential. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities.
Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. For a confidential inquiry, simply email your recruiter directly or recruitment@bell.ca to make arrangements. If you have questions regarding accessible employment at Bell please email our Diversity & Inclusion Team at inclusion@bell.ca.

Title: Manager II, Quality Assurance/Business Intelligence (PB527)
Description:
Summary of Duties
Reports to the Manager IV, Information Technology Services or as assigned by Director of Information Technology Services. Leads the strategic design and delivery of the business intelligence platforms as well as manages a team responsible for the development and delivery of Quality Assurance techniques, processes and methodologies. Performs management duties as required for other ITS teams.
Work Performed
Manages and leads the activities, schedules and personnel (both union and non-union) as assigned. Responsible for all activities of staff in the assigned team and makes recommendations on personnel actions (hiring, terminations, performance, attendance and training). Takes action to ensure team members work together to effectively achieve team, division and corporate goals.
Responsible for managing the delivery of projects through the complete lifecycle from requirements definition to implementation and transition to support. Oversees the technical project team, which may be staffed with internal resources and/or third party consultants and vendors. Manages employees to include recruiting, training, setting clear job expectations, addressing conduct issues and conducting performance appraisals; coaches employees for growth and development.
With a comprehensive understanding of applicable business processes, identifies projects and participates in business case development and project management where technology will enhance efficiency and effectiveness in service delivery.
Manages the team responsible for the analysis, design, development, configuration, integration, implementation and support of business intelligence solutions that support the Corporation’s business processes.
Leads the development, maintenance, and on-going support of the business intelligence platform architecture, which includes defining and implementing standards, continuous refinement activities, and the architecture review process.
Develops and maintains roadmaps for business intelligence tools and associated platform components. Leads discussions and decisions around business intelligence tools, reports and solutions to enable process improvement and technology adoption across the Corporation. Responsible for software updates and patching.
Leads the development, adoption and coaching on Quality Assurance (QA) methodologies, templates, processes and best practices. Responsible for the continual improvement of QA processes and Test Maturity Model throughout Information Technology Services.
Liaises with vendors, other municipalities, and the other technology related organizations to keep current with developing software concepts.
Responsible for the administration and management of various City of London contracts and service level agreements.
Assists with the evaluation and recommendation of software and other associated technology as required.
Participates in projects as assigned.
Performs other duties as assigned.
Participates in the management rotation of after hours on call support and preventative maintenance duties.

Qualifications/Experience
Three year Community College Business Information Systems Diploma or Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Computer Sciences or in a related field plus five years of application experience is required.
Specialized Training & Licenses
Skills and abilities in the following areas are necessary:

Successful experience supervising staff. Demonstrated leadership and interpersonal skills in order to direct, develop, motivate, and support employees.
Excellent organizational and time management skills and be able to effectively coordinate a number of projects simultaneously.
Superior written and oral communication skills.
Information and Technology and Project Management focused certifications are an asset; examples include, but are not limited to: PMP - Project Management Professional, CAP – Certified Analytics Professional, CBAP – Certified Business Analysis Professional, Microsoft Certifications (Fundamentals, Associate, Expert).
Familiarity with Microsoft Power BI and Cognos Analytics would be an advantage.

Compensation and Other Information
$96,723 to $126,632

This is a permanent position being filled on a temporary basis for up to 2 years.
Our hiring process is in accordance with the City of London’s Mandatory Proof of COVID-19 Vaccination Administrative Policy


As an inclusive employer, we are committed to providing a fully accessible recruitment process. Please contact us at any time during the recruitment process and let us know what accessible supports you may need.

20-Apr-2022

Title: Sr. Analyst, Continuous Improvement
Description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients. 

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute. 

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com 

Job Description 

What You’ll Be Doing 

Reporting to the Director, Contact Centre Continuous Improvement you’ll be focusing on identifying continuous improvement opportunities (low to no-tech) through data analysis & process reviews using Lean Six Sigma methodologies to improve average handle time, first call resolution & demand reduction. As a Senior Analyst, you’ll use your experience and direct client feedback to improve the quality of key processes, conduct independent research on existing procedures and systems that support the current state and identify changes needed to support improvements. You will partner with teams within Channel Optimization and other functional areas to drive client-focused initiatives that will ensure CIBC remains relevant to Canadians changing banking behaviors. 

You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote. 


How You’ll Succeed 

Creative /Problem Solver – You can identify, quantify, recommend and document call reduction reasons and opportunities that will help in achieving annual objectives 
Intuitive / Knowledge Driven – You can conduct independent researches on existing policies, procedures, methodologies and systems that support the current state and identify changes needed to support revised processes. Work with business and process engineering to identify and build process improvements into design 
Address Process Inefficiencies – you can review business processes and identify ways to improve for efficiencies. Be able to think in a structured way when solving problems, and organizing work and can analyze data/situations fully and accurately to guide or reach productive decisions. 
Detail Driven – You extract findings and gather insights through data mining and can prepare and document all required artifacts from idealization to post implementation tracking and reporting including call trends over time 
Communication Skills – Excellent verbal and writing skills to effectively articulate ideas and opinions that involve analysis, interpretation, and assessment. 


Who You Are 

You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You're confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way that is sound and insightful. 
You embrace and champion change. You'll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best. 
You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it's the right thing to do. 
You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don't. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making. 
You demonstrate experience in knowledge of contact centres & tools such as Knowledge Central, ECIF, COINS, TSYS, AS400 & Chordiant. Strong PC skills with experience that includes Word, Excel and PowerPoint. Knowledge of Verint & Speech Analytics is preferred 


What CIBC offers 

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck. 

We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program. 
Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients. 
We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development. 


What you need to know 

CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com 
You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit 
CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation. 


Job Location Toronto-81 Bay, 18th Floor 
  Employment Type Regular 
  
Weekly Hours 37.5 
  Skills 
Business Analysis, Business Process Analysis, Call Center, Change Enablement, Cross-Functional Teamwork, Cross-Team Collaboration, Problem Analysis, Problem Solving, Process Reviews, Six Sigma, Taking Initiative, Time Management

Title: INTERNATIONAL FUNCTIONAL AND REPORTING ANALYST
Description:
International Functional and Reporting Analyst
 - (21449)
Find Your Spot at Humber
If you are interested in higher education and are looking to contribute to the largest polytechnic college in Ontario as we shape the future of our students and communities, here is your opportunity to join our team.
At Humber, our career paths open up a world of infinite possibilities for you to explore. People are at the heart of the Humber experience. Here, every day we work shoulder to shoulder to deliver excellence, and in doing so, we redefine what it means to be a leader in polytechnic education. Humber employees are a diverse group of committed, caring and fun-loving people. We learn and grow together. We take finding and growing the right talent very seriously. We strive to find and nurture extraordinary employees who bring their best each day.
Humber is a place like no other. Here you will “Find Your Spot” and build a career and future that grows as we grow. In this rich, diverse workplace, we encourage innovation ideas. We support you to find deep meaning and purpose so that you can be proud of what you do and where you work.
Visit www.humber.ca for more information.

Job Details:
Position Title: International Functional and Reporting Analyst
Status: Full-time Permanent
Hours: 37.5 hours per week
Faculty/Department: International
Campus/Location: North Campus
Salary: $35.83/hr

What You Will Do:
Under the direction of the Associate Director, International Admissions and Student Services, the International Functional and Reporting Analyst provides system and technical support to Humber International in four key areas: Systems administration and innovation, reporting oversight & leadership, data analysis and technical support.
The incumbent plays a primary technical role within Humber International as the technical lead and liaison with other technical colleagues at Humber, including the systems professional in the Registrar’s Office, ITS and Institutional Analysis.
Systems administration and innovation
Manage all elements required for ongoing use of the set of central Tableau dashboards through maintenance of the underlying databases, data aggregation, cleaning and inputs optimized for the Tableau dashboard systems
Support and represent Humber International in weekly CRM & Banner status meetings and support the prioritization of Humber International changes (additions, modifications, development) that will improve systems performance for Humber International operations
Maintain and edit all templates in MS Dynamics used to issue international offers of admission in collaboration with the Manager of International Admissions
Conduct User Acceptance Testing (UAT) as systems upgrades are introduced in collaboration with the Business System Analyst team in the Registrar's Office, ITS and vendors
Update and maintain the Scheduled Leave Reports throughout the academic year and document updates and year over year changes in collaboration with the Manager, International Student Services
Configure the academic year components in Banner specific to international admissions including data entry for all programs and terms: start and end dates, coop flag, EAP flag, and tracking of programs that will allow conditional acceptance in collaboration with Manager, International Admissions
Update Co-op information and tracking annually for all programs in both CRM and Banner yearly and as new programs are introduced to ensure coop letters are accurate
Provide Microsoft Dynamics software training (onboarding, new developments/advancements) to staff in International and manage access on behalf of the department
Provide timely, expert support to the international admissions team to ensure all communications are sent out and received in line with business practice
Create and submit JIRAs to document needed fixes due to systems bugs and required enhancements

Reporting oversight & leadership
Oversee and manage the design and improvements of the Humber International reporting systems to ensure end user needs are met, and provide training and support to end users as needed
Develop, circulate and maintain critical operational reports (e.g. International-specific Day 10 report) throughout the year and ensure reports meet stakeholders' business needs
Oversee, manage and automate the International portion of Humber's Google Analytics reports to support International digital marketing campaigns
Oversee, administer and lead use of the tracking system in Google Analytics, including end user support and training
Maintain a library of processes and procedures in a centrally accessible format to be able to generate prospective student lists to support outbound communications for all areas within Humber International and ensure lists' accuracy and timeliness

Data analysis
Work with departmental leadership to understand and interpret business problems and design analytical reports, summaries and techniques to assist in the solving of those problems
Provide technical advice and support on the design, implementation, maintenance and development of statistical analyses in support of the achievement of the department's goals and strategic plans
Collaborate with other Humber departments (Registrar's Office, Institutional Analysis, ITS, Finance, etc.) to solicit data to incorporate into data analyses most impactful for Humber International
Provide direct support, counsel and advice to Institutional Analysis regarding ongoing dashboard design, implementation and development for use by the Humber community
Provide on-demand, ad hoc reports and statistics as needed for members of the Humber International team

Technical support
Resolve technical issues in collaboration with Humber International team members to support Customer Service team functions (unblocked and unsubscribed lead issues, unbalanced batch process issues, etc. in MS Dynamics)
Provide technical support to Humber International team members to resolve issues with application refunds, deactivated applications, and reprocessing of applications associated with payment processing
Provide technical support to the admissions team when there are record issues or MS Dynamics related issues such as: updating student demographic information and re-sending offers
Ensure all Banner technical enhancements related to international admissions processing are prioritized within overall Banner technical planning
Provide focused systems training and support for specific Humber International tasks and responsibilities to department staff members (e.g. Banner, MS-Dynamics)
Troubleshoot day to day technical issues related to application processing and provide support as needed
What You Bring to the Role:
Education
The successful candidate will have an undergraudate degree or equivalent.
Field(s) of Study: Information technology / computer science, mathematics, research analysis, business (only with a strong emphasis on math-related majors such as statistics or finance)

Minimum of five (5) years experience in:
Demonstrated use of technical reporting tools such as Tableau, Excel, Access and other means
Demonstrated experience designing and maintaining server databases
Excellent interpersonal, listening and customer service skills
Demonstrated understanding of statistical reporting and analysis underlying the reports
Demonstrated understanding of Google Analytics architecture, set-up, maintenance and use in a marketing context. Experience of same strongly preferred
Demonstrated proficiency working with student information systems and relational databases
Superior communication skills with the ability to explain complex processes
Extensive experience working in the post-secondary education environment with strong understanding of college business processes
Strong leadership skills and the ability to work independently
Superior logical and technical abilities to develop and modify complex application programs
Experience working with large Oracle databases to produce query and reports using data mining tools such as Cognos, SQL, and scripting tools considered an asset
Experience using issue and project tracking tools/software such as JIRA and Asana

What’s In it for you?
An opportunity to have an impact with a post-secondary institution, poised to do great things.
A diverse, hard-working, committed team of people who care about each other.
Tools and technology that will allow you to succeed at your job.
Amazing perks
Highly supportive work culture

At Humber College we don’t just accept difference — we celebrate it! Experience comes in many forms, skills are transferable, and a progressive mindset goes a long way at Humber. If your experience is close to what we’re looking for, consider applying and tell us why you are a great candidate for this job. Find your Spot at Humber!
We thank you for your interest in working with Humber College. Only applicants selected for an interview will be contacted. Consideration for Support Staff and Academic positions will be given to internal employees in accordance with the respective Collective Agreements.

Equity, Diversity and Inclusion
Humber College is committed to a workforce that reflects the diversity of our students and our city. We actively seek Indigenous Peoples and individuals from equity-deserving groups with demonstrated skills and knowledge to deal with all aspects of equity, diversity and inclusion in a post-secondary environment.
Accommodation
Humber College is committed to accommodating applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process, in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Our HR Generalists will work with applicants requesting accommodations at any stage of the hiring process. This document is available in alternate formats upon request.
Anti-Discrimination Statement
At Humber College, all forms of discrimination and harassment are prohibited. Students and employees have the right to study, live and work in an environment that is free from discrimination and harassment. If you need assistance on concerns related to discrimination and harassment, please contact the Centre for Human Rights, Equity and Inclusion http://hrs.humber.ca/human-rights-equity-diversity.html or the Office of Student Conduct at studentconduct@humber.ca.

Title: Senior Compensation Analyst
Description:
Montréal, QC
JOB TITLE
Senior Compensation Analyst
CONTRACT TYPE
Regular
PUBLICATION DATE
2022-03-26
COUNTRY
Canada
Company presentation

A world leader in gases, technologies and services for Industry and Health, Air Liquide is present in 78 countries with approximately 64,500 employees and serves more than 3.8 million customers and patients. Oxygen, nitrogen and hydrogen are essential small molecules for life, matter and energy. They embody Air Liquide’s scientific territory and have been at the core of the company’s activities since its creation in 1902.

Entity and activity description

Air Liquide’s ambition is to be a leader in its industry, deliver long term performance and contribute to sustainability - with a strong commitment to climate change and energy transition at the heart of its strategy. The company’s customer-centric transformation strategy aims at profitable, regular and responsible growth over the long term. It relies on operational excellence, selective investments, open innovation and a network organization implemented by the Group worldwide. Through the commitment and inventiveness of its people, Air Liquide leverages energy and environment transition, changes in healthcare and digitization, and delivers greater value to all its stakeholders.

Air Liquide’s revenue amounted to more than 20 billion euros in 2020. Air Liquide is listed on the Euronext Paris stock exchange (compartment A) and belongs to the CAC 40, EURO STOXX 50 and FTSE4Good indexes
Missions and Responsibilities

Air Liquide is seeking a senior level Compensation Analyst, located in Houston, TX or Montreal, QB, and reporting into the Americas Total Rewards & International Mobility COE. The Senior Compensation Analyst is responsible for compensation projects and activities, and requires regular interaction with Air Liquide employees, managers and senior leadership across businesses and geographies.

This position will perform the following responsibilities:
Participate in the administration of compensation programs including base pay changes, incentive plans, employee stock purchase planProvide support for salary increase requests for new hires, promotions, and other related transactions
Evaluate new or revised jobs to determine appropriate salary grade and classification (e.g. hourly or salaried)Resolve compensation issues working with HR and managers.Conduct ongoing job evaluation to ensure, internally equitable, and externally competitive compensation structures.Identify and participate in compensation surveys to benchmark our internal pay practices and to conduct research into market trends.Ensure the effective maintenance, upgrading and data accuracy of the organization's pay systems and job structures (titles, jobcodes, job profiles, etc.).Participates in review of escalated issues related to pay changes, incentive increases or other compensation related activities.Serve as day-to-day US contact for Air Liquide ESPP program; support Shareholder Services in Paris with US employee shareholder matters.Develops methods for supporting innovation and change across the organization.Conduct analysis to support market competitive merit increase budgets and salary structure movement to senior leadershipLeads the execution and creation of the annual pay planning project plan and deadlines in collaboration with Talent Management, HRIS and other key stakeholders.Develops plan documentation for annual bonus plans.
 In conjunction with Employee & Labor Relations, maintain and update policy and procedure documents for compensation plans, ensuring compliance with all legal requirements,
Identify opportunities to standardize practices across business lines and geographiesParticipate in the analysis, development, and implementation of new programs, policies and processes that support the company’s compensation philosophy.Understand compensation related provisions of union collective bargaining agreements to ensure proper program administrationCreate and maintain compensation information on company intranet and other websitesSupport the adoption and administration of region or world wide compensation practices
Other special projects as needed and requested.
Competencies and Profile

Qualifications:
BS / BA in HR, Business, or other related fields.CCP preferred.Must have a minimum of 5+ years in compensation, preferably within a corporate compensation department in a global, highly-matrixed organization.Experience and comfort working in a fast-paced and empowered environment.
Ability to multitask in a fast paced environment and act with a sense of urgency.Experience in developing and running basic queries and reports from human resources information systems (HRIS).Experience with Workday and PayFactors or other salary survey software preferred.Advanced knowledge and experience with Google or Microsoft suite of products, including spreadsheet tools and formulas (vlookups, IF statements, pivot tables, data analysis, charting, etc.), word processing, and slide presentations.Experience with formal job evaluation tools and processes (job pricing, job leveling, Factor Based methodologies, etc.)Experience partnering with and advising management on all aspects of compensation plans.

Competencies:

Ability to read and interpret documents such as policies and procedures manuals, job descriptions, and bonus plans.Ability to write routine reports and correspondence. Ability to speak effectively before groups of customers or employees of organizationAnalytical and conceptual ability necessary to evaluate large amounts of internal and external data, balancing the needs of customers and management within budgetary constraints, company guidelines, policies and government regulations.Approaches problems in a rational manner using sound strategies that ensure comprehensive understanding and effective resolution.Ability to organize own work and perform independently.Must possess strong attention to detail.Excellent verbal and written communication skillsFree-thinking, innovative, and adaptable attitude toward solutions.Must possess the energy and drive to execute under pressure and meet tight deadlines.Excellent process & planning, time management, and communication skills.Project management (managing initiatives from ideas generation to full execution).Agree to disclose your COVID-19 vaccination status, as a condition of employment.Agree to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and to maintain this fully vaccinated status, as a condition of employment.

Work Environment:

The position is an office-based position and occasionally requires work-related travel.Position interacts on a regular basis with colleagues located in various locations across the Globe.
Additional information

Looking for a job ? Find a career instead!

We focus on the professional development of our employees by offering several training programs and encouraging internal career paths. In Quebec or abroad (Air Liquide is present in 80 countries!), seize the opportunity to build a career that matches your ambitions!

Why our employees love working for Air Liquide

Collaborative work team
Competitive compensation (base + bonus)
Very advantageous pension plan
Full benefits
Free remote medical consultation service for the whole family
Recognition programs
Health and wellness program
Stock option
Discounts for employees at several partner companies and on our products
Ultra-safe work environment

*** Thank you for your interest in Air Liquide. Note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. For more information about our company, visit us online at www.airliquide.ca

At Air Liquide, we value the health and safety of our customers, patients and employees. As such, we strongly encourage everyone to be fascinated against COVID-19 and all future collaborators will be required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and maintain that full vaccination status.

Title: Business Analyst IAM
Description:
Company Description
Talan Canada is growing and looking to strengthen its team with a Business Analyst IAM for the Montreal office, who will be interested in working with clients from multiple industries.
Job Description
The main tasks are:
Support / Onboarding:
Be Single Point of Contact to onboard application on IAM solutions (SSO + IAM)
Capture the requirements of users that ease the adoption and push it to the Product Owner
Ensure of the stability and availability of the services/tools for IAM
Ensure to operate the services in compliance with the security rules
Communicate on incidents
Participate to reduce the online support activity by:
Promoting the Self service
Enhance the existing documentation
Identify automation of recurrent tasks
Spread the knowledge
Liaise with teams in Bangalore and Paris
Contribute to the documentation and spread the good usage of the tools
Promote the SSO solution of the group by holding presentation session
Animate Hands-on session with applications.
Qualifications
Technical Skills:
Desired: IAM, AD/LDAP, OIDC, SAML2, basic network, API, Git
Plus: Python or any language, ELK stack, SQL
A curiosity on security field is mandatory.
Soft Skills:
Practical sense: the candidate must suggest pragmatical solutions to fit the need of the user while respecting the quality standards.
Analysis and synthesis: be able to understand complex problems involving multiple IT teams or users.
Organisation and planning: be able to manage his working time autonomously and have a strong sense of priority
Perseverance and result oriented: Demonstrate self-exigence. Perseverance to find a solution, despite the difficulty. Stay positive. Focus on the outcome.
Oral and written communication: adapt your message to capture the attention of your audience. The candidate should able to communicate with developer, business analyst or manager.
Client centric and sense of service: To identify needs, the candidate must understand the reasons and motivations of the users of the platforms. He must direct his tasks according to their work habits, while helping them to evolve.
Cooperation and Team Spirit: He must work in good agreement with the members of the IAM teams all around the world and other teams like security and infrastructure team.
Languages: English, French is a strong plus since we are supporting tools at group level.
Experience needed:
At least 5 years experience in support, business or developer analyst and be knowledgeable on Identity Access Management domain.
Educational Requirements:
Bachelor of computer science or other related university degree
You must live in Montreal or be willing to relocate rapidly from anywhere in Canada and possess a valid work permit.
Additional Information
Talan is a consulting firm specializing in digital innovation and transformation. For over 20 years, Talan has been advising, supporting, and implementing transformation projects for businesses and public authorities, in France and abroad. With operations on five continents and nearly 5,000 consultants, the group anticipates a revenue of 600 million euros in 2022 and expects a turnover of 1 billion euros by 2024. The group places innovation at the heart of its development strategy and is involved in areas of technological change affecting major corporations, such as Big Data, the Internet of Things, Cryptocurrencies, and Artificial Intelligence.
Joining Talan also means:
Joining a Canadian group with more than 500 consultants, working in an agile and pragmatic way with large companies (Finance, Insurance, Telecommunications, Services, Distribution, Public sector) by combining consulting services / technological expertise / innovation / ability to deliver and deploy projects
Joining dynamic teams, where the role of the employee is at the center of attention, with the desire to create spaces allowing everyone to flourish
Participating in different communities to contribute to development and to innovate, all with a strong team and entrepreneurship spirit
Talan is a great playground, it's up to you!

Title: TDS Operations Analyst II
Description:
TD Description

Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
 Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.



Department Overview

     We want to hear from you if you're hardworking, collaborative and innovative with a forward-thinking approach to join our Access Controls team.
      This team coordinates user access intake, user attestations and works with business and technology groups to maintain the standard role documentation process, with a focus of improving controls around access management.
     
 We also support access management related initiatives through effective collaboration with various business groups to build operational capabilities that drive efficiency, improve client service levels and reduce operational risk.
    



Job Description

The Business Analyst demonstrates governance, control and risk management behaviors that align with TD policies and practices to drive accountability of team deliverables. You support the successful delivery of Access Control initiatives by:

 Participating in the problem statement articulation, planning, execution, and project management activities
 Developing, collaborating and executing on tactical plans that align to the Risk & Control framework
 Facilitating communications with all partners
 Identifying, supporting and offering creative solutions to key operational or process issues across the broader team




Job Requirements


Administration of the manual attestation process, which includes but is not limited to: 
       
Sending out of attestation emails to people managers (or their delegates), submission of access revocation requests and documentation of data change requirements
 Managing attestation packages
 Reviewing and updating attestation feed configuration, ensuring currency for both data and glossary definitions
 Monitoring attestation progress, following up with people managers and escalations, as required.
 Investigation and timely escalations / management of issues

 Support tasks related to the various access control processes specifically around access de-provisioning and application intake
 Coordinate with business, technology partners and control teams to troubleshoot and remediate issues.
 Participate in process optimization and automation enhancements.
 Connect with various partners to understand new access control requirements
 Support any remediation activities, as needed
 Lead initiatives to improve the Risk & Control framework 
Build positive relationships and work closely with key partners to establish the accurate support model and offering leadership as needed




Additional Information


Undergraduate degree
 3+ years' experience
 Experience in Access Management processes and controls
 Experience in User Attestation Administration
 Strong Excel skills
 Ability to track and document multiple requests simultaneously through completion in a fast-paced environment.
 Understand IT security risks, processes, controls and communicate at a technical level
 Sound analytical skills with the ability to problem solve and ‘think outside of the box’
 Able to connect with a diverse group of partners at all levels of the organization 
Outstanding problem-solving capabilities and an ability to collect and analyze data, and provide insights
 Highly motivated individual with a consistent record to deliver results




Inclusiveness

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.
