Title: Project Operations Analyst / PMO Analyst / PSA Analyst
Description:
Calligo is an award-winning managed data services provider. It has a global track record in improving organizations' productivity & profitability by making their data more available, secure and safe. The right candidate will be excited to work in a dynamic & collaborative value-centric technology company.

Within Calligo, the Project Management Office, is accountable to ensure the successful completion of projects against business objectives. The role ensures project execution happens with a focus on value generation, to ensure we are biasing towards action, have clear distribution of responsibilities on the project, are following the desired governance framework, providing necessary reporting and documentation to meet audit compliance standards, and providing reporting and communication to enable broader alignment and business integration.
Key Responsibilities

Help ensure Resource/Project management systems are kept up to date, with accurate information based on plans - both for pipeline projects (being setup by the Sales/Commercial team), and also ensuring that delivery teams / project leads are managing projects in accordance with defined expectations. These duties would include:
Ensuring pipeline projects plans are regularly reviewed and updates being made in alignment with commercial and pre-sales stakeholders
Ensuring timecards are being completed (submitted & approved) on time each week and at month end
Ensuring project status and other information needed is being regularly captured by the Project Leads
Ensuring the Executive and other Leads in the business are receiving the necessary reporting from the planning systems via the PowerBI reports, and updates to the systems and reporting are being delivered
Ensuring the system (workflows, fields etc) is continually being improved to maximize the value we receive from it, whilst reducing/removing unnecessary processes and data to create efficiency
Self-managing one’s time to maximize your personal contribution to the business, with a lens of profit-orientated PMO, including activities such as:
Continuous learning to increase one’s personal productivity, in terms of new tools and methods, or new business concepts or frameworks
Critically reflecting on one’s personal schedule, activities, and considering how to optimize and reduce waste via outdated or unnecessary meetings and activities
Critically reflecting on activities and initiatives, to understand how they will generate more customer value, and what the true customer need is
Collaborating with adjacent stakeholder groups to continue to seek opportunities to create value, via productivity improvements, waste reduction, new value creating initiatives, etc.
Ensuring Calligo corporate is well informed of assigned projects, by:
Reporting of project status, risks/issues, dependencies etc, through defined communication channels via standardised reporting methods
Ensuring Calligo maintains full compliance to internal compliance for project execution standards by:
Holding project teams accountable to follow defined internal procedures in documentation and reporting methods
Compiling necessary reporting and information packs required for auditors
Perform other related duties as assigned, available and capable

Skills Knowledge and Expertise

Belief in yourself to create value and bring change
Boldness and confidence to communicate fearlessly, balanced with humility and a hunger to learn
1+ years in an IT/Technology centric organization
1+ years in an Operations/Project Management related role/responsibilities
Experience within a PMO is preferred
Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to engage, influence, and inspire
Strong organizational skills and a meticulous attentiveness to critical details
Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office (Outlook, Teams, Word, PowerPoint, Excel, PowerBI) is essential to enable daily task execution, collaboration, and communication
Knowledge of additional PM tools is helpful, namely: Microsoft Project Online, Microsoft Project Operations (PSA), Financial Force PSA

Benefits

Training and development for career growth
25 Days Holiday (increasing with length of service)
RRSP
Healthcare
Life Assurance
Flexible working

About Calligo
Calligo transforms data into businesses’ most lucrative asset. We combine great minds in data science, privacy, security and engineering with leading machine learning, data analytics and cloud platforms to support the operational, customer-centric and revenue-generation aspirations of some of the world's most ambitious and progressive organizations.

Title: Organizational Change Management (OCM) Analyst, Data in Action
Description:
Help us boldly shape retail in Canada 
Canadian Tire Corporation, Limited (“CTC”) is one of Canada’s most admired and trusted companies. With world-class Owned Brands and exciting market-leading merchandising strategies, we are continually innovating with purpose: to be there for Canadians from coast-to-coast. We are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join Canadian Tire and its group of companies. 
Competing in the age of analytics and AI will require a new operating architecture - one that is horizontally connected and designed to leverage an integrated foundation of data to drive rapid deployment of insights and intelligent applications. The DNA (Data in Action) program is a collaborative effort to build and mature enterprise capabilities in data governance, business Intelligence, advanced analytics, and artificial intelligence. It also aims to advance the infrastructure and processes that will enable the enterprise to drive more data and insights into action. 
Reporting to the Manager, Learning and Communications, the Organizational Change Management (OCM) Analyst, Data in Action will be responsible for planning, designing, and creating marketing materials to support a large enterprise transformation program in the data, analytics and AI domain. They will elucidate and translate technical requirements and create content to communicate technical designs to an executive and enterprise-wide audience. They will maintain active engagement between the DNA program, business stakeholders and HR Corporate Communications throughout the lifecycle of the projects. They will work closely with domain experts to understand processes, create communication plans, and develop content to support engaging and clear communication. They will help ensure written communication in various forms (presentations, blog posts, website etc.) are error-free, relevant, and matches our brand voice and tone. They will contribute to achieving the team’s stakeholder engagement goals and provide support with any other stakeholder engagement materials or activities required for the program’s overall success. 
To help define where and how we work, CTC has introduced Hybrid Workplace Personas. While each role fits into a different persona category, this may evolve as employees progress in their career or business needs change. The OCM Analyst is, categorized as a Connector, which means that the incumbent will be working with a variety of colleagues and partners to achieve business outcomes that require a mixed use of virtual and CTC campus presence. 
What you’ll do 

Gather, understand, and translate business and technical requirements in the data and analytics domain to identify and execute change communication needs 
Translate technical designs into content for the broader audience (enterprise and executive) 
Balance multiple priorities, prioritize, and deliver high-quality written communications on time in a fast-paced, deadline-oriented environment 
Create fresh, clear, engaging, user-focused marketing copy that demystifies complex functionality and generates engagement 
Design and produce innovative messaging and visual internal communication to increase program awareness and engagement in various mediums (slides, blog posts, digital brochures, newsletters, website content, executive updates etc.) 
Plan and organize meetings, presentations, and other events to engage and inform stakeholders. Facilitate sessions and collaborate with key resources to develop and execute change and communication related deliverables. 
Support designing an evaluation plan that monitors adoption and engagement rates of stakeholders 
Develop a workplan, identifying key deliverables, effort and duration of tasks and timelines 
Conduct regular communication with stakeholders to present deliverables, provide status updates, resolve issues and review updated plan 
Support managing a group mailbox and a group page to ensure communication from the program matches our brand voice and tone 
Advocate for new ways of working and champion upskilling enterprise wide 

What you bring 

BA degree in English, Journalism, Communication, Creative Writing, or relevant writing-heavy program 
Minimum of three (3) years’ experience in planning, designing, and writing a variety of program marketing materials for a broad enterprise audience, preferably in corporate, internal or employee communications 
Demonstrated professional-level writing ability with respect to voice, style, organization, and structure, and clear understanding of the target audience(s) and presentation of key message(s). A portfolio of samples is required 
Experience with organizational change management on strategic initiatives, preferably in a corporate, or retail environment 
Experience in a fast-paced and unpredictable environment; highly self-directed and able to work well under tight timelines 
Advanced competencies in collaboration, communication, team building, and stakeholder engagement 
Proficiency with Microsoft Office suite is required (Word, SharePoint & PowerPoint. Visio is an asset) 
OCM, proofreading and/or editing certifications would be an asset 

About Canadian Tire Corporation 
As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies . To learn more follow us on LinkedIn . 
CTC is committed to the fight against COVID-19 and being there for Canadians. In support of this, we have adopted a COVID-19 Vaccination Policy to protect the health and well-being of our employees. Employees will be required either to be fully vaccinated or undergo regular COVID-19 testing in order to access the workplace until further notice.

Title: Tax Operations Analyst - Advanced Excel - 336718
Description:
Tax Operations Analyst
On behalf of our client in the Banking Sector, PROCOM is looking for a Tax Operations Analyst.
Tax Operations Analyst – Job Description
The Analyst will also provide a range of analytical/ process support, reporting, analytics and assist in the generation of various tax slips and filings with Canada Revenue Agency (CRA)
The Analyst will also work to investigate, improve, and redesign existing processes and pain points within the Registered Plans and Mutual Funds Tax production space
Your high energy and desire to invoke change will enable you to find creative solutions that not only optimize the efficiency of existing processes but also improve employee engagement and satisfaction
You are a leader with a keen sense of finding the root cause of problems by sifting through data as well as strong interpersonal skills to lead change within diverse teams and skillsets
You are driven to succeed in a dynamic and changing Wealth Management environment to drive competitive advantage within the Operations functions at Wealth
Tax Production:
Support and assist in the generation of adhoc queries, monthly reporting for various reconciliations, and work with Operations, Wealth Partners, Technology and Vendors to scope, test and review Tax UAT and production cycles and leverage available technologies.
Generate various Tax slips and filings with CRA as required and provide Partners with necessary calculations related tax financial information
Support and assist in the production of various non- registered and Mutual Funds tax products (i.e T5s, T5008s, T3s, etc.) and the gathering of income payment data and tax information from Fund Accountants for various Tax reporting
Process Optimization:
Drive continuous improvement of the current state Tax Production model service level agreements (SLA) to enhance the client experience and operational efficiencies
Analyze current state processes and perform root cause analysis for any breaks and gaps in process, including but not limited to:
Finding Data integrity or quality issues
Independently drive change and solutions for all identified root causes.
Take a risk-based approach in applying innovative solutions to unique problems in differing lines of business and tax products
Liaise and drive change between multiple stakeholders (Technology, Business Architecture, Operations, Wealth Business lines etc.)
Recommend and summarize improvements to Management and senior leadership

Tax Operations Analyst – Mandatory Skills
Data literacy, process optimization, data technology tools
Intermediate-Advanced Level Excel: write macros, VBA, formulas, manage data, able to find easier way to complete work, creativity and willing to learn
Strong knowledge of VBA macros and other programming languages is a must
Strong data analyst skills (1-3 years experience in data analyst) can be new grad with some experience and very strong technical skills
Drive change and solutions for root causes that they identify
Data integrity issues and fix data, provide recommendations
Drive continuous improvements and perform root cause analysis (find data integrity issues, identify outdated processes and technology used)
1-3 years work experience in analytical roles (data analysis, Operations Analyst, data validation, reporting, and analytics techniques)
A general understanding of Banking Operations and interest in financial services
Computer science, business, mathematics, stats or related field, accounting, finance
1-3 years experience as business analyst or related

Tax Operations Analyst – Nice to Have Skills
Experience with Alteryx, Tableau
Understanding of the Federal and Provincial Tax Act as it pertains to income reporting
Experience in using ISM, RPM, SEI, and Baycom (SMS and Primebase) system would be an asset
Knowledge of the Canadian tax system

Tax Operations Analyst - Assignment Start Date
ASAP – 24 months to start
Tax Operations Analyst - Assignment Location
Toronto, ON – Work Hybrid

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
Req Id: 360636
At Bell, we do more than build world-class networks, develop innovative services and create original multiplatform media content - we advance how Canadians connect with each other and the world.
If you’re ready to bring game-changing ideas to life and join a community that values professional growth and employee wellness, we want you on the Bell team.
Our Bell Business Markets team enables the digital transformation of businesses and governments nationwide through solutions in areas including Internet and private networks, voice and unified communications, contact centre, security, Internet of Things, data centre and cloud. We’re proud to be Canada’s leading provider of broadband network and communication services for businesses and governments.
Do you often think about how details fit within the big picture?
Do you enjoy challenging the status quo?
Are you a Customer Experience Champion?
Are you technical and a visionary who loves working on transformation projects?
If so, The Bell Business Markets team is looking for a bright-minded individual with solid project management and business analysis skills who is capable of driving change while working through complex issues in an overall mandate to provide support to key members of the project/product development team.
The Business Analyst within the Client Services group for Bell Business Markets, will be part of a team responsible for the optimization and delivery of exciting transformation projects or new product introduction. The role will function as an interface with the operational group, IT and a team of experts working on project engineering with overall responsibilities and an opportunity to lead in the definition of solutions, creation of requirements, roadmaps, sequences and overall end-to-end delivery.
This is an exciting opportunity to work with high calibre professionals on projects that make Bell better. If you have a background in the management, analysis and development of projects and processes; plus you are experienced and passionate about improved service and the customer experience, this is a great opportunity to play a leading role in contributing to Bell’s key strategic imperatives.
Job duties / accountabilities:
Represent the customer and the Client Services team within Bell Business Markets on new product introduction, but also system and process improvement initiatives.
Responsible for the intake of large client deals from Sales and the dispatch to either the Operations or the Automations teams.
Assess priority , costs, risks and operational work effort for large client projects
Perform a list of validations to ensure the large client projects are ready to be worked on by the operations team immediately
Determine feasible project delivery timelines and align with Sales, customer and operations/RPA teams
Develop sustainable, repeatable and quantifiable business process improvements
Collect and analyze data to initiate, develop and recommend business practices and procedures that focus on enhanced customer service, increased productivity, and cost reduction
Assume a leading role in performing and overseeing the multi-functional tasks associated with these objectives, while working closely with colleagues and other business stakeholders.
Work with Business Stakeholders, Operations Teams, Development Teams, Technical SMEs, and Leadership to ensure that the solutions provided align with the business requirements and business objectives
Optimize delivery through the process life cycle (ordering to delivery to billing).
Recommend changes to established methods, propose alternative and new solutions to improve operational efficiency
Assist in the implementation of the new solutions by providing subject matter expert support in the change management process
Critical Qualifications/Competencies:
Comprehensive knowledge of Change Management, Project Management and Process Improvement principles
Customer Experience focused
Project/Product knowledge and experience within (specifically, but not limited to):
Voice : BTC, SIPT
Data: IPVPN, Broadband
Managed Services: VMS, MIS-Network, MIS-Wireless & MIS-Video
Professional work ethic, inter-personal skills and strong organizational skills are essential
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
Conceptual thinking and creative problem solving skills
Ability to lead and influence others
High level knowledge of Client Services processes and products within large, cross-functional organizations
Collaboration and negotiation skills
Analytical and technical skills
Flexibility; ability to comfortably operate in a rapidly evolving environment.
Advanced MS Office skills, particularly MS Excel and MS PowerPoint.
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
A demonstrated ability to deliver results with particular strengths in:
Organizational skills
An ability to work independently
#LIST1
#Talent
Bilingualism is an asset (English and French); adequate knowledge of French is required for positions in Quebec.

Title: Senior Business Analyst, BCEHS Transformation Office
Description:
As per the current Public Health Order, full vaccination against COVID-19 is a condition of employment with PHSA as of October 26, 2021.


The Senior Business Analyst performs complex research and analysis to support operations of clinical and provincial programs of the BCEHS. This role will be engaged in multiple initiatives, and will be responsible for project planning, business requirements gathering (i.e. data, clinical workflow/business process and functional needs) and supporting the execution of projects and change management.

What you bring

A level of education, training, and experience equivalent to a Master’s degree in Business, Health Informatics, or a related discipline plus a minimum of five (5) years’ recent related experience including three (3) years in a team lead role.

Excellent oral and written communication skills including the ability to communicate complex ideas in simple terminology.
Demonstrated experience organizing and writing application related documentation and proposals.
Ability to understand and clearly relate technical information to internal and external members of the organization.
Ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem solving environment, utilizing your advanced critical thinking capabilities.
Understands business analysis and project management methodology.
Superior ability in presentation, facilitation, negotiation and issue management/escalation.
Ability to facilitate and encourage cooperation between diverse operational groups and skill sets.
Strong skills and experience in MS Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint and MS Project, Access), SharePoint and Visio, Crystal reports and other Business Intelligence Tools.
Experience with main stream project planning software and tools preferred.


What we bring


Every PHSA employee enables the best possible patient care for our patients and their families. Whether you are providing direct care, conducting research, or making it possible for others to do their work, you impact the lives of British Columbians today and in the future. That’s why we’re focused on your care too – offering health, wellness, development programs to support you – at work and at home.

Join one of BC’s largest employers with province-wide programs, services and operations – offering vast opportunities for growth and development.
Access to professional development opportunities through our in-house training programs, including +2,000 courses, such as our San’yas Indigenous Cultural Safety Training course, or Core Linx for Leadership roles.
Enjoy a comprehensive benefits package, including municipal pension plan, and psychological health & safety programs and holistic wellness resources.
Annual statutory holidays (13) with generous vacation entitlement and accruement.
PHSA is a remote work friendly employer, welcoming flexible work options to support our people (eligibility may vary, depending on position).
Perks include access to fitness classes and discounts to 350 BC-wide recreational programs, travel, technology, car and bike sharing, and more.

Job Type: Regular Full-Time
Location: 2955 Virtual Way, Vancouver BC V5M 4X6
Hours of Work: 08:00-16:00 Monday-Friday
Requisition #: 124769E


What we do


BC Emergency Health Services (BCEHS) provides provincial emergency medical care and patient transfer services.


Learn more about PHSA and our programs: jobs.phsa.ca/programs-and-services


PHSA is committed to employment equity, encouraging all qualified individuals to apply. We recognize that our ability to provide the best care for our diverse patient populations relies on a rich diversity of skills, knowledge, background and experience, and value a safe, inclusive and welcoming environment.

Title: Senior Policy Analyst (Research & Stat Officer 3)
Description:
Department: Municipal Affairs and Housing
Location: HALIFAX
Type of Employment: Permanent
Union Status: NSGEU - NSPG
Closing Date: 4/21/2022 (Applications are accepted until 11:59 PM Atlantic Time)



 About Us




The Department of Municipal Affairs and Housing is the primary housing delivery agency in Nova Scotia. The Department is also responsible for ensuring the availability of safe, suitable, and affordable housing for all Nova Scotians. Our work involves making strategic investments, leveraging new funding, and building on critical partnerships to help further position ourselves to meet current and future housing challenges.


For more information check us out at: https://housing.novascotia.ca






 About Our Opportunity




Reporting to the Manager of Housing Strategy and Transformation, the Senior Policy Analyst leads policy analysis as well as specialized and complex statistical research and program analysis resulting in the development of program policy options for seniors leadership on strategic housing policy and recommendations to inform decision-making.


Your strong research and analytical skills and demonstrated policy experience will ensure the Housing Strategy and Transformation team has evidence-based analysis, research and evaluation information.






 Primary Accountabilities




As a Senior Policy Analyst, you will formulate policy recommendations based on sound research and analysis. A few of your key responsibilities will include:



Providing analysis of policy options and presenting summaries, recommendations and reports on a variety of complex issues, programs and services;
Researching and conducting statistical analysis related to a range of housing and municipal policy initiatives and strategies;
Preparing reports, presentations and briefing materials for senior leadership;
Determining data requirements and designing collection methods; 
Supporting policy and program review through statistical analysis; and 
Contributing to the formulation of policy recommendations and solutions based on your research and analysis.


 




Qualifications and Experience




You have a bachelor’s degree and five (5) years of related experience; or a master’s degree and three (3) years of related experience.


As the ideal candidate you have demonstrated experience in policy analysis; research including qualitative and quantitative methods; and preparation of reports, presentations and briefing material. You are analytical in nature and can identify opportunities, evaluate alternatives and provide sound recommendations to senior management. You must be able to work and participate as a member of a multi-disciplinary team. This role also requires the ability to work independently with minimal supervision, be self-motivated, exercise sound judgement under pressure and follow-up pro-actively and address issues as they arise. You must have advanced written and oral communications skills and presentation skills along with excellent interpersonal, organizational and project management skills.


Experience undertaking data analytics to support evidence-based decision-making is considered an asset.


We will assess the above qualifications and competencies using one or more of the following tools: written examination, standardized tests, oral presentations, interview(s) and reference checks.






 Equivalency




An equivalent combination of training, education and experience will be considered. Equivalencies include, but are not limited to:



a related 2-year diploma and 7 years of related experience
9 years of related experience


 
Applicants relying on education and experience equivalencies must demonstrate such equivalencies in their application.






 Benefits




Based on the employment status and union agreement, the Government of Nova Scotia offers its employees a wide range of benefits such as Health, Dental, Life Insurance, Pension, General Illness (Short and Long Term), Vacation and Employee and Family Assistance Programs. Click here to learn more about our various benefits offerings and eligibility criteria.






 Working Conditions




Most of your work is spent located in a comfortable office environment. Some travel may be necessary in this role. There may also be opportunities for flexible working options.






 What We Offer





Career Development where you have access to career guidance, tools, resources, and ongoing training for every stage of your career.
Engaging workplace. Our Employees feel valued, respected, connected, and tuned in. We have forward-thinking policies and strategies.
Countless Career Paths.
Department Specific Flexible working schedules.






 
Pay Grade: PR 13
Salary Range: $2,396.86 - $2,913.59 Bi-Weekly


Employment Equity Statement:
Our goal is to be a diverse workforce that is representative, at all job levels, of the citizens we serve. The Government of Nova Scotia has an Employment Equity Policy, and we welcome applications from Indigenous People, African Nova Scotians and Other Racially Visible Persons, Persons with Disabilities and Women in occupations or positions where they are under-represented. If you are a member of one of these equity groups, you are encouraged to self-identify on your electronic application.


This is a bargaining unit position initially restricted to current civil service employees represented by the Nova Scotia Government Employees Union (NSGEU). If applying from outside a government office, employees must apply correctly via this link:


 
Failure to apply correctly means that your application will not be given first consideration as a bargaining unit applicant, and will only be included if external applications are pursued.


External applicants and current casual employees will only be considered if there are no qualified civil service bargaining unit candidates. PLEASE NOTE: Candidates will not be considered for an interview if applications are incomplete or are missing information.


Offer of employment is conditional upon the completion of all applicable background checks and confirmation of credentials, the results of which must be satisfactory to the employer. We thank all applicants for the interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. All questions and concerns may be directed to Competitions@novascotia.ca.

Title: Business Systems Analyst
Description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.
Job Title
Business Systems Analyst
Job Description
What will you do?
Elicit functional and system requirements for Registrations Compliance projects for Capital Markets and Wealth Management
Develop plans and accurate estimates for completion of requirements, continuously improving the level of details and accuracy of estimates
Analyze and document detailed business and system solution requirements using Agile methodology
Define practical user experiences, including storytelling, personas, process flows and interactions
Build and maintain a repository of reusable requirements documentation to support future initiatives, following the enterprise standards
Apply advanced coverage analysis techniques to ensure relationship between scope, detailed requirements, and testing through to implementation
Contribute to successful project completion within budget and on time by identifying risks and developing/recommending mitigation strategies.
What do you need to succeed?
Must-have
3-5 years fulfilling both Business Analyst and/or Business System Analyst roles
Proficiency in Agile Methodology Framework
Expertise in gathering, analyzing and documenting User Stories, Use Cases, workflow diagrams, and E2E requirements
Experience with requirements elicitation techniques such as Document Analysis, Interviews, Facilitated Workshops, Observation, Prototyping, Focus groups, Surveys
Experience in working with large projects with multiple stakeholders, data sources and system interfaces
Ability to communicates and build relationship with team members, stakeholders and business partners in order to complete deliverables.
Experience in generating new and effective ideas, approaches and solutions to complex problems & opportunities; openly question traditional assumptions track and manage changes to requirements throughout the project life cycle
Familiarity with relational databases, and query languages
Nice-to-have
Good understanding of capital markets, registrations and licensing compliance is an asset.
Knowledge of North American and international securities trading and data related to complete trade life cycle.
Experience with JIRA, and Confluence
Job Summary
As a Business System Analyst in the Compliance IT team, you will execute all aspects of requirement delivery- planning, elicitation, analysis and documentation, and requirements management. You will be a part of a multi-disciplinary scrum team, working closely with requirements stakeholders to make decisions about requirements approach – requirements deliverables, activities, effort estimates and will recommend best courses of action.
Address:
TORONTO, Ontario, Canada
City:
CAN-ON-TORONTO
Country:
Canada
Work hours/week:
37.5
Employment Type:
Full time
Platform:
Technology and Operations
Job Type:
Regular
Pay Type:
Salaried
Posted Date:
2022-04-07-07:00
Application Deadline:
2022-05-27-07:00
Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment
At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.

We also strive to provide an accessible candidate experience for our prospective employees with different abilities. Please let us know if you need any accommodations during the recruitment process.

Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you.

Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at rbc.com/careers.

Title: Cloud Infrastructure Analyst
Description:
You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You'll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you'll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.
Job Description:
Role Summary:
As a Cloud Infrastructure Analyst, you will be an essential part of the Cloud Infrastructure & Operations team; a highly recognized group within the Data & Analytics division that plays a direct role in Big Data, Machine Learning and Analytics technologies by designing, building and supporting Analytics infrastructure, and middleware technologies on Cloud platforms.
What will you do?
Understand and work with Amazon Web Services (AWS) Platform as a Service (Paas), Software as a Service (SaaS), and Hadoop administration and related technologies.
Evaluate functions and features of cloud services and related technologies.
Involvement with small and medium size infrastructure projects, and participate in projects throughout the entire project lifecycle, and define, manage and track project deliverables using defined technologies.
Work closely with other team members, technical/team leads, management, specialized IT areas and application support teams to ensure consistent delivery and quality of platform and cloud services.
Maintain up-to-date documentation and procedures for all supported cloud-related platforms, and define requirements in cooperation with Developers and other Specialists.
Develop scripts and functions to support internal processes and improve system performance.
Define, document and implement consistent standards and procedures
Share the responsibility of 7X24 rotational on-call duties, after hour change support and disaster recovery support
What you need to succeed?
High academic credentials and University level degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Science or a related field.
Knowledge and experience in Information Technology with high academic credentials in a related field.
Understand, can describe and can put into action complex concepts.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Passion for data and analytics as a career.
Strong organizational skills with the ability to handle several tasks efficiently.
Demonstrated ability to take initiative and learn independently.
Unique Requirements
Ability to receive Security clearance is required for this role [minimum of 5 consecutive years of residency in Canada].
What will be nice to have?
Proficiency with Linux.
Familiarity and/or experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS) environment.
Knowledge of Web development, Extract, Transform and Load (ETL) and Report development.
Scripting languages (Linux Bash, Microsoft Powershell, etc.).
Knowledge of database concepts such as data mapping, logical and physical data modeling.
Experience giving presentations to a wide variety of audiences including stakeholders, clients, etc.
What’s in it for you?
Being part of our journey in developing the next greatest digital experience.
Flexible Benefits from the day you join to meet the needs of you and your family.
Wellness programs that support the three pillars of your health – mental, physical and financial.
An extensive support system for continual learning including company-run courses, access to online learning platforms, opportunity for rotations, etc.
A flexible work schedule, so long it includes core working hours.
#LI-Hybrid
The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted. It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors. In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance. Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results.
Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.
Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.
At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

Employees permitted to work remotely are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 in order to attend a Sun Life office, Financial Centre or offsite location where activity related to Sun Life business occurs.
Employees whose job duties require them to attend a Sun Life office, Financial Centre or offsite location for Sun Life business must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 effective May 1st. Employees in these roles may participate in Sun Life’s Rapid Screening Program as an alternative until April 30th.
We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: IT Business Lead Analyst
Description:
The IT Business Lead Analyst is a senior-level position responsible for liaising between business users and technologists to exchange information in a concise, logical and understandable way in coordination with the Technology team. The overall objective of this role is to contribute to continuous iterative exploration and investigation of business performance and other measures to gain insight and drive business planning.

Responsibilities:
Provide input during development and implementation phases, including formulation and definition of systems scope, objectives and necessary system enhancements for complex, high-impact projects
Identify and communicate risks and impacts and propose risk mitigation options, considering business implications of the application of technology to the current business environment
Consult with business clients to determine system functional specifications and partner with multiple management teams and other units to meet organizational objectives
Evaluate new IT developments and evolving business requirements and recommend appropriate systems alternatives and/or enhancements to current systems by analyzing business processes, systems and industry standards
Provide in-depth and sophisticated analyses with interpretive thinking to define problems, develop innovative solutions and influence strategic functional decisions
Supervise day-to-day staff management issues, including resource management, work allocation, mentoring/coaching and other duties and functions as assigned
Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.
Qualifications:
6-10 years of experience
Proficiency in MS Office (Word, Excel, Visio, PowerPoint) with extensive experience using Excel for data analysis
Experience with all phases of Software Development Life Cycle
Comprehensive knowledge of the principles of business analysis
Education:
Bachelor's degree/University degree or equivalent experience
Master's degree preferred
-
Job Family Group:
Technology
-
Job Family:
Business Analysis / Client Services
-

Full time
-

Title: Senior Business Analyst
Description:
About Capgemini
Capgemini is a global leader in consulting, technology services and digital transformation, is at the forefront of innovation to address the entire breadth of clients opportunities in the evolving world of cloud, digital and platforms. Building on its strong 50 year heritage and industry specific expertise, Capgemini enables organizations to realize their business ambitions through an array of services from strategy to operations. Capgemini is driven by the conviction that the business value of technology comes from and through people. It is a multicultural company of 200,000 team members in over 40 countries.
Visit us at www.capgemini.com. People matter, results count.
Short Description
Role: Senior Business Analyst
Location: Toronto, ON
Employment type: Fulltime
BA – Financial Products and Balance Sheet :
Adjustments within the broader Data Management Capabilities (DMC) framework that also involves integration with data provisioning points for downstream consumers (both systems and users) and reconciliations. The Adjustments stream of work enables the capture and application of adjustments to source data from various trading and settlement systems, so that it can be shared by many consumers across Finance and Risk for consistent reporting.
Lead the BA responsibilities of a high visibility project involving GL reconciliation, Adjustments and supporting other Regulatory reporting efforts.
Qualifications
Must-have Skills/Experiences and/or Education, certifications, qualifications, designations:
(please identify # of years’ experience required for each) Financial Products knowledge, particularly Derivatives, Securities, Loans and Deposits
5+ Years of proven Business Analysis experience and project delivery in financial services industry
Strong understanding of financial products, balance sheet, general ledger reconciliations, ME Adjustments, etc.
Nice-to-have Skills/Experience and/or Education, certifications, qualifications, designations:
Experience working with Product Control, Financial Control or Regulatory Reporting functions
SQL – Expertise in SQL is essential for data analysis purposes, for both data provided by other systems and data generated by the Adjustment process itself
Job Responsibilities
Lead the BA responsibilities of a high visibility project involving GL reconciliation, Adjustments and supporting other Regulatory reporting efforts.Gather and document detailed business requirements from business stakeholders. Consult with technical team to assess the feasibility of the requirements and outline challenges and data gaps.Communicate effectively with business users and internal teams to understand the problem statement and technical challenges and come up with ideas of efficient solutions.Get familiar with current data models and systems. Perform data analysis and reverse engineering, using SQL, Python, or other tools, in order to figure out how to present relevant data.Create technical specifications by translating business requirements into a document that is understandable by development team. Alternatively, extract business requirement from SQL code or other technical specifications and make modifications to comply with new requirements.Understand the various financial products in RBC and how they have been modeled, such as derivatives and securities. Be familiar with reconciliation process and concepts of trades, positions, and sub-ledger and General Ledger accounts.Work with tools and platforms such as Hadoop Hive, Tableau, Dremio, Drools; and be willing to learn new ones as needed.Perform Data Quality Control tasks using innovative techniques or by automating manual processes.Interface with business areas, including high profile stakeholders, to ensure all initiatives support business strategies and goals and provide recommendations for future state.Provide leadership and direction to ensure adherence to strategic approach.
Disclaimer

Title: Project Controls Analyst
Description:
Greenstone Gold Mines L.P. is a 60/40 joint venture partnership between Equinox Gold and Orion Mine Finance Group formed for the purpose of the joint ownership and development of the Greenstone Gold Property including the Greenstone Mine located on a historical mine site in the Geraldton-Beardmore Greenstone belt in Ontario. The Greenstone Mine is managed directly by a dynamic and experienced Owner’s team, with an estimated $1.5 Billion investment over the three-year construction and commissioning phase, and a 14-year operating life of mine.


Greenstone Mine is seeking a Project Controls Analyst to join our team. Reporting to the Project Controls Manager, the Project Controls Analyst is responsible for providing project control support to ensure that the project control system is properly implemented and utilized.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES MAY INCLUDE:
Provide data analysis and data validation support to create data dashboards, reports, and visualizations to highlight trends
Support the preparation of data requirements for the weekly and monthly reports, and various presentations, including the development of graphs, tables and other visual tools
Collect and label project pictures for various reports
Review weekly progress reports from the contractors and reports slippages and deviation from baseline plan
Support the project schedulers by collecting and providing input for the development and maintenance of the Integrated Master Schedule
Track and coordinate the progress for various contracts on a day-to-day basis from a schedule perspective to ensure that the project is on-track
Maintain action tacking tools for risks and other project priorities, follow up with project team members for updates
Other tasks as assigned

SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES
Excellent working knowledge of MS Office products (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) and data tools
Strong analytical skills, including compiling, managing, and presenting data
Attention to detail
Establish and maintain positive working relationships with others, both internally and externally
Ability to meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment

EXPERIENCE, QUALIFICATIONS AND EDUCATION
Degree or Diploma in Engineering, Business, or equivalent experience
5 + years of experience in data analytics, project controls reporting in large construction projects
Mining experience is considered an asset

LOCATION
This position will be based in Geraldton, ON on a rotational basis.


We thank all candidates for their applications, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
Greenstone Gold Mines is committed to inclusiveness, equity, and accessibility. We encourage all qualified candidates to apply.
Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
GGM is committed to ensuring the health and safety of all workers in the workplace and recognizes that COVID-19 vaccination has been shown to be very effective in reducing COVID-19 virus transmission and protecting most vaccinated individuals from severe consequences of COVID-19. Being vaccinated will help protect our workforce and our local Indigenous and community partners. In that respect, Greenstone Mine has a implemented a mandatory COVID-19 vaccination.

Title: Analyst, Supply Management
Description:
External Job Description
Closing Date: April 21, 2022
Reporting to the Director, Supply Management, the Analyst, Supply Management is responsible for conducting analysis and diagnostic work on strategic supply categories. The successful candidate will use techniques that range from primary data aggregation to complex models to support sourcing strategies, negotiations, and contract management.
The Analyst will support Category Managers by providing ongoing market and economic analyses identifying key issues and trends, verifying contract pricing to ensure compliance with adjustment mechanisms, supporting internal demand analysis and preparing demand forecasts, and tracking and reporting value, benefits, and key performance indicators for management.
Responsibilities:
Be a courageous safety leader, adhere to and sponsor safety and environmental rules and procedures
Conduct reviews of strategic supply contracts, to verify contract price adjustments and ensure compliance with adjustment mechanisms.
Conduct ongoing market analysis identifying key issues and trends relevant to strategic supply categories.
Prepare information for tracking the value and benefits for each contract and report on performance indicators.
Complete internal demand and fulfillment reviews for each contract and prepare updates to demand forecasts.
Work with the Category Managers to develop the value propositions for the selected categories.
Review existing spend data to identify new categories for strategic sourcing and ascertain demand by collaborating with site representatives.
Determine end-user needs, functional requirements, technical specifications, and potential for alternatives, standardization and rationalization for the selected categories.
Establish a fact base for the selected categories, to identify current demand and buying practices, existing contracts, conditions of the contracts, and the potential for renegotiating terms.
Analyze the supply market to develop understanding of supply/demand dynamics, supplier capabilities and capacities, market position, competition, and alternatives to supply for the selected categories.
Understand competitive forces, reverse engineer suppliers’ costs, and determine relative bargaining strengths and weaknesses for the selected categories.
Identify cost reduction options for the selected categories through a strong understanding of life-cycle costs.
Conduct data analysis and develop and maintain models to support the sourcing strategies for the selected categories.
Provide assistance and conduct other work duties as assigned by the Director, Supply Management.
Qualifications:
A post-secondary Business/Finance/Marketing degree or equivalent certifications.
Minimum 5 years of relevant work experience within the mining or related industry.
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
Thorough understanding of analytical methods.
Advanced Microsoft Excel skills and proficient with other Microsoft Office applications.
Knowledge and understanding of supply management and mining operations.
Well-developed written and verbal communication skills with strong interpersonal skills.
Ability to work in a team environment and to effectively develop and maintain a rapport in an active network of internal and external contacts.
Ability to manage competing priorities to meet tight deadlines in a challenging environment.
Motivated self-starter with a strong sense of ownership and accountability over assigned work.
Foreign language skills (particularly Spanish) would be an asset #LI-JN1
About Teck

Title: Junior Business Analyst, Strategic Partnerships and Performance, Indigenous Health
Description:
Job Description: 
  


Job Title: 


     Junior Business Analyst, Strategic Partnerships and Performance, Indigenous Health
    




 Work Site: 


     Indigenous Health
    




 Status:


 Start Date:


 Hours:





 Regular Full Time
     

       As soon as possible
     

       0830-1630
     

       Days off: Saturday, Sunday, Statutory Holidays
     




 Salary: 


     $27.82 - $39.99 per hour
    




 Reference#: 


     162315-esa
    




 Come work as a Junior Business Analyst, Strategic Partnerships and Performance with Vancouver Coastal Health (VCH)!



 Vancouver Coastal Health is committed to improving the health and access to culturally safe healthcare of the Indigenous people in our region, and we recognize that we all have a contribution to make in reconciliation and healing. VCH’s Indigenous Health team works with staff and physicians across all programs and departments to provide strategic leadership, partner collaboration and community engagement to assist VCH to become a more culturally competent and safe organization.



 Vancouver Coastal Health is looking for Junior Business Analyst, Strategic Partnerships and Performance to join the Indigenous Health team. Apply today to join our team!
  

 As an Junior Business Analyst, Strategic Partnerships and Performance, Indigenous Health with Vancouver Coastal Health you will:

 Work with staff and physicians across all programs and departments to provide strategic leadership, partner collaboration and community engagement to assist VCH to become a more culturally competent and safe organization.
 Report to and in support of the Manager, Strategic Partnerships & Performance, Indigenous Health, the Business Analyst provides complex analysis and project support for special initiatives and analyze information and statistical data, conduct benchmarking activities, prepare and compile reports and technical documents and utilizes presentation software and tools to support business planning, decision-making and performance management for the department.
 Work to ensure Indigenous Health contracts are up to date, revised appropriately, monitored as necessary, and that the agencies are effectively supported.
 Work independently, and interface with Indigenous Health Directors, Managers, Coordinators, and other team members to gather and synthesize information for reporting purposes.
 Collaborate with VCH Decision Support on indicator development for performance measurement and monitoring.


 QUALIFICATIONS:


 Education & Experience


 Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration or a related field, supplemented by financial and project management courses.
 Three (3) years’ recent, related experience in a complex health care environment with progressively more responsible experience in information analysis, research and benchmarking or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.


 Knowledge & Abilities


 Employs expertise in the use of current desktop computer applications to create and manage a variety of databases, documents and presentations.
 Uses strong analytical, financial and research abilities to support decision-making.
 Applies exceptional problem-solving abilities to independently resolve issues and overcome obstacles.
 Effectively utilizes both verbal and written communication skills when providing advice and information and/or seeking/acquiring information.
 Optimizes departmental effectiveness and contributes to organizational success by applying excellent time management skills to prioritize and complete assignments and schedule activities.
 Practices diligence and care when maintaining, monitoring, calculating and summarizing data, records and confidential information.
 Physical ability to perform the duties of the position.


 As per the current Public Health Orders (Long Term Care/Seniors Assisted Living Provincial Health Officer Order and the Health Sector Order), as of October 26, 2021, all employees working for Vancouver Coastal Health must be fully vaccinated for COVID-19. Proof of vaccination status will be required.



 WHY JOIN VANCOUVER COASTAL HEALTH?


 VCH is a world class innovator in medical care, research and teaching, delivering service to more than one million BC residents. At VCH, we embrace thinking boldly, taking smart risks, and "going first" when we believe it will lead to the best possible outcomes for patients and their families. We invite you to join us in creating healthy lives in healthy communities by showcasing our passion for care, connection to the communities we serve and our culture of teamwork that makes VCH a great place to work.
  

 Comprehensive health benefits package, including MSP, extended health and dental and municipal pension plan

Title: Sr. Reinsurance Analyst (TAI)
Description:
Position Overview
This opportunity is with a TAI, a subsidiary of RGA. TAI provides the complete software and service suite of solutions for life companies to self-report all reinsurance business; ceded or retroceded in an electronic format to share with your reinsurance partners.

Responsibilities
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

As a Senior Reinsurance Analyst, you will:

Own and drive the administration of our services.
Work as part of the team, and take a lead role in the timely and accurate completion of projects, including data analysis and documentation.
Ensure quality assurance - through the highest quality of work that meets and exceeds client expectations is performed. This includes:
Ensure data quality on administration systems.
Perform retention and exception reporting; looking into root causes and policies.
Maintain the SLAs with the clients.
Support running of monthly and quarterly administration cycles by reviewing and processing cycle exceptions and reviewing reporting output.
Respond to ad hoc internal or reinsurer requests.
Mentor and lead - train junior analysts on business knowledge.
Grow your career as we grow. You will quickly increase the depth and breadth of your reinsurance knowledge. You will:
Participate in projects as required including data analysis and documentation.
Implement reinsurance business processes and best practices.
Make an impact. You will have an opportunity to make your voice heard and see your ideas, policies, and strategies implemented.


Requirements
Bachelor's degree in Actuarial Math or Sciences, Mathematics, Finance or Computer Science. Willingness to pursue your ARA designation.

The Experience:

3+ years of insurance operations.
Have expertise in recognizing systemic trending issues and data anomalies within large data sets.
Have exposure to project management concepts and practices.
The Industry Knowledge.
Have familiarity with various life insurance products written in the North American market
Basic insurance principles.
Reinsurance administration and treaties.
The technical – and data – skills.
Hands-on experience accessing and manipulating data with Excel, SQL and Access.
Experience in using the TAI administration system
The relationship-building skills.
You have outstanding verbal and written skills.
You know how to work with any level of internal or external clients.
You enjoy conducting research, digging deep and breaking down problems, and innovating solutions..
You are approachable, energetic, enthusiastic, curious, and funny. You are a team player, a collaborator, and an independent thinker.


Company Overview
TAI, as subsidiary of RGA is a market leader in life reinsurance systems in North America with clients in the United States, Bermuda, the Caribbean, United Kingdom, South Africa and Hong Kong. TAI is focused on simplifying reinsurance administration through software and service solutions. TAI Software automates reinsurance administration for life, annuity and longevity business and TAI Services helps identify and solve areas of reinsurance risk. Over 90% of the top insurers in North America, by life face amount issued, trust TAI software for their life reinsurance administration.

Title: Intermediate Business Analyst
Description:
Summary
Dokainish & Company is looking for an Intermediate Business Analyst to join our consulting firm. The Intermediate Business Analyst will facilitate and manage projects by serving as the liaison for users and developers. This role is responsible for communicating goals and evaluating results as requested.
The ideal candidate has a curious mind and enjoys taking a challenging problem, breaking it down into sections, reviewing the information, and asking the right questions. This person must have exceptional people skills as well as creative solutions.
Responsibilities:
Develop and communicate – Develop and communicate detailed specifications for implementation while maintaining customer expectations. Produce reports, timelines, and graphics to communicate expectations and progress to management, customers, investors, and other relevant parties.
Research and test - Research and analyze the nature, effect, and results of system difficulties. Work closely with IT team to satisfy data sampling, project analysis, testing verification, and other user requests from existing client databases.
Collaborate – Work closely with colleagues to understand technical needs. Understand how any disruptions will potentially change a project and affect the business. Communicate with team leads to ensure client satisfaction, and provide recommendations as needed.

Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Business, or a related field
Minimum of seven years of related experience
Experience overseeing testing and writing test plans
Excellent communication and customer service skills

About Dokainish & Company:
Since 2011, Dokainish & Company has been providing its clients with world class project consultancy services. Our clients have come to expect the highest delivery quality from our staff. Dokainish & Company focuses on all aspects of Project Services within small or multi-billion dollar capital projects.
We truly thank all applicants for their interest in joining the Dokainish & Co. Team, but only those candidates considered for an initial interview will be contacted.

Title: Credit Analyst, Business Banking
Description:
Address:
105 rue St-Jacques O
Job Family Group:
Commercial Sales & Service
Bilingualism (French) required
Performs ongoing comprehensive client credit analysis for an assigned number of client portfolios to assess the business entity’s overall financial health and credit risk using discretionary authority within prescribed limits. Makes credit decisions or provides timely advice to the business banking relationship manager for action in compliance with internal controls and audit, regulatory, and Bank policies and procedures.
Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules.
Supports the execution of strategic initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.
Helps determine business priorities and best sequence for execution of business/group strategy.
Conducts independent analysis and assessment to resolve strategic issues.
Breaks down strategic problems, and analyses data and information to provide insights and recommendations.
Coordinates the management of databases; ensures alignment and integration of data in adherence with data governance standards.
Builds change management plans of varying scope and type; leads or participates in a variety of change management activities including readiness assessments, planning, stakeholder management, execution, evaluation, and sustainment of initiatives.
Leads or participates in defining the communication plan designed to positively influence or change behaviour; develops tailored messaging; and identifies appropriate distribution channels.
Provides input into the planning and implementation of operational programs.
Executes work to deliver timely, accurate, and efficient service.
Analyzes lending applications to identify, correct, and make credit decisions or advise of deficiencies and/or exceptions in accordance with sound credit granting principles; recommends remedies to maintain acceptable asset and credit quality.
Analyzes lending applications to confirm security valuations and completes and approves credit applications for authorization in compliance with the Bank’s business banking lending policy.
Develops risk profiles, credit structuring of lending proposals, and completes credit investigations.
Responds to inquiries and resolves issues raised through audits and quality checks to adequately document lending decisions.
Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders.
Ensures alignment between stakeholders.
Integrates information from multiple sources to enable more efficient processes, enhance analysis, and/or streamline reporting.
Designs and produces regular and ad-hoc reports, and dashboards.
Monitors and tracks performance and addresses any issues.
Follows security and safeguarding procedures and applies due diligence in accordance with Bank’s policies and ethical standards for the prevention of loss due to fraud, robbery, counterfeiting, money laundering, or defalcation.
Adheres to business banking lending processes, policies, procedures, legal, regulatory, audit, and ethical requirements.
Maintains the confidentiality of customer and Bank information in compliance with Bank policies and procedures.
Identifies risks and takes appropriate actions, including all documentation and other regulatory requirements to maintain operational integrity.
Liaises between clients and various departments across the organization to discuss issues and procedures, and provide product support and expertise.
Focus is primarily on business/group within BMO; may have broader, enterprise-wide focus.
Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules.
Works independently on a range of complex tasks, which may include unique situations.
Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.
Qualifications:
Typically between 4 - 6 years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Advanced understanding of business banking products, lending process and directives, credit risk policies and standards, supporting processes, applicable legal and regulatory requirements, and Bank policies.
Strong knowledge of credit qualification and adjudication standards, policies, and procedures.
Technical proficiency gained through education and/or business experience.
Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth.
Collaboration & team skills - In-depth.
Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth.
Influence skills - In-depth.
Data driven decision making - In-depth.
We’re here to help
At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.
As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.
To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en .
BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.

Title: HR Technology Analyst
Description:
You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You'll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you'll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

 Job Description:
 Job description 

This is a temporary (18 month contract) role with remote work options available in Ontario.
 The HR Technology Analyst (Reporting, Data Management & Security) will help bring proactive HR insights closer to users in an integrated, accessible and secure way. We are looking for someone who learns new systems with ease, can analyze a request to get to the heart of the issue, and who is comfortable working in a collaborative, team-oriented environment.
 As a member of the Reporting, Data Management and Security squad, this role supports HR Systems security, production analytics, and data transformation across all HR Systems, with Workday HCM at the core. This squad ensures that workforce insights are proactively curated, designed and secured so that strategic insights are delivered to key decision-makers in the flow of work.

 What will you do?

 Design, build and test user-centric reports and dashboards in Workday and other reporting environments (SAP Webi, Tableau)
 Provide prompt access to HR Systems, Reports and Data in compliance with Sun Life policies
 Troubleshoot Workday reporting and security issues
 Support the elimination of technical debt, including the redesign of the security framework and reduction of custom and scheduled reports
 Contribute to effective governance of HR Data, including adding meta-data within Workday reports and supporting the classification and cataloging of data across HR Systems
 Support system maintenance on all HR Systems through reviewing release notes and completing full cycle testing
 Proactively recommend changes that enhance user experience, data quality and the effectiveness of analytics and dashboards
 Participate as an active team member to suggest, triage, refine, plan and prioritize work
 Follow and recommend improvements to internal standard operating procedures to ensure consistent quality and to mitigate risk


 What do you need to succeed?

 2+ years’ experience in HR Systems, IT, Data Analysis or a related field
 Experience working with Workday Reporting, Security and Advanced Analytics is preferred
 Working knowledge of Excel macros, Tableau, and VBA is an asset
 Must be able to understand functional and technical details and think strategically to connect requests and implement standardized, globally scalable solutions
 Dedicated commitment to customer service, clear communication and team collaboration
 Proven ability to follow privacy and data classification policies
 Strong attention to detail to ensure data integrity and high quality
 Creative thinker with an innovative, growth mindset


 #LI-Hybrid

 The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted. It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors. In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance. Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results.

 Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

 Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.

 At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

 Sun Life is committed to the health and safety of all those in our workplaces and our communities. In accordance with Sun Life’s Vaccination Policy (Canada):

 Employees permitted to work remotely are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 in order to attend a Sun Life office, Financial Centre or offsite location where activity related to Sun Life business occurs.
 Employees whose job duties require them to attend a Sun Life office, Financial Centre or offsite location for Sun Life business must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 effective May 1st. Employees in these roles may participate in Sun Life’s Rapid Screening Program as an alternative until April 30th.


 We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Senior Business Intelligence and Reporting Analyst
Description:
TD Description
Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.
Department Overview
The Marketing Technologies, Analytics & Insights (MTA&I) function within Marketing is a central source of internal and external consumer insights and data analytics which supports both corporate and business unit strategies for TD Bank Financial Group Canada and TD Bank, America’s Most Convenient Bank.
The MTA&I team mission is to be influential change agents and consumer advocates to help deliver the better bank and to drive shareholder return through optimizing the impact of marketing. We do this by delivering hindsight (what happened), insight (why), and foresight (future actions) on how to best reach consumers, who to target, what to say, and build intelligence on the market and competitive landscape. The group seeks to deliver excellence in analytics and insights to support short-term business success as well as long-term strategy of the bank.
The MTA&I team brings together a diverse range of technical and business expertise including market research, business analytics, data science and modelling, business intelligence, data strategy and governance, data management, campaign targeting and delivery, and visualization.
Job Description
The successful candidate will be responsible for Campaign Analytics within the broader Marketing Analytics group. If you are driven by helping stakeholders understand data, love when the latest direct-to-consumer marketing campaign results are available, and continually strive to challenge the "process status quo" to make workflows run as efficiently as possible – this is the role for you!
Success in this role will be achieved by:
1. Translating key business objectives into insight rich experiments that drive marketing ROI
2. Ensuring execution (i.e., list creation) is done efficiently and with excellence
3. Designing campaign results can be actioned by providing high value campaign reporting
4. Work in a consultative role to provide "value-added" insights in the form of analysis, interpretation and advice of campaign reporting
5. Your success will be predicated on your ability to forge strong partnerships, communicate effectively, deliver on-time, and continuously strive for increased efficiency.
ResponsibilitiesDesign/execute/measure high impact direct to consumer marketing experimentsContinuously improve campaign design and delivery by leveraging any and all analytical tools/techniques at your disposalExecute with excellenceManage your project pipeline to ensure agreed upon timelines can be metProactively provide analytical guidance to key stakeholders, based on deep understanding of the businesses, to understand and enhance marketing ROIMaintain a culture of risk management and control, supported by effective processes and sound infrastructure
Skill SetsFamiliarity with direct marketing principles (Predictive Models, Experiment Design, A/B testing, Sample Size calculations, Net Performance Measurements, etc.)Good knowledge of everyday banking products and transactions; Mutual Funds, Investment Products, Savings, GICs and registered banking productsTechnical and detail orientedKnowledge of how campaigns are created by leveraging customer data from internal data warehouses through the use of programming tools such as Unica and SASA project management mindset to help deliver on time to specificationsTeam player while able to work independentlyPragmatic decision maker blending a mix of intellect, experience and street smartsA profit driven mindset
Job Requirements
1-2+ years of relevant experience in a direct marketing, consulting, analytics, or agency-side role in financial services/telecom (or other high volume direct marketing industries)Significant experience with IBM Campaign (Unica)Knowledge of SQL and SAS; knowledge of databases and data structures; knowledge of vendors and file format requirementsExperience designing and executing successful direct marketing experiments, including channel testsFamiliarity with concepts such as "next best offer" and "always-on" an assetDegree in business, science, statistics, engineering, or other quantitative disciplineTrack record of delivering successful initiatives on time and on budget
Additional Information

We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.
