Title: Senior Business Analyst / Consultant
Description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.
At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.
To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com
Job Description
What You’ll Be Doing:
As a Senior Business Analyst in the Client Operations, Infrastructure Project Delivery team, you will:
Provide high impact analysis and thought leadership on strategic Projects and Programs involving Wealth and Capital Markets trading platforms and the Trade life cycle including Broadridge Systems
Be responsible for the end-to-end delivery of work packages and initiatives, including Analysis of Deliverables, Stakeholder engagement, Requirements documentation, Business Case and Benefits planning, Execution delivery, Risk Mitigation, Communication, Testing and People Change Management
At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. To successfully perform the work, details on your work arrangement (proportion of on-site and remote work) will be discussed at the time of your interview.
How You’ll Succeed:
Disciplined Analysis and Documentation– Work with Business Partners, Business Sponsor/Lead(s), Technology partners, Stakeholder groups, and project team members, to assess and document the current state and to formulate a target state and roadmap. Present detailed business requirements and process flows aligned with CIBC’s strategy and ensure all required artifacts are socialized and approved within required timelines. As assigned, participate in User acceptance and business implementation activities.
Strong Collaboration and Decision Support– Lead activities to help internal partners make informed and timely decisions related to scope, requirements, technology, organization, cost, schedule etc. Motivate and inspire your project teams as you work toward a common goal and successful outcomes. Build ongoing partnerships with clients and business partners.
Clear Communication – Develop compelling presentation materials to support working team and executive discussions and to articulate Workstream status. Maintain detailed risks, actions, issues and decision logs, track progress and schedule regular reviews and updates. Raise awareness and status of items through clear and timely communication.

Who You Are :
You can demonstrate knowledge of Trading systems: knowledge of Financial systems, front-office and back-office operations and Capital Markets/Trading Investment processes and platforms, specifically knowledge of Broadridge (BFS) Systems (2-5 years) and processes is an asset
You can demonstrate experience in: defining and reengineering processes, documenting business requirements, formulating test plans and people change management tactics. You have worked on large scale, multi-faceted programs and understand what it takes from a client, business and technology perspective to successfully define and deliver change within a fast paced and high-volume environment.
You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You are confident in your ability to formulate and communicate insights in an impactful way.
Communication and interpersonal skills are your strengths. You have exceptional interpersonal, collaboration and communication skills necessary to gain commitment and support for desired objectives and to deliver project artifacts.
You embrace and champion change. You will continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work to deliver your best.
Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work, and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.
You have a degree/diploma in Business, Arts, Science, Engineering, and/or a related field of study.
What CIBC Offers:
At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.
We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.
Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.
We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.
What you need to know
CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit
CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.

Toronto-55 Yonge Street, 5th

Title: Risk Analytics & Resilience Engineer / Analyst
Description:
Requisition ID: 59281
Job Category: Project Management
Location: Mississauga, ON, Canada
With over six decades of business and technical experience in the mining, energy, and infrastructure sectors, we see challenges evolving in every industry. We respond quickly with solutions that are smarter, more efficient, and innovative. We draw upon our 9,000 staff, with experience in over 150 countries, to challenge the status quo and create positive change for our clients, our employees, and the communities we serve.
Our Project Delivery Group (PDG) helps clients with world-class project delivery from studies to building assets, operating the assets, and developing efficiencies through our people, methodologies, governance, and systems. Our engineering and project management and construction disciplines ensure safe, efficient, and sustainable delivery of projects globally across the metals and mining, infrastructure, and energy sectors.
Risk Analytics and Resilience Engineer/Analyst
Major fields: All Engineering /Applied mathematics/Applied statistics.
The fourth industrial revolution has aﬀected most industries, including mining and metals, infrastructures, and energy. However, these major paradigm shifts did not improve the track record in predicting project outcomes, engineering systems reliabilities, and dealing with risks. The emergence of artificial intelligence, data analytics, and predictive models is where Hatch is determined to explore innovative ways to address such issues.
Hatch Risk Analytics and Resilience services are defined within the global Risk Management Practice to incorporate such computational techniques and practical understanding of risk response within Hatch’s risk management capabilities. Therefore, we are searching for Junior Risk Analytics and Resilience Engineer/Analyst with knowledge of data science and probabilistic methods, proficiency in computer programming, and a good understanding of engineering projects, systems, and operations’ resiliency. Specific expertise and interest in risk specialties are encouraged.
Position Summary
Reporting to the Global Director, Risk Management, the incumbent in this role will support Risk Analytics and Resilience services in creating probabilistic analytical tools and studies primarily focusing on application across all of Hatch’s business sectors, namely, mining and metals, energy and renewables (such as Nuclear), and infrastructures. This include a wide array of applications in projects, and operations.
The ideal candidate will be a team player and a keen learner who is curious to solve some of the world’s most complex problems.
Responsibilities
Support Hatch’s Risk Analytics and Resilience services in establishing primary capabilities, including but not limited to:
o Probabilistic Resilience Modeling
o Probabilistic Risk Assessment
o Risk Analytics Systems
o Virtual Risk Memory
Assist with the development of Probabilistic and Bayesian modeling of risk systems including Boolean logic such as fault trees, and event treesAssist with Operational risk modeling, assessment, and systemsAssist with reliability engineering studiesAssist with safety risk analysis and incident forecastingAssist with rare events probabilistic risk and impacts studies (e.g., failure, flood, fire)Assist with decision and value of information analysisModelling and reflecting on heavy-tailed risk events (aka., black swans)
Qualifications and Requirements
Minimum requirements
Must be working towards graduating in 2022 or recently graduated with a Bachelors of applied sciences or engineering degree from a recognized university in engineering, applied mathematics, or applied statistics.Working knowledge of Python and R programming languages and proven knowledge of data analysis, cleaning, and processing.Familiarity with machine learning, statistical learning, and probabilistic inference libraries.
Additional assets
Post-secondary degrees including masters and doctorates are encouraged to apply.Familiarity and proven industry or academic experience in the following subject matters:
o Bayesian statistics and mathematical formulation of probabilities.
o Natural Catastrophe Modeling and sophisticated Monte Carlo methods
o Developing Natural Language Processing (NLP) applications.
o Developing and applying Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML models in industrial (preferred) and business settings.
o Relational and graph database systems and data structures.
o User interface and dashboard development in Power BI, R, or Python.
o Simulation methodologies of discrete events and dynamic simulation.
o Qualitative and semi-quantitative risk studies such as FMEAs, LOPA, PHAs, and project risk workshops.
o Resilience, business continuity, incident response and disaster recovery concepts.
o Meetings and workshops facilitation, and public speaking.
Position can be located either in Mississauga, Vancouver, or Montreal.
Why join us?
Work with great people to make a difference
Collaborate on exciting projects to develop innovative solutions
Top employer
What we offer you?
Flexible work environment
Long term career development
Think globally, work locally
We're committed to fostering a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we operate and serve. Hatch is an Equal Opportunity Employer that considers applicants without regard to age, race, color, national origin, citizenship, religion, creed, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, or any other protected status. If you have any accommodation requirements, please let us know. We'll do our best to meet your needs in accordance with applicable local legislation.

Title: CPFR Analyst
Description:
The CPFR Analyst will drive Collaborative Planning, Forecasting and Replenishment with the external customer and their account team throughout the item life cycle in the total supply chain. This role will influence the customer's forecast, plan and execute events, and lead the customer supply relationship.
Utilizing customer systems and joint business targets, the CPFR will analyze data trends to support the business planning and execution processes through accurate forecasting. Should have a complete understanding of all of the customer's extensive systems and data of future/historical replenishment, sales, inventories to best drive best in class forecast accuracy and processes.
This role will be also responsible for building relationships with internal supply contacts including Retail Sales, Demand Planning, Logistics and several other functions.

What you'll do
Full ownership of customer KPIs, including in-stocks, fill rate, on time delivery and customer inventory levels, etc
 Drive collaborative planning, forecasting & replenishment throughout the Sales & Operational Planning Process (S&OP)
 Provide analysis for customer extensive systems & data of replenishment, sales inventories etc to best drive forecast
Possess a variety of information sources including customer specific data, marketplace data & input from National Account Managers to analyze business situations
Full ownership of the customer order management process
Take full ownership of the customer supply chain, continuous improvements and customer driven events.
• Deep understanding of customer's systems to align with external drivers to identify replenishment opportunities with keen focus on promotional and item life cycle events
.
• Utilize customer data and sales intelligence and validate and influence the forecast
• Communicate item forecast issues with Customer Replenishment and NAM teams
• Understand business drivers and brand strategies
• Flow inventory through supply chain to maximize shelf presence and service targets on a daily and strategic horizon
• Lead projects to drive store execution and reduce waste in the customer supply chain


Education and Competencies
Minimum 5 years of experience in front line customer relations
Prior experience in the CPFR role preferred
Understanding of warehousing, traffic, and inventory relative to order processing, distribution
and delivery or orders on time

Equality

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, disability or medical condition; colour, ethnicity, race, citizenship, and national origin; religion; pregnancy, family status and caring responsibilities; sexual orientation; sex, gender identity, gender expression, and transgender identity; protected veteran status; size or any other basis protected by appropriate law.

Title: Senior Business Analyst
Description:
Req Id: 361731
At Bell, we do more than build world-class networks, develop innovative services and create original multiplatform media content – we advance how Canadians connect with each other and the world.
If you’re ready to bring game-changing ideas to life and join a community that values, professional growth and employee wellness, we want you on the Bell team.
The Bell IT team uses emerging technologies, Agile and DevOps to design and build innovative solutions that enable Bell’s communications services for businesses and consumers. We’re looking for creative problem-solvers who are curious, collaborative and ready to be on the leading edge of technological transformation.
The RECL portfolio is a fast-paced and Agile delivery team within the Network and Technology Services organization. Our mandate is to work with Bell corporate stakeholders and technology partners to create and deliver solutions that provide new or enhanced capabilities that leverage Bell’s strategic IT assets. This team consists of Project Managers and Business Analysts who focus primarily on solution delivery in Bell’s SAP ERP (P50) and BW systems. The team’s primary business focus areas are Finance, Leasing, and Asset Accounting. This specific position focuses on all integrated processes that feed into areas of owned and leased capital equipment, leased Right of Use assets, and equipment records to support the asset sub-ledger.
Job Duties / Accountabilities:
The Business Analyst, supported by the Project Manager, is responsible for gathering and documenting the business requirements and then ensuring that the deliverables produced by the development effort conform to the business requirements.
Beyond the facilitation of the up-front business requirements and system requirements gathering sessions and resulting documentation, the role also involves driving the user acceptance testing process, including preparation of acceptance criteria, review of the test plans and scenarios, review of test results as well as taking responsibility for end-to-end testing. In specific instances, the Business Analyst also executes test cases to ensure system integrity.
The Business Analyst is also involved in key development and design deliverables, including (and not limited to) interface specifications, integration requirements, data schemas, and design documentation, and conversion strategies.
Contribute to project planning by developing the project charter documentation, including assisting with high-level plans, conducting feasibility analysis and developing the business case.
Collaborate with our Testing Centre of Excellence (TCOE) team to review test strategy, plans and scenarios, development of test scripts, and the review of test results
Partner with Enterprise Architects and technical primes in the creation of conceptual/architectural solutions.
Partner with the PMO/Project Manager to deliver highly successful projects. Joint activities include but not limited to:Organize stakeholder team meetings to identify and validate business and system requirements.
Work with application consultants and business stakeholders to craft solutions based on business requirements and system capabilitiesAbility to identify and quantify risks relevant to business and systems requirements, delivery timelines/quality & budget constraints.Ability to support multiple delivery projects concurrently throughout the development lifecycle.
Essential Skills / Competencies:
5-8 years in an IT Business Analyst role or a combination of education and leadership experience in Finance areas like Real estate management, Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, Project System, Plant Maintenance and/or Asset Accounting processes. Knowledge of BI/BW an asset.
Experience in collaborating with multiple and diverse stakeholders in the creation of end-to-end solutions, problem resolution and risk management.
Excellent verbal and written communication and computer proficiency with Microsoft Office tools (Word, Excel, Powerpoint, Visio)
Strong knowledge of project delivery methodology and best practices (e.g. AGILE & Waterfall)
Self-starter with the ability to take accountability for projects, identify feasible alternatives & create a strategy for analysis and resolution with little direction.
Attention to details with a focus on accuracy and commitment to meet deadlines.
Ability to analyze, extract, integrate, conceptualize and apply ideas, processes and information to create solutions in a constantly changing technological and business environment.
Ability to react quickly to changing issues and priorities with the ability to work under pressure and meet constantly changing timelines
Strong customer advocacy through the clear definition of the business problem (s) to be solved as well as the documentation of the user acceptance criteria, in partnership with client stakeholders.
Critical Qualifications /Competencies:
Familiarity or expertise in Real estate management, Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, Project System, Plant Maintenance and/or Asset Accounting
Post secondary degree with a Business or IT focus, or equivalent experience
Business Analyst training and/or certification or equivalent experience in related field
Value-Added competencies / Experience
CPA, CGA or CMA
Trained / experience in Agile Delivery
Exposure / delivery experience with S4 Hana
Working Conditions:
Available to work occasional weekends and evenings to meet deadlines and support system launches
Occasional travel in support of project delivery work

Title: Business Operations Analyst
Description:
What You'll Do:
This is an excellent opportunity for you to demonstrate COGS management through savings and Gross Margin improvement for Cloud and Network Security organization. Among other things, your focus will be to drive accurate COGS forecast, cost optimization initiatives and improving operational velocity for strategic projects.

Responsibilities Include: Drive forecasting, reporting and variance analysis for cloud security COGS. Ability to understand and analyze the moving pieces of forecast model and drive the process end-to-end with minimal guidance. Ability to provide suggestions on efficiencies based on data driven models. Ability to prepare and maintain depreciation schedule for all capex purchases. Utilize various financial tools including Business Objects, Essbase (Fetch), Hyperion, and Tableau Highly analytical thinker who leans towards structure and process. You are an effective communicator and analyst, while continuing to focus on learning and listening. You have a strong attention for details and are self-motivated to research outliers and unknowns. Expertise in Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Access) Proficient in Cisco/Financial Applications: FinABC, Systems Integrator, Hyperion, Business Objects & Oracle, iproc, Smartbuy
Minimum Requirements Bachelor’s degree – CPA preferred 2-5 years of related work experience (finance, accounting, operations etc.) Skills to include Essbase, Business Objects, Advanced Excel skills and PowerPoint for executive presentations. Experience working with senior management and ability to inspire change and challenge decision-making where necessary Excellent interpersonal skills with confidence and strength to challenge the status quo Excellent time management and planning skills with the ability to shift priorities in a highly dynamic environment. Strong quantitative analysis, modeling, and logical reasoning skills

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
Business Analyst - ( 22000191 )
Description
Grow with the best. Join a smart, innovative, and inspired team that strives for growth and operational excellence. Bringing together individuals with diverse backgrounds, talents, and expertise, our 25,000 team members in over 400 locations worldwide are vital to making our Company stronger.
As data continues to grow in size and complexity, we need more robust tools to help clients manage, understand, and interact with it. Our focus centers around developing strategy alongside client needs and using software as a platform to deliver value and centralize insights across services. Software and digital strategy are the solutions that bridge the data to knowledge gap to deliver insights and analytics for clients to stay on top of the information that matters most and ultimately drive efficiencies in the operations of their assets.
Our shared focus is to combine digital transformation, modern visualizations, user experience design, data contextualization, and narrative science to help clients reach their full potential. Stantec is ranked No. 10 on the Top 150 Global Design Firms list by Engineering News-Record (ENR) and No. 10 on the Top 300 Architecture Firms list by Architectural Record, both leading industry publications. We want our digital practice to enter this upper echelon as well and it is our vision within the Water business line to increase awareness of Stantec as a global leader for digital solutions.
Your Opportunity
We are seeking a Business Analyst to increase our capacity in product development and delivery. Stantec’s Digital Practice in our Water business line works closely with account managers and clients to develop and deploy top tier digital solutions. This work includes gathering requirements, developing user stories, and managing agile product development. Our goal is to transform the water industry with best-in-class digital solutions. These solutions cover the complete project and water lifecycle, from planning to operations, and watershed management to wastewater treatment. Frequently they extend to asset management and regulatory compliance.
Stantec’s Digital Practice in our Water business line works closely with product owners and development leads to develop solutions with top tier information access and analytics. This journey includes identifying, defining, developing, delivering, and supporting those products. This role is primarily focused on the product development stage of that journey.
This role will include working with multiple software development teams. Collaboration with other Digital Practice leadership, product owners, and development teams is anticipated. The ideal candidate will have experience as a business analyst and managing development as an agile lead.
Your Key Responsibilities
Do: Project Delivery
Scrum master experience and well versed in agile / scrum ceremonies.
History of successfully working as a business analyst in an agile environment.
Gather critical information from meetings with stakeholders and be able to create meaningful requirements and document thoroughly.
Evaluate business processes, elicit requirements, and perform requirements analysis.
Collaborate with UX designers during the interface design stage.
Extremely organized and be able to develop a ground structure of existing requirements.
Be able to develop a solid requirements structure, document requirements, acceptance criteria and review test cases for testing team.
Ensure that solutions/requirements meet the business needs and are in alignment with system constraints.
Perform quality assurance testing and help business team in performing user acceptance testing as required.
Be able to produce required documentation for releases, create change proposals, and provide an organized structure.
Lead: Agile Product Development
Ability to lead and manage all aspects of agile / scrum product development life cycles
Able to negotiate with project sponsors when roadblocks occur during development
Support and educate the Project Sponsor , especially on grooming and maintain the product backlog.
Serve as a liaison between stakeholders and the technical team.
Review team’s work and provide technical guidance on development approach and challenges
Conduct work in a safe manner and promote health and safety within the office and outside of the office while visiting clients and job sites.
Effectively challenge and inspire staff to work together (even if we are apart) within our Water Digital Solutions business and being accessible to our staff.
Innovate: Develop and Deploy Innovative Solutions
Ability to lead and collaborate in project team setting and to engage in creative and critical thought.
Recommend solutions by identifying problems and understand the business problem & need.
You will be receiving direction from Digital Practice leadership in various locations and working with teams in remote locations.
Qualifications
Capabilities and Credentials
Ability to communicate complex technical concepts in writing and verbally.
Possess strong interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal, along with the ability to prioritize multiple tasks.
Excellent documentation skills and analytical/critical thinking
Candidates must be well organized, self-motivated, and enjoy finding solutions to problems.
This role may require some travel to attend meetings with clients and dev teams.
Proven experience with application development, quality assurance, and testing methodology.
Experience with environmental compliance and built infrastructure, including real time data, operational technologies, and regulatory compliance.
Understanding of technology areas like API, Swagger, Postman
Experience with Jura, Microsoft Azure or AWS cloud-based application development and deployment. Experience with Microsoft SQL is a plus.
Experience in working with clients to ensure satisfaction with deployed products.
Experience overseeing and directing support of digital products.
Familiar with the ITIL framework
Familiar with Project Management Institute Standards
Can work well in a distributed team environment without direct supervision.
Technology knowledge and understanding of IT industry best practices.
Experience working in a consultant role is preferred.
Education and Experience
Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution.
Minimum of 3 years of experience in software development performing requirements gathering, elaboration, story creation, acceptance validation, and agile management of teams.
Typical office environment working with computers and remaining sedentary for long periods of time. Field work may include exposure to the elements including inclement weather.
This description is not a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that may be required of the employee and other duties, responsibilities and activities may be assigned or may be changed at any time with or without notice.
Stantec is a place where the best and brightest come to build on each other’s talents, do exciting work, and make an impact on the world around us. Join us and redefine your personal best.

Other Locations : Canada

Title: Central Planning Analyst
Description:
Company Introduction:
T&T Supermarket Inc. was found in 1993 with two stores in BC. Since then, it has expanded rapidly and is now Canada’s largest Asian supermarket chain with 29 stores across the country: 13 in BC, 6 in Alberta, and 10 in Ontario. The Company’s continuous expansion is bringing forward its first-ever store in Montreal, Quebec and 3 more new stores in BC, Alberta, and Ontario, all set to open in 2022/2023.
The Role:
Reporting to the Manager, Central Planning the Central Planning Analyst provides assistance and support to the team by analyzing data and generating reports using database management skills, coordinating with different parties internally and following up on various projects as required.
Major Responsibilities:
Review to analyze monthly sales/inventory history
Purchasing to replenish stock in timely manner
Manage vendors and work with shipping teams to ensure products arrival on time
Meet replenishment KPIs and maintain purchasing records, prepares summary statistical analysis
Monitor forecasting errors and improve forecast accuracies
Provide feedback on capacity risks and supply issues to merchants and planning partners where necessary
Knowledge, Skills and Ability Requirements:
A bachelor’s degree in Statistic, Mathematic, or other relate disciplines
Minimum 1-years’ experience in purchasing / demand forecasting
Ability to collaborate with multiple stakeholders, taking initiative and managing multiple priorities in a rapidly changing environment
Analytical thinking and has ability to identify alternatives to solve problems
Ability to communicate effectively across all levels of the organization and with external stakeholders
Proficient in Microsoft Office, including Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook etc.
Food industry experience is an asset
Data analysis with power BI is an asset
Strong written and verbal communication skills in English
Ability to communicate in Chinese (Cantonese and/or Mandarin) is an asset
Benefit
Quarterly discretionary bonus
Life/AD&D insurance
Extended health/dental/vision care
Retirement benefit
Paid annual/sick/marriage/bereavement leave
Subsidized staff meal
In-store staff purchase discount
Work Hours
 5-day work week (Monday to Friday), 9:00am – 5:30pm
Safety Statement

Safety continues to be T&T Supermarket’s top priority. We’ve established health and safety policies and measures to ensure our working environment is as safe as possible.

Title: Business Systems Analyst

Your main tasks will include analyzing an organization's efficiency by studying its needs, its business model, its workflows, and its technological systems.
