Managing competing resources and priorities.Serving as a liaison between stakeholders and users.Monitoring deliverables and ensuring timely completion of projects.Facilitating a successful release handover.· Validate resource requirements and develop cost estimate models.Evaluating risks and predicting potential problems.Evaluating Key Performance Indicators.Acquiring knowledge of products or services provided by the business.Incorporating user suggestions into projects.Requirements/Skills: A bachelor’s degree in business or related field or an MBA. A minimum of 5 years’ experience in business analysis or a related field.Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills.The ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them to determine acceptable solutions.Advanced technical skills.Information technology, Statistics, Data Analysis Reporting, Business Model Analysis, Process Design, Systems Analysis, Project Management, Business, Finance, MarketingExcellent documentation skills. Experience creating detailed reports and giving presentations.A track record of following through on commitments.Excellent planning, organizational, and time management skills.Experience leading and developing top performing teams.A history of leading and supporting successful projects.Microsoft Access and/or SQL experience strongly preferred.Ability to impact operations and effect change without being confrontational.Detail oriented, analytical and inquisitive.Ability to work independently and with others.Extremely organized with strong time-management skillsJob Type: Full-time

Title: Director, Business Intelligence and Analytics - OH North
Description:
Want to make a difference in your career? Consider this opportunity
Reporting to the Vice President, Performance, Accountability and Funding Allocation the Director, Business Intelligence and Analytics within the North Region will be responsible for advancing the development, implementation and communication of frameworks for population health needs assessments (including health equity planning, capacity planning and business plans), health system monitoring and performance measurement tools, and evaluation approaches to monitor and report on the performance of strategies that support population health management for the North Region. The Director is also responsible for providing guidance in the management and reporting of key results across Ontario Health North Region, providing strategic advice to senior leadership in the development of evidence-based performance indicators, and providing risk mitigation strategies which will inform health system funding allocations within Ontario Health North Region and provincial programs. The Director will lead the translation of complex information using analytical techniques, complex data collection, survey instruments, research methods, software applications and statistical analytics into meaningful analysis to inform regional and provincial priorities and recommend actions aimed at addressing system performance issues.
Please be advised that the scope of this role is regional in nature and therefore, will focus on the particular needs of Ontario Health North Region.
Here is what you will be doing:
Lead the development and implementation of standardized performance frameworks and enabling technologies, including dashboards, scorecards and key performance indicators for evaluating the success of regional initiatives and sustaining a high performing health care system
Translate complex information using analytical techniques and complex data collection to inform strategic priorities and support solutions, recommendations and actions aimed at addressing health system and performance issues
Prepare reports and analysis for a variety of audiences, including the Chief Regional Officer, Regional Leadership Team, Ontario Health North Region portfolios, work groups, health service providers, Ontario Health Teams and other stakeholders.
Aligning the North Region data & analytics operations and business processes with Ontario Health’s Data and Analytic Strategy and Operating Model
Work closely with Ontario Health North Region planning portfolios and Ontario Health Teams to support an understanding of population health management and future planning of health needs using a health equity approach
Design and implement evaluation models and approaches to determine the effectiveness of the health care strategy and the impact on the health care system and users of the system
Provide leadership in the development, implementation and communication of innovative frameworks for all population health needs assessments, performance measurements, and evaluation requirements to monitor and report on the performance, quality and effectiveness of strategies that support population health management for the North Region using a health equity approach
Provide leadership, expertise and advice on needs assessment, identifying health inequities, performance measurement and accountability to inform the planning of equitable and sustainable health system improvements throughout the North Region
Lead the development of health system analytics that supports a population health approach to planning and executing programs, policies, and interventions across the health care system and its non-health partners including community and social services, research advisors and partnerships, municipal and local government, and local public health units
Work in a close partnership with the System Strategy, Planning, Design and Implementation portfolio to advance regional health system goals
Provide the direction and support required to ensure initiatives are in alignment with provincial and local strategic priorities
Work closely with North Region providers to align work with provincial, North Region and Ontario Health initiatives
Leads regular team meetings to set goals and monitor department performance. Develops supports and evaluates the performance of the team members, assigns work and projects, monitors and adjusts workloads as required.
Accountable for hiring, providing training and development, evaluating performance, and in consultation with HR/OD makes decisions re discipline or termination and plans for appropriate staff levels for the department.
Conducts performance appraisals and provides support and direction to help employees achieve their objectives.
Other duties as assigned
Here is what you will need to be successful:
Education and Experience
Post-secondary or Masters degree in, health informatics, statistics, economics, health administration, epidemiology, business administration or equivalent education/experience
5-10 years of relevant experience with at least 3 years at a management level.
5 years' work experience in the public or private sector in a health care sector
Solid background in integrating large, complex initiatives in a changing environment.
Solid background in managing multi-functional teams, in support of achieving overarching corporate objectives.
Extensive experience with tools such as SAS, Access, PowerBI, Tableau, Sharepoint, SQL
Proficiency with other Microsoft Office tools including Excel, Word and Powerpoint,
Exposure to advanced Excel functionality such as macros and pivot tables
Knowledge and Skills
Strong knowledge of data architectural techniques such as enterprise data warehouse, data federation, hub and spoke architecture
Expert knowledge of health related data and databases, health care reporting requirements, statistical/analytic software, business intelligence tools, data manipulation, reporting and visualization
Demonstrated experience in developing data models to support static and ad-hoc reports, analytics and research, dashboards, data mining, trending, creation of key performance indicators
Experience using healthcare and demographic datasets and standards, including CIHI (DAD, NACRS, CCRS, NRS), Intellihealth and Statistics Canada census
Understanding of current and emerging theories, principles, strategies, frameworks, methods, applications, best practices and techniques used in developing and building complex analytical models and their application in health system and population health domains
In-depth knowledge of local health issues, priorities and needs while recognizing the broader trends in health care policy and system development.
Extensive experience in building and maintaining strong stakeholder relationships
Demonstrated ability to facilitate meetings and mediate among stakeholder groups and individuals to solicit understanding and support
Proven ability to build consensus and lead projects with multiple stakeholders to achieve sustainable system wide change
Highly developed communication skills, both verbally and written. The ability to provide and obtain information of a complex, technical or sensitive nature effectively, clearly, concisely and logically, and at an appropriate level and in an appropriate format is required.
Demonstrated experience in supporting transformation using data as an enabler to facilitate strategic thinking and planning
Demonstrated knowledge of change management principles
Excellent abilities to analyze and interpret complex information to deliver a solution that meets business needs including prioritization
Experience in effective strategic planning, budgeting, research, resource allocation, analytics and policy processes
Demonstrated ability to effectively contribute to and help motivates teams by mentoring and training, setting priorities, ensuring quality of work
Comfortable working in a dynamic and fast-pace environment
French language is an asset
Employment Type: Full Time Permanent
Employment Location: OH North - Sudbury, North Bay, Thunder Bay, Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario (currently virtual; subject to change)
All applicants must be a resident of Ontario to be considered for roles at Ontario Health.
Internal Application Deadline Date: April 14, 2022
Note: As part of the initial recruitment screening process, Applicants must confirm that they are Fully Vaccinated against COVID-19. If Applicants are not Fully Vaccinated, they will be asked to identify any accommodation needs pursuant to a protected ground under the Code. If no such accommodation is identified, the Applicant will not be eligible to proceed through the recruitment process.

Title: Project Manager / Business Analyst
Description:
Tundra Technical Solutions has built a safe and open community of talented women to help advocate for those looking to get ahead in their science, technology, engineering, math, and data careers. As a LinkedIn Diversity Champion, Tundra is a staffing firm that provides equal opportunities, career advice, and mentorship in the workplace for those who apply and join our community! Apply now to be first in line for equitable contract and full-time opportunities with the world’s most recognizable brands in the STEM industries. We can’t wait to introduce you to our clients.
Collaborating with the Manager of Enterprise Applications Management acting as Decommissioning Program Lead, the Project Manager/Senior Business Analyst (herein referred to as “Snr PM/BA Decomm”) will assist in developing an overall Decommissioning Practice. This will include primarily coordinating the efforts of a selected consulting partner and also collaborating closely with key customers to understand immediate and long-term requirements, Digital Systems teams such as data architecture and database administrators, technical and application management teams, enterprise architecture team members, infrastructure teams, QA and PMO teams to update project delivery methodology.
Key Requirements
10 years of senior project/program management experience with IT / technology projects and programs.
2 to 3 years of solution delivery using Agile methodology, tools, and techniques.
5 years of application management/solution delivery experience ideally with ERP-type implementations.
Minimum of 5 years of business analysis experience.
Experience leading a scaled program with multiple inter-dependencies across various teams in large organizations.
Excellent problem-solving, interpersonal, and analytical skills, with the ability to coach and mentor.
5 years of experience leading large consulting partner firms.
Strong communication skills at all levels within large organizations, ability to develop positive relationships with key partners, ability to prepare and deliver effective presentations and meaningful project/program documentation, ability to propagate information promptly, clearly, and unambiguously.
Key Accountabilities
Data analysis and data architecture skills
Data and information governance
Artificial Intelligence (AI), Business Intelligence (BI), Machine Learning (ML)
Industry experience: Mining or mechanical asset-intensive industry
Application experience: ERP systems, financial systems, Asset management systems, Maintenance management systems,
Strong business acumen,
A degree or diploma in either business or information systems would be beneficial.
Formal Scrum or Agile training (e.g. SAFe® Scrum Master (or Advanced Scrum Master), Certified Scrum Practitioner (CPS), Professional Scrum Master (PSM1 or PSM2) or Certified Scrum Coach (CSC))
Experienced in working with geographically dispersed partners and development teams, in offices or the field
Knowledge and awareness of Cloud (IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS) as well as a solid grasp of DevOps (preferably MS Azure),
Experience with Cloud-based web application development (preferably on the Azure platform)
Taking direction from key partners and Decommissioning Program Lead coordinates and facilitates the efforts towards developing an effective Decommissioning Framework / Practice.
Lead, facilitate and coordinate efforts of the selected consulting partner,
Oversee, coordinate and lead all Teck team resources,
Standard business analysis responsibilities as they relate to any solution delivery, including but not limited to:
Requirements definition, Workshop Facilitation, JAD Sessions as required
Using Agile, the definition of Epics, Features, and User Stories where appropriate
Business process mapping, improvement, and data requirements definition
Development of test plans, test cases, and the execution of test plans
Organizational readiness
Deliver industry-standard project management through the application of project management best practices,
Engage partners by raising impediments, validating risk, and communicating status and performance metrics,
Ensure teams actions are aligned with the projects goals/vision
Ensure effective project planning, monitoring, and execution,
Guide teams to achieve key milestones, on time, on quality, and within the scope
Provide industry-standard project governance, including regular relevant project monitoring and status reporting,
Look for ways to strengthen teams' understanding of Agile/Scrum concepts and principles
Facilitate Agile Value Increment Planning (VIP). Retrospectives
Ensure Scrum and Sprint practices are used as appropriate across teams
Agile Backlog grooming
Bringing transparency to Business and IT organizations about the development and growing trust
Identify trade-offs between short and long terms benefits to drive a shared vision between and across the team and key partners
Be a courageous safety leader, enforce and sponsor safety and environmental rules and procedures,

Title: Senior Business Systems Analyst (Remote, Americas)
Description:
Company Description
Shopify is a leading global commerce company, providing trusted tools to start, grow, market, and manage a retail business of any size. Shopify makes commerce better for everyone with a platform and services that are engineered for reliability, while delivering a better shopping experience for consumers everywhere. Shopify powers millions of businesses in more than 175 countries and is trusted by brands such as Allbirds, Gymshark, PepsiCo, Staples, and many more.

Job Description
Shopify Support is a team of over 1500 hard-working and dedicated individuals committed to providing a high quality service that enables Merchants all over the world to fulfill their entrepreneurial dreams. Our mission is to make commerce better for everyone and we are constantly innovating how to do this more effectively.
The Support Revenue Operations team is an innovative cross-functional team that connects Shopify+Merchants+Support+Revenue through thoughtful systems and insights that drive outcomes for our business.
About the Role:
The Senior Business Systems Analyst will have a keen eye on the data and metrics that connect our support tooling. They will be a leader on the team responsible to gather insightful data, create data informed strategies, and support the research, design, and implementation of Support’s evolving business systems. The Senior Business Analyst will help Support Revenue Operations drive success through reporting and data analytics that define and measure the success of initiatives and tooling implementation.
This role requires someone that sees the big picture and can effectively liaison between data & analytics teams. Support Revenue Operations is a new implementation of an existing craft and as such educating stakeholders and getting executive buy-in will be fundamental skills to have in addition to a broad technical acumen.
What you will be doing:
Responsible for the data gathering and analytics that are intertwined with Support and Revenue teams tooling.
Support the Revenue Operations team with researching, scoping, and measuring the impact of tooling and process improvements.
Work with the Data and Analytics teams to create insightful data dashboards, visualizations, and validate expected outcomes.
Manage day-to-day Revenue Operations reporting activities to help Support leadership drive priority business outcomes through data insights.
Establish and maintain Revenue Operations and Support tooling KPI’s and driving action items to course correct as necessary.
Creation of Salesforce dashboards and reporting.
Balance strategy and execution to achieve outcomes, by understanding both the big picture as well as the smallest details.
Develop internal networks to cultivate an environment of cross-collaboration both within Support and with other stakeholders and teams.
Consider the impact on merchants, employees, and Shopify, and weigh all 3 in analysis and decision making.
Proactively identify areas of focus and risks and remove roadblocks for the team.

Qualifications
Experience and skills that are important for success in this role:
4+ Years of Experience in Business Analytics or Revenue Operations for a SAAS business.
Advanced knowledge of Excel, Google Sheets, experience with Mode, Tableau or other data visualization tools, Basic SQL, and Github.
Deep understanding of data engineering, statistical methods, data analytics and reporting.
Experience designing data structures to ensure consistent and reliable data collection / reporting capability.
Exceptional data-storytelling skills and ability to conceptualize complex metrics and ideas for various audiences.
Experience working in Sales, Marketing, or Support operations.
Strong aptitude for problem solving.
Excellent interpersonal and collaboration skills - you are able to work effectively with and influence a diverse group of stakeholders.
Practical experience designing, building, and presenting reporting efforts surrounding Go-To-Market performance.
Grit: you are conscientious, resilient, and dedicated to achieving excellence and driving results.
Nice to haves:
Effective public speaker
Experience with remote working
Experience in Marketing, Support or Sales operations
Effective working in SQL
Salesforce certification(s)
Additional Information
We know that applying to a new role takes a lot of work and we truly value your time. We are looking forward to reading your application!
At Shopify, we are committed to building and fostering an environment where our employees feel included, valued, and heard. Our belief is that a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion enables us to truly make commerce better for everyone. We strongly encourage applications from Indigenous peoples, racialized people, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities and/or people with intersectional identities.
Shopify is now permanently remote, and we’re working towards a future that is digital by design. That location you see above? Consider it merely an example of hundreds of potential locations Shopify is hiring. Learn more here: https://www.shopify.com/careers/work-anywhere
Our belief is that a strong commitment to diversity & inclusion enables us to truly make commerce better for everyone. We encourage applications from Indigenous peoples, racialized people, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities, and/or people with intersectional identities. Please take a look at our Sustainability Reports to learn more about Shopify’s commitments to our communities, and our planet.
At Shopify, we understand that experience comes in many forms. We’re dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team - so if your experience is this close to what we’re looking for, please consider applying.

Title: Land and Permits Interface Analyst, Expansion Project
Description:
Date: Apr 8, 2022
Location: Burnaby, British Columbia, Canada
Company: Trans Mountain
The Trans Mountain Expansion Project will provide increased capacity to support Canadian crude oil production growth and ensure access to global energy markets. The largest project in the pipeline’s history, it involves installing approximately 980 kilometres of new pipeline, as well as new and modified facilities.


As a Land and Permit Interface Analyst with Trans Mountain, you’ll have the opportunity to work on our major project team, with a progressive and fast-paced group of Land and Permitting professionals. This team is working to deliver the required land and permit access for construction. This position is based in our Burnaby office.
Key Responsibilities
Analyze requirements for land, permits and project schedules, to determine priorities and alignment with land and permit acquisition teams.
Coordinate with engineering and survey teams to acquire land, crossings, and road lists and drawings in order to expedite land and permits delivery.
Produce readiness reports as required for discrete construction packages and spreads.
Track actions, issues, risks and dependencies associated with land and permits delivery.
Provide an interface with Project Management and General Contractors to align project requirements with land and permits delivery.
Track commitments and conditions derived from agreements and permits to ensure compliance.
Ensure all documentation is available to the General Contractor through the Construction Binder.
Ensure the Line Lists are complete and representative of land and permits delivery.
Maintain Permitting Registers of all permits, licenses, notifications, approvals, registrations and other authorizations.
Tracking Permit status (under preparation, lodged, obtained), key milestone dates and approval conditions.
Maintaining copies of applications, supplementary information and granted permits on the Projects document management system.
Provision of weekly, monthly, and ad hoc reports relating to land and permits delivery.
Support the project management and land/permits leadership in understanding of data and data analysis.

Qualifications and Professional Experience
Undergraduate degree in Business, Engineering, Computer Science, or similar field, preferred.
3-6 years of project related experience.
Excellent Microsoft Excel skills.
Analytical mindset with demonstrated critical thinking and problem-solving skills as well as the ability to adapt to changing priorities and deadlines. Approaches challenges with mental tenacity and ability to overcome resistance and competing priorities.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Strong organization skills.
Ability to attend to detail and work in a time-conscious and time-effective manner.

In the Fall of 2021, the Government of Canada expressed its expectation that all federally owned or regulated companies (including Trans Mountain) implement polices to ensure that all employees are fully vaccinated against COVID-19.

In order to be considered as a candidate for a position with Trans Mountain, you must be fully vaccinated or eligible for accommodation based on a certified medical contraindication, religion, or another prohibited ground for discrimination as defined under the Canadian Human Rights Act or applicable human rights legislation.
We Build Careers and Pipelines That Last
Our story is about determination, resourcefulness and resilience. It’s about charting our own course, finding innovative solutions to challenging problems and doing the right thing. It was true when Trans Mountain became a company in 1951 and it’s just as true today. We welcome new members to our team that embrace the qualities in our story, that thrive on the new path and directions we take. Our culture is one of care and taking our responsibilities seriously. If you would like to contribute to our culture, then join our journey.

A Rewarding Opportunity. We offer:
A place to share a sense of purpose and build relationships.
Meaningful work that makes a difference.
An opportunity within the Canadian energy industry.

In keeping with Trans Mountain’s commitment to maximize benefits for communities, priority will be given to qualified candidates from Indigenous, local and regional communities along the Trans Mountain existing, and expansion, pipeline corridor.

In Alberta, the existing pipeline system spans the traditional territories of Treaty 6, 7 and 8, and the Métis Nation of Alberta (Zone 4).

In British Columbia, the system crosses the traditional territories of numerous First Nations that are affiliated with the Secwepemc, Dakelh (Carrier), Nlaka'pamux, Syilx/Okanagan, Interior and Coast Salish, Stó:lo, as well as the Métis.
Trans Mountain also operates through 15 First Nation Reserves located within the region spanning the BC interior through Fraser Valley.

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
Trans Mountain is committed to supporting diversity and individual differences. The diverse viewpoints and cultural knowledge that our employees bring to work enrich our organization’s collective cultural understanding, which is reflected in the work we do every day. Trans Mountain welcomes new team members from traditionally underrepresented groups, including women, Indigenous Peoples, members of visible minorities and persons with disabilities.

Title: Sr Analyst, Business Systems - Guidewire Claims Center
Description:
Sr Analyst, Business Systems - Guidewire Claims Center
Job ID : 5624
Category : Technology Solutions
Brand : Definity
Regular/Temporary : Regular
Fulltime/Parttime : Full Time
Location : Toronto, Canada
Definity includes some of Canada’s most long-standing and innovative insurance brands, including Economical Insurance, Sonnet Insurance, Family Insurance Solutions, and Petline Insurance. With strong roots that date back to 1871, we’ve grown to become a digital leader in the insurance industry. We’re proud to help our clients and communities adapt and thrive in a world of constant change.

Our promise to you: It’s better here. Why? Because we CARE, and we provide an employee experience that’s collaborative, ambitious, rewarding, and empowering.

Our ambition is to be one of Canada’s leading and most innovative P&C insurers. Come be a part of our journey, and love what you do.
What can you expect in this role?
Provide estimation of delivery work necessary to realize requirements through development lifecycle
Elicit, analyze, specify and communicate functional and non-functional business, system and implementation requirements
Write concise User Stories which include precise acceptance Criteria, accurate Specifications by Example and testable Functional Scenarios
Facilitate meetings / working sessions with stakeholders to document, review and approve requirements
Ensure the requirements are unambiguous and understandable by both business users and solution delivery teams
Validate the correctness of delivered requirements in advance of the active business owner reviewing completed work
Assist the testing team in defining testing scenarios (including data, acceptance criteria, rules, etc.) for each requirement that is going to be delivered during an iteration
Collaborate with Product Owner and Delivery Team to define and deliver the project vision
Collaborate with the Scrum Master/Project Manager and the team to develop and maintain the project Kanban/Product backlog, and develop the Iteration/Sprint Plan and Release plan
Facilitate meetings (e.g., Stand-ups, Retrospectives, Acceptance Review, etc.), as required
Supports the identification and resolution of Risks / Issues / Blockers in collaboration with the project team
Collaborate with Product Owner, Technical Lead, and Test Analyst on maintenance projects to identify sets of cohesive problems (improvement themes) for development
Support multiple concurrent projects
Collaborate with Scrum team on work prioritization
Perform Root Cause Analysis
What do you bring to the role?
Self-starter who can set own priorities and can work independently with little guidance
A willing and open attitude to learn and grow
Flexible in your work approach to meet the needs of a diverse and changing work environment
Strong written and verbal communication skills, presentation and facilitation skills
Ability to influence and effectively negotiate with stakeholders
Analytical skills to visualize, articulate, and solve problems and concepts
Post-secondary education or equivalent industry experience
5+ years’ experience as a Business Systems Analyst or Business Analyst
Experience in P&C insurance
Strong experience with policy administration systems. Experience with Guidewire PolicyCenter is strongly preferred.
Strong Interpersonal, communication and collaboration skills – confidence and ability to work with internal team and external vendor partners seamlessly
Agile background – stories, elaboration, requirement methods
Jira/Confluence
Experience with the following systems is considered an asset: Guidewire ClaimCenter, Guidewire BillingCenter
Business analysis, Lean Six Sigma, Agile certifications are considered an asset: CCBA, IIBA-ACC, Lean SIx Sigma Yellow Belt or higher, CSM, CSPO
Proficiency with Microsoft Visio
Skills in data analysis with MS Excel or other analysis tools
We also take potential into consideration. If you don’t have this exact experience, but you know you have what it takes, be sure to give us more insight through your application and cover letter.
Go ahead and expect a lot — you deserve it, and we’ve got it:
Hybrid work schedule for most roles
Company share ownership program
Pension and savings programs, with company-matched RRSP contributions
Paid volunteer days and company matching on charitable donations
Educational resources, tuition assistance, and paid time off to study for exams
Focus on inclusion with employee groups, support for gender affirmation surgery, access to BIPOC counsellors, access to programs for working parents
Wellness and recognition programs
Discounts on products and services
Our inclusive work environment welcomes diversity and supports accessibility. If you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process, please let us know by contacting: [email protected]
Background checks
This role requires successful clearance of a background check (including criminal checks and leadership references).

Title: NA
Description: NA

Title: Student Experience Analyst
Description:
Land Acknowledgement
George Brown College is located on the traditional territory of the Mississaugas of the Credit First Nation and other Indigenous peoples who have lived here over time. We are grateful to share this land as treaty people who learn, work, and live in the community with each other.
At George Brown College, we have established a reputation for equipping our students with the skills, industry experience and credentials to pursue the careers of their choice. As employees, we are committed to creating an enriching learning community for our students, delivering excellence in what we do, holding ourselves accountable for our work and demonstrating diversity and respect for one another.
What responsibilities will you have in this role?
Develops and compiles process documentation by creating detailed and overview process maps for the division.
Recommends changes to operational policies, procedures and processes and consulting with relevant subject matter experts and management to implement changes.
Analyzes data to support Key Service Indicators as set out for the division.
Creates and maintains manuals and online staff training materials or online training modules resulting from changes.
Gathers data using one of the following methods: design and administering surveys; organizing and facilitating focus groups; one-on-one or group interviews with students or staff as needed.
Improves current data collection activities in service areas that will provide greater insight to impacts on student success retention rates.
Develops surveys and reporting for service feedback and student engagement for the Division using Campus Labs or other tool.
Provides systems support and administration for applications managed by the Contact Centre and Student Success Hubs.
Troubleshoots technical support for Contact Centre team relating to the access and functionality of any of our applications.
Monitors and maintains all aspects of the Knowledgebase system to ensure functionality and performance is optimized.
Collaborates with internal stakeholders and Knowledgebase vendor to implement any new features to increase utilization for self-service.
Co-ordinates business requirements with other project team members to ensure our student experience goals are being met as it may relate to future projects or upgrades: knowledgebase, CRM, chatbot, live chat, and Contact Centre software and agent applications.
Develops and tests IVR scripts for outbound call campaigns and enhancements for the Contact Centre or other stakeholders.
Works collaboratively with ITS and external service providers in regards to software, databases and software development and troubleshooting.
Assesses new technology for use in the Student Success Division and the Student Success Hub and provide recommendations to management for its appropriate usability or the business area.
Contributes to the development of project briefs and detailed project plans.
Participates in departmental and college wide projects related to student service and enhancing the student experience.
Provides trend analysis, student service data and technical expertise to the project team.
Other duties as assigned.
What qualifications do you need for this role?
Three-year diploma or degree or equivalent from a recognized post-secondary institution in Information systems, statistics, computer sciences, business administration.
Current CompTIA A+ Plus Certification (industry standard exam) is required.
Minimum five (5) years experience related to information systems in an analyst position or similar information processing environment.
Advanced knowledge and experience using Adobe Creative Tools and MS Office; programming includes Java, HTML and CSS.
Technical knowledge to diagnose and resolve end user devices (computers and printers) and standard software issues correctly and quickly.
Experience providing technical support in the diagnosis and resolution of all types of recurrent and uncommon problems associated with the Customer Flow Management system.
Scripting skills for Cisco IVR outbound call campaigns.
Prior Business analysis experience gathering, documenting, and communicating stakeholder requirements to effectively recommend and evaluate solutions and provide quality assurance.
Experience with developing programming within an institutional environment involving a broad range of stakeholders, both internal and external.
Experience with managing, reporting, and data collection.
Strong ability to create clear and concise reports based on a variety of data.
Experience facilitating conflict resolution.
Demonstrated excellent communication, collaboration, teamwork, people skills, interpersonal, negotiation and problem-solving skills; high level of tact and diplomacy.
Excellent organizational, planning, coordinating, and multi-tasking skills with demonstrated ability to manage the delivery of numerous complex and demanding tasks and competing deadlines. Ability to assign tasks and set priorities.
Demonstrated commitment in delivering excellent service to others - key in supporting the success of our students and College.
Effective ability to interact with others and deal with situations in ways that respect diverse backgrounds, experience and styles.
Flexibility in adapting to change and in participating in consultative decision-making processes.

Hours of Work: Monday – Friday 8:30 am – 4:30 pm

Interview process may consist of a practical skills component.
TO APPLY:
If you are a George Brown College employee, click here to apply via our internal site.
If you are an external candidate, go to www.georgebrown.ca and click on the “Employment at George Brown” link or click on the ‘apply’ button to the left of the posted job to apply.
NOTES:
Please ensure your resume highlights all relevant education, training and experience that are applicable to the minimum qualifications for this role.
The College requires proof of degrees, credentials or equivalencies from accredited regional or federal post-secondary institutions and/or their international equivalents. Credentials may require validation at the time of interviews.
First consideration will be provided to internal candidates in accordance with our Support Staff Collective Agreement.
Closing: April 15, 2023
George Brown College is committed to creating and sustaining an equitable and inclusive learning and working environment. We encourage and actively seek applications from Indigenous, Black, racialized people, visible minorities, 2SLGBTQIA+ persons, all genders, and persons with disabilities. George Brown College is committed to accommodating applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process, in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). The Human Resources representative responsible for the recruitment for this position will work with applicants requesting accommodation at any stage of the hiring process. Candidates who require accommodation in the interview process may contact talentacquisition@georgebrown.ca and all information received will be addressed confidentially.
As a unionized workplace, we support our internal employees by providing first consideration to qualified applications as set out in the Collective Agreement.
For information on George Brown College, please visit our website at www.georgebrown.ca.

Title: Manager, Business Intelligence Consulting
Description:
Type: Permanent/Full-time/Remote work
Location: e-Office Environment
Compensation: Based Salary to commensurate with experience + Individual Bonus + 4 weeks’ vacation + Benefits Package, Health and Dental, 100% Employer Paid Premiums + Pension Plan 6% Employer Matching + Paid Annual Corporate Vacation & More.
Position Overview:
Our Technical Consultants who focus on Business Intelligence Reporting work directly with c-suite Finance, IT, and Operations personnel in law firms to customize, develop, and implement industry leading BI reports. Our BI reports provide fresh data that give clear insight into a firm’s operation. This data propels our clients towards streamlining internal processes which awards them with a strong competitive advantage in their market. As the Manager, you will oversee client projects for the BI Consulting Team as well as be the technical lead for your own projects where you will take a customer centric approach while applying customized, innovative and quality technical solutions from requirements gathering to go live implementations. You will work closely with the Director of BI Consulting, Technical Consultants, Project Managers as well as our Innovation Team and/or Managing Partners. This role will require remote management of Consultants, Clients and respective projects.
Responsibilities:
Provide ongoing support to a team of experienced Business Intelligence Consultants.
Work closely with BI Consultants to ensure smooth facilitation of BI client projects.
Handle escalations/questions from consultants and clients on Business Intelligence reporting.
Lead consultation with law firm clients to gather technical project requirements.
Provide ongoing support and training on reporting tools that interact with Elite 3E and Aderant to clients.
Customize and configure applications to agreed requirement specifications.
Design, develop and document technical solutions in 3E and Aderant.
Assist with the development and execution of technical solutions with a remote project team.
Analyze client requirements and provide project quotes.
Train end users and customer development staff in the functionality of products.
Work with Division Director and HR on planning staffing levels and recruitment.
Assist Division Director with ongoing coaching, mentorship and skills development of team.
Required Experience:
7+ years of experience performing Business Analysis – requirement gathering and documentation
7+ years of experience in an IT, Software Development, or Consulting role
Minimum 1+ years’ experience in a leadership capacity.
Strong expertise in Business Intelligence (BI) Team Skills:
PowerBI: Dashboard Design, Visualization and Development; Security and Administration
MDAX and Tabular Model
SSRS – SQL Server Reporting Services: SSRS Report Builder: Paginated Reports; Drill Down and Drill through, SSRS Reports Server Configuration and Management, T-SQL, SQL Server
PowerQuery/PowerPivot
Proven experience of familiarity with performing query optimization and data validation.
Hands on experience with other reporting tools – Business Objects, Crystal Reports, Tableau and/or TM1
Must possess Advanced Excel skills
University Degree in Information Technology, Software Development or a Business Degree with a certification in IT or Software Development.
Working Conditions:
25% Travel to the US &/or Canada
75% working from home remote office
Datolite Solutions is an equal opportunity employer. All applications for this role will be considered; however, only short-listed candidates will be contacted
What we offer
Opportunity to join a growing technology consulting firm.
Competitive compensation packages.
Incentive programs based on achievements.
Flexibility of working from remote location or home office.
Competitive total benefits package.

Title: Salesforce, Business Analyst
Description:
IKO Industries Ltd. is a market leader in the manufacturing of roofing and building materials. IKO is a Canadian owned and operated business with production facilities worldwide and has many years of unparalleled success in the roofing materials industry. Quality, integrity, and trustworthiness are the values that underlie this success, and we have built this company by hiring people who hold these values. People like you!
Job Description
The IKO Global IT department is looking for a passionate, inquisitive, detail oriented and highly customer focused Business Analyst -Salesforce to join our Salesforce Global COE (Center of Excellence). The COE supports the growing needs of our user community. Experience working on facilitating the evolution of the Salesforce platform driving benefit and adoption with new business process and features is a key requirement.
WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?
Competitive salary
Competitive health and benefit plan
Competitive matched retirement savings program
The opportunity to join a continuously growing organization with focus on Diversity and Inclusion
The opportunity to work with an industry leader in manufacturing
WHEN YOU JOIN US YOU WILL BE.
The Business Analyst will participate in the whiteboard vision and execution of the end-to-end technology architecture, assist in gathering business and technical requirements from business objectives and manage and maintain the IKO Salesforce.com platform in accordance with the prioritized IKO IT roadmap.
This role will support maintenance and administration duties within the IKO Salesforce.com platform using the full feature set available on the platform.
The Business Analyst should be a technologist at heart, and passionate about the opportunity to play a pivotal role in the vision of an established business with an eye to growth and enablement through technology.
Key Responsibilities:
Support the business with our implementations, adoption, and ongoing utilization of Salesforce; assist Salesforce admins in the support of our Salesforce implementation including but not limited to managing multiple user setup, profiles and roles, fields, record types, page layouts, workflow, and validations.
Serve as front line point of contact, respond to issues, change requests, and other administrative needs of IKO Salesforce.com end users including preparation of communications required to end users.
A focus on Sales /Field enablement to facilitate our sales users driving value with the Salesforce platform.
Take on an evangelist role for Salesforce, increasing awareness of new features; Assist with development of training curriculum.
Participate and lead in business process review workshops and perform detailed analysis of business requirements to ensure project have proper impact and adoption.
Assist in creating key metrics and dashboards and ensure key stakeholders understand the information and derive value.
Take a primary role in devising test plans, creating test cases, establishing protocols and appropriate testing environments, and coordinating actual software testing.
Ensure appropriate documentation is complete for supporting systems and projects
OUR IDEAL CANDIDATE.
5+ years BA experience participating in JAD sessions, developing, and documenting Business Requirements and Functional Specification documents.
1-2 years of hands-on BA experience on the Salesforce.com Platform, including Sales, Service Cloud and Partner Communities.
Experienced with global Saleforce.com environments and deployments across multiple geographical regions, such as North America and Europe is an asset.
Experienced working within an IT Governance model (e.g., Cobit, ITIL, ISO 27001) within Agile environment.
Strong data background with experience with system integration, data modeling, dashboard, and report development.
Demonstrable experience working closely with Sales and Marketing groups.
Experience working within the manufacturing and/or building industries is desired.
Additional Skills:
Ability to present complex information clearly and concisely to different levels of the organization (written and verbal – i.e., PowerPoint);
Business process flows and modeling.
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
Have an open/partnering mentality and comfortable challenging ideas with the goal to deliver the best solution.
Foster an open/partnering mentality to help improve overall team performance.
Curious and actively inquisitive about the outside world and learning about new ideas for improvement
#LIJC1
Benefits of Employment: IKO recognizes that its success is due to the strength of its employees. A primary goal of IKO is to promote individual employee's sense of accomplishment and contribution so that employees enjoy their association with IKO. The Company invests in its employees so that they are the most knowledgeable in the industry, and undertakes great efforts to nurture loyalty to, and teamwork at, IKO. We are pleased to offer competitive compensation, health care, a progressive and challenging workplace and a commitment to teamwork and integrity.
Diversity and Equal Opportunity Employment: IKO Industries Ltd. is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to diversity and inclusion and are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without consideration to race, religion, creed, color, national origin, age, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status or disability. IKO Industries Ltd. encourages and welcomes applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Title: Manager, Business Intelligence Consulting
Description:
Type: Permanent/Full-time/Remote work
 Location: e-Office Environment
 Compensation: Based Salary to commensurate with experience + Individual Bonus + 4 weeks’ vacation + Benefits Package, Health and Dental, 100% Employer Paid Premiums + Pension Plan 6% Employer Matching + Paid Annual Corporate Vacation & More.
 Position Overview: Our Technical Consultants who focus on Business Intelligence Reporting work directly with c-suite Finance, IT, and Operations personnel in law firms to customize, develop, and implement industry leading BI reports. Our BI reports provide fresh data that give clear insight into a firm’s operation. This data propels our clients towards streamlining internal processes which awards them with a strong competitive advantage in their market. As the Manager, you will oversee client projects for the BI Consulting Team as well as be the technical lead for your own projects where you will take a customer centric approach while applying customized, innovative and quality technical solutions from requirements gathering to go live implementations. You will work closely with the Director of BI Consulting, Technical Consultants, Project Managers as well as our Innovation Team and/or Managing Partners. This role will require remote management of Consultants, Clients and respective projects.
 Responsibilities:

 Provide ongoing support to a team of experienced Business Intelligence Consultants.
 Work closely with BI Consultants to ensure smooth facilitation of BI client projects.
 Handle escalations/questions from consultants and clients on Business Intelligence reporting.
 Lead consultation with law firm clients to gather technical project requirements.
 Provide ongoing support and training on reporting tools that interact with Elite 3E and Aderant to clients.
 Customize and configure applications to agreed requirement specifications.
 Design, develop and document technical solutions in 3E and Aderant.
 Assist with the development and execution of technical solutions with a remote project team.
 Analyze client requirements and provide project quotes.
 Train end users and customer development staff in the functionality of products.
 Work with Division Director and HR on planning staffing levels and recruitment.
 Assist Division Director with ongoing coaching, mentorship and skills development of team.

 Required Experience:

 7+ years of experience performing Business Analysis – requirement gathering and documentation
 7+ years of experience in an IT, Software Development, or Consulting role
 Minimum 1+ years’ experience in a leadership capacity.
 Strong expertise in Business Intelligence (BI) Team Skills:
 PowerBI: Dashboard Design, Visualization and Development; Security and Administration
 MDAX and Tabular Model
 SSRS – SQL Server Reporting Services: SSRS Report Builder: Paginated Reports; Drill Down and Drill through, SSRS Reports Server Configuration and Management, T-SQL, SQL Server
 PowerQuery/PowerPivot
 Proven experience of familiarity with performing query optimization and data validation.
 Hands on experience with other reporting tools – Business Objects, Crystal Reports, Tableau and/or TM1
 Must possess Advanced Excel skills
 University Degree in Information Technology, Software Development or a Business Degree with a certification in IT or Software Development.

 Working Conditions: 

25% Travel to the US &/or Canada
 75% working from home remote office

 Datolite Solutions is an equal opportunity employer. All applications for this role will be considered; however, only short-listed candidates will be contacted


















What we offer






Opportunity to join a growing technology consulting firm.
 Competitive compensation packages.
 Incentive programs based on achievements.
 Flexibility of working from remote location or home office.
 Competitive total benefits package.

Title: Salesforce, Business Analyst
Description:
IKO Industries Ltd. is a market leader in the manufacturing of roofing and building materials. IKO is a Canadian owned and operated business with production facilities worldwide and has many years of unparalleled success in the roofing materials industry. Quality, integrity, and trustworthiness are the values that underlie this success, and we have built this company by hiring people who hold these values. People like you!
Job Description
The IKO Global IT department is looking for a passionate, inquisitive, detail oriented and highly customer focused Business Analyst -Salesforce to join our Salesforce Global COE (Center of Excellence). The COE supports the growing needs of our user community. Experience working on facilitating the evolution of the Salesforce platform driving benefit and adoption with new business process and features is a key requirement.
WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?
Competitive salary
Competitive health and benefit plan
Competitive matched retirement savings program
The opportunity to join a continuously growing organization with focus on Diversity and Inclusion
The opportunity to work with an industry leader in manufacturing
WHEN YOU JOIN US YOU WILL BE.
The Business Analyst will participate in the whiteboard vision and execution of the end-to-end technology architecture, assist in gathering business and technical requirements from business objectives and manage and maintain the IKO Salesforce.com platform in accordance with the prioritized IKO IT roadmap.
This role will support maintenance and administration duties within the IKO Salesforce.com platform using the full feature set available on the platform.
The Business Analyst should be a technologist at heart, and passionate about the opportunity to play a pivotal role in the vision of an established business with an eye to growth and enablement through technology.
Key Responsibilities:
Support the business with our implementations, adoption, and ongoing utilization of Salesforce; assist Salesforce admins in the support of our Salesforce implementation including but not limited to managing multiple user setup, profiles and roles, fields, record types, page layouts, workflow, and validations.
Serve as front line point of contact, respond to issues, change requests, and other administrative needs of IKO Salesforce.com end users including preparation of communications required to end users.
A focus on Sales /Field enablement to facilitate our sales users driving value with the Salesforce platform.
Take on an evangelist role for Salesforce, increasing awareness of new features; Assist with development of training curriculum.
Participate and lead in business process review workshops and perform detailed analysis of business requirements to ensure project have proper impact and adoption.
Assist in creating key metrics and dashboards and ensure key stakeholders understand the information and derive value.
Take a primary role in devising test plans, creating test cases, establishing protocols and appropriate testing environments, and coordinating actual software testing.
Ensure appropriate documentation is complete for supporting systems and projects
OUR IDEAL CANDIDATE.
5+ years BA experience participating in JAD sessions, developing, and documenting Business Requirements and Functional Specification documents.
1-2 years of hands-on BA experience on the Salesforce.com Platform, including Sales, Service Cloud and Partner Communities.
Experienced with global Saleforce.com environments and deployments across multiple geographical regions, such as North America and Europe is an asset.
Experienced working within an IT Governance model (e.g., Cobit, ITIL, ISO 27001) within Agile environment.
Strong data background with experience with system integration, data modeling, dashboard, and report development.
Demonstrable experience working closely with Sales and Marketing groups.
Experience working within the manufacturing and/or building industries is desired.
Additional Skills:
Ability to present complex information clearly and concisely to different levels of the organization (written and verbal – i.e., PowerPoint);
Business process flows and modeling.
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
Have an open/partnering mentality and comfortable challenging ideas with the goal to deliver the best solution.
Foster an open/partnering mentality to help improve overall team performance.
Curious and actively inquisitive about the outside world and learning about new ideas for improvement
#LIJC1
Benefits of Employment: IKO recognizes that its success is due to the strength of its employees. A primary goal of IKO is to promote individual employee's sense of accomplishment and contribution so that employees enjoy their association with IKO. The Company invests in its employees so that they are the most knowledgeable in the industry, and undertakes great efforts to nurture loyalty to, and teamwork at, IKO. We are pleased to offer competitive compensation, health care, a progressive and challenging workplace and a commitment to teamwork and integrity.
Diversity and Equal Opportunity Employment: IKO Industries Ltd. is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to diversity and inclusion and are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without consideration to race, religion, creed, color, national origin, age, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status or disability. IKO Industries Ltd. encourages and welcomes applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Title: Developer, Business Intelligence
Description:
Req Id: 361252

 At Bell, we do more than build world-class networks, develop innovative services and create original multiplatform media content – we’re revolutionizing how Canadians communicate.

 If you’re ready to bring game-changing ideas to life and join a community that values bold ideas, professional growth and employee wellness, we want you on the Bell team.

 We’ve created a brand new team for our Small and Medium Business customers. Our team sells the best Internet, TV and Wireless services across Canada. Using industry-leading, cutting-edge solutions in IoT and 5G we power Canada’s business growth. If you're an innovative, collaborative, and performance-driven professional who wants to play a key role in a winning culture, now is the time to join our team! Opportunities to build something of this scale don’t come around every day – get in on the ground floor!

 Our Business Intelligence Team within BSMB provides reporting and analytical insight to Marketing, Sales and Product teams to support day-to-day operations and strategic planning. The team plays an integral role in decision-making at multiple levels of management through complex analyses, predictive modeling, data definition and standardization, data mining, reporting, as well as sourcing external data from 3rd party relationships.

 Do you know someone who would be perfect for this opportunity? If you refer a qualified candidate who is not a current Bell employee and they are hired, you may be eligible to receive a referral bonus! Simply look for the referral hashtag in the job description to see if this role qualifies.

 The Role:
 Reporting to the Senior Manager, Business Intelligence, this role will develop data solutions that integrate our small and medium businesses. You will proactively find and capture data from various sources to improve the performance of our business.

 The Business Intelligence Developer will review and analyze data from multiple internal and external sources. Communicating analysis results and making recommendations to senior management. You will also play a key role in supporting current and future advanced analytics projects with data to enable modeling and analytics.

 The ideal candidate should be a self-starter who is willing to learn and evolve with the business. You have an insatiable drive and passion to continually improve our results.

 Key Responsibilities:

 Design databases, understand and translate business needs into data models
 Analysis, design and development of ETL programs with SAS and Teradata
 Propose and implement optimized automated solutions to inefficient processes and code
 Design and develop optimized data models, structures and coding techniques to improve efficiency
 Converge with and collect requirements from end users; translate requirements into technical solutions
 Support and troubleshoot technical problems within the Bl Environment
 Design and introduce new processes and solutions to drive sophisticated BI processes.
 Translate business requirements into efficient BI solutions.
 Deliver on key projects and data strategies that directly support key business drivers.
 Take part in defining the overall data integration architecture (e.g. ETL processes, Data Marts, OLAP).
 Design, develop and implement procedure to consolidate internal and external data sources to provide business insights


 Critical Qualifications & Competencies:

 3+ year hands-on experience with ETL development and design techniques
 Advanced knowledge of SQL is required (3+ years experience)
 Experience with SAS programming language and SAS Data Integration Studio
 Experience with Teradata and SQL Server
 Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Business Analytics, Information Technology, Computer Science and/or related fields or experience
 Experience in gathering and analyzing system requirements
 Knowledge of Data Marts, Data Warehousing and Business Intelligence concepts
 Emphasis on development of high quality code focused on efficiency and the elimination of data integrity or quality issues.
 Demonstrated ability to effectively manage multiple projects and competing priorities simultaneously and to work independently and as part of an extended team 
Experience with Excel (tables and pivot tables)

 
Preferred Competencies

 Experience in technology companies and/or telecom networks is a strong asset
 Experience developing cubes, complex reports and dashboards using MicroStrategy
 Experience using Python or R for use in advanced analytics


 #ProgrammeRecommandationEmployes

 Bilingualism is an asset (English and French); adequate knowledge of French is required for positions in Quebec.

 Additional Information:
 Position Type: Management Job Status: Regular - Full Time Job Location: Canada : Ontario : Toronto || Canada : Ontario : Ottawa || Canada : Quebec : Montreal Flexible work profile : Mobile Application Deadline: 05/08/2022

 Please apply directly online to be considered for this role. Applications through email will not be accepted.

 At Bell, we don’t just accept difference - we celebrate it. We’re committed to fostering an inclusive, equitable, and accessible workplace where every team member feels valued, respected, and supported, and has the opportunity to reach their full potential. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities.

 Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. For a confidential inquiry, simply email your recruiter directly or recruitment@bell.ca to make arrangements. If you have questions regarding accessible employment at Bell please email our Diversity & Inclusion Team at inclusion@bell.ca.

Title: Senior Business Analyst
Description:
Job Posting #896516
Position: Senior Business Analyst
Site: The Princess Margaret Cancer Foundation (700 University Avenue, 4th Floor) & remote
Department: Foundation
Hours: 35 Hours/week
Status: Temporary, Full-Time (Covering for a leave)
Do you want to be part of a bold, daring, and ambitious team that will Conquer Cancer In Our Lifetime?
About us
As one of the world’s leading cancer charities, The Princess Margaret Cancer Foundation (PMCF) raises funds for Princess Margaret Cancer Centre, one of the top 5 cancer research centers in the world, to deliver Future Care Now.
For more than a decade, The PMCF has been on an aggressive growth trajectory. Setting daring and audacious goals is a mindset that is driven by our culture and passion to perform. We have pioneered many successful fundraising programs, including our world-leading Princess Margaret Home Lottery, and some of the world’s largest cancer fundraising events. The foundation’s vision, which will be your vision, is to Conquer Cancer In Our Lifetime.
The Princess Margaret is a proud member of University Health Network, Canada’s largest research hospital network, which also includes Toronto General Hospital, Toronto Western Hospital, Toronto Rehab Institute and The Michener Institute for Education.
About The Role
The Senior Business Analyst role is a temporary full-time position, reporting to the Director, Granting and Accountability. The successful candidate will play a critical role in advancing the development and implementation of a new fund management system that will replace the existing platform with a Go-Live date of June 2023 and the delivery on a range of projects surrounding granting and managing funds. This individual will be a strategic thinker who can work collaboratively with various stakeholders and has strong problem-solving, analytical, research, communication, and change management skills.
You will:
New fund management system
Responsible for end to end delivery of a new fund management system.
Update taxonomy of funds management data and apply new taxonomy to existing funds.
Works with key stakeholders within all business functions to align technology solutions with business strategies especially with the intent to replace/upgrade the current business systems.
Responsible for communication flow and all documentation related to the project, including but not limited to authoring documents based on the assembly of requirements, for example, Business Requirements Documents (BRDs), requests for proposals (RFPs), and other such documentation.
Responsible for assessing, recommending and managing the potential and selected vendors to develop the new system.
Monitor project progress with regards to goals and objectives, budget management, time management and risk management.
Prepare agendas and lead project meetings.
Prepare and share project status reports with all involved stakeholders.
Build a cordial professional relationship with stakeholders to facilitate engagement.
Develop implementation solutions and lead project team(s) to achieve successful implementation and execution of new system.
Granting and funds management
Analyze granting and fund utilization information to support Foundation and Cancer Centre decisions and strengthen accountability to our donors.
Use problem-solving skills to address immediate fund management issues and identify solutions that will enhance operational efficiencies and prevent recurrence.
Support initiatives and processes that ensure donor funds are geared towards the highest impact, in close collaboration with Foundation and Cancer Centre stakeholders.
Other
Identify and develop trusted relationships with critical internal and external stakeholders.
Work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment demonstrating teamwork, innovation and excellence.
Provide support to the Director, Granting and Accountability in the design, project management and advancement of emerging strategic projects.
You have:
Technical Skills & Capabilities
Experience in bringing business systems technology to life.
Project management experience, including building effective plans, leveraging work back schedules and navigating internal and external groups, timelines and dependencies.
Experience in business process analysis and re-design at an organizational level, including change management and training on implementation.
Strong business analytical acumen and the flexibility to work both as a project manager and perform business analyst-type tasks.
Leadership & Interpersonal Skills
Strong ability to collaborate and partner with diverse stakeholders with competing interests/agendas within a complex governance setting.
Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills.
Able to multi-task under a highly demanding & continuously changing environment.
Quick learner of new technologies and procedures.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
Ability to work both independently, as well as to play a key role in building a cohesive team.
Experience & Education
5+ years of relevant work experience.
University degree in in relevant fields, preferably in health or business administration.
Proficient in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook; PowerPoint); Visio and experience working with Raiser’s Edge or other related fundraising databases are an asset.
Detail oriented, extremely well organized, and able to manage time and multi-task to accomplish a multitude of tasks, with conflicting priorities and timelines. Action oriented, results oriented.
Why work with us?
Experience a sense of purpose that you won’t get anywhere else, in any other job. You will be making a difference for millions of people impacted by cancer.
We have an open and approachable culture that enables you to bring your best ideas forward.
We will invest in your growth through ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and education assistance programs.
We offer flexible working arrangements to support your need to balance life at work and at home.
Vaccines (COVID-19 and others) are a requirement of the job unless you have an exemption on a medical ground pursuant to the Ontario Human Rights Code.
If you are interested in making your contribution at UHN, please apply on-line. You will be asked to copy and paste as well as attach your resume and covering letter. You will also be required to complete some initial screening questions.
Posting Date: April 5, 2022 Closing Date: April 26, 2022
For current UHN employees, only those who have successfully completed their probationary period, have a good employee record along with satisfactory attendance in accordance with UHN's attendance management program, and possess all the required experience and qualifications should apply.
UHN thanks all applicants, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
UHN is a respectful, caring, and inclusive workplace. We are committed to championing accessibility, diversity and equal opportunity and welcomes all applicants including but not limited to: all religions and ethnicities, LGBTQ2s+, BIPOC, persons with disabilities and all others who may contribute to the further diversification of ideas. Requests for accommodation can be made at any stage of the recruitment process providing the applicant has met the Bona-fide requirements for the open position. Applicants need to make their requirements known when contacted.

Title: Senior Information Security Analyst (IAM) (Ottawa Hub)
Description:
Requisition ID: 148049

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.
Senior Information Security Analyst (IAM) (Ottawa Hub)
The Global Identity & Access Management (GIAM), Governance Team is responsible for the governance of established security controls pertaining to Identity and Access. Our Enterprise Access Governance (EAG) and IAM Onboarding teams work closely with operations teams to ensure our controls are in place and operating effectively to reduce risks to our Bank.
 As a Senior Information Security Analyst within the Enterprise Access Governance (EAG) Team you would be responsible for supporting the achievement of the Bank’s information security objectives of integrity, confidentiality/privacy and continuity by ensuring Logical Access is effectively governed for the Enterprise. You will provide oversight over access management through recertification controls, privileged access, toxic combinations (i.e. SoD) etc. for enterprise applications and platforms. You will also be responsible to carry out day-to-day operational tasks in support of Identity and Access Management through design/development/implementation of various reports, which can be leveraged to identify and remediate access as required.
Where could you work? Both at home and in the office.
We’re focused on being an employer of choice for the communities we serve and offering a hybrid work environment for top Tech talent in Canada’s capital city.
We’re creating a local ScotiaTech Hub in Ottawa. You’ll have the opportunity both to work remotely and head to the Ottawa office for in-person moments that foster team cohesiveness and collaboration.
Is this role right for you? In this Role, you will:
Perform tasks and projects related to Identity & Access governance functions; including access requests, access certification, communication, and documentation of operational processes and procedures.
Analyze certification data and access processes and procedures to deliver recommendations for greater efficiency of the certification process
Look for continuous improvements to maximize automation where possible and reduce manual efforts in all processes and procedures within the team, while considering and evaluating the bank’s risk appetite and risk culture.
Excel in relationship building (internal / external GIAM) and work with various teams to assist in completion of all certifications across the enterprise
Demonstrate personal accountability for assigned projects, initiatives, and daily processes
Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role?
Must Haves:
3+ years of hands-on working experience with IAM
2+ years of hands-on working experience with Enterprise core systems, such as Sailpoint, CyberArk or Active Directory
3+ years of hands-on working experience with the Microsoft suite of applications (i.e.: MS Access, MS PowerPoint, MS Excel)
Strong analytical skills, specifically data analysis
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Competent to work on complex projects independently
Good working knowledge of information security policies and standards
Strong customer communication skills
Once settled in position, you will be providing after-hours availability for any urgent issues / incidents / escalations on occasion as required
Nice to Haves:
Technical designation is considered an asset (e.g., CompTIA Security+, CISSP)
Fluency in Spanish is considered an asset
Experience with UNIX-flavor systems and/or LDAP
What's in it for you?
We have an inclusive and collaborative working environment that encourages creativity, curiosity, and celebrates success!
You'll get to work with and learn from diverse industry leaders, who have hailed from top technology companies around the world
We foster an environment of innovation and continuous learning
We offer a competitive total rewards package, including a performance bonus, company matching programs (pension & Employee Share Ownership), generous vacation; health/medical/wellness benefits; employee banking privileges
#INTECH
#Ottawahub
Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Ottawa

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.
