Title: Cognos BI Developer
Description:
About big river technologies
We are seasoned industry veterans with decades of experience in capital markets technology and delivery excellence. We created big river technologies to be the boutique customer-centric firm we always wanted to work for, truly focused on client success. Headquartered in Gananoque, in the heart of the beautiful 1000 Islands region of Eastern Ontario and with office in New York City, we work for some of the world’s largest and most successful financial organizations and software vendors. Our Business-Driven Development methodology ensures projects are delivered on time & budget. We have three core practices: FinTech, user experience discovery, and enterprise computing. Our work spans end-to-end solution development including ideation, architecture, design, software development, quality assurance and overall delivery. We’re passionate about what we do. Come join us, you will thrive.
As a Cognos BI Developer you will assist with the development of reports for New Product Approval (NPA) Platform and GRC Data Warehouse using IBM Cognos. You will be a member of the GRC Analytics team that designs, develops, and implements reporting solutions on the NPA GRC Platform and GRC Reporting Data Warehouse. You will interact directly with internal business clients to understand their reporting, analytics & data needs, design business intelligence solutions, and work with other members on the team (data modelers, report authors, ETL developers, data analysts, etc.) on the implementation of such solutions. This includes the development of detailed list reports, crosstab reports, senior management dashboards, and integration reports.

You will also be responsible for the development of Cognos Framework Manager models, reporting fragments, and notifications using IBM Cognos Analytics (v.11).

To develop detailed list reports, crosstab reports, senior management dashboards, and integration reports using Cognos Analytics (v. 11).
To develop data triggered notifications for the NPA Platform using Cognos Event Studio.
To develop and maintain Cognos Framework Manager models for the GRC Reporting Data Warehouse.
To assist and provide guidance to ETL & data warehouse developers with complex ETLs, stored procedures, triggers, MQTs and views on our DB2-based Data Warehouse necessary for reporting purposes
To provide guidance to other development team members, and validate and verify deliverables before migration to QA, UAT and Production.
To provide assistance and guidance during the QA, UAT, and Production stages to quickly confirm the validity of potential issues and to determine the root cause and best resolution of verified issues


Required skills:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Information Technology, or related field required
At least 5+ years of experience as a Cognos BI Developer.
A strong understanding of Cognos Analytics v11 architecture and report development.
A strong understanding of Cognos Framework Manager modeling, including the design of DMR and business user friendly models.
Experience with the performance testing of Cognos reports and the ability to quickly identify and resolve performance issues.
Strong understanding of advanced data warehouse concepts (Factless Fact Tables, Temporal \ BI-Temporal models, etc.)
Well versed in writing complex, yet efficient SQL code, especially in a DB2 environment.
Effective communication and presentation skills.
Excellent collaboration and team skills.


Other Desired Skills:

Experience using the Cognos Java SDK.
Experience with writing JavaScript and using it to extend the functionality of Cognos Report Studio.
Experience with the Cognos Microsoft Office plug-in.
Domain knowledge of risk, compliance and audit a plus.
Experience with other BI applications like Tableau a plus
Experience with Tibco Virtual Data Platform (previously known as Composite) a plus
Experience with NoSQL databases such as MarkLogic a plus
Experience with Agile development practices
Strong analytical and design skills, including the ability to understand business requirements and translate them into efficient and effective technical designs that work well within large-scale, well-structured enterprise environments.
Excellent trouble-shooting skills, with the ability to quickly identify and document the root cause of issues, and effectively communicate possible resolutions.


Work Related Expectations
For this role, our Client is based in the United States in the eastern standard timezone, and therefore, you will be working remotely, among a larger client integrated team. We require that our team be willing to work flexible hours to accommodate client requirements in a variety of time zones. We service clients across North America, Europe and Asia/Pacific regions and vary our working hours accordingly.
big river technologies are committed to employment equity and diversity and welcomes applications from women, visible minorities, aboriginal people, persons with disabilities and persons of any sexual orientation or gender. We are also committed to improving access and opportunities for all individuals, including those with disabilities by identifying and removing barriers that may prevent, inhibit or restrict their access to employment opportunities. If you require accommodation at any stage of our hiring process (application, interviews, assessments, and placement), please contact us via email at hiring@bigrivertech.com. We thank all applicants responding and showing interest to work for us, however; only those interviewed will be contacted.

Title: Business Operations Analyst
Company: Mitsubishi Hitachi Power Systems Americas, Inc.
Description:
At MHIRJ, our employees work together to move the world forward - one good idea at a time. If you have a good idea, we’ll provide the environment where it will thrive and grow into a great product or customer experience. Your ideas are our fuel.


From day one, you will work to enable insights and intelligent decision-making across functions and contribute to the delivery of real projects using the latest technology to solve business problems. You will receive one-on-one training and coaching from a team of talented experts and take on increasingly, while learning in a challenging and rewarding environment.


The Sales & Operations Planning team main objective rests with leveraging data and analytical techniques to be able to guide business decisions with primary focus on the health of the company’s P&L. The Business Operations Analysts are the direct source for providing insight to help enhance the fidelity of commercial decision making for the CRJ Aftermarket and help digitize that effort by developing Online tools & dashboards to deliver recommendations.


The activities may include and are not limited to:



Advanced understanding of supply chain process and concepts (supply planning, procurement, warehousing, order fulfillment, transportation)
Identify and establish Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) related to material planning, supply chain performance, and delivery to customer.
Identify required data elements and ensure a high level of data quality and accurate reporting of all KPIs.
Develop automated reports with defined steps and methodology, allowing frequent and streamlined updates.
KPIs are to pertain to, and are not limited to: Performance of suppliers, Open orders, On-time delivery to customers, and material returns.
Understand and analyze KPIs; delivering actionable insights to improve the current process.
Present findings to Material Logistics team and other stakeholders, promoting knowledge and understanding of KPI tracking, methodology, and actionable items.
Work closely with Material Logistics and Planning, leveraging KPIs to drive discussion and strategic decisions. 
Communicate findings with airlines and promote efforts being taken to improve their experience and customer relationship.
Develop action plans to ameliorate existing processes and improve material logistics performance.
Perform ad-hoc data analysis per business needs

Some other useful skills include effective use of Microsoft Office and a strong math/statistics background. Candidate is expected to be comfortable presenting in front of stakeholders, pick up new concepts quickly and balance multiple projects simultaneously.


Qualifications


As our ideal candidate, you

Have a minimum of 5 years’ experience in material planning and KPI tracking
Experience in qualitative and quantitative evaluation methods
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
General programming proficiency, with an emphasis on Python and SQL. 
Experience with Enterprise Resource Planning and software.
Create and deliver on-time and high quality reports
Proficient in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
High organizational skills and a team player able to work with variable departments.
Demonstrated skills in data visualization techniques.
Demonstrated experience in extracting actionable insight from quantitative data.




MHIRJ is an equal opportunity employer and encourages women, Aboriginal people, persons with disabilities and members of visible minorities to apply.

Title: Salesforce Business Analyst
Description:
What's Bench? Check us out in Medium, Betakit, Financial Post, Perkins + Will, our Instagram, and our Blog.

We acknowledge that Bench headquarters is located on the traditional, ancestral, and unceded territory of the Coast Salish Peoples, including the territories of the xʷməθkwəy̓əm (Musqueam), Skwxwú7mesh (Squamish), and Səl̓ílwətaʔ/Selilwitulh (Tsleil-Waututh) Nations.

Businesses need to understand their financial performance, but for many smaller ones, this means a trade-off between managing their books and running their businesses.

Our mission is to make a profound difference in the quality of life of one million people. From creatives to chiropractors, Bench helps thousands of small business owners and entrepreneurs master their financial lives. Because understanding your finances should be three things: simple, effortless, and affordable.
We're growing fast, and we're looking for exceptional people to join us on this incredible journey. Check out our culture guide to learn more about what it's like to work at Bench and read more about our business here!


What does the Salesforce Business Analyst look like?

At Bench we're aiming to make a profound difference in the lives of our customers, by making entrepreneurship more accessible. We are doing this by delivering disruptively affordable and simple accounting services for small businesses in the US - where 80% of business owners today either do not do any bookkeeping; or, struggle to do it themselves.

Reporting to our Team Lead of Business Operations Systems and Analytics, you'll be a critical team member helping implement an exciting, best-in-class, go-to-market system and process transformation. While you bring technical Salesforce knowledge and experience, you'll greatly expand your Salesforce experience and technical knowledge working with a highly skilled team to improve the user experience for the day-to-day sales and marketing activities and analytical decisions. With the Business Operations and analytics team members around you, you'll drive a transformation of how systems, data, and analytics support Bench's business from Salesforce. As a Salesforce Business Analyst, you'll be leading process workshops, collaborating with Marketing and Sales Leaders to understand their process requirements, then working closely with technical teams to create outstanding solutions for Bench!

What you'll get up to:

Be responsible for configuration, design functionality, and end-user support of the Salesforce platform.
Analyze our current structure for all aspects of user and license management
Collaborate with various internal departments (Sales, Account Management, Retro) to ensure Salesforce environment continues to evolve for internal needs relating to functionality and performance
Establish and implement change control and best practices with regard to system maintenance, configuration, development, testing, data integrity, etc.
Analyze the applications connected to Salesforce, including but not limited to Salesforce CPQ, Marketo, Salesloft, Distribution Engine, etc.
Identify production risks and areas for improvement; prioritize, design, and facilitate successful implementation and adoption of new processes.
Develop and implement training for end-users. Create and maintain all training materials and guides for processes related to Salesforce business applications.
Be accountable and results focused, including building strong relationships with others based on integrity and authenticity
Make mistakes and face challenges, but be motivated to learn fast from them and make high impact technical system improvements
Embrace feedback with arms wide open and action it to further your success
Be able to contribute to a high-performing team by bringing lots of mental horsepower, amazing work ethic, positive energy, and a little weirdness to keep things interesting

What you'll need:

3+ years of previous experience as a Salesforce Admin
Previous experience configuring and supporting the existing salesforce infrastructure including custom objects, record types, fields, page layouts, formulas, data validation rules, flows, etc.
2+ years of experience working as a Business Analyst, gathering business requirements from Sales or Marketing Teams, documenting processes, and building business cases for Salesforce implementations
Extensive experience with Process Improvement, identifying bottleneck, and creating process diagrams
Conduct system review sessions to optimize and streamline processes
Running workshops for requirements gathering
Demoing future state processes
Extensive experience breaking down the requirements backlog into logical subparts for Salesforce developers and administrators
For example: writing technical requirements for Salesforce Developers & Admin in Google Sheets or Jira
One of the following certifications: Salesforce Administrator, Salesforce Advanced Admin, or Salesforce App Builder
An ability to collaborate with GTM Leaders and Senior Stakeholders to understand their process and workflow requirements and then develop an appropriate business case for specific managed packages within the Salesforce Ecosystem.
Experience analyzing or creating business cases for managed packages.
Be extremely interested and motivated to learn more about the Salesforce Platform
A genuine passion for helping people that create outstanding internal user experiences

It could be an even better fit if you have:

Experience with a combination of Agile and Waterfall (in the future we will be moving towards a more formal Agile Framework utilizing Scrum or Kanban).
An understanding of data structures, data flows, and data modeling.
Knowledge of object-oriented methodologies and approaches (so you can collaborate better with Salesforce Developers)

What you'll get:

At Bench we share information freely and openly whenever possible. The salary range for this role is $72,720 - $90,900 per year, depending on experience,
In addition,we offer an extended benefits package that includes paid vacation, unlimited paid flex days, stock options and full health, dental, and vision.
You'll get unlimited access to Inkblot Therapy, our virtual counselling service to support mental wellbeing, and Bravely, our confidential, on-demand, 1:1 professional coaching service.
Bench has a number of Affinity Groups - groups of people who have shared identities and experiences! The purpose of these groups is to support underrepresented Benchmates and amplify their voices.
Our HQ is in downtown Vancouver BC, where we offer hybrid and remote working opportunities. This full-time position also has the flexibility to work remotely from anywhere else in BC, as well as Alberta, Ontario, New Brunswick, and Nova Scotia.
Whether working remote or hybrid, we'll set you up with everything you need to work from home, from day one.

Everyone has their own unique talents. Even if you don't meet 100% of the qualifications outlined above, tell us why you'd be a great fit for this role in your application.

We believe that unchecked biases disproportionately impact the most marginalized people in society—including but not limited to BIPOC, LGBTQ2S+ people, immigrants, and people with disabilities. We strongly encourage applications from people with these identities or other marginalized communities because we believe that without you, we are all less. At Bench, we don't stand for tokenism. We stand for representation.

Title: Senior Policy Analyst
Description:
About the Insurance Council
The Insurance Council of British Columbia is the regulatory organization that licenses and regulates the activities of over 38,000 life and general insurance agents, general insurance salespersons, insurance adjusters, and restricted travel insurance agents in British Columbia.
The Opportunity
The primary focus of this role is to assist with the development of guidelines, policies and standards for licensees in conducting their business in accordance with the Financial Institutions Act, Council Rules and Council’s Code of Conduct. In addition, the Senior Policy Analyst will play an important role in identifying gaps and required policies to align with changes in regulation or industry practice.
Why Work for the Insurance Council?
Work with a great team of people in a rewarding career that makes a difference. We’re in a downtown location with plenty of amenities nearby. The Insurance Council has a friendly and collaborative environment with a team who’s committed to protecting the public.

We offer a comprehensive health and dental plan
Work-life balance
This position is mostly remote work enabled. The incumbent would be required to come into the office as needed.
Professional development
Equitable employment opportunities

We have established health and safety practices to limit exposure to COVID-19, including a vaccination requirement for all staff.
Who We’re Looking For
The ideal candidate will have the ability to interpret and apply legislation and policies to differing situations, project management skills with demonstrated analytical and judgement skills.
Duties and Responsibilities

Play a key role in the development of new and updated policies to support practices and regulatory compliance that fosters professionalism, competency and conduct
Research and write guidelines, policies and notices
Review current policies against regulatory requirements to ensure consistency and identify gaps
Provide advice on appropriate controls to support policies and evidence of compliance
Participate in projects where the outcome may impact policies or guidelines
Prepare briefing materials such as briefing notes, presentations and reports
Develop sound data analysis
Maintain excellent and up-to-date knowledge of the the Financial Institutions Act, Council’s Code of Conduct, the Council Rules and other relevant legislation and industry practices
Participate in determining an action plan in response to regulatory or industry change
Undertake horizon scanning to identify upcoming developments within the insurance industry and working with the Manager of Policy to identify next steps
Work with Practice and Quality Assurance team to identify gaps and overlapping work
Work with Professional Conduct team to identify trends in complaints and investigations
Identify emerging industry trends and assist in determining an appropriate course of action
Liaise with other departments as required
Assist management, as required
Handle other duties as assigned


Qualifications

Minimum three years of experience in policy development, project and/or program management, and strategic planning.

Experience in managing multi-stakeholder programs or initiatives.
Experience in managing an inter-disciplinary team.
Experience in writing reports and briefings for senior executive or equivalent.
Experience in conceptualizing, analyzing, investigating and reporting on a wide variety of issues.
Experience in program design and evaluation.
Experience interpreting, applying and advising on federal and provincial programs, government legislation, regulatory requirements and policies.
Skill set in researching, writing, critical thinking and business acumen.
Computer skills, having proficiency with the Microsoft Office suite, specifically with word processing and spreadsheet programs.
Bachelor’s degree in relevant field of study such as economic, political science, law or business administration is an asset.
Experience in the development of legislation and regulations is an asset.
Additional experience in a regulatory or financial services role is an asset.
Insurance experience is an asset.

Title: Sr Analyst Digital Marketing Canada
Description:
Description
18 month contract
Built on innovation. Powered by an entrepreneurial spirit. Driven by a passion for putting the customer first. These are hallmark characteristics that define our company as well as the associates who fuel our success. Bath & Body Works is one of the world’s leading specialty retailers. We believe in cultivating a values-based community of associates that reflects our customers and where diversity, equity and inclusion are part of how we operate.

Our Digital Marketing team at Bath & Body Works is comprised of highly collaborative associates that are dynamic and take pride in everything they do. We have a strong focus on growth and development and a passion for your success.
Description
The Senior Digital Marketing Analyst, reporting to the Director of Digital Marketing, will join the team for an 18-month mat leave replacement contract, with possible extension. The role primarily focuses on the development and execution of brand paid media strategies including paid search, social and programmatic. In collaboration with an external agency, the Analyst’s objective is to grow Canadian E-commerce and store traffic, ultimately resulting in an increase in revenue through an omni-channel strategic approach.
Roles and Responsibilities
Develop ad content strategy that supports daily promotions, big events and holiday gifting
Execute creative briefs, partnering closely with graphics and translation teams
Provide a weekly performance overview of paid media channels, comparing KPIs to past promotional activity
Manage a testing calendar, collect and analyze data, identify trends and insights to maximize performance
Assist in marketing campaign hindsight process, aggregating cross-channel assets
Act as key liaison between agency and brand
Drive professional growth by staying close to the latest industry trends through continual research, webinars and industry events

Other Responsibilities
Oversee and support one direct report with regular touchbases, periodic performance reviews and coaching
QA site creative deliverables to ensure accurate brand and promotional messaging
Maintain local brick & mortar search listings

Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing or related field
1-3 years of paid media program management for a retail company in-house or at an agency
Experience working in beauty, consumer goods, fashion or retail industries preferred
Ability to extract actionable insights from various data points
Understanding of content and A/B testing strategies
Ability to multitask and project manage key business priorities in a fast-paced environment
Attention to detail with strong written and verbal communication skills required
Strong team player and positive, proactive attitude with great interpersonal skills
Ability to brief senior leaders, foster relationships with internal and external teams, and be solid support for immediate team members
Ability to think innovatively and creatively and change course if necessary, to achieve desired results
Results oriented, must be willing to take ownership of all assigned responsibilities and adhere to deadlines
Highly proficient in English and working French
Proficiency in MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint, and Word)
Knowledge of Adobe Creative Cloud (In Design, Photoshop and Illustrator) is an asset

What you can expect from us:
Hybrid work model
Employee Discount
Benefits: Medical, Dental, Eye Care
Competitive salary
Indoor gym
Free Parking
Fun challenges guaranteed!

An equal opportunity employer, we do not discriminate in hiring or terms and conditions of employment because of an individual’s race, ancestry, colour, place of origin, religion, gender, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, age, disability, sexual orientation, pregnancy, genetic information, family status or marital status, or any other protected category recognized by provincial or federal laws. We only hires individuals authorized for employment in Canada.

Title: Analyste de Catégorie / Category Analyst
Description: Analyste de CatégorieDHP - une division de Dorel Industries Inc. est un important fabricant/importateur de produits d'ameublement pour la maison. Notre division se spécialise dans une grande variété de meubles prêts à assembler qui apportent à la fois confort et valeur à chaque espace de vie.DHP est actuellement à la recherche d'un Analyste de Catégorie qui est motivé, efficace et très organisé pour rejoindre notre équipe de Catégorie.Responsabilités· Le Spécialiste de Catégorie soutiendra les gestionnaires de Catégorie en compilant des informations, en analysant des données et en fournissant des recommandations pour améliorer l'exécution des plans d'affaires de la Catégorie.· Fournir des données pour aider les gestionnaires de Catégorie à prendre des décisions concernant l'assortiment de produits, le marchandisage, la tarification et la promotion.· Fournir des rapports spéciaux et standardisés afin de participer au processus d'examen des Catégories.· Développer et présenter des rapports de gestion de Catégorie en collaboration avec les Gestionnaires de Catégories.· Participer à la création de planogrammes de meubles en utilisant des données essentielles et des informations sur la Catégorie pour piloter le rayon.· Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les équipes interfonctionnelles pour soutenir la gestion des Catégories en matière de développement de produits, d'approvisionnement, de stocks/chaîne d'approvisionnement et de tarification.· Rechercher régulièrement des données sur l'industrie et effectuer des comparaisons.· Maintenir des fichiers, des rapports et des feuilles de calcul pour soutenir les processus de merchandising par Catégorie.Qualifications· Diplôme universitaire de premier cycle requis.· 2 ans d'expérience dans la vente au détail, les ventes et/ou la gestion des Catégories.· Compétences de niveau intermédiaire/avancé en Microsoft Office, avec des compétences avérées en Power Point et Excel.· Expérience de l'analyse et de la communication de données pour identifier les problèmes, les tendances ou les exceptions afin d'améliorer les résultats et de trouver des solutions.· Bonnes compétences en matière de présentation et de communication, à l'écrit comme à l'oral.· Capacité à établir et à atteindre des normes élevées pour soi-même ; capacité à prendre des décisions et à résoudre des problèmes.· Autonome, capable de poursuivre des projets même dans des moments d'ambiguïté.· Bonne gestion du temps et capacité à gérer des projets importants simultanément.Category AnalystDHP – a division of Dorel Industries Inc. – is a leading manufacturer/importer of home furnishing products. Our division specializes in a wide variety of ready to assemble furniture that brings both comfort and value to every living space.DHP is currently seeking a motivated, efficient and highly organized Category Analyst to join our Category Team.Responsibilities· The Category Specialist will support category managers by compiling information, analyzing data, and providing recommendations to enhance the execution of category business plans.· Provide data to help category managers make decisions concerning product assortment, merchandising, pricing, and promotion.· Provide ad hoc and standardized reports and participate in the category review process.· Develop and present category management reports in collaboration with category managers.· Assist in creating furniture planograms utilizing critical data and category insights to drive the shelf.· Work closely with cross functional teams to support category management on product development, sourcing, inventory/supply chain, and pricing activity.· Regularly seek out industry data and execute comp shops.· Maintain category files, reports, and spreadsheets to support category merchandising processes.Qualifications· Bachelor’s Degree required· 2 years of experience in Retail, Sales, and/or Category Management· Intermediate-to-advanced level skill in Microsoft Office, with demonstrated Power Point and Excel skills· Experience with analyzing and reporting data to identify issues, trends, or exceptions to drive improvement of results and find solutions· Good presentation and communication skills, written and verbal· Able to establish and attain high standards for self; able to make decisions and solve problems· Self-starter who can continue projects even through moments of ambiguity· Good time management skills and capable of managing major projects simultaneouslyJob Types: Full-time, PermanentBenefits:Casual dressDental careEmployee assistance programExtended health careFlexible scheduleLife insuranceOn-site childcareOn-site gymPaid time offVision careSchedule:8 hour shift

Title: Project Coordinator/Business Analyst
Description:
CTC006681 : Project Coordinator/Business Analyst

Location : Montreal, Quebec

Field : BA
Position Type : Contract Starting : April 21, 2022

Ending : October 21, 2022

Resources Required : 1

Position Description

The Planning and Strategy is a fast paced and dynamic team within the Network and Technology organization. Specifically, the planning and strategy team is responsible for the fast-paced delivery of strategies, the setting of executive targets and the reporting to measure against them. We are also accountable for long-term planning to enable the organization to remain successful in a highly competitive environment.
Job Duties/Accountabilities:
The Project Coordinator/Project Manager will join the team and will assume overall responsibility for the following:
Working collaboratively with a variety of stakeholders, internal departments and vendors to coordinate the collection and digestion of complex data
Synthetizing large amounts of data and identifying trends, potentials risks and developing remediation plans
Developing and maintaining repeatable reporting for various programs, building summary views and executive-level slides and IT dashboards
Managing incoming requests, tracking and coordinating requests for time-sensitive reporting
Managing a high rate of change within constrained timelines in a very fast-paced environment
Facilitating multi-domain/stakeholder calls and proactively managing action registers in a timely fashion
Working with global teams and across overlapping time zones
Working occasional weekends and evenings as required
Providing relevant and high quality project governance and communication to sponsors, executives and project team members, including key project milestones, weekly status reports, action registers, and risk assessments/contingency plans.
Responding to issues and managing the customer’s expectations
Managing and tracking budget activities
Driving innovation and simplicity - identifying opportunities and drive process improvements, standardization, and enablers to gain efficiencies
Critical Qualifications/Competencies:
A minimum 3 years of Project Coordinator or Business Analyst experience
Very strong skills and high level of experience in Excel and Powerpoint
Very strong organization skills, time management, and very high attention to detail
Very strong ability to manage multiple parallel streams of work
Very strong verbal and written communication skills
Strong ability to be responsive in a timely fashion and complete deliverables in the face of multiple priorities and challenging timelines
Strong negotiation and facilitation skills
Ability to work independently as well as in a team setting; a self motivator
Proven ability to manage fast-paced projects with a significant amount of change
Ability to manage ambiguity, uncertainty and changing priorities
Preferred Qualifications /Competencies:
Knowledge of project management methodology and best practices, proficiency using MS Office products (Excel, Word, PowerPoint), proven ability to build automated IT dashboards and strong understanding of the Project Life Cycle. Formal project management training is desirable; PMI/PMP certification is not required but is considered an asset.
Experience in Information Technology, along with a background knowledge of the telecommunications industry
Knowledge and understanding of Client’s network, systems, IT and Operations processes
Knowledge of Client’s residential services products
Knowledge and experience in building dashboards and executive level PPT slides
Working Conditions:
Ability to efficiently work in virtual and co-located teams, handling multiple projects, a high rate of change with significant time sensitivity and aggressive timelines
Fast paced working environment interfacing with a myriad of stakeholders
Available to work occasional weekends and evenings as required
Ability to work with global teams and across overlapping time zones

Title: Sales Business Performance Analyst (Remote)
Description:
Deliver with passion
Quadient delivers exceptional experiences with passion. We continually strive to innovate and reimage something new. That inspires and motivates people to exceed expectations. Our business success is underpinned by the trust that our clients invest in our products, and in our commitment to delivering the very best solutions. This trust is earned by great people, doing a great job. We call it: The Power Of You.
Summary:
Do you have Salesforce (SFDC) and sales analytics experience? Are you comfortable with Salesforce, SAP, Power BI and Excel? Yes? Then we want to talk to you!
As a Business Performance Analyst, you can be the driving force behind the world's most meaningful customer experiences, helping our customers create personalized interactions. We simplify the connections between people and what matters.
In This Role, You Will:
Develop management reporting and actionable insights for internal stakeholders to help them better understand and optimize their business (weekly, monthly, and quarterly cadences)
Act as the primary business partner to key Sales leaders; Assist with business plan frameworks, including weekly forecasting, QBRs, and rep performance analysis
Business partner to Sales - Fosters close, cooperative relationships with managers and department support personnel.
Develop Go-to-Market (GTM) framework in partnership with Sales, Marketing and BizOps leaders; Includes territory analysis, capacity management, GTM performance, and ROI analysis.
Contribute to other departmental metrics, KPIs, scorecards and business analysis as needed
What You Bring:
Understanding of sales processes and solution selling cycle
5+ years sales/business operations and analytics experience, or directly relevant experience
Proven ability to interpret analysis and provide actionable insights and recommendations beyond the initial delivery of the data
Proficiency in Salesforce, PowerBI, SAP, and Excel
Able to influence without authority and serve as a trusted advisor to internal stakeholders and teams
Highly organized and accountable; Able to develop, manage, and communicate status of projects across teams in support of a common goal. Delivers projects on time and with highest quality.
Sharp, energetic, assertive and results-oriented; able to prioritize and focus in an evolving environment
Demonstrated ability to collect stakeholder feedback, deeply understand their pain points, and meet them on their level to drive solutions
Passionate about solving unmet needs to department leaders and delivering awesome projects that they love using to accomplish their goals
What We Bring:
We want Quadient to be a place where we are all able to bring our whole selves to work and where our differences are embraced and celebrated. We operate in diverse areas, cultures and communities; our customers are as unique as we are. We celebrate our shared commitment to great work — and to each other. As a diverse collective of thinkers and doers, we are continuously inspiring innovation.
Our values define how we work as a team: Empowerment, Passion, Inspiration and Community. They make us EPIC. Together.
About Quadient:
At Quadient, we exist to help organizations simplify the connection between their customers and what matters most. From mortgage approvals, medical results, and insurance claims, to accounts receivables, invoices and inbound packages.
Every day - we help companies manage over 788 million connections with their customers. Our award-winning solutions and best in class customer service are the reasons we have grown to become the driving force behind the world’s most meaningful customer experiences.
Disclaimer:
We thank all applicants in advance for their interest but regret that only candidates under consideration will be contacted. We are an equal opportunity employer.
Quadient Canada is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, or age.
As part of our commitment to accessibility for all persons with disabilities, Quadient Canada welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process.
Quadient does not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies or fee-based recruitment services. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Quadient employees or any organization location. Quadient is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Business Performance
Sr Analyst-Global Pricing Performance & Insights
Description:
You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.
At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible — and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way. When you join #TeamAmex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day.
American Express Global Commercial Services (GCS) is the Global leader in the Corporate Payments Solutions space and subsequently continues to be an exciting and fast-growing business. The Global Pricing Performance & Insights (PPI) team within GCS, is instrumental in leading data driven insights to elevate Customer engagement, accelerate sales and drive profitable charge volume growth for the organization.
The Analyst position within the Global Pricing Performance & Insights (PPI) organization offers the opportunity to be part of this dynamic organization. The incumbent reporting to the Manager of PPI International, will play a critical role in supporting the development of growth and analytic strategies to increase performance and drive execution while working alongside senior leadership with GCS.

The incumbent will enhance business decision-making process by providing insightful and analytical recommendations using data across International organisation to drive growth, highlighting trends, risks and opportunities. The individual is also responsible for supporting global standardization efforts, develop and implement process improvements, drives automation to gain efficiencies across core activities and functions.
Key Responsibilities include:
Creation of senior leadership reporting, data analysis, planning and performance measurement
Navigate through multiple data layers to create different views across international markets
Consult and collaborate with PPI leadership and internal teams to analyze and collaborate on strategic business
Initiatives to drive performance and profitability across Sales and Account Development
Performing analytics, predictive models on market data and support growth initiatives
Performing complex analysis to provide key summaries and recommendations by manipulating broken data
Be strategic and able to identify opportunities to initiate analysis that creates a positive impact on business


2-4 years of relevant work experience with Bachelor’s in a quantitative field (e.g. Computer Science, Statistics, Econometrics, Mathematics)
Minimum 2 years of hands on experience with SQL/ Hive/Python /MLS * Must have
Experience in Tableau visualizations, calculated fields and code for hierarchy user access of data *Must have
Strong Strategic & Analytical Thinking: Require extensive analytical experience to support Pricing Performance Insights
Manager and Business in reviews and special projects. Ability to adopt a broad perspective and link data into information that supports business strategies to specific initiatives.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Change management: Be an agent of change, ability to initiate and adapt to change. Provides solutions to address
Business transformation, strategic alignment, technology implementation and culture change. Incorporate risk mitigation planning/execution.
Effective Communication and Build relationships: Ability to write structured and compelling messages addressed to
Various audiences/levels within the organization. Ability to communicate outcome to stakeholders highlighting data findings that convert into actions
Growth Mindset: Will to make things happen and go above and beyond. Ability to challenge status quo, innovate and
Think out of the box. Ability to manage multiple and complex work streams across departmental boundaries and deliver a
Diverse set ofinitiatives that result in transformational outcomes
Self-starter and high level of accountability and able to solve ambiguous/ open ended business challenges
Proven ability to deliver results in a fast paced and highly matrixed environment
Strong teamwork required with their colleagues and other teams, and ability to manage multiple priorities. Strong work
Ethic with a will-to-win and demonstrated personal excellence
Experience in Customer Relationship Management tools (i.e. Salesforce, other)
Ability to work under pressure and meet tight timelines, eye for detail

Offer of employment with American Express is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background verification check, subject to applicable laws and regulations.
Currently, the Company requires that colleagues be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 in order to work in or visit any of our Canada offices, subject to legally required accommodations. If the role you are applying for is designated as hybrid or onsite, you will be required to visit our offices.

If you have a disability and need accommodation, please speak with the Recruiter for more information.

Title: Senior Business Analyst – Marketing
Description:
Who We Are, What We Do, Where We Are Going
Magnet Forensics is a global leader in the development of digital investigative software that acquires, analyzes and shares evidence from computers, smartphones, tablets and other IoT related devices. We are continually innovating so that our customers can deploy advanced and effective tools to protect their communities, countries and companies.

Headquartered out of Waterloo, ON but with over 400 employees spread out globally, Magnet is continuing to expand and grow. Where we are today, is not where we want to be tomorrow.
Your Role
The Senior Business Analyst (BA) is responsible for creating or improving new or existing business models and processes that support strategic business decisions. The Senior BA will engage with business leaders and team members to analyze systems, data, and processes to identify data-driven changes that will create efficiencies, add value, and deliver on Magnet's Strategic Initiatives. The Senior BA will ensure their recommendations are successfully implemented and adopted throughout Magnet.
What You Will AccomplishCreate detailed business analysis that outline opportunities for improvement and supporting solutionsData analysisCommunicate with business leaders and team members to understand business process and go forward strategiesAct as an expert resource to business leads and team members in designing business processes that introduce efficienciesTrain new and existing usersCreating and maintaining documentation on processes, policies, and help related materials for team membersAssist technical consultants with the development of technical documentation of existing and future applications.Writing detailed descriptions and workflow diagrams of users current and projected needs program functions, and steps required to modifyGather and draft requirements and functional specification documentsProvide change management support during system implementation
What We Are Looking For
We’re looking for someone who checks off most, but not all, of the boxes listed in “skills and experiences”. It’s more important to us to find candidates who can display indicators of success through skills they have developed and experiences they have been a part of, than to find folks who have ‘been there, done that”. We want to be part of your development journey, and we’ll learn as much from you as you learn from us.

There are a couple must haves, but we will keep that list short:
5 + years’ experience work implementing and improving dynamic business process & systems3 + years’ experience working with marketing business teamsExperience with Salesforce.com and other marketing systemsAbility to work with cross functional teams
The Most Important Thing
We’re looking for candidates that can provide examples of how they have demonstrated Magnet InteGRITy in their previous experiences:
Greater Good – We think beyond our own interests and strive to improve communities around the world. This demonstrates our passion for making a difference in the world.
Respect – We hold ourselves accountable through transparent sharing of information and we have faith in each other’s abilities
Innovation – We lead the industry in excellence and reliability while keeping the user experience simple and relevant. We are not afraid to push the boundaries to stay ahead of our competitors.
Teamwork – We collaborate internally and externally, while caring about each other and listening to our customers.
Magnet Forensics Inc. is an affirmative action, equal opportunity employer. It is Magnet Forensics policy to recruit and select applicants for employment solely on the basis of their qualifications, with emphasis on selecting the best-qualified person for the job. Magnet Forensics does not discriminate against applicants based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, or disability or any other status or condition protected by applicable law.

Magnet Forensics encourages applications from all qualified candidates. Magnet Forensics has a great record of accommodating persons with disabilities. Contact our AODA contact at aoda@magnetforensics.com or 519-342-0195, if you need accommodation at any stage of the application process or want more information on our accommodation policies.

Title: Business Intelligence & Analytics Specialist
Description:
BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE & ANALYTICS SPECIALIST (JOB NUMBER: HR-050422-001-MCB)
MISSION AND OBJECTIVES
BNP Paribas HR Analytics & Insights team delivers decision-supporting dashboards and headcount reports to HR Management, HR Subject Matters Experts (SMEs) and Business leads. As part of the 2025 roadmap, BNP Paribas HR is set to improve both its efficiency and effectiveness while significantly enhancing its service offer. The team will offer sophisticated visualizations and predictive models, featuring workforce metrics, analytics, trends analysis and recommendations to further support the Business in its decisions and strengthen our employee value proposition.
To deliver upon the ambition, the team is looking for a skilled proactive professional, passionate about business intelligence and analytics, with proven experience in data investigation, predictive modeling, a strong knowledge of data storytelling with the ability to design dashboards to tell the story.
The candidate must also demonstrate strong interpersonal relationship skills, and the ability to closely work with senior leaders in HR and business leads to shape data-driven solutions and provide insights. Acting as a front-door to the HR Analytics team, their passion for analytics must be complemented with the ability to be organized, prioritize and negotiate timelines, work efficiently with peer business and technology teams, and have strong interest in leaning the business.
The candidate will also perform business analysis and deliver PeopleSoft reporting.
This is a key position requiring both technical knowledge and business acumen and is ideal for individuals who thrive in a fast-paced environment. Strong interpersonal relationship skills are required, as the Business Intelligence & Analytics specialist will interact with senior leaders in HR and business leads to shape data-driven solutions.
This position will provide stimulating opportunities for motivated individuals to contribute to the success of the strategic HR roadmap.

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES
The scope of work covers below main activities:
1. Business Intelligence and analytics
Build and maintain strong connections with HR leadership and SMEs to understand their strategic goals and business imperatives with respect to workforce analysis and planning, thus delivering reporting which bring maximum value.
Design, develop and maintain standardized dashboards, metrics, KPIs and reports including with PeopleSoft.
Provide summary level and detailed reports incrementally and on an ad-hoc basis; examples include overtime reports, time-off management, headcount reports, payroll reports
Implement best in class data processes, data management and data quality controls.
Use data as a driver to provide the business with insights
Identify and use multiple data sources, analyze and present results – interpret data and derives significant patterns or points of attention, provide recommendations and insight based on key trends and knowledge of business challenges.
Produce analysis and sharp visualizations through business analytics and intelligence technologies such as PowerBI to help make informed decisions.
Help team enhance scope of Data Science activities: e.g. Developing Forecasting, Multi-Variate models, Regression/Correlation analysis, Machine learning, AI, etc.
Co-create solutions with our Enterprise Data Management team to ensure scalable solutions are delivered
Train and coach HR teams on how to interpret data and metrics and make the best use of the reports and dashboards
Demonstrate a continuous learning curve and open mind-set to bring in innovative ideas.

2. Project management
Autonomously design, plan and drive successful delivery of projects using strong project management skills
Comprehensive assessment of business needs to build a precise understanding of requirements and translate into functional specifications
Project contribution at all stages of development
Keep track of the pipeline confirmed priorities, ensure features are developed, reviewed, thoroughly tested, and implemented as per user requirements.

3. Database Management/HR Workflow
Maintain data integrity, create and utilize reports and data queries to authenticate integrity of employee information, resolves differences between Finance and Human Resources systems, and assist with reconciling data between PeopleSoft and other internal compensation systems, including Payroll
Participate in auditing and maintenance of employee records, including HR status updates, terminations, and new hires

4. Additional missions may include
Participate in alternative systems research and RFPs
Support and assist new product implementation both within Human Resources and outside the department.
KEY SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Science, Math, Engineering, Finance or similar field
15 years overall experience with at least 4 years’ experience in analytics, business intelligence, or similar roles.
Strong stakeholder expectations, prioritization, presentation, timeline negotiation skills
Experience with fostering strong working relationships with Sr managers and partners
Experience in People Analytics
Experience in building and managing data infrastructure
Strong applied mathematical, statistical, and analytical skills to design and interpret descriptive and predictive statistics
Experience in data mining, text analytics, data collection strategies
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with an ability to convey ideas and effective story-telling through data, reports and dashboards.
Client-focused, ability to effectively collaborate and communicate with the respective HR and Business stakeholders;
Strong analytical and problem solving skills with high attention to detail and accuracy.
Experience with HRIS Systems (Peoplesoft, WorkDay HCM is an asset but not mandatory as training can be provided)
Outstanding operational and organizational skills in addition to detailed oriented work
Ability to work under pressure to meet deadlines
Self-starter, proactive in seeking information and approaching business problems with creativity
Able to work well independently and in a team environment
Experience working in a large, complex organization is an advantage

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Bilingual: English and French
Proficient with PowerBi, Tableau, or similar business intelligence and analytics tools.
Coding knowledge and experience in several languages: for example, R, Python, Java, MS Excel/VBA, , etc.
Experience with database programming languages including SQL
Knowledge of Business Objects
Experience in one or more of the ETL platforms such as KNIME, Alteryx
Experience with data sources and reporting tools; HCM PeopleSoft

** Only selected applications that meet the requirements of the role will be contacted **

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Developer
Description:
Make a difference
Our Business Intelligence team is still growing! Are you passionate about Business Intelligence and looking for an opportunity to join a growing team within an organization that invests in its communities? Do you have experience in software development for business intelligence in a Microsoft environment? If so, we want you! We are searching for a collaborative and strategic developer who enjoys working in a fast-paced environment. You will have the opportunity to join our new data-focused team on one of our organization’s largest and most impactful initiatives!
This position reports to the Manager, Business Intelligence within the Information Technology and Services (ITS) department of TCHC. Performing in a senior role, this position supports both existing business software systems and develops new ones, as authorized by client business groups through ITS management. This position is involved in all areas of BI systems development, from business concept to implementation.
TCHC is currently going through a major transformation of one of its main tenant management system to an integrated cloud based housing management solution where upwards of 40 systems will be migrated to the new system. ITS is also building out a new BI roadmap to create a unified BI strategy to provide analytics and future BI capabilities.
What you’ll do

Works with internal clients to gather business requirements and evaluates data requirements by using data profiling to create source to target data mappings
Translates user requirements into technical architecture vision and implementation plans, going from design to implementation to production support
Designs data models including customized business dimensions, facts and measures to support scorecard and self-service reporting needs
Designs databases using star, snowflake, normalization techniques required for data modelling
Designs cube projects (SSAS / Tabular) including cube hierarchies, partitioning, processing and loading strategies
Ensures consistent use of internal information architecture standards
Uses Microsoft SQL Server Analysis Services, Integration Services, Reporting Services and Power BI to develop interactive dashboards, data visualizations, balance scorecards and other analytics for self-service BI solutions
Designs, develops and maintains the Extract Transformation And Loading (ETL) programs required to build BI solutions
Develops BI reports, dashboards and analytics to support TCHC’s corporate business ensuring optimal performance and availability
Builds a data pipeline to enable data integration from disparate, large data sources. Drives collection of new data, refinement of existing data sources, working with Data Governance to ensure compliance of data standards
Performs ad-hoc database migrations, upgrades, installations, configurations, troubleshooting and monitoring of SQL Server databases
Assists with BI project work efforts estimation
Develops detailed technical specifications, User Guides and ETL documentation including training of users
Serves as Subject Matter Expert in BI tool development concepts
Researches into the current state of BI marketplace to make recommendations and selection criteria for the procurement of new BI tools and technologies
Coordinates and supports development efforts of technical and corporate staff with database tuning efforts as well as ongoing application implementation, support and upgrades
Supports production issues and maintenance as necessary – acting as second level support for troubleshooting and resolving BI related applications / databases
Participates in BCP and DR planning, ITSM process improvement, run book creation and service catalog updates

What you’ll need

University degree or equivalent
University degree in computer science or a relevant technical discipline preferred
5 years’ experience in designing / architecting high performance ETL programs using T-SQL and SSIS, developing and maintaining dashboards and reports using Microsoft technologies (SSRS reports, SSAS / Tabular cubes, Power BI), building data warehouses, analytics, and dimension modeling using IDE tools such as Visual Studio, Eclipse or Jupyter Notebook
3+ years’ experience with master data management, development on big data platforms (Hortonworks, Cloudera or Azure) and languages such as Python, R or SPARQL
3 years’ experience with data modeling multidimensional and tabular models, data management, data migration, data cleansing and synchronization and working with business clients directly by consulting with them to gather requirements to deliver projects
Experience working with various forms of data infrastructure including SQL Server, Hive, Impala and column-oriented databases such as Cassandra, MongoDB etc.
Experience with Hadoop modules such as HDFS, MapReduce, Hive, YARN, HBASE and Oozie
ITIL certification
Demonstrated knowledge about business intelligence, the use of BI and analytics to improve business operations
Demonstrated knowledge of multidimensional and tabular data models
Demonstrated ability to create standards and go from design to implementation
Demonstrated capable of performing SQL Server database backups, restores and patching on Windows environments
Excellent oral and written communication skills and ability to present to client groups, to consult with technical and non-technical staff and to prepare reports and proposals  Must be able to handle multiple priorities in a fast paced environment
Excellent organizational skills to deliver projects on-time and on-budget
Excellent interpersonal and conflict resolution skills, sensitivity and tact
Demonstrated experience with working on large scale and multiyear initiatives
Demonstrated experience with Microsoft BI stack
Demonstrated experience with Microsoft Azure, Power BI or other modern BI tools
Demonstrated experience building SSAS / Tabular cubes and Power BI dashboards / reports against such cubes
Demonstrated experience in building / designing / maintaining a SQL Server data warehouse
Has worked in large data migration projects
Demonstrated knowledge and experience with Hadoop, Hortonworks HDP and Linux server environment is a plus
Experience with social housing management is a plus
Excellent analytical skills, able to manage multiple projects under strict timelines, work well in a demanding dynamic environment and meet overall objectives
High level of personal integrity, and the ability to professionally handle confidential matters and show an appropriate level of judgment and maturity
High degree of initiative, dependability and ability to work with little supervision

What’s next
Once you apply, we’ll review your resume and cover letter to determine if your skills and experience match the qualifications for the role. Only qualified candidates will be contacted to move forward in the hiring process. If you are contacted, the process will include one or more interviews and/or assessments and reference checks.
Candidates for unionized positions must score a minimum of 70% to pass any interview or assessment and be considered for the next stage of the recruitment process. Successful candidates will be determined based on score and where applicable, union seniority. Note: not all candidates who score 70% or higher will automatically proceed to the next stage of the recruitment process as this will be dependent on the number of candidates and number of available roles.
Please Note: TCHC has a mandatory vaccination policy wherein staff are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of November 23, 2021 with the exception of employees with approved accommodations.

Title: Business Analyst, Strategic Initiatives and Change Management
Description:
Come Work with Us!  At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.  Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.





































































































 Job Title




































 Business Analyst, Strategic Initiatives and Change Management
  





































 Job Description






































 Engage with Finance line teams on all aspects of the project lifecycle, from analysis through design, testing, change readiness and implementation
 Engage with various IT groups throughout the project lifecycle, including collaboration at key stages, e.g. UAT issue management and issue resolution
 Responsible for all related business deliverables including business requirements, stakeholder analysis, functional specification, testing approach, use/test cases and change readiness planning
 Influence the project scope and solution, based on thorough understanding the business needs, and the related technical and business architecture
 Responsible for functional and integration testing, where required, including analysis and documentation of test results
 Function as the project’s main point of contact for Finance business users
 Engage and solution business challenges using process reengineering and technology deliveries
 Responsible for building and maintaining a repository of reusable requirements documentation to support future initiatives
 Provide consulting services to business stakeholders, offering subject matter expertise on feasibility of initiatives and proposed solutions
 Interface with senior executives to provide updates on projects and drive resolution of roadblocks


 Must-have

 Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration or Finance/Accounting related discipline
 Relevant previous experience working in a change management function, within Financial Services
 Experience with various project delivery methodologies, such as Waterfall, Iterative, and/or Agile
 Strong commercial acumen, knowledge and understanding of Wholesale and Retail banking processes
 Strong functional knowledge / experience of Finance processes
 Relevant business analysis experience
 In-depth understanding of Finance data and process flows front to back


 Nice-to-have

 Enrolment in or completion of CPA Certification, Certified Business Analysis Professional and/or Project Management Institute – Professional in Business Analysis
 Large scale change/project delivery experience in Finance







































 Job Summary




































 The Strategic Initiatives and Change Management Analyst will support business analysis activities for data, process and technology projects driven by or impacting Wholesale Finance. You will support the Finance teams globally in tasks associated with the Finance Strategic Initiatives and Change Management programs of work recommending solutions to problems found during project life cycle.
  




































 Address:

2022-04-11-07:00

 Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment
 At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.  We also strive to provide an accessible candidate experience for our prospective employees with different abilities.
