Title: Senior Analyst, Information Quality
Description:
Category Data Analysis

City Toronto, Ottawa, Ontario, Canada


Job Description Senior Analyst, Information Quality


Who we are
We are an organization comprised of industry thought leaders who are passionate about health data and want to make a difference in the health care field. We are an independent, not-for-profit organization and together with our partners we provide essential information on Canada's health systems, enabling decisions that lead to healthier Canadians. As a valued member of the CIHI team, you and your work will have a pivotal role in the evolution of Canada's health care systems.
CIHI is recognized as an exceptional place to work that embraces diversity, respect, integrity, collaboration and innovation.
At CIHI, we recognize what matters to our employees. Some of the benefits of working at CIHI include
HOOPP Pension Plan (Defined Pension)
Retirement Planning Program
Generous vacation days for permanent and long-term contracts
Work-life balance
Career Planning Program
Learning and Professional Development Program
Flexible benefits program from your first day on the job for permanent and long-term contracts


Why is this role important?
The Senior Analyst, Information Quality is responsible for evaluating and reporting on the quality of CIHI’s data holdings and information products by compiling and interpreting data and information from multiple sources, including carrying out statistical and qualitative analyses. They will support the development, implementation and improvement of corporate information quality tools and processes, including metadata and activities related to SAS data governance.


Working closely with CIHI staff and external stakeholders, the Senior Analyst will be responsible for helping identify client-specific and corporate data and information quality needs; planning and conducting analyses; synthesizing, summarizing and presenting results; and critically reviewing other sources of information such as research literature and technical documents. They will also participate in knowledge exchange, process improvement initiatives, strategic planning and promoting a quality culture across CIHI.


What you'll do
1. Develops and maintains a detailed knowledge of CIHI data sources including: reporting standards, data processes and methods, information quality, related analytical/information products.


2. Develops and maintains a detailed knowledge of CIHI’s Information Quality Framework and the tools and activities that it encompasses; and supports its enhancement and implementation across the organization in accordance with the CIHI’s Information Quality Plan.

3. Participates in quality-related projects, including project development, planning and coordination; conducting analysis; summarizing and interpreting results; writing reports and presenting findings to internal and external clients.

4. Provides consultative support to internal and external clients with respect to the analysis of data to help identify, investigate and document quality issues; and suggest ways to improve information quality.


5. Participates in the development and delivery of internal education and knowledge exchange sessions relating to data and information quality.

6. Assists in the development of analytical techniques and information quality monitoring tools as needed. Develops and documents new analytic methodologies in collaboration with CIHI staff.


7. Keeps current with respect to the relevant research literature.

8. Participates in other corporate project teams as required.

9. Contributes to the promotion of CIHI products and services through participation on committees, attendance at conferences, assisting with the preparation of articles for publication and other activities as required.

10. Respects privacy and confidentiality of information by following policies in Privacy and Confidentiality of Health Information at CIHI and related procedures and directives.

11. Assumes responsibility for other related duties as assigned


What you'll bring to the table
Undergraduate degree in a relevant subject (e.g. Health Information, Statistics, Social Sciences)


3 - 5 years related experience. Preference will be given to candidates with experience in:
Synthesizing and presenting information for different audiences
Information quality management practices
Analyzing multiple large and complex datasets (including longitudinal data)

Strong conceptual and problem solving skills.

Strong verbal communication skills; strong analytical and technical writing skills.

Ability to synthesize and translate data into information for non-analysts, including strong data visualization and report writing skills.

Knowledge of SAS for data analysis and statistical methods (advanced SAS knowledge is an asset).

Knowledge of data and information quality concepts, tools, methodologies and practices and the ability to apply them to a variety of data and products.

Knowledge of data governance practices, including metadata management, is an asset.

Ability to multi-task and work effectively in a matrix environment.

Knowledge of CIHI’s databases. Advanced knowledge of one or more is an asset.

Knowledge of the Canadian health care system is an asset.

Ability to fulfill occasional travel requirements.

Fluency in both official languages is an asset.


Closing Statement
To find out more about this role and other exciting opportunities visit our website at www.cihi.ca and check out our 'Careers' section.
We thank all those who apply, however, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
Vaccination remains the most effective tool to reduce the risk of COVID-19. CIHI is committed to ensuring the health and safety of our employees in the workplace, and therefore CIHI requires proof of vaccination for all of our employees unless a valid accommodation under legislation exists.


Employment Equity
At CIHI we are committed to fostering an inclusive, barrier-free and accessible environment. Part of this commitment includes arranging accommodations to ensure an equitable opportunity to participate in the recruitment and selection process. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.




Analyste principal, Qualité des données


Notre organisation
Notre organisation regroupe des leaders d'opinion de l'industrie qui sont passionnés par les données et veulent faire bouger les choses dans le domaine de la santé. À titre d'organisme autonome et sans but lucratif, nous collaborons avec nos partenaires pour fournir de l'information essentielle sur les systèmes de santé au pays, favorisant la prise de décisions éclairées qui visent à améliorer la santé des Canadiens. À titre d'employé de l'ICIS, vous jouerez un rôle déterminant dans l'évolution du système de santé canadien.
Nous offrons un milieu de travail exceptionnel qui favorise la diversité, le respect, l'intégrité, la collaboration et l'innovation.
L'ICIS, sachant ce qui importe à ses employés, leur offre une gamme d'avantages, dont les suivants :
une structure salariale concurrentielle
un régime d'avantages sociaux flexible dès le premier jour de travail
l'adhésion au régime de retraite HOOPP
un programme de planification de la retraite
un équilibre travail-vie personnelle
un programme de planification de carrière
des programmes d'apprentissage et de perfectionnement professionnel


Pourquoi ce rôle est-il important ?
L’analyste principal, Qualité de l’information, évalue la qualité des banques de données et des produits d’information de l’ICIS et en fait rapport en compilant et en interprétant les données et l’information provenant de sources multiples, ce qui comprend l’exécution d’analyses statistiques et qualitatives. Il appuie l’élaboration, la mise en œuvre et l’amélioration des outils et des processus de l’ICIS liés à la qualité de l’information, notamment les métadonnées.

En étroite collaboration avec le personnel de l’ICIS et les intervenants externes, l’analyste principal aide à cerner les besoins des clients et de l’organisme en matière de qualité des données et de l’information, planifie et réalise des analyses, synthétise, résume et présente les résultats et scrute avec un œil critique d’autres sources d’information, comme des travaux de recherche et des documents techniques. Il participe également aux activités d’échange de connaissances, aux initiatives d’amélioration des processus, à la planification stratégique et à la promotion d’une culture organisationnelle de la qualité.


Quelles seront vos responsabilités ?
1. Acquérir et maintenir une connaissance approfondie des banques de données de l’ICIS, y compris les normes de déclaration, les méthodes et processus liés aux données, la qualité de l’information ainsi que les produits analytiques et d’information connexes.

2. Acquérir et maintenir une connaissance approfondie du Cadre de la qualité de l’information de l’ICIS de même que des outils et activités qui s’y rattachent, et en appuyer l’amélioration et la mise en œuvre à l’échelle de l’organisme conformément au Plan d’assurance de la qualité de l’information de l’ICIS.

3. Participer aux projets sur la qualité, dont l’élaboration, la planification et la coordination de projets, la réalisation d’analyses, la synthèse et l’interprétation des résultats, la rédaction de rapports et la présentation de résultats aux clients internes et externes.

4. Offrir un soutien consultatif aux clients internes et externes en ce qui a trait à l’analyse des données en vue de repérer, d’étudier et de consigner les problèmes de qualité des données et suggérer des façons d’améliorer la qualité de l’information.

5. Participer à l’élaboration et à la présentation de séances internes de formation et de partage des connaissances sur la qualité des données et de l’information.

6. Contribuer à l’élaboration de techniques analytiques et d’outils de contrôle de la qualité de l’information, au besoin. Élaborer et consigner les nouvelles méthodologies analytiques en collaboration avec le personnel de l’ICIS.

7. Rester au fait des travaux de recherche pertinents.

8. Collaborer avec d’autres équipes de projets de l’ICIS, au besoin.

9. Contribuer à la promotion des produits et services de l’ICIS en participant à des comités, à des conférences, à la préparation d’articles pour publication et à d’autres activités, au besoin.

10. Respecter le droit à la vie privée et protéger la confidentialité des renseignements en suivant les politiques énoncées dans le document Le respect de la vie privée et la confidentialité des renseignements personnels sur la santé à l’ICIS ainsi que les procédures et directives connexes.

11. Assumer d’autres fonctions connexes assignées.


Que mettriez-vous à profit ?

Diplôme de premier cycle dans une discipline pertinente (p. ex. information sur la santé, statistique ou sciences sociales).

3 à 5 ans d’expérience pertinente. La préférence sera accordée aux candidats ayant de l’expérience dans les domaines suivants :
la synthétisation et la présentation d’information destinée à divers publics;
les pratiques de gestion de la qualité de l’information;
l’analyse de nombreux ensembles de données volumineux et complexes (incluant les données longitudinales).

Excellentes aptitudes pour la conceptualisation et la résolution de problèmes.

Excellentes aptitudes pour la communication orale ainsi que pour l’analyse et la rédaction technique.

Aptitudes à résumer et à vulgariser les données pour les non-analystes, notamment d’excellentes aptitudes pour la présentation visuelle des données et pour la rédaction de rapports.

Expérience de l’utilisation de SAS et connaissance des méthodes d’analyse de données et statistiques (connaissance approfondie de SAS, un atout).

Connaissance des concepts, des outils, des méthodologies et des pratiques liés à la qualité des données et de l’information et capacité de les utiliser pour diverses données et produits.

Connaissance des pratiques de gouvernance des données, y compris la gestion des métadonnées, un atout.

Capacité de gérer plusieurs tâches de front et de travailler efficacement dans un environnement matriciel.

Connaissance des bases de données de l’ICIS; connaissance approfondie d’au moins une, un atout.

Connaissance du système de santé canadien, un atout.

Capacité de répondre aux exigences de déplacements occasionnels.

Maîtrise de l’anglais essentielle; maîtrise du français, un atout


Declaration
Pour en savoir plus sur cette offre ou sur d'autres excellentes possibilités, visitez-nous au www.icis.ca et parcourez notre section Carrières.
Nous remercions tous les participants, mais nous ne communiquerons qu'avec les candidats retenus.
La vaccination reste l’outil le plus efficace pour réduire le risque de COVID-19. L’ICIS s’engage à assurer la santé et la sécurité de ses employés au lieu de travail. Par conséquent, l’ICIS exige une preuve de vaccination pour tous ses employés, à moins qu’une mesure d’adaptation ne s’applique en vertu de la loi.


Équité en emploi
L'ICIS s'engage à offrir un milieu de travail inclusif, sans obstacle et accessible. Il s'engage entre autres à prendre les mesures d'adaptation nécessaires en vue de favoriser une participation équitable aux processus de recrutement et de sélection. Par conséquent, si vous avez des besoins spéciaux, nous nous efforcerons d'y répondre.

Title: Business Systems Analyst
Description:
You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You'll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you'll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.
Job Description:
Business Systems Analyst
Band 5
Role Summary:
The Business Systems Analyst will use his/her knowledge of business objectives, processes, products, technology and quality concepts to:
Partner with business and information technology areas to ensure the delivery of quality solutions that meet the needs of the business.
Plan and manage the business requirements effort required on small- to mid-sized projects to support business needs including change management of business requirements and estimating work effort.
Particpate as a member of project teams to implement business solutions and applications
Main Accountabilities:
Identify and assist in the re-engineering, improvement or replacement of existing business processes and associated technology
Elicit, document, examine and manage business requirements on projects by following the current company development methodology. This involves managing business requirements sessions, conducting interviews and accessing existing documentation
Understand relationships and facilitate the communication between the business and technology areas
Coordinate and facilitate business requirements gathering sessions, gap analysis, risk assessment and business requirements validation
Translate the business requirements into functional requirements. Ensure traceability and understanding of the requirements by all project/support members to enable systems enhancements /projects to be constructed
Participate in Project Management activities such as managing the delivery of projects through initiation, estimating, work planning, analysis, design, constructions, deployment and post-project review
Engage IT resources such as architects, designers, developers, and the testing team at the appropriate times in the project life cycle
Competencies:
Customer and results focused: ability to work with customers to understand and act based on their needs, assess risks, and achieve a valued result
Strong analysis, organization and problem solving skills
Consistently builds and maintains relationships within IT and with business clients
Adaptable: maintains effectiveness while managing competing demands, dealing with frequent change, delays or unexpected events
Dependable: Follows instructions in a timely manner, responds to management decisions and follows through on commitments
Professional: superior client facing skills, able to adjust approach to meet the needs of business sponsors and stakeholders. Treats others with respect, reacts well under pressure and accepts responsibility
Judgment: Uses sound and accurate judgment, supports and explains reasons for decisions and makes timely decisions
Proven leadership skills: ability to tactfully bring opinions, comments and thoughts forward. Able to drive discussions and manage business meetings to meet objectives
Strong communication skills: able to understand and accurately interpret the meaning, purpose and importance of verbal and non-verbal messages. Creates an open and trusting environment by sharing information in a timely manner. Ability to express ideas, thoughts and information so that it can be understood by others
Documentation: writes logically and concisely ensuring meaning is clear and presented in a way that meets the user's needs. Applies plain language principles, proper grammar and sentence structure
Innovative: looks for new, sometimes unconventional approaches to the way things are done
Teamwork: Enables and inspires others, assist members of the project team to meet common goals and timelines, works closely with and supports the Project Manager to delivery on time and on budget
Strong knowledge and experience using business analysis principles and industry best practices (eg. business process modeling, conceptual data modeling) and tools
Ability to work in a global multi-site environment
Experience working in a matrix environment, onshore/offshore IT model
Technical Skills:
Minimum 2 years experience as a business systems analyst involved in all phases of a project life cycle.
Analysis: able to break down high level business requirements into more detail by questioning and probing for clarification
Deliverables: able to produce project documentation including but not limitied to: business, functional/non-functional, and user requirements documents, process and data maps, use cases, tracability matrix, report specifications, implementation and test plans, etc.
Knowledge of systems integration management methodologies, processes and techniques.
Facilitation: able to guide and keep a group on track, recognize issues that need to be dealt with, and ensure everyone is heard, guide the group through collaborative decision-making to achieve its goals
Consulting: Elicit information by applying approaches or styles applicable to the situation. Use questioning techniques and objective listening to clarify expectations and assumptions, make recommendations for alternatives to overcome challenges
Proficient with MS Office suite of products including MS Visio and MS Project
Experience with Third Party vendors and COTS implementation projects.
Assets:
Experience with CMMI or other process improvement methodology
CCBA or CBAP designation or working towards designation
The candidate selected for this role is required to have special clearance from the Royal Canadian Mounted Police. To see if you are eligible for this clearance, please review the section 201 on the Federal Government site (https://www.tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca/esc-src/personnel/pdcf-rsrp-eng.html)

Title: Senior Business Systems Analyst
Description:
Company Description
Momentum Financial Services Group, formerly Money Mart Financial Services is a leading provider of financial services in North America. For 40 years we've been committed to providing financial solutions that meet the evolving needs of consumers and business owners. Backed by a retail network of over 700 locations and robust digital and mobile platforms, we provide access to cash and related products to help our customers achieve their goals. We operate retail locations in local communities and cities across Canada under the Money Mart® brand and in Quebec as Insta Cheques® and in United States as Money Mart® and The Check Cashing Store®.
Our highly skilled workforce puts customers first in everything we do. We serve millions of people annually with diverse and innovative financial products and services. Through this ever-evolving suite of services, we empower customers to manage their finances and improve their lives. Wherever customers are on their financial journey, Momentum Financial Services Group provides solutions.
We believe in giving back to the communities where we live and work. With the generous support of our customers and staff, we proudly contribute over two hundred & fifty thousand dollars annually to charities and non-profit organizations, along with using our time and talent to serve in local communities throughout Canada and the United States. We are looking for aspiring, passionate people who are dedicated to understanding and providing our customers with the right financial solutions utilizing a growing menu of products and services. We embrace diversity and offer a fast-paced work environment.

Job Description
GENERAL FUNCTION
As a Senior Business Systems Analyst, you will be a liaison between business stakeholders and the technology team in all phases of development from solution definition to deployment.

Qualifications
DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES
Assigned to work on varying project assignments & tasks individually or as part of a team
Gather and organize business stakeholder’s business and technical requirements, make recommendations, and create consensus around business solutions.
Translate stakeholder requirements into technical specifications that can be used for development and break down technical complexities so that they can be easily understood by business stakeholders.
Lead and facilitate meetings with the appropriate subject matter experts in both business and technology teams
Understand current state infrastructure, business flows and perform in-depth analysis to develop future state flow
Document workflows and business logic related to data for consumption by end users, technology, QA teams
Review the test cases / test scripts with the QA/ business teams. Provide assistance and guidance during the QA&UAT phases to ensure that test cases are accurate and appropriate, quickly confirm the validity of potential issues, and to determine the root cause and best resolution of verified issues
Work with the application development team to minimize postproduction defects identifying defects as early as possible in the build & test stages of the release cycle
Provide support across full Software development lifecycle (SDLC)
Develop and maintain a broad understanding of Money Mart services and their interaction.
Develop strong internal and external networks to find new opportunities for collaboration.
EXPERIENCE / SKILLS
Minimum of 7 years’ experience in IT field with 5 in a Business Architect / Analyst level position in banking / financial services sector.
Excellent verbal / written communication and presentation skills.
Strong quantitative analytical skills and expertise with MS Office.
Leadership, collaboration, and conflict resolution.
Creativity, ingenuity, and willingness/ability to try new things.
Curiosity to quickly become an expert in new areas and acquire new skills
Additional Information
BENEFITS
Medical / Dental/ Vision benefits available
Company paid life insurance
Paid holidays
PTO / 401K / Tuition Reimbursement
All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
We invest in our employees, and offer extensive training, and development programs to set you up for future success. If we sound like a fit and you’re ready to start an exciting career with an organization that encourages employee growth, apply today! We look for bright, energetic, motivated individuals who are interested in learning and developing their career.

Title: Procurement Business Analyst
Description:
Job summary:







Are you interested in joining us? Please send your resume to:
careers@solotech.com




 Founded over 40 years ago, Solotech is a world leader in audiovisual and entertainment technology with 18 strategic locations in Canada, the United States, the United Kingdom and China. Thanks to an inventory encompassing over 300 renowned manufacturers, Solotech is the single source for audio, video, lighting, rigging, soft goods, control and collaboration solutions and services. The company is internationally recognized for its expertise in Live Productions and Systems Integration in various markets, namely music, sports, business, culture and education. Clients can also benefit from its Service Center, Online Store and virtual technology know-how. Solotech is fully supported by three major shareholders: Claridge, Desjardins Capital and Investissement Québec. The company employs 1,360 professionals in its offices located in Los Angeles, Las Vegas, Nashville, Miami, Orlando, Pensacola, London, Birmingham, Manchester, Calgary, Toronto, Montreal, Ottawa, Quebec City, Saguenay, Halifax, Macau and Hong Kong.





Find out more at 
www.solotech.com




                     Reporting to the Director, Procurement Optimization and Business Intelligence, the Procurement Business Analyst will be responsible to further develop the end-to-end procurement process to improve delivery cycle time and establish operational efficiency.
                   















Your day will look like this:







Identify best procurement practices and optimization opportunities, innovative or emerging processes and latest trends to improve business practices, policies, procedures, and process controls
Streamline the ERP procurement process to introduce business intelligence opportunities (e.g., leverage supplier collaboration opportunities through B2B interfaces)
Collaborate with peers and participate in forums to standardize and mature purchasing management processes and reporting requirements
Establish a procurement forum for key procurement stakeholders across the company to provide oversight, guidance, and support to the business
Gather, validate, and document procurement business requirements
Execute change management plans to drive acceptance and maximize engagement and efficiencies.
Provide guidance and ensure proper application to general company policies
Develop and implement the strategic suppliers business review model, including a scorecard process with continuous improvement plans
Coordinate the preparation of the supplier performance review meetings. Interact with internal stakeholders and suppliers to ensure appropriate support and execution of deliverables
Create, track and report procurement dashboards and KPIs designed for targeted stakeholder audiences 
Enhance operational and financial KPIs, including a supplier dashboard to promote supplier / distributor identification and key data elements (facilitate price list access, preferred distribution channels, delivery lead-time, etc.)
Lead the implementation of a spend classification taxonomy for reporting and compliance monitoring purposes
Monitor and administer the supplier vendor incentive rebate (VIR) and growth incentive rebate (GIR) programs
Monitor and update preferred supplier lists
Perform ad-hoc analysis exercises of spend data
















Your profile:






Bachelor’s Degree in relevant field
Minimum of 5 years experience in procurement best practices and supply chain principles
Excellent computer skills including ERP knowledge (Microsoft Dynamics 365 is an asset), advanced MS Excel analytics skills, including lookups and pivot tables
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in French and English required
Effective time management skills and ability to prioritize and communicate to ensure deadlines are met
Analytical thinker with attention to details
Knowledge of procurement process, PR, approval, PO creation and maintenance
Capability of authoring procedures and work instructions into a formal document
Implementing changes to business processes, reporting and change management specific to procurement, to drive continuous improvement















Our offer to you
:







Competitive compensation and group insurance plan, including telemedicine service
Corporate savings plan with employer contribution
Skills development activities and opportunities for career advancement
Reimbursement of professional fees required for employment
Reimbursement of professional development fees
Work environment conducive to personal health and well-being
Recognition program
Employee assistance program




**We thank all applicants for their interest in Solotech, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Threat Intelligence Analyst
Description:
As an Threat Intelligence Analyst at Fortinet, you will join Cyber Threat Intelligence (CTI) Collections / Analysis team: a group of highly skilled analysts, collectors, and specialists who dedicate themselves to protecting customers and their assets from external threats. With our proprietary hybrid intelligence platforms and methodologies, you will utilize your writing and editing skills to support the production of actionable intelligence for our customer base. Threat intelligence activities include assessing current and emerging threats covering cyber-crime and various forms of malicious exploitation.
Responsibilities:
Monitor, analyze and report on cybersecurity events, incidents and vulnerabilities from multiple sources.
Review and analyze data from various sources such as OSINT / Darknet / TECHINT.
Work closely with Internal Research team to identify customer-specific threats.
Create customer-specific analytical reports based upon identified findings.
Create regular Security Trend reporting utilising information from Internal threat repository.
Analyze information regarding intrusion events, Security incidents and other threat indications and early-warning functions.
Follow best practices of operational security to safeguard sources and methods.
Qualifications:
Strong Information Security fundamentals.
Good understanding of Cyber Threat Intelligence.
Able to create high-quality security analysis reports.
Ability to understand and analyze various threat vectors effectively.
Should have knowledge of cyber threats, malware, APTs, exploits etc.
Familiarity with the DarkNet, DeepWeb, open-source, social media and other sources of cyber-criminal activity.
Strong people skills with the ability to communicate effectively and the ability to explain and elaborate on technical details.
Must be interested to learn new technologies and skills.
Ability to adapt and innovate.
Ability to maintain the highest levels of discretion and confidentiality.
Nice to have:
Experience in SOC environment.
Any experience in Cyber Crime Research.
Certification of CEH, OSCP, and other cybersecurity.
Programming/scripting knowledge.
Language Proficiency: Any international language such as Arabic, Russian, Japanese, Chinese, German, Italian is a plus.
Desired Experience: 2-4 years.
#LI-CN1

Title: Senior Business Analyst, Distribution Solutions
Description:
Senior Business Analyst, Distribution Solutions
You will drive business analysis on our key distribution solution metrics and relevant industry trends while seeking innovative efficiencies within the Distribution Solution teams (i.e., standardizing processes, leveraging internal tools & technology).
Location

Toronto , Canada
Our North American Life & Health business is seeking Senior Business Analyst to join our Toronto-based Distribution Solutions team.

Reporting to the Vice President, Distribution Solutions, you will be responsible for the delivery and overall excellence of distribution focused project planning, documentation & execution while engaging with Distribution Solutions team and key stakeholders. You will formulate business plans and leverage Munich Re’s core competencies to empower individual insurance distribution.
Your job
Support business planning & strategy execution
Support communications, marketing, and presentations for VP Distribution Solutions
Formalize project plans and supporting execution of Distribution Solutions projects
Liaise with internal Munich Re partners to assist in project completion
Establish & measure key metrics
Prepare & support VP updates and presentations to senior executives
Understand the Canadian individual insurance landscape including distribution and Munich Re core capabilities

Your profile
Minimum 7-10 years of working in relevant role, recent project-related work experience in project management, business analysis, process design.
University degree or equivalent in Finance or Business preferred
Strong understanding of individual insurance
Proven ability to deliver results and projects on time & with a high degree of accuracy
Strong communicator and collaborator across multiple business units
Attention to detail and thorough, willing to learn new skills
Able to work independently to complete tasks
Demonstrated ability to perform in a dynamic, rapidly changing environment
Understanding of technology tools and how to leverage tech as a force multiplier
Passionate about making a difference and comfortable with ambiguity

About us
Together, we engage with everything we have and are, to help humankind act braver and better.

As the world’s leading reinsurance company with more than 40,000 employees in over 50 locations around the globe, Munich Re introduces a paradigm shift in the way you think about insurance. By turning uncertainty into manageable risk, we enable fundamental change. We recognize Diversity, Inclusion, and Belonging as a key priority with a culture that welcomes different thoughts and opinions. We dare to think big and are continuously innovating on behalf of our clients.

Our data, our technology, and our teams place us in a unique position to drive transformative change in the life insurance industry. We invest strategically in our world class talent, offering our employees a work experience that promotes professional development, innovation, and rewards high performance.
Please note that only candidates who are selected for interview will be contacted directly.
We thank all candidates for their interest.

Title: Senior Consultant, Business Systems Analyst
Description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.
At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.
To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com
Job Description
You’ll join CIBC’s Corporate Centre Technology (CCT), Finance, Human Resources & Corporate Secretary, and Legal Technology (FHRCST) Team. As a Senior Consultant, Business Systems Analyst (BSA), you’ll be leading complex projects to provide solutions aligned to CIBC and CCT’s strategic roadmap. You’ll require to participate in all phase s o f various new and ongoing projects with focus on ideation and solution requirements in collaboration with a diverse team to build f lexible and innovative solutions that deliver a best in class best-in-class client experience.
As the Senior Consultant - BSA, you are a leader who is excited to solve large complex issues, you issues, you will be tasked to provide comprehensive recommendations and proposals, in addition to guidance and coaching to other team members . You’ll be participating in writing user stories for Agile projects as well as preparing traditional Waterfall documentation, , providing support ing to QA and AD functions, maintaining training materials for your domain , m anaging relationships , and communicating with Technology and Business s takeholders.
At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. To successfully perform the work, details on your work arrangement (proportion of on-site and remote work) will be discussed at the time of your interview.
How You’ll Succeed
Understanding and Analyzing Business Requirements – Work closely with various business and technology partners to lead the discussion and build client focused and innovative solutions that meet business requirements and are aligned with CIBC’s and CCT’s strategic roadmap. Conduct in depth analysis of processes, functional, reporting or data integration requirements and document and communicate the information. As a Subject Matter Expert (SME) in your domain, provide advice and direction to various stakeholders to ensure that the business requirements are appropriately defined. Prepare and validate Solution Requirement Documents (SRD) packages and obtain required signoffs.
Reporting & Analytics – Take ownership of several reports and prepare on an ongoing basis, Lead the delivery of streamlined process, influence decisions and/or identify gaps. Provide technical guidance concerning business implications of application development projects. Gather and analyze information and provide recommendations to address and resolve business issues for a specific business group
Partnership & Collaboration - Lead cross-functional work packages. Partner with project managers, technical resources, vendors, and management to ensure accurate execution of projects.
Proven Leadership and Mentorship - Support end-to-end project implementation and be the Subject Matter Expert in Business Analysis. Drive to collaborate and support individuals and cross-functional teams to resolve organizational, operational and process problems and coach junior level team members.
Who You Are
You can demonstrate experience in: conducting analysis and providing corresponding, insights for executive presentations and at least 5 years in a Business System Consultant role leading projects and designing solutions. It is an asset if you have experience managing relationships at the Senior Executive level.
You have a degree/diploma in Computer Science, Business, and/or a related field.
You act like an owner. You thrive when you are empowered to take the lead, go above the beyond and deliver results. You have the willingness to take ownership, get your hands dirty and surface insights that are clear and concise for a diverse set of technology and business stakeholders.
You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it is the right thing to do.
You embrace and champion change. You'll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best. You seek out innovative solutions and opportunities for continuous improvement.
You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You're confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
You're driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to create a shared vision.
Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
It’s an asset if you have experience with Agile methodologies, and Application and/or Architecture design .
Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.
What CIBC offers
At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.
We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.
Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.
We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.
What you need to know
CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit
CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.
Job Location
Toronto-81 Bay, 17th Floor
Employment Type
Regular
Weekly Hours
37.5
Skills
Agile Methodologies, Business, Business Analysis, Business Systems, Business Systems Analysis, Development Projects, Documentations, Leading Project, Management Reporting, Problem Solving, Requirement Documents, SAP Products, Solutions Design, Writing User Stories

Title: Analyste Senior, Opérations Douanières / Custom Program, Senior Analyst
Description:
Qui sommes-nous ? 
Chez Pratt & Whitney, nous croyons que le vol motorisé a transformé, et continuera de transformer, le monde. C'est pourquoi nous travaillons avec un coeur d'explorateur et un acharnement de perfectionniste à concevoir, produire et entretenir les moteurs d'avion les plus avancés et les plus fiables du monde. Notre porte folio diversifié - composé de moteurs commerciaux et militaires ainsi que de moteurs destinés à l'aviation d'affaires, générale et régionale, et aux hélicoptères - nous permet, ainsi qu'à nos clients, de passer du possible au réel. C'est ainsi que, chez Pratt & Whitney, nous abordons notre travail et ce qui nous inspire à nous dépasser.

 Nos attentes
 Relevant du directeur des opérations douanières, le titulaire a la responsabilité du suivi et du contrôle de la performance financière et opérationnelle du processus de conformité douanière

Agit comme référence en douanes pour toutes les divisions de la compagnie
Maintient et optimise la performance des processus de douanes et des fournisseurs de service (courtiers en douanes)
Supporte le Programme d'autocotisation des douanes (PAD)
Coordonne les sessions de formation sur la conformité douanière
Impliqué dans le maintien des programmes sur la sécurité aux frontières (exemple: CTPAT, PIP, AEO)
Développe un système de rétention des documents officiels douaniers et en assure le maintient


 À quoi ressemblera votre quotidien ?
 Coordonne le Programme d'autocotisation des douanes (PAD) de l’ASFC (Agence des services frontaliers du Canada) :

 Analyse la performance du courtier en douane basé sur des indicateurs de performance contractuels prédéfinis (KPIs)
 S’assure de la conformité du travail des usagers et des systèmes informatiques en effectuant des analyses de données et en implantant les actions correctives.
 Prépare les réponses aux demandes de validations officielles de l’AFSC pour le programme CSA

 Développe et maintient à jour le manuel de conformité douanière:

 Documente les processus clés et les instructions de travail critiques aux opérations douanières
 Maintient à jour la base de données Access des codes HTS (Harmonized Tariff System

 Coordonne des sessions de formation sur la conformité :

 Développe le matériel de formation (exemple: Incotermes, tarif, valeur, CTPAT, etc.)

 Prépare et coordonne les cliniques qualités sur la résolution de problèmes et s’assure du suivi des actions retenues
 Participe aux projets d’amélioration continue du département en effectuant des analyses de données et en faisant le suivi des plans d’actions
 Assiste à l'identification des enjeux de processus ou systèmes et applique l'automatisation lorsque requis.
 Doit maintenir ses connaissances à jour sur la conformité et la législation douanière

 Ce dont vous avez besoin pour réussir

 Ingénierie, gestions des opérations et de la logistique, programmation
 Diplôme de courtage en douane serait un atout
 Bilingue
 Expérience de 2 à 3 ans en logistique industriel et conformité douanière
 Abilité à travailler sous pression
 Flexible pour modifier ses priorités en fonction des besoins des clients
 Abilité à travailler effectivement avec différents départements
 Démontre un fort leadership et une orientation client
 Forte capacité à l’analyse avec une approche systématique en résolution de problème
 Connaissance avancée des logiciels Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Access, Power BI serait un atout
 Connaissance du logiciel SAP/ERP serait preferable


 Ce qui vous attend 

Programme de congé à rémunération différée
 Garderie pour jeunes enfants
 Programmes d’avancement professionnel et de scolarisation
 Horaires flexibles
 Programmes et formations sur le leadership
 Gamme d’avantages sociaux, régime d’épargne et régime de retraite
 Programme d’aide de financement pour les congés parentaux
 Programme de reconnaissance et de récompense


 Diversité et inclusion

 Le générique masculin est utilisé sans discrimination et uniquement dans le but d'alléger le texte. P&WC souscrit au principe de l’équité en matière d’emploi et est déterminé à encourager la diversité et l’inclusion. Nous sommes heureux d’étudier la demande d’emploi de tous les candidats qualifiés, sans égard à leur race, couleur, religion, orientation sexuelle, genre, nationalité d’origine, âge, handicap, statut d’ancien combattant ou tout autre statut protégé par la loi.


 Who we are
 At Pratt & Whitney, we believe that powered flight has transformed and will continue to transform the world. That's why we work with an explorer's heart and a perfercionnist's grit to design, build, and service world's most advanced aircraft engines. We do this across a diverse portfolio including Commercial Engines, Military Engines, Business Aviation, General Aviation, Regional Aviation, and Helicopter Aviation and as a way of turning possibilities into realities for our customers. This is how we at Pratt & Whitney approach our work, and this is why we are inspired to go beyond.

 What are our expectations? 
Reporting to the Manager Customs Operations, the incumbent is responsible to monitor and control the financial and operational performance of the customs conformity process

Act as the reference in customs matters
Maintain and optimize the performance of the customs processes and of the customs brokers
Support the CSA (Custom Self-Assessment) program
Coordinate and present training sessions on customs conformity
Involve in the maintenance of the compliance security program at the border (ex: CTPAT, PIP, AEO)
Develop and maintain a controlled system for official customs documents retention


 What your day to day will look like 
Coordinate the CSA program (Customs Self-Assessment) from the CBSA (Customs Border Service Agency):

 Analyze the customs broker performance based upon preset contractual indicators (KPI)s
 Ensure users and IT system compliance to the program by analyzing data and implementing corrective measures
 Prepare the responses to CBSA’s audit questions regarding the CSA program

 Develop and maintain the Custom Compliance Manual:

 Document the critical work instructions and key processes required for the customs operations
 Maintain the HTS (Harmonized Tariff System) codes Access database up to date

 Coordinate the training sessions on customs conformity:

 Develop training material on customs matters (i.e. Incoterms, tariff, CTPAT etc.)

 Prepare and coordinate the quality clinics on problem resolutions and ensure follow-up on required actions for closure
 Participate to departmental continuous improvement projects by conducting data analysis and by following-up on the action plans
 Support to identify processes/systems gaps and automate if necessary
 Keep abreast of customs conformity and legislation

 The tools you need to be successful 

Engineering, Operations and Logistics, Programming
 Diploma in Customs Brokerage would be an asset
 Bilingual
 2 to 3 years of experience in industrial logistics and customs compliance
 Ability to work under pressure
 Flexibility to change priorities based on customer demands
 Ability to work efficiently with different departments
 Demonstrate strong leadership and customer focus
 Strong analytical skills with a systematic problem-solving approach
 Advanced knowledge of Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Access software, Power BI would be an asset
 Knowledge of SAP/ERP software would be preferable


 What we offer 

Long-term deferred compensation programs
 Daycare for young children
 Advancement programs to enhance education skills
 Flexible work schedules
 Leadership and training programs
 Comprehensive benefits, savings and pension plans
 Financial support for parental leave
 Reward programs for outstanding work


 Diversity and inclusion 
The masculine pronoun is used without discrimination and solely for the purpose of making the text easier to read. P&WC is an equal opportunities employer, seeking to promote diversity and inclusion. We will consider applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of their race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, nationality, age, disability, veteran status or any other status protected by law.

Title: Capital Planning Business Analyst
Description:
Posted 
      

       06-Apr-2022 
      



       Service line 
      

       GWS Segment 
      



       Role type 
      

       Full-time 
      









       Areas of Interest 
      

       Accounting/Finance, Administrative, Consulting, Data & Analytics, Property Management, Risk Management 
      









       Location(s) 
      

       Toronto - Ontario - Canada 
      









JOB SUMMARY

         The purpose of this position is to provide the research, data mining/analysis, reporting and interpretation of account company performance metrics and capital planning systems data.
       

 ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

         Generates, reviews and understands reports. Uses aggregate data from multiple sources to assist in creating a complete analysis, improvement and/or recommendation.
       

 Reviews the accuracy of information provided and responds to requests from management and vendors.


         Understands and works with scenario planning (exit/maintain/grow) tools/models. Analyzes trends in general business conditions.
       

 Identifies opportunities for improvements by and among the clients and/or companies.


         May coordinate involvement of personnel from other departments and information technology groups to facilitate successful project implementations.
       


         May act as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) for key systems/processes in subject teams and day-to-day functions.
       


         Facilitates the maintenance and reporting of benchmarks and performance metrics. Other duties may be assigned.
       

 SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES

         No formal supervisory responsibilities in this position. May provide informal assistance such as technical guidance and/or training to coworkers. May coordinate and assign tasks to co-workers within a work unit and/or project.
       












QUALIFICATIONS
 To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.
 Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
 EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE
 Bachelor's degree (BA/BS) from 4-year college or university required. Master's degree preferred. Minimum of 2 years of related experience and/or training.
 
 CERTIFICATES and/or LICENSES
 None.
 
 COMMUNICATION SKILLS
 Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong organizational and analytical skills. Ability to provide efficient, timely, reliable and courteous service to customers. Ability to effectively present information.
 FINANCIAL KNOWLEDGE
 Requires knowledge of financial terms and principles. Ability to calculate intermediate figures such as percentages, discounts and/or commissions. Conducts basic financial analysis.
 
 REASONING ABILITY
 Ability to comprehend, analyze, and interpret documents. Ability to solve problems involving several options in situations. Requires solid analytical and quantitative skills.
 
 OTHER SKILLS and/or ABILITIES
 Solid experience in use of Microsoft applications with emphasis on SQL Server database, Excel and Power Platform (Power Automation and Power Apps). Ability to use query and report generation tools. Experience using Asset Management Information Systems or Capital Planning Management Systems is an asset.
 
 SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITY
 Decisions made with understanding of procedures and company policies to achieve set results and deadlines. Responsible for setting and meeting own project deadlines. Errors in judgment may cause short-term impact to coworkers and supervisor.













       CBRE GWS 
      











         CBRE Global Workplace Solutions (GWS) works with clients to make real estate a meaningful contributor to organizational productivity and performance. Our account management model is at the heart of our client-centric approach to delivering integrated real estate solutions. Each client is entrusted with a dedicated leader and is supported by regional and global resources, leveraging the industry's most robust platform. CBRE GWS delivers consistent, measurably superior outcomes for our clients at every stage of the lifecycle, and across industries and geographies.

Title: 1 year contract - Manager, Visualization and Business Intelligence
Description:
Requisition ID: 147952

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.
Purpose:
The Manager, Visualization and Business Intelligence will be accountable for delivery of business intelligence and data analytics primarily in support of the deposit portfolio including Day-to-Day Banking, High Interest Savings products, GICs under Canadian Banking. Using analytics tools such as SAS, SQL and Power BI, this role will access a wide range of sophisticated data sources to uncover insights and support various business initiatives. The incumbent will also lead the creation of dashboard visualization standardization, to bring together industrial visualization best practices and design principles to the department.
Accountabilities:
Accountability 1 –Visualization Standardization
Create best-in-class, visually attractive and engaging visualization standard that aligns the existing 200-300 Power BI dashboards under CB Analytics, to achieve high consistency of branding, layout, readability and design uniformityApply understanding of the needs of different analytics discipline (Business Intelligence, Data Infrastructure, Data Science, Reporting), to gather requirements and incorporate ideas into a design that would cater the needs of various analytics deliverables, business partners and Executive audienceAdopt design principal and visualization best practices to create visualization guidelines, dashboard templates and conduct presentation that arouse interest and promote adoption to analytics peersEffectively communicate to dashboard creators and end-users in order to provide guidance and assistance to the adoption of the visualization standard
Accountability 2 – Data Analytics and Visualization
Utilize a variety of Business Intelligence analytical and reporting tools (eg. SAS, SQL, Power BI) to access Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW), Data Lake (EDL) and other platforms to perform complex analysis and reporting, including interactive dashboards, regular reports and ad-hoc requests as requiredProvide dynamic reporting on key performance metrics to various stakeholders in retail, product lines, channels, customer acquisition, marketing and external stakeholders for compliance and benchmarking studiesProvide strategic analysis that will assist the business to optimize existing accounts and product mix from various channels, grow primary customer and optimize opportunity to acquire non-Scotiabank customersEffectively manage and prioritize multiple business initiatives, projects and ad-hoc analysis with business stakeholders and possible external partners.Document existing processes and workflows, and look for opportunities to optimize and automate work streamParticipate in onboarding to any new data platforms and analytics tools such as Python, Bitbucket, MinIO, Cloud solution, etc.
Accountability 3 – Business Impact
Manage, design and create data cubes and interactive dashboards that support retail banking business partnersSupport the development and implementation of long-term data and analytics strategy that move towards high degree of automation and end-user self-help solutionsAct as the advocate of CB Analytics to showcase analytics solutions and dashboards that helps business partners to gain insight, build business cases and make fact-based decisionsAcquire and enhance knowledge in technical areas, product strategies, competitive practices, market insights to continuously improve analytics valueUnderstand the Bank’s risk appetite and AML/ATF practices in day-to-day activities and decisions.

Must have Qualifications:
4+ years of analytical experience requiredMust be proficient with Power BI, SAS and SQL.Experience in leading data visualization and/or analytics initiativesExcellent communication skill and relationship-building skill with analytics peers and business partnersExperienced with Excel pivot table and MS OfficeBachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Marketing, Finance or Business
Good to have Qualifications:
Microsoft Power BI DA-100 or equivalent certificateRelated design experience2+ years experience in financial industry
Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Laboratory Analyst
Project Manager, Business intelligence
Description:
Req Id: 366051
At Bell, we do more than build world-class networks, develop innovative services and create original multiplatform media content – we advance how Canadians connect with each other and the world.
If you’re ready to bring game-changing ideas to life and join a community that values, professional growth and employee wellness, we want you on the Bell team.
Bell Residential and Small Business provides the most innovative, industry-leading Internet, TV and Smart Home products and services to Canadians.
Position Description:
As a leader within the BI team and in the role of Project Manager, the successful candidate will support various types of projects affecting the BI team (New Product Introduction, New BI tool/infrastructure changes, data and/or Process Enhancements, Governance, etc.).
Job Duties/Accountabilities:
Overall management of capital funded projects, strategic projects, governance and local initiatives

Delivery of documentation to formally initiate a project & monitor project developments including project reviews, meetings, work sessions, action-registers
Facilitates meetings to communicate progress, status, issues, assignments and escalations
Facilitates work sessions, focus groups and organizes demos when required
Preparation & facilitation of internal and executive presentations related to project scope timeline, activities, issues, budget and progress as required
Leads and collaborates on elaboration of business cases to support project scope and/or monetary investment
Develop and manage all aspects of project and program engagement from planning, external vendor relationships, communications, resources, budget, change, risks and issues
Ensures that quality standards are adhered to and that projects are completed on time, on scope and on budget.
Lead the evolution of project tracking tools (JIRA, Confluence, etc.).
Manage BI ingestion process & project prioritization
Critical Qualifications/Competencies:
Strong interpersonal and strong leadership skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to influence and collaborate across cross-functional teams
Ability to present complex information in a clear and concise manner to different stakeholders (peers, team members, executives and clients)
Strong influencing, negotiation and risk management skills
Strong organizational and time management skills with ability to work independently
Ability to design and improve project management processes, tracking tools and overall best practices
Must be proficient in MS Project, Word, Excel, PowerPoint
Strong understanding of Jira (administration level knowledge)
Must have at least 5+ years of project management experience; preferably technical project management
Preferred Qualifications/Competences:
Previous exposure and understanding of BI project delivery (data ingestion, tool integration, reporting evolution).
Experience in owning technical program development from start to finish, and leading cross-functional teams to deliver projects within tight deadlines
Demonstrated ability to understand and discuss technical concepts
Experience in designing and implementing/improving project management tools, documentation and processes (mapping, charting, RACI charts etc.)
Strong leadership, diplomatic and motivational skills including the ability to lead up, across and down multiple business and technology organizations
Familiarity with PEATS Finance Tool, Confluence & Jira
PMP Designation or equivalent
