Title: 0802 - Analyste d’affaires & Fonctionnel BI
Description:
Nous sommes à la recherche de personnes qui sont à la fois passionnées de technologies reliées à la Data, qui ont un sens du collectif et qui ont envie d’offrir à des clients des solutions adaptées à leurs problématiques d’affaires. Et si en plus vous avez le sens de l’humour et une belle personnalité, nous pensons que vous vous plairez beaucoup chez agileDSS.
 Aujourd’hui nous cherchons d’un Analyste d’affaires & Fonctionnel en intelligence d’affaires pour se joindre à notre équipe et travailler pour l’un de nos clients, qui sera très heureux de pouvoir bénéficier de votre expertise. 


agileDSS, c’est quoi/qui ?
 agileDSS est une entreprise de service-conseil spécialisée en analytique avancé. Depuis plus d’une quinzaine d’années, nous accompagnons les grandes entreprises à tirer le meilleur parti de leurs données par le biais d’une expertise de pointe en analytique avancé à travers des projets en Business Intelligence, Cloud Analytique et Big Data. 



Côté savoir-faire, ce poste est pour toi si tu as : 

5 ans d’expérience total en Intelligence d’affaires (BI)
    
 3 années d’expérience à titre d’analyste d’affaire et/ou fonctionnel
 2 années d’expérience avec à titre de développeur BI ou équivalent

 Avoir le sens des affaires et un esprit analytique
 Compétences dans la collecte des exigences/besoins, la conception, la cartographie, les tests unitaires et les tests d'intégration
 De solides compétences en analyse, en conception et en documentation
 Autonome, joueur d'équipe, esprit collaboratif démontré, bon esprit analytique et de synthèse, souci du détail et rigueur;
 Excellentes aptitudes pour les relations interpersonnelles et la communication, autant verbalement que par écrit;
 Capacité d’adaptation et polyvalence dans son rôle; 
Capacité à établir les priorités et à accomplir des tâches dans un environnement au rythme rapide;
 Maitrise de Microsoft Excel, Power BI et du langage SQL
 Bilingue Français / Anglais
 Maitrise du développement Agile et des processus SCRUM

 Atouts

 Connaissances en modélisation DataVault et dimensionnelle
 Connaissances de « Cloud Data Warehouse » comme Snowflake et Azure Synapse
 Maitrise d’outils ETL comme SSIS, Informatica, Talend, etc.
 Connaissances de l’environnement Azure (Storage, Data Factory, Azure DevOps)
 Connaissance des principes de DevOps et DataOps


 Mais n’oublions pas le savoir-être !
 Avant toute chose on cherche un nouveau collègue qui va s’épanouir dans notre environnement! Si tu es une personne qui aime apprendre et partager ses connaissances, qui comprend le service-conseil, qui possède une certaine autonomie, et qui est drôle et bienveillant tu as de grandes chances de te plaire chez nous ! 




À quoi tu peux t’attendre dans ton rôle ?

 Interagir avec les unités d'affaires pour comprendre les besoins, les transformer en requis fonctionnel, proposer de nouveaux processus et aider aux activités quotidiennes.
 Analyse et développement des requêtes SQL d’analyse et de profilage de données complexe;
 Analyses techniques et les modèles analytiques ;
 Participation aux activités de déploiement;
 Analyse des impacts dans les systèmes existants lors des demandes de changements ;
 Fournir un soutien fonctionnel pour les questions d'application et de processus d'affaires
 Participation aux migrations de différents entrepôts de données vers Azure Synapse et/ou Snowflake ;
 Collaboration avec les architectes, les programmeurs, les analystes d’affaires et les chargés de projets dans la réalisation des différents projets ;
 Participer au développement et maintien des flux ETL si requis;


 Ce qu’on t’offre
 Nous sommes avant tout une équipe de collaborateurs à taille humaine qui a à cœur le bien-être de ses employés, c’est pourquoi nous t’offrons:

 Une rémunération annuelle fixe et une bonification annuelle selon l’atteinte de ta performance
 Un plan d’accompagnement, des formations et des certifications intéressantes pour toi et agileDSS
 À l’occasion l’accès à des conférences internationales
 Des assurances collectives et un Programme d’Aide aux Employés (santé mentale et physique)
 5 semaines de vacances
 Le remboursement des abonnements de sport et du transport
 Des horaires flexibles et télétravail
 Un environnement favorisant l’intrapreneuriat et la réflexion stratégique
 Des activités à Responsabilité Sociale et Environnementale.
 Des évènements d’entreprise en local, en région et à l’international

Title: Analyst, Risk & Controls
Description:
At Parkland, our purpose is to Power Journeys & Energize Communities. We are a prominent independent supplier and marketer of fuel and petroleum products and a leading convenience store operator. As One Parkland team, we proudly serve diverse retail, commercial and wholesale customers across Canada, the United States, the Caribbean region, and South America. We power a growing family of locally known brands including Fas Gas Plus, Pioneer, RaceTrac, Superpumper, Ultramar, Chevron, Esso, and ON the RUN.
 We recognize that diversity gives us an edge and inclusion propels us forward. We’re also a passionate team of down-to-earth achievers, committed to getting our customers, colleagues and communities further, faster. As such, we welcome talented individuals that have a variety of perspectives, backgrounds, and industry experience who will contribute to the success of our One Parkland team.
 Position Title: Analyst, Risk & Controls
 Team and Location: Risk & Controls – Calgary, AB or Remote
 Position Summary:
 Reporting to the Senior Analyst, Risk and Controls, the Analyst will assist the planning, execution and reporting of Parkland’s compliance program, across Canada, USA and International.
 Bringing relevant experience of both Canadian and US financial control requirements, the successful candidate will operate as a business partner, bringing value-added insight to the Business and support the continued enhancement of the Program.
 As a member of Parkland’s Risk and Control function, the successful candidate will also gain exposure to a wider range of risk management capabilities, including: Enterprise Risk Management, Internal Audit and Commercial contract assessments.
 The successful candidate will bring a commercially focused, value-add, risk management mindset and demonstrate a track record of ‘thinking outside of the box’ and driving significant innovation in the delivery of compliance audits.
 Key Responsibilities:

 Support the execution of Parkland’s Internal Controls over Financial Reporting (ICFR) compliance program, including process updates, interviews, walkthroughs and testing of key controls to evaluate the design and operating effectiveness of ICFR.
 Assist with annual FS risk assessment, scoping and materiality calculations using top-down risk-based approach.
 Build and maintain/enhance internal control documentation including process flow diagrams, process narratives and design and operating effectiveness of testing results.
 Prepare clear, concise, appropriately referenced work papers to document test procedures performed and conclusion drawn.
 Monitor remediation of control deficiencies identified and provide recommendations for operational improvements.
 Conduct root cause analysis and develop corrective action plans and recommendations, with follow up and support for resolutions.
 Operate as a business partner, supporting process and control owners to implement best practices and improve control efficiency while maintaining effectiveness.
 Develop value-add, interactive reports that clearly communicate outcomes of design and effectiveness testing and drive remediation efforts by process and control owners.
 Partner with Management in responding to external auditors for business control-related matters.
 Provide consulting services to management through Finance policy and procedure research, guidelines and best practice as required, with recommendations for improvements.
 Work with other internal controls stakeholders (such as ERM, IA, Finance etc.) to strengthen and continually improve Parkland's control framework.
 As required, support the execution of the wider Risk & Controls work program, including internal audits, enterprise risk assessment processes and other consulting / project work.
 Bring good understanding of ICFR methodology to help the department develop a “best in class” practice.
 Assist with the implementation of data analytical tools to perform sampling, analyze data to improve audit and business efficiency and effectiveness, (including for risk assessments).
 Support the maturation of the Compliance program across the organization.
 The team is to be regarded as a business partner when reviewing and developing procedures for the business. Policy and procedure research and development is required as well as review and recommending refinements.

 Qualifications and Skills:

 Minimum 3 years of C-SOX and/or SOX internal controls experience, preferably with a public accounting firm.
 Good knowledge of US and Canadian regulatory requirements relating to financial controls.
 Excellent communication, teamworking skills and a desire to work in a high-performing team.
 Possession of a professional accounting designation (CPA, CA, CMA, CGA).
 Must have strong oral and written communication skills; the ability to speak candidly to Management regarding audit results is critical.
 Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
 Ability to build strong relationships within the team as well as within the business.
 Strong analytical and computer skills preferably JDE, Excel, Word and PowerPoint.
 Ability to work under pressure, resolve problems and make decisions quickly and effectively, using a strong sense of self confidence.

 We Offer: 

Our Performance-based Annual Incentive Plan, an annual bonus awarding your performance.
 A share in our success through the Employee Share Purchase Plan and 100% company matching.
 A flexible group benefit plan that offers health and dental coverage choices to meet the needs of each unique employee. Inclusive of life and disability insurances, Health Care and Lifestyle Spending options, and a supportive Employee and Family Assistance Program.
 Participation in Parkland Pledge, an employee-driven charitable giving program.
 An employee referral program – earn up to $2000 for your referral.
 In-house learning and development opportunities, leadership training, international opportunities.
 Discount Programs and Educational Scholarship Programs for family members.
 A safety focused work environment and ongoing safety training.

 Please note:

 Candidates must be legally able to work in Canada at this time. Parkland regrets that it is unable to sponsor employment Visas.
 Parkland Corporation is committed to the principles of Employment Equity. We strive to provide accessibility in employment to ensure equal access to employment opportunities for candidates, including persons with disabilities. Parkland Corporation will endeavour to provide accommodation to persons with disabilities in the recruitment process upon request. If you are selected for an interview and you require accommodation due to a disability, please notify us upon scheduling your interview.
 Please note that final candidates for this position will be required to undergo a confidential pre-employment background check which may include but not be limited to educational, criminal, credit, drug and alcohol and/or Fitness for Duty testing.

Title: Technical Support Analyst (On-Site)
Description:
Driven by a passion for detail and a tradition of excellence in design and architecture, Amacon is recognized as one of Canada’s most influential real estate development and construction firms. With five decades of development and construction expertise, a precise level of design and craftsmanship is evident in all the homes and commercial developments that Amacon builds.


Position Summary

The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of both Network and Systems Administration along with a solid understanding of Microsoft Core and Cloud Infrastructure and strong experience with Change Processes and Change Control. Reports directly to the Project Manager, Technology. This position is located in Downtown Vancouver.
Maintenance

Deploy, configure, and update network hardware and software
Ensure incident response and management protocols and process are consistently followed
Administration and maintenance of servers and network infrastructure
Ensure high quality on time completion of all infrastructure projects, support services and verbal commitments; Provide effective oral and written project status updates and presentations
Act as tiered support for high-severity and business impacting infrastructure issues
Ensure adherence to effective ITIL infrastructure process and policies
Create proficiency in switches, Routing, VPNs, VLAN, Trunks, Network design, remote networks integration. Perform Installation, configuration, administration of wired and wireless Switches for: Local Area Network- LAN: (VLAN, Inter-VLAN Routing) and Wide Area Network-WAN by implementing different WAN technology to meet the different needs of business
Maintain server infrastructure to support business requirements and established service levels
Solid knowledge of building/supporting VMWare virtualized environments


Security

Implement and maintain fail proof infrastructure systems, controls, and policies to protect corporate assets, systems, and intellectual property
Monitor network devices performance, analyze data flow to make recommendations
Ensure disaster recovery plans and solutions are in place and kept up to date
Provide a system administrative function for application servers
Maintain the integrity of company data (corporate, print, and digital) by ensuring systems are monitored effectively, securely, and according to established compliance guidelines
Provide support and resolution of network security problems on the LAN/WAN, troubleshoot, and fix advanced network related issues in collaboration with other teams


Operations and Support

Maintain a high work ethic in a flexible and fast-paced environment
Ensure existing infrastructure supports organizational business requirements
Drive continuous improvement and best practice administration and support of key assigned corporate IT infrastructure areas
Support web applications, virtual machines, and cloud solutions
Co-ordinate all system related changes and follow established Change Management Processes


Skills & Qualifications
Required:

5+ years of Network and Systems Administration experience
Post-secondary education in information systems or equivalent, or an equivalent combination of education, training, and relevant experience/certifications
Extensive Windows experience including Active Directory, DNS, DHCP, IIS, SCOM, SCCM, MS Exchange, MS Teams
Strong knowledge of local area network administration including firewalls and network protocols and standards;
Strong knowledge of virtualized environments: VMware vSphere;
Hands-on software and hardware troubleshooting experience;
Experience with data management;
Administration of NAS, SAN, DAS;
Scripting in PowerShell, Bash;
Strong time management skills with the ability to be self-directed and thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
Data Networking and Network security experience
Preferred:

Experience with Microsoft SQL Server Administration
Programming knowledge/scripting experience for automation (PowerShell/Python)
Familiar with agile system administration methodologies (DevOps)
Experience in Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS)
Expertise in security protection solutions including Firewall, Web Proxy, Anti-Virus etc.
Knowledge of information management and data classification
Packet Shaper, Load Balancer and Proxy Server Knowledge
Experience working with Encryption techniques and PKI infrastructure
Disaster recovery (including DRP planning and testing) experience
Certifications in ITIL, MCSA, CCA, VCP

Title: Sales & Business Development Analyst
Description:
Job Field:
Business Development/Sales/Marketing/Communications
Job Type:
Full-time
Building Location:
Length of Assignment:

Who We Are

BGIS is a leading provider of customized facility management and real estate services. With our combined team of over 6,500 globally, we relentlessly focus on enabling innovation through the services we deliver, while actively looking for new opportunities that will enable innovation for our clients’ businesses. Globally, we manage over 320 million square feet of client portfolios across 30,000+ locations in North America, Europe, Middle East, Australia and Asia. Further information is available at www.bgis.com

SUMMARY

As the Sales & Business Development Analyst, you will take ownership of the Sales platform as the company continues to expand through new contract wins and develop the analytical ability of the system. This role will support both North America and the UK.

You will be responsible for the day-to-day configuration, support, maintenance and improvement of the Sales platform.

A large part of the role will initially focus on training users and growing the Salesforce skill set across the organization as well as evolving the current state of our Salesforce instance for advanced Sales & marketing use.

KEY DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

 Salesforce Administration

Administration of the Salesforce Platform, including system configuration, maintenance, enhancements and upgrades, data integrity, deployments, security, end-user support, documentation, and governance.
All aspects of user and license management including new user setup/deactivation, roles, profiles, permissions, public groups, OWD, sharing rules.
Salesforce configuration changes, including (but not limited to): Workflow, Process Builder, Flow, assignment rules, approval processes, fields, page layouts, record types, dynamic layouts, apps, actions, custom settings, mobile administration, dashboards and reports.
Create a platform roadmap and define priorities for evolving and improving Salesforce use and functionality by liaising with stakeholders.
Own the communication of any platform changes to end users and stakeholders.
Data management to improve Salesforce data quality, implementing rules and automation as needed.
Maintain Salesforce as an accurate and holistic view of our customers and business processes.
Work closely with stakeholders to understand their requirements and then tailor Salesforce for these unique needs.
Set up new users and ensure profile and permissions follow BGIS’s guidelines.
Identify unused or under-utilized platform features.
Ensure all third-party integrations flowing into Salesforce are live and accurate.
Working collaboratively as part of the team across all divisions.

Troubleshoot Any Integration Issues

Support the business with analysis, investigations, and approved release features.
Provide support to the team in creating reports, performance dashboards and workflows to manage business metrics and gain analytic insights.
Build analytic visualization dashboards to assist with business data-driven decisions.

KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS

High school completion plus a specialized technical (apprenticeship) or business course.
Salesforce Admin (ADM201 and ADM211) certification. (Essential)
The ability to build custom objects, formula fields, validation rules, workflows, triggers, custom views, reports, dashboards, and other content of intermediate complexity on the Salesforce Lightning platform.
Data migration/Data Loader experience.
Strong project and data management skillset.
(Desirable) A working knowledge of Pardot and Quip/Salesforce Anywhere Experience (Essential) Minimum 3 years experience in a Salesforce Administrator role (Desirable) Experienced Microsoft Power BI user Aptitudes Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Must be detail conscious and methodical in approach.
Ability to manage and work on multiple tasks at the same time and make judgements on which must be resolve first.
Character Enthusiastic and Positive Committed to the delivery of excellent customer service.
Calm manner, able to work under pressure.
Able to make sound decisions when needed.
A team player, able to work with BGIS and client representatives at all levels.
Must demonstrate a strong sense of focus Reliable and self-motivated, able to prioritize demands and work under pressure Circumstances Must be flexible in their working patterns.

Licenses and/or Professional Accreditation

Salesforce Admin (ADM201 and ADM211) certification.

At BGIS we believe that diversity and inclusion is a key business driver, such that we never lose sight of its importance as it is woven into the fabric of our organization. We are committed to maintaining a barrier-free recruitment process by providing equal employment opportunities through recruiting and retention of individuals of all backgrounds. We recognize that promoting diversity is an essential component of our continuing pursuit for organizational success!

Title: Senior Business Application Analyst, Payroll/Time & Absence
Description:
TD Description

Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
 Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.



Department Overview

Reporting to the AVP, HR Platform, the Senior Business Application Analyst plays a key role in the successful design and implementation of TD's new Time Tracking and Absence Management application.  The successful candidate will be responsible for designing, configuring and implementing a time tracking and absence solution that includes robust automation and best in class payroll processes to maximize the efficiency on how we run and execute our payroll at TD.  This critical role will be part of a large multi-year global HR technology transformation that will deliver an enhanced colleague experience across the enterprise. From ideation to implementation, you'll play a key role in rolling out the project and delivering a complex technical solution for one of North America's largest financial institutions.



Job Description

About this Role
 Working closely with our system integrator, participate in functional design and refinement sessions with business partners, subject matter experts, and technology to understand and analyze TD's business requirements.
 As a Senior Business Application Analyst, you will: 

Provide subject matter expertise on key business process decisions related to Time Tracking, Payroll, and Absence Management
 Design, configure, and implement requirements into the application.
 Think out of the box and implement creative solutions for TD requirements not captured by standard functionality offering by the application.
 Demonstrate configurations through the development of prototypes.
 Work with our system integrator and technology partners to help map and convert legacy data into the technology application.
 Work closely with the Integrations team to develop test scenarios and test integrations between Workday and all 3rd party systems we interact with at TD.
 Assist and participate in the end-to-end testing of the time tracking and payroll solution.
 Train and share knowledge with project team, help build a collaborative environment.




Job Requirements

What can you bring to TD?
 Share your most relevant experience, credentials and knowledge for this role, as well as these essential requirements and attributes:
     
 The preferred candidate must have hands on experience with configuration and implementation of payroll and time tracking applications like Peoplesoft, Workday or Oracle Cloud, or relevant workforce management applications like Kronos.
 Strong knowledge and understanding of Canadian and US payroll legislation.
 Previous consulting experience with a consulting/software company is considered a plus.
 Excellent verbal and written communication skills
 Strong business analysis and requirements gathering abilities.
 You have advanced knowledge with Microsoft Excel and have the ability to create pivot tables and advanced macros, along with being able to analyze and reconcile large volumes of data.
 You have a bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Finance, Accounting, Management Information Systems, Computer Science, or other related fields.
 Working knowledge of DB2/SQL.

Title: Sr. Data Analyst (R)
Description:
Join our Winning Team as a Senior Data Analyst
When was the last time you bragged about where you work? At CARFAX, we do it every day. Why? Because we’re proud to work for a company with a strong mission and trusted brand. We’re proud to work with people who care about what they do and work hard every day to deliver their best. And just announced, the return of the 4-day work week from May 30th through Labour Day! We’ve created the type of company culture where the term, “work- hard play- hard” is taken to new heights. Even today, while working remotely, our culture is strong, and our team is connected!
As a Senior Data Analyst, you will be working with the Data Science Manager on high-value data projects across multiple departments. You will be working on complex research and analysis, requiring strategic thinking and strong problem-solving skills, while working cross-functionally across multiple departments and as part of a team.
The CARFAX Culture
People who work at CARFAX are happy. Team CARFAX knows their work has purpose and everyone contributes to our mission to help consumers throughout the lifecycle of buying, owning, and selling used cars. Our culture offers a unique blend of a high achieving; high-energy workforce in a casual, laid back setting and our employee-focused culture is consistently honored as a "Best Place to Work".
As a Senior Data Analyst your responsibilities will include:
Maintaining and improving established, advanced machine learning processes on data mining
Providing actionable ad hoc analytics insights for internal stakeholders
Designing and building recurring reports for internal stakeholders to make data-driven decisions
Identifying and implementing ways to supercharge data quality and data integrity
Using advanced analytical methods to explore and extract additional data value for existing and emerging products
Documenting analysis results and presenting value to stakeholders
Creating reusable processes to assist data evaluation and analysis across teams within the Data Services department
To be considered for this role, you will need:
3-5 years of direct experience performing advanced data analytics or a master’s degree in Statistics, Data Analytics, or related field
3+ years’ experience in SQL and R
Strong grasp of statistical modeling techniques such as linear regression, logistic regression, GLM, etc.
Experience with Natural Language Processing projects
Ability to effectively communicate analysis and insights to all levels of the organization
A passion for continuous learning
Confidence to challenge the status quo

Title: Senior Product Analyst, Pricing Strategies
Description:
TD Description
Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.
Department Overview
TD's Canadian Card Payments and Loyalty business is one of the largest dual issuers of Visa and MasterCard products in Canada. Consumer credit and debit cards, as well as Business credit cards, are distributed nationally, leveraging our retail distribution network, direct response channels, and key co-brand partnerships.

MBNA is a mono-line, credit-only line of business, which serves as a digital flanker brand to TD Cards portfolio and caters to the mid-market customer segment.

Since early 2018, MBNA has been on a multi-year, multi-stakeholder transformation effort. The team has full end-to-end accountability for the business transformation strategy and financial results including:
Establishing processes and products to win in the market, championing the development and implementation of programs, initiatives, capabilities, products and services to deliver the strategy while ensuring compliance with regulatory guidelines
Owning the capability to drive profitable growth and increase market share
Developing and executing on initiatives and programs to support and engage the customer throughout the lifecycle
Job Description
The Pricing Strategies Senior Product Analyst is responsible for the deep understanding of fees and policies across TD and MBNA. The analyst will act as the SME to respond to all inquiries related to fees and policies as well as identify optimization opportunities to drive revenue.
Proactively monitor TD and MBNA portfolios and identify opportunities to improved risk-adjusted returns, based on customer behavior, risk profiles and competitive landscape
Able to access and analyze multiple data systems (TD & MBNA) to inform business casing and scope decisions within projects
End-to-end ownership of all credit card terms and pricing policies
End-to-end ownership of the default pricing programs, including implementing and testing changes in Blaze and TRIAD, delivering on financial commitments, growth, regulatory compliance, and client experience
Partner with large cross-functional team (TS, Operations, credit risk, marketing, product, acquisition, regulatory delivery, issue management, and more) to drive identified revenue opportunities
Identify opportunities to drive business growth & value within scope of fees and policies
Continuously enhance knowledge/expertise in the pricing space, keep current on emerging trends/developments and grow knowledge of the business
Job Requirements
Job Requirements:
Proficient knowledge of and ability to conduct product research, product analysis & development, modeling, forecasting, pricing, and competitive intelligenceKnowledge of current and emerging competitor and market trendsAbility to communicate effectively in both oral and written formAbility to work collaboratively and build relationshipsAbility to work successfully as a member of a team and independentlyAbility to exercise sound judgement in making decisionsAbility to analyze, organize and prioritize work while meeting multiple deadlinesSkilled in using analytical software tools, data analysis methods and reporting techniquesSkilled in using computer applications including MS Office, SQL/Hive/Impala, Blaze, TSYS-TS2 & TRIAD
Inclusiveness

We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Cost & Inventory Analyst / Analyste des coûts et inventaires
Description:
La version française suit
Don’t let this opportunity go up in smoke! Keep this amazing opportunity to join Everguard Fire and Safety (Everguard) to yourself. Why fan the flames of interest of other applicants about this vibrant multi-industry fire and life safety services and solutions company with comprehensive product offerings; globally recognized product and solution partners; installation, commission, inspection, and testing services and 24/7/365 support? You’re right, you don’t! Instead, you apply immediately so you can be part of a dynamic and exciting team of professionals across Canada who are focused on delivering high-quality products, solutions, and services to our clients. Every day, you will get to work with a dynamic and professional team and showcase your unique knowledge, skills, and abilities. If you want to fulfil your dream of finding a job where you can build your skills, live the adventure of doing something different every day, in unique locations, and sometimes travel, then look no further. We are the place for you. Become the envy of all your friends and become master of your destiny.


RESPONSIBILITIES
As our Cost & Inventory Analyst, you will be responsible for working with the Supply Chain Lead and Business Development Team to ensure the accuracy of pricing in the Corporate ERP as well as supporting the day-to-day pricing process. Some of the additional expectations of this role include:


Managing and prioritizing large volumes of information from suppliers regarding changes to price lists, surcharges, and tariffs
Monitoring client contracts to ensure system pricing reflects contractual obligations
Formatting vendor price files to ensure data accuracy and appropriate formatting i.e., unit of measure, descriptions, categorization, contact information
Managing new product listings within the Corporate ERP ensuring appropriate cost and other key data elements
Responding to pricing and product set up inquiries from the sales team and operational managers
Compiling data and reports from various sources to complete cost variance analysis
Generating and analyzing inventory reports, providing insights and recommendations regarding inventory levels and usage
Assisting in the development of cost standards for materials and labour costs
Maintaining data integrity within the system by conducting vendor reviews to ensure information accuracy


SKILLS
The successful candidate will bring a combination of knowledge, experience and abilities including:

Well-developed analytical and problem-solving abilities coupled with keen attention to detail to identify issues, opportunities, and trends along with the underlying principles, reasons, or facts
Demonstrated ability to effectively manage their schedule to ensure timely execution of work to support the needs of internal and external clients
Excellent attention to detail as well as strong analytical, technology, communication, and organizational skills;
Confidence in communicating with a variety of stakeholders and presenting analysis and recommendations in a relatable manner
Ability to work with a high level of autonomy and sense of personal responsibility for achieving success both individually and as part of the larger team
Previous experience with ERP systems or centralized procurement/inventory management systems


QUALIFICATIONS

Minimum of 3 years’ experience in cost accounting, price/cost management or inventory control
Post-secondary education in a related field
Combinations of education and experience will be considered
Bilingual preferred however not required


Everguard offers a competitive compensation and benefits package. If you are excited by the opportunity to contribute to a highly successful and growing company and interested in being part of a dynamic team, we want to hear from you.


We embrace diversity across all our operations and foster a respectful and inclusive work environment. Individuals that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills are encouraged to apply.

~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*


Ne laissez pas cette opportunité partir en fumée! Gardez cette formidable opportunité de rejoindre Everguard Incendie et Sécurité (Everguard) pour vous-même. Pourquoi attiser les flammes de cette entreprise dynamique de services et de solutions multisectoriels en matière de sécurité incendie et de sécurité des personnes, qui propose une gamme de produits complète, des partenaires de produits et de solutions mondialement reconnus, des services d'installation, de mise en service, d'inspection et de test et une assistance 24/7/365 ? Vous avez raison, vous ne le faites pas! Au lieu de cela, vous postulez immédiatement afin que vous puissiez faire partie d’une équipe dynamique et passionnante de professionnels à travers le Canada qui se concentrent de fournir des produits, des solutions et des services de haute qualité à ses clients. Chaque jour, vous aurez l'occasion de mettre en valeur vos connaissances, vos compétences et vos aptitudes uniques dans votre travail. Si vous voulez réaliser votre rêve de trouver un emploi où vous pouvez développer vos compétences, vivre l’aventure de faire quelque chose de différent chaque jour, dans des endroits uniques, et parfois voyager, alors ne cherchez pas plus loin. Nous sommes l’endroit pour vous. Devenez l’envie de tous vos amis et devenez maître de votre destin.


RESPONSABILITÉS

En tant qu'analyste des coûts et de la maintenance, vous serez chargé(e) de collaborer avec le responsable de la chaîne d'approvisionnement et l'équipe de développement commercial afin de garantir l'exactitude des prix dans l'ERP de l'entreprise et de soutenir le processus de tarification au quotidien. Parmi les attentes supplémentaires de ce rôle, citons les suivantes:


Gérer et prioriser les grands volumes d'informations provenant des fournisseurs concernant les changements de listes de prix, de suppléments et de tarifs
Suivi des contrats des clients pour s'assurer que la tarification du système reflète les obligations contractuelles
Mettre en forme les fichiers de prix des fournisseurs pour assurer l'exactitude des données et le formatage approprié, c'est-à-dire l'unité de mesure, les descriptions, la catégorisation, les informations de contact
Gérer les listes de nouveaux produits dans l'ERP de l'entreprise en veillant à ce que le coût et les autres éléments de données clés soient appropriés
Répondre aux questions de l'équipe de vente et des responsables opérationnels sur les prix et la configuration des produits
Compiler des données et des rapports provenant de diverses sources pour effectuer une analyse des écarts de coûts
Générer et analyser les rapports d'inventaire, fournir des informations et des recommandations concernant les niveaux d'inventaire et leur utilisation
Contribuer à l'élaboration de normes de coûts pour les matériaux et la main-d'œuvre
Maintenir l'intégrité des données dans le système en effectuant des examens des fournisseurs pour assurer l'exactitude de l'information


COMPÉTENCES

Le candidat retenu apportera une combinaison de connaissances, d'expérience et de capacités, notamment :

 Des capacités d'analyse et de résolution de problèmes bien développées, associées à une attention particulière aux détails, pour identifier les problèmes, les opportunités et les tendances ainsi que les principes, les raisons ou les faits sous-jacents
Capacité démontrée à gérer efficacement son emploi du temps afin d'assurer l'exécution du travail en temps opportun pour répondre aux besoins des clients internes et externes
Excellente attention aux détails ainsi que de solides compétences en matière d'analyse, de technologie, de communication et d'organisation
Confiance dans la communication avec une variété de parties prenantes et la présentation d'analyses et de recommandations d'une manière relatable
Capacité à travailler avec un haut niveau d'autonomie et sens de la responsabilité personnelle pour atteindre le succès à la fois individuellement et en tant que membre de l'équipe plus large
Expérience préalable des systèmes ERP ou des systèmes centralisés de gestion des achats et des stocks


QUALIFICATIONS

Minimum de 3 ans d'expérience en comptabilité analytique, en gestion des prix et des coûts ou en contrôle des stocks
Études postsecondaires dans un domaine connexe
Une combinaison d'études et d'expérience sera prise en considération
Bilingue de préférence, mais pas obligatoire


Everguard offre une rémunération et des avantages sociaux compétitifs. Si vous êtes passionné par l'opportunité de contribuer à une entreprise très prospère et en pleine croissance et que vous souhaitez faire partie d'une équipe dynamique, nous souhaitons vous entendre. Nous adoptons la diversité dans toutes nos opérations et favorisons un environnement de travail respectueux et inclusif. Les personnes qui représentent une variété de milieux, de perspectives et de compétences sont encouragées à postuler.

Title: Cost & Inventory Analyst / Analyste des coûts et inventaires
Description:
La version française suit
Don’t let this opportunity go up in smoke! Keep this amazing opportunity to join Everguard Fire and Safety (Everguard) to yourself. Why fan the flames of interest of other applicants about this vibrant multi-industry fire and life safety services and solutions company with comprehensive product offerings; globally recognized product and solution partners; installation, commission, inspection, and testing services and 24/7/365 support? You’re right, you don’t! Instead, you apply immediately so you can be part of a dynamic and exciting team of professionals across Canada who are focused on delivering high-quality products, solutions, and services to our clients. Every day, you will get to work with a dynamic and professional team and showcase your unique knowledge, skills, and abilities. If you want to fulfil your dream of finding a job where you can build your skills, live the adventure of doing something different every day, in unique locations, and sometimes travel, then look no further. We are the place for you. Become the envy of all your friends and become master of your destiny.


RESPONSIBILITIES
As our Cost & Inventory Analyst, you will be responsible for working with the Supply Chain Lead and Business Development Team to ensure the accuracy of pricing in the Corporate ERP as well as supporting the day-to-day pricing process. Some of the additional expectations of this role include:


Managing and prioritizing large volumes of information from suppliers regarding changes to price lists, surcharges, and tariffs
Monitoring client contracts to ensure system pricing reflects contractual obligations
Formatting vendor price files to ensure data accuracy and appropriate formatting i.e., unit of measure, descriptions, categorization, contact information
Managing new product listings within the Corporate ERP ensuring appropriate cost and other key data elements
Responding to pricing and product set up inquiries from the sales team and operational managers
Compiling data and reports from various sources to complete cost variance analysis
Generating and analyzing inventory reports, providing insights and recommendations regarding inventory levels and usage
Assisting in the development of cost standards for materials and labour costs
Maintaining data integrity within the system by conducting vendor reviews to ensure information accuracy


SKILLS
The successful candidate will bring a combination of knowledge, experience and abilities including:

Well-developed analytical and problem-solving abilities coupled with keen attention to detail to identify issues, opportunities, and trends along with the underlying principles, reasons, or facts
Demonstrated ability to effectively manage their schedule to ensure timely execution of work to support the needs of internal and external clients
Excellent attention to detail as well as strong analytical, technology, communication, and organizational skills;
Confidence in communicating with a variety of stakeholders and presenting analysis and recommendations in a relatable manner
Ability to work with a high level of autonomy and sense of personal responsibility for achieving success both individually and as part of the larger team
Previous experience with ERP systems or centralized procurement/inventory management systems


QUALIFICATIONS

Minimum of 3 years’ experience in cost accounting, price/cost management or inventory control
Post-secondary education in a related field
Combinations of education and experience will be considered
Bilingual preferred however not required


Everguard offers a competitive compensation and benefits package. If you are excited by the opportunity to contribute to a highly successful and growing company and interested in being part of a dynamic team, we want to hear from you.


We embrace diversity across all our operations and foster a respectful and inclusive work environment. Individuals that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills are encouraged to apply.

~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*

Title: Sr. IT Ops Analyst (Networking Tools)
Description:
TD Description
Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.
Department Overview
Our IT organization isn’t just here to support our business. We’re here to reinvent it – by changing the way our customers,
partners and employees interact with our company. To do that, we’re looking for people who bring great ideas and who make our partners’
ideas better. Intellectually curious advisors (not order takers) who focus on outcomes to creatively solve business problems.
People who not only embrace change, but who accelerate it.
Job Description
About This Role
The Network Tools Engineer is a senior position with the team and will lead projects to deliver Dashboards, Tools Automation and Analysis capability to
internal customers at all levels across TD.
You will need to have expertise and apply that expertise in leading network tools such as SevOne and NetScout products among others,
to ensure TD BANK gets the full value from its investments.
Job Requirements
Scope of Responsibilities/Expectations:
Build, integrate and maintain a scalable and cost effective network infrastructure management solution that can deliver early detection of issues as well as provide
customers visibility to the state of network services.
Partner with the front office, back office, and devops teams, end users, and business partners to solve complex challenges with innovative ways to connect.
Utilize network tools that monitor utilization, predict capacity requirements, and manage inventory and configuration.
Integrate tool suite with Service Now
Demonstrate a high level of creativity and expertise to develop simple, high impact solutions to improve our communications systems.
Identify innovative opportunities and drive from idea to business case development.
Provide technical direction and oversight to network support teams.
Find and create new methods to increase performance, automation, and scalability.
Participate on Service Restoration Teams when critical problems arise - 24x7x365.
Regional travel may be required; percentage will vary based on project needs.

Required Skills and Experience:
3+ years experience planning, designing, installing, configuring ,and administering network management tools such as SevOne, NetScout nGenius Pulse, NetScout nGenius One, Nagios, NetBrain, and SolarWinds.
Working knowledge of network topologies, methodologies and protocols
Knowledge and experience of producing Network Dashboards from multiple tools for various audiences, such as Leadership, Management and Operations
Intermediate knowledge of network systems design principles and standards
Intermediate knowledge of packet capture and analysis
3+ years experience with linux based operating systems
3+ years experience in scripting languages such as Python, PERL, BASH, or similar
3+ years experience in project management or implementation
3+ years working with reporting tools such as Tableau or similar
Ability to provide clear and concise reporting to multiple levels of management while also being able to dig into details of specific line items in those reports
Excellent written and oral communication skills, including the ability to articulate project level presentations to business sponsors.
Strong troubleshooting and critical thinking skills to resolve complex problems.
Ability to draft and document designs and standards.
Project experience implementing network infrastructure, network management tools, reporting tools, and/or data analysis tools with a focus on network data.
Operational excellence with knowledge of ITIL practices

Experience Desired:
Understanding of SDN/SD-WAN networks.
Security products/practices – ACLs, Firewalls, VPN, etc.
ITIL and Enterprise Change Management
Technical project management background
Experience working in a large enterprise environment (1000+ devices)
Service Now
Behavioral Characteristics
Proactive approach and enthusiasm for problem identification and solving
Passionate about customer satisfaction and learning about the business
Ability to work within tight time-lines
Ability to think strategically and suggest creative solutions
Ability to synthesize complex requirements into simple business practices
Flexible and able to adapt to changing priorities

Basic Requirements:
5+ years applicable Network experience
3+ years of experience with at least one of the following network management tools: Cisco ACI, CISCO ISE, SevOne, NetScout nGenius Pulse, NetScout nGenius One, Nagios, NetBrain, SolarWinds
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or equivalent years of experience
Additional Information
Join in on what others in TD Technology Solutions are doing:
Inspire a positive work environment and help champion quality, innovation, teamwork and service to the business.
Learn voraciously, stretch your thinking,
Inclusiveness
At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.
Job Family
IT Operations
Job Category - Primary
Technology Solutions
Hours
37.5
Business Line
Corporate
Time Type
Full Time
Employment Type
Regular
Country
Canada
**Province/State (Primary)
Ontario
City (Primary)
Mississauga

4720 Tahoe Boulevard

20-Apr-2022

Title: Specialist, Business Intelligence, Application and Web Services, Information Technologies
Description:
Position Overview
The Applications and Web Servies team within Information Technologies is currently seeking two Full-time Limited Term Specialists, Business Intelligence for approximately 21 months.
This position reports to the Associate Director, Applications and Business Intelligence & Analytics within the IT Operations portfolio at the University of Calgary. The position works 35 hours per week, with normal business hours being 08:30 - 16:30, Monday to Friday. The position is subject to high stress and requires balancing multiple priorities with tight deadlines. There may be a requirement for after-hours work, depending on the nature of the projects.
Position Description
Summary of Key Responsibilities (job functions include but are not limited to):
Design and manage the BI presentation tools and applications environment.
Configure BI Tools
Develop the semantic layer and metadata as well as create reports and dashboards.
Develop, manage, and update data models, including conceptual and logical models of the data warehouse, data mart, and staging area, and may include an operational data store or source system.
Responsible for the scripts required to extract, transform, clean and move data and metadata so they can be loaded into a data warehouse, data mart, or operational data store.
Test, monitors, manages and validates data warehouse activity including data extraction, transformation, movement, loading, cleansing, and updating processes.
Tune databases for performance, creates capacity plans, and manages data security.
Act as a resource for colleagues with less experience and manages medium to low complexity projects.
Work with end users and business analysts to ensure tight fit between BI environment and business requirements.
Participate in providing team training as well as end-user training and documentation.
Qualifications / Requirements:
Diploma or University Degree in Computer Science or similar field
Power BI or other DW/BI certifications are preferred
5-7+ years' experience in Business Intelligence or related fields
Ability to translate business needs into technical solutions
Strong analytical, problem-solving and debugging skills
Program Delivery Methodology skills including SCRUM and Agile fundamentals is considered an asset
Ability to use standard BI and database tools including SSIS, SSAS, and Power BI
Understanding of SQL, including MS SQL and Oracle, and relational/multi-dimensional designs
Good understanding of the Kimball methodology
Strong understanding of Data Warehouse (DW)/BI concepts and principles
Strong conceptual, communication and technical skills
ITIL Foundations certification is an asset
Additional Desirable Skills include:
Exposure or understanding of Dashboards, Scorecards, OLAP, Key Performance Indicators, Data Mining, Corporate Performance Management, Predictive Analytics.
Experience or exposure to data modelling tools such as Embarcadero, Erwin, Visio
Exposure or understanding of ERP data models and processes (e.g. PeopleSoft, SAP, etc)
Application development skills with Power Platform (Power Apps, Automate)
Ability to learn and use other tools as required (Cognos, Tableau).
Application Deadline: April 19, 2022
We would like to thank all applicants in advance for submitting their resumes. Please note, only those candidates chosen to continue on through the selection process will be contacted.
Additional Information
This position is classified in the Professional Career Band, Level 3 of the Management and Professional Staff Career Framework.
To find out more about management and staff opportunities at the University of Calgary and all we have to offer, view our Management and Staff Careers website.
The University strongly recommends all faculty and staff are fully vaccinated against COVID-19.
About the University of Calgary
The University of Calgary is Canada's leading next-generation university - a living, growing and youthful institution that embraces change and opportunity with a can-do attitude. Located in the nation's most enterprising city, the university is making tremendous progress on its Eyes High journey to be recognized as one of Canada's top five research universities, grounded in innovative learning and teaching and fully integrated with the community it both serves and leads. The University of Calgary inspires and supports discovery, creativity and innovation across all disciplines. For more information, visit ucalgary.ca.
The University of Calgary has launched an institution-wide Indigenous Strategy in line with the foundational goals of Eyes High, committing to creating a rich, vibrant, and culturally competent campus that welcomes and supports Indigenous Peoples, encourages Indigenous community partnerships, is inclusive of Indigenous perspectives in all that we do.
The University of Calgary recognizes that a diverse staff/faculty benefits and enriches the work, learning and research experiences of the entire campus and greater community. We are committed to removing barriers that have been historically encountered by some people in our society. We strive to recruit individuals who will further enhance our diversity and will support their professional success while they are here. We encourage all qualified applicants to apply, however preference will be given to Canadian citizens and permanent residents of Canada.

Title: Lead Salesforce Analyst - CPQ (hybrid)
Description:
Why join Stryker?

We are proud to be named one the World’s Best Workplaces and a Best Workplace for Diversity by Fortune Magazine! Learn more about our award-winning organization by visiting stryker.com

Our total rewards package offering includes bonuses, healthcare, insurance benefits, retirement programs, wellness programs, as well as service and performance awards – not to mention various social and recreational activities, all of which are location specific.
Who we want
Detail-oriented process improvers. Critical thinkers who naturally see opportunities to develop and optimize work processes – finding ways to simplify, standardize and automate.
Dedicated achievers. People who thrive in a fast-paced environment and will stop at nothing to ensure a project is complete and meets regulations and expectations.
Hard-working winners. Confident, competitive and results-oriented professionals who create a track record of success.
What you will do
As the Lead Business System Analyst CPQ, you will be responsible for deploying and supporting sales tools within Salesforce Configure Price Quote (CPQ) (collectively SFDC) that enable our commercial teams to “sell more” and “sell faster.” You will work closely with functional leaders and commercial teams to deploy and support new processes and functionality on SFDC. Beyond supporting the launch and roll out of new technologies, another critical component of the role will be the ongoing maintenance to ensure optimum performance and continued improvement over time. You will also be responsible for day-to-day basic troubleshooting, user account maintenance, addressing user questions, collecting enhancement requests, identifying new training needs, system performance monitoring and supporting the business through the regular release cycle.
To succeed in this role, this individual needs to be a true problem solver, analytical and continuously seek to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of processes. You need to be a natural collaborator who possesses a high intellectual curiosity and thrives in a dynamic, fast-paced environment that serves as an intermediary between daily business operations and the IT organization. This individual must serve as a contributing member of the Business Enablement Solutions team while championing Stryker’s Vision, Promise and Mission.
Responsibilities may include:
Individual Responsibilities:
Proactively collaborates with internal teams/departments to promote a culture of inclusiveness and cooperation
Consistently meets service delivery expectations based on input from the business
Responsible to live and exemplify Stryker’s Values: Integrity, Accountability, People, and Performance
Develop trusted partnerships with IT and the business (Commercial, Finance, Operations)
Functional Responsibilities:
Partner with Sales Ops, Finance, and Commercial to build and deploy Salesforce CPQ configuration automation
Foster greater CRM adoption and improve internal customer experience on an ongoing basis
Provide ongoing support of the CPQ application, monitor commercial opportunities and identify gaps, and propose system enhancements
Develop training programs and/or communication for end users on deployment of new dashboards and tools ensuring strong change management and adoption protocols
Provide ongoing support of Sales Managers through creation of management dashboards
Lead and perform regression and user acceptance testing efforts with initial technology deployment and future enhancement releases
Coordinate preparedness and ensure implementation of business data loads across different functional teams
Drive data cleansing activities during deployment cycle by collaborating with local and national data owners; provide guidance on how to maintain post deployment
Serve as the communication channel between IT and the business/end users regarding the technology, issue identification/resolution, implementation, enhancements, etc.
Responsible for helping to onboard new users and maintain users after the initial launch including applying different user accessibility/visibility within the system
Provide initial troubleshooting for user issues and escalate for resolution as needed
Develop training plan and partner with super users to ensure that training is completed, collect feedback for training improvements and maintain training materials so that they remain current
Engage appropriate stakeholders to define requirements, testing, and creating proper procedures
Manage communication with Users when there are system or performance issues, upcoming releases, tips and tricks, etc.
Ensure that system issues are submitted via the appropriate process and collaborate with IT to ensure timely resolution
Understand, collect, author and execute business requirements and testing scenarios
Coordinate and participate in system testing with business super users
Develop and maintain project and process documentation
Collect and help to prioritize enhancement requests; coordinate appropriate communication with the business users to help keep them informed
Drives decisions on design requirements, final standards, business processes, go-no go, etc.
Work collaboratively across the organization to understand related applications, make recommendations, and define/document development requirements as needed
Build strong relationships with Europe business enablement team to engage in best practice exchange on SFDC
Actively participate in the Bi-weekly SFDC Governance calls with other Stryker divisions including license allocation and maintenance across Divisions
Conduct & Compliance
Abide by and support the policies set forth in the Stryker Code of Conduct
Understand that compliance with the Code of Conduct, as it may be amended by Stryker Corporation from time to time, is a condition of continued employment with Stryker
Conduct work in compliance with all laws, rules, and regulations and in accordance with Stryker’s high ethical standards
Report any violations of these policies and procedures to Stryker management or in the manner outlined in Stryker’s Ethics Hotline Policy
Knowledge & Skill Requirements
Strong organizational skills with a proven ability to handle multiple priorities and manage projects to a timely conclusion
Works well under pressure to meet tight timelines without compromising accuracy
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written – able to relay technical information to functional users and business information to technical experts
Experience with process/workflow mapping and demonstrated basic project management skillsets including change management
Ability to think outside the box
Strong Microsoft Office especially PowerPoint skills
Excellent interpersonal skills; comfortable dealing with all levels of management and maintaining relationships with all stakeholders
Highly proactive and action oriented with a willingness to drive improvements and change
Good judgment with the ability to make timely and sound decisions
Good understanding of business processes
What you need
University Degree required in computer science, business, data analytics or equivalent field
4+ years’ experience required
Previous experience and knowledge of all aspects of Salesforce CPQ preferred
Salesforce Business Admin Certificate or equivalent experience preferred, can provide on the job training and certification support for the right candidate
Familiarity with Stryker technology platforms such as Salesforce.com, Oracle, PowerBI, etc. preferred
Internal applicants with an equivalent combination of education, experience, and performance over time at Stryker will be considered
Know someone at Stryker?

Be sure to have them submit you as a referral prior to applying for this position. Learn more about our employee referral program at https://careers.stryker.com/referrals/

Title: Senior Business Analyst - Payments
Description:
TD Description
Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.
Department Overview
The Canadian Payments Platform & Capabilities Team, is part of Enterprise Payments (serving both Canada and the US), which is within TD's Digital Strategy & Payments organization. The Team is responsible for developing and maintaining the near-term strategy, transformation, and execution of TD's Payments roadmap. We focus on initiatives that create business value, improve customer experience, and de-risk the payments made by Canadians. Collectively, these initiatives will enable TD's Next Generation Payments Platform which will allow any customer (business to retail) to make any payment (E-Transfer on Real-Time-Rails, Electronic Funds Transfer, Wires, etc.) to anywhere (domestic or international) at any time (safely and securely).

We work closely with the Lines of Business (Personal Banking, Business Banking, Corporate Commercial) to collect, prioritize, shape, and execute their needs. We also work closely with Digital, Marketing, Fraud, GAML, and Risk to ensure we are building the most convenient and safe payments products for our customers.
Job Description
Reporting to the AVP, International Payments, the successful candidate will play a critical role in the management and delivery of business analysis activities on complex, transformational, cross-functional project(s) for Enterprise Payments, such as Mobile Wallets, eCommerce, and other. The primary responsibilities of the Senior Business Analyst include, but are not limited to, the following:
Leadership of the end-to-end business requirements throughout the lifecycle of the project, working collaboratively with stakeholders from lines of business, technology, operations, and governance & control, always keeping a customer-centric focus
Proactive identification and management of requirement risks, issues, assumptions, dependencies, and constraints
Contribution to Change Management deliverables (stakeholder analysis, gap analysis, change planning, etc.) to ensure readiness of our customers, colleagues, and cross-functional stakeholder groups
Application of a variety of business analysis tools and techniques to solicit requirements and ensure alignment with business and Enterprise Payments' needs and strategies
Adherence to Enterprise Project Management governance and controls to ensure requirement deliverables meet best practices and standards
Collaboration with technology partners, providing recommendations towards system requirements and design to ensure alignment to business requirements
Contribution to Quality Assurance activities by supporting development of test strategies, test plans and test scenarios; and active participation in assessment and resolution of testing defects
Contribution to team development of skills and capabilities through mentorship of colleagues by sharing knowledge and experiences
Fostering a collaborative team environment by actively participating in team meetings and reward & recognition programs
Contribution to a positive work environment by embracing diversity in the workplace and supporting and proudly representing TD in the community
Job Requirements
Advanced knowledge of business analysis, project delivery practices and standards across the project life-cycle
4 - 5 years of experience in business analysis (BA accreditation is an asset)
Proven experience in successful requirements delivery for large, complex, multi-stakeholder programs/projects
Strong verbal/written communication, collaboration, and facilitation skills, adapting style and technique to a diverse audience
Prior experience in a financial institution (payments-focused role is an asset)
Strong leadership with a demonstrated ability to effectively collaborate with all levels
Prior experience in Agile requirements delivery is an asset
Ability to analyze, organize and prioritize work while meeting multiple deadlines
Skill in using analytical software tools, MS Office, data analysis methods and reporting techniques
Additional Information
Join in on what others in TD Technology Solutions are doing:
Inspire a positive work environment and help champion quality, innovation, teamwork and service to the business.
Learn voraciously, stretch your thinking,
Inclusiveness
At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Senior Business Systems Analyst (Fixed Term Contract- 12 months)
Description:
ABOUT US
 CI Global Asset Management is one of the country’s largest investment fund companies. CI is known for its innovation and ability to adapt quickly to the changing needs of Canadian investors. It provides employees with a fast-paced and challenging work environment with opportunities for advancement. CI is part of CI Financial, a diverse group of financial services firms.
 POSITION: Senior Business Systems Analyst  LOCATION: Toronto, ON. STATUS: Fixed Term Contract, 12 months
 **Please note that this position is a fixed term contract (not an incorporated or independent contract position).
 JOB OVERVIEW
 This position is primarily responsible for the maintenance and enhancement of system solutions for the investment management and trading platform as well as various web applications. The successful candidate will work closely with business analysts and application developers to identify system requirements and implement quality technical solutions. This role also requires assisting the application support team as needed with production issues.
 WHAT YOU WILL DO

 Communicate with business analysts to understand/define business needs and document workflows.
 Convert business requirements into functional specifications.
 Partner with the system architect and programmer analysts to build systems and solutions that fit business requirements.
 Liaise with the wider IT teams to coordinate interdependencies and resolve issues.
 Produce quality test plans and manage all aspects of system and user testing.
 Assist project managers to develop accurate project timelines and provide status updates.

 WHAT YOU WILL BRING
 Skills:

 Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
 Proven ability to efficiently utilize resources and work collaboratively in a team.
 Proficiency in SQL, sufficient to analyze data and investigate stored procedures written in Transact SQL.
 Able to multi-task and manage multiple projects as well as changing priorities.
 Detailed-oriented and a demonstrated ability to make independent decisions.
 Familiarity with Linux/Unix based operating systems.

 Experience:

 5+ [KS1] years in business analysis and systems design within the financial industry.
 Financial services industry knowledge, with a focus on asset management is preferred.
 Working knowledge of an investment management system is ideal.
 Broad background in trading, including but not limited to, execution management systems, order management systems, settlements, market data, etc.
 SDLC and Agile development framework experience is favourable, but not essential.

 Required Education/Training:

 Bachelor’s degree in Finance/Business or Computer Science.
 Financial courses like CSC/CFA are an asset.

 WORKING CONDITIONS

 Temporarily working remotely due to COVID-19.
 Occasional overtime work is required.

 WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US
 Our dedication to the Employee Experience at CI is aimed at supporting, empowering and inspiring our talented team through:

 Recognition & Compensation
 Training & Development
 Health & Well-being
 Communication & Feedback

 If you are a passionate, committed and dynamic individual, please submit your resume in confidence by clicking “Apply”.
 Only qualified candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
 CI Financial Corp. and all of our affiliates (“CI”) are committed to fair and accessible employment practices and we are committed to providing accommodations for persons with disabilities. If you require accommodations in order to apply for any job opportunities, or require this posting in an additional format, please contact us at accessible.recruitment@ci.com, or call 416-364-1145 ext. 4747. If you are contacted by CI regarding a job opportunity or testing and require accommodation in any stage of the recruitment process, please use the above contact information. We will work with all applicants to determine appropriate accommodation for individual accessibility needs.
