Title: Senior System Business Analyst - Public Sector
Description:
Putting people first, every day:

BDO is a firm built on a foundation of positive relationships with our people and our clients. Each day, our professionals provide exceptional service, helping clients with advice and insight they can trust. In turn, we offer an award-winning environment that fosters a people-first culture with a high priority on your personal and professional growth.
Your opportunity:

Our Toronto or Ottawa, office is looking for a Senior Business Analyst to join our Technology Consulting Practice. This role would allow for a candidate to develop various aspects of their skill sets including: change & stakeholder management, business process modelling & optimization, requirement planning and management, solution assessment and validation.
As part of this role, you will act as a liaison between business units and technology teams to elicit, analyze, document, validate business requirements, user stories and process mapping. The individual will also be able to direct and monitor QA/QC activities to ensure that the solution will meet business needs.
Responsibilities will include:
Consult with business leaders to ensure understanding of requirements and their alignment to strategic direction of the business.
Interact with stakeholders to become a trusted advisor throughout the engagement.
Understand business strategy and objectives by studying the business function, gathering information, and evaluating output requirements and formats. Elicits and documents functional and non-functional requirements for services to meet business needs.
Possess advanced level understanding of Business Analysis, business processes, workflows, and methodologies.
Direct and monitor BA and QA/QC activities to ensure the traceability and optimum coverage of business requirements by defined test plans, test cases and test scripts.
Collaborate with application developers, designers, and architects to ensure a shared understanding of the business model and requirements.
Establish the estimation of analysis, documentation and testing efforts for various projects and initiatives.
Provide senior management/project management regular updates on deliverable timeline and project status.
Responsible for conducting workshops to gain insights into end user and customer needs.
Manage the Product Backlog for a solution, working with the greater delivery team to prioritize requirements, define and manage scope and sprints for a project.
Work with end users to plan and execute User Acceptance Testing.
Respond proactively to both business and project issues and escalate appropriately.
Perform other job-related duties as assigned.
How do we define success for your role?
You demonstrate BDO's core values through all aspect of your work: Integrity, Respect and Collaboration
You understand your client’s industry, challenges, and opportunities; client describe you as positive, professional, and delivering high-quality work
You identify, recommend, and are focused on effective service delivery to your clients
You share in an inclusive and engaging work environment that develops, retains & attracts talent
You actively participate in the adoption of digital tools and strategies to drive an innovative workplace
You grow your expertise through learning and professional development.
Your Qualifications
University Degree or College/CEGEP Diploma.
Minimum of 5 years of experience in Business Analyst or Business System Analyst role.
Public Sector experience is preferred.
Solid understanding of SDLC, Software BA methodologies, tools and process with proven experience in Waterfall, Agile or Hybrid development environment.
Analytical thinking and using Business Analysis techniques to problem-solving, requirements elicitation and analysis, data modelling, business process modelling and requirements management.
Thorough understanding of how to interpret business needs and translate them into the solution and operational requirements.
Ability to produce requirements artifacts, such as Process Flow Diagrams, Wireframes, BRDs, SRS, User Stories, Use Cases and scenario, Data Migration Rules and Mapping, etc.
Proficient in establishing relationships, analyzing perspectives and managing stakeholders.
Ability to guide QA strategy, test plan and direct testing and quality assurance activities.
In-depth collaboration and team skills to work with a diverse working group.
Personal organization skills that can manage work effort to provide quality service in a productive and cost-effective manner.
Strong ability to manage competing priorities on multiple projects simultaneously to meet deadlines.
Must be self-sufficient and require limited assistance to perform duties.
In-depth verbal and written communication skills.
Optional qualifications:
Experience with business cases, RFPs and statements of work.
Experience with data, cloud.
Experience with writing SQL scripts.
ITIL v3, CMST, CMSQ, PMP, CBAP or CCBA certification.
Bi-lingual (French).
Federal security reliability/secret clearance.
Industry experience (insurance, mining, others).
Why BDO?
Our firm is committed to providing an environment where you can be successful in the following ways:
We enable you to engage with the firm's strategic plan, and be a key contributor to the success and growth of the firm.
We help you be the best professional you can be in our services, industries and markets.
Achieve your personal goals outside of the office and make an impact on your community.
Giving back, it adds up: Where company meets community. BDO is actively involved in our communities by supporting local charity initiatives. We support staff with local and national events where you will be given the opportunity to contribute to your community.

Total rewards that matter: We pay for performance with competitive total cash compensation that recognizes and rewards your contribution. We provide flexible benefits from day one, and a market leading personal time off policy. We are committed to supporting your overall wellness beyond working hours, and provide reimbursement for wellness initiatives that fit your lifestyle.

Everyone counts: We believe every employee should have the opportunity to participate and succeed. Through leadership by our Chief Inclusion and Diversity Officer, we are committed to a workplace culture of respect, inclusion, and diversity. We recognize and celebrate the valuable differences among each of us, including race, religious beliefs, physical or mental disabilities, age, place of origin, marital status, family status, gender or gender identity and sexual orientation. If you require accommodation to complete the application process, please contact us.


Ready to make your mark at BDO? Click “Apply now” to send your up-to-date resume to one of our Talent Acquisition Specialists.

To explore other opportunities at BDO, check out our careers page.
Thank you for applying! We look forward to meeting with the selected interview candidates.
To explore other opportunities at BDO, check out our careers page. #LI-KK

Title: Pricing & Promotions Analyst
Description:
What Is the Prescription For A Great Career?



 At Rexall, we are community difference makers. Our hearts skip a beat when we meet talent who sees the bigger picture and wants to make an impact in our communities, our teams, and our business. This means finding even better ways to work, share ideas, and making a material difference in the Rexall journey.
       


 We are leaders in health and wellness and a talent destination for over 7000+ Rexall team members. We are proud to be part of the McKesson family, ranked eighth in the fortune 500. Together, we are defining better health through innovation, service, and living the “ICARE” values. Talk about a dream team!
       


 At Rexall, we are better together. We serve our customers, partners, and patients best—we are our best—when everyone brings their true self to work. Our connected, inclusive culture celebrates our lived experiences, backgrounds, expertise, and self-expression to let us win as one team. Leveraging our differences distinguishes us and brings out our best performance.
       


 The road ahead is one of adventure and heart. Are you our next all star?
       

 The Role: Pricing & Promotions Analyst

         Reporting to the Manager, Pricing and Promotions, this role will be an integral member of a high-profile, cross functional-strategic initiative focused on optimizing the effectiveness of Rexall’s promotional activities. The Pricing & Promotions Analyst acts as consultants to key Category Management partners, providing fact-based insights and recommendations to improve total sales, margin and overall promotions' effectiveness.
       


 Principal Responsibilities:


 Will be responsible for accurately forecasting, tracking, and reporting the sales, margin, and promotional impact and effectiveness across a range of front of store categories (Cosmetics, Convenience, Beauty and Health etc).
 Work directly with Category Managers and Directors to optimize promotional sales and make recommendations based on trends, targets, promotional strategies
 Provide proactive recommendations on sales-, margin-, and basket-driving promotions
 Monitors and analyzes promotional activities to determine efficiency, accuracy, and performance relative to forecast and identify trends
 Analyze data to calculate baseline sales and margin and estimate incremental sales and margin for promotional within a set of categories.
 Own real-time consolidated forecast; measure and provide reporting relative to category targets and other metrics
 Support the Manager, Pricing and Promotions to develop and implement product price strategies including segment strategies for the various markets and channels.
 Download and organize baseline price information, analyze and report on inconsistencies, and finds opportunities to optimize sales and profitability through pricing strategies.
 Build various reports such as daily trend report, ad reports, period end reports, etc. for various customers in Merchandising.
 Perform weekly updates to Ad Reporting Tool and develop promo reports on ad hoc basis.
 Update monthly scorecard with new data and present results to team to show performance year over year.
 Perform other duties as assigned to support Rexall Pharmacy Group ULC



 Knowledge, Skills and Experience:


 2-3 year College Diploma in a related field.
 Analytical and strong attention to detail: including; exploring data, discovering patterns, relationships, anomalies and trends.
 Excellent organizational, time management and multi-tasking skills.
 Customer-focused and a great teammate.
 Excellent communication skills both written and verbal.
 Solid understanding of Microsoft Office software, specifically Excel. Access is preferred.



 The Rexall DNA:


 Ready to make an impact- You are mission-driven and want to make a difference
 Builds consensus- Your people-first mindset shows in all that you do
 Embraces change- You move fast and change excites you
 Drives achievement- You are wired to always exceed your personal best
 Overcomes adversity- You see the world as glass half full and embrace a good challenge
 Trail blazer- You love creating the path forward and being able to shape the future
 Fun- You think laughter is the best medicine and your positive energy is contagious



 Side effects may include…


 A closely connected culture
 Competitive compensation, pension, benefits, personal days, employee discounts, and vacation time
 Fully utilizing your talent
 Professional growth and development via challenging projects and assignments
 Warm and fuzzy feelings knowing you have helped your community, your team, the business and social causes through the Rexall Care Network



 The Hiring Process:


 Start your #ALLin journey by applying the role you want online
 We’ll send you an invitation to complete a digital interview so you can tell us more about yourself
 One of the members of our Talent Attraction team will connect with you to chat about our #ALLin, award winning and Great Place to Work certified culture
 Follow us on @LifeatRexall on IG and Rexall Pharmacy Group on LinkedIn
 Bonus! You can earn some cash – for every single friend you refer once you get hired!



 Are you? #ALLin?


 It’s a condition of employment that you be fully vaccinated within 14 days of your start date, and should you receive an offer you will have to attest to this in writing. In addition, you may be required to upload proof of vaccination or have a valid medical or other Human Rights Code-related exemption.

 Rexall Pharmacy Group ULC is committed to providing an accessible environment for all of our customers, employees, and job applicants. Rexall Pharmacy Group ULC will make available to any selected applicants’ accommodations and/or accessible formats should they require. Candidates are encouraged to discuss any accommodation they may need in order to allow for the most effective selection process.

Title: Sr Bus Application Analyst
Description:
TD Description
Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.
Department Overview
Customer data is an integral part of TD and is currently an underutilized asset of our organization. The Data as a Service (DaaS) - Application Support & Compliance Product is responsible for the organization, management, and oversight of customer data and related solutions for the enterprise, including operational platforms, analytical data stores, data management solutions and customer communication capabilities. This team/pod is primarily responsible for supporting 20+ business applications and platforms. In this role you will be working closely with various stakeholders, technology support teams and TD Control Partners to help, identify and support business operations to the various applications and platforms.
Job Description
About this Role

We are seeking a self-motivated and well-versed individual who wants to work in a fast-paced team operating in a dynamic business environment. Reporting to the Practice Lead from a people management perspective and part of an agile pod. The Senior Business Analyst will be responsible for managing multiple applications and platforms supported by the team/pod by ensuring timely and effective business support for operations. The Senior Business Analyst will work closely with various Lines of Business and technology partners to ensure the applications are aligned to our Enterprise Strategy, deliver legendary customer service, implement process improvements to ensure consistency, quality, and operational excellence supporting customer information management for the Enterprise.

In this role, responsibilities include:
Support for one or more of the following applications and platform: Big Data and Legacy platforms (Oracle/DB2) and applications; and focus on overall business operation solutions, optimization and process improvements
Support the Cloud migration project in the implementation of the Support Op model ensuring the project is hitting milestones and escalating issues promptly.
Introduce higher levels of automation, reduce manual processes, streamline processes and identify and resolve business and process issues.
Implement and be responsible for Support op model procedures
Accountable for documentation management for Business Operations and Project artifacts (ie. Operations Manuals, Business Process Documentation, Test Plans, etc)
Mapping of processes (ie. current and future state) for Business Operations
Support development and/or implementation of standards, policies, procedures, and solutions that mitigate risk and maximize availability of service, efficiency and effectiveness.
Oversee the incident management communication for all applications supported by Application Support & Compliance team to create awareness for Lines of Business (LOB) and technology partners and by working cohesively to resolve the issues quickly and effectively.
Lead and coordinate the integrated implementation of policies, processes, procedures, and solutions across multiple functional areas supported by ED&A Operations team.
Identify issues and opportunities, understand trends and provide specialized business management advice to manager and teams for process improvement.
Support the promotion and expansion of operation capabilities including benefits identification
Adhere to internal policies / procedures and applicable regulatory guidelines, contribute to the review of internal processes and activities and assist in identifying potential opportunities to improve operational efficiencies.
Act as an escalation point for application and operation issues both directly and through internal/external business partners (including external vendors)

Job Requirements
What can you bring to TD?
Share your most relevant experience, credentials and knowledge for this role, as well as these essential requirements and attributes:
Undergraduate degree
The ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously while maintaining a high standard of work and attention to details
Experienced knowledge in using Microsoft software, particularity Excel, MS Visio, PowerPoint, SharePoint Designer
Experienced knowledge in using JIRA, Confluence, and ServiceNow
Detail oriented with strong analytical skills
Good verbal and written communication skills
Excellent time management and organizational skills
Able to adapt and prioritize, meeting deadlines, in a fast-paced environment
Operates with a sense of urgency, quickly responding to Stakeholders
Positive and professional attitude and always demonstrates professionalism
Additional Information
Team Commitments
Participate fully as a member of the team, support a positive work environment that promotes service to the business, quality, innovation and teamwork and ensure timely communication of issues/ points of interest
Support the team by continuously enhancing knowledge / expertise in own area and participate in knowledge transfer within the team and business unit
Keep current on emerging trends/ developments and grow knowledge of the business, related tools and techniques
Participate in personal performance management and development activities, including cross training within own team
Keep others informed and up-to-date about the status / progress of projects and / or all relevant or useful information related to day-to-day activities
Contribute to the success of the team by willingly assisting others in the completion and performance of work activities; provide training, coaching and/or guidance as appropriate.
Contribute to a fair, positive and equitable environment that supports a diverse workforce
Act as a brand champion for your business area/function and the bank, both internally and/or externally
Participate in knowledge transfer within the team and other business units, including participation in cross-functional groups or committees
Inclusiveness
At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Business Analytics Analyst - Permanent Role - 336275
Description:
Business Analytics Analyst – Permanent Role
On behalf of our client in the Consulting Sector, PROCOM is looking for a Business Analytics Analyst.
Business Analytics Analyst – Job Description
Be a Power User of our data infrastructure – data flows from lake to visualization
Consult with business units to assist with the preparation of opportunity assessments and business cases that will help rationalize project ideas to the project prioritization and selection committee
Monitor and control all project activities, issues, change requests and risks
Communicate with project sponsors, senior management, and functional area managers and/or consultants regarding the status of specific projects through formal and informal verbal and written communication methods
Produce simple, concise presentations and visualizations of data to clearly communicate key insights
Building and assuring the proper data quality and governance processes
Work with the Global Data Office to build and enhance Data Quality tests
This role will need to establish the escalation process of the Data Quality exception-based flags and work with internal divisions to fix issues related to data
Develop effective communication with all different parties in case of data issues
Restructure our data governance function by monitoring tasks and updating documentation
Analyze the data impact on the business and collaborate with the risk function to sign off on processes
Relationship Management:
Foster successful relationships and act as a trusted advisor for team members and stakeholders across the enterprise
Ensure the operations follow all Safe Food for Canadians Regulations (SFCR), Global Food Safety Initiative (GFSI) and Good Warehouse Practices (GWP)/Good Drivers Practices (GDP) for transport rules and regulations.
Other projects or duties as assigned
Ensure the operations follow all Safe Food for Canadians Regulations (SFCR), Global Food Safety Initiative (GFSI) and Good Warehouse Practices (GWP)/Good Drivers Practices (GDP) for transport rules and regulations

Business Analytics Analyst – Mandatory Skills
Power BI Dashboard developing skillset using DAX language & report building
3 – 5 years of experience in related field
Excellent programming skills, including expert level familiarity with DAX, SQL, Python, or similar
Demonstrated knowledge of Power BI functions such as analytics, data modeling & mining, reporting, data cleansing, Power Query
Knowledge of big data infrastructure
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into the application and operational requirements
Exceptional interpersonal skills in areas such as teamwork, facilitation, and negotiation
Excellent communication and presentation skills with the ability to create and tailor communications to a wide variety of audiences
BA/BS in technical field (Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Physics, Engineering, etc.)
This position must pass a post-offer background and drug test

Title: Manager, Business Intelligence
Description:
Altima Dental provides dental care to thousands of Canadians through over 100 locations across Canada. The company is growing rapidly through acquisitions and organically through new and innovative ways. We are hiring a Manager of Business Intelligence to help drive this growth.
Manager Business Intelligence
The Manager of Business Intelligence will play an integral role in expanding the organization’s analytical capabilities and providing value-added analysis to management and business partners. Our team is exploring transformative ways to use business intelligence to enable management to make better and more informed decisions.


The Manager of Business Intelligence will:


Assist in enabling, communicating, and promoting a data culture based on data driven decision-making across the organization
Plan out and manage project milestones and dependencies
Help to choose the best technologies to meet our needs
Deliver key analysis and KPIs in an organized way, including UI/UX design of Power BI reports and dashboards
Develop/improve new and existing Power BI data models
Assist in the maintenance of our data infrastructure and ETL process
Explore data and behavior patterns to improve existing processes
Assist with ad-hoc projects as required


This is a dynamic role with an opportunity for you to develop a broad skillset and to make a meaningful impact within a growing environment. This opportunity will be a perfect fit for an individual with an analytical mindset, a willingness to explore metrics in creative ways, and a keen interest in delivering information in an organized and meaningful way.
Qualifications

University degree/college diploma with 2 to 5 years of relevant experience
Intermediate to advanced level of computer skills, ideally with experience in SQL, Power BI, Excel and Azure
Strong organization and analytical skills with an attention to detail
Excellent communication skills and ability to interact with all levels of the organization
Experience managing projects and people
Working knowledge of the Microsoft Azure platform is an advantage, but not a requirement


We thank all candidates for their interest; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
If accommodation is needed in the application process, or those needing job postings in an alternative format please e-mail a request to hr@altima.ca.
Altima strongly believes that diversity in the workplace is essential to our success. As a result, we are committed to providing equal opportunities regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

Title: Senior Forest Analyst
Description: Can you bridge the gap between the business of forestry and the information/data/analysis required to support informed decision making? Are you analytical by nature and understand data, statistics, and a range of analytical tools?Forsite is looking for a Senior Forest Analyst (Edmonton) with solid communication skills to support our clients in Western Canada. The successful applicant will become a key team member supporting the delivery of strategic planning and landbase analysis projects. The position requires a minimum of 5 years of related experience, a post-secondary education with a natural resource management focus and professional forester accreditation (or eligibility).Forsite is a dynamic forest management services company serving government and industry clients since 1987. We are a collaborative project-focused organization that strives to provide opportunity for our employees and value for our clients. Forsite has been SAFE certified since 2007 and is committed to providing a safe work environment.Working within Forsite’s Resource Management and Technology business area you will lead and work with project teams to provide forestry business knowledge and technical analysis that offers cost effective, innovative, and meaningful solutions. You will have exceptional problem solving, written and oral communications skills with an ability to translate complex analysis results into practical knowledge that supports informed decision making.Potential project types include forest management planning, timber supply analysis, cumulative effects analysis, landbase reporting for timber and non-timber resource values, carbon reporting / management strategies, economic viability and operability, inventory projections, growth and yield analysis, strategic silviculture investment analyses, etc.The ideal candidate will have a background in operational forestry, strategic planning, timber supply, growth & yield tools, and GIS analysis. You must have excellent data manipulation skills using databases, geodatabases, and scripting languages (SQL, Python, etc).You will be expected to produce clear written and verbal communications to document project inputs and explain project results.Forsite is looking for the most suitable individual for the position available with the skills and knowledge to effectively complete the duties required of the position. Applications are welcome from anyone. At Forsite, we foster and sustain an environment of diversity & inclusion where everyone can reach their full potential.Only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.Job Type: Full-time

Title: Customer Operations Analyst Principal
Description:
Ceridian is a global leader in Human Capital Management technology. Simply put, we allow our customers to do the most complex things well (HR, Payroll, Benefits Administration, Workforce Management and Talent Management) and do them to scale.

Makes Work Life Better™ is our brand promise, not only to our customers, but to our employees as well. Our flagship platform, Dayforce, helps leaders make smart decisions based on data, strategy and intelligence that create value and maximize productivity.

How do we make work life better?

By delivering an award-winning product, conceptualized and developed by award-winning leaders, that result in award-winning customer employee experiences
By hiring highly innovative, diverse talent that fully embraces and embodies our core values in everything they do: Customer Focus, Equity, Shared Ambition, Agility, Transparency, Optimism
By using modern technology, such as voice-activation with Dayforce Assistant and access to your money as soon as you earn it with Dayforce Wallet to stay in rhythm with the evolving demands of our 4 million global users

We understand that no matter where you are, choosing a new employer is always one of life’s most stressful events. We encourage you to check us out at Ceridian.com to learn more about how we are impacting the world of work for our customers, employees and you!

Location: For this role, we are open to remote work anywhere in the US or Canada

About the Opportunity:
As the Customer Operations, Principal you are a versatile, self-driven, proactive, and hands-on key business partner to the SVP within one of Ceridian’s Support business units, and their leaders. Your responsibilities include Business Insights, Strategic Projects, Process & Tools, Reporting & Analytics, Forecasting, and working alongside a diverse team of business partners.
Reporting to the Sr. Director, Customer Operations, this role provides an excellent opportunity to be a key operations lead in an important area of our business that is challenged with a wide range of deliverables related to customer experience and as a result, has significant exposure to Sr. leaders. You will see the impact of your work in this role.

Expectations for the role include:

Ability to deliver relevant insights and recommendations, driven by complex detailed-level analyses that you’ve built or consolidated and present effectively
Ability to actively identify areas of opportunity for the business to drive scale, improve margins, and/or streamline existing processes
Problem-solving, project management, and collaboration skills to take on new challenges, interpret operational needs, and develop & execute integrated, tactical solutions in collaboration with relevant business functions for overall success
Understand customer success key drivers and stay close to the business through regular interactions with leadership
Strong team player who is willing to collaborate and knowledge share with the team on an ongoing basis

What you'll get to do:

Individual:

o. Build processes/targets/tools that help drive change across the business to achieve KPI’s
p. Forecast activity using team input, historical analysis, forward-looking projections, and other key metrics to make recommendations to leaders, considering opportunities and risk factors
q. Proactively design and interpret key performance metrics and appropriate data visualizations, and share insights with business partner
r. Proactively drive analysis based on gaps, articulating key highlights to senior leaders
s. Build strong relationships through value added interactions
t. Create/join relevant calls for leaders that you support, staying current with the business
u. Work directly with your business partners in support of launch & training activities
v. Build relationships across the business to influence outcomes that ensure that solutions fit with your detailed knowledge of the operations, goals, and processes of the company
w. Forward looking thinker, with an ability to ensure process creation/enhancements can scale with the business

Team:

x. Create and/or work with our Customer Ops team to make repeatable/reliable reports to support the business
y. Intake, review, and execute on tactical ad-hoc requests from the business
z. Participate in quality “technical reviews” of peer analytics output
aa. Coordinate with IT & other Ops business units for larger scale deployments to the business
bb. Actively participate in strategic initiatives across the company and stay connected to the business and pace of change
cc. Partner with additional teams to get data/reporting relevant to customers to support value of Dayforce through customer journey.

Skills and Experience we value:

Curiosity and passion to continue to learn about the business and ask questions
Ability to think strategically from the perspective of the leadership team, to synthesize data across multiple datasets and pull together an overall story
Excellent analytical skills, problem solving and organizational skills, with strong attention to detail
Advanced skills with PBI
Working knowledge of SFDC an asset
Superior knowledge of Microsoft Suite, with major focus on analytics and presentation programs
Ability to lead a team within operations as we scale the business
Exceptional presentation, written, and oral communication skills
Solid leadership skills, including driving impact and influence across teams
Strong strategic planning skills and sharp business judgment with exceptional execution
Strong project management skills with high levels of personal accountability/reliability
Proactive learner with self-starter mentality and strong interpersonal skills
Developed business acumen and financial literacy skills
Ability to take on a people leadership capacity within the team as we scale

What would make you stand out:

Post-Secondary Diploma in Analytics or Business-related discipline
Experience in the HCM space
5+ years relevant experience with tax operations, customer support, customer success, management consulting, data analytics, or other relevant professional experience
Experience in forecasting, planning and analysis of key metrics an asset
CPA or MBA an asset
3+ years people management experience

Ceridian is fueled by the diversity of our talented employees. We are an equal opportunity employer and consider and embrace ALL individuals and what makes them unique. We believe our employees should be happy and healthy, with peace of mind and a sense of fulfillment. We provide our employees with comprehensive benefits for various life circumstances and needs, great opportunities for career development, and a balanced lifestyle to achieve personal and professional success. We encourage all individuals to apply for positions that fit their passions.

We thank all applicants in advance for their interest in this position; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. If you are selected for an interview, you will be contacted by a Ceridian Recruiter with a @ceridian.com email directly from our organization.

Title: Senior Consultant, Business Intelligence (flexibility to work from any MNP location in Canada)
Description:
What do you think of when you hear the name MNP? Most likely tax and accounting, but as one of Canada’s largest consulting organizations, we’re so much more! We’re also serious about technology.
Make an impact with our Digital Solutions team as a Senior Consultant, Business Intelligence. This diverse team of tech-savvy problem solvers has expertise and delivery depth across client platforms, applied data and analytics, applications and cloud and business platforms solutions. As a trusted advisor, you’ll gather, secure and organize meaningful insights to design digital solutions that meet clients’ evolving needs.
At MNP Digital, we’re a team of highly skilled and creative thinkers that continuously support and learn from each other. We pride ourselves on translating our clients’ challenges into real results by leveraging technology – and that all starts with having the right people to deliver. We’ve created an environment where you’ll continuously grow, always have a voice and collaborate on work that’s meaningful and fulfilling. If you’re ready to take your career into your own hands, you’ve come to the right place.
Responsibilities
Lead the development of business intelligence reporting utilizing Power BI, Power Platform and other leading analytical tools
Reporting to the Manager, Business Intelligence, provide input on best practice development principals, as well as ensure data integrity, quality and accuracy in reporting
Work with data engineering, data science and business teams to develop MNP’s Enterprise Analytics program
Understanding of reporting security requirements (row level security, etc.)
Engage in the quality assurance process and manage deployment pipeline for BI reports (Power BI embedded deployment pipeline)
Architect, design and execute on the development of efficient and robust data models that can be leveraged to develop engaging and effective dashboards
Play a pivotal role in defining enterprise BI standards (including visual design), ensuring the delivery of high quality and scalable reporting
Provide training and documentation to users ensuring consistency and standardization when running self-serve analytics
Query and analyze large datasets of both structured and unstructured data
Develop a thorough understanding of MNP’s services, businesses and industry
Skills and Experience
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field
3+ years of experience in an analytics role, utilizing business intelligence tools
Experience in PowerBI and SQL
Experience in utilizing DAX to create dynamic measures in PowerBI
Experience in Power Platform
Certifications in Azure and Power BI will be considered an asset:
MCSA: BI Reporting
Microsoft Certified: Azure Data Engineer Associate
Microsoft Certified: Azure Enterprise Data Analyst Associate
Microsoft Certified: Power Platform Solution Architect Expert
Experience with Azure Data Factory would be an asset
Experience with data lakes would be an asset
MyRewards@MNP
More than a paycheque, MNP is proud to offer customized rewards for our team members. With a focus on health and wealth, we provide an extensive list of benefits that support our unique culture and foster work-life integration.
Our MyRewards@MNP program offers benefits that allow you to thrive at work and outside of the office. Be rewarded with generous paid time off including 4 personal days, firm sponsored social events, a group pension plan with 4% matching contribution, voluntary savings products, bonus program eligibility, a wellness subsidy, health and dental benefits, mental health resources, exclusive access to perks and discounts, professional development assistance, learning opportunities through MNP University, a flexible ‘Dress For Your Day’ environment and more!
#LI-Hybrid

Title: Coordinator/Analyst, Surgical Supply Chain
Description:
Explore the next stage of your career with one of BC’s top employers!
Fraser Health is responsible for the delivery of hospital and community-based health services to over 1.9 million people in 20 diverse communities from Burnaby to Fraser Canyon on the traditional territories of the Coast Salish and Nlaka’pamux Nations. Our team of nearly 40,000 staff, medical staff and volunteers is dedicated to serving our patients, families and communities to deliver on our vision: Better health, best in health care.
Position Highlights
We currently have an exciting opportunity for a Full Time Surgical Supply Chain Coordinator/Analyst to support the Surgical Services team at Surrey Memorial Hospital and Jim Pattison Outpatient Care & Surgery Centrelocated in Surrey, B.C. In this role, you will be responsible for the analysis, coordination and conduct of audits related to Supply Chain and System effectiveness within the Surgical Network across Fraser Health while collaborating with the Surgical Director, OR Managers, front line staff and BCCSS.
Your main responsibilities will be to:
Oversee and supervise supply analysts and/or DPC clerks, as appropriate/required, including the coordination and evaluation of staff training and orientation.
Analyze and evaluate findings, develop recommendations on system and process improvements to ensure data quality and compliance with MOH standards/requirements.
Provide information related to data quality and operational requirements to user departments and related areas.
Provide support and assistance in the development and implementation of Supply Chain & Scheduling standards, policies and processes, including the coordination of Change Management processes.
Conduct and implement projects as assigned.
For more details, kindly refer to the full job description.
As the successful candidate, you have:
Graduated from a recognized Diploma Program in a health, business, Supply Chain or technology related discipline.
Three (3) years of experience in a supply chain or supply systems environment, including one (1) year of supervisory experience.
Valid Class 5 BC Driver's License and access to a vehicle for business-related purposes.
An equivalent combination of education, training and experience is acceptable.
Your professional and technical capabilities consist of the following:
Demonstrated ability to supervise.
Knowledge of Purchasing and Inventory.
Ability to evaluate staff, educational requirements and to conduct training and orientation sessions.
Knowledge of Meditech Magic with ability to audit/analyze processes.
Ability to operate related equipment including applicable software applications
This Full Time position is available at Surrey Memorial Hospital and Jim Pattison Outpatient Care & Surgery Centre.
If this sounds like the ideal role for you, here are more reasons why you should apply:
A career that offers you the opportunity to work in a fast growing and exciting organization with health care providers who are excellent in their respective fields.
Competitive salary package, including comprehensive health benefits coverage.
An opportunity to make a difference every single day in the world of health care.
We are proud of the innovation, dedication, professionalism and tenacity of our physicians, employees and volunteers. More than any building or technology, it's our people who make Fraser Health distinct.
Effective October 26 th 2021, all new hires to Fraser Health will need to have full COVID 19 vaccination (have received a full series of a World Health Organization “WHO” approved vaccine against infection by SARS-COV-2, or a combination of approved WHO vaccines). Please note this applies to all postings, and individual medical exemptions must be approved by the Provincial Health Officer.
Twelve acute care hospitals, BC’s first dedicated outpatient care and surgery centre and a wide range of services in public health, home health, mental health and long-term care facilities - all within Metro Vancouver and the Fraser Valley. Known as one of the most desirable place to live in the world, these vibrant communities along with inspiring scenery and easy access to an abundance of outdoor activities provide an amazing quality of life.
Are you ready to take the next step in your career?
Apply today so we can continue the conversation and make a difference in the communities we serve. We value diversity in the work force and seek to maintain an environment of Respect, Caring & Trust.
Curious to know what it’s like to work here? Like us on Facebook (@fraserhealthcareers), follow us on Twitter & Instagram (@FHCareer), or connect with us on LinkedIn (fraserhealthcareers) for first-hand employee insights.

Title: Store Operations Analyst
Description:
Help us boldly shape retail in Canada
Canadian Tire Corporation’s (CTC) rich heritage of serving Canadians from coast-to-coast dates back to 1922. Our vision is to become the #1 retail brand in Canada by 2022 and we are focused on innovating and making important investments in our business, especially when it comes to our people. To reach our goal, we need the best talent to help us evolve and drive change across the business – and boldly help shape Canada’s retail industry. As we strive to be at the forefront of a complex and vastly changing retail industry, it is an exciting time to join the Canadian Tire family of companies.
Reporting to the Manager of Operations Reporting & Analysis, this position will collaborate with the Store Operations team to provide analytical interpretation, analysis, presented recommendations and consultative services to assist with new initiatives, day to day business, or to solve pressing business problems.
What you'll do
Responsibilities
Support the business with an analytical skillset, including developing operational reporting and executive dashboards, providing analysis for the business
Manage data, translation of data into actionable insights
Provide findings to all levels of the organization’s leadership in an understandable and compelling manner
Work with business partners to optimize tasks to increase efficiency and accuracy, include driving the design of automation for the business
Build robust and interactive reports to shed light on the performance of various initiatives
Who you are
We are looking for individuals who are:
Creative and courageous, with the ability to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold, strategic moves in this rapidly evolving retail environment
Action oriented, and comfortable taking calculated risks to better serve our customers and business
Outcome focused, critical thinkers with the ability to analyze and visualize, to ensure continuous improvement across our entire business
Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward
Effectively anticipate and respond to disruption, while consistently delivering strong performance
If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then this is definitely the place to be.
What you bring
A post-secondary degree or certificate (business, finance/ commerce) and / or 2+ years of experience in an administrative function with financial or business reporting responsibilities or 2+ years in an analytics function
Proficient with statistical methods and mathematical techniques including predictive modeling, regression, AB testing, cluster analysis, etc.
Advanced Excel skills
Strong problem solving, analytical and strategic thinking skills; can see the "big picture" in a complex business environment
Ability to clearly communicate results to technical and non-technical audiences
Demonstrated experience in exploratory data analysis and data mining, processing of large, complex data sets
Comfortable manipulating and analyzing complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality data from varying sources and big data environments
Hands-on experience using business intelligence and statistical analysis tools such as R, Cognos, Micro Strategy, Knime, Alteryx or other
Familiarity with relational databases and SQL
Have a good eye for and an understanding of visual report design principles
Ability to execute multiple projects and drive key business results under tight deadlines
Self-starter attitude with willingness to learn and master new technologies
Ability to work independently and in an ambiguous environment
About Canadian Tire Corporation
As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies . To learn more follow us on LinkedIn .

Title: Senior Analyst, Risk & Controls (IT Audit)
Description:
At Parkland, our purpose is to Power Journeys & Energize Communities. We are a prominent independent supplier and marketer of fuel and petroleum products and a leading convenience store operator. As One Parkland team, we proudly serve diverse retail, commercial and wholesale customers across Canada, the United States, the Caribbean region, and South America. We power a growing family of locally known brands including Gas Plus, Pioneer, RaceTrac, Superpumper, Ultramar, Chevron, Esso, and ON the RUN.
We recognize that diversity gives us an edge and inclusion propels us forward. We’re also a passionate team of down-to-earth achievers, committed to getting our customers, colleagues and communities further, faster. As such, we welcome talented individuals that have a variety of perspectives, backgrounds, and industry experience who will contribute to the success of our One Parkland team.
Position Title: Senior Analyst, Risk & Controls (IT Audit)
Team and Location: Risk & Controls – Calgary, AB or Remote
Position Summary:
Reporting to the Manager, Risk and Controls (IT Audit), the Senior Analyst will assist with the IT compliance activities, across Parkland’s various businesses and operations, including IT, business transformation and integration initiatives.
The successful candidate will bring a commercially focused, value-add, risk management mindset and demonstrate a track record of ‘thinking outside of the box’ and driving significant innovation in the delivery of compliance audits.
Key Responsibilities:
Assist with developing and maintaining the IT Risk Assessment and scoping for Parkland; including identifying areas where compliance audits should focus.
Execute Parkland’s IT compliance (C-SOX and SOX) program including execution of walkthroughs and tests of design and operational effectiveness of IT controls. These include:
Assist with annual and ongoing IT compliance scoping to identify any changes to the systems, applications, and automated controls considered to be in-scope for the current fiscal year.
Prepare clear, concise, appropriately referenced work papers to document test procedures performed and conclusion drawn.
Pre and post- implementation reviews of system implementations or enhancements.
Coordinate compliance program testing IT controls with external audit IT team members, control owners, managers and executive Management.
Evaluate IT control deficiencies for impact and perform root cause analysis to determine appropriate Management actions.
Monitor Management’s remediation efforts to closure, including review of supporting evidence.
Support initiatives to improve controls, make processes more efficient, effective, and/or reduce cycle time for IT compliance.
Perform various other reviews of IT management policies and procedures such as change management, business continuity planning/ disaster recovery and information security to ensure that controls surrounding these processes are adequate.
Bring best practices and strong IT Controls methodology to help the department develop a “best in class” practice.
Assist with the implementation of data analytical tools to perform sampling, analyze data to improve audit and business efficiency and effectiveness, (including for risk assessments).
Support the maturation of IT Compliance program across the organization.
The team is to be regarded as a business partner when reviewing and developing procedures for the business. Policy and procedure research and development is required as well as review and recommending refinements.
Qualifications and Skills:
3 to 5 years of relevant C-SOX and SOX IT Controls experience.
Certified Information System Auditor (CISA) with Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) is considered an asset.
Excellent knowledge and experience of IT General Controls across domains such as access, change management, operations, application controls and reports testing.
Experience with application of data analytics and visualization (preferred).
Ability to build relationships with business customers.
Ability to manage confidential content.
Strong attention to detail and follow-up.
Ability to work under pressure, resolve problems and make decisions quickly and effectively, using a strong sense of self confidence.
Project management skills including the ability to work on various projects and prioritize accordingly.
Moderate knowledge of accounting practices (preferred).
High energy: Self-motivated with the ability to effectively manage concurrent projects.
We Offer:
Our Performance-based Annual Incentive Plan, an annual bonus awarding your performance.
A share in our success through the Employee Share Purchase Plan and 100% company matching.
A flexible group benefit plan that offers health and dental coverage choices to meet the needs of each unique employee. Inclusive of life and disability insurances, Health Care and Lifestyle Spending options, and a supportive Employee and Family Assistance Program.
Participation in Parkland Pledge, an employee-driven charitable giving program.
An employee referral program – earn up to $2000 for your referral.
In-house learning and development opportunities, leadership training, international opportunities.
Discount Programs and Educational Scholarship Programs for family members.
A safety focused work environment and ongoing safety training.
Please note:
Candidates must be legally able to work in Canada at this time. Parkland regrets that it is unable to sponsor employment Visas.
Parkland Corporation is committed to the principles of Employment Equity. We strive to provide accessibility in employment to ensure equal access to employment opportunities for candidates, including persons with disabilities. Parkland Corporation will endeavour to provide accommodation to persons with disabilities in the recruitment process upon request. If you are selected for an interview and you require accommodation due to a disability, please notify us upon scheduling your interview.
Please note that final candidates for this position will be required to undergo a confidential pre-employment background check which may include but not be limited to educational, criminal, credit, drug and alcohol and/or Fitness for Duty testing.

Title: Sr. Manager - Business Intelligence - Reporting & Analytics
Description:
Req Id: 365311

 At Bell, we do more than build world-class networks, develop innovative services and create original multiplatform media content – we advance how Canadians connect with each other and the world.
 If you’re ready to bring game-changing ideas to life and join a community that values, professional growth and employee wellness, we want you on the Bell team.
 Bell is making unmatched investments in our world-leading broadband fibre and wireless networks because we know they’re the backbone of the products and services our customers love. If you’re excited about transforming the way people connect, our Network team is the right place for you.
 We’ve created a brand new team for our Small and Medium Business customers. Our team sells the best Internet, TV and Wireless services across Canada. Using industry-leading, cutting-edge solutions in IoT and 5G we power Canada’s business growth. If you're an innovative, collaborative, and performance-driven professional who wants to play a key role in a winning culture, now is the time to join our team! Opportunities to build something of this scale don’t come around every day – get in on the ground floor!

 Our Business Intelligence Team within SMB provides reporting and analytical insight to Marketing, Sales and Product teams to support day-to-day operations and strategic planning. The team plays an integral role in decision-making at multiple levels of management through complex analyses, predictive modeling, data definition and standardization, data mining, reporting, as well as sourcing external data from 3rd party relationships.

 Do you know someone who would be perfect for this opportunity? If you refer a qualified candidate who is not a current Bell employee and they are hired, you may be eligible to receive a referral bonus! Simply look for the referral hashtag in the job description to see if this role qualifies.

 The Role:
 Reporting to the Director, Business Intelligence, this role will lead a team of BI professionals responsible for the delivery of reporting and analytics. You will deliver solutions that enable our strategic roadmap, establish governance across the BI requests, and drive best in class practices within BI.
 
The applicant will be responsible for the design and delivery of programs with speed and accuracy. It is imperative that the candidate is strategic, analytical, with the ability to think outside the box, and drive new unique approaches in a collaborative manner with all business units and levels.

 This role is a mix of project management, technical skills (SQL, SAS), and business analysis (data discovery, business rules, root cause analysis). You will bring significant experience and knowledge of business intelligence reporting and analytics. This foundational background will enable you to help us discover value from our data.

 Key Responsibilities:

 Lead BI professionals to support our BSMB segment to achieve their objectives
 Present key findings to management teams and business stakeholders
 Effectively engage and influence cross-functional teams to deliver highest level of quality on all projects
 Engage and build strong relationships with stakeholders to incorporate their goals, and instill confidence to ensure alignment to and adoption of solutions.
 Instill a performance culture, a sense of shared purpose and the collective skill sets needed to deliver business goals
 Know your strengths and build a team with complementary abilities by attracting and developing the right talent
 Foster excitement for what’s next by building and communicating the case for change
 Champion BI capabilities and create advocacy for the Business Intelligence team to our business partners and senior management
 Lead the identification, planning, development and implementation of enhancements to key reporting and analytics
 Develop and enforce standards around documentation, development and overall quality of deliverables


 Critical Qualifications & Competencies:

 Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Business Analytics, Information Technology, Computer Science and/or related fields or experience
 Ability to work in a fast paced environment and manage multiple requests through effective prioritization
 Strong problem solving skills and demonstrated ability to be highly creative in formulating solutions
 Excellent presentation skills
 Structured and proactive with the need to quickly execute agile development
 Resourceful, autonomous, disciplined self-starter, with the ability to work independently and as part of an extended team
 Passion for uncovering business needs, identifying opportunities, and aligning efforts to ensure timely implementation
 Knowledge of Microsoft suite including Excel and PowerPoint


 Preferred Competencies

 Significant experience and knowledge of Bell systems and data
 Project Management Designation/Certification 
Experience in business intelligence fields - strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, analyze, design and disseminate significant amounts of information with high attention to detail and accuracy
 Solid understanding of the BI lifecycle including the design, development, QA, maintenance, and support stages
 Knowledge of data marts and data design/architecture concepts
 5+ years of experience in the data management discipline covering the data development, reporting, and analytics space
