Title: Stagiaire Développeur informatique décisionnelle et gestion de données (4 mois) / Business Intelligence Developer Intern (4 months)
Description:
Job Description:
**THE ENGLISH POSTING FOLLOWS**
Airbus est un pionnier international de l'industrie aérospatiale. Nous sommes un leader dans la conception, la fabrication et la livraison de produits, services et solutions aérospatiaux à des clients à l'échelle mondiale. Nous visons un monde mieux connecté, plus sûr et plus prospère.
Constructeur d'avions commerciaux, avec des divisions Espace et Défense ainsi que des Hélicoptères, Airbus est la plus grande entreprise aéronautique et spatiale en Europe et un leader mondial.
Chez Airbus Canada, nos collaborateurs travaillent ensemble à faire évoluer la mobilité partout dans le monde, une bonne idée après l'autre. Si vous avez une bonne idée, nous avons l'environnement pour qu'elle devienne un produit unique ou une expérience client exceptionnelle. Vos idées sont notre énergie.
Dans votre rôle, vous devrez :
Travailler au sein du groupe de gestion de données de l’équipe de programme pour le A220
Participer au développement d’un système intégré de gestion de données qui est aussi un outil décisionnel
Analyser les requis de données et définir l'architecture des solutions de base de données.
Créer du rapportage et analytiques utilisant outils de SQL de Microsoft
Développer des automatisations utilisant Visual C# ou Python
En tant que candidat idéal,
Vous êtes inscrit pour un Baccalauréat en TI, informatique ou génie logiciel (ou équivalent)
Vous êtes motivé et démontrez un intérêt pour l’informatique décisionnelle et la gestion de données
Vous avez des connaissances des logiciels de MS office. Préférablement habile à manipuler des données dans le logiciel Microsoft Excel et Microsoft Access
Vous avez des connaissances dans Visual C# ou Python
Vous êtes une personne organisée et autonome
Si ce stage vous intéresse merci de postuler sur le site d’emploi de votre université.
Veuillez télécharger votre curriculum vitae en français et en anglais.
L'utilisation du genre masculin a été adoptée afin de faciliter la lecture et n'a aucune intention discriminatoire.
Airbus Canada souscrit au principe d'équité en matière d'emploi et encourage les femmes, les autochtones, les personnes handicapées et les membres des minorités visibles à soumettre leurs candidatures.
*****************************************************************************************************************************
Airbus is an international pioneer in the aerospace industry. We are a leader in the design, manufacture and delivery of aerospace products, services and solutions to customers worldwide. We aim for a better connected, safer and more prosperous world.
Manufacturer of commercial aircraft, with Space and Defense divisions as well as Helicopters, Airbus is the largest aeronautics and Space Company in Europe and a world leader.
At Airbus Canada, our people work together to make mobility evolve around the world, one good idea after another. If you have a great idea, we have the environment for it to become a unique product or a great customer experience. Your ideas are our energy.
In your role, you will:
Work with the Data Management team in the Program Office department for the A220 aircraft program
Participate in the development of an integrated data management system and business intelligence reporting tool
Analyze data requirements and architect database solutions
Develop reporting and analytics using Microsoft SQL tools
Develop automations using Python or Visual C#
As our ideal candidate,
You are enrolled in a Bachelor’s degree in IT, computer science, or software engineering (or equivalent)
You are motivated and demonstrate an interest in Business Intelligence and Data Management
You are familiar with MS Office, particularly Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Access
You are familiar with Visual C# or Python
You are organized and autonomous
If this internship interests you, please apply on your university’s employment platform.
Please upload your resume in French and English.
The use of the masculine gender has been adopted for ease of reading and has no discriminatory intent.
Airbus Canada subscribes to the principle of employment equity and encourages women, aboriginals, persons with disabilities and members of visible minorities to apply.
This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company’s success, reputation and sustainable growth.
Company:
Airbus Canada Limited Partnership
Contract Type:
Internship / Stage / Praktikum / Beca
Experience Level:
Student / Etudiant / Student / Estudiante
Job Family:
Programme & Project Management <JF-PP-PM>
By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus.

Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.
Airbus is, and always has been, committed to equal opportunities for all. As such, we will never ask for any type of monetary exchange in the frame of a recruitment process. Any impersonation of Airbus to do so should be reported to emsom@airbus.com .

Title: LRM Application Analyst
Description:
West Fraser is a leading diversified forest products company. We are listed on the TSX and recognized for the eighth time, as one of Canada's Top 100 Employers and one of Canada's Best Employers for Recent Graduates. Are you interested in working for a company that offers both a challenging work environment and a rewarding career path? We are a growing Company looking for talented people to be part of our team. Our Information Technology group in Quesnel, BC has an opportunity for an:
LRM Application Support Analyst
As part of the IT group, this role will provide support, analysis, and development assistance for the Land Resource Manager (LRM) enterprise application which supports the woodland operations areas of the business. It will be your responsibility to define, develop, test, analyze and maintain reports, integrations and applications to support strategic initiatives and enhance business performance. This includes writing, coding, testing, and analyzing data. You will also research, design, document, and modify specifications. You should have the ability to work in a dynamic environment and a willingness to troubleshoot technical issues.
You will be responsible for:
Being a lead resource in projects implementing new technologies to support strategic initiatives
Supporting Trimble LRM (Land Resource Manager) – An enterprise application for managing woodlands resources
Leading in maintenance, support, and operational troubleshooting of systems and applications to continuously improve service availability
Coordinating with key stakeholders for testing, enhancement, and upgrades of business systems
Identifying opportunities for improvement with our timber management technologies and implementing them
Integrating into a team of professionals motivated to use technology to give our organization a competitive advantage
Defining technical solutions to business challenges
Providing technical support for databases related to LRM including”
User and Security management
Databases Tuning
Data loading
As the ideal candidate you bring:
Four-year university or technical institute degree in the field of Computer Science or Engineering or equivalent work experience
Enterprise application support and configuration experience
A drive and ability to learn new technologies in short timeframes
Systems integration, interface design, data conversion and solution architecture experience
Moderate knowledge of PL/SQL or T-SQL Languages
Basic knowledge of Oracle and Microsoft data migration and ETL tools
JavaScript experience is an advantage
Knowledge of ITIL processes
Well-established organizational skills
Excellent communication skills
Detailed and proactive approach to work
Experience with Trimble LRM (Land Resource Manager)
West Fraser Timber has over 60 locations across Canada, the United States and Europe. We believe strongly in promoting from within and pride ourselves on providing a challenging environment with continuous development. The successful candidate should be interested in future growth opportunities within the company. West Fraser offers an excellent compensation package including a competitive salary, excellent benefits and an outstanding pension plan.
If this position sounds like the career for you, submit your cover letter and resume at www.westfraser.com/jobs click "apply now" in green at the top of the page.
For more information on West Fraser and our current opportunities, visit our website at: www.westfraser.com/jobs
We thank all candidates for their interest; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Junior Business Analyst - 336705
Description:
Analyste d’affaires junior
Dans le cadre de ses ententes avec ses différents clients, Procom est actuellement à la recherche d’un Analyste d’affaires junior pour une entreprise dans le domaine des télécommunications. Notre client est situé à Montréal.

Description des tâches et responsabilités – Analyste d’affaires junior
Les responsabilités du poste incluent :
Travailler en collaboration avec une variété d'intervenants, de services internes et de fournisseurs pour coordonner la collecte et la digestion de données complexes;Synthétiser de grandes quantités de données et identifier les tendances, les risques potentiels et développer des plans de remédiation;Développer et maintenir des rapports reproductibles pour divers programmes, créer des vues récapitulatives et des diapositives de niveau exécutif et des tableaux de bord informatiques;Gérer les demandes entrantes, suivre et coordonner les demandes de rapports urgents;Gérer un taux de changement élevé dans des délais limités dans un environnement au rythme très rapide;Faciliter les appels multi-domaines/parties prenantes et gérer de manière proactive les registres d'action en temps opportun;Travailler avec des équipes mondiales et sur des fuseaux horaires qui se chevauchent;Fournir une gouvernance et une communication de projet pertinentes et de haute qualité aux sponsors, aux cadres et aux membres de l'équipe de projet, y compris les étapes clés du projet, les rapports d'état hebdomadaires, les registres d'action et les évaluations des risques/plans d'urgence;Répondre aux problèmes et gérer les attentes du client;Assurer la gestion et suivi des activités budgétaires;
- Stimuler l'innovation et la simplicité - identifier les opportunités et favoriser l'amélioration des processus, la normalisation et les catalyseurs pour gagner en efficacité.

Exigences du poste – Analyste d’affaires junior
Un minimum de 3 ans d'expérience en tant que coordinateur de projet ou analyste d'affaires;Très bonnes compétences et haut niveau d'expérience dans Excel et Powerpoint;Excellentes compétences organisationnelles, gestion du temps et très grand souci du détail;Très forte capacité à gérer plusieurs flux de travail parallèles;Très bonnes compétences en communication verbale et écrite;Forte capacité à être réactif en temps opportun et à terminer les livrables face à de multiples priorités et à des échéanciers difficiles;Solides compétences en négociation et en facilitation;Capacité à travailler de façon autonome ainsi qu'en équipe; une motivation personnelle;Capacité éprouvée à gérer des projets rapides avec une quantité importante de changements;Capacité à gérer l'ambiguïté, l'incertitude et les priorités changeantesQualifications/compétences souhaitées :Connaissance de la méthodologie et des meilleures pratiques de gestion de projet, maîtrise des produits MS Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint), capacité avérée à créer des tableaux de bord informatiques automatisés et solide compréhension du cycle de vie du projet. Une formation formelle en gestion de projet est souhaitable; La certification PMI/PMP n'est pas requise mais est considérée comme un atout;Expérience en technologie de l'information, ainsi qu'une connaissance de base de l'industrie des télécommunications;Connaissance et expérience dans la création de tableaux de bord et de diapositives PPT de niveau exécutif.

Type de poste
Contractuel 12 mois avec de fortes possibilités de renouvellement.
Date de début
Immédiatement
Numéro de référence
BH336705

____________ENGLISH VERSION___________
Junior Business Analyst
As a part of its agreements with its various clients, Procom is currently seeking a Junior Business Analyst for a company in the telecommunication sector. Our client is located in Montréal.

Job details – Junior Business Analyst
Key responsibilities for this position include:
Working collaboratively with a variety of stakeholders, internal departments and vendors to coordinate the collection and digestion of complex data;Synthetizing large amounts of data and identifying trends, potentials risks and developing remediation plans;Developing and maintaining repeatable reporting for various programs, building summary views and executive-level slides and IT dashboards;Managing incoming requests, tracking and coordinating requests for time-sensitive reporting;Managing a high rate of change within constrained timelines in a very fast-paced environment;Facilitating multi-domain/stakeholder calls and proactively managing action registers in a timely fashion;Working with global teams and across overlapping time zones;Working occasional weekends and evenings as required;Providing relevant and high quality project governance and communication to sponsors, executives and project team members, including key project milestones, weekly status reports, action registers, and risk assessments/contingency plans;Responding to issues and managing the customer’s expectations;Managing and tracking budget activities;
- Driving innovation and simplicity - identifying opportunities and drive process improvements, standardization, and enablers to gain efficiencies.

Mandatory Skills – Junior Business Analyst
A minimum 3 years of Project Coordinator or Business Analyst experience;Very strong skills and high level of experience in Excel and Powerpoint;Very strong organization skills, time management, and very high attention to detail;Very strong ability to manage multiple parallel streams of work;Very strong verbal and written communication skills;Strong ability to be responsive in a timely fashion and complete deliverables in the face of multiple priorities and challenging timelines;Strong negotiation and facilitation skills;Ability to work independently as well as in a team setting; a self motivator;Proven ability to manage fast-paced projects with a significant amount of change;Ability to manage ambiguity, uncertainty and changing priorities;Preferred qualifications / competencies :Knowledge of project management methodology and best practices, proficiency using MS Office products (Excel, Word, PowerPoint), proven ability to build automated IT dashboards and strong understanding of the Project Life Cycle. Formal project management training is desirable; PMI/PMP certification is not required but is considered an asset;Experience in Information Technology, along with a background knowledge of the telecommunications industry;Knowledge and experience in building dashboards and executive level PPT slides.

Assignment Length
12-month contract – renewable
Start date
Immediately
Reference number
BH336705

Title: 0750 - Architecte de Solution BI & Cloud
Description:
Nous sommes à la recherche de personnes qui sont à la fois passionnées de technologies reliées à la Data, qui ont un sens du collectif et qui ont envie d’offrir à des clients des solutions adaptées à leurs problématiques d’affaires. Et si en plus vous avez le sens de l’humour et une belle personnalité, nous pensons que vous vous plairez beaucoup chez agileDSS.
 Aujourd’hui nous cherchons un Architecte de Solutions BI et Cloud pour se joindre à notre équipe et travailler pour l’un de nos clients, qui sera très heureux de pouvoir bénéficier de votre expertise. 
agileDSS, c’est quoi/qui ?
 agileDSS est une entreprise de service-conseil à taille humaine spécialisée dans la Data. Depuis plus d’une quinzaine d’années, nous accompagnons les grandes entreprises à tirer le meilleur parti de leurs données par le biais d’une expertise de pointe à travers des projets en Business Intelligence, Cloud Analytique, Big Data et DataOps.
 Côté savoir-faire, ce poste est pour toi si tu as : 

5 à 10 ans d’expérience en BI 
2 ans à titre d’Architecte de solutions et au moins 3 projets significatifs 
Expérience en design et modélisation de solutions analytiques
 Expérience en gestion d'équipe à titre de référent technique
 Être à l’aise en face à face client et à parler en public
 Connaissances des services Azure
 Connaissance des différentes plateformes cloud : Azure et Snowflake
 Expérience passée en Front et back-end, idéalement avec les outils Microsoft
 Curiosité, excellent relationnel, créativité, force de proposition
 Avoir le goût du challenge et l'envie de réussir. Passionné par ce que vous faites
 Maitrise écrit / oral français et anglais
 Posséder la connaissance et l’expérience des différents processus, méthodologies et techniques de développement Agile - Atout
 Connaissances de plusieurs domaines d'affaires


 Mais n’oublions pas le savoir-être !
 Avant toute chose on cherche un nouveau collègue qui va s’épanouir dans notre environnement! Si tu es une personne qui aime apprendre et partager ses connaissances, qui comprend le service-conseil, qui possède une certaine autonomie, et qui est drôle et bienveillant tu as de grandes chances de te plaire chez nous ! 


À quoi tu peux t’attendre dans ton rôle 

Faire des audits auprès de clients
 Faire des préconisations et Roadmap
 Élabore l’architecture de données et de solutions;
 Développement et ingénierie de données sur les services de données Azure;
 Analyse des besoins utilisateurs;
 Participation aux ateliers de collecte de besoin;
 Apprentissage continu des nouveaux outils et frameworks de développement avec du temps y étant dédié;
 Participe au processus d’assurance qualité;
 Participe à la présentation des livrables au client sur la partie technique, avant, pendant et après les projets;
 Coach et oriente les juniors et intermédiaires au sein des projets;
 Agit comme facilitateur au sein de projets analytiques avec les clients;
 Conseille et oriente les analystes et les développeurs sur la partie technique.
 En interne au sein de l’équipe agileDSS : 
    
Être référent en architecture de solution
 Réaliser les entrevues techniques
 Montée en compétence et mentorat des employés



 Ce qu’on t’offre
 Nous sommes avant tout une équipe de collaborateurs à taille humaine qui a à cœur le bien-être de ses employés, c’est pourquoi nous t’offrons:

 Une rémunération annuelle fixe et une bonification annuelle selon l’atteinte de ta performance
 Un plan d’accompagnement, des formations et des certifications intéressantes pour toi et agileDSS
 À l’occasion l’accès à des conférences internationales
 Des assurances collectives et un Programme d’Aide aux Employés (santé mentale et physique)
 5 semaines de vacances 
Le remboursement des abonnements de sport et du transport
 Des horaires flexibles et télétravail 
Un environnement favorisant l’intrapreneuriat et la réflexion stratégique
 Des activités à Responsabilité Sociale et Environnementale.
 Des évènements d’entreprise en local, en région et à l’international

Title: Sr. Process Analyst - Supply Chain Execution
Description:
Description
Ingram Micro helps businesses fully realize the promise of technology.TM No other company delivers the full spectrum of global technology and supply chain services to businesses around the world. Ingram Micro’s global infrastructure and deep expertise in technology solutions, supply chain, cloud, and mobility enable its business partners to operate efficiently and successfully in the markets they serve. Combined with distinct market insights and the trust and dependability generated from decades of strong partner relationships, Ingram Micro stands apart as the global technology services provider for the future.

POSITION SUMMARY:

The Sr. Process Analyst - Supply Chain Execution will use their skills in leading process design, SCE application knowledge, development integration, testing and deployment, to focus on architecting a solution using Business Process Re-engineering techniques and methods to achieve a defined business outcome. The Sr. Process Analyst-Supply Chain Execution works on the complete life cycle from business needs definition, through process design, build or system configuration, testing, training, end user and technical documentation and delivery for process enactment and final diagnosis.

The Sr. Process Analyst-Supply Chain Execution plays a significant role in re-engineering global Supply Chain processes and solutions which are global in nature, integrated with other process areas, scalable, flexible are customer focused and follows industry best practices.

The Sr. Process Analyst-Supply Chain Execution would be expected to work cross functionally to define and solve complex problems in Distribution Center operations, manpower and productivity estimates, work scheduling, business and functional processes, and supply chain logistics. This would include analysis on, but not limited to, order behavior, inventory behavior, storage mode, Pareto, resource productivity, incentive plans, cost, alternatives evaluation, operating scenario model building, and capacity analyses using statistical (such as regression) and mathematical (such as linear programming) techniques.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Process Change Implementation & Key Performance Indicator (KPI) Management (Percent of time spent in this area: 40%)

Lead, facilitate, manage, and implement business process improvements and system changes to improve Key Performance Indicators for Warehouse operations, Warehouse engineering standards, Inventory management Transportation and Customer/Vendor Requirements/SLAs in collaboration with cross-functional departments. Change Management encompasses people, process, and tools with focus on effective communication with Process Owners and Stakeholders
Lead cross-functional projects with focus on process/change management to ensure all teams are tracking to project Milestones, Deliverables, KPI/Service Level Agreements, Process Improvement Measurements, and Sustainable Control Plan for Monitoring post project implementation.
Serve as a supply chain process expert / SME/Consultant focused on reducing costs and increasing efficiencies within Supply Chain Organization and Divisions/Business Units across the company.
Drive best practices sharing and implementation from a systemic process change impact standpoint in working closely with Supply Chain process owners, Partner Operations Managers, BPI Managers, Project Managers, etc. for centralized repository of knowledge management, including process maps, business requirement documentation, test cases, macro libraries, etc. to share across campuses.

Process Analysis, Testing, and Communication (Percent of time spent in this area: 40%)
Work with business and customers to help them understand their needs and translate them into application and operational requirements.
Must recognize areas for process improvement and develop plans and requirements for implementing them.
Coordinates a collaborative testing process between the business and IS team members.
Proactively identifies and reports on business issues, dependencies, and risks related to system enhancements, functionality/design gaps, and user acceptance testing.
Communicates with internal and external customers, management, and stakeholders on a regular basis.
Provides detailed statistical analysis of current operations through data mining of existing information and formulate data collections schemes as necessary to support process improvements.
Conduct root cause analyses of labor and/or process inefficiencies through operational data analysis, Pareto charts, process reviews, time studies, statistics reviews, simulation and discussions with operational leadership.
Drafts and designs layout of equipment, materials, and distribution facilities to illustrate maximum efficiency, using drafting tools and CAD.
Must detect and resolve issues effectively across process and systems in a timely manner and escalate accordingly.
Must make sure all measures comply with Ingram’s business/partners standards, governance, policies, and procedures.

Business Systems Documentation and Training (Percent of time spent in this area: 20%)
Update all relevant documentation such as test scripts, training materials, business process documentation, macros, etc.
Updates job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; maintaining personal networks; participating in professional organizations.
Provides recommendations and advice on emerging technology trends.
Develops and maintains a library of such documentation.
Performs regular audits against documentation to ensure the business is complying with governance standards and other policies and procedures.
JOB QUALIFICATIONS:
Education:


Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Engineering (Industrial/Mechanical) or IS management field or equivalent work experience required.
Experience: Minimum of 4-6 years’ experience in:
Analysis and designing business processes in Supply Chain execution area.
Developing product requirements based on input gathered from a variety of sources including analysis results and feedback from the user community.
Supply Chain Concepts like Warehouse management, Materials management, Inventory management, process design and Process Improvements. Line management in an operating environment a plus.
Excellent communications skills both written and oral; proven client, team, and meeting facilitation skills.
Any one or more industry leading Warehouse Management Systems (WMS), Transportation Management systems and Labor Management System (LMS) like SAP, JDA, Oracle, Manhattan, high jump, etc.
Material Handling Systems (MHS) and other industry leading warehouse automation technologies.
Reviewing project deliverables for completeness and quality, and compliance with established project standards.
Demonstrated use of lean, six sigma, DMAIC, DMADV, ISO-9000, Kaizen, Poke yoke and other tools and methodologies towards process improvements and process design
Detailed understanding of business analysis concepts, Supply Chain processes and Supply Chain applications
Demonstrated competency in developing efficient and effective solutions to diverse and Complex business problems.
Liaising with project management office and appropriate Project Management offices to help manage the day-to-day interdependencies of multiple project teams.
Good with numbers and must have solid analytical skills
Demonstrate good leadership skills and the ability to motivate
Creating and leading a supportive team-oriented work climate that enables business team members to develop professionally and that values diversity, promotes teamwork and collaboration and emphasizes quality, customer satisfaction, creativity and cost effectiveness.
Building, maintaining, and developing strong business relationships with both internal and external customers.
MS Office Suite with strong MS Excel skills, MS Access, and Visio. Advanced skills in Excel, SQL, or other analytical tools for data mining and analysis
LEAN Six Sigma Certified and/or Six Sigma Yellow/Green Belt is preferred
This position is based in Toronto, Canada with 25%- 30% travel to Irvine, California, United States and/or any other US ALC locations (based on need and demand)

Ingram Micro is an inclusive Equal Employment Opportunity employer, with a focus on Diversity, Equity & Inclusion. We consider applicants without regard to gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, disability, or any other characteristic protected by law. If you require accommodations or assistance to complete the online application process, please reach out to the Talent Acquisition Specialist/Job Poster and identify the type of accommodation or assistance you are requesting. We will try our best to make these accommodations. Please do not include any medical or health information in this email.

Ability to review and translate Business Requirement Specifications and Technical Design Documents to build test strategy, test cases, and impact analysis

Title: Business Analyst /BSA
Description:
Business Analyst /BSA

Capco – The Future. Now.

Capco is a distinctly and positively different place to work. Much more than consultants, we are active participants in the global financial services industry. Our passionate business and technology professionals enjoy a unique environment where they are actively encouraged to apply intellect, innovation, experience and teamwork. We are dedicated to fully supporting our world class clients as they respond to challenges and opportunities in: Banking, Capital Markets, Finance Risk & Compliance, Insurance, and Wealth and Investment Management. Experience Capco for yourself at capco.com

Let’s Talk About You

You want to Own Your Career. You’re serious about rising as far and as fast as your work and achievements can take you. And you’re ready to write the next chapter of your career story: a challenging and rewarding role as a Capco Business Analyst.

Let’s Get Down To Business

We are looking for Business Analyst / BSA to join our Business Consulting team. This is a chance to join one of the fastest growing and exciting consultancies, with an opportunity to grow with the company as it expands.

Responsibilities

Establish collaborative relationships with external and internal stakeholders.
Working closely with clients to define and optimize their roadmap
Gather accurate requirements and create user stories
Strategically and creatively think about how the consumer experience should work; translating a vision to processes and requirements
Shaping and executing complex digital transformations

Show Us What You’ve Got

It will be very useful if you have some or all of the following skills and experience:

5+ years Business Analysis experience
Elaborate and elicit detailed technical user stories based on feature and epics prioritized via business roadmaps and desired outcomes
Key skillsets required:
Agile delivery experience
Ability to structure and derive technical details from business priorities, technical architecture and elicit sufficient details to provide clarity to clear scope and desired outcomes
Collaborative and ability to manage complex priorities
Cloud & multi tiered apps
Work with vendor and project teams to analyze and document data, process, integration details and specification fo the teams' to follow
Support teams' to answer questions and triage issues
Liaison with both vendor and teams to align and coordinate details to produce a final set of specification, technical stories, intakes and any artifacts required to support the targeted scope (JIRA, Confluence a must)

Professional experience is important. But it’s paramount you share our belief in disruptive innovation that puts clients ahead in a tough market. From Day One, your key skill will be to perceive new and better ways of doing things to give your clients an unfair advantage.

Now Take the Next Step

If you’re looking forward to progressing your career with us, then we’re looking forward to receiving your application.

Capco is well known for its thought leadership and client-centric model that distinguishes it from other consulting firms. Capco’s strong technology and digital knowledge base, it’s global experience of the Financial Service enables us to deliver projects from strategy through to delivery. We are committed to providing new areas of expertise from which our clients will greatly benefit. We have:

Access to industry-focused talent globally

Title: Sr. Business Systems Analyst
Description:
TD Description
Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.
Department Overview
Building a World-Class, Diverse and Inclusive Technology Team at TD
We can't afford to be boring. Neither can you. The scale and scope of what TD does may surprise you. The rapid pace of change makes it a business imperative for us to be smart and open-minded in the way we think about technology. TD's technology and business teams become more intertwined as new opportunities present themselves. This new era in banking does not equal boring. Not at TD, anyway.
TD Business Systems Analysis covers a mandate that includes (but isn't limited to) proposing technical systems to accomplish business requirements enterprise-wide. These experts build relationships with business partners and other groups of diverse subject matter experts and stakeholders (both internal and external) to:
Plan + Elicit + Analyze + Document + Communicate +Manage system requirements;
Assess client needs and recommend the right technology; and
Offer operational and process-related analysis and support.
There's room to grow in all of it.
Job Description
About This Role
Credit Card Serving Platform- Rewards and Loyalty POD We are looking for someone to plan, manage, and lead the delivery of detailed system requirements and technical and functional specifications that align to standards and frameworks. You will provide technical leadership and work in close partnership with ambitious business and technology partners, project teams and stakeholders to plan, elicit, analyze, document, communicate and manage detailed functional specifications.
Meaningful work is fueled by meaningful performance and career development conversations with your manager. Here's some of what you may be asked to perform:
Work with technology partners (e.g. Solution Designers and Architects) to research and analyze current state system capabilities and define technology solutions options and recommendations.
Define, document and translate business requirements into detailed functional specifications, taking into account non-functional requirements.
Assist testing teams in translating requirements and use cases into test conditions and expected results for product, performance, user acceptance, and operational acceptance testing.
Contribute to project management activities such as: scoping and estimating project efforts, identifying risks and recommending mitigation measures, communicating activity status, as well as escalating and communicating possible issues.
Participate in quality management reviews, including designs, prototypes and other requirements work products.
Work closely with stakeholders to determine solutions, assess impact to existing work processes and systems, and pinpoint how to manage integration.
Provide operational and process-related analysis and support.
Respect existing processes and standards including requirements management and project management disciplines, technology delivery and business technology architecture, escalating issues as needed.
Gain knowledge in own area, stay abreast of technology trends and developments, develop expertise in TD services, applications, infrastructure, analytical tools and techniques, business domains and their products and services.
Work with vendors to support business case development (consistent with technology requirements and guidelines) including benefits identification, RFI/RFP and service level agreements.
Coach new or less experienced colleagues and serve as a reference point throughout requirements management life cycle.
Job Requirements
What can you bring to TD? Share your credentials, but your relevant experience and knowledge can be just as likely to get our attention. It helps if you have:
Undergraduate Degree or Technical Certificate.
5-7 years relevant experience.
Commitment to applying advanced to expert knowledge of business technology delivery practices and standards and related expertise, including design, development, testing and project management.
Advanced to expert knowledge of system analysis process and techniques, as well as system components, functionality, interfaces, data flows and business rules.
Ability to work independently as the senior or lead system analyst and coach or guide team.
Experience and comfort level acting as a subject matter expert and consultant.
Additional Information
Join in on what others in TD Technology Solutions are doing:
Inspire a positive work environment and help champion quality, innovation, teamwork and service to the business.
Learn voraciously, stretch your thinking,
Inclusiveness
At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Business Systems Analyst
Description:
Ceridian is a global leader in Human Capital Management technology. Simply put, we allow our customers to do the most complex things well (HR, Payroll, Benefits Administration, Workforce Management and Talent Management) and do them to scale.

Makes Work Life Better™ is our brand promise, not only to our customers, but to our employees as well. Our flagship platform, Dayforce, helps leaders make smart decisions based on data, strategy and intelligence that create value and maximize productivity.

How do we make work life better?

By delivering an award-winning product, conceptualized and developed by award-winning leaders, that result in award-winning customer employee experiences
By hiring highly innovative, diverse talent that fully embraces and embodies our core values in everything they do: Customer Focus, Equity, Shared Ambition, Agility, Transparency, Optimism
By using modern technology, such as voice-activation with Dayforce Assistant and access to your money as soon as you earn it with Dayforce Wallet to stay in rhythm with the evolving demands of our 4 million global users

We understand that no matter where you are, choosing a new employer is always one of life’s most stressful events. We encourage you to check us out at Ceridian.com to learn more about how we are impacting the world of work for our customers, employees and you!

Location: For this role we are open to remote work located anywhere within the United States or Canada.

About the Opportunity:
Ceridian Data eXchange (CDX) is a comprehensive set of people, process and technology, used to direct and regulate the data integration between internal and external systems.
Dayforce Link is a centralized, secure cloud solution for internal and edge-based file transfers, including data transformation. Dayforce Link collects, transforms and delivers customer data both to and from internal Ceridian systems, as well as external trading partners.

What you’ll get to do:
Application Administration, Configuration, & Maintenance

Design, planning and implementation/engineering of integration solutions using IBM MFT Suite (Sterling File Gateway, Sterling Integrator, Sterling Secure Proxy/SEAS, IBM Control Center, IBM Perimeter Servers, etc)
Perform ifix’s and application upgrades
System testing, tuning and capacity planning
Monitor active Business Processes and assigned schedules
Experience with clustered architectures and associated High Availability, workload management and Disaster Recovery practices.
Configure and manage Routing Channel Templates
Design and support of Business Processes using the IBM Graphical Process Modeling tool
Command Line Adapter configuration, including working with Antivirus, GPG and network file sharing
MFT Trading Partner configuration setup using IBM Sterling Secure Proxy, using various communication protocols (SFTP, FTPS, HTTPS, FTP, SMB, Connect: Direct, etc)
Knowledge of Web services using methods such as soap and restful
Create custom file layers and custom email notifications
Perform technical configurations, such as network communications and adapter configuration
Onboard new employees by creating and supporting user accounts and user groups
Use audit records and trace logs to provide reporting as required

Security Standards

Ensure that the Command Line Adapter 2 is continually working with antivirus
Ensures all file transmissions and adapters are secured according to InfoSec standards
Manage GPG/PGP Keys to ensure they are functioning as required
Assist the Application Administrator with regular DR tests as required by BCP Team
Setup and manage services and adapters (i.e. SFTP/SMB/etc) including custom protocols as required
Proficient in various B2B communication protocols such as FTP, FTPS, SFTP, HTTP, HTTP/S, AS2, etc

Environments

Responsible for managing all environmental instances including Production, DR, Dev, and Test
Ensures each environment is built appropriately and functioning as required
Ensures data sets for each environment are sanitized as required
Deploy Resource Manager objects from environment to environment

Incident Support (Tier 3)

Act as an escalation point for Production Operators and Route Provisioners, by providing high-end technical support. This includes:

o. Product navigation (i.e. guidance around, and execution of complex tasks within the technology portfolio)
p. Data mining (i.e. investigating variances in data transactions totals)
q. Customer interaction (i.e. escalation point for customer concerns)

Track and update all incidents in the incident management system, ensuring that documentation is thorough, accurate and meets ticket quality standards and is resolved in a timely manner.
Review tickets for repetitive issues and collaborate with support teams to identify effective/sound solutions that will resolve these conclusively.

Change Management

Primary individual responsible for opening change requests
Ensures all environmental changes follow the proper change controls

Skills and Experience we value:

5+ Years practical experience as an application architect
Bachelors Degree in computer science or information systems preferred
Thorough knowledge in Unix/Linux platforms and writing shell scripts
Thorough knowledge of B2Bi and under laying technologies (BPML, XML, Xpath, SQL, network topologies and MFT)
Experience working with the following suite of IBM MFT technologies:

o. IBM Sterling File Gateway
p. IBM Sterling B2B Integrator
q. IBM Control Center
r. IBM Connect: Direct
s. IBM SEAS
t. IBM Secure Proxy CM
u. IBM Transformation Extender (ITX)

Required to understand and uphold all Ceridian Data eXchange, Infrastructure, Infosec, Privacy policies and standards

Ceridian is fueled by the diversity of our talented employees. We are an equal opportunity employer and consider and embrace ALL individuals and what makes them unique. We believe our employees should be happy and healthy, with peace of mind and a sense of fulfillment. We provide our employees with comprehensive benefits for various life circumstances and needs, great opportunities for career development, and a balanced lifestyle to achieve personal and professional success. We encourage all individuals to apply for positions that fit their passions.

We thank all applicants in advance for their interest in this position; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. If you are selected for an interview, you will be contacted by a Ceridian Recruiter with a @ceridian.com email directly from our organization.

Title: Processing Fee Analyst
Description: Processing Fee Analyst - OverviewThe Processing Fee Analyst is part of a team responsible for the accurate and timely recording of fees for third party use of gas plants, associated gathering systems, compressors and batteries. Reporting to the Sr. Manager, Midstream you will work closely with other internal departments and external parties to calculate, process and record facility charges. This position is located in Calgary.Processing Fee Analyst – The Role· Maintain working knowledge of the company’s commercial and joint venture contracts;· Analyze facility fee revenue and operating costs to support joint venture, financial accounting, engineering, and operations;· Volumetric and financial analysis of the performance of the midstream assets, including gas plants, associated gathering systems, compressors and batteries;· Setup, implement and maintain facility charges and distribution of revenue;· Calculate and invoice gas volumes by third party flowing through operated facilities;· Support the annual preparation of equalization calculations;· Support the budgeting and planning group with processing fee revenue forecasts;· Assist with collection of accounts receivable related to processing fees;· Liaise across all departments and handle inquiries related to processing fees;· Continually identifying areas of improvements, documenting potential efficiencies and participating in process improvement opportunities;· Standardize internal procedures and handle inquiries received.Processing Fee Analyst – The Person· Data analysis, critical thinking and problem-solving skills required· Must be organized with strong attention to detail while being able to manage multiple priorities· Strong computer skills with proficiency in Microsoft Office applications, specifically Excel is required· BComm or other relevant post-secondary education is preferred· Prior accounting experience is beneficial· Experience with P2 Metrix and/or Tableau is preferred· Experience with P2 QbyteFM, GeoScout, CGI Landman, Petrinex and EnergyLink is beneficial· Joint venture experience or Canadian Association of Petroleum Production Accounting (CAPPA) certification is beneficial· Ability to work independently in a dynamic environment and meet deadlines· Excellent interpersonal and communication skills· Team player who enjoys learning and contributing to team goalsProcessing Fee Analyst – The CompanyCanlin Energy Corporation is a privately held, long reserve life, natural gas weighted producer in the Western Canadian Sedimentary Basin. Our E&P business produces over 40,000 boe per day from predominantly operated wells, infrastructure and facilities. Canlin’s key priorities are running safe and sustainable business, focusing our portfolio, improving productivity, generating value from our midstream assets and investing for growth and value. Please visit us at www.canlinenergy.com to learn more about our operations.Job Types: Full-time, PermanentSalary: From $75,000.00 per yearSchedule:Monday to FridayEducation:Bachelor's Degree (preferred)Experience:oil and gas accounting: 3 years (preferred)QbyteFM, GeoScout, CGI Landman, Petrinex and EnergyLink: 1 year (preferred)JV or CAPPA: 1 year (preferred)

Title: Sr. Business Analyst, Technology & Operations
Description:
Address:
250 Yonge Street
Job Family Group:
Strategy & Change
BMO is hiring a Sr. Business Analyst with strong business knowledge in the areas of Wealth Management and Capital Markets.
Technical knowledge in the reconciliation tool iMatch (intelliMatch) is a huge asset!
Knowledge of following platforms are also beneficial:
1. iMATCH / SQL Server
2. RPA Developer Tools - UI Path / Power Automate
3. Power BI/Power Apps
4. ETL Tools
Drives change management plans and activities from initiation to implementation & sustainment to achieve desired business results. Engages leaders, stakeholders and other impacted audiences in the change to create an engaged workforce who understands the change & what it means for customers and employees. Understands a variety of business dimensions that must be considered in the implementation of change (products, people, processes, channels), and associated risks that must be interpreted, evaluated and mitigated. Drives overall business results by ensuring that change is understood, accepted and sustained.
Acts as a trusted advisor to assigned business/group.
Influences and negotiates to achieve business objectives.
Recommends and implements solutions based on analysis of issues and implications for the business.
Assists in the development of strategic plans.
Identifies emerging issues and trends to inform decision-making.
Leads the change strategy planning process combining subject matter expertise and organizational knowledge to implement successful change.
Analyzes the scope of change to determine people, process, financial, technology, risks & other impacts.
Breaks down strategic problems, and analyses data and information to provide insights and recommendations.
Provides advice and guidance to assigned business/group on implementation of change; evaluates the change environment to understand complexity and impact of change to develop a program that meets required objectives.
Applies change management methodology and general management skills and knowledge to plan, organize and execute change management in a variety of project sizes.
Collaborates with internal/external stakeholders to provide business context in the design, development and implementation of change. Ensures alignment between stakeholders.
Develops change management solutions and makes recommendations based on an understanding of the business strategy and stakeholder needs.
Develops change strategy that enables leaders to promote the change and execute the change; ensures stakeholders to want to make the change.
Builds and executes communications plans to drive awareness and understanding, including analyzing audiences, developing key messages and identifying the right channel, frequency and sender.
Identifies resistance to the change and builds required plans to overcome objectives through communications and training in order to implement and sustain the change.
Monitors and tracks adoption of the change, and addresses any issues. Implements any corrective actions required and celebrates successes.
Focus is primarily on business/group within BMO; may have broader, enterprise-wide focus.
Provides specialized consulting, analytical and technical support.
Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules.
Works independently and regularly handles non-routine situations.
Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.
Qualifications:
Typically between 5 - 7 years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Knowledge of business analysis, project delivery practices and standards across the project lifecycle - In-depth.
Deep knowledge and technical proficiency gained through extensive education and business experience.
Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth.
Collaboration & team skills - In-depth.
Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth.
Influence skills - In-depth.
Data driven decision making - In-depth.
We’re here to help
At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.
As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.
To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en .
BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.

Title: Project Manager / Business Analyst - Application Decommissioning (Contract)
Description:
Teck Digital Systems is increasingly delivering projects and products through many programs that result in the use of small medium and large applications requiring to be decommissioned. One of the programs driving the need for formal decommissioning practice is the Replace Business Systems (RBS).
The RBS program is replacing old ERP systems currently used at each mine site across four steams of value chains:
Health, Safety, Environment, and Community
Finance (Source to Pay)
Maintenance and Asset Management
Human Resource and Information Management
Sourcing and Contracting
Several existing sites were or are still being supported by withholding ‘mainframe’ type technology (AS/400, various versions and deployments of JD Edwards, and custom-developed payroll solutions) that also need to be taken through a Decommissioning practice or framework.
The scope of the decommissioning strategy must address all future Teck applications at end of life or being replaced by a new/different application. Ideally, a repeatable process will be crafted to manage and affect the decommissioning of all applications being retired. This will include custom-built applications, COTS and On-prem solutions, and all Cloud (SaaS) applications since the historical data from all of these applications may need to be accessed.
Decommissioning includes all layers of the delivery stack:
Application code (source and prod),
In alignment with replacement project data conversion, data archiving, and ongoing data provisioning to future business processes,
APIs and Interface and integration components,
Associated scripts,
Infrastructure hardware (i.e. servers), storage devices, network devices,
All environments (dev, test, system test, user test, staging),
Any other utilities used to manage, coordinate or use the system,
Termination of all related contracts and costs.
Data or transactions that need to be referred back to or referenced.
Data that is required on a rolling basis for a defined period to compare new vs old i.e. budgets when comparing this vs last year or this year vs two years ago.
Data that is required to be aggregated with new data to provide trends or a current analysis based on x years prior. i.e. maintenance records and asset usage data (cycles, rotations, km’s, etc) to optimize maintenance schedules.
Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, and Business Information systems may require access to historical data from time to time, to adequately meet a requirement or evolve future strategies.
Another major program at Teck includes the RACE transformation program. RACE is Teck’s business transformation strategy. It began with the implementation of our first strategy - RACE21. This focused on taking a company-wide approach to renewing our technology infrastructure, accelerating, and scaling our automation and robotics program, connecting our data systems to enable the broad application of advanced analytics and artificial intelligence, and empowering our employees. The success of RACE21 has been critical to our success as a business. Our ongoing transformation strategies include RACE25 where we will continue to drive a step-change in Teck's performance, and help Teck become the most innovative and sustainable miner in the world.
Collaborating with the Manager of Enterprise Applications Management acting as Decommissioning Program Lead, the Project Manager/Senior Business Analyst (herein referred to as “Snr PM/BA Decomm”) will assist in developing an overall Decommissioning Practice at Teck. This will include primarily coordinating the efforts of a selected consulting partner and also collaborating closely with key customers to understand immediate and long-term requirements, Teck Digital Systems (TDS) teams such as data architecture and database administrators, technical and application management teams, enterprise architecture team members, infrastructure teams, QA and PMO teams to update project delivery methodology.
Key Requirements
10 years of senior project/program management experience with IT / technology projects and programs.
2 to 3 years of solution delivery using Agile methodology, tools, and techniques.
5 years of application management/solution delivery experience ideally with ERP-type implementations.
Minimum of 5 years of business analysis experience.
Experience leading a scaled program with multiple inter-dependencies across various teams in large organizations.
Excellent problem-solving, interpersonal, and analytical skills, with the ability to coach and mentor.
5 years of experience leading large consulting partner firms.
Strong communication skills at all levels within large organizations, ability to develop positive relationships with key partners, ability to prepare and deliver effective presentations and meaningful project/program documentation, ability to propagate information promptly, clearly, and unambiguously.
Key Accountabilities
Data analysis and data architecture skills
Data and information governance
Artificial Intelligence (AI), Business Intelligence (BI), Machine Learning (ML)
Industry experience: Mining or mechanical asset-intensive industry
Application experience: ERP systems, financial systems, Asset management systems, Maintenance management systems,
Strong business acumen,
A degree or diploma in either business or information systems would be beneficial.
Formal Scrum or Agile training (e.g. SAFe® Scrum Master (or Advanced Scrum Master), Certified Scrum Practitioner (CPS), Professional Scrum Master (PSM1 or PSM2) or Certified Scrum Coach (CSC))
Experienced in working with geographically dispersed partners and development teams, in offices or the field
Knowledge and awareness of Cloud (IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS) as well as a solid grasp of DevOps (preferably MS Azure),
Experience with Cloud-based web application development (preferably on the Azure platform)
Taking direction from key partners and Decommissioning Program Lead coordinates and facilitates the efforts towards developing an effective Decommissioning Framework / Practice.
Lead, facilitate and coordinate efforts of the selected consulting partner,
Oversee, coordinate and lead all Teck team resources,
Standard business analysis responsibilities as they relate to any solution delivery, including but not limited to:
Requirements definition, Workshop Facilitation, JAD Sessions as required
Using Agile, the definition of Epics, Features, and User Stories where appropriate
Business process mapping, improvement, and data requirements definition
Development of test plans, test cases, and the execution of test plans
Organizational readiness
Deliver industry-standard project management through the application of project management best practices,
Engage partners by raising impediments, validating risk, and communicating status and performance metrics,
Ensure teams actions are aligned with the projects goals/vision
Ensure effective project planning, monitoring, and execution,
Guide teams to achieve key milestones, on time, on quality, and within the scope
Provide industry-standard project governance, including regular relevant project monitoring and status reporting,
Look for ways to strengthen teams' understanding of Agile/Scrum concepts and principles
Facilitate Agile Value Increment Planning (VIP). Retrospectives
Ensure Scrum and Sprint practices are used as appropriate across teams
Agile Backlog grooming
Bringing transparency to Business and IT organizations about the development and growing trust

Successful candidates must be fully vaccinated against infection by COVID-19. Candidates who are unable to be vaccinated due to a personal characteristic protected under applicable human rights legislation may request to be exempt from this requirement. About Teck
At Teck, we value diversity. Our teams work collaboratively and respect each person’s unique perspective and contribution.
