Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Business System Analyst
Description:
Aviso Wealth:
A career with Aviso Wealth means being part of an organization dedicated to your success and career development. It means belonging to a group of talented, energetic professionals who live their values every day. Our amazing people and dynamic culture set Aviso Wealth apart. If you’re looking for interesting and challenging work, at a company committed to its people, find out more about what Aviso Wealth has to offer.
The Opportunity:
We’re looking for a Technical Solutions Analyst to join our IT team.
Reporting to the Lead Technical Solutions the Technical Solutions Analyst is responsible for a wide range of duties at a strategic and tactical level. You will apply your industry and technical knowledge, and business acumen to solve a wide range of clients and business requirements. You will effectively manage advanced programs and resources to communicate successfully with our clients and other business units.
Who you are:
You take initiative, seeking out and owning opportunities to improve yourself, your team, and our business
You’re comfortable in a fast-paced environment, maintaining a keen attention to detail even when under pressure
You thrive in a collaborative environment, sharing your knowledge with your colleagues, and celebrating success as a team
You’re a life-long learner, staying current on market events, industry news, and innovative trends and technologies
You believe in sustainable financial strength, and you’re committed to long-term wealth solutions
You consider the impact of your actions on your team members, our partners, our clients, and the places where we live and work
What your day looks like:
Liaise with internal and external partners and stakeholders to analyze, define, document, and transform business requirements into functional and non-functional technical system requirements, interaction design, information architecture, and underlying data or processes requirements, including reports and data extracts requirements
Develop high level and detailed technical specifications in accordance with SDLC, security, governance and architecture documentation objectives
Work closely with members of the development, infrastructure and QA teams to review system requirements specification, and make sure that the implemented solutions meet customer expectations
Work with the application architect, business analysts, software vendor and other IT teams to design and implement downstream and upstream solution processes, interfaces or applications
Partner with infrastructure and business teams in order to design solutions and work with users to identify, diagnose and resolve business system issues or deficiencies proactively
Assists with implementation of vendor software releases and custom solutions into multiple environments
Provide time and cost estimates for customer service activities from inputs of different stakeholders
Develop and maintain effective and collaborative working relationships with customers, business units, partners and service providers to drive projects and services being delivered successfully
Requirements
Your experience and skills:
Post-secondary degree/diploma in the field of computer science, engineering or information systems
5+ years of related experience working in a complex environment
Expert knowledge using Microsoft SQL Server and/or ORACLE, and Relationship Database principles
Knowledge of database design and file management techniques
Understand of .NET and/or JAVA applications development, web, mobile and integration technologies
Completion of the CSC/IFIC Operations course would be an asset
Proven analytical and problem-solving skills, with a thorough understanding of how to interpret business needs and translate them into data, application and operational requirements
Excellent written and oral communication skills, with the ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with various levels of management, staff and external clients
Ability to work independently within a team, multi-task and manage competing priorities
Excellent knowledge of applicable data privacy practices and laws
Understanding of Services Agreements as related to commercial IT systems
Experience in supporting wealth management and/or credit unions business would be an asset
Fluent communication skills in English are required and bilingual skills in French are an asset
Benefits
At Aviso, you’ll find a dynamic, entrepreneurial culture that rewards innovation and celebrates success. We offer a competitive compensation package, career enrichment, and regular social events to foster teamwork. Aviso Wealth welcomes and encourages applications from all qualified individuals including persons with disabilities. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs in all stages of the hiring process.
We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.
No recruiters or agencies, please.
Company Overview:
Aviso Wealth is a national, integrated financial services company, with over $100 billion in assets under administration and management. Aviso Wealth is owned by Credit Union Centrals, The Co-operators / CUMIS and Desjardins. Our MFDA-regulated dealer, full-service IIROC-regulated brokerage, and insurance dealer support thousands of financial advisors at credit unions across Canada. Our award-winning online brokerage, Qtrade Direct Investing, and our digital advice platform, VirtualWealth, give Canadians flexible choices for building their wealth. Our asset manager, NEI Investments, is a Canadian leader in Responsible Investment funds and portfolios, which are available through a national network of advisors. Aviso Wealth also provides custodial services and introducing broker services to independent financial organizations, including banks, trust companies, insurance companies, investment dealers, portfolio managers and financial planning firms. We have operations in Toronto, Vancouver, and Montreal with a regional office in Winnipeg. More information about Aviso Wealth is available at www.aviso.ca.

Title: Senior Manager, Data Visualization
Description:
Some opportunities happen only once in a lifetime - like a job where you have the chance to change lives. At Alexion, people living with rare and devastating diseases are our Guiding Star. We are driven to continuously innovate and create meaningful value in all we do to help patients and families fully live their best lives. We value the uniqueness and diversity of our employees and recognize that nurturing the diverse perspectives and strengths of our people translates into innovative breakthroughs for patients.


Senior Manager, Data Visualization
This is what you will do:
The Senior Manager, Data Visualization supports the development and enhancement of digital technology and leads the data visualization initiative developed to monitor clinical trial data quality and vendor performance. The position manages complex abstract clinical data management technical projects and is responsible for tasks used to define how and where technologies are applied to collect, code, review, validate, and visualize clinical trial data received in-house and from external sources.
You will be responsible for:
Using complex data sources to produce integrated clinical trial management data visualizations for stakeholders
Data normalization for portfolio level reporting and visualization
Advising teams on how best to interpret and utilize outputs to increase data integrity/quality and reduce redundancies to create efficiencies in data collection and process
Supporting an agile, value-focused culture, and providing input into technical projects sought at improving data-science tools and infrastructure
Supporting the development of predictive analytics to identify the likelihood of future outcomes
Working closely with key business stakeholders to understand business initiatives and how data insights can drive and measure progress
Using technical, creative problem-solving and good development practice skills to achieve successful outcomes

You will need to have:
Bachelor’s or advanced degree in a Computer Science or related with at least 5 years of experienceExperience with data visualization tools (e.g., Elluminate, Spotfire, etc.).
Experience with Master Data Management for clinical trial data sources
Experience in interpreting business need and translating into the development of dashboards and reports to be used by decision makers
Effective verbal and written communication, influencing, and partnering skills
The duties of this role are generally conducted in an office environment. As is typical of an office-based role, employees must be able, with or without an accommodation to: use a computer; engage in communications via phone, video, and electronic messaging; Bachelor’s or advanced degree in a Computer Science or related with at least 5 years of experience; maintain general availability during standard business hours

We would prefer for you to have:
Clinical programming background
Solid grasp of applied mathematical, machine learning and AI techniques and workflows
Good understanding of project management techniques and methods
Experience of agile working practices
Knowledge of the end-to-end clinical trial process

Alexion is a global biopharmaceutical company focused on serving patients and families affected by rare diseases and devastating conditions through the discovery, development and commercialization of life-changing medicines. Headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts, Alexion has offices around the globe and serves patients in more than 50 countries. Further information about Alexion can be found at: www.alexion.com.

Alexion is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We are committed to fostering a culture of belonging where every single person can belong because of their uniqueness. The Company will not make decisions about employment, training, compensation, promotion, and other terms and conditions of employment based on race, color, religion, creed or lack thereof, sex, sexual orientation, age, ancestry, national origin, ethnicity, citizenship status, marital status, pregnancy, (including childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), parental status (including adoption or surrogacy), military status, protected veteran status, disability, medical condition, gender identity or expression, genetic information, mental illness or other characteristics protected by law. Alexion provides reasonable accommodations to meet the needs of candidates and employees. To begin an interactive dialogue with Alexion regarding an accommodation, please contact accommodations@Alexion.com. Alexion participates in E-Verify.

AstraZeneca completed its acquisition of Alexion, marking the creation of Alexion, AstraZeneca Rare Disease. If you're interested in career opportunities with AstraZeneca, click here.

Title: Business Analyst - Core Banking Technology
Description:
The Business Analyst - Core Banking Technology is a senior-level position responsible for liaising between business users and technologists to exchange information in a concise, logical and understandable way in coordination with the Technology team. The overall objective of this role is to contribute to continuous iterative exploration and investigation of business performance and other measures to gain insight and drive business planning.

Responsibilities:
Provide input during development and implementation phases, including formulation and definition of systems scope, objectives and necessary system enhancements for complex, high-impact projects
Identify and communicate risks and impacts and propose risk mitigation options, considering business implications of the application of technology to the current business environment
Consult with business clients to determine system functional specifications and partner with multiple management teams and other units to meet organizational objectives
Evaluate new IT developments and evolving business requirements and recommend appropriate systems alternatives and/or enhancements to current systems by analyzing business processes, systems and industry standards
Provide in-depth and sophisticated analyses with interpretive thinking to define problems, develop innovative solutions and influence strategic functional decisions
Supervise day-to-day staff management issues, including resource management, work allocation, mentoring/coaching and other duties and functions as assigned
Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.
Qualifications:
6-10 years of experience
Flexcube DDA (ideal)
ServiceNow
Jira
Proficiency in MS Office (Word, Excel, Visio, PowerPoint) with extensive experience using Excel for data analysis
Experience with all phases of Software Development Life Cycle
Comprehensive knowledge of the principles of business analysis
Education:
Bachelor's degree/University degree or equivalent experience
Master's degree preferred

Title: Business Analyst, Supply Chain
Description:
Joseph Ribkoff designs classic and contemporary garments for fashion-forward women with a youthful state of mind. Each one of our carefully tailored pieces offers the effortless fashion, fit, and quality that we’ve been synonymous with.

Over the years, the brand has blossomed into a touchstone for timeless, youthful style. Driven by a passion that has never ceased to propel our company’s vision, Joseph Ribkoff has been an ally to women, dressing them with flair and perfect fit for over 65 years. From our quality and distinctly designed products to our unwavering commitment to retail partners, Joseph Ribkoff’s values resonate in everything we do and create.

Today, his legacy lives on through the work of a devoted, talented team operating from the four corners of the world. Sold in over 60 international markets, Joseph Ribkoff is a global emblem of quality and elegance.

Montreal Corporate Head Office, where most of their employees are based, offers career opportunities in Design, Operations, Sales, Marketing, Finance, IT and HR as well as in the Production and Warehousing facilities.

OBJECTIVE:
The IT Analyst will work closely with management to reach set objectives. He accompanies the customers in implementing the projects and in reaching the project’s objectives. He analyzes the business processes and documents the needs, for technical analysis and programming purposes.

RESPONSABILITIES:

Identifies the customer’s needs and performs a business process analysis
Aligns the customer’s processes according to best practices
Adequately documents business needs and processes according to company standards
Establishes parameters for system components based on processes agreed to with the customer
Identifies required application corrections
Provides templates, confirms the quality of data received, imports and validates the customer’s data
Analyzes the developments required and obtains approval; prepares the specifications, creates the quote, obtains development and time estimates, and submits them to the customer
Trains expert users;
Deals with the unexpected and adapts work execution accordingly
Tests, reviews and updates the systems
Assists in implementing interfaces between systems
Ensures the continuous improvement of assigned processes, and updates the standard process guide
Tests official versions and maintains test scripts as related to assigned processes
Reports any unsolicited behaviours in the application

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Relevant experience with a manufacturing and distributing company
Bachelor’s degree or a College diploma in computer science or experience in a similar role
Good knowledge of an ERP, PLM or BI Solution implementation process. (SAP, JD Edwards, Microsoft D365)
Good knowledge of the financial processes of a manufacturing company
Proficiency with MS Office and Visio
Basic knowledge of SQL
Demonstrate interpersonal skills, ease at establishing relationships with the customers, and quickly establish ties with them
Demonstrate excellent interpersonal communications, based on respect, diplomacy and judgment, and oriented towards the search for solutions
Demonstrate leadership, honesty and motivation
Have the customer’s best interest at heart
Comfortable in providing training
Ability for teamwork
Autonomous and sense of initiative
Bilingual, written and spoken

Joseph Ribkoff is an equal opportunity at will employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of age, race, religion, color, disability, sex, sexual orientation or national origin.

Title: Data Analyst (Mobile Applications)
Description:
Title: Data Analyst (Mobile Applications)
Location: Scarborough, ON
Type: Contract

Join a rock-solid organization as our client’s next Data Analyst and sit at the center of projects that drives decisions. You’ll help one of Ontario's most trusted organizations work on the latest project, and be rewarded with great opportunities.

What you'll do

Assess and evaluate its first mobile app for both iOS and Android users.
Monitor analytics and metrics from a range of sources including Google Analytics, AppFigures, and proprietary dashboards
Monitor support tickets raised by EO app users during the pilot period to collect relevant insights on user behavior, expectations and barriers
Measure and analyze how app users behave
Synthesize data to develop insights that will inform future iterations of the app
Help understand various use cases to overcome barriers to positive user experiences
Summarize pilots results into a final report assessing the Personalized Voter Communications (PVC) pilot and including recommendations for next steps

Who you are


3-5 years of experience in digital analytics
Previous experience in mobile app analysis, preferably with non-profit or public sector apps
Experience developing insights to inform future iterations of mobile apps through synthesis of user feedback, analytics, metrics and business goals
Expertise with a range of analytical tools including Google Analytics, AppFigures, and SaaS dashboards
Expertise with MS Excel
Ability to synthesize data, generate reports and prioritize feature development
Interpretation of data and proposing recommendations
Exceptional oral and written communication skills in English for presentations and reports.

Apply now—we look forward to meeting you!

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
Equivalent Experience

Description:
Overview
The Business Analyst is an active member of the Engineering Enabling Systems team, a section of the Software Engineering department at MAS.
The Business Analyst is primarily responsible for translating business and operational needs into solutions by developing and communicating requirements to the Information Technology (IT) group. Acting as a liaison between commercial and military organizations and Engineering, this position will be responsible for conceptualizing business and operational requirements and transforming them into effective and viable engineering and IT solutions. Understanding the relationship between technology and supply chain planning is essential for this position. We are looking for an experienced Business Analyst with knowledge and hands-on experience in the implementation of maintenance and supply chain management systems.

Responsibilities include:

Organize, lead and facilitate workshops with business organizations to gather and document requirements.
Identify, analyze and map processes and rules, visually and concisely, then propose target processes with the help of IT.
Test and validate the solution and ensure that it meets the customer's requirements.
Collaborate as an active member of a multi-disciplinary project submission team.
Review submission documentation to determine technical and engineering requirements.
Define concept of operations (CONOPS); use case, business process and notation (BPMN) and system models.
Analyze the impact of new requirements on the current IT plan and business processes.

Skills:
Business analysis

Top Skills Details:
Business analysis

Additional Skills & Qualifications:
The successful candidate must be eligible to meet the requirements and conditions of the Canadian Controlled Goods Program (CGP) and the U.S. International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR).
A "RELIABILITY" security clearance is required. A SECRET security clearance may be required.
A Bachelor's or Master's degree with relevant specialization is an asset. Preferred areas of specialization: software engineering, computer engineering and computer science.

Experience:

At least 8 years in the following areas of information technology: maintenance and supply chain management systems and IT related systems implementation.
Experience in analyzing and improving supply chain data, information and processes.
General understanding of supply chain process issues.
Practical experience in translating business needs into functional and technical requirements.
Experience in business process design.
Experience in the selection of business solutions.

Personal Skills:

Excellent learning ability.
Self-starter and committed.
Results-oriented and excellent at problem solving.
Demonstrate passion, drive, motivation and agility.
Be team oriented.
Ability to adapt.
Assume responsibility.
Ability to work under pressure.
Ability to communicate easily.
Strong organizational and leadership skills.

Asset:

People to have defense aerospace
Have previous experience from Dessault or siemens defence
having worked with federal government agencies
bilingual
Visio
BPEN or specialized tool
JIRA
CONFLUECE

Disqualify:

Need to be Canadian, reliability clearance (Canadian program) and need secret classifications

Experience Level:
Intermediate Level

À propos d'Aston Carter:
Aston Carter, une division d'Aerotek, est un fournisseur d'envergure mondiale de services de recrutement et de dotation de personnel pour les sociétés à la recherche de professionnels du milieu des affaires hautement spécialisés. Aerotek est une société en exploitation d'Allegis Group, un fournisseur multinational de solutions en matière de talent.
Aston Carter s'engage fermement à offrir un service de premier ordre aux clients et aux professionnels du milieu des affaires dans un vaste éventail de disciplines, notamment la comptabilité, la finance, la gouvernance ainsi que la gestion du risque et de la conformité. Avec plus de 60 bureaux en Europe, Asie et Amérique du Nord, Aston Carter offre une expertise locale, régionale et mondiale pour répondre aux besoins uniques de ses clients.
Reconnu "best of staffing" par nos clients et le talent que nous recrutons, Aston Carter s'engage à livrer un service hors pair a tous nos partenaires d'affaire.

Aston Carter is a distinguished global provider of recruitment and staffing services to companies requiring highly specialized business professionals. With more than 60 offices across Europe, Asia Pacific and North America, Aston Carter provides local, regional and global expertise to drive value and meet our customers' unique needs. Title: Software Engineer - Business Intelligence Platform
Description:
Calabrio is looking for a Software Engineer! Our Vancouver-based Business Intelligence Platform team, which builds software that is part of Calabrio’s contact center suite, is looking for an Engineer to help Calabrio get to the next level by designing, implementing, and creating features that work in a SAAS based, multi-tenant, secure cloud environment. You will create innovative software in a dynamic and rewarding environment working with product and development teams in Vancouver, Minneapolis and Stockholm that will challenge your skills and help you reach the next level of your career.
What you’ll be doing:
Collaborate, learn and create in an engaging, dynamic and rewarding environment with people whose passion for creating outstanding software matches yours.
Implement REST-based web services in a Java platform using microservices, Java EE and supporting data structures
Build high availability, asynchronous and message-based services using AWS
Maintain and enhance GWT-based front ends
Creating robust continuous integration and deployment infrastructure
Requirements
MUST HAVES:
Passion for agile development practices such as continuous delivery, continuous integration, unit testing and test driven development
Skilled in backend application development: Java, REST APIs, JSON, database programming fundamentals, etc.
Experience with distributed version control systems and cloud based build tools
Experience working in Kanban/Agile and DevOps environments
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Strong attention to detail
NICE TO HAVES:
Experience with any of the below tools and technologies is a major plus!
AWS (e.g. CloudFormation, EC2, Elasticsearch)
Containers (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes)
Continuous Integration tools including Jenkins and Artifactory
Microservices (e.g. Quarkus, Dropwizard, Spring Boot, Swagger)
RabbitMQ, Kafka
Benefits
Calabrio People are: Open, Clear, Ambitious, Accountable, Collaborative, Consistent
What we value most…workplace diversity and ensuring an environment of mutual respect. We believe that diversity and inclusion are critical to our success, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.
Our commitment is to continue to keep our people healthy, focused, and creative. We've built a company culture where you’ll feel motivated and truly excited to come to work. Calabrio is driven by the diversity of our talented team members who come from a wide variety of backgrounds and lifestyles. As an equal opportunity employer, we always consider and embrace ALL individuals including what makes them unique. We believe our team members should be happy and healthy, with peace of mind and a sense of accomplishment.
About Calabrio:
Calabrio has joined forces with some of the best minds and most progressive concepts on enriching human interactions through our customer experience intelligence platform. For you, that means working on high-performing innovative teams that combine their incredible ideas in one incredible company.
Our team members are offered comprehensive benefits for various life circumstances and needs, great opportunities for career development, and a balanced work-life to achieve personal and professional success (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).
Awards & Accolades:
Calabrio has 300 Global Partners, more than 2.25 million agents, and over 7,000 customers worldwide. We’ve been doing this for more than two decades and have been recognized by leading independent third parties such as Gartner, Forrester, and G2 Crowd as a leader and visionary. Thanks to the hard work and dedication of every Calabrio team member, we have been recognized by the Star Tribune Top Workplace for 8 years in a row, #20 on the 2020 Fast 50 list, named one of BC’s Top Employers for 2021 and recognized as a top 50 fast-growth company by Minneapolis/St Paul Business Journal.
Calabrio celebrates and fosters a culture that thrives on diversity. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer that prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. We provide employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Calabrio are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status, parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. We celebrate the >40 nationalities of team members that contribute to our success.

Title: Intermediate Business Systems Analyst - Remote - Victoria
Description:
Are you an experienced Business Systems Analyst? Are you looking to use your exemplary client relation and collaboration skills? We are seeking an Intermediate Business Systems Analyst for a remote 12 month contract role. If you would like to be considered for this exciting opportunity, apply now!



Advantages
What’s in it for you?

Key Responsibilities:
Planning and delivering multiple systems projects including chairing meetings, defining objectives, priorities, timeline and resource requirements, and leading systems professionals in defining work assignmentsManaging the design for enhancements and maintenance of mission critical systems by developing functional requirements/specifications and leading walkthroughs to ensuring the requirements and associated specifications addresses the business needMeeting with client stakeholders to identify how technology can be used more effectively to resolve business and/or organizational issues and collaboratively establishes strategic plans and budgets that will drive substantive change to existing systems and business processesConducting investigations of possible solutions including incorporating untested concepts, identifying internal and external impacts and linkages, and consulting with other systems professionalsConducting needs assessments, data collection, and technology research, and analyzes options, risks, cost benefits and support requirements of various proposed solutionsFacilitating meetings with management and staff to resolve technical issues concerned with proposed systems / program changesDeveloping briefing notes, position papers, and presentations to clients and branch managers on detailed project proposals, and on emerging or overlapping issues in order to guide decision makingEnsuring client requirements and priorities are understood and met throughout the systems development life cycle (e.g. change management, problem resolution, acceptance testing, implementation, and post implementation reviews)Developing database queries and develop and execute test plansCollaborate effectively with technical staff with respect to the installation, configuration, maintenance and problem resolution of hardware, software, operating systems and network components

Title: Lead, Business Intelligence, Developer Lifecycle Management/ Chef d'équipe, Intelligence d'affaires- Gestion du cycle de vie des développeurs
Description:
The Opportunity

The Operate Business Intelligence team at Unity is central to enabling data-driven decision-making, identifying new revenue growth opportunities, and executing on strategic initiatives. We are looking for an analytical, communicative, and intellectually curious Business Intelligence Lead to join our team in Montreal to support the Developer Lifecycle Management product! Your role will include hiring, management, growth, and retention of BI talent, and project management of key initiatives.

What you'll be doing

Aid in the product life-cycle development and strategy for emerging game operations side objectives
Drive day to day execution and delivery of tasks, lead the team, and motivate team by explaining how their work relates to the wider business objectives
Lead a team of Business Intelligence source material experts on all aspects' developer related
Be the specialist on all aspects of developer experience and be the bridge between Product, Data Science, Engineering, and Sales
Help maintain a team of dashboards to monitor product performance and ensure success on a technical and business level

What we're looking for

Ability to mentor, coach, and develop team members, lead by example, and build strong relationships
A passion for data, analysis, and problem solving
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Self-starter who can operate independently and drive work to completion in a timely fashion
Skilled with SQL (required) and Excel (required)
Willingness to work with multiple time zones

You might also have

Experience managing small size teams
Knowledge of existing BI development / dashboarding tools
Familiarity with ETL practices and tools
Gaming industry background

Life at Unity

Unity (NYSE: U) is the world's leading platform for creating and operating real-time 3D (RT3D) content. Creators, ranging from game developers to artists, architects, automotive designers, filmmakers, and others, use Unity to make their imaginations come to life. Unity is the foundation upon which the world's most powerful digital content is created. Specifically, Unity's platform provides a comprehensive set of software solutions to create, run and monetize interactive, real-time 2D and 3D content for mobile phones, tablets, PCs, consoles, and augmented and virtual reality devices.

In the fourth quarter of 2021, Unity had, on average, 3.9 billion monthly active end users who consumed content created or operated with its solutions. The applications developed by these creators were downloaded, on average, five billion times per month in 2021. For more information, please visit www.unity.com.

Unity is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. Therefore, we provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law. If there are preparations or accommodations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.

Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. Unity does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Unity will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Unity.


L'opportunité

L'équipe Operate Business Intelligence de Unity est au cœur de la prise de décision pilotée par les données, de l'identification de nouvelles occasions de croissance des revenus et de la mise en œuvre d'initiatives stratégiques. Nous sommes à la recherche d'un(e) chef d'équipe en intelligence d'affaires possédant une curiosité intellectuelle et des compétences en analyse ainsi qu'en communication, qui se joindra à notre équipe à Montréal dans le but de soutenir notre volet Gestion du cycle de vie des développeurs! Votre rôle comprendra le recrutement, la gestion, la croissance et la rétention de talents spécialisés dans l'intelligence d'affaires, ainsi que la gestion de projet d'initiatives clés.

Ce que vous allez faire

Contribuer au développement du cycle de vie des produits et à l'élaboration d'une stratégie visant à atteindre les objectifs émergents de l'équipe des opérations de jeu
Piloter l'exécution et la livraison quotidiennes des tâches, diriger et motiver votre équipe en expliquant comment leur travail est lié aux objectifs commerciaux élargis de l'organisation
Diriger une équipe d'experts en intelligence d'affaires du contenu source, sur tous les aspects liés au développement
Assumer le rôle de spécialiste de l'expérience du/de la développeur(se) dans tous ses aspects et faire le lien entre les équipes de produits, de science des données, de développement et de vente
Contribuer à la mise en place de tableaux de bord afin d'effectuer le suivi de la performance des produits et d'en assurer la réussite sur un plan technique et commercial

Ce que nous recherchons

Une capacité à encadrer les membres de l'équipe, de les soutenir et de les aider à se perfectionner, de prêcher par l'exemple et d'établir de solides relations
Une passion pour les données, l'analyse et la résolution de problèmes
D'excellentes aptitudes en communication et en compétences relationnelles
Un esprit d'initiative et la capacité à travailler de façon autonome et à mener le travail à terme dans les délais impartis
Des compétences avec SQL (requis) et Excel (requis)
Une volonté de travailler avec des équipes multiples situées dans des fuseaux horaires différents

Vous avez peut-être également

Une expérience dans la gestion d'équipes de petite taille
Une connaissance des outils existants de développement de l'intelligence d'affaires et des tableaux de bord
Une connaissance des pratiques et des outils en matière d'extraction de traitement et de chargement des données (ETC)
Une expérience dans le secteur des jeux vidéo

La vie chez Unity

Unity (NYSE: U) est la plateforme la plus utilisée au monde pour la création et l'exécution interactive de contenu 3D en temps réel (RT3D). Des créateur(rice)s, notamment des développeur(se)s de jeux vidéo, des artistes, des architectes, des concepteur(rice)s automobiles, des cinéastes et bien d'autres professionnel(le)s, utilisent Unity pour donner vie à leurs projets. Unity constitue la base sur laquelle sont créés les contenus numériques les plus remarquables au monde. Plus précisément, la plateforme de Unity offre un ensemble complet de solutions logicielles pour créer, exécuter et monétiser du contenu interactif 2D et 3D en temps réel pour les téléphones mobiles, les tablettes, les ordinateurs, les consoles et les appareils de réalité augmentée et de réalité virtuelle.

Au quatrième trimestre de l'année 2021, Unity comptait en moyenne 3,9 milliards d'utilisateurs finaux actifs mensuels ayant consommé du contenu créé ou exploité au moyen de ses solutions. Les applications développées par ces créateur(rice)s ont été téléchargées en moyenne cinq milliards de fois par mois en 2021. Pour en savoir davantage, veuillez consulter le site www.unity.com.

Unity souscrit au principe de l'équité en matière d'emploi et favorise un environnement inclusif et innovant où se joignent les meilleur(e)s employé(e)s. Par conséquent, nous offrons des chances égales pour l'emploi sans nous baser sur l'âge, la race, la couleur, l'ascendance, l'origine nationale, la religion, le handicap, le sexe, l'identité ou l'expression de genre, l'orientation sexuelle ou tout autre statut protégé par la loi. Si nous pouvons effectuer certains préparatifs ou aménagements afin d'aider à faire en sorte que votre entrevue soit une expérience confortable et positive, veuillez nous en faire part.

Les chasseurs de têtes et les agences de placement ne peuvent pas envoyer de CV sur ce site Web ni directement aux gestionnaires. Unity n'accepte pas de CV non sollicités provenant de chasseurs de têtes ou d'agences. Unity ne paiera aucuns frais à une agence ou à une entreprise tierce qui n'a pas signé d'entente avec elle.

Title: Lead, Business Intelligence- Trust & Safety, Monetize Products/ Chef d'équipe, Intelligence d'affaires, Trust & Safety, Produits de Monétisation
Description:
The opportunity

The Monetize Business Intelligence team at Unity is central to enabling data-driven decision-making, identifying new revenue growth opportunities, and completing critical initiatives. We are looking for a Business Intelligence Lead to manage and strengthen a team of BI Developers for our Trust & Safety Suite of products within Monetization. Our advertising and In-App Purchasing solutions and technologies are deployed in hundreds of thousands of apps used by hundreds of millions of users every day. This generates extensive data sets that need to be mined for valuable insights in order to understand how to continue to drive this fast-growing business and support our developer community.

The BI team is viewed as the first line of defence when problems and curiosities arise, and you will be leading and assisting your team to provide crucial reporting tools and insights that are the backbone of the decision-making process for the Product team.

What you'll be doing
Manage your team and develop them to achieve their potential. You will be responsible for a cross-product BI team whose core responsibilities include building dashboards for product teams, A/B analysis, owning data reporting pipelines, and working cross-functionally across Product, Engineering, and Data Science to drive forward new product initiatives
Drive day to day execution and delivery of tasks, lead the team, and empower the team by explaining how their work relates to the wider business objectives
Collaborate with your Product partner and Senior Engineering leadership to conceptualize, prioritize and develop new products
Be the source material expert on all products under the Trust & Safety suite and be the bridge between Product, Data Science, Engineering, and Sales
Aid in the product life-cycle development and strategy for emerging Unified Auction objectives

What we're looking for
Experience leading a small to medium-sized team
Experience in AdTech or Mobile Gaming Industry
Ability to mentor, coach, and develop team members, lead by example, and build positive relationships
Strong collaboration, facilitation, and communication skills
Skilled with SQL/BigQuery and Excel and experience dashboarding with BI Tools i.e. Tableau, Looker, Data Studio

You might also have

A passion for data, analysis, and problem solving
Familiarity with ETL practices and tools (AirFlow, Pyspark)
Data development with Looker

Life at Unity

Unity (NYSE: U) is the world's leading platform for creating and operating real-time 3D (RT3D) content. Creators, ranging from game developers to artists, architects, automotive designers, filmmakers, and others, use Unity to make their imaginations come to life. Unity is the foundation upon which the world's most powerful digital content is created. Specifically, Unity's platform provides a comprehensive set of software solutions to create, run and monetize interactive, real-time 2D and 3D content for mobile phones, tablets, PCs, consoles, and augmented and virtual reality devices.

In the fourth quarter of 2021, Unity had, on average, 3.9 billion monthly active end users who consumed content created or operated with its solutions. The applications developed by these creators were downloaded, on average, five billion times per month in 2021. For more information, please visit www.unity.com.

Unity is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. Therefore, we provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law. If there are preparations or accommodations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.

Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this Web site or directly to managers. Unity does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Unity will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Unity.

L'opportunité

L'équipe d'intelligence d'affaires et de monétisation de Unity est au cœur de la prise de décision pilotée par les données, de l'identification de nouvelles occasions de croissance des revenus et de la mise en œuvre d'initiatives essentielles. Nous sommes à la recherche d'un(e) responsable en intelligence d'affaires qui sera chargé(e) de gérer et de renforcer une équipe de développeur(se)s BI pour notre suite de produits Trust & Safety au sein de l'équipe Monetization. Nos solutions et technologies publicitaires et d'achats intégrés sont déployées sur des centaines de milliers d'applications utilisées par des centaines de millions d'utilisateur(trice)s chaque jour. Elles produisent d'importants jeux de données qui doivent être analysés pour en tirer de précieuses informations, ce qui permettra de comprendre comment poursuivre une croissance rapide et appuyer notre communauté de développeur(euse)s.

L'équipe d'intelligence d'affaires est la première ligne de défense lorsque des problèmes ou événements inhabituels surviennent. Vous dirigerez et aiderez votre équipe à fournir des outils de création de rapports et des informations cruciales qui constituent l'épine dorsale du processus décisionnel de l'équipe chargée des produits.

Ce que vous allez faire

Gérer votre équipe et la faire évoluer pour qu'elle réalise son potentiel. Vous serez responsable d'une équipe d'intelligence d'affaires multi-produits dont les principales responsabilités consistent à créer des tableaux de bord à l'usage des équipes de produits, à effectuer des analyses A/B, à posséder des pipelines de rapports de données et à travailler de manière transversale avec les équipes de produits, de développeur(se)s et de science des données pour faire avancer les nouvelles initiatives de produits
Piloter l'exécution et la livraison quotidiennes des tâches, diriger et motiver votre équipe en expliquant comment leur travail est lié aux objectifs commerciaux élargis de l'organisation
Collaborer avec votre partenaire produit et le/la responsable sénior du développement pour conceptualiser, hiérarchiser et développer de nouveaux produits
Être l'expert(e) de référence sur les produits liés à la suite Trust & Safety, et constituer le pont entre les services des produits, de la science des données, du développement et des ventes
Contribuer au développement du cycle de vie des produits et à l'élaboration d'une stratégie visant à atteindre les objectifs émergents de l'équipe Unified Auction

Ce que nous recherchons

Une expérience dans la gestion d'équipes de taille petite à moyenne
Une expérience dans l'AdTech ou dans l'industrie des jeux vidéo mobiles
Une capacité à encadrer les membres de l'équipe, à les soutenir, à prêcher par l'exemple et à développer
Une bonne connaissance de SQL, BigQuery et d'Excel, ainsi qu'une expérience de la création de tableaux de bord au moyen d'outils de veille stratégique (Tableau, Looker, Data Studio, etc.)

Vous avez peut-être également

Une passion pour les données, l'analyse et la résolution de problèmes
Une connaissance des pratiques et des outils en matière d'extraction de traitement et de chargement des données (AirFlow, Pyspark)
Une expérience de développement de données sur Looker

La vie chez Unity

Unity (NYSE: U) est la plateforme la plus utilisée au monde pour la création et l'exécution interactive de contenu 3D en temps réel (RT3D). Des créateur(rice)s, notamment des développeur(se)s de jeux vidéo, des artistes, des architectes, des concepteur(rice)s automobiles, des cinéastes et bien d'autres professionnel(le)s, utilisent Unity pour donner vie à leurs projets. Unity constitue la base sur laquelle sont créés les contenus numériques les plus remarquables au monde. Plus précisément, la plateforme de Unity offre un ensemble complet de solutions logicielles pour créer, exécuter et monétiser du contenu interactif 2D et 3D en temps réel pour les téléphones mobiles, les tablettes, les ordinateurs, les consoles et les appareils de réalité augmentée et de réalité virtuelle.

Au quatrième trimestre de l'année 2021, Unity comptait en moyenne 3,9 milliards d'utilisateurs finaux actifs mensuels ayant consommé du contenu créé ou exploité au moyen de ses solutions. Les applications développées par ces créateur(rice)s ont été téléchargées en moyenne cinq milliards de fois par mois en 2021. Pour en savoir davantage, veuillez consulter le site www.unity.com.

Unity souscrit au principe de l'équité en matière d'emploi et favorise un environnement inclusif et innovant où se joignent les meilleur(e)s employé(e)s. Par conséquent, nous offrons des chances égales pour l'emploi sans nous baser sur l'âge, la race, la couleur, l'ascendance, l'origine nationale, la religion, le handicap, le sexe, l'identité ou l'expression de genre, l'orientation sexuelle ou tout autre statut protégé par la loi. Si nous pouvons effectuer certains préparatifs ou aménagements afin d'aider à faire en sorte que votre entrevue soit une expérience confortable et positive, veuillez nous en faire part.

Les chasseurs de têtes et les agences de placement ne peuvent pas envoyer de CV sur ce site Web ni directement aux gestionnaires. Unity n'accepte pas de CV non sollicités provenant de chasseurs de têtes ou d'agences. Unity ne paiera aucuns frais à une agence ou à une entreprise tierce qui n'a pas signé d'entente avec elle.

Description: “The start date of this job is flexible and in order to find the best candidate the job may remain open much longer than the date mentioned on this posting…..or you may be asked to start sooner than the expected start date if you are able to do so!”URGENT:  Please read the job description below. If this interests you, please send a MS-Word version copy of your updated resume (ASAP) along with your salary expectations, first available date and a telephone contact number.Please mention the job title above in the subject lineThe recruiter in charge of this role is TanviIf you do not think you are a match for this opportunity, but know someone who is, feel free to forward this email to them and you will be eligible for a referral bonus upon a successful hire.One of our major telecommunication clients is looking for a Bilingual Marketing Analyst/ Analyste marketing bilingueLength: 12 months contract with the high possibility of an extensionLocation:  Montreal, QCPROJECT DETAILS: Her/his main responsibility is to consolidate market information (competition pricing, trends, results, etc.) in order to improve or create price structures and in-market rebate. The person will have to incorporate the new credits in the IT systems. He/she excels in identifying, analyzing, and evaluating the impacts of a price adjustment on the company's profitability. With the senior analyst, price management, she or he represents the marketing department in front of the sales channels in terms of prices.As an expert, the price management analyst must be an innovator, generator of new ideas.MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES· Analyze and improve existing pricing structures and develop new ones as needed· Produce and analyze different impact scenarios based on business strategies· Communicate the KPIs clearly and concisely to business partners by popularizing the information· Identify opportunities, diagnose problems, and make corrections in terms of price management as well as commercial agreements· Produce, analyze reports and make optimization recommendations in data processing· Ensure data integrity throughout the pricing processSelling point for your role- Fun team!! Able to see the direct results of their work. Never dull – you will resolve challenge. La personne devra intégrer les nouveaux crédits dans les systèmes informatiques. Il excelle dans l'identification, l'analyse et l'évaluation des impacts d'un ajustement de prix sur la rentabilité de l'entreprise. Avec l'analyste sénior, gestion des prix, elle représente le département marketing auprès des canaux de vente en matière de prix.En tant qu'expert, l'analyste en gestion des prix doit être un innovateur, générateur d'idées nouvelles.PRINCIPALES RESPONSABILITÉSAnalyser et améliorer les structures de tarification existantes et en développer de nouvelles si nécessaireProduire et analyser différents scénarios d'impact basés sur les stratégies d'affairesCommuniquer les KPI de manière claire et concise aux partenaires commerciaux en vulgarisant l'informationIdentifier les opportunités, diagnostiquer les problèmes et apporter des corrections en termes de gestion des prix ainsi que des accords commerciauxProduire, analyser des rapports et faire des recommandations d'optimisation dans le traitement des donnéesGarantir l'intégrité des données tout au long du processus de tarificationArgument de vente pour votre rôle - Équipe amusante !! Capable de voir les résultats directs de leur travail. Jamais ennuyeux - vous résoudrez le défi. Il est reconnu pour sa rigueur et son organisation efficace des priorités.Please note that this is the most up to date version of job description available at this time – During Client Interview you will receive additional information – variance may apply !Please visit the TEAMRECRUITER website to review other CAREER OPPORTUNITIES!Job Types: Full-time, Fixed term contractContract length: 12 monthsSchedule:Monday to Friday

Title: Sales Analyst
Description:
Robert Half is hiring for a Sales Analyst for our client in the Retail space. The Sales Analyst will be responsible for analyzing data within the business' retail accounts to identify and anticipate consumer trends and help make business recommendations. This is a hybrid work model and a 3 month initial contract with the opportunity to extend. Apply today to learn more!

What you'll do:
Evaluate and track retail market data
Forecast sales trends and opportunities for growth
Generate and analyze sales reports
Report and analyze POS data, which includes understanding account information related to order patterns and timing; and update CTC POS tracker as required
Provide POS Tracker for retail accounts

3-5 years of sales analysis and operations experience with high-end distribution centers
5+ years of experience working with reporting software
Ability to navigate and organize considerable amounts of data via Vlookup, Xlookup,Sumif, Pivot Tables, etc.
Experience managing inventory flow processes and SRO program
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work independently

Title: IT Technical Analyst
Description:
Job Type: Full-Time


The Gateway to Your Future
The IT Technical Analyst is responsible for for the support and administration of applications and services used for the production, management, and delivery of content and online services to the business. The incumbent will collaborate with team members and functional stakeholders to provide support and technology solutions for the Gaming Management System.

We Provide

Full benefits package for full-time employees
Retirement savings plan
Exciting, supportive and fun work environment
Family and friends discounts on travel, tech, food, beverage, and fitness
Development and training opportunities
Key Responsibilities

Maintain production systems related to Gaming Management Systems and Services. This includes development, staging and production environments.
Ensure application standards and guidelines are applied and maintained for administration, deployment and monitoring, over a range of platforms that are largely comprised of industry standard components. This includes applications, web server components and databases.
Develop and apply an in-depth understanding of business processes to ensure application and service processes and outputs are error free and complete.
Ensure application continuity and quality by owning the resolution of issues across platforms; track progress and escalate as appropriate.
Review and ensure complete and appropriate handover of documentation prior to operational acceptance of new or changed applications.
Ensure that applications and related services are documented and kept current.
Keep abreast of technical developments of operational importance to the company, and to participate in developing or setting standards as directed.
Contribute to process development and best practice. To look at new ways to improve resilience, performance levels and supportability.
Manage change control implications for designated systems.
Provide capacity planning, monitoring, and maintenance of designated system(s).
Identify trends or problems (as defined under ITIL).
Establish and maintain effective working relationships with all stakeholders.
Undertake advanced administration tasks as required (e.g. to support problem resolution).
Support the infrastructure teams and the 24/7 group in deploying applications and solving problems.
Participate in the on-call support to the 24/7 team.
What You Bring

Post-secondary Diploma/Degree in computing science, Information Technology or related field
Knowledge of Enterprise level centralized and decentralized architectures, their strengths and weaknesses.
Application testing approaches, including smoke, regression, and load/performance testing.
Developing, documenting and executing test plans and test cases.
Ability to manage third party vendors, and develop conceptual understanding of black-box systems
Knowledge of application security paradigms and related testing approaches
Knowledge of high availability database (MS SQL, Oracle) designs and database connectivity methods
Familiarity with data analysis, data quality and governance concepts
Familiarity with Cloud-based web technology stacks, their administration and configuration
Strong understanding of API’s, interface data flows and message queue technologies (Mulesoft or similar)
Ability to troubleshoot new and grand-fathered applications and interfaces
Knowledge and experience with application monitoring tools (AppDynamics or similar)
Exposure to ITIL methodologies.
Demonstrable knowledge and experience of three or more of the following: building highly scalable systems
automated deployment
source control and release management tools
monitoring tools and/or transaction monitoring
virtualization of applications particularly using VMware and converged infrastructure
Experience in multiple database environments
Experience in programming languages / scripting e.g. Unix shell or Perl
Excellent organization, written, and client facing skills
Critical thinking, self-motivation, and multi-tasking skills.
Review processes and implement efficiency enhancing procedures.
Ability to use and understand Microsoft Office Applications (Project, Excel, Words, Visio, etc.) email, Internet navigation and presentation software (PowerPoint or other software).
Strong understanding of casino products (slots & table games), systems and/or similar environments.
A proven track record of successful project implementation in a software and technology implementation environment.
Experience working collaboratively with multidisciplinary teams with a focus on delivery in a rapidly changing environment.
Experience developing and maintaining applications in a multiplatform environment (Windows Server and/or Linux environments).
Previous experience in a support or customer facing role.
Formal training in Application Systems Development Life Cycle Management methods and techniques.
Experience delivering production support in a 24/7 operation.
Hands-on experience with Sybase, Microsoft Operating Systems, Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle, Linux, Java and .NET environment. Gaming technology experience including Bally GMS Version 15
Experience with Casino Market Place, Slot Data Systems and other Gaming and Entertainment related systems.
Experience with POS Systems – Squirrel or Micros.
Why Work With Us?
Gateway celebrates and empowers our team members, who make it all possible. A career at Gateway means working with great people, being recognized for your unique contribution and career advancement opportunities across our 27 locations. Our employees thrive with ongoing training and leadership programs while working in a dynamic and fun environment. See for yourself what its like to be on a team that values your vision, skill and energy.


Get to Know Gateway
Gateway Casinos & Entertainment Limited (Gateway) is one of the largest and most diversified gaming and entertainment companies in Canada. Across its 28 gaming properties in British Columbia, Ontario and Edmonton, Alberta, Gateway currently employs approximately 8,648 people and boasts approximately 448 table games (including 49 poker tables), 13,887 slots, 85 restaurants and bars and 561 hotel rooms. Gateway is the service provider for the Central, Southwest and North gaming Bundles in Ontario, which includes 11 properties in their portfolio. A multi-pronged growth strategy has seen Gateway diversify and expand its product offering, including developing proprietary casino and restaurant brands, dramatically improving the gaming customer experience while attracting new customers. Some of Gateway's proprietary brands include Match Eatery & Public House, Atlas Steak + Fish and the new Halley's Club. In 2017, Gateway celebrated 25 years in the business of gaming and entertainment in Canada. Further information is available at www.gatewaycasinos.com.

Apply Now!
Not the right fit this time? Follow us on our careers social media pages!



Gateway is a proud equal opportunity employer and dedicates itself to Respect, Integrity, Team-Work and Exceptional Customer Service. We are committed to providing an inclusive and barrier free candidate experience and work environment. If you require accommodation at any point during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know.

Title: SEO Senior Analyst
Description:
We are

Accenture Interactive—a new breed of agency that’s all about the Experience. For us, customer experience is not an add-on; it’s foundational to who we are and how we empower our clients. As the world’s largest, most disruptive agency, we drive lasting growth for clients by helping them design, build, and run meaningful experiences that make people’s lives better, more productive, and more meaningful. We do this in three ways: by transforming organizations through standout products and services; by building and delivering award-winning campaigns so brands can engage and communicate creatively with customers at scale; and by using our top-notch skills to pilot, integrate, scale, and run the platforms that underpin the world’s greatest experiences. Visit us here to learn more about what makes us the Experience Agency.

Job Summary
There will never be a typical day at Accenture Interactive, but that’s why people love it here. The opportunities to make a difference while working on exciting client initiatives are limitless in this ever-changing space. Here’s a snapshot of your responsibilities:

Delivery
Plan, develop and implement strategic development for SEO campaigns, starting from kick-off and extending thru post-launch and analysis stages.
Defining and building keyword lists based on clients’ objectives and market opportunity, using a mix of proprietary tools, analytics data, and PPC data.
Performing keywords research to identify gaps and new opportunities, preparing and executing on-page optimization strategies and content briefs to achieve organic visibility for our clients.
Prepare website technical audits to identify areas of concerns, prioritize of action items and produce user stories for development sprints.
Reviewing website server logs, crawl reports, and analytics reports to come up with strategies to improve crawl budget and indexation
Reviewing web analytics data to provide feedback to our internal team on performance, and to analyze visitor behavior and trends to come up with next steps
Stay on top of latest search marketing trends, share findings and resources to help team and management consistently remain updated on high paced developing digital world
Work with the Accenture digital SEO team to help elevate client expectations and share insights and knowledge
Collaborate with internal and client teams to achieve/over-achieve set goals and objectives
Help innovate and develop client search marketing strategy
Utilize media research tools (SEM Rush, Similar Web, Comscore, etc.) and resources to aid in telling the story for the client
Work with Product Managers, UX, Content, and Web Developers to champion and adhere to all SEO best practices
Organize and participate in client presentations and decks delivering reporting of account performance, providing insightful analysis/trends, recommendations and opportunities to meet goals and KPI’s
Consistently seek and share with the team innovative ways to help elevate client expectations and goals
Proactively manage client accounts across multi platforms and channels, anticipate issues and develop solution focused recommendations

Basic Qualifications
Minimum of Bachelor's degree, or equivalent work experience
2+ years of experience in digital marketing
2+ years of hands on SEO with enterprise clients
2+ years of experience in a similar SEO and Analytics role
Excellent communication, relationship building and presentation skills
Advanced skills in Excel, Word and PowerPoint skills
A curious and innovative mind to help initiate, lead and manage SEO accounts
Ability to work in a fast paced and demanding environment as well as to balance several clients needs simultaneously
Experience with enterprise level SEO tools (ex: Deepcrawl, Conductor, brightedge etc.) is an asset
Experience with agile methodology, user story production and sprints.
Experience with location management platforms like Yext
Bilingual French and English speaking is preferred
Set Yourself Apart:
Strong project management skills and ability to manage multiple responsibilities in a fast-paced environment
Strong client relationship skills and ability to manage multiple responsibilities in a fast-paced environment
Passionate about SEO, data, analytics and technology
Previous experience managing large SEO accounts at a search marketing agency
Strong networking skills both internally and with client and vendor relationships
Ability to take complex solutions and make them simple to explain and digest
Team Player – a positive attitude to help build a good relationship with teammates and to help client growth collaboratively
Professional Skill Requirements
Proven ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment
Desire to work in a data driven environment
Excellent communication (written and oral) and interpersonal skills
Ability to take complex solutions and make them simple to explain and digest

Title: Senior Consultant, Data Integration and BI
Description:
Responsibilities

Design, build, and test custom data warehouse and BI solutions for Myers-Holum clients using the Oracle NetSuite Analytics Warehouse (NSAW) platform
Translate business requirements into technical specifications
Develop custom data integration solutions to ingest data from multiple sources (cloud and on-premise) using various data integration / data pipelining tools, Oracle Analytics Cloud (OAC), and Oracle Autonomous Data Warehouse (ADW)
Implement NSAW Best Practices

Qualifications and Skills

5+ years of relevant professional experience
3+ years experience with data management using Oracle or other relational database
3+ years experience with data warehouse and data integration projects, using ETL / data integration / data pipelining tools
Proficiency with at least one cloud or on-premise data integration / data pipelining tool, such as Fivetran, Stitch, Talend, Glue, Nexla, Informatica, Oracle Data Integrator
Proficiency in at least one version of SQL: Oracle (preferred), SQLServer,MySQL, PostgreSQL, Snowflake
Experience with at least one of the following BI tools: Oracle OBIEE, OAC, Looker, PowerBI, Qlikview, Tableau
Experience with using REST APIs and/or GraphQL APIs to get data from cloud data sources is preferred
Knowledge of ERP data and business processes
Business analysis skills
Strong written and verbal communication skills

About Myers-Holum

Myers-Holum Inc. (MHI) is a technology and management consulting firm founded in 1981 and based in New York, New York with several professional services practices, specialized skills and expertise
Today, MHI has regional presence in core markets across North America delivering of NetSuite and other cloud services.
Our firm is comprised of a remote workforce of 275+ consultants and developers working across the US and Canada
Our cutting edge technology partners include Oracle + NetSuite, Google Cloud Platform, Dell Boomi and Stripe, all working with us to provide the best customer experience throughout each implementation
Specialties include Enterprise Data Management, Data Warehousing, Business Intelligence/Analytics, Master Data Management, Performance Management, Google BigQuery, NetSuite ERP and Ecommerce implementations and Managed Services
Having consulted for more than 800 companies ranging from the Fortune 500 to the lower Mid-Market, our workforce represents a diverse and ambitious group of consulting and development professionals with comprehensive industry, systems, and data management expertise.
The clients we service represent a wide array of industries including: Manufacturing, WD, Retail, Ecommerce, Software & Technology, NFP, Financial Services, Pharma & Healthcare, Hospitality, and Insurance
Having been a NetSuite Alliance Partner and Commerce Agency Partner since 2017, MHI has been recognized as NetSuite Partner of the Year in 2019, 2020 and Dell Boomi Growth Partner of the Year in 2020
Website: myersholum.com

Benefits

MHI offers competitive base salary, incentive pay and comprehensive benefits including medical, dental, 401k
Company access to training and full coverage for certification/exam fees in a variety of products and professional skill sets
Career growth and upward mobility to meet your long term goals
Remote working opportunity when not traveling for client requirements with full access to the team through technology

Title: Senior BI Application Developer, Security Analytics (Remote Ottawa Hub)
Description:
Requisition ID: 135581

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.
Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.
In Technology at Scotia, we’re questioning everything about how we bank today to come up with the right solutions for our customers tomorrow. Reinvention starts here — and it starts with you.
The Team
The Security Analytics team within Scotiabank’s Information Security & Control (IS&C) department is responsible for delivering IT infrastructure and security analytics to the IS&C leadership team to enable active measurement and tracking of cyber security risks across the global bank and its subsidiaries.
The Role
As a key member of the Security Analytics team, the Senior Business Intelligence (BI) Application Developer will work with the team to investigate, define and document requirements for high-profile management-level dashboards and reports. The senior developer will then assume responsibility for the design, development and implementation of suitable database objects, data integration (ETL) scripts, metrics, reports and dashboards to satisfy those requirements.
Is this role right for you?
You’re a team player and have a proven track record of getting things done.
You’re detailed-oriented and have a solid reputation of producing high quality deliverables. You enjoy working with large volumes of structured and unstructured data and thrive in data driven organizations.
You’re passionate about data analytics and enjoy contributing to the end-to-end report development process, including:
Investigating, defining and documenting the department’s reporting requirements and underlying data requirements;
Researching and reviewing potential data sources and assessing data quality;
Designing, developing and maintaining database objects (tables, views, stored procedures);
Designing, developing and maintaining SSIS packages to integrate data from suitable data sources into the department’s data warehouse;
Designing, developing and maintaining SSRS and Power BI reports and dashboards.
You’re proactive and continuously seek to understand end-user requirements in order to implement effective data visualizations in new reports and enhance the quality of existing reports. You also seek opportunities to automate the most time and resource intensive processes related to data collection, validation, transformation, etc. to optimize the production and delivery of steady state reports using best practices.
You’re a mentor and trusted advisor. You are recognized as a BI subject matter expert within the team and across the broader organization. You contribute to the maintenance and operations of the department’s Data Warehouse and BI environment (production and non-production). You help investigate and diagnose issues and ensure problems and defects are resolved in a timely manner.
You’re curious and you enjoy learning.
Where could you work? Both at home and in the office.
We’re focused on being an employer of choice for the communities we serve and offering a hybrid work environment for top Tech talent in Canada’s capital city.
We’re creating a local ScotiaTech Hub in Ottawa. You’ll have the opportunity both to work remotely and head to the Ottawa office for in-person moments that foster team cohesiveness and collaboration.
Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role? We’d love to work with you if you have:
You have at 3+ years of experience as a Developer in Data Warehouse / Business Intelligence projects and assignments.
You have 3+ years of technical hands-on experience with Microsoft BI technologies (SQL Server, SSIS, SSRS, SSAS and Power BI Report Server).
You have advanced data manipulation skills using Excel.
You have advanced knowledge and experience with SQL and scripting languages such as PowerShell.
You have some practical experience in Web design and development with ASP.NET framework using C# and VB.NET.
You have some practical experience with Cloud technologies (e.g., Microsoft Azure).
You’re able to effectively handle ambiguous, ad hoc tasks and changes in direction and priorities in response to unexpected events and circumstances.
You have an undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology or equivalent from a recognized post-secondary institution.
What's in it for you?
We have an inclusive and collaborative working environment that encourages creativity and curiosity and celebrates success
We provide you with the tools and technology needed to create meaningful customer experiences
You’ll get to work with and learn from diverse industry leaders, who have hailed from top technology companies around the world
Our work from home social channel offers weekly virtual yoga, social events, learning opportunities, and lots more.
We offer a competitive total rewards package, including a performance bonus, company matching programs (on pension & profit sharing), and generous vacation.
