Title: Marketing Analyst (Real Estate)
Description: Our client with offices located in Midtown Toronto is one of the most active developer/builders in the GTA with 10 high-rise residential towers in various stages of development, representing over 3.5M GFA, 4,230 condominium units and over $3.375 billion of development value.They are looking to hire an experienced Marketing Analyst. This position is ideal for an individual with prior experience in the Property development industry.The Marketing Analyst will be responsible for executing the strategic sales and marketing plan for various communities across the GTA. Candidate will serve as a trusted advisor and will execute a full complement of marketing initiatives to drive growth and enhance market positioning, which may include; but not limited to: completing necessary market studies to inform decision making, executing marketing campaigns, coordinate sales launches and sales administrative tasks, while ensuring the company’s overall business growth objectives.Reporting to the Vice President of Sales & Marketing, and indirectly to the Marketing Manager, you will be a self-motivated, energetic, driven and results oriented individual. Working closely with development teams, you will execute strategies for elevating the company's presence and strengthening the company’s brand as being a reputable developer.MARKETING: · Achieves marketing and sales operational objectives by contributing marketing and sales information and recommendations to strategic plans.· Manages major marketing initiatives, which requires collaboration with marketing agencies in areas such as creative development, digital media, and communications.· Reviews consultant contracts to understand full scope of work required and tracks performance to ensure successful completion of activities.· Managing the company’s social media accounts, working with marketing agency to curate impactful social campaigns that engage the consumer audience and result in improved lead generation.· Ensures company website(s) are up to date, offer a user-friendly experience and are mobile optimized.· Strategizes on ways to continuously improve the customer experience with purchasers on various communities.· Produce competitive market analysis (CMA) to help inform revenue analysis studies, product development and production of marketing collateral.· Strategic in the deployment of e.marketing campaigns utilizing current CRM databases.· Ensure CRM systems capture up to date purchaser information to ensure e.mail campaigns are successful in reaching the target audience(s).· Help coordinate project launches; aid in selecting a sales facility, preparation of marketing & ID drawings and production of marketing collateral and signage schematics.· Ensure presentation centre is merchandised appropriately and materials are up to date.· Ensure an appropriate amount of inventory is on hand at all times i.e. office supplies and refreshments for customers.· Track and monitor costs against project budget· Record all invoice details and prepare for approval to ensure prompt payment per agreed upon terms.· Arranging for the company to attend relevant industry events and conferences.· Facilitate award submission entries, i.e. CHBA, OHBA, BILD, NHBA· Cultivate positive business relationships with company executives, operational teams, industry professionals and sales teams.SALES: · Facilitate tracking and execution of brokerage co-op agreements based on set approval criteria.· Ensure purchaser deposits and mortgage pre-approvals are received before any co-op agreements or commissions are advanced.· Facilitate commission payments to lead and co-operating brokers in a timely manner.· Prepare sales and tracking reports when required.· Ensure all sales agreements, amendments, cheque/ID photocopies, co-op agreements, assignments are saved on the company server – Sharepoint.· Make suggestions on improving the overall sales process and brokerage experience.· Adhere to company policy by returning phone calls within a 24-hr period.· Cultivate positive relationship with the brokerage community.REPORTING: · Track key metrics (KPI’s) on a regular basis, and report results, trends and opportunities to improve engagement, likes and followers on various social channels.· Reporting on current market data, industry related news releases, and new sales launches.· Visit competitor sales facilities to obtain sales materials when required.· Maintain real estate research and market intelligence databases by project/submarket on company server.· Produce analytic reports on performance of SEO & SEM campaigns, social media, and e.marketing campaigns.· Structure, compile, and draft internal and external reports, including investment offering summaries, confidential information memoranda, market study analysis, responses to Requests for Proposals (RFPs), and other adhoc industry reports.QUALIFICATIONS: · Post-secondary education in Marketing, Business Administration, or a similar program· 1– 3 years of relevant work experience (including co-op)· Real estate experience or a strong interest in this industry is highly preferred.· Excellent verbal and written communication skills.· Excellent interpersonal skills to interact with coworkers, customers, partners, and other external stakeholders.· Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment with changing priorities and deadlines.Job Types: Full-time, PermanentSalary: $60,000.00-$70,000.00 per yearSchedule:8 hour shiftDay shiftMonday to FridayExperience:Marketing: 3 years (preferred)Real Estate/Propery: 1 year (preferred)Administrative: 2 years (preferred)Data analytics: 1 year (preferred)

Title: Sr SEO Analyst (Remote)
Description: A Little Bit About Us: We are a growing global technology company that is looking to reinvent the way organizations build Trust in People with technology and AI-backed background checks. We are proud to share that we recently secured 43 million in funding, were named one of Canada’s Companies-to-Watch in Deloitte’s Technology Fast 50™ Awards, and are on track to become one of Canada’s fastest-growing start-ups.Who are Certonians?We are soccer players, DIY creators, spicy-food lovers, karaoke lovers, wine connoisseurs, and so much more! We are a team of 150+ people currently living the dream at Certn and are looking for more team members to level us up. If you are excited about working with a group that values accountability, working synergistically with one another, being inclusive of different perspectives, and not being an a$$hole - aka approaching all solutions & problems with compassion and empathy - we want to hear from you!The Opportunity: We are looking for a Sr SEO Analyst to expand our growing Marketing team! Reporting to Director, Growth Marketing you will be responsible for analyzing, reviewing and implementing websites and content that is optimized to increase traffic organically from search engines.Success in the role requires someone with an understanding of the different levers of SEO, a savvy mind for core marketing principles and an ability to think big picture.As our Sr SEO Analyst, you will: Develop on-page and off-page optimization strategies that increase Certn and our subsidiaries website SERPs globallyThe Sr SEO Analyst will work closely with the Sr PPC Analyst to execute tests, collect and analyze data and results, identify trends and insights, in order to achieve maximum ROIClosely collaborate with digital development teams to ensure SEO best practices are properly followed throughout the website; including site architecture, proper silo structure, and ability to advise development teams on effective site migrations that maintain SEO standings.Work with content and marketing teams to drive SEO in content creation and content marketing.Take responsibility for onsite SEO implementations. As well as leading and lagging SEO kpi reporting and attribution.In-depth understanding of technical SEO monitoring and execution (audits & fixes), internal link structures, offsite link-building and digital PR. Run site speed and performance audits as needed, with knowledge of core web vitals.Perform ongoing keyword research, discovery and optimization for new SEO keywords to use throughout the company websites and marketing executions. Including pillar content, video and image SEO strategies.Create and execute link building strategy, as well as link profile management, penalty avoidance and recovery strategies.Determine measurable goals that demonstrate improvement in marketing efforts. Monitor daily performance metrics with SEO tools including, but not limited to Google Analytics, SEMRush, Ahrefs, Screaming Frog and GSCAbility to manage SEO-relevant scripts and codes through Google Tag Manager, analytics and conversion tracking.We're hoping you'll bring: A thirst for new: An SEO Specialist will have in-depth knowledge of cluster based keyword research, SEO copywriting and the behaviours of search engines. SEO is an ever-changing landscape, so our SEO specialist needs to be continuously learning and evolving.Communication skills: SEO involves a number of different areas of the organization – from marketing to product, and often the results can be slower burn. This is where the upside and importance of SEO needs clear communication to the business.Adaptability: Google and SEO algorithms change constantly. Complacency is the death of great SEO…you need to be able to move with change, and change our strategy and content accordingly.Ownership: Yes, SEO has many stakeholders but we are looking for someone to join and immediately establish themselves as the SEO leader for the organization. In order to achieve this you need domain expertise, team work and patience.Why Certn?Our goal is to make sure Certn to be the best place for you to work. That means we are consistently asking for your feedback, researching best practices, and implementing new programs and changes in the way we work so that we can each walk away every day feeling proud to work here!Some of the benefits you can expect at Certn are...4 weeks of paid vacation12 wellness daysExtensive health benefitsFamily support program (including support for new parents and caregivers)Remote-first and supports flexible remote arrangementsGreen transportation allowanceFitness & wellness allowanceWork from home allowanceProfessional development budgetAnd a few more goodies!Does this role sound like it was made for you, yet you don’t check every box?We value diversity in our teams’ experience. Whatever your background, experience, ethnicity, physical ability, sexual orientation, race, and gender is, we want to hear from you! We are dedicated to fostering an inclusive and diverse environment for all employees from all walks of life. One of our corporate goals is to build an environment that will be the best place for you to work and spend your time. To accomplish that, we know we need to develop a diverse team where everyone feels included and where a variety of voices are heard.*If you have a disability that requires accommodation during any stage of our recruitment process, please let us know how we can best assist you*About CertnWe’re changing the way background checks are done. Easily manage your entire screening process- from customizing packages, paying for only what you need, and tracking status updates – with Certn’s powerful all-in-one platform and proprietary API.Job Types: Full-time, PermanentBenefits:Extended health carePaid time offWork from homeSchedule:Monday to Friday

Title: Business Analyst, Supply Chain
Description:
Joseph Ribkoff designs classic and contemporary garments for fashion-forward women with a youthful state of mind. Each one of our carefully tailored pieces offers the effortless fashion, fit, and quality that we’ve been synonymous with.

Over the years, the brand has blossomed into a touchstone for timeless, youthful style. Driven by a passion that has never ceased to propel our company’s vision, Joseph Ribkoff has been an ally to women, dressing them with flair and perfect fit for over 65 years. From our quality and distinctly designed products to our unwavering commitment to retail partners, Joseph Ribkoff’s values resonate in everything we do and create.

Today, his legacy lives on through the work of a devoted, talented team operating from the four corners of the world. Sold in over 60 international markets, Joseph Ribkoff is a global emblem of quality and elegance.

Montreal Corporate Head Office, where most of their employees are based, offers career opportunities in Design, Operations, Sales, Marketing, Finance, IT and HR as well as in the Production and Warehousing facilities.

OBJECTIVE:
The IT Analyst will work closely with management to reach set objectives. He accompanies the customers in implementing the projects and in reaching the project’s objectives. He analyzes the business processes and documents the needs, for technical analysis and programming purposes.

RESPONSABILITIES:

Identifies the customer’s needs and performs a business process analysis
Aligns the customer’s processes according to best practices
Adequately documents business needs and processes according to company standards
Establishes parameters for system components based on processes agreed to with the customer
Identifies required application corrections
Provides templates, confirms the quality of data received, imports and validates the customer’s data
Analyzes the developments required and obtains approval; prepares the specifications, creates the quote, obtains development and time estimates, and submits them to the customer
Trains expert users;
Deals with the unexpected and adapts work execution accordingly
Tests, reviews and updates the systems
Assists in implementing interfaces between systems
Ensures the continuous improvement of assigned processes, and updates the standard process guide
Tests official versions and maintains test scripts as related to assigned processes
Reports any unsolicited behaviours in the application

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Relevant experience with a manufacturing and distributing company
Bachelor’s degree or a College diploma in computer science or experience in a similar role
Good knowledge of an ERP, PLM or BI Solution implementation process. (SAP, JD Edwards, Microsoft D365)
Good knowledge of the financial processes of a manufacturing company
Proficiency with MS Office and Visio
Basic knowledge of SQL
Demonstrate interpersonal skills, ease at establishing relationships with the customers, and quickly establish ties with them
Demonstrate excellent interpersonal communications, based on respect, diplomacy and judgment, and oriented towards the search for solutions
Demonstrate leadership, honesty and motivation
Have the customer’s best interest at heart
Comfortable in providing training
Ability for teamwork
Autonomous and sense of initiative
Bilingual, written and spoken

Joseph Ribkoff is an equal opportunity at will employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of age, race, religion, color, disability, sex, sexual orientation or national origin.

Title: Senior Systems Analyst - Toronto
Description:
Our client is seeking a Senior System Analyst to join our growing team! As a Senior System Analyst, will be involved in the system administration, troubleshooting, analyzing data and solutioning of the IFRS17 Calculation Engine and other Longview Consolidation system application. 
  
 What you will bring :
  

6+ years of system administration knowledge in any simple or complex databases, and system applications.
Experience with system maintenance, setting up hierarchies/roll ups.
Experience with building system reports and extracts through use of programming language or configuration tools
Experience with troubleshooting: drilling down, analyzing, identifying data issues and help solutioning
Background in building technical solutions based on business requirements
Helped building processes and controls
Working experience in advanced MS Excel is required

 Please forward your resume to : Devika.Soundranayakam@Randstad.ca
  

Advantages


An award-winning, inspiring workplace that supports its people and recognizes great work
Stimulating, challenging projects and development opportunities to help you grow your skills and career
A comprehensive financial rewards program that recognizes your success
An extensive, flexible benefits package
An industry leading Employee Share Purchase Plan where we match 50% of net shares purchased
A $350 annual wellness account that promotes an active lifestyle


 Responsibilities


System administration of the IFRS17 Calculation Engine and Longview Consolidation System application.
Troubleshoot, analyze, and propose solution to help remediate data issues
Help prepare the detailed business requirements related to Finance and IT systems
Maintain the Longview system applications and the related analytical programs
Maintain the system hierarchies, structure, and reports to support Finance teams with financial reports and disclosures required
Support with the Dry-run testing, Opening Transition phase of IFRS17, and parallel run
Help meet the target workday timetable to support the IFRS17 system close processes
Help design and develop New IFRS17 system reconciliation and reports required for management and regulatory reporting.
Support the analytics function (ah-hoc or on-going) to provide business insights to Finance stakeholders
Ensure completeness and accuracy of the data in the system applications by monitoring, and maintaining new interface system controls
Help support transition from project phase to BAU
Liaison with IT teams on any system changes that impact Finance systems and processes
Help support the Group IFRS17 system transition deliverables
Help with special projects


 Qualifications
 Qualification, Education Required
  

University or college degree in computer science, computer engineering, mathematics, accounting and information systems or equivalent
Excellent problem solving and analytical skills
Ability to work independently, to multitask and take initiative when required
Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously
Attention to detail and high level of accuracy in work product
Strong Communication skills (both verbal and written)

 Nice to Have:
  

Familiarity with P&C insurance would be nice to have
Some understanding of accounting/finance system functions such as General Ledger and any financial reporting systems/tools


 Summary
 The role also includes on-going maintenance of system hierarchies, structure, system applications, and reports.
  
 Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.
  
 Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to accessibility@randstad.ca to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

Title: Software Engineer - Business Intelligence Platform
Description:
Calabrio is looking for a Software Engineer! Our Vancouver-based Business Intelligence Platform team, which builds software that is part of Calabrio’s contact center suite, is looking for an Engineer to help Calabrio get to the next level by designing, implementing, and creating features that work in a SAAS based, multi-tenant, secure cloud environment. You will create innovative software in a dynamic and rewarding environment working with product and development teams in Vancouver, Minneapolis and Stockholm that will challenge your skills and help you reach the next level of your career.
What you’ll be doing:
Collaborate, learn and create in an engaging, dynamic and rewarding environment with people whose passion for creating outstanding software matches yours.
Implement REST-based web services in a Java platform using microservices, Java EE and supporting data structures
Build high availability, asynchronous and message-based services using AWS
Maintain and enhance GWT-based front ends
Creating robust continuous integration and deployment infrastructure
Requirements
MUST HAVES:
Passion for agile development practices such as continuous delivery, continuous integration, unit testing and test driven development
Skilled in backend application development: Java, REST APIs, JSON, database programming fundamentals, etc.
Experience with distributed version control systems and cloud based build tools
Experience working in Kanban/Agile and DevOps environments
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Strong attention to detail
NICE TO HAVES:
Experience with any of the below tools and technologies is a major plus!
AWS (e.g. CloudFormation, EC2, Elasticsearch)
Containers (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes)
Continuous Integration tools including Jenkins and Artifactory
Microservices (e.g. Quarkus, Dropwizard, Spring Boot, Swagger)
RabbitMQ, Kafka
Benefits
Calabrio People are: Open, Clear, Ambitious, Accountable, Collaborative, Consistent
What we value most…workplace diversity and ensuring an environment of mutual respect. We believe that diversity and inclusion are critical to our success, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.
Our commitment is to continue to keep our people healthy, focused, and creative. We've built a company culture where you’ll feel motivated and truly excited to come to work. Calabrio is driven by the diversity of our talented team members who come from a wide variety of backgrounds and lifestyles. As an equal opportunity employer, we always consider and embrace ALL individuals including what makes them unique. We believe our team members should be happy and healthy, with peace of mind and a sense of accomplishment.
About Calabrio:
Calabrio has joined forces with some of the best minds and most progressive concepts on enriching human interactions through our customer experience intelligence platform. For you, that means working on high-performing innovative teams that combine their incredible ideas in one incredible company.
Our team members are offered comprehensive benefits for various life circumstances and needs, great opportunities for career development, and a balanced work-life to achieve personal and professional success (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).
Awards & Accolades:
Calabrio has 300 Global Partners, more than 2.25 million agents, and over 7,000 customers worldwide. We’ve been doing this for more than two decades and have been recognized by leading independent third parties such as Gartner, Forrester, and G2 Crowd as a leader and visionary. Thanks to the hard work and dedication of every Calabrio team member, we have been recognized by the Star Tribune Top Workplace for 8 years in a row, #20 on the 2020 Fast 50 list, named one of BC’s Top Employers for 2021 and recognized as a top 50 fast-growth company by Minneapolis/St Paul Business Journal.
Calabrio celebrates and fosters a culture that thrives on diversity. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer that prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. We provide employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Calabrio are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status, parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. We celebrate the >40 nationalities of team members that contribute to our success.

Title: Lead, Business Intelligence- Trust & Safety, Monetize Products/ Chef d'équipe, Intelligence d'affaires, Trust & Safety, Produits de Monétisation
Description:
The opportunity

The Monetize Business Intelligence team at Unity is central to enabling data-driven decision-making, identifying new revenue growth opportunities, and completing critical initiatives. We are looking for a Business Intelligence Lead to manage and strengthen a team of BI Developers for our Trust & Safety Suite of products within Monetization. Our advertising and In-App Purchasing solutions and technologies are deployed in hundreds of thousands of apps used by hundreds of millions of users every day. This generates extensive data sets that need to be mined for valuable insights in order to understand how to continue to drive this fast-growing business and support our developer community.

The BI team is viewed as the first line of defence when problems and curiosities arise, and you will be leading and assisting your team to provide crucial reporting tools and insights that are the backbone of the decision-making process for the Product team.

What you'll be doing
Manage your team and develop them to achieve their potential. You will be responsible for a cross-product BI team whose core responsibilities include building dashboards for product teams, A/B analysis, owning data reporting pipelines, and working cross-functionally across Product, Engineering, and Data Science to drive forward new product initiatives
Drive day to day execution and delivery of tasks, lead the team, and empower the team by explaining how their work relates to the wider business objectives
Collaborate with your Product partner and Senior Engineering leadership to conceptualize, prioritize and develop new products
Be the source material expert on all products under the Trust & Safety suite and be the bridge between Product, Data Science, Engineering, and Sales
Aid in the product life-cycle development and strategy for emerging Unified Auction objectives

What we're looking for
Experience leading a small to medium-sized team
Experience in AdTech or Mobile Gaming Industry
Ability to mentor, coach, and develop team members, lead by example, and build positive relationships
Strong collaboration, facilitation, and communication skills
Skilled with SQL/BigQuery and Excel and experience dashboarding with BI Tools i.e. Tableau, Looker, Data Studio

You might also have

A passion for data, analysis, and problem solving
Familiarity with ETL practices and tools (AirFlow, Pyspark)
Data development with Looker

Life at Unity

Unity (NYSE: U) is the world's leading platform for creating and operating real-time 3D (RT3D) content. Creators, ranging from game developers to artists, architects, automotive designers, filmmakers, and others, use Unity to make their imaginations come to life. Unity is the foundation upon which the world's most powerful digital content is created. Specifically, Unity's platform provides a comprehensive set of software solutions to create, run and monetize interactive, real-time 2D and 3D content for mobile phones, tablets, PCs, consoles, and augmented and virtual reality devices.

In the fourth quarter of 2021, Unity had, on average, 3.9 billion monthly active end users who consumed content created or operated with its solutions. The applications developed by these creators were downloaded, on average, five billion times per month in 2021. For more information, please visit www.unity.com.

Unity is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. Therefore, we provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law. If there are preparations or accommodations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.

Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this Web site or directly to managers. Unity does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Unity will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Unity.

L'opportunité

L'équipe d'intelligence d'affaires et de monétisation de Unity est au cœur de la prise de décision pilotée par les données, de l'identification de nouvelles occasions de croissance des revenus et de la mise en œuvre d'initiatives essentielles. Nous sommes à la recherche d'un(e) responsable en intelligence d'affaires qui sera chargé(e) de gérer et de renforcer une équipe de développeur(se)s BI pour notre suite de produits Trust & Safety au sein de l'équipe Monetization. Nos solutions et technologies publicitaires et d'achats intégrés sont déployées sur des centaines de milliers d'applications utilisées par des centaines de millions d'utilisateur(trice)s chaque jour. Elles produisent d'importants jeux de données qui doivent être analysés pour en tirer de précieuses informations, ce qui permettra de comprendre comment poursuivre une croissance rapide et appuyer notre communauté de développeur(euse)s.

L'équipe d'intelligence d'affaires est la première ligne de défense lorsque des problèmes ou événements inhabituels surviennent. Vous dirigerez et aiderez votre équipe à fournir des outils de création de rapports et des informations cruciales qui constituent l'épine dorsale du processus décisionnel de l'équipe chargée des produits.

Ce que vous allez faire

Gérer votre équipe et la faire évoluer pour qu'elle réalise son potentiel. Vous serez responsable d'une équipe d'intelligence d'affaires multi-produits dont les principales responsabilités consistent à créer des tableaux de bord à l'usage des équipes de produits, à effectuer des analyses A/B, à posséder des pipelines de rapports de données et à travailler de manière transversale avec les équipes de produits, de développeur(se)s et de science des données pour faire avancer les nouvelles initiatives de produits
Piloter l'exécution et la livraison quotidiennes des tâches, diriger et motiver votre équipe en expliquant comment leur travail est lié aux objectifs commerciaux élargis de l'organisation
Collaborer avec votre partenaire produit et le/la responsable sénior du développement pour conceptualiser, hiérarchiser et développer de nouveaux produits
Être l'expert(e) de référence sur les produits liés à la suite Trust & Safety, et constituer le pont entre les services des produits, de la science des données, du développement et des ventes
Contribuer au développement du cycle de vie des produits et à l'élaboration d'une stratégie visant à atteindre les objectifs émergents de l'équipe Unified Auction

Ce que nous recherchons

Une expérience dans la gestion d'équipes de taille petite à moyenne
Une expérience dans l'AdTech ou dans l'industrie des jeux vidéo mobiles
Une capacité à encadrer les membres de l'équipe, à les soutenir, à prêcher par l'exemple et à développer
Une bonne connaissance de SQL, BigQuery et d'Excel, ainsi qu'une expérience de la création de tableaux de bord au moyen d'outils de veille stratégique (Tableau, Looker, Data Studio, etc.)

Vous avez peut-être également

Une passion pour les données, l'analyse et la résolution de problèmes
Une connaissance des pratiques et des outils en matière d'extraction de traitement et de chargement des données (AirFlow, Pyspark)
Une expérience de développement de données sur Looker

La vie chez Unity

Unity (NYSE: U) est la plateforme la plus utilisée au monde pour la création et l'exécution interactive de contenu 3D en temps réel (RT3D). Des créateur(rice)s, notamment des développeur(se)s de jeux vidéo, des artistes, des architectes, des concepteur(rice)s automobiles, des cinéastes et bien d'autres professionnel(le)s, utilisent Unity pour donner vie à leurs projets. Unity constitue la base sur laquelle sont créés les contenus numériques les plus remarquables au monde. Plus précisément, la plateforme de Unity offre un ensemble complet de solutions logicielles pour créer, exécuter et monétiser du contenu interactif 2D et 3D en temps réel pour les téléphones mobiles, les tablettes, les ordinateurs, les consoles et les appareils de réalité augmentée et de réalité virtuelle.

Au quatrième trimestre de l'année 2021, Unity comptait en moyenne 3,9 milliards d'utilisateurs finaux actifs mensuels ayant consommé du contenu créé ou exploité au moyen de ses solutions. Les applications développées par ces créateur(rice)s ont été téléchargées en moyenne cinq milliards de fois par mois en 2021. Pour en savoir davantage, veuillez consulter le site www.unity.com.

Unity souscrit au principe de l'équité en matière d'emploi et favorise un environnement inclusif et innovant où se joignent les meilleur(e)s employé(e)s. Par conséquent, nous offrons des chances égales pour l'emploi sans nous baser sur l'âge, la race, la couleur, l'ascendance, l'origine nationale, la religion, le handicap, le sexe, l'identité ou l'expression de genre, l'orientation sexuelle ou tout autre statut protégé par la loi. Si nous pouvons effectuer certains préparatifs ou aménagements afin d'aider à faire en sorte que votre entrevue soit une expérience confortable et positive, veuillez nous en faire part.

Les chasseurs de têtes et les agences de placement ne peuvent pas envoyer de CV sur ce site Web ni directement aux gestionnaires. Unity n'accepte pas de CV non sollicités provenant de chasseurs de têtes ou d'agences. Unity ne paiera aucuns frais à une agence ou à une entreprise tierce qui n'a pas signé d'entente avec elle.

Title: Lead, Business Intelligence, Developer Lifecycle Management/ Chef d'équipe, Intelligence d'affaires- Gestion du cycle de vie des développeurs
Description:
The Opportunity

The Operate Business Intelligence team at Unity is central to enabling data-driven decision-making, identifying new revenue growth opportunities, and executing on strategic initiatives. We are looking for an analytical, communicative, and intellectually curious Business Intelligence Lead to join our team in Montreal to support the Developer Lifecycle Management product! Your role will include hiring, management, growth, and retention of BI talent, and project management of key initiatives.

What you'll be doing

Aid in the product life-cycle development and strategy for emerging game operations side objectives
Drive day to day execution and delivery of tasks, lead the team, and motivate team by explaining how their work relates to the wider business objectives
Lead a team of Business Intelligence source material experts on all aspects' developer related
Be the specialist on all aspects of developer experience and be the bridge between Product, Data Science, Engineering, and Sales
Help maintain a team of dashboards to monitor product performance and ensure success on a technical and business level

What we're looking for

Ability to mentor, coach, and develop team members, lead by example, and build strong relationships
A passion for data, analysis, and problem solving
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Self-starter who can operate independently and drive work to completion in a timely fashion
Skilled with SQL (required) and Excel (required)
Willingness to work with multiple time zones

You might also have

Experience managing small size teams
Knowledge of existing BI development / dashboarding tools
Familiarity with ETL practices and tools
Gaming industry background

Life at Unity

Unity (NYSE: U) is the world's leading platform for creating and operating real-time 3D (RT3D) content. Creators, ranging from game developers to artists, architects, automotive designers, filmmakers, and others, use Unity to make their imaginations come to life. Unity is the foundation upon which the world's most powerful digital content is created. Specifically, Unity's platform provides a comprehensive set of software solutions to create, run and monetize interactive, real-time 2D and 3D content for mobile phones, tablets, PCs, consoles, and augmented and virtual reality devices.

In the fourth quarter of 2021, Unity had, on average, 3.9 billion monthly active end users who consumed content created or operated with its solutions. The applications developed by these creators were downloaded, on average, five billion times per month in 2021. For more information, please visit www.unity.com.

Unity is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. Therefore, we provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law. If there are preparations or accommodations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.

Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. Unity does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Unity will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Unity.


L'opportunité

L'équipe Operate Business Intelligence de Unity est au cœur de la prise de décision pilotée par les données, de l'identification de nouvelles occasions de croissance des revenus et de la mise en œuvre d'initiatives stratégiques. Nous sommes à la recherche d'un(e) chef d'équipe en intelligence d'affaires possédant une curiosité intellectuelle et des compétences en analyse ainsi qu'en communication, qui se joindra à notre équipe à Montréal dans le but de soutenir notre volet Gestion du cycle de vie des développeurs! Votre rôle comprendra le recrutement, la gestion, la croissance et la rétention de talents spécialisés dans l'intelligence d'affaires, ainsi que la gestion de projet d'initiatives clés.

Ce que vous allez faire

Contribuer au développement du cycle de vie des produits et à l'élaboration d'une stratégie visant à atteindre les objectifs émergents de l'équipe des opérations de jeu
Piloter l'exécution et la livraison quotidiennes des tâches, diriger et motiver votre équipe en expliquant comment leur travail est lié aux objectifs commerciaux élargis de l'organisation
Diriger une équipe d'experts en intelligence d'affaires du contenu source, sur tous les aspects liés au développement
Assumer le rôle de spécialiste de l'expérience du/de la développeur(se) dans tous ses aspects et faire le lien entre les équipes de produits, de science des données, de développement et de vente
Contribuer à la mise en place de tableaux de bord afin d'effectuer le suivi de la performance des produits et d'en assurer la réussite sur un plan technique et commercial

Ce que nous recherchons

Une capacité à encadrer les membres de l'équipe, de les soutenir et de les aider à se perfectionner, de prêcher par l'exemple et d'établir de solides relations
Une passion pour les données, l'analyse et la résolution de problèmes
D'excellentes aptitudes en communication et en compétences relationnelles
Un esprit d'initiative et la capacité à travailler de façon autonome et à mener le travail à terme dans les délais impartis
Des compétences avec SQL (requis) et Excel (requis)
Une volonté de travailler avec des équipes multiples situées dans des fuseaux horaires différents

Vous avez peut-être également

Une expérience dans la gestion d'équipes de petite taille
Une connaissance des outils existants de développement de l'intelligence d'affaires et des tableaux de bord
Une connaissance des pratiques et des outils en matière d'extraction de traitement et de chargement des données (ETC)
Une expérience dans le secteur des jeux vidéo

La vie chez Unity

Unity (NYSE: U) est la plateforme la plus utilisée au monde pour la création et l'exécution interactive de contenu 3D en temps réel (RT3D). Des créateur(rice)s, notamment des développeur(se)s de jeux vidéo, des artistes, des architectes, des concepteur(rice)s automobiles, des cinéastes et bien d'autres professionnel(le)s, utilisent Unity pour donner vie à leurs projets. Plus précisément, la plateforme de Unity offre un ensemble complet de solutions logicielles pour créer, exécuter et monétiser du contenu interactif 2D et 3D en temps réel pour les téléphones mobiles, les tablettes, les ordinateurs, les consoles et les appareils de réalité augmentée et de réalité virtuelle.

Au quatrième trimestre de l'année 2021, Unity comptait en moyenne 3,9 milliards d'utilisateurs finaux actifs mensuels ayant consommé du contenu créé ou exploité au moyen de ses solutions. Les applications développées par ces créateur(rice)s ont été téléchargées en moyenne cinq milliards de fois par mois en 2021. Pour en savoir davantage, veuillez consulter le site www.unity.com.

Unity souscrit au principe de l'équité en matière d'emploi et favorise un environnement inclusif et innovant où se joignent les meilleur(e)s employé(e)s. Par conséquent, nous offrons des chances égales pour l'emploi sans nous baser sur l'âge, la race, la couleur, l'ascendance, l'origine nationale, la religion, le handicap, le sexe, l'identité ou l'expression de genre, l'orientation sexuelle ou tout autre statut protégé par la loi. Title: Senior Manager, Data Visualization
Description:
Some opportunities happen only once in a lifetime - like a job where you have the chance to change lives. At Alexion, people living with rare and devastating diseases are our Guiding Star. We are driven to continuously innovate and create meaningful value in all we do to help patients and families fully live their best lives. We value the uniqueness and diversity of our employees and recognize that nurturing the diverse perspectives and strengths of our people translates into innovative breakthroughs for patients.


Senior Manager, Data Visualization
This is what you will do:
The Senior Manager, Data Visualization supports the development and enhancement of digital technology and leads the data visualization initiative developed to monitor clinical trial data quality and vendor performance. The position manages complex abstract clinical data management technical projects and is responsible for tasks used to define how and where technologies are applied to collect, code, review, validate, and visualize clinical trial data received in-house and from external sources.
You will be responsible for:
Using complex data sources to produce integrated clinical trial management data visualizations for stakeholders
Data normalization for portfolio level reporting and visualization
Advising teams on how best to interpret and utilize outputs to increase data integrity/quality and reduce redundancies to create efficiencies in data collection and process
Supporting an agile, value-focused culture, and providing input into technical projects sought at improving data-science tools and infrastructure
Supporting the development of predictive analytics to identify the likelihood of future outcomes
Working closely with key business stakeholders to understand business initiatives and how data insights can drive and measure progress
Using technical, creative problem-solving and good development practice skills to achieve successful outcomes

You will need to have:
Bachelor’s or advanced degree in a Computer Science or related with at least 5 years of experienceExperience with data visualization tools (e.g., Elluminate, Spotfire, etc.).
Experience with Master Data Management for clinical trial data sources
Experience in interpreting business need and translating into the development of dashboards and reports to be used by decision makers
Effective verbal and written communication, influencing, and partnering skills
The duties of this role are generally conducted in an office environment. As is typical of an office-based role, employees must be able, with or without an accommodation to: use a computer; engage in communications via phone, video, and electronic messaging; Bachelor’s or advanced degree in a Computer Science or related with at least 5 years of experience; maintain general availability during standard business hours

We would prefer for you to have:
Clinical programming background
Solid grasp of applied mathematical, machine learning and AI techniques and workflows
Good understanding of project management techniques and methods
Experience of agile working practices
Knowledge of the end-to-end clinical trial process

Alexion is a global biopharmaceutical company focused on serving patients and families affected by rare diseases and devastating conditions through the discovery, development and commercialization of life-changing medicines. Headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts, Alexion has offices around the globe and serves patients in more than 50 countries. Further information about Alexion can be found at: www.alexion.com.

Alexion is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We are committed to fostering a culture of belonging where every single person can belong because of their uniqueness. The Company will not make decisions about employment, training, compensation, promotion, and other terms and conditions of employment based on race, color, religion, creed or lack thereof, sex, sexual orientation, age, ancestry, national origin, ethnicity, citizenship status, marital status, pregnancy, (including childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), parental status (including adoption or surrogacy), military status, protected veteran status, disability, medical condition, gender identity or expression, genetic information, mental illness or other characteristics protected by law. Alexion provides reasonable accommodations to meet the needs of candidates and employees. To begin an interactive dialogue with Alexion regarding an accommodation, please contact accommodations@Alexion.com. Alexion participates in E-Verify.

AstraZeneca completed its acquisition of Alexion, marking the creation of Alexion, AstraZeneca Rare Disease. If you're interested in career opportunities with AstraZeneca, click here.

Title: Business Analyst, Supply Chain
Description:
Joseph Ribkoff designs classic and contemporary garments for fashion-forward women with a youthful state of mind. Each one of our carefully tailored pieces offers the effortless fashion, fit, and quality that we’ve been synonymous with.

Over the years, the brand has blossomed into a touchstone for timeless, youthful style. Driven by a passion that has never ceased to propel our company’s vision, Joseph Ribkoff has been an ally to women, dressing them with flair and perfect fit for over 65 years. From our quality and distinctly designed products to our unwavering commitment to retail partners, Joseph Ribkoff’s values resonate in everything we do and create.

Today, his legacy lives on through the work of a devoted, talented team operating from the four corners of the world. Sold in over 60 international markets, Joseph Ribkoff is a global emblem of quality and elegance.

Montreal Corporate Head Office, where most of their employees are based, offers career opportunities in Design, Operations, Sales, Marketing, Finance, IT and HR as well as in the Production and Warehousing facilities.

OBJECTIVE:
The IT Analyst will work closely with management to reach set objectives. He accompanies the customers in implementing the projects and in reaching the project’s objectives. He analyzes the business processes and documents the needs, for technical analysis and programming purposes.

RESPONSABILITIES:

Identifies the customer’s needs and performs a business process analysis
Aligns the customer’s processes according to best practices
Adequately documents business needs and processes according to company standards
Establishes parameters for system components based on processes agreed to with the customer
Identifies required application corrections
Provides templates, confirms the quality of data received, imports and validates the customer’s data
Analyzes the developments required and obtains approval; prepares the specifications, creates the quote, obtains development and time estimates, and submits them to the customer
Trains expert users;
Deals with the unexpected and adapts work execution accordingly
Tests, reviews and updates the systems
Assists in implementing interfaces between systems
Ensures the continuous improvement of assigned processes, and updates the standard process guide
Tests official versions and maintains test scripts as related to assigned processes
Reports any unsolicited behaviours in the application

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Relevant experience with a manufacturing and distributing company
Bachelor’s degree or a College diploma in computer science or experience in a similar role
Good knowledge of an ERP, PLM or BI Solution implementation process. (SAP, JD Edwards, Microsoft D365)
Good knowledge of the financial processes of a manufacturing company
Proficiency with MS Office and Visio
Basic knowledge of SQL
Demonstrate interpersonal skills, ease at establishing relationships with the customers, and quickly establish ties with them
Demonstrate excellent interpersonal communications, based on respect, diplomacy and judgment, and oriented towards the search for solutions
Demonstrate leadership, honesty and motivation
Have the customer’s best interest at heart
Comfortable in providing training
Ability for teamwork
Autonomous and sense of initiative
Bilingual, written and spoken

Joseph Ribkoff is an equal opportunity at will employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of age, race, religion, color, disability, sex, sexual orientation or national origin.

Title: Software Engineer - Business Intelligence Platform
Description:
Calabrio is looking for a Software Engineer! Our Vancouver-based Business Intelligence Platform team, which builds software that is part of Calabrio’s contact center suite, is looking for an Engineer to help Calabrio get to the next level by designing, implementing, and creating features that work in a SAAS based, multi-tenant, secure cloud environment. You will create innovative software in a dynamic and rewarding environment working with product and development teams in Vancouver, Minneapolis and Stockholm that will challenge your skills and help you reach the next level of your career.
What you’ll be doing:
Collaborate, learn and create in an engaging, dynamic and rewarding environment with people whose passion for creating outstanding software matches yours.
Implement REST-based web services in a Java platform using microservices, Java EE and supporting data structures
Build high availability, asynchronous and message-based services using AWS
Maintain and enhance GWT-based front ends
Creating robust continuous integration and deployment infrastructure
Requirements
MUST HAVES:
Passion for agile development practices such as continuous delivery, continuous integration, unit testing and test driven development
Skilled in backend application development: Java, REST APIs, JSON, database programming fundamentals, etc.
Experience with distributed version control systems and cloud based build tools
Experience working in Kanban/Agile and DevOps environments
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Strong attention to detail
NICE TO HAVES:
Experience with any of the below tools and technologies is a major plus!
AWS (e.g. CloudFormation, EC2, Elasticsearch)
Containers (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes)
Continuous Integration tools including Jenkins and Artifactory
Microservices (e.g. Quarkus, Dropwizard, Spring Boot, Swagger)
RabbitMQ, Kafka
Benefits
Calabrio People are: Open, Clear, Ambitious, Accountable, Collaborative, Consistent
What we value most…workplace diversity and ensuring an environment of mutual respect. We believe that diversity and inclusion are critical to our success, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.
Our commitment is to continue to keep our people healthy, focused, and creative. We've built a company culture where you’ll feel motivated and truly excited to come to work. Calabrio is driven by the diversity of our talented team members who come from a wide variety of backgrounds and lifestyles. As an equal opportunity employer, we always consider and embrace ALL individuals including what makes them unique. We believe our team members should be happy and healthy, with peace of mind and a sense of accomplishment.
About Calabrio:
Calabrio has joined forces with some of the best minds and most progressive concepts on enriching human interactions through our customer experience intelligence platform. For you, that means working on high-performing innovative teams that combine their incredible ideas in one incredible company.
Our team members are offered comprehensive benefits for various life circumstances and needs, great opportunities for career development, and a balanced work-life to achieve personal and professional success (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).
Awards & Accolades:
Calabrio has 300 Global Partners, more than 2.25 million agents, and over 7,000 customers worldwide. We’ve been doing this for more than two decades and have been recognized by leading independent third parties such as Gartner, Forrester, and G2 Crowd as a leader and visionary. Thanks to the hard work and dedication of every Calabrio team member, we have been recognized by the Star Tribune Top Workplace for 8 years in a row, #20 on the 2020 Fast 50 list, named one of BC’s Top Employers for 2021 and recognized as a top 50 fast-growth company by Minneapolis/St Paul Business Journal.
Calabrio celebrates and fosters a culture that thrives on diversity. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer that prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. We provide employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Calabrio are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status, parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. We celebrate the >40 nationalities of team members that contribute to our success.

Title: Programmer Analyst (ASP .NET Development)
Description: Help us boldly shape retail in CanadaCanadian Tire Corporation, Limited (“CTC”) is one of Canada’s most admired and trusted companies. With world-class Owned Brands and exciting market-leading merchandising strategies, we are continually innovating with purpose: to be there for Canadians from coast-to-coast. We are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join Canadian Tire and its group of companies.The Decision Support Analyst role is to develop and support applications and processes in our Operations Planning Centre (OPC) to enable day to day decision making and support product flow in the most efficient possible manner.The Decision Support Analyst works closely with rest of the Decision Support team, IT and business stakeholders to provide technical expertise, business knowledge, supply chain understanding, reporting, analysis and coordination on essential Supply Chain processes and objectives at the OPC. They are technical yet very knowledgeable in the OPC business processes which facilitate the rapid deployment and enhancement of cost reducing applications.To help define where and how we work, CTC has introduced Hybrid Workplace Personas. While each role fits into a different persona category, this may evolve as employees progress in their career or business needs change. The Decision Support Analyst position is categorized as a Roamer, which means that the incumbent can successfully complete their role objectives virtually and are not required to be present on a CTC campus unless they choose to do so.What you’ll doDevelop, document and maintain applications while aligning to IT and industry coding, database standards.Provide support and maintenance of existing applications including documentation and code maintenance ensuring the assigned applications run as efficiently and smoothly as possible. This includes participating in 24/7 paging rotation for support.Support the business in decision making by providing ad-hoc information, reports and databases as required.Work with users to understand, define and document business and technical needs and translate such needs into user's requirements.Make recommendations, provide different alternatives and be able to clearly communicate pros/cons of each.Commit to and actively work to remain knowledgeable in latest coding languages, database software, system, standards etc.Become knowledgeable and gain experience with business processes and systems in order to provide effective solutions for various groups within OPC and rest of Supply Chain.Work with rest of the team, business stakeholders, IT and all levels of Management on integration of CTR systems and processes with rest of the CT Banners.What you bringPost-secondary education in either computer science, business and/or logistics is an assetKnowledge of Supply Chain business processes and good understanding of retail principles0 to 4 years of experience in full lifecycle of application development, database design, and implementation (open to fresh graduates). Experience in creation and maintenance of UML-based documentation would be an asset.Ability to prioritize and cope with competing and changing objectives in support of long term goals while maintaining stakeholder expectationsStrong analytical skillsProven ability to facilitate formal and informal communications across all levels of staff, as well as work both at a conceptual and highly detailed levelAbility to thrive and contribute to a learning environment within the Decision Support teaWeb development with ASP.NET (C# development with AJAX toolkit extension).Database development in Oracle and MS-SQL Server. SQL, as well as Oracle PL/SQL and MS T-SQL.Experience with Data Transfers using SSIS packages.Microsoft Office skills (MS-Access, MS-Excel) with exposure to process diagram software (ie: Visio).Working knowledge in Unix O/S platforms (AIX preferred) an asset.Working knowledge in basic database administration for Oracle and MS-SQL Server an asset.Web Service development and integration an asset.Experience with Big Data platforms (Hadoop, Hive, Azure/ADLS, GCP/BigQuery, Snowflake, NoSQL, etc.). Snowflake experience highly desirable an asset.Experience in data analysis, modeling and ETL/ELT development in a Big Data environment an asset.Working experience with CI/CD pipelines (Bitbucket/Git, Jenkins, Artifactory), ETL tools (e.g. Diyotta, DataStage, etc.) and data streaming (Kafka, NiFi, Event Hubs, etc.) and asset.Experience with development in Java, JavaScript, Python and R an asset.About Canadian Tire CorporationAs one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies. To learn more follow us on LinkedIn.CTC is committed to the fight against COVID-19 and being there for Canadians. In support of this, we have adopted a COVID-19 Vaccination Policy to protect the health and well-being of our employees. Employees will be required either to be fully vaccinated or undergo regular COVID-19 testing in order to access the workplace until further notice.Job Type: Full-timeSchedule:Day shiftHolidaysMonday to FridayNight shiftWeekend availability

Title: Haskell Software Engineer - BI Software Development Team
Description:
Calabrio is looking for a Software Engineer! Our Vancouver-based Business Intelligence Engine team, which builds software that is part of Calabrio’s contact center suite, is looking for an Engineer to help Calabrio get to the next level by designing, implementing, and creating features that work in a SAAS based, multi-tenant, secure cloud environment. Microservices (e.g. Quarkus, Dropwizard, Spring Boot, Swagger)

Title: Program Analyst I – Ajax, ON
Description:
Program Analyst I – Ajax, ON
Location: Ajax, ON

Term: Contract position – 12 months (extendable)

Shift: Monday to Friday – 8:00 am to 4:30 pm

Pay Rate: $31.00 to $33.00 per hour (based on experience)

Job Summary:
Support new development and sustaining programs/projects using the company’s Program Management tools, processes, and best practices. The Project Analyst will lead, manage, coordinate and support administration and data analysis, along with effective KPI reporting, to ensure successful execution of plans allowing the company’s to meet program objectives.

Responsibilities:
Create/Monitor Project Schedules to identify key risks and manage appropriate action plans to address identified risks.Create and maintain customer requirements document database for new development programs.Support Program Managers on NRC budget submissions and NRC cost tracking, and management via Quarterly Budget process and using Earned Value Management (EVM) on a monthly basis.Support NRC Cost Recovery initiatives by ensuring outstanding claims are tracked, and that the Commercial Manager has all required data to compile claims.
Support Program Managers with additional tasks as required, including but not limited to:
The company’s Projects – from initial preparation through execution and progress monitoring.Support and facilitate PROMPT Toll Gate reviewsSupport and facilitate documentation release per SDRLs.Support of Engineering MER and P audits.Coordinate the preparation and finalization of internal and customer PMR presentations with internal cross-functional IPT.Lead various internal meetings as required, and maintain associated action registers and issue related minutesLead or participate in internal and Customer audit activities as required.
Support North American Program Managers with Cost Reduction activities by leading the following:
Completion of feasibility studies on new cost reduction ideas.Follow-up on open actions from cost reduction executive steer co. meetings.Support functional cost reduction workshops by coordinating required activities.Update presentation slides for Program Management Reviews.Manage change control board on development programs (prior to S9) to control cost and scope.

Qualifications:
A Diploma/Degree in Business Administration or Operations Management (technical background would be an asset).Minimum 3 – 5 years of experience in Aerospace or related industry, preferably in a project management roleProject Management Professional (PMP) certification would be an asset.Extensive working knowledge of all Microsoft Office applications including Access, PowerPoint, Excel, Word, Outlook, Project, and SharePoint.Good understanding of Manufacturing processes and production flows.Good financial acumen is a definite asset.Confident self-starter with ability to work independently.Ability to organize and prioritize workload, and co-ordinate several projects at one time with aggressive deadlines.Ability to interface with Customers (Internal / External) and drive actions to closure.Proven team player with excellent communication (written and verbal) and interpersonal skills.Detail oriented with excellent customer service skills.

To apply please email your resume to Tayyaba at: thamid@cantech.agency

Title: BI Developer (SSIS/SSAS)
Description:
BI Developer (SSIS/SSAS)
Primary Location – Toronto, ON

V-Soft Consulting is currently hiring for a BI Developer (SSIS/SSAS) for our premier client in Toronto, ON. This is a 12 of months contract position.

Education and Experience »
Experience with analyzing data in source systems to identify data cleanliness issues (e.g. missing values, duplicate meanings, and invalid data)
Experience with developing feedback processes to fix corrupt data in the source systems
Experience with developing data extraction, transformation, and load programs (daily and initial load) functionality on a wide-range of data repositories (relational and multi- dimensional data stores)
Experience with developing, implementing and maintaining schedule/dependency logic for Extract Transform Load (ETL) scripts
Experience with developing monitoring and error notification processes to ensure data is updated as designed
Experience with developing automation extraction, cleansing and load scripts
Experience generating research models and reports (scheduled and ad-hoc)
Proven troubleshooting and analytical experience
Experience in process decomposition/mapping and business process re-engineering and complex data models using UML.
Experience in the use of development tools and business re-engineering software
Experience in developing enterprise architecture deliverables (e.g. business, logical, and physical models) based on Enterprise Application Processes and Modeling methodology and guidelines

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities »
Knowledge and experience in developing data analysis applications
Knowledge and understanding of Information Management principles, concepts, policies and practices
Ability to provide expert advice in developing and integrating process and information models to enable identifying and eliminating redundant business processes
Experience with developing monitoring and error notification processes to ensure data is updated as designed
Hands on experience working with stakeholders to develop and document interface specifications design between Business Intelligence solutions and external applications
Extensive experience with conceptual, logical and physical data modelling tools like Power Designer, and Visio.
Knowledge and understanding of Accessibility for Ontarians with Disability Act (AODA) and related regulations and standards

WHAT YOU’LL DO:
Job Responsibilities »
Supports Client’s wide-ranging business information requirements, implementing and supporting business intelligence software solutions
Develops and supports customized query applications which analyze key business data
Develops and supports guided analysis and drill-down functionality, routine scheduling and notification of report generation, and effective implementation of “opportunity” and “key-trend” alerts.
Provides Clients with approach options and tools for managing business-related data in a manner that assists in quantitative analysis of progress and the relationship between operational actions and their effect on business objectives.

Interested?
Qualified candidates should send their resumes to neha@vsoftconsulting.com

V-Soft Consulting Group is headquartered in Louisville, KY with strategic locations in India and across the U.S., including Madison, Chicago, Denver, Harrisburg and Atlanta. Known as an agile innovative technology services company, we were recently rewarded the Large Business of the Year award from Louisville Business First, and were recognized among the top 100 fastest growing staffing companies in North America. V-Soft has a wide variety of partnerships across diverse technology stacks, and holds such titles as MuleSoft Certified Delivery Resource, Oracle Gold Partner, ServiceNow Partner, Microsoft Partner and Cisco Registered Partner, amongst many others.
For more information or to view all our open jobs, please visit www.vsoftconsulting.com or call (844) 425-8425.

Title: Lead, Business Intelligence- Trust & Safety, Monetize Products/ Chef d'équipe, Intelligence d'affaires, Trust & Safety, Produits de Monétisation
Description:
The opportunity

The Monetize Business Intelligence team at Unity is central to enabling data-driven decision-making, identifying new revenue growth opportunities, and completing critical initiatives. We are looking for a Business Intelligence Lead to manage and strengthen a team of BI Developers for our Trust & Safety Suite of products within Monetization. Our advertising and In-App Purchasing solutions and technologies are deployed in hundreds of thousands of apps used by hundreds of millions of users every day. This generates extensive data sets that need to be mined for valuable insights in order to understand how to continue to drive this fast-growing business and support our developer community.

The BI team is viewed as the first line of defence when problems and curiosities arise, and you will be leading and assisting your team to provide crucial reporting tools and insights that are the backbone of the decision-making process for the Product team.

What you'll be doing
Manage your team and develop them to achieve their potential. You will be responsible for a cross-product BI team whose core responsibilities include building dashboards for product teams, A/B analysis, owning data reporting pipelines, and working cross-functionally across Product, Engineering, and Data Science to drive forward new product initiatives
Drive day to day execution and delivery of tasks, lead the team, and empower the team by explaining how their work relates to the wider business objectives
Collaborate with your Product partner and Senior Engineering leadership to conceptualize, prioritize and develop new products
Be the source material expert on all products under the Trust & Safety suite and be the bridge between Product, Data Science, Engineering, and Sales
Aid in the product life-cycle development and strategy for emerging Unified Auction objectives

What we're looking for
Experience leading a small to medium-sized team
Experience in AdTech or Mobile Gaming Industry
Ability to mentor, coach, and develop team members, lead by example, and build positive relationships
Strong collaboration, facilitation, and communication skills
Skilled with SQL/BigQuery and Excel and experience dashboarding with BI Tools i.e. Tableau, Looker, Data Studio

You might also have

A passion for data, analysis, and problem solving
Familiarity with ETL practices and tools (AirFlow, Pyspark)
Data development with Looker

Life at Unity

Unity (NYSE: U) is the world's leading platform for creating and operating real-time 3D (RT3D) content. Creators, ranging from game developers to artists, architects, automotive designers, filmmakers, and others, use Unity to make their imaginations come to life. Unity is the foundation upon which the world's most powerful digital content is created. Specifically, Unity's platform provides a comprehensive set of software solutions to create, run and monetize interactive, real-time 2D and 3D content for mobile phones, tablets, PCs, consoles, and augmented and virtual reality devices.

In the fourth quarter of 2021, Unity had, on average, 3.9 billion monthly active end users who consumed content created or operated with its solutions. The applications developed by these creators were downloaded, on average, five billion times per month in 2021. For more information, please visit www.unity.com.

Unity is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. Therefore, we provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law. If there are preparations or accommodations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.

Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this Web site or directly to managers. Unity does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Unity will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Unity.

L'opportunité

L'équipe d'intelligence d'affaires et de monétisation de Unity est au cœur de la prise de décision pilotée par les données, de l'identification de nouvelles occasions de croissance des revenus et de la mise en œuvre d'initiatives essentielles. Nous sommes à la recherche d'un(e) responsable en intelligence d'affaires qui sera chargé(e) de gérer et de renforcer une équipe de développeur(se)s BI pour notre suite de produits Trust & Safety au sein de l'équipe Monetization. Nos solutions et technologies publicitaires et d'achats intégrés sont déployées sur des centaines de milliers d'applications utilisées par des centaines de millions d'utilisateur(trice)s chaque jour. Elles produisent d'importants jeux de données qui doivent être analysés pour en tirer de précieuses informations, ce qui permettra de comprendre comment poursuivre une croissance rapide et appuyer notre communauté de développeur(euse)s.

L'équipe d'intelligence d'affaires est la première ligne de défense lorsque des problèmes ou événements inhabituels surviennent. Vous dirigerez et aiderez votre équipe à fournir des outils de création de rapports et des informations cruciales qui constituent l'épine dorsale du processus décisionnel de l'équipe chargée des produits.

Ce que vous allez faire

Gérer votre équipe et la faire évoluer pour qu'elle réalise son potentiel. Vous serez responsable d'une équipe d'intelligence d'affaires multi-produits dont les principales responsabilités consistent à créer des tableaux de bord à l'usage des équipes de produits, à effectuer des analyses A/B, à posséder des pipelines de rapports de données et à travailler de manière transversale avec les équipes de produits, de développeur(se)s et de science des données pour faire avancer les nouvelles initiatives de produits
Piloter l'exécution et la livraison quotidiennes des tâches, diriger et motiver votre équipe en expliquant comment leur travail est lié aux objectifs commerciaux élargis de l'organisation
Collaborer avec votre partenaire produit et le/la responsable sénior du développement pour conceptualiser, hiérarchiser et développer de nouveaux produits
Être l'expert(e) de référence sur les produits liés à la suite Trust & Safety, et constituer le pont entre les services des produits, de la science des données, du développement et des ventes
Contribuer au développement du cycle de vie des produits et à l'élaboration d'une stratégie visant à atteindre les objectifs émergents de l'équipe Unified Auction

Ce que nous recherchons

Une expérience dans la gestion d'équipes de taille petite à moyenne
Une expérience dans l'AdTech ou dans l'industrie des jeux vidéo mobiles
Une capacité à encadrer les membres de l'équipe, à les soutenir, à prêcher par l'exemple et à développer
Une bonne connaissance de SQL, BigQuery et d'Excel, ainsi qu'une expérience de la création de tableaux de bord au moyen d'outils de veille stratégique (Tableau, Looker, Data Studio, etc.)

Vous avez peut-être également

Une passion pour les données, l'analyse et la résolution de problèmes
Une connaissance des pratiques et des outils en matière d'extraction de traitement et de chargement des données (AirFlow, Pyspark)
Une expérience de développement de données sur Looker

La vie chez Unity

Unity (NYSE: U) est la plateforme la plus utilisée au monde pour la création et l'exécution interactive de contenu 3D en temps réel (RT3D). Des créateur(rice)s, notamment des développeur(se)s de jeux vidéo, des artistes, des architectes, des concepteur(rice)s automobiles, des cinéastes et bien d'autres professionnel(le)s, utilisent Unity pour donner vie à leurs projets. Unity constitue la base sur laquelle sont créés les contenus numériques les plus remarquables au monde. Plus précisément, la plateforme de Unity offre un ensemble complet de solutions logicielles pour créer, exécuter et monétiser du contenu interactif 2D et 3D en temps réel pour les téléphones mobiles, les tablettes, les ordinateurs, les consoles et les appareils de réalité augmentée et de réalité virtuelle.

Au quatrième trimestre de l'année 2021, Unity comptait en moyenne 3,9 milliards d'utilisateurs finaux actifs mensuels ayant consommé du contenu créé ou exploité au moyen de ses solutions. Les applications développées par ces créateur(rice)s ont été téléchargées en moyenne cinq milliards de fois par mois en 2021. Pour en savoir davantage, veuillez consulter le site www.unity.com.

Unity souscrit au principe de l'équité en matière d'emploi et favorise un environnement inclusif et innovant où se joignent les meilleur(e)s employé(e)s. Par conséquent, nous offrons des chances égales pour l'emploi sans nous baser sur l'âge, la race, la couleur, l'ascendance, l'origine nationale, la religion, le handicap, le sexe, l'identité ou l'expression de genre, l'orientation sexuelle ou tout autre statut protégé par la loi. Si nous pouvons effectuer certains préparatifs ou aménagements afin d'aider à faire en sorte que votre entrevue soit une expérience confortable et positive, veuillez nous en faire part.

Les chasseurs de têtes et les agences de placement ne peuvent pas envoyer de CV sur ce site Web ni directement aux gestionnaires. Unity n'accepte pas de CV non sollicités provenant de chasseurs de têtes ou d'agences. Unity ne paiera aucuns frais à une agence ou à une entreprise tierce qui n'a pas signé d'entente avec elle.
